review: Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Microgestin for a few years but Walgreens was out so the pharmacist gave me Aurovela and said it is the same? I feel like this person should absolutely not be qualified to work in medicine. One week later and my anxiety is through the roof, insomnia is horrible!!, and I feel so awful mentally and physically. I am so angry and upset with Walgreens and I now have to pay out of pocket to get Microgestin for this month because my insurance counted the Aurovela.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this for maybe 4 years and I’ve never had any issues with it. I had debilitating periods before and this has made my periods virtually nonexistent. I haven’t experienced any of the side effects some other women have, but everyone is different and all bodies are different. For me, this has been a god sent and works perfectly for my body!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Let me start by saying everyone’s body reacts differently to any hormonal substance! I started Junel FE around late 2021, as Sprintec caused me to have breakthrough bleeding after being on it for 5ish years. During the first and second month of being on this pill I had begun feeling depressed, which sucked as I hadn’t dealt with that before. I also had break through bleeding for a bit which was super annoying. But I decided to stick it out, knowing my body was just slowly getting used to the new pill. It has now been about 4 or 5 months on Junel, and I honestly want to go cold turkey right now. I’ve had intrusive thoughts constantly, depression, anger, and no sex drive. The only pros of Junel are that my period is only 3 days long, and I only have cramps on the first day. Plus I haven’t gotten pregnant. I’m hoping to find a better source of (non-horomonal) contraceptive soon!

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 18 years old and recently started taking this birth control. My doctor told me I would see results in two weeks and I’m now on week 3 and nothing has changed. My acne actually got worse and the main reason my mom had me start this pill was to clear up my acne she’s been complaining about. I know it’s early but I’m getting really frustrated that things are getting worse and these reviews aren’t helping. I’m open to hearing someone’s thoughts about this.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Best birth control. No side effects for over 4 years.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was very nervous when my pharmacy switched my brand of birth control from Aurovela to Blisovi because I didn't have any noticeable side effects with Aurovela and was scared that would change, but it actually turned out noticeably better than Aurovela. I still have no side effects but now have ~4 day periods while I had ~6 days on Aurovela and ~8 without any, and my cramps are much better with both Aurovela and Blisovi.
Generess Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Initially I took Generess Fe for irregular periods. I was fortunate to have no side effects, weight gain, etc. I think it's worth a shot!

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I really liked it at first, made my periods super short and light and no weight gain, but after almost a year of being on it I've been having irregular periods often and really bad depression.

Junel 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible. It made my periods easier and made me bleed way less and only for 3 days. Everything was amazing at first. Then I started having high prolactin levels and my breast would leak after every period for 1-2 weeks. I’ve never been pregnant nor had sex so this was horrible. My boobs swell and I was in severe pain. It helps if you have horrible periods but if you use it to skip or just use it long enough, eventually it messes up your hormones. I got tested and wasted so much money just to find out it was my BC causing this. Please be very careful if your breast start leaking or if it causes you to faint. The doctors won’t believe you but the tests never lie.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on the pill for probably around a year. I have noticed me gaining weight but my workout and eating habits definitely factor into that. I do find myself nauseous a lot but I correlate that to acid reflux and previous anxiety issues. I don’t really see any negative side effects besides feeling irritable and on edge on the placebo week but it’s helped my periods and ton and I have clear skin. Definitely try it and see if it works for you!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on Lo Lo to stop bleeding. Well 9 days and no change - the bleeding actually  seems worse. Praying it stops so tired of bleeding. I didn't like the depo.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on LoLo for two months and this is my first time ever being on birth control. I started the 1st pack on the 1st day of my period but it lasted 4 extra days past its usual time. Slight breast tenderness at first but it went away. My PMS moodiness was much better. My period came on on the last 4 pills but it was very light; I barely needed a pad. On my second pack, I had some light spotting between Days 13-17 (on the active combination pills). I'm 33 years old with a BMI of 30. I'm having to switch to another brand because LoLo is on backorder everywhere near me, but I've had a pleasant experience so far.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for about 6 months and I am stopping it immediately because of the effects it has had on my mental health. I’ve never been this depressed or having anxiety this bad in my life. My feelings get hurt so easily and I cry almost every day. I can’t control myself when I get the feeling of crying. I’ve cried in front of my family and friends which I used to never do because it used to take a lot for me to cry. It’s also made me feel really insecure with myself and think so badly of myself because it’s made me so depressed and think so negatively about any and everything in my life. I’ve never experienced this severe mental health in my life, please don’t use this birth control. It’s made me lose a lot of weight too. The only good thing from this was it got rid of my period and I’ve had clear skin.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 35 and I have been doing natural temp testing birth control for a few years but decided that I am a bit moody-anger more often than not  and perhaps a bit of estrogen could help. I decided to try this theory out and go with Lo Loestrin Fe. I have been taking for a few months and I love it. My mood is stable and like others state, every day is a great (and logical..ha). I have noticed  the last three months I have had terrible PMS moods. I become extremely angry and set off as well as fatigued before or during the placebo pills. I’m going to keep tracking my moods on Fitbit— try to pin point what’s going on. I also noted that when it comes to that last week I have skipped the last blue pill or two before placebo. At, times I have missed a pill or two.  I wonder if this could be affecting things w/ abrupt drop in hormones. I’m going to make sure I take exactly on schedule if I have to set a phone alarm. This birth control is way too good to give up on just yet!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I actually really love Junel. I have tried everything from Yaz to Lo Loestrin to Apri and this has been the ONLY birth control my body is fine on. Yeah there was a brief month where my mental health was rough, but that wasn’t from the birth control itself (turns out thyroid conditions and PCOS can be a beast until they are figured out). This was the first one I ever tried and any time it’s been changed I start dreaming of when I can go back on this one. If you do have issues from it or any birth control, it probably is from another hormonal issue so don’t write it off completely.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I actually don’t have a lot of side effects with this drug. I got on it to help with my periods and clear my skin. My skin cleared up right away and my period became light and eventually went away. But, my period eventually came back and hasn’t gone away in 2 months. I tried to keep taking it to see if it would go away because it’s worked for everything else, but it’s not leaving so I’m trying Junel. Other than that it is good, and remember birth control is different for everyone.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Please do not take this specific birth control pill if you already deal with anxiety or depression. I have been taking Junel for 10 months and the last month of taking it I experience crippling anxiety. I had panic attacks and suicidal thoughts. I had the random thought to check out the side effects of Junel since it was the only prescription medicine I was taking and was shocked by the reviews. It seems pretty 50/50 but most of the people who had bad experiences talked about anxiety being a huge issue. I also realized the things I had been dealing with for months are also listed under side effects (hair loss, water retention, difficultly wearing contacts, insomnia, leg cramps, reduced tolerance to carbs) and quickly decided to discontinue use. It has only been just over a week but I can already feel such a difference. I still experience anxiety daily but such a little amount compared to before. I did read it can take a few months for side effects to go away.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Blisovi Fe 1/20 for about 2 months. I take birth control because my period is very long, heavy, painful, etc. I was on Lolestrin Fe before taking this and it was actually working but I still wanted a shorter period. Unfortunately in the first month on Blisovi Fe my period lasted about 11 days and less then a week later it started again. It also made me extremely anxious and depressed, to the point of panic attacks almost every week, which is not normal for me. I’ve lost a few pounds while on Blisovi but am constantly bloated since I started taking it. I also started noticing an increase in sinus and respiratory problems which could also be related to this medication. Overall I do not recommend this product.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I was put on it as I have severe PMS and bleeding but believe me I took it for  3 weeks and it has been absolute nightmare !! I am a rather happy person who is very outgoing and talkative but this pill, it put me into a depressive mood, I lost interest in my hobbies, studies etc and I would start crying and couldn’t stop most of the time. I know it’s not like that for everyone and some people might not have this but if you all of a sudden experience those things.. it might be the pill. I’m staying off for sureI can deal with the pain but not this mental torture

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Loestrin Fe for a little over a year. Honestly I didn’t have very many side effects except for low libido/dryness and irregular periods. My periods were so irregular, I'd get a period in the middle of my pack and sometimes I’d go months without them. It kinda sucked because I would never know if I was pregnant or not because I didn’t know when my period was supposed to come. Since I had low libido I experienced terrible dryness which is uncomfortable and embarrassing :/ . my skin was always super clear on it though!! Everyone’s different so if you’re thinking about trying it just do it

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I absolutely love this birth control. I have had zero issues whatsoever. I take mine continuously and skip placebo pills. No side effects, no mood swings, nothing. Highly recommend!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this because a nurse practitioner recommended it for heavy periods. It did make my flow lighter for the most part, HOWEVER- I had breakthrough bleeding 3/4 months on it, lasting probably a total of 10-15 days out of the month. Enough to need to wear a pad. I have been more depressed than I ever have been in my life. I have had panic attacks frequently, which were never that big of a problem for me. The worst part has been weight gain. I have gained 5 pounds in 4 months despite the fact that my weight had been stable for 7 years. I am constantly hungry - actually starving to the point of sickness if I don't eat. It didn't change my libido, but I don't want to engage in intercourse if I'm bleeding. I will stop this birth control and seek an ablation. Plus, it's extremely expensive and most insurance plans don't cover it. I am mad at the nurse practitioner for recommending this pill.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I only took for 5 days because I got so incredibly nauseous and had diarrhea so much so that I couldn’t work for a day and just couldn’t keep taking them.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I went on Lolo when I was 16 to help with acne and heavy flow. Needless to say I’m still on it 8 years later. It stopped my period all together after a month or so. Saw my gyno because of it and was cleared since this can happen with lolo. Before this birth control, I was going through 5 or more super plus tampons a day. So I can’t complain about the lack of period. In terms of acne reducing, this is where it  loses some points. It did help reduce my cystic acne, but it didn’t clear my skin either. I had to go on spironolactone a couple years later to actually clear my skin completely. Regarding weight change, I did not see any huge change. I do struggle with weight loss, but I also have a hypothyroid. With mental health, depression runs in my family genetically, and surprisingly it did not increase any intrusive thoughts. It actually  helped regulate them. Birth control is different for everyone since every body is different. I’d recommend giving it  try!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wanted to share my experience after reading so many reviews. I was on Nuvaring for 3 years prior and I started realizing the 3rd year that I had gained over 30 lbs and could not get it off for the life of me. I went off of Nuvaring about 6 months ago and my weight drastically started going down! I am able to control my weight and lose it. Cons of Blisovi Fe 1/20 is that I have spotting in the middle of the month before my period and it continues into my period. Then I get about a week free of spotting and that has been since I started. I realized that I was nauseous when I first started. I thought it was from Covid and taking vitamins on an empty stomach but it was definitely the pill the first 2 months. Now I take the pill in the morning with no nausea. My stomach has been more upset then usual so maybe that’s a con, I’m not sure. As for sleeping, I could barely get 5 hours of sleep on Nuvaring and now I can at least get 7 hrs and I feel a bit more energetic.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It’s been a little over a month for me. I wanted to give it more time, but I have been extremely emotional. I feel like crying all the time for no reason, and I am overly sensitive. I struggle with depression and anxiety, and I was hoping it would have helped. I’ve also gained nearly 10 pounds in the month I’ve been on it (I’m 22 and run about 3 miles a day). I’ve had headaches everyday, and I was super nauseous when I first started the pill (it went away after a week). I wish I could give this pill more time but I’m feeling like things are getting worse than better. I went on the pill to help with my extremely bad PMSing (sadness) but I feel sad all the time now.
Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I been on hailey for like almost a year and I love it. I haven’t had a period in a year and I don’t really cramp much either, I have no acne either.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this version for around 10 months. Initially, I really liked it! My breasts were super sore for the first 6 months (and def got bigger) which I didn't particularly mind as I didn't notice any other symptoms. Fast forward to now, and the long-term effects of this pill are coming to light. I've gained 22 lbs since I started (without any changes to diet/exercise), and am still slowly climbing. My body doesn't cooperate with me during exercise like it used to, and I feel out of energy. Also, I stopped getting my period altogether. The most I've ever gotten is a tiny bit of dark-colored discharge during my placebo weeks. I get "hot flashes" about 5-6 hours after taking my pill every day and constantly feel warm. I didn't ever notice any changes to my skin at all, but my hair def got a lot greasier. Trial and error! Will be switching.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I will start by saying I know everyone’s body is different, and may not work for me, might work great for you! However, I’ve tried tons of BC pills this birth control is definitely not for me, and has the worst side effects that I personally have experienced! I started experiencing anxiety, which I’ve rarely had issues with in the past. I also have been slightly nauseous, but I mostly notice myself dry gagging…often.. so bizzare! I also have been having more headaches and stomach aches than usual. Especially when I first started taking this pill, lots of headaches. I also experienced horrible night sweats, which have started to go away after a few months. I also spot a light brownish blood, nearly everyday, even after a full period. Sex drive definitely decreased, but not horribly bad. That is just my experience from June Fe pill.
Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had a good experience. No real side effects. Worse acne during breakouts than I usually have but otherwise the best Pill I’ve taken.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this medication 3 months ago. My doc switched me from a BCP I’ve been on for years with absolutely no issues. I was trying to be an easy patient so I went along with the switch. I’ve had unbearable cramps since the first pill I took. To the point where they’re debilitating. I’ve also had insane mood swings and constant anxiety. I’ve had issues like this years ago, but the first 2 weeks on the meds I was an absolute nightmare to everyone around me and I still don’t like how I am. I’ve had to reach out to my other doc for anxiety medications because this drug has set me so far back. I’m switching back to my old BCP ASAP!

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Haven't had any major side effects. Minor heart palpitations which I usually have around my cycle. Much better mood control than when I was on lower dosed Aviane. Better libido as well.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Lo Lo estrin for 8 years! Absolutely best birth control I've been on! Was skeptical at first to the idea of no period, but loved that fact after several months. Never got pregnant while on it. No mood swings. No weight gain. No acne! Wish my insurance didn't make me have to change
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took for two years in high school and a year into college, never got pregnant. I'm taking it again now a few years later and it's fine.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First birth control I ever tried and I went on it because I was in a long term sexually active relationship. No bad side effects EXCEPT I had 0 sex drive, it completely changed my relationship for the worse. Switching to find something else that will hopefully increase my sex drive

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Emotionally this drug hasn't done much to me more than the normal emotional I would have without birth control. Acne wise I do break out a little but its nothing compared to my acne when I first started birth control 4 years ago, but it is slightly more breaking out then other birth controls I have been on. I don't have any break through bleeding and my period is extremely light to none on the 24/4 schedule. It has not completely fixed my cramping during my period but it is much better now. The one draw back I do have from it is it seems to have wrecked my sex drive/libido, most of the time I am not completely like ew no, I don't want to have sex when it is initiated by someone else but it does make me never want to initiated it because I never just feel in the mood. Overall I would just have to say it's not life changing for the better but its definitely not giving as bad as side effects as other birth controls .

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been in this for 2 full months now. My boobs got so big and sore during the first month but they went back to normal after a few weeks. Also some headaches at the beginning. My periods started during the third week of pills for both months as I continued to take the remaining pills and I bled for twice as long as usual and had longer durations of cramping. It wasn’t as bad of cramping as without the pills, but lasted the entire time I bled (when it usually lasts 1 day and I’d very painful) I usually bleed 3-5 days but I have bled for 7-10 days both months on this. I am going to continue with the third pack and then consider trying something else. No weight gain while taking these.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on other generics for this birth control...Larin Fe 1/20 and Microgestin Fe 1/20. I had a great experience on BOTH of those medications and was on them for about 3 years. No weight gain, clear skin, light/ no periods. Then I went off BC for a few years which brings us to the present. My OB/GYN prescribed me Larin Fe 1/20 again but my pharmacy couldn't get Larin, so they gave me Aurovela Fe 1/20 instead. Worst. Experience. Ever. Now, I know that it takes time for your body to adjust, but I know my body on this medication in other brands so I know Aurovela is causing trouble. The worst is the chin acne, bloating (constant), and trouble with constipation. My lifestyle habits haven't changed. I still workout 3-4 times a week and drink plenty of fluid and have a fairly healthy diet which includes fiber. I am not on any other medications either except this pill. I called my pharmacy to switch me to a different brand. If Junel Fe 1/20 doesn't work, I'm switching pharmacies.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was weary to start BC because I had heard a lot of bad things. Loestrin took a couple weeks to get used to. It caused me to have mood swings, nausea, and fatigue. However, after a couple of weeks it got better. I no longer feel nauseas and my mood is more stable than before I went on the pill. I recommend getting the app Flo and setting a pill reminder for a certain time each day. I haven’t gained a pound. Push through the first month or so. Overall,I’ve had a great experience.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I will start by saying that I used to loathe birth controls  and was an advocate to natural periods. Life taught me a lesson. I was diagnosed and had surgery for Endometriosis in April 2021. After surgery the doctor told me the endo would come back if I didn't start hormonal therapy to suppress my periods. I was against it and waited until August to convince myself to start LoLo. My biggest fear was weight gain. I am so glad I gave this a try. This pill stabilized my hormone levels and made me feel better than I ever have in 7 years investigating my pain and hormonal issues. No more crazy mood swings. No more heavy debilitating periods. No more 10 days of misery of PMDD. Side effects I noticed: Nausea, headache, sore breasts and bloating. They all went away within the first 3 months. I still experience some bloating and sore breasts around my period, nothing unbearable. Due to stable hormones, I was able to lose 10 lbs already. This pill changed my life for the better.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this pill in Jan. of 2020, I was 18. I stopped taking it in Sept. of 2021. It was my first birth control ever so I overlooked my symptoms a lot. My doctor prescribed Taytulla to help get rid of my ovarian cyst but I decided to keep taking it after it was gone. I gained over 40 lbs in the last year of using it (while working out 5/6 days a week & being underweight my whole life)! My anxiety was the worst, I would have anxiety attacks at work and had to leave early multiple times because I’d pass out. Around the same time, I started having suicidal thoughts. My mood swings were a nightmare for everyone around me, I constantly felt bad. I'd cry all the time and ANYWHERE, it was embarrassing and only made anxiety worse. After stopping, I’ve felt happier, no intense crying, I’ve even lost some weight. My periods are irregular again so I started a new pill. Hope it works better than this one. Good luck to anyone taking Taytulla, I hope you have a better experience.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’d just like to weigh in to these comments and say that I’m shocked at all these comments saying it made them crazy and moody, this pill FIXED my anxiety and craziness

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Aurovela was the first birth control pill I tried. It was not the right fit for me. It caused extremely irregular bleeding, where I would either spot all month or not bleed at all. I have always had above average skin with no acne. But when I started Aurovela, my skin was inflamed with constant breakouts that looked more like a rash. I am also not an emotional person, but found myself crying at everything when I was taking Aurovela. All in all, not my best experience with the pill, but if it works for others, more power to you!

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I tried the loestrin 1/20 or the Junel 1/20 which is the off brand. At first I felt great light periods improved acne but after about 6 months I noticed major increase in hair loss. I have thick waist length hair, at least I used to, I’ve had a very hard time with it and after five months on a new pill I’m still losing hair and it will take years to fully recover my hair. Be very careful when taking birth control, I wish to heaven I would have NEVER taken it.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Please do not take this and if you are experiencing new anxiety or depression stop taking this!  I have taken Larin Fe with no issues for over 2 years.  Recently my pharmacy switched wholesalers and can no longer get Larin Fe so they gave me Junel Fe.  I have been taking this medication for 6 weeks and it finally hit me today what has made the last 6 weeks so miserable, Junel.  I went from being a happy, easy-going person to a miserable, moody, depressed, crying for no reason, anxious and withdrawn individual.  I have had chronic headaches.  Awful menstrual cramps, breast pain, bloating and generalized pain in my abdomen. It has been awful.  I did some self reflection to try to determine what was happening to me and it hit me, this all started when I began taking Junel Fe.  I reached out to my pharmacy and was told "you are not alone, we here this a lot with this medication".  Why is this still on the market.  I would not wish this on anyone.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my most recent prescription and I can't say its been the best. I have had terrible mood swings, episodes of extreme anxiety, and no sex drive- which isn't the biggest deal for me. I am easily upset and have been crying very often. My poor boyfriend has been taking the front load of it all- he prob thinks I'm crazy at this point. I am not hungry as often and this has caused me to be light headed when I stand up. I only switched this brand and upped my dosage because my periods were not normal - I had one every two weeks. Thankfully, I have not gained weight because that was my biggest concern from the reviews I have read. I'm not over all thrilled while being on this prescription. I have PCOS and my mood swings and anxiety are more severe being on this. This medicine is almost putting my relationship on the line at this point.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Junel FE 1.5/30 for five years, from the time that I was 18 to the time that I was 23.  I took it at the same time every day, and never had a single pregnancy scare.  Please girls, remember: Birth control is HUGELY personal.  Our hormones are so sensitive.  What works for one, may not work for another.  I would say that the first three years of the pill were fine for me and I had no issues except for one.  That issue? I would fall asleep every early afternoon and sleep for two or three hours.  I NEEDED a nap.  It was a family joke, a friend group joke.  I never connected it to my birth control.  That issue was the same issue for the full five years.  The last two years on it, however, I also lost my libido and felt totally disinterested in sex and less joyful that I'd ever felt.  That was really the last straw for me and I went off it in November of 2020.  Within a month, my sex drive was back, I wasn't sleeping all afternoon, and I felt better than I'd ever felt.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I originally started out with Sprintec and could immediately see weight gain, swollen breasts and severe mood changes. So I switched to Junel, and my breasts were no longer swollen and I lost weight. My skin has been incredibly clear, very regular periods, light, and no cramps really… but this pill has affected me sexually. I am constantly having back to back UTIs, despite cleaning thoroughly after intercourse. And I no longer have a sex drive. The first year my bf and I were together, I was completely different, but since Junel, I have a hard time wanting to engage in ANY kind of sexual act. It has also put my emotions on blast. I am incredibly angry, I cannot control how I feel anymore. This pill seriously has damaged my mental & physical health. I know a lot of people have a great experience, so don’t let my review turn you away. But if you feel this way on this pill, know you aren’t alone. I thought I was crazy but I am about to get off this pill.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this after 5 years of debilitating menstrual migraines. World-ending pain no matter how light my period. My naturopathic doctor and I decided to get rid of my periods by taking this continuously. I was hesitant because of potential side effects, and I'm very sensitive. After about 3 months my period went away completely and my quality of life increased drastically. I no longer have any period, or any menstrual migraine, no side effects that I can tell. I'm very active, yet eat whatever I want. I literally say a prayer of gratitude to science every morning when I take my little pill. Thank you, science.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Blisovi for a little over 2 years now and in the beginning it was great. I really didn’t have many side effects. I got on it for acne purposes and it did a wonderful job clearing up my face within 3 months. However the longer I’ve been taking it the more I’ve been experiencing side affects. Some months around my period I get very Irritable or sad and other months I’m perfectly fine. Some months I experience really bad cramps not even just in my uterus but up into my diaphragm and back. Just seems like every month it’s a new type of side affect. My sex drive was fine taking this until about recently, it’s decreased significantly. Overall I’ve had more good experiences with this birth control than bad but just make sure you are keeping track of side affects even once you have been taking it for awhile!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):i have had a great experience with blisovi- the only negatives are tender breasts/occasional cramping and I noticed some increased appetite. Other brands have ruined my mental state, but blisovi didn’t cause anything that isn’t usual. No difference in sex drive and no noticeable weight gain

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 31 years old and have suffered from hormonal acne since high school. I have tried every cream/treatment out there and nothing seemed to work. I went to a new ob/gyn who took the time to do a hormone test and found out I had low progesterone levels. After using Junel for ONLY about a month, my skin has never looked better, so I have continued to take them (I started in September 2021). Even during that "time of the month" when I usually have annoying chin breakouts, those are nonexistent! I know that everyone is different and medication has different side effects, but this has truly been a miracle for me. I highly recommend giving this a try, I'm glad that I did!

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My acne got the worse it has ever been on this pill. Avoid at all costs I did not think my skin would ever be this bad in my life and I cry daily about it .

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m 20 and have been taking Nortrel for about 3-4 years now. I have little complaints about this brand of birth control. I definitely would recommend.

Aurovela 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this birth control for about two years. I’m 19 years old and had no idea what it was doing to my body. They have only got worse from when I started this brand. I had no idea all along this was the root to all my problems. It has caused me severe anxiety and I am not the person I used to be. Every single other review is exactly the same concept of mine!!!!
Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Made me incredibly moody, suicide, emotionless, and had no sex drive ever.

Hailey Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this birth control for about a month now. Overall experience has been very easy going! I will say, however, that the first 2 weeks on this pill I was experiencing nausea soon after taking my daily dose. I assume that this is pretty normal because it most definitely could’ve been my body adjusting to the hormones. I have also felt very fatigued after starting this birth control. Often sleeping around 12 hours a day which is not normal to me at all! I didn’t experience any spotting which was a plus because many birth control would have me spotting for months! Overall this birth control worked really well with my body aside from the tiredness!!

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this a month and a half ago. I had some irregular spotting a week into my second month. Face seems bloated, which is really weird. I have been getting this super painful cystic acne on my chin and around my mouth as well. It’s getting better as of today, so I’m going to give this birth control one more month to see if it just needed some time to steady out. No weight gain so far, but I am really active (run 3 times a week, yoga on other days).  My boobs are ginormous, which sucks as someone with gender confusion lol. They were sore at first but they don’t hurt anymore. Definitely had some mood swings since starting, but I also have a history of mental health issues and oscillating moods so I’m not sure if it’s related. I’ll update again in a month after I decide to quit or continue.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was recently switched to Larin Fe without my knowledge because Junel Fe was out of stock so they switched to a generic brand and the name was covered on the label so I didn’t think anything of it. That last two months I have been broken out head to toe with severe breakouts, couldn’t sleep at all and random severe anxiety and I would snap in a second over the stupidest things. I now stopped taking it all together and can now sleep my breakouts are clearing up and no more anxiety or feeling to cry or snap at anyone. I would never recommend this birth control to anyone. And feel pharmacist should be letting us know when there is a change from regular to generic brands for this reason. I pray this saves someone from making the wrong choice.

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I honestly felt fine during the time I took this birth control! My primary doctor didn’t seem to worry about it when I brought up that my BC might be causing this, thought it was my diet/lack of activity. Thankful my OB switched me to something different.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this pill for 6 months and every day I take the pill, about 4-6 hours after, I feel nauseated. The only positives things are it has a $0 copay (at least for me) and I haven't gotten pregnant. 3/10. Do not recommend.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Blisovi 24 for 2 1/2 years, stopped it to have my son then got back on it. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I can not stop crying, feel very moody and I feel extremely nauseous. I only have been on it for 5 days. The worse I felt in my life!

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I'm not sure really, I've had cramps that have lasted going into the 3 Rd week now and bleed was ok at first got to day 6 and not it's the heaviest I've ever had I'm going to go ahead and stop taking it and go see my doctor again this was supposed to help me with heavy flow it did the opposite never taking this again.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this for birth control just for a few months until my husband's vasectomy was scheduled. I then became super depressed, crying every single night for absolutely no reason. My heart would race constantly which would then cause more anxiety. I lost myself and who I was and I'm thankful I realized this is what the cause was. I literally thought I was losing my mind and just waiting to die. The things these hormones can do to your body is scary! I immediately stopped taking it. If you have had or currently have any mental health issues, I would stay far far away.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Absolutely horrible. I was on another combination pill for about 4 months before this birth control. I haven’t even been on this birth control for a whole month.. I genuinely thought I was going crazy and couldn’t figure out why I was having problems till I realized it all matched up to me using this birth control.

Ortho-Novum 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started this pill at 15 for birth control. Took for 5 years. Then later at 25 I started trying to get pregnant. I did not conceive until 28 (3 years!) , My other two children were conceived with the help of fertility specialist. I too believe the birth control led to my fertility issues. Over effective I guess

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this pill!! I was given Aurovela fe 1/20 after almost losing my IUD which ended up being imbedded in my cervix for months. I was scared to be put on hormonal birth control because of all the side effects I’ve heard people had. However, I love this pill. I haven’t had any mood swings, my migraines have gone away completely, and my periods have gotten significantly lighter. I have nothing but good reviews for this birth control!! I can’t believe all the bad reviews I see for this pill.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I stopped taking this medication after approximately 2.5 months. My doctor prescribed it because of my extremely heavy periods that caused anemia. After 2 months on this medication I experienced the longest and heaviest period of my entire life, 13 straight days of very heavy bleeding. I experienced pelvic pain every single day which was more frequent than before I took the medication. My breasts became bigger and very sore and tender. I bloated up so much. The only "positive" thing I got out of this medication was that it subdued my emotions to the point my depression and anxiety improved, but it also subdued any feelings of elation that I used to have. I'm not sexually active so I wasn't taking it to prevent pregnancy. I will never take this stuff again.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I don't normally comment and I'm only here to see if any reviews talked about getting pregnant after stopping Blisovi (I plan to stop taking it soon to start trying for a pregnancy). While on the shot I was often depressed/anxious and had moderate acne. Once I switched to Blisovi, my anxiety and depression decreased and my face has not been this clear since before puberty (even my acne scars are healing!). I don't take the sugar pill, so I have not had a period while on it (except after my covid shot, which was weird). My weight has been consistent and I have not noticed any other symptoms. I take the pill about the same time every day, plus it minus an hour or two. I haven't noticed any problems if I take it a bit later than usual. I've been on it for about 2 years now. It works for me and my body.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Only had minimal side effects the first few months taking it. Now I don’t have any noticeable side effects and I skip my periods every month with it, which is fantastic! Personally, I don’t get all the bad reviews. I absolutely love it. Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 21 and around 110lbs My doctor prescribed this for me when I was 20 because I was getting married and also for my irregular periods. I can tell that my body is going through what I normally would be because I would be a grouchy lady. I have also cramped lately which has greatly been reduced but its manageable. I guess I'm used to bleeding heavily and instead I'm not so my brain is making me think something is wrong.The only problem I'm having is making sure I take it on time .

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this pill for only a week. I had nausea, vomiting and the worse headaches. I already had anxiety but in just a few days it intensified. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My experience was strange only because I have always been use to the regular side effect of BC: heavy flow, full 7 days or more of flow, pms, and headaches. Also someone who experiences regular anxieties this didn’t seem to trigger any changes in my mood at all, no increase in anxiety or depression. So far so good. My experience so far as of 4 years

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I decided to switch to Aurovela in hopes to have a new birth control that would finally help with my skin. I began to breakout on my shoulders and back as well, so after about 8 months or so I decided to get off birth control all together in hopes for my body to go back to normal. 6 months later, I feel like my skin has improved with help of curology, but I also plan on getting on yaz soon to see if that helps my cramps and acne flare ups during my cycle.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on a specific pill for three years, but my body began to no longer cooperate with that pill so I had to make a switch. The only thing she told me to do is give it longer to adjust with my body. I have given plenty of time and can’t take it anymore. I have the most horrendous list of side effects I could have imagined. My body doesn’t feel like my own anymore. Do not recommend.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wanted to leave a review to hopefully help some people as I feel people are more inclined to review when they have had a really good or especially when they have a really bad experience. Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on aurovela for about 3 years now. It’s not bad I don’t have bad side effects only I did gain a little bit of weight but with diet and exercise I have been able to lose it.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Have been taking Junel 1/20 for about 7 years. I initially started taking it to help with my irregular periods and acne. It was a godsend! Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first BC medication so take with my review what you will. Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I was on this pill for about a year but they recently switched me. Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Ok so I'm 19 and wanted to start bc as I’m sexually active now so I went to my gyno and she gave me this. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla wasn’t the right birth control for me. I was on it for two months before I had to stop because I couldn’t handle the side effects anymore. I never stopped being starving the entire time, regardless of how much I ate. This caused me to feel bloated and miserable all of the time. It caused awful acne that never heals and causes scarring every time I get even a small zit that still hasn’t stopped over a year and a half later. While on the birth control I would have my period starting on day 7 of the pack and it would last until I started a new pack. Birth controls are very individual so it may work great for others. However, my gynecologist refused to take any of my symptoms seriously and yelled at me when I refused to continue taking it. So, I’m leaving a review so that if someone encounters the same issue as me they’re able to validate their feelings and switch birth control methods if necessary.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):These reviews are saving my life. My moods have been the ABSOLUTE WORST since starting Blisovi back in December. Pirmella 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been taking Pirmell 777 for heavy bleeding and clotting the first week it slowed down then the 2nd week it got heavy again with the clotting the size of a dollar coin and still haven't stop bleeding been bleeding since Nov.18th.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took lo loestrin fe for a month and then switched to blisovi because it was free with my insurance. Larin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Junel FE for several years with no problems. Last month Walmart switched me to Larin FE because they were out of Junel. There is something in these pills that  is making us very sick and should be pulled off the market now!! I stopped taking them 4 days ago and still don't feel right yet...

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my third year on Junel Fe. It is the best birth control I've had. Historically, my periods were painful. I missed work and could not function for the first day or two of getting my period. After having a daughter, my doctor prescribed this pill. I experienced intense nausea the first two weeks, comparable to morning sickness. This went away. I have lost weight on Junel Fe. My moods were noticeably regulated during the pre and menstrual phase. My periods went from moderately heavy and passing clots, to light periods, to no periods, after a year of use. I did find that if I missed 3 pills, I would experience breakthrough bleeding that lasted a few weeks, leading to the need for a reset. Every woman is unique. This has worked for me, and I ask for it specifically when some doctors attempt to give me a generic or different brand.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is easily the worst birth control I have been on. It doesn’t stop my bleeding and I bleed randomly throughout the month. The months I have taken this birth control have been some of the worst months ever.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Was prescribed Junel but was given Aurovela. Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):As a first time birth control user, I was really nervous about the side effects we have all heard from birth control horror stories. Thankfully, on this birth control, I experienced little to no side effects. I experienced little to no change in body weight and my acne has cleared up almost completely. (My breasts do swell sometimes and it can be painful for a week or two, but this is rare.) The first two months were not great. I struggled with breakthrough bleeding and was frustrated and startled by the intensity and quantities of the bleeds which lasted for 7-10 days at a time. But after completing about 2.5 packs, my breakthrough bleeding stopped completely and now when I take my placebo week, my withdrawal bleeding lasts about 4-5 days and it’s extremely light. No awful mood changes. Haven’t gotten pregnant either!! lol

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):** DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL ** If you have any underlying mental health issues/anxiety or anything I do not recommend this pill at all. I have pretty mild anxiety, I don’t take anything for it, but I do not suffer from depression. I took Lo Lo and immediately, the first day of taking it I got depression symptoms. By day 2 and 3 I had suicidal thoughts and I have NEVER in my life been suicidal. Literally nothing was wrong but I was uncontrollably sobbing every day and having suicidal thoughts. Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control I’ve only been using for 2 weeks. I woke up this morning with terrible vaginal itching and pain. I don’t sleep and I get random severe headaches that last 1-2 minuets.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Originally on Junel Fe 1/20 but needed substitution as no pharmacys locally are carrying that anymore, so Larin Fe 1/20 was substituted. Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you struggle with mental health, this birth control is definitely not for you. I was irritable, sensitive, emotional, and just feeling down all the time. Even after a week of not taking it I feel so much better mentally. Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on and off this one and one thing I noticed is the fog people talk about . I wouldn’t say this one is terrible as I’ve been on it over 2 years and have had worse but it still isn’t perfect. Luckily my husband is getting a vasectomy next month so I’ll be rid of it soon!!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this for about a year and 1/2 now. I was diagnosed with PMDD (premenstrual dysphoric disorder), which is basically where you have super PMS when you already have anxiety and/or depression. It was BAD, especially through the pandemic. My doctor prescribed continuous birth control to completely eliminate PMS and periods, and I’ve never felt better! My mood is definitely more stable, and I haven’t experienced any more extreme lows like I used to get. As far as side effects go; my breasts did get bigger at first but the swelling went down after a couple months, and my sex drive has gone down quite a bit. Considering all of the other possible side effects I could have had, I’m totally okay with just that one. Plus, it has done its job well with preventing pregnancy when I am intimate.  As a lot of others have said, everyone’s bodies are different and won’t react the same, but that’s just my positive experience on this medication.  :)
Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Would not recommend.  Not the same as Junel or Loestrin. TONS of spotting and cramps every 2 weeks.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Junel Fe 1.5/30 for about 9 months. I originally was on Junel Fe 1/20 but experienced some breakthrough bleeding months in so I switched to a higher dose. Everyone is different and everyone’s body is different however this pill did not work for me. I have a history of anxiety and depression and this pill made me insane. I cried so easy, I was so easily aggravated, I felt like I could never be happy and nothing could make me happy, like the smallest things bothered me.  Probably the worst mood swings I have ever experienced, and my doctor convinced me that it was normal. But after 9 months, I had had enough. I switched to another brand and feel so much better and so much more like myself. Never experienced any nausea or other symptoms. My skin was pretty decent on this pill too, however I care most about how I feel mentally. Also, I had been on birth control before this so I’m not sure if that effects it either.

Nortrel 0.5/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been in pharmacy for 17 years. I know the ins and outs of BC. Just because it is the same active ingredient doesnt mean it will react in your body the same. Every body is different and every medication is different. I personally have been using the nortrel for many many years. They switched me to Necon and nope not having it. Your body will react to something it's not used to. So if you start on one and they switch you to a different generic chances are your body won't like it. I've had triphasic, biphasic and other monophasic pills. I went back to my Nortrel tried and true. I skip placebos. Never any breakthrough bleeding. Periods are super short. No moodiness. I have anxiety in general and this does not bother me at all. Cleared my acne. The tri phasic ones I had made me PSYCHO. It is true hormones affect everyone differently. Don't be scared by the reviews. Try it and if it doesn't work - switch it. Simple as that.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Aurovela for 8 months, it makes me extremely irritable and I haven’t been able to gain weight I’ve always weighed 125lbs and now I struggle to get over 113lbs. It has also recently stopped my period

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am on lo loestrin for endometriosis. I have lots of GI symptoms from endo but also had super painful, heavy periods. I have only been on lo lo for 2 months and while it helps the GI symptoms and makes my periods lighter they are still extremely painful. It is helpful till I have my endo excision surgery but after I probably won't take it.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hailey Fe 1/20 is such a miracle birth control brand I ever been on so far, when I was on the depo shot for a couple of months it made me more hungry than usual, had me get longer periods,  made me gained 15 pounds TBH I was feeling less confident anyway one day I decided to stop taking the depo shot for good. So I decided to give the pills a try in early November till now Honestly it was the best decision I ever made I have less increase of appetite, regular period cycles and no weight gain increase. I give Hailey Fe birth control a 9 out of 10.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was scared to start this birth control from the reviews I have read but I have had zero issues with it. I have been on Lo Loestrin Fe for 4 years and needed to switch because of insurance issues. I did not gain any weight, break out, or have any unwanted side effects. My boobs felt a little swollen for the first week or so but that quickly faded. I got my period when expected and it was so light for 3 days. I have had no issues and I am pleasantly surprised with how easily I transitioned to this pill.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had a very negative experience with this birth control. I only took it for one month and had to switch brands. It made me have the worst anxiety and depression of my life to the point where I couldn’t leave my bed. It also gave me terrible breakout's. Everyone’s body reacts differently but I wouldn’t recommend this birth control to anyone.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was so scared of getting on the pill and even more when I saw the bad reviews saying that it was the worst thing ever... But don't let the reviews scare you in advance without trying because it worked well for me. I am a person that often has mood swings and history with depression but it didn't worsen my mood. I didn't  gain any weight, my skin is still clear and I'm even less bloated ! However the first days I started, my head was exploding and I felt sick but after 3 days it was completely gone. I don't feel any nausea nor digestive issues. The only thing that is a little weird is the spotting that I had the 2 first months but it went away. And so far, I haven't got pregnant so I guess it works...

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my second time on Lo Loestrin and I love it as much as the first time. I took a break for a few months and I just went back on it around 2 weeks ago. My skin is already clearing up (larger pimples), though I still have comedonal acne. But looking back at pictures when I was on the pill for almost a year, my skin was flawless. My periods were pretty much nonexistent, if they came they’d last two days. I never experienced cramps or weight gain. This pill honestly did wonders for me, still can’t remember why I stopped lol. There were a few negatives about it though, I experienced mood swings for a bit when I started it, other than that nothing worth remembering. But I do see a lot of bad reviews from women who had an awful experience with the pill. Keep in mind it affects everyone completely different. Something I learned about this pill is the importance of taking it at the exact same time everyday. You should make sure to take it within the same hour everyday. Good luck !
it gave me such bad mood swings that I was diagnosed with bipolar II (ladies you aren’t crazy)

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the 2nd birth control pill I’ve tried and so far it’s been amazing. I’ve had little to no cramping, light to no periods and no mood swings. I have noticed my breast are slightly growing and tender (which isn’t a bad thing) I think it’s a really good pill to try out after discussing with your health care provider!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Junel Fe 24 for about 1 1/2 years now. Works very well as a contraceptive. Definitely causes significant weight gain if you are not active. I am able to have a period every 5 months, though I have to be off the pill for at least a week before the bleeding starts. Bleeding stops about 3 days after I begin taking it again. If you decide to take this pill, it will take a while for your body to acclimate to it. You have to be on top of the weight gain once it begins. Periods may be hard to control or manage at first, but once you get into a rhythm it is great. It is a great contraceptive. I have unprotected intercourse twice a week with my partner of about a year and have not had any pregnancy scares or worries. I highly recommend this.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control has been the best experience so far!! The lower dose pack, I believe 1/20 caused me some major symptoms. My boobs would hurt walking down the stairs for half of the month and I’d feel like I could get my period at any moment. The constipation caused by this also led to GI issues which almost led to a long path I will not get into. I was tirelessly trying to lose weight and nothing would budge my face and arms would just show how much water I was retaining, the constipation didn’t help matters either . Once I increased the dose with my gyn to the 1.5/30 my problems were solved!! This all happened to me to because insurance switched me off Gildess without my knowing. Just wish it didn’t take me 8 months to diagnose what was going on, but hopefully my post can be of some help to others.
Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Gave me cystic acne for the first time and I’m 29 years old. My skin is really important to me so this was extremely frustrating
Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Do not take do not take! This should not be on the market. Side effects are so real. Do not take

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on birth control pills before but not this particular brand with only 4 inactive pills. I've been on this for 3 months and have had no major problems. I like that there are 24 active pills so that I get only a 4-day period. I felt 100% better than when I had the implant which I had to take out after a year because it was driving me crazy & making me bleed everyday. I think it may be causing vaginal dryness but that's almost all BC for me.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla was an awful experience for me. I gained 10 pounds and was never able to get it off. Horrible and painful acne, it made me super depressed and tender breasts. Other than that it did it’s job making my period shorter but overall would NOT recommend.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Immediately after starting this medicine , I began gaining weight , causing self esteem issues . I also notice a big increase in my anxiety and depression having very dark thoughts , and almost feeling like I was in a constant state of panic . I would often cry and feel sadness for no reason , caused me to feel extremely tired and irritable .I stop liking things I usually loved . Don’t recommend for people that suffer with mental health.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my first time EVER on birth control. I started using them because obviously I was sexually active but I had took 5 plan b’s within 3 months! I know it’s bad, so I started taking birth control for that reason and also because I don’t want a baby anytime soon. I have been on it for exactly 2 weeks and 1 day. The side effects I’ve had is mainly my breast! They have grown! They hurt, some days it’s not that bad but other days I can’t even touch them! My nipples have been sensitive as well. Another side effect is headaches! I go to sleep with one and wake up with one but not all the time, when I do they are very painful! I’ve noticed that I’m very tired, I want to sleep like all the time. But overall nothing to harsh. I thought my body would take it bad but it’s doing pretty good! Everyone is different so try it for yourself! Also my sex drive increased

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you have pre-existing mental health conditions such as anxiety and panic attacks, please please do not take this birth control. I was on a combination pill for almost 15 years and then decided to try Lo Loestrin FE so my periods would be more manageable. I would take my painful periods over what this pill did to me any day. After my second pack, I started having the worst anxiety (had it prior but not terrible)/panic attacks and depression (I have NEVER had depression). I stuck it out but finally stopped Nov. 26th after my depression got scary. It got worse for a week after discontinuing (almost got admitted to psych) but now almost 3 weeks after stopping, I am slowly feeling better. Please avoid if you already have anxiety/depression/panic disorder!

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed Junel as the first birth control pill I've ever taken, and I'm go glad I was! My biggest worry was gaining weight, but I haven't gained any. My period was super heavy and painful before, so I was also super pleased to find that I basically don't even bleed on my period while on the pill. I definitely recommend this pill, if anything it has helped more than hurt.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Junel for about 4 years now just fine, I still have some acne but this never caused any weight gain. I also barely get my period, it comes only a couple times in a year randomly, some months I get a light period, some months it’s nothing at all.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Aurovela Fe 1/20 for a year and it definitely made my period a lot lighter and I never had issues with cramps or anything. The downside is that I used to stay around the same weight for years but after being on it I gained 10 pounds. I also used to never really have issues with acne until I started Aurovela. I've now been off of it for a month and my skin has already gotten so much better!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Use with caution. Junel Fe was the first birth control I started taking to try to regulate my hormones from irregular periods and problems with anxiety. I took it for about 8 months and then stopped because I felt like it truly wasn’t doing anything for me and I don’t like taking unnecessary medications. 2 years later I’m taking it again for its actual purpose and it’s month 5 and I have had terrible mood swings and spotting 2-3 times a month. I’ll be stopping this birth control and giving my body a break. Not sure if I’ll try something else. I’m giving it a 3 because the mood swings and depressed mood is enough to make me stop it but I didn’t experience any other side effects but maybe low sex drive.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I absolutely love this medication. Someone on here said they don't like seeing the comments instructing others not to take it, and I completely agree! I have been on Junel Fe 1/20 for two years and I have never experienced any negative side effects such as weight gain or depression/anxiety. This pill lightened my periods, prevents pregnancy, and rid of my cramps. I highly recommend trying it, but our bodies react differently to medications! I will not be changing my method of birth control and I am more than happy that this is the pill my doctor prescribed me.

Larin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this for 2 months and immediately got off. First birth control pill to try and the mods swings were awful, I had zero motivation to even get out of bed, horrible headaches everyday, and anxiety for so much worse. Medications are different for everyone so you can try this one out but it was a no go for me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel Fe (Sub) for 6 months now and I want to give my honest opinion because I read these reviews back before I started it and they scared me. First few months I was dealing with very painful and sore breasts, headaches within an hour of taking my pill (I took it at 9pm so that I could fall asleep after due to the headaches) and bloating. At month 3 I was having some anxiety, unreasonable irritation at anything and everything, and random crying. but once I hit month 4 everything changed! The breast pain stopped the headaches stopped I felt like my normal self again, calm, kind, relaxed, no more bloating, my skin was really clear, and at my 6 month visit with my gyno I was down in weight. I think with all birth control you need to give it some time to regulate your hormones.  I definitely talked about stopping the pills during that 3rd month but I am really glad that I waited it out because I feel back to normal and I don't have to worry about an unplanned pregnancy.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Birth control side effects affects everyone differently. But damn, I think I would've rather dealt with the problem I had before than whatever Junel Fe put me through. It started with mood swings, to a very dark and heavy feeling to raging mental breakdowns every few days to intrusive suicidal thoughts. I  found myself getting constantly irritated and getting into a lot of fights with my boyfriend over things that I usually wouldn't be *that* upset over if I wasn't on the pill. Everyday it felt like I was drifting farther away from myself. If it starts getting mentally very bad, stop taking the pill immediately, because you'll literally be driven more insane day by day.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on lolo for nearly a year now (20yo).  I wanted to try this pill for the low hormones. Initially I loved this pill. I never have my period but take pregnancy tests every two months so I actually love it as my period used to last 7 days. It also cleared up some bumps on my forehead for a few months. I didn’t notice many side effects at first and they might not be the same for everyone. I have now realized it’s made me anxiety worse and I cry a lot more often (think 1-2 a year (which is not necessarily great I know) to 2-3 times a month). These crying episodes are not always logical ie cried because I bumped the sidewalk while parking or cried because I had leftovers for breakfast. I also have more digestive issues. I’m not sure they are directly associated to the pill but as soon as I started the medication it made me constipated and I’ve now had on and off constipation ever since starting the pill. I also become nauseous a lot more frequently.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this birth control I would say for about 3-4 years give or take possibly 2. I really liked it at first, it made my periods lighter and less symptoms of my period like cramps and headaches. But over the last year I’ve gotten so moody . I thought it was just me going through stuff. Even thought I didn’t wanna be with my boyfriend of 5 years any more because there’s times I wanna rip off his head, like I literally can’t stand him. But then other days it’s norma , how I’ve always felt for him . I also NEVER get my period anymore . I’ll have spotting for a day and that’s it . I also have lost all my sex drive like it doesn’t even interest me anymore unless I am drinking. I wanna get off of this BC so bad but I don’t know what to switch too . I would NOT recommend this BC . Many other side effects I haven’t included .

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Compared to previous birth controls, I had no complaints with moodiness, mood swings, depression, or anxiety; I felt great. However, taking this pill flared up my psoriasis horribly, when it was almost completely gone prior to starting. It also made me lose so much hair! Another negative is that there are only 2 days of placebo pills, and I like being able to take a week off like other birth controls. On the positive side though, I had no period, pms, cramps, or headaches my entire time on it. I recommend to try it out, but if there are undesirable side effects in the first month or two, do not continue it, they only get worse!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve tried a good amount of different birth control pills and this one was by far the shortest period, lightest period, cramps reduced significantly, no weight gain at all, not a lot of bloating, and my acne is not really worse or better which is fine. HOWEVER, I have never experienced anxiety like I do on this pill. That being said — different for everyone, but I’m considering going off and facing absolutely terrible cramps because the anxiety on this is so bad for no reason.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I originally started with Junel 1/20 roughly two/two and a half years ago. I was on that one less than four months before switching to 1.5 because I was bleeding the entire almost four month period. 1.5 has definitely worked a lot better for me, I did gain weight, my breasts went from 32C to 34DD (not as fun as it sounds) and I noticed that I wouldn't feel as sluggish around my period like I had before. I started on the pill because of the pain I was experiencing was enough to make me drop to the ground at age 16. It helped significantly with the pain but lately it has been coming back. My dr had me try a few others before Junel and she is having me try a new one to see if the pain goes away, otherwise I may need surgery. The pill was honestly the best working I had ever had and if the pain wasn't coming back, I have no doubt that I would've been kept on it for the foreseeable future.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Please be careful!!! It makes you depressed and super sensitive.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I needed this medication to function with PCOS and PMDD, and took it continuously for 5+ years under various names (Microgestin, Junel, Loestrin). I loved it, no noticeable side effects. However, I was one of unlucky few to develop liver tumors as a result and am pretty devastated that now hormonal BC is no longer an option for me for the rest of my life. I still recommend this pill, but believe women should have liver monitoring with extended use.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am your typical 19 year old girl who began college this August and started this birth control. I was the most outgoing, happy, loving and charismatic person. The first month was okay, I didn’t notice much. The next months after were a living nightmare for me. I never had mental health issues, depression, anxiety, panic attacks, etc. After taking this for 3 months I began to cry all of the time. I felt so out of my body and I began to get so angry and irritable and depressed with everything. I physically felt horrible, tired all of the time, overwhelmed, and just sad. I would get horrible anxiety at things that typically wouldn’t make me upset. THIS HAS BEEN HORRIBLE. I literally felt like I was losing my mind and going insane. I bled for weeks straight, would miss an occasional period, and spot every month. PLEASE DON'T TAKE THIS. It’s awful

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this birth control for a month now coming off of Tri Lo Sprintec and it has made me very very bloated.  Breaking out a bit but not sure if it's going to get worse.  At times I feel very hungry and other times I don't.  It has helped with my anxiety during my period but not sure if I can handle the bloating after I eat.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched to this medication from microgestin FE 1.5/30 for unknown reasons. When I voiced my concerns, I was told that because they are both generic forms, nothing inside of my body would change. I took the other generic for 2.5 years, no issues. I’ve been on Junel for 2 week and have been bleeding moderately (much more than spotting) AND had severe cramping since starting the medication. Reached out to my prescriber again with concerns and was told it was normal for Junel. If you don’t have to take this brand, I wouldn’t. I’m also tired all the time and sore for no apparent reason. I’m cranky and indifferent at the same time. Considering taking myself off of it.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel, microgestin, and aurovela mixed around for almost 2 years and have never had any issues, and this was the first BC I was ever put on. I had gotten on birth control due to extremely painful periods and was scared of side effects so my OB recommended the low dosage. My only problem with it is that when I’m on the placebo week my cramps are still extremely painful. I will usually just skip the placebo week and move on to the next pack to skip periods. (Checked with my Dr, he was ok with it) overall good BC.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m very concerned with my appearance and very skeptical of any medications I put into my body especially birth control because I’ve seen many horror stories with weight gain and hormonal acne and such but I got to say after my doctor convinced me to try this birth control my life has never been better. It’s such a light dosage it doesn’t give me migraines or any side effects if you have PCOS like me I 100% suggest this birth control it’s amazing

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Please whatever you do do not take this pill in my opinion. I have always dealt with anxiety and depression, but never like this before. Non stop thoughts racing through my mind and random moments of sadness and crying. This pill has been debilitating and I cannot function on it. I don't like  it. I took it for my ovarian cysts and I’d almost rather deal with that pain than the mental suffrage this has caused me. Not only mentally painful but physically. I have blood clots in my legs and feel like I have one in my chest. As with every birth control everyone’s body acts different but take this into consideration.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was given this brand of BC to help with my sexual drive in my relationship and because of weight gain . It was a lower dose than what I began with. I was on lo loestrin for about 5-6 months and it lead to even more weight gain. It also caused my acne to get worse than I’ve ever had. Even worse than when I started puberty. I have cysts in places I’ve never had acne before (back/ forehead) - I usually have breakouts on my chin. I don’t recommend this brand. I heard stories about its after effects when coming off the pill as well. I now have a copper IUD. I’m still experiencing issues from taking lo loestrin. It’s great for those it works for, but it was a really bad experience for me.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is absolutely the worst birth control for me. I was on Lo Loestrin for about 4 years before I was forced to switch to Blisovi because my insurance would only cover this one. I was told this was the generic version of Lo Loestrin and that it would essentially be the same, but it's definitely not. I've been on it for 2 months and so far I have: gained weight (not a ton but a little), gotten acne whereas my skin was very clear while on LoLo, had an increase in appetite, have had really bad anxiety, have not been able to sleep, and I've gotten my period 2 times within 1 month. Also when I get my period its really long and really heavy. Overall, this birth control has made me want to stop using birth control in general. I do want to just say also that birth control definitely affects everyone differently so if you have the option, give it a try, but listen to your body and switch off of it if you feel that it's negatively affecting your physical/mental state.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Loestrin for about 4 years, and I loved this birth control. I only got my period every 3 months and when I did they were super light. It didn't affect my weight or my skin, just made my boobs bigger which I was happy about. It didn't affect my sex drive at all, overall I had very few symptoms due to this pill. I recently had to switch to Blisovi FE because my insurance stopped covering Lo Loestrin and it's horrible. Definitely wish I could still take this pill because it was the best birth control I've ever been on.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first experience with birth control and most likely my last. Now thinking back, two weeks after taking Junel Fe began my symptoms of irrationality, anxiety, and depression. For the last three months I have been so confused as to why I have been so anxious and sad even though I have so much to be thankful for. It wasn’t until my husband researched this pill, that I was relieved to find out I am not crazy and many others have experienced the same effects. The intrusive nonstop negative thoughts have been persistent for almost three months. I am eagerly awaiting the end of my cycle to see if I will ever go back to normal after this pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 46 and I've previously had just bad experiences with birth control, but I'm trying again because my cramps are so debilitating. I also have generalized anxiety disorder. So I tried a pack for a month, being super aware and sensitive, paying attention to how it affected me. I can honestly say that I had zero mood changes, which was awesome. Then, the third week, I started spotting. Ok - here's the breakthrough bleeding. The second day, it was more and I started having cramps.
