Everyday the bleeding increased, cramps, diarrhea, temperature fluctuations, fatigue - I felt like I was on ground hog's day with the first day of my period. I mostly laid around and just felt like trash. It went on for 5 days and I was like "I am not enduring this for 3 months." So, I stopped before my active pack was over and the cramps stopped a day or so later. My spotting is decreasing. I contacted my doctor and she was like, "yeah, not enough estrogen." So am trying a new pill next month.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control to prevent pregnancy and hopefully ease my monthly cramps. This was the first time I have gone on the pill, and I was very worried about hormones and side effects but I was willing to try it out in sake of preventing pregnancy. My overall experience with this brand has been amazing! I have had no side effects and haven't gained weight. Any monthly PMS symptoms I used to suffer through are gone, my periods are lighter, and my skin has never looked clearer. For the most part I've never had too much issues with acne but I wouldn't consider my skin to be perfect by any means (a few pimples here and there on my face and body throughout the month), but ever since I started taking Blisovi my skin has never looked clearer and fresher. Any acne on my body has also completely cleared! Although I'm rating this birth control a 10/10, I do wan't to give a fair warning the first 2-3 days on the pill I did have a little bit of spotting.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible B/C pill!!! I don't have to worry about getting pregnant, since taking this pill I have been on my cycle off and on for weeks! Walgreens carry this brand only. So I switched pharmacy quick and STOPPED taking this and went back to Junel.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I always had bad periods but in September of last year the cramps started to be like contractions, bringing me to my knees and taking my breath away because they hurt so bad. My friends told me probably cysts so I got a vaginal ultrasound and they said everything looked fine but taking birth control would probably help. I read reviews for this birth control for houuuuuurrrsss and was scared to take it because of the reviews. I already struggle with depression and anxiety....however this medication had no effect on my emotional well being. It did however change my periods drastically. I only bleed lightly for a couple of days, maybe one time per period I might have to take ibuprofen for light-medium cramps but other than that it's been smooth sailing for me. I will say though my entire adult life I've weighed between 130-140 pounds. I started this birth control in December of 2020 when I was right at 140 pounds and I am now 185 pounds

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My main reason for picking Lo Loestrin Fe was for PMDD along with heavy periods. I do have bipolar 1, and I take lamictal along with various psych meds. I was told that the higher levels of estrogen in some pills can make the lamictal less effective in managing bipolar. I was advised if in the event of experiencing a mood episode to speak with my psychiatrist to have them  increase the lamictal dosage if my moods became symptomatic. However, as far as the bipolar aspect went moodwise, I did not have any issues. It did improve my acne and controlled my facial hair growth. When I got off of it, my facial hair grows a lot more rapidly than it did on the lo lo. I was on lo lo for 4 months and it did put 7 pounds on me. I’m not sure if this was weight gain or water weight. I did lose this after discontinuing the bc. My main reason for posting a review is to share my experience as a woman who takes lamictal as I always wondered what other women chose for contraception who have bipolar.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At first I thought I was flying through with fair colors on this birth control. Till the last week of the small yellow pills. I literally wanted to bitch slap everyone in my presence. The anger was palpable I almost ended a great relationship with the guy I’m dating, when out the blue I began ruminating on all the perceived slights I thought I had incurred. I had to avoid a certain co-worker for fear I would curse her out. This medication had me seeking reprisals and as a therapist this is not who I even am as a person. This will be my last month on this pill for sure!

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Junel Fe 1/20 for just over a year, and I had decided to stop birth control and then decided to go back on. I had wanted to continue with Junel Fe, but my doctor gave me Aurovela 1/20 and told me it's the same generic and it is the same thing as Junel Fe. It is definitely NOT the same. It has been only 4 days and I had to stop it. I am writing this after sleeping only 2 hours a night since I started this pack because my headaches are so unbearable that I had to take Tylenol every few hours to not be in pain, and I am so nauseous literally all the time that it doesn't even feel real. I never had any of this with Junel Fe. I immediately asked my doctor to switch me back and I just hope these side effects go away, I don't ever want to feel like this again. Please do not switch to this!!!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got my period when I was 10 years old. My flow has always been very heavy and  I'm told my cramps sound worse than other people I know. I’ve also struggled with a lot of hormonal/mental issues from being a teenager and because of the pandemic. I talked to my doctor at my annual appointment and he put me on Blisovi and let me say, as someone who’s gone to therapy and tried many ways to cope with anxiety, this has honestly helped me more than anything else has! My periods were fairly light on the placebo days and usually lasted around 3 days and I only needed panty liners. Only side effect was a little breast pain for me. My cramps aren’t as bad and I’d say it feels a lot better considering I used to throw up and miss social events because of them. I went on a different pill after three months of this one because it was a little more convenient (I could get more refills at a time) but it never made me feel as good. Glad to be back on Blisovi:)

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m pretty sure this brand is giving me depression because I was fine before I started taking it. Not only that but my emotions are all over the place and I've been lashing out a lot more often. OH! the first pack I took, I skipped my sugar pills and now I’m on my 4th pack- still no period. Maybe I just need to change the brand? Maybe that will make a difference. Everyone’s different though so everyone will react different.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this pill for 5 years. At first it was great for about a year, I had light periods always on time, my skin was clear and I had no acne ever which that continued the whole 5 years, but then my periods became even lighter but cramping was worse. I started getting more anxiety than ever, panic attacks all the time, and I gained 10 pounds. My boobs did grow a size but with all of that said it’s not worth it in my opinion. Getting off of it was the best decision ever

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill gave me constant heartburn 24/7 for 12 days so I had to stop taking it. I’m sure it’s great for birth control but I can’t have heartburn 24/7. Not gonna work for me.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on generic form of Junel 1/20 (norethindrone acetate and ethinyl estradiol) for 6 months. I did not take it continuously and had a 7-day break after 21 active days. I, unfortunately, had too many side effects and after 6 months needed to switch. My side effects included acne/rash, bloating 24/7, weight gain of 10 lbs, mood swings with depressive episodes, lack of sex drive, lack of energy, and breakthrough bleeding every other week lasting about a week (2 weeks out of 4 a month). The breakthrough bleeding was the last straw. 2 positives were no pregnancy scares and my bleeding was so light that I needed only liners or light tampons. This pill caused me to have a dark brown discharge for half of the month. I switched to Tri-Estarylla and so far no issues with this pill.

Pirmella 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve had a good experience with this birth control! My period is very light and it has alleviated previous intense cramping. It regulates my period so it is very easy to predict when it will come. It has cleared up my acne, but it has left some dark spots on my skin. Some more downsides is that it makes me depressed the week before my period and it has lowered my libido.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking Tarina Fe 1/20 for a month now, not taking the placebo week, & it has been awful. I’ve felt super angry over the smallest things, I can’t stop eating, I get horrible hot flashes, I’ve been extremely dehydrated, I’ve had a constant migraine since starting, I’ve been getting horrible cramps, my acne has been pretty bad as well & I'm on the heaviest period I’ve had in 2 and a half years.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used to take Nortrel 1/35 until it was put on back order and my pharmacy started giving me Primella 1/35. I honestly think whatever dose this is is perfect for me because I don’t have any side effects, no weight gain, no moodiness, nothing & my periods are now regular and fairly light. Not everyone has the same experience, however it works great for me & I’ll continue to use it :) (also nortrel 1/35 is a great pill as well if anyone is interested)

Hailey Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used to be on Junel Fe but when I switched insurance they prescribed me this instead saying it would be the same thing. I had absolutely no problems on Junel Fe, in fact it was working wonderfully for me. Well I’ve been taking Hailey for about a week and I swear I’m an emotional wreck. Again, it’s only been a week but I’m so irrationally emotional and it’s driving me crazy. I’m going to continue to use it to see if my hormones level out but it’s been a rough switch so far.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been taking this for 6 months. I switched to the pill from the patch for irregular periods and breakthrough bleeding. My periods were non existent until this last month (month 6) I was spotting and passing clots for about a week with severe cramps. I’ve also gained 15-20 pounds depending on what scale I use. I’ve been at the same weight previously for 3+ years and having that change has drastically made my depression worse. I have anxiety attacks without this pill and after starting it the frequency has gone up tremendously. I have a condition called POTS and my symptoms of tachycardia and hypertension have gotten worse since starting this medication. Upside, I’m not pregnant! Overall would NOT recommend this drug at ALL.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control in June 2020. It is now November 2020. I had severe depression in the second and third months of taking it. I felt extremely depressed. I was experiencing suicidal thoughts and a complete emptiness that I've never felt. My sex drive is very low. Although it did clear up my acne and I do struggle with acne. However, the sadness has subsided but I am currently experiencing some of the worst anxiety of my life. The anxiety is 24/7 and I sometimes can not sleep. It is debilitating anxiety. Where my heart feels like it's beating so fast that I am about to pass out. This is not a good birth control. Please read reviews before considering.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Awful. Breaking out, feel horrid. Never had this with other brands.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking this pill for a year now, and I finally found the source of my anxiety. I feel so validated from these comments. I thought I was an anxious mess and couldn't sleep because I was getting married and getting adjusted to married life, but I'm even more anxious than ever and as I can see from these comments this is definitely the source. I have never taken medication for sleep or anxiety until I started taking this pill, and my doctor started me on a low dose sleep/anxiety med when melatonin wasn't working. If you can, get another generic or just be prepared to be gloomy, anxious and sleepy all the time and know it's not you it's the birth control. I'll be starting Hailey FE 1/20 soon and hopefully it'll be better. Giving it a 3 because it worked in the sense that I'm not pregnant, but I can't believe how it wrecked me emotionally.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I started taking this pill about the 13th of September and it was great. My bleeding had stopped. I got to my last pill and I started having some pregnancy symptoms. So fast forward to 3 weeks later I'm still having those symptoms I stopped taking the pill I believe it was before the 9th of October and I can honestly say that I don't know if it's the pill that has caused this but I am  continuously having these pregnancy symptoms and I just don't know what to do anymore. I've had multiple negative tests I've even had a negative blood test at the the hospital but I'm still having the symptoms. I'm going to test again tomorrow but I don't know what's going on. I've started spotting on the 10th of October lasted for about 3 days thought it was implantation bleeding so I didn't think anything of it. I waited 2 weeks took a test, negative, took another test, negative to another test negative, they've all been negative! I do not recommend this pill. I feel like I'm going crazy!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Made me suicidal and very sick for 3 months, so sick I was bed rested because I couldn't even stand. I missed all my periods. It made me more aggressive and angry.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Breast tenderness, bloating, tiredness, unmotivated, anxious, gastrointestinal issues, dark urine, depression, anxiety impulsiveness, stomach pains, over eating, acid reflux, insomnia, overall sadness. I do not like this medication. After 12 days I’m quitting cold turkey!

Ortho-Novum 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My gyno first prescribed this when I was 17 and had an ovarian cyst. My mother refused so since I was underage, I could not get them. At 19, again the gyno prescribed them and since I was of age, I took them for four years until I got married and wanted to start a family. Big surprise, I couldn't get pregnant. It took 1 year and 3 months for my periods to return during which I was told I would "never get pregnant without Clomid". I stuck it out and figured I took them for 4 years so it would probably take 4 years to undo the damage. I got pregnant 1 year and 3 months after I stopped taking them. I never bothered to read anything about them until I had to do a college paper on a "controversial topic". I decided to do the paper on bc pills and it was only then that I saw there were serious side effects. The story has a happy ending in that I did go on to have several children, zero abortions, no more cysts, and great success with the "Fertility Awareness" method of birth control.

Nortrel 0.5/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Honestly it’s a great birthcontrol. I’ve been taking nortel for 3 months for my acne and cramps and neither have been fixed but I may need to be on it longer. I have became extremely emotional and would cry all the time over dumb stuff. also if it made me even more emotional I’d feel the need to vomit because it was so bad. I don’t recommend if you are currently depressed however it may make you depressed if there is stuff going on in your life.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Taytulla in 2019 and it’s been great to me. I have zero side effects. I feel completely normal. I haven’t had a period in months which is normal. It’s expensive but IDK it’s worth it. I’ve had terrible experiences with other pills.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Has worked perfectly so far! It has been seven months, and it has completely cleared up hormonal acne on my body and helped my face although not as completely. I have not had any mood symptoms or nausea. Maybe a slight reduction in libido but not much. Also went from over a week of severe pain and heavy flow to a few days of light flow and minimal pain. I love this birth control so far. Before starting it, I read the reviews here, and they scared me, but I have not had any of their experiences. Keep in mind usually only unsatisfied people bother to leave reviews.

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was hoping to put less hormones in my body and so switched from nuvaring to LoLo to try something different after many years. I asked my boyfriend to pay attention to any mood changes since sometimes it’s hard to know/observe when it’s in your body. It’s been one month and this last week of pills I’ve really felt a discerning difference. I’ve never had mood changes like this on birth control , and although they aren’t extreme they’re enough to color my day to day experiences in a negative way. My boyfriend said I'm more anxious, and I've also noticed I'm easily irritated/angered by small things every single day. My mood usually isn’t like this. Currently on the two sugar days & all those emotions are even more intense.  I'm going to stop the pill now because I'm usually a pretty happy person and this pill is really dampening that. Good luck & pay attention to all the signs if you try this one out!

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My pharmacy quit carrying Blisovi 24 FE (I was on it for three years). I switched to Hailey for a month and am stopping birth control all together because of it. My breasts are very sore, my face broke out like crazy, no libido, skin is itchy and I'm very emotional.
Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Bleeding 2 weeks into taking pill. Some cramping - Did not notice any other side effects

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this medication for several months now. I was prescribed Junel, but they've been out of stock for months, so this is what the pharmacy has been giving me. I've had anxiety in the past, plus I was in a pretty toxic relationship, so I thought my symptoms were normal and not a result of the BC. I've been battling with severe anxiety and waves of depression. The week before my period, I'm  very irritable and can't stand life. I'm so glad you ladies spoke up. I seriously was thinking I was losing my mind. I'm completely abstinent now, so I'm going to stop taking it, and hopefully my anxiety and depression subsides. I did notice that I had no anxiety on the days that I took my reminder pills. I really hope this solves my issues. I have been so miserable inside my own skin. It's been a very scary experience. I'm giving it a 5 because it did do a good job as a contraceptive. The side effects are just too much for me.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been on birth control before and was prescribe Larin Fe through an online service. It immediately caused headaches that did not subside. During my second month taking it I bled a lot while taking the active pills. It was not spotting, more blood than a normal period. Needless to say this medication had no benefits. I was taking it strictly because I wanted to skip my period.

Aurovela 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am a perimenopausal 46 YO who was dealing with some major anxiety issues and other symptoms that this part of life brings. My doctor suggested I try this BC pill because is shortens the length of periods and helps with the heaviness as well. It took about a week or so to get acclimated to the new hormones, but after that, I am like my old self again. I would recommend this pill to anyone who is going through/about to go through perimenopause. It has helped me so much. Oh, and I only have light periods every 6-7 weeks. Love that part too.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I tried Lo Loestrin Fe when I was in high school and was on it for about two years. During that time, I never had a regular period (the whole reason I started birth control). I was always spotting, which was really annoying. Additionally, I found myself having a lot of uncontrolled mood swings. Just because Lo Loestrin Fe didn't work for me doesn't mean it won't work for you. Everyone's body is different and it's worth a go.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Larin is absolutely the worst thing I've ever been on! I got on Depo at 18 this was my first time getting on birth control. Depo simply worked for me I was on Depo for almost 6 years and never had ONE SIDE effect. Skin was always crystal clear, never had a period or spotting expect once or twice a year, never gained any weight, no mood swings or energy issues. I switch to Larin because of the risk of osteoporosis when on Depo. Lets just say I'm switching back to Depo next week after being on Larin for 3 months. I would much rather deal with osteoporosis than these side effects. My skin has never been this bad in my life. Its dry and I have so much hormonal acne that won't go away (I also know its the birth control because on the off week from the pill my skin instantly begins to clear up). I'm so dehydrated all the time now. I've been experiencing horrible motion sickness & vomiting. My breast are swollen and tender all the time. My energy levels and sleep patterns are horrible. 0/10

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on it for 3 months until I began to notice a significant change in my mood, mental health, and well being. I noticed I was super sensitive, very emotional, loss of appetite, and I felt very cloudy minded. Though I was emotional, there were other times where I just felt flat. These symptoms really began to bother me and once I read reviews and realized others were feeling this way, I decided to stop taking Tarina. I am now going to switch back to the patch! I understand everyones body is different but just be aware that this pill can make you feel this way. I have never experienced any symptoms like this until I was 3 months into taking the pill. I thought it was just me having the winter blues but it was much more than that. Be aware of your body!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 44 years young and I  have been on LoLo for about a year now only because my last high dose pill was discontinued. I was concerned with a little bit of spotting in the beginning, but I haven't had any real side effects. My periods are very light, and my doctor assured me that as long as my period still happens it's nothing to worry about. I am a bit emotional towards the end of the pack, but I've always gotten emotional before my period comes! All in all, a pretty good contraceptive

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control did not leave me with any bad side effects regarding my mood or weight. However, I was bleeding every other week. It was so annoying and now I’m switching over to Sprintec.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched to Aurovela when I moved and changed pharmacies about 4 months ago. I've dealt with anxiety and depression for my entire life, but I was always able to cope until I started Aurovela. I lost all motivation, could barely force myself out of bed most days, and it amplified my anxiety nearly to the point of having panic attacks. I've always been a stoic person, but while taking this medication, I was constantly on the verge of tears. I started to suspect a few weeks back that the medication was causing my extreme mood swings, anxiety, and depression, so I made an appointment with my doctor and just got switched to a new medication. I've only been off Aurovela for a few days, but I'm already feeling a million times better. I can't believe I toughed it out for so long. I've tried several brands of birth control pills over the last decade, but this is by far the worst. Save yourself the trouble, don't take this medication.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started on June Fe 1/20 about 4 months ago and I’ve barely experienced any side effects. I haven’t had any weight gain, acne, serious mood changes, etc. The only slight side affect I’ve had is the lightening of my period. My period was very light to begin with so it has been close to nothing while on Junel Fe. I’ve also experienced some brown discharge. Everyone’s body is different, but I haven’t had any sort of mental disorders so I am not sure how it would affect someone with that. Overall, for my first birth control, Junel Fe has worked out pretty well for me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first month I loved this medication. Lighter period, cleared up acne, no nausea. However, month 2, and I became an emotional wreck with gradually worsening anxiety/depression. I’d randomly burst into tears while driving or doing other daily mundane tasks. I had to stop this pill with near immediate improvement in mood symptoms. I’d rather bleed an entire month than lose my sanity.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Taytulla for about 3 1/2 years now and I have not had any side effects other than my period going away and my breasts being a little tender. I was on the brand name for 1-2 years and then insurance switched me to generic. I had normal to light periods before taking this but now it is gone completely which is awesome. Having no period for this long freaked me out a little but my doctor said it is normal, and I am a healthy 20 year old. This is the first BC I have been on and I have 0 complaints. I have not noticed any weight gain or mood changes over these past few years and I have gotten used to not having a period! Also not preggo which is nice!  I went on accutane and noticed light spotting for a day or two each month but recently got off and haven't had a period since. Every birth control effects people in different ways so I would keep an open mind! This has been life changing for me.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking Blisovi for at least two years now. I started taking it when I was about 19. It was wonderful- at first. Like it cleared my acne dramatically. No cramps - ever. However, at one point the packaging changed, which I thought was weird but whatever. Now I'm positive that this pill is giving me cystic acne. Because on the placebo weeks, my skin clears back up again. (22 now) Looking for another form of birth control ASAP.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):it has worked for all around except for one thing I'll get into it further on). My skin has cleared up, zero mood changes and I haven't gained any weight. My period is now super light and regular as well. My only con... vaginal dryness!!! so bad!!! It is very hard to be intimate with my partner. Other than that, Junel Fe is great.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched from Junel Fe to Aurovela Fe 24. I was really scared reading the horrendous comments, but after talking to my doctor she convinced me to give it a chance. The first day the natural nausea. The second day the small acne. After that it was exactly like Junel. My skin in clearer than ever, my period went from heavy 7 days to 2 light days. My appetite HAS increased but I am on a weight gain journey so it is helping in that aspect. My mood hasn't been effected in any way and I have had mental health issues in the past including taking anti-depressants at a time. I don't know how it would effect those going from high estrogen to low, but I would still recommend giving this medication a chance especially if you have been on Junel or fall under that umbrella of lo loestren, etc. Everybody's body is different and the one positive  comment I had seen before going on it mentioned that those who have bad experiences are more likely to post about it, so here is your positive comment!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking this since June 2020 and it's the first form of birth control I've tried. No complaints whatsoever! My acne has cleared up, periods are extremely light and I only have one every 3 months, and no change in my sex drive or mood. I was worried that I would gain weight, but the only weight I've gained is due to stress/diet changes. No vaginal dryness either.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This has made my vag dry, this is a problem because I have never had this issue before but I'm hoping it will pass. Also I'm not pregnant and I barely have any acne.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this to help with my PMDD. I gained 15lbs in 2 months of taking this while training for a marathon! This was the worst decision ever. I stopped when the scale hit 15lbs!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking birth control for the first time 4 months ago and it was fine for the first 3 months, but then things went downhill. I developed an eczema rash, which is very unusual because I've never had eczema before. I would get chronic headaches and an upset stomach, which again, is unusual because I do not have a sensitive stomach. My cramps and tender breast issues did not improve on this birth control, in fact I think the tenderness may have gotten worse. The worst part about this medication was the mood swings. I already struggle with anxiety, but it is manageable and normally my mood is stable. This birth control made me very sensitive, irritable, anxious, sad and any other negative emotion you could think of. It started causing problems with my loved ones and I feel like I can't control my own emotions. I don't feel like myself and I hate it, so I will be switching as soon as this pack is over and honestly I can't wait to be done with these pills.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Nexplanon for years and was waiting on insurance to approve my new one so started this. The first month started well. I gained a bit of weight but was feeling better than the troubles I was having with the implant at the end (I had been informed my implant lasted longer than it actually did by a past doctor and it was expiring and causing symptoms from expiration). Around the third week I started getting horrible stomach problems, migraines, mood swings, and ANXIETY. I gained 30lbs in 3 months even after I got off of it I continued to gain and to this day I still have sensitive stomach, am now on medication for anxiety because it messed my mental health up so bad. I’m finally levelling out 6 months later and beginning to lose the stubborn weight I gained on it. This was the worst experience of my life and I’m happy to be back on my Nexplanon but it’s taken a long time for me to even get to my normal on Nexplanon and I’m not there yet. I didn’t get pregnant on it.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When I started Blisovi Fe 1/20 it made me feel sort of weird for the first few days. After that I felt like I was losing weight which was a blessing for me since I’m around 200 lbs. Recently I missed taking it for one day and for some reason I started my period again. (I had already started my period at the beginning of the month before I started this contraceptive) I’m not sure why,  but it does suck. So far no pregnancy which is a plus but regardless I am really angry about having my period again. (If anyone could tell me why, please let me know..)

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this birth control for over a year in total but stopped taking it for a while. When I first got on Anyacen I gained 15+ pounds. I just recently started taking the pill again and the change I feel is drastic and it's only been a week back on it. I noticed undeniable tiredness that wasn't there before, I'm way more irritable with others, and my sex drive has plummeted. I think birth control affects everyone differently, this is just my experience.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Junel Fe for almost a month. I don't like taking it because I can taste the  pill. I started taking the pill on the 26th of September & started my cycle on October 7th & still bleeding but  normal instead of heavy. The nurse told me that it may  take a couple of months for my body to get adjusted to the pill. I will continue taking the pill until otherwise.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you deal with anxiety, DO NOT TAKE. I was on it for a few months and my anxiety sky rocketed. Couldn't eat, couldn't sleep, panic attacks. My heart felt like it was constantly beating out of my chest. I was miserable. I've been off it for a month and still dealing with it. It's gotten better but still not 100%.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At first I was given Junel Fe, but then my insurance switched me to Blisovi Fe (not that I liked Junel Fe either). I developed an eczema rash and horrible mood swings on Junel Fe, as well as chronic headaches. Blisovi Fe came with the same bad mood swings and frequent headaches. My eczema rash went down slightly, but it's still present, so I will be switching medications as soon as possible. I understand that everyone reacts differently to birth control, but I did not have a good reaction to either brand for this hormone combo, so I will be trying a different hormone combination entirely.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking this for 9 months now. I had severe pain with my periods along with hemorrhagic cysts that would burst about 4 times a year. I was so afraid to take birth control because of the horror stories, but after seeing a really good dr who explained everything well and listened to me well (she is amazing) I finally gave this a try. This is the first birth control I've taken and my periods have never been easier in my life. I don't even have cramps anymore!  It has been world of difference. Everything is a trade off of course. I've gained about 10 pounds, I get occasional headaches, 1 or 2  bad ones a month, and I feel a little out of it. But really is worth it for me. It beats having to deal with extreme pain every month, ER trips, and fear of something really bad happening with a cyst. Overall the side effects have been minimal. People usually only give reviews if they have bad experiences, but I wanted to put this out there as my overall good experience with this medication.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is causing me to have hair loss so bad. I also am very emotional and have no sex drive and am in a bad mood. I stopped taking it for about 3 months and got back on it for awhile and now I'm thinking of stopping it again. It is awful.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had perimenopausal symptoms since my early 40s.  I began Lo Loestrin Fe at 43 and I am now in my mid 40s and I love it.  My life was awful before LoLo.  It is like I am a kid again.  No erratic periods, no hot flashes, less hair loss, and just feeling more normal.  I will stay on this until I reach menopause at 51.  Thank god for Lo Loestrin Fe.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS!! I took only the first 12 days of this pill and had to stop IMMEDIATELY! I have always been happy and active and has never experienced unusual depression or anxiety until I took this! I couldn’t sleep, or eat for weeks! I lost 10 pounds and experienced depression on a whole new level. I was away at college and had to call my mom to come get me because I was experiencing suicidal thoughts. DO NOT TAKE THIS. I’ve been off of it for 6 days now and am JUST NOW starting to eat small meals and feel like I’m in my right mind. If you have experienced crippling anxiety and can not seem to reason know it’s this medication. This seriously needs to get off of the market ASAP because 78% of girls that take this feel the same way. I’m never taking birth control ever again.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hi I’m an 18 year old girl and I’ve currently been on this pill for about 3-4 months. Although it has allowed me to have lighter periods. That is, for me, the ONLY positive side affect. This pill has caused me severe anxiety, loss of appetite, hopelessness, migraines & nausea, constantly tired and just overall destroyed my sex drive and ability to feel pleasure. I genuinely thought I was crazy and I even enrolled myself into counseling. Come to find out, the pharmacist lady randomly overshared to me her crazy stories of what birth control had done to her and I ended up researching Junel. Although everyone is different and I may be a rare case of bad side affects, getting off this pill may have saved my life. I highly recommend, DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL if you are someone who already struggled with anxiety and self esteem issues. I seriously thought I was crazy.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got put on this birth control 3 weeks ago and I am not liking it at all. I’ve been on Mibelas 24 Fe for almost 8 years and after my annual pap, my dr prescribed me this. I’ve already gained weight, I face is breaking out, I CANNOT STOP EATING. This birth control is horrible and I just want to stop it overall. I’ve already gained 10lbs on this pill.

Larin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had to start taking Larin when I couldn't get Microgestin. I have been on MG for forever and have never had any issues. Made this switch last month and I knew after 2 weeks something wasn't right. I had horrible mood swings, I got really swollen in the abdominal area, felt like my allergies were on 1000. I contacted my OB on week 3 and told her I had to get something different. I would not recommend Larin to any woman. Now working on getting myself back to some form of balance after this horrible experience.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this medicine for a month, and then I stopped for a few months and then I started taking it again, The first time I took it all  experienced was a little nausea, However the second time a took it I experienced the worst stomach pain in my life, I was debating whether to go to the ER or not, I couldn’t sleep and I was throwing up, I couldn’t eat or move, I am not sure if the pill caused this but it happened when I started taking it again so I believe it is from the pill, I experience extreme nausea now, and I barely eat, A lot of people say it can take 2-3 months for nausea to stop, so I will continue taking it, If I experience the pain I experienced last time, I am going to stop taking it. Don’t let this review determine whether you’re going to take this pill or not, every body is different .

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first time taking hormonal birth control. I am 43 years old and started taking Junel to help take the edge off of perimenopause symptoms. I took the first pill on the first day of my cycle, and the first effect I experienced was that my period ending up lasting for 12 days (as opposed to my usual 4). For the weeks, I had some minor headaches and bloating, minor weight gain (maybe 1.5 - 2 pounds), and breast pain. I was willing put up with the physical discomforts, but what made me discontinue Junel after 1 month was the depression and anxiety. I do have a history of post-partum depression, so it's possible that I am just one of those who is more at risk for depression with *any* BC. Maybe it would have levelled off after a few months of use, but I just wasn't willing to risk it. Of course, as soon as I stopped taking the pill, I got my period right away. I essentially had my period for 3 out of 4 weeks of this month. Ugh.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Alyacen for 6 months and with a very active sex life I can give it a good rating for doing what birth control is supposed to do. However my mood swings are terrible. From screaming rage and a racing heart in traffic to complete break downs at the drop of a hat during a rough day I have considered coming off Alyacen for that reason alone. Other than that I think its been pretty effective.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Aurovela Fe 1/20 a month ago (Sep 2021) and the reviews scared me at first but so far my side effects have been small pimples on my cheek and forehead, nausea like once a week and like 2 days where I randomly felt sad and started crying outta nowhere lol. That’s it. This is my first time ever taking birth control and I mainly got it because of my really heavy periods and TERRIBLE cramps. I started my period 3 days ago and so far it’s been lighter and I got very very light cramps the first 2 days to where they were manageable and I didn’t need to take any pain relievers. But just keep in mind that everyone reacts differently to these type of things, especially if your doctor or pharmacy switched you from a high dose BC to a low dose BC (which would be Aurovela). As for the pimples I use Curology so that’s been helping me and I drink some ginger ale whenever I get nauseous. I hope my review helped!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Okay, before I say anything this birth control can be great for you and bad for me. Every body is different but for those that can relate read away.I was on Lolo estrin before this birth control, and that was awful way worse than this. But in April I decided to change and go onto this birth control. First month I was really nauseous and my anxiety was really bad. My period was okay, everyday before my period I get a really bad migraine, sometimes even a few. For a few months I was fine, but then felt as though I was having awful panic attacks. I was anxious over everything. I felt so different, and not myself at all. No motivation, and feeling as though my life would be like this forever. I began having awful thoughts, and anxiety through the roof. I couldn't watch movies about people with mental illness anymore because it made me have panic attacks. If you are experiencing mental health problems from this pill or any pill you should immediately get off of it.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I take this med for HRT. I hit peri-menopause early. (And I'm 47 now.) When I did have a period I experienced rage that was simply off the charts. My OB/GYN and I agreed I needed HRT desperately. I have to say that when I started taking it the experience was miraculous. I tolerate this medication with no side effects whatsoever, and the rage simply vanished. This medication really saved me.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Couldn't even lose a half a pound on this birth control!!!!!!!@!!!!!!!I tried so hard for a year the scale wouldn't budge I thought I was going to go insane then I realized it was the birth control......which I started exactly a year ago. Overall no other side effects other than 100 % no sex drive, which was also awful for my marriage.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Terrible pill. Bled almost the entire first month. 2 weeks the second, spotting. Missed taking the pill by an hour and period starts. Had to set an alarm to take it. Tried it for five months, never worked well. Period arrived at unscheduled times and for a week plus at a time. 48 years old.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took Larin Fe 1/20 for almost two years after I had my second IUD removed because it was inserted incorrectly. I would have never gone back on the pill, but I needed my muscle to heal from the IUD being lodged into it. Would not recommend this brand of birth control pills to anyone, I could tell how horrible it made me feel within a month or two of using it. I’m a pretty upbeat person who loves physical activity and being around friends/family, but I quickly hated all those things and found it hard to stay happy all the time. The littlest inconvenient would push me over the edge and it was nowhere near normal. I’ve recently quit it cold turkey and feel AMAZING. I’m back to enjoying life and do not recommend this brand of pill to anyone at all.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):!!please remember birth control works different for everyone!! I first got put onto BC my freshmen year of college because I had ovarian cyst. My gyno suggested Lo Lo and it worked great. My acne cleared, boobs got bigger, and I had no issues emotionally. I stopped taking it for a bit because I forgot it on a vacation & decided to wait 6 months to get back on. I then moved to a different college and went to a gyno who suggested a generic higher dosage BC -  that was TERRIBLE. I was an emotional wreck, so sensitive about everything, and the worst side effect was I had constant vaginal dryness and reoccurring BV. So I stopped taking that after about 5 months. and recently got put back on Lo Lo after visiting a new gyno and it’s been fantastic. It has been about 1 month and I’ve already noticed my boobs have gotten slightly bigger (totally cool with that), I already have a pretty high sex drive but I literally can’t go a day without thinking of it now haha & no emotional/acne issues. I’m 22 btw :)

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I would say it’s OK can you have sex on the Brown pill The condom got stuck inside me and he came while doing that I take my pill every day i’ve been spotting is this normal

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My pelvic health doctor suggested this birth control as a way to help with ovarian cysts and cycle related pains. I was on it for 4 months. I started having a lot of sleeping problems, anxiety (especially at night), breast tenderness, severe bloating, gas pains, digestion complications. I also experienced some depression, feelings of despair and dread. I thought it was all from my stressful job (RN) but I didn't have these issues before taking this bc. I gave it 4 months for my body to adjust to it but this is not a good fit for me. I've been off the birth control for 5 days now and noticed a HUGE difference in my digestion, my fluid retention has improved and I have been sleeping better at night and no longer dread what the next day will bring. Hopefully this review will help others as well.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on and off this birth control for years. From ages 16-18, then took a break for about a year, and then from ages 19-(almost )21. I honestly didn’t know what to expect coming off of this BC again, since the only time I had been off it I was doing active duty military training. I assumed the change in anxiety, weight loss, etc. was because I was in a unique/stressful environment I’d never experienced before. However, after getting off of it once again, I can say this birth control worsened the feelings of mental illness. I wish I hadn’t taken it for so long. I’ve been so insecure, had zero sex drive whatsoever, and felt bloated/overweight constantly. My anxiety and mood swings reached their peaks while taking this. It was a struggle to lose weight while taking this, even with exercise & eating in a calorie deficit. My joints would swell, and I’d still experience all the feelings of periods while taking this without the bleeding. It did seem to help curb my acne though.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Prior to taking this birth control I had terrible cramps, almost completely irregular periods and rough mood swings. This pill saved my girly parts because after about 2 months my period almost completely disappeared, very light and bled maybe a full day and a day of spotting, and moderate cramps every other month.  I experience mood swings only the week of my period and it’s been pretty spot on every month. the only time it’s changed is when i take antibiotics. Highly recommend for a beginners birth control pill !!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I haven't been on this birth control pill long. I started taking the pill after my doctor said it will help with my PCOS. I missed one day and the next day, I was extremely emotional like I was having a mental breakdown! I'm an emotional person anyway but it's normally when something happens and I've never had a breakdown out of nowhere. I've had all the memories I suppressed when I was younger come back at full force. I'm very depressed and feel very lonely. I'm nauseous and can't eat. I'm having cramps out of this world. It feels like I'm going to get my period soon and I'm just finishing week 1. I'm going to stop the birth control and see if I somewhat go back to normal.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed this medication to ease the effects caused by my uterine fibroids (extremely heavy periods with large clots, having to change a super tampon plus thick pad every two hours, irregular cycles, pain from head to toe). I am not using this medication for birth control as I am not sexually active. Prior to taking this medication, I had been off hormonal birth control for about four years. Unfortunately, this medication is not helping me, aside from clearing up most of my hormonal acne! My periods are still heavy but now last two to three times longer with constant spotting and discharge of old blood in-between. I have intense bouts of nausea and dizziness, along with headaches, diarrhea, complete loss of energy and motivation, and moderate pain everywhere. I've never experienced side effects this bad from birth control before.
Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The worst! It’s been already almost two months of bleeding.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took LoLo for about 4-5 years, I LOVED it! I only got off of it because my insurance stopped covering it. I super light 2-3 day periods, little to no cramping, easy peasy. no weight gain, no headaches, no mood swings. I MISS IT!!

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First of all.. I would NOT recommend these pills to anyone! I have PCOS and  Endometriosis.I didn't even make it to week 3... even in the pamphlet it says if you are having stomach pains to NOT stop taking it. Let's talk about the side effects I had. That very first pill had my stomach in loads of pain. I couldn't sleep at night, was very nauseous, had hot flashes like crazy. I would pour sweat then start freezing. I had migraines. My boobs hurt the entire time. I couldn't control any of my emotions. I cried all the time, I was angry and yelling at my husband for the tiniest things! It got so bad he told me to stop taking it so I did. IF you have anxiety or depression do NOT take these! Again I wouldn't recommend these to anyone!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My obgyn prescribed this to me to treat menopause symptoms. Well, peri menopause. I was still ovulating and having some periods sporadically. She also prescribed a low dose testosterone gel to go along with it. The combination was life changing! I felt like my old self again!!!! My symptoms were major fatigue, anxiety, joint pain, loss of sex drive, loss of all motivation and weight gain. After taking the combo of Larin Fe and testosterone I felt so much better. I’m like a different person now. This review is supposed to be about Larin Fe and I can say it is responsible for helping me feel myself again. I was on it for several weeks before the testosterone and no longer had hot flashes or mood swings. The testosterone gel added to it was a perfect combo. Finally an obgyn who knew what they were doing! All the others kept giving me estrogen and progestin pills but my hormones were still fluctuating. The Larin Fe took over and kept my levels at a steady rate.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was originally on Junel and took a break since I was in between doctors. I started birth control to help with my extremely heavy flow. My new doctor decided to keep me on Junel since I didn’t have any issues. Unfortunately my pharmacy gave me Aurovela. Because of this drug, I’ve had a 3 week cycle. And had had cramping for 2 of those weeks. I tried to give it a second month, because maybe my body needs to get used to it. I ended up throwing the 3 month pack away and told my pharmacy I would pay out of pocket to make the switch

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was so scared reading all of the negative reviews but I saw one that said that most people only review things when its bad and people don’t review when its good so I wanted to change that! My period was almost unbearable. It was affecting my grades in college on the day that I got it. After being on Lo lLo (almost 2 months) I haven’t gotten my period! The only side effect was nausea for me but that goes away soon. Not getting my period is an amazing feeling. Try a drug for yourself and base your opinion on your own experiences!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was the type that never wanted to get on birth control because of all the bad things people told me about it, but then when I started having sex my hormones made me breakthrough bleed during and after sex so my gyno decided to put me on Lo Loestrin Fe and omg i love this pill. I've been on this pill for about 4 months and I haven’t had any acne, weight gain, or anything like that, during my period it will be either very light or heavy and it will last for about 8 days so like 3 days longer than how long my period was before i took this pill but I’m totally okay with that. This pill is amazing I love it so much I highly doubt I’ll ever switch to another pill.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Please, please, PLEASE do not take this birth control!!!!! I'm 19 years old and started taking birth control to regulate my period. I had been on Blisovi for a week and felt like I was on a euphoric high but about 3 weeks later, I began to feel like I was at the lowest I've ever been. I've been very fortunate to not have many issues with mental health in the past, so this was strange to happen out of nowhere. I continued to feel the most empty & depressed I've ever felt for about another month until I contacted my OBGYN to switch my birth control. I switched over to a lower dose of birth control, Lo Loestrin Fe, which I haven't even been on for even a week, and I'm already starting to feel like myself again. I'm not sure if the Lo Loestrin will have any negative side effects in the future, but I can still tell you to NOT take Blisovi. It's not worth the depression.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Blisovi Fe 1/20 for about 2 years now. I am 19 and weigh 130lbs. At first the pills made my periods heavier and really inconsistent. I started having cramps and breast tenderness for the first time when I was on my scheduled period. After about 4 months, my period became regular and normal flow. Today, I occasionally have lil cramping here and there (depends on what I eat). The pills made my acne clear up and now I have a very light period (with lil cramping if I eat fast food). My weight or moods did not change.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If I could give this a 0, I would. DO NOT take this medication. I read all the bad reviews, and figured I would have a different experience, because I have never had a problem with birth control in the past. I was WRONG. This stuff has literally ruined me. I already had anxiety but it has now turned absolutely crippling. I can’t sleep, eat, or do any of the things I used to enjoy. My boobs are in intense pain at all times. I cry over literally everything. I have genuinely never been so unhappy with myself in my entire life. I hope I can go back to normal after quitting cold turkey this week.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am currently on month 4.Pros: no period, no weight gain.Con: back acne (never had acne in my life), anxiety & depression (never really had either) and I am  always tired!!!!!!!!!! I know have been going to bed at like 8:30?! wakeup tired, tired throughout the day. UGH. I am done with this

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had a very positive experience using Junel FE 24. I started this BC after I went to my doctor with severe bleeding that would not stop for months at a time. I was later diagnosed with menorrhagia and prescribed these pills. I have been on them for 3 months now with hardly any side effects. My first cycle after starting the pills was heavy but since then they have been very light and short. Before starting Junel I suffered from horrible migraines 3-4 days out of the week and since starting them I have only had 1 headache in the last 3 months. I can't give an opinion on how effective it is at preventing pregnancy since I am not sexually active. Above all I have been very please with my experience taking this BC and I hope it is just as helpful to others who may suffer from this condition.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before I started on Hailey 24 Fe and I was reading the reviews on this sight I was really nervous for bad side effects. I am happy to say my fears weren't all justified. I just started my second month on Hailey 24 Fe. So far my symptoms have been as follows-Loss of appetite - more emotional but it has steadied out-Larger swollen breasts-Can't stand the smell of fish or cooked bacon- Super mild periods-Barely any cramping or bleeding-No weight gain-No acneOverall starting Hailey 24 Fe has been almost stress free and everything is manageable.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I know they say to give birth control at least 3 months for your body to adjust. Well I recently switch to Lolo because my previous BC was making me more anxious and started making me really sad. Whenever I was on the placebo pills I would feel great and then by day 2 of hormones I would fall back in these emotional cycles. Unfortunately, Lolo has made it worse. I’m almost through month 2 and I cannot describe how angry this pill makes me, over nothing! It gets to the point where, I’m pacing around, hysterically crying- my fiancé and I are struggling real hard to deal with the mood swings. It’s almost like I need to take mental meds to cope with this birth control. I’ve seen posts on here about people sticking it out- but I’m not sure I want. If you have any predisposition to mental side effects, I would pick a different pill.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was previously taking Lo Loestrin but insurance will now only cover Blisovi Fe. I always kind of struggled with birth controls altering my mental health but I honestly believe this one is by far the worst for me. I have missed a lot of periods on this pill which I am getting concerned with. I was taking Blisovi then at the end of the pills I noticed I had one last Lo Loestrin and took that. I just switched back to Blisovi and I have been an absolute disaster. I am anxious constantly and it is beginning to effect my relationship. I don't feel like myself and it is frustrating because I know I wasn't like this before. Started talking to a therapist because of it but I truly think it is the medication, or at least it takes my anxiety to this upsetting level. Need to switch to something else but I am not sure what is next.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Lo Lo for about 4 months now and I have really tried letting it sink in. I have pushed through the acne, constant bleeding, and horrible period cramps. I had a few mood swings and have just started gaining a little weight. I don’t think the low dosage is for me!

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before going on this medication I had for the most part clear skin and was actually happy with it! I've been doing a nightly skin routine every night to keep it this way! But when I started this birth control, almost instantly I got acne all along my chin line and lower cheeks. My face is so sore and tender along with my boobs! And they are also 2 sizes bigger and are constantly sore. I am going to get it switched as my face looks terrible now. Mood swings come and go as well...

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started using Hailey about 5 months ago, mainly for how bad my cramps were. Being said it hasn’t helped my cramps at all, but it cleared up my skin and i’m not pregnant so there’s that. It did lower my sex drive to almost nothing however so maybe that’s why I’m not pregnant. Don’t love it, don’t hate it.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m youngish and I'm at the end of my second month of taking this kind after switching my last one. my periods are VERY light like I bleed for a week but barely bleed the whole day. Did this happen for anyone else? I also have been very bloated after eating and never used to happen.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched to Blisovi after taking Taytulla since my insurance stopped covering that brand. Although I’m told the formula is the same, my reaction was not. I was tired and very emotional. What forced me to write this review however was the back acne it caused along with hormonal acne under my chin. I have very sensitive dry skin and all of a sudden my skin was oily and breaking out. I tried every trick in the book to get rid of it until switching birth controls was the last resort. Within 10 days my skin was back to normal and my back was completely clear like before. So if you’re having skin issues consider that it might be this brand and switch. Everyone told me how unlikely it was and I’m glad I listened to my instincts.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am on my fourth month of taking this birth control. I am 22, and had recently found out I had PCOS after one of my many cysts, grew to be 4 inches and I had to have surgery. So taking the hormonal birth control, was not really for me to prevent a pregnancy, but more so of preventing another large cyst and other symptoms that come from PCOS; facial hair/ body hair, acne, losing scalp hair, etc. I had advised my doctor that although I have not been clinically diagnosed, I do have anxiety. After 4 months on this particular birth control, I can say that my anxiety has definitely  exacerbated.  Some days I don't know if I can continue taking it because I get so anxious. I find that with jogging/ walking, being outside, and making time for myself, I can manage the anxiety somewhat. I have not had any weight gain. My scalp hair loss has significantly decreased in my opinion. My periods are just now adjusting.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I didn't have any weight gain , but my mood swings were terrible I would get mad at my boyfriend for no reason. I had a huge loss of sex drive, and no issues with acne. Will try another one called Avian and see how it works out.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had the worst experience taking this pill. I felt awful the entire time taking it. I started at the start of my period and it lasted for 16 days, when my period had finally finished I felt so depressed I could barely do anything and when I didn’t feel like crying I was so angry for no reason, my skin also broke out with hormonal acne all over my chin. I also noticed an increase in my appetite and felt very bloated and gassy.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Overall I am happy with it, I switched from Sprintec. My PMS symptoms are very light, I barely cramp and my "periods" are very short, although it's never fresh red blood it's always brown when I take the week break. No breakthrough bleeding or anything like that though. I have a low sex drive, but it's been that way basically since I started taking birth control a little over a year ago and I can't say if it's because of the birth control or not, or if a different brand would effect sex drive better. But overall I don't have any complaints and it seems to work pretty well.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the first birth control pill I have ever taken in my life. I just trusted my OBGYN when she prescribed it to me. The first month was fine, got my period when expected (I’ve had a regular period all my life without BC) until months 2-6… I’ve had THE WORST experience with my periods. I started spotting more, and having breakthrough bleeds almost every week. I look at my period tracker app, and almost 80% of the month, I was bleeding. I wouldn’t even count them as my real periods anymore because some days would be lighter than others, consistently was off, color.. everything. I followed up with my PCP and he told me that that was normal for a first time BC user and to just continue for a couple more months. No way.  I don't like it and now I completely quit this brand. Currently trying to research a better one.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Literally horrible, it works for some but not me. I did break out at first but I figured that was just normal because I had been on the IUD (which wasn’t working for me, started to get chronic BV) then immediately started taking the pill, I figured it’s just my body reacting to the hormones…boy was I wrong, I’ve been on this pill for 5+ months and never have had more terrible mood swings or bloating. It’s affecting my everyday life and it didn’t click that it could be this birth control until other people shared similar stories. I’ve been on BC since I was 13 and now am 25 and never have had bloating, break outs, or mood swings this bad. I’ve been on the depo shot (went off it bc constant bleeding started after 4 years of no side affects) and the IUD too and never had these types of problems. I’d advise to never take this pill, I seriously feel so emotionally unstable

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill has changed my life for the worst. I have lost love and interest for things such as my sport, school, and hobbies. My acne got worse and I have never been so depressed. I have gotten such low motivation and have anxiety attacks almost daily. I also overthink things that I have already gotten over. Please do not take this pill... there are better birth control options out there.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the first birth control I’ve been on. Long story short I cannot wait to be switching. I’ve never experienced anxiety before going on this pill. I have extremely negative thoughts and became so insecure. I have an extremely low sex drive now and haven’t gotten my period since I’ve been on it. To add to these issues a few months into taking these pills my breast hurt so bad I can’t touch them and barely get out of bed. I hope the new pill I switch to is much better.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst birth control pill ever!  I took Ortho tricyclin for years and never had an issues!  I’m now in my mid 40’s and my Obgyn recommended Aurovela to relieve my menopause symptoms and prevent pregnancy.  Well they made me so nauseated, who feels like having sex?  I stuck it out for 5 months and the nausea/vomiting only got worse!  I lost 10 pounds that I didn’t need to lose.  I stopped taking them and 3 days later, felt amazing!  This is the worst BC pill EVER!

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor prescribed this birth control to help regulate my periods. I started taking this pill on the last day of my period (day7). The first few days were fine. But on days 5 and 6, I bled heavily and had cramps like a normal period. After that, I spotted every day with cramps and backache. But the worst part is the mood swings and fatigue! I can go from happy and relaxed one minute to angry/irritated/anxious/sad/depressed the next. I just sit and cry. My poor husband gets the brunt of it, but he’s so sweet and understanding, which makes me cry even more. And I feel overwhelmingly tired to the point where my brain is constantly cloudy. My doctor said to give it more time, but I don’t know how much longer I can take take this and subject my husband to the mood swings.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):first time I've ever tried birth control and its improved my life so much. I was terrified at first but now my skin is clear, my cramps are substantially better, I know when I'll be experiencing my period, AND I don't experience horrible pms like I previously did. At the beginning I did feel mildly moody at times but its subsided since I continued taking it. I love it

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was very skeptical because of the negative reviews about this birth control. I’ll start by saying I have PCOS. Really bad periods since I got my period at age 13.  I have bad PMS during ovulation/before my period. I’ve had a miscarriage, then when I got pregnant I had a c-section 4 years ago. Never been on birth control before just suffered through all of this. I got cysts that are so painful I couldn’t walk. My periods were heavy and horrendous. I decided to try this birth control and it literally changed my life. I have no acne anymore, I lost 15 pounds, (I went on every diet you can think of to lose weight and just eating a cookie made me gain 3 pounds before this birth control) I'm not bloated anymore, I don’t have mood swings anymore, my periods are much lighter. I do cramp still but not even close to being doubled over like before. My only regret is taking it sooner. If you have PCOS and want relief, try it. It might change your life too. :)

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Well, I'm not pregnant and my skin looks amazing! That's about where it stops. I think that this medicine will probably work amazing for SOME people, but I am unfortunately just not one of those people. My period while taking Hailey 24 Fe was extremely irregular, coming several times during the month from anywhere between 2-5 days at a time. Perhaps the worst side effect were the mood swings. I absolutely could not control myself at all on this medicine when these random bleeding episodes arrived. I would feel emotionally devastated at the smallest things, things that were not even issues, that I could recognize weren't issues... but that didn't help much. I sobbed for hours on end to my boyfriend over the phone over absolutely nothing. My boyfriend and I recently were trying to decide where to go for dinner, and I didn't want pizza. My reaction? To cry that I didn't want pizza. And then when we finally got where we were going (not pizza)? I cried again. Hailey messed me up.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This stuff messed up my stomach. When I first started taking it winter 2019 my periods stopped so I stopped taking it for a few months  Doc said that was fine to not have a period so I went back on it. Started to get upset stomachs in the spring of 2020. I started talking a multivitamin that I had previously taken before using these pills and out of nowhere I got horrendous stomach pains to the point where I couldn’t eat for a week and diarrhea and after that I could only eat homemade soup and bananas. All the blood tests, stool and vitamin level test came back fine. It took over 6 months with limited foods to get my stomach to an ok state. I stopped talking them but when I tried taking vitamins again in Jan 2021 the same thing happened. Finally got diagnosed with IBS and Functional Dyspepsia. Had endoscopy, ultrasounds, more blood tests. Took another 6 + months to get an ok stomach again. These pills was the only thing new in my life and now my stomach is ruined. Still limited diet

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At first I thought this was a miracle pill.  I took it for 6 years, starting in 2016.  I didn't have any of the side effects I was used to having with other pills. Around 2018 I noticed my hair was getting weird.  Like,  I would wake up in the morning and the hair at my temples was fuzzed out. Around 2018 I also learned my a1c had gone up by about 1.5 points.  This was concerning,  but my doctor shrugged it off -I wasn't diabetic (yet). It was 5.9 in 2018 and 2019. My blood pressure started going up as well.  Periods stopped.Last year I noticed my hair was way thinner than ever and was falling out in handfuls.  Two months ago I found out I was full out diabetic. I did research.  Loestrin has very high androgen levels.  This can cause hair loss,  insulin resistance, breast tissue loss. I stopped taking it a week ago and already see less hair loss and lower glucose numbers.  I hope my body can heal from all this androgen

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this birth control since 05/2021 because I have PCOS.  I am 36 years old.  In the first month I was fine. When I got my first period while using the birth control it was the most painful period I have ever had. The was so excruciating. I cried every single day I was on. The period even lasted for a whole month.  Since taking the birth control I have also felt a lot of rage and anger. I am the most positive and happy person you can meet but not being on this pill. I would say it worked wonder for my skin.  I noticed my face glowing.  Also it also made me perimenopausal. I have hot flashes. I am definitely going to stop and ask my obgyn for a different one.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have taken several different types/brands of birth control pills in my life. My insurance stopped covering my Lo Loestrin Fe so my Dr prescribed Junel Fe. I didn’t even make it a whole month. Thankfully after 2 plus weeks of gradually getting more moody, bloated, hungry, depressed and just overall blah, it occurred to me that the only thing changed is my BC pills. I have had horrible side effects!! Now I’m cramping. The very thing that taking BC was supposed to lessen. I searched on Loestrin’s website that they offer coupons. So it may cost a little more than before but it will definitely be worth it. I contacted my DR and they immediately changed me back to the Lo Loestrin. Thank goodness!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Don’t take this. Please don’t get on this BC. For the first few months on it I was fine, but after two years on it all I can say is that I'Im completely done. Mood swings, extreme anxiety (especially around when my period is supposed to start), depression, and so on. I could go on for hours about the horrible side effects of this BC. I have truly not felt like myself. Aside from the horrible mental effects I have ZERO sex drive and random cramps and bleeding. Every time I am sexually active I somehow convince myself that I am pregnant, which is really just from the anxiety this drug has given me. DO NOT TAKE THIS!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Was on Blisovi.  I had been changed by my OBGYN  - without telling me from Junel which worked well for me for the last 3 years.  For about 5 days before I threw it in the trash and had 3 panic attacks back to back. No history of recent struggles with anxiety or depression but I can tell you my life literally paused on this pill for the few days I took it. The anxiety attacks felt like I was dying.  Nausea was non stop, constant need to just burst into tears, and heavy spotting. Basically the only thing this pill did for me over the few days I took it was not allow me to get pregnant. If I can give some advice, talk with your doctor about the pros and cons before just giving it a go like I did. I learned my lesson here and won’t ever recommend this pill to anyone I know.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I started taking this birth control to change my period for an upcoming vacation. It’s probably on me, and I assume I did it wrong but my doctor told me I could start taking it at any time. I had already ovulated when I began taking the birth control thinking it will regulate my cycle and allow me to only have four days of bleeding at the end of the pack. Well that didn’t happen. I had my normal period, right on time as scheduled as if I had not been taking the birth control at all. Now, I will say the days changed. It wasn’t lighter, per se, but whereas I would’ve normally had a heavy day on day 2, it was moderate throughout, which was helpful for my vacation. I won’t continue were taking it as I was only taking it for the vacation but I will say I didn’t experience any other side effects whatsoever.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Do not recommend:Mood swings - screaming at everyone sight and then crying hysterically.Depression Weight gainCystic acne on my face, chest & backSevere headachesVery light period was the only positive I can think of, but it is not worth the negatives...

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’d like to start this out with the fact that I’ve always been sensitive to hormonal birth control, I usually experience weight gain and depression. I had the IUD and did not care for it for those reasons but they were subdued compared to the side effects I had to Junel Fe. I’ve been taking it for six days and can’t properly communicate the level of random (but steady) uncontrollable fits of rage every single day that I’ve taken it so far, to the point where I am going to cease taking it immediately for the sake of my job, relationships, and overall mental health. The constant need to shove food down my throat 24/7 to the point of fixated obsession and if I don’t, triggers another mindless rage. If you are sensitive to hormones I would not recommend taking this at all, I’ve always experienced periods of depression while taking birth control, I’ve never experienced uncontrollable rage as a side effect in any medication other than this.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for about a week and a half and I can not stop crying. I totally stopped eating. I wake up with depression and anxiety and fall asleep with depression and anxiety. I literally have never felt so low in my life. I hope no one else ever has to feel this way.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was having bleeding and cramping issues while on a low dose hormone pill. My doctor insisted it was because my hormones were not balanced and she switched me to this full hormone pill. Not only did my symptoms not go away but now I'm experiencing headaches, nausea, depression, suicidal ideations, GI problems, anxiety, constant bloating, rashes, weight gain, and massive mood swings. This is by far the worst birth control I've ever been on. I'm 36 and I've been through the patch, paragard, isobloom, Ortho tricyclone low along with a number of generic versions. I do not recommend this pill.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Yeah.. it's a no from me on Blisovi. Previously was on Junel Fe 1/20 for two years, very little side effects to none at all. Regular but very light periods with occasional cramping. Worth it IMO. Switched over (without my knowledge) to Blisovi from my OBGYN and figured I'd give it a go.
