I'm only a week into it and I've had 2 panic attacks and have this really awful feeling of general unwellness... like I'm struggling to catch my breath? Not pregnant, negative for COVID, so I'm going to assume it's these pills. Other side effects I experienced were stomach pains, nausea (the most prominent), fatigue. Just not worth it. May work for some other people out there, but I've already looked into other providers to get me back on Junel. Definitely take the advice 'to each his own'. For me, this pill didn't work like many others but there are loads of people out there who may find it a great fit.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Dr prescribed Larin Fe cause I wanted to not have much of a period and help with my acne! I was on it about a month and I could tell I was easily aggravated and felt enraged sometimes! Talked to Dr and said give it 3 months to give it time to completely work! 3 months later I was still feeling ill, enraged, low sex drive but no periods! It wasn't worth it to me! Called Dr and he wanted to give me an anxiety pill! I said nope and stopped taking it! 2 weeks later and I am experiencing the worst symptoms I have ever felt! Cramps, nauseous, and back hurting! It's been horrible! 3 days later I went to Dr and got nausea meds and Ultram for pain! I wouldn't recommend this pill!

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this for a month before I immediately got off of it. I originally had been on Lo Loestrin Fe for over a year before my insurance stopped paying for it. Then switched to Microgestin for a few months, which was fine except I was getting occasionally cystic breakouts. Switched to this and for the first month I had never been more emotionally unstable. I had the worst mood swings and cried hysterically for no reason (and I don't cry very easily either). It got to the point where I had some rather--dark--thoughts. As soon as I switched back to Lo Loestrin Fe, the depression, mood swings, and frantic crying subsided. I had some 2 months left of the Aurovela Fe, but I would literally never give it to my worst enemy.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Right now I just finished my first set. My period was light this month. I can say I’m noticing random bleeding… I hope my body isn’t rejecting it! Other than that no complaints.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve only been on this for one week but normally this is the time when side effects of OCPs are at their worst for me. I’m 35 and have taken Lutera, Sprintec, and the NuvaRing in the past. I took a break for several years because I didn’t want to take anymore hormones. Over the past few years I’ve noticed my periods were becoming heavier, longer and more painful. Not to mention my PMS for the week leading up to it was also becoming unbearable. Two weeks of feeling miserable and then two weeks of feeling just ok. I couldn’t take it anymore. That’s too much time out of my life living in misery. I asked for a pill that had low estrogen and was given this. So far, I experience brief nausea within an hour of taking pill and sometimes wake up in the middle of the night, but my mood is great, no problems with my sex drive, no spotting, and I feel more stable.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Never ever will I put this in my body again. I moved for college and when I switched pharmacies, I went to pick up my normal prescription of Lo Loestrin fe. Instead they gave me Junel Fe. I tried to tell them this was the wrong prescription, they told me it was the exact same, the exact same formula, everything just a different brand. After being on this for only 2 weeks I can tell you right now they are not the same. This has been the worst two weeks emotionally of my life. I am someone who very rarely cries, I am not an emotional person. These two weeks I’ve cried every single day, multiple times. I’ve never been so insecure in myself, my body, it caused my eating disorder to almost came back after about 2 years. I was convinced my incredible loving boyfriend was going to break up with me, for absolutely no reason at all. It was purely in my head from this terrible drug. 0/10 DO NOT TAKE THIS.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Please do not take this medication if you already struggle with anxiety or depression!! I have had anxiety since 2015, but it was minor until I started taking Junel Fe. I first took Junel Fe in 2015-2018, but switched to Liletta. After I was having complications with Liletta (cramping, bad PMS, slightly increased anxiety), I decided to switch back to Junel Fe as I had taken it in the past, but it was not the same. I started in November of 2020 and stopped abruptly in April of 2021. At first I felt fine, but I started to notice random intrusive thoughts that disturbed me a lot. I developed headaches and switched to Junel Fe 1.5/3 in hopes that it would help. That month on that pack was the WORST month of my life. I felt depressed, had the worst panic attack of my life, and began to speak with a therapist. This medication worsened my anxiety to the point that I almost took antidepressants. I feel better after 3 months off of it, but please be cautious! You are not crazy if you feel this!

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on this medication for 3 months. I have bipolar II/depression/anxiety, so when my mood swings and depressive episodes  increased lately I didn’t immediately link it to the birth control. However, I’m medicated for my other conditions, and I usually have my mood swings and depression pretty under control. Lately I’ve been breaking down crying CONSTANTLY. I finally started wondering if it was the pill and started reading online… reading all of the other reviews on here has confirmed my suspicions. Benefits are I’m not getting the hormonal boils I normally get every month and when taken continuously I skip my period (which helps with my endometriosis) but overall not worth it.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Junel for two years before my pharmacy switched to Aurovela. Never in my life have I been so depressed for no reason whatsoever. I’ve been experiencing rage issues, which is very unlike me- overly emotional- and then to complete apathy at the flip of a switch. I’m always nauseated, and gaining weight despite working out 6 days a week. I’ve never had issues about being down on  myself, but here I am absolutely disgusted with every aspect of my body and mind. I feel like I am losing my sanity and will not be starting the new pack.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Everyone reacts differently to different birth control. A lot of people who react badly to this one seem to  have tried multiple BC pills before. This BC helped calm down all of my PMS symptoms and has given me the freedom to relax on my period. If you have difficulty with emotions and anger on your period this might be a good solution for you. Disclaimer: I have bipolar disorder and I may react differently because of that.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor switched me to this when I turned 40. Something about not needing a higher dose anymore. With my other medication I had zero periods, which I LOVED.  She said that wouldn’t change. Absolutely wrong. My insurance made me switch doctors so I couldn’t complain about this to her when it happened. My sex drive increased, which was great, but now I had a monthly complete with mood swings and terrible cramps.Then when my insurance changed again the cost became ASTRONOMICAL!  $157 PER MONTH!This medication is insane and I am excited to finally change next month.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Tarina Fe for almost a year, and it has been the worst year of my life. I CRY all the time. I’m sad all the time. Yes my periods are short, almost painless, and not a heavy flow at all but it isn’t worth being sad all the time. I’ve never if my life dealt with so much anxiety.
Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I feel like I can’t stop bleeding and it’s driving me insane and I’m really thinking about getting off this Birth control and switching

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have taken Blisovi Fe 1/20 for about a year now, after my insurance was cancelled I started taking a generic called Audubon. I truly love Blisovi and it's generics. I did suffer from the crazies and I could feel my literal adrenaline pumping from the crazy thought patterns I would get stuck in. Luckily,  my partner has been very understanding and was there for me at the beginning stages of this birth control. Now the only difference I notice is the size of my breasts and the weight. I get massive breasts from taking this birth control as well as a lot of weight loss. I do not retain any fat or weight and I guess it is because of the hormones heightening my metabolism. I started getting this birth control supplied from "simple health" I got a 6 month supply for $100. I truly recommend this birth control and the provider. I was nervous before getting on the pill because it was my first time, ever. I was on the nexplanon whenever I was in HS and tried the IUD but did not like.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have used this med for probably a year now after it was switched on me through the pharmacy. I really wish I had read these reviews sooner! I haven’t felt like myself for awhile & thought I was going crazy! Now I know why. This is the worse birth control ever. I am terrified to try anything new after trying this..can’t believe birth control can make you feel this way. Horrible!

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I enjoyed LoLo quite a lot. I didn’t realize how much of a difference it made until I took a break from it for a few months last year. It lessened my acne, cramps and PMS a ton! As for my period it was a lot shorter and more regulated on LoLo. On this, my period would usually last 1-3 days. Day 2 was usually the most severe, and some months my period would never come. I recently have had to switch to another birth control because of concerns of high blood pressure, but it doesn’t seem LoLo is the culprit. I also am unsure if it made me gain weight as its not a legitimate side effect.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Did this make my period completely bearable and short? Yes. did it also make me loathe myself, everyone around me, cause anxiety, depression, body dysmorphia, and paranoia? Also YES. it’s been 5 months and I’m going off of it tomorrow.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just started taking this brand/formula, I’m almost done with the first pack. So far my side effects have been very tender breasts, vaginal irritation and more discharge than usual, maybe some mood swings, and maybe increase in appetite. I haven’t had any spotting yet. I believe my breast might’ve grown considering they were very tender. I said maybe mood swings because I did have a few minor upsets which did seem somewhat irrational. I also have been eating more I believe but I’ve been trying to workout so I don’t gain any unwanted fat. I’ll come back to update my experience after my first period which should be in a week. Then I’ll continue to update my side effects as the months go by. Before trying this birth control I looked at the reviews listed on here and became extremely discouraged. I’ve been on birth control for 4 years now and have switched my formula/brand for the third time now. Going to give honest and experienced feedback!

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking this birth control for a little over 3 months. They told me give it 3 months and it'll level out everything. Wrong. I have literally been on my period every other week or every week. I take it at the same time every I'm supposed to and it just does not work for me. I just ended my period on Sunday and I start spotting yesterday (Saturday) and today I woke up cramping and bleeding AGAIN. I'm so sick of being on my period. Waiting for a call to switch. Also, last week when I was on it, it literally was as if I didn't even take it. Clots, bad cramps, going 6-7 days. I feel like I've been patient enough. ALSO, I had a terrible migraine for about a month when I started it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I only took it for 2 days and the first and second day I was so anxious I had a panic attack and severe intrusive thoughts. As a person who struggles significantly with mental health, the increase in estrogen really impacted my wellbeing. I have been unable to eat and function for 2 days now. If you’re a person that struggles with your mental health, seriously consider before you take this, and make sure you talk with your doctor and a mental health professional before taking this, to understand the risks.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Literally the worst birth control pill. Do not take this. I know everybody has different experiences, but if I can help someone not go through what I’m experiencing I will. I’ve never had panic attacks like that, but this past week has been god awful. Constantly panicking, no appetite, feeling like I'm losing control, intrusive thoughts. I was talking with my friend trying to figure out the cause for my episodes, and when I looked up these reviews I broke down crying. I’m immediately going off of these pills. Never will I wish the feelings I had on my worst enemy. I never had bad mental health issues, but these pills messed me up, physically and mentally.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've never been so hungry in my life. I'm starving all the time and have insane cravings. I'm a tiny girl who doesn't usually eat that much. I finally just put it together.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel Fe for 3 months now for sake of not getting pregnant. I will be getting married in September. I was expecting the worst because my mother and sister both did not do well with birth control. But, they are different temperaments then me and seem to have different hormone levels (I know- shocker- we are all different). The worst symptom I've experienced is a little weight gain. Food just tastes so incredibly good at times on this birth control. My moods haven't changed, but even if I was a little off, I could contribute that to wedding prep and moving stress. It would be unfair to contribute that to birth control, at this time. My periods are lighter and I hardly have to take Ibuprofen for the cramps. I would say my minor acne has cleared up too. I support this "low estrogen dose" option. I have had a good experience, but alas, everyone is different. Choose the option that best suits you. As for me, its been great.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel for the past 90 days. Overall, I've had  a positive experience with Junel. It made my cramps better, reduced my bloating, eliminated my diaherra and nausea problems during my period, and my flow is a lot lighter.  My weight stayed about the same. The only downside is it made my period is less predictable and it last longer. I feel like my anxiety increased a little, but mellowed out over time. I was really afraid at first due to all the negative reviews. I would say just give it a try! Your experience may be good like mine. So glad I have a resolution for all my years of painful periods.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just started this pill, and I missed my period IDK if that’s normal, but I constantly feel sick nausea almost everyday, wanting to just stay in bed all day. I didn’t expect these side effects to be this bad

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I would highly recommend not taking this product. I had severe involuntary facial twitching that started one week after starting this medication. Thankfully, it subsided after stopping this birth control, but took a few weeks until it was completely gone.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill has made my breakouts go from 0 to 100. I normally have great skin, but after two months I have been breaking out by my chin and lower jaw with cystic acne and whiteheads. I was originally on Lo Loestrin for 2 years until my insurance stopped covering it. I have used Junel for two months so far but do no want to continue to the third because of how insecure I have become with my acne. I know it could be worse, but for me it is not a fun time. However, it did improve my mental health compared to Lo Loestrin with being less anxious, but insecurity has risen. I also get my period now unlike with loestrin. No weight gain.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Tarina Fe for 6 months and have no complaints! I honestly love it as far as birth controls go. I haven’t noticed any mood, weight or acne changes. I am generally hungrier throughout the day but that’s totally manageable. One complaint is that my periods are weird, not really super bloody (sorry if that’s TMI), and they only last 2-3 days. It’s kind of strange but they’re completely pain free, unlike my periods before being on birth control.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am on my second pack of Aurovela and so far it has been the worst experience. I used to take Microgestin and never had ANY side effects. I took a 4 year break from BC as I was single, but recently wanted to start up again due to bad PMDD. Since it was Microgestin was discontinued my doc started me on this.I've been in such a funk with depression, anxiety, AWFUL CYSTIC ACNE, yet I wasn't attributing it to the birth control, because I just had COVID, so I thought my body was still recovering. After reading the reviews though I know its the BC.You know when you start your period and you feel ugly for a few days? (i.e. bad complexion, bloated, tired, sad, etc), well Aurovela has made me feel like this for over a month. I know BC affects everyone differently, however, I feel like this one is universally terrible, especially if you're already struggling with mental health. For reference I'm 26yo Latina.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Blisovi for 6 years and have never had the problems that some of the women below have experienced. I began taking birth control due to my menstrual cramps causing nausea, fainting episodes, and fatigue. Once I began Blisovi, I noticed an immediate change in my cycle. When considering birth control, you have to understand that everyone's body will react differently from others. You just have to use your best judgement, read up on other birth control pills, and listen to your doctor when considering which birth control to take.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):i’ve used this pill for 4 months and now i’m switching because of insurance. i felt like a whole different person on this. I would have all these mood swings for no reason. i became very depressed and was very sad all the time. but this stuff works wonders. i did have some spotting in the first month but i had mild cramps instead of the usual severe ones. my face looks so clear and healthy. so basically it helped me physically but not mentally.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I would highly not recommend using this birth control. The first week I was on it was great. The second week…. Everything went downhill. I developed painful cramps and heavy bleeding while still taking the pill on time. I also developed a facial twitch that eventually went away after stopping the medication and waiting an additional week for the medication to clear out of my system. The mood swings were so horrible that I honestly didn’t feel like myself at all.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is terrible!!! I’ve had constant spotting, severe depression, nausea, one minute I can eat everything in my fridge the next I don’t want anything to do with food. I’m also breaking out in this horrible rash. And I do not have sensitive skin so I knew it was from this birth control because I stopped it for a week it went away then I started it again and my entire back has a really bad rash. I’ve also had really bad cramps. I’m so disappointed. This just did not work for me. I’m giving it a 3 because at the end of the day it did do it’s job…but side effects were TERRIBLE

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m going to start off by saying EVERYONE IS DIFFERENT. Just because you had a good or bad experience doesn’t mean someone is going to be just like you. I personally have had a great experience on this medication. Cleared my acne, light and shorter, no changes in mood, and no weight gain. The only way to figure out if this medication is right for you, is to try it. This isn’t some hair product with that had good or bad reviews… you’re ingesting this product.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never had acne my entire life but 3 weeks after starting this I had bad cystic acne. I almost switched but I stuck it out and it has gone away! I’ve noticed more bloating than usual and my boobs are so so sore. It has helped lighten my periods and haven’t had any other bad side effects! I’d recommend it. However, I was on Lo Loestrin fe before this and that was the BEST. I never had any side effects. It is just too expensive though.
username: Been on it for 3 months now

review: Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to Lo Lo after being on a normal combination pill that caused a very very bad reaction to the estrogen levels. I had been experiencing thunderclap migraines, dizziness, and extremely high blood pressure which I'd not had previously. After switching to Lo Lo they went away and I feel a lot, better. I wouldn't say I'm back to normal though either. I feel like I can cry at any moment and my anxiety isn't super good either. MY LIBIDO WAS DESTROYED... like I have a very high libido naturally, but after a while on lo lo I have such a hard time getting turned on/orgasming. It's almost impossible and it sucks. I'm in the process of switching to a progestin only pill to see if that helps. I want to feel more like myself even if I might get some more spotting. Lo lo is also pricier and I had to deal with my insurance trying to drop coverage multiple times.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the first BC I have ever been on. I came here to see if anyone else has been experiencing the same things I have. I have been on it for a month and have had these symptoms:Constant breast painRestless legs Stomach CrampsTerrible mood swings Trouble sleeping HORRIBLE Migraines(I’ve never had a migraine in my life).My period was EXTREMELY LIGHT(which is the only positive). I started taking them to help with period cramps and heavy flow, but I’m still experiencing painful cramps. Judging by the symptoms I see others are experiencing, it seems I’m on the negative end as well. I plan to talk to my doctor about switching.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the first birth control I've ever been on (still on it currently) and I will be honest: the first three months are awful. I was feeling ill and not like myself and while I don't recommend you keep going feeling this way I will say that after three months on it all my bad symptoms stopped. It was like my body flipped a switch and said, "Okay, I'm used to this now."Haven't had a pregnancy scare or period ever since then. This contraceptive isn't for everyone.

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had originally been on this birth control pill about 3 years ago, and I had no problems at all. I would bleed for the 4 days of the period and then two weeks later I would bleed for the entire week. It was very frustrating. I went to the doctor about it, and it actually thinned out the lining of my uterus. They are changing my birth control to something else that wont have such negative side effects.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is by far the worst on I've ever been on. I would literally rather go back to Depo and I bled for months on it! Walgreens switched from Taytulla to this and Aurovela has given me the worst yeast infection, acne, mood swings, I have no appetite, my anxiety and depression has gotten worse, it's spiking my blood pressure, and my poor libido. I have to take antidepressants now. It did help ease my menstrual pain, I'll give it that but these side effects are definitely not worth it. After reading other reviews, I'm glad I'm not alone. I'm stopping this ASAP!

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was hospitalized from intracranial hypertension from what I believe is from this birth control. All I can say is that it made my life so much worse in the matter of two months. Please, run away from this drug as fast as you can.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this type of birth control for over a year now, I was on depo before and it was horrible for me because I was bleeding for 6 months and I lost weight. I’m terrified of pregnancy and my periods are short and I don’t even bleed is more brown than blood. I don’t get cramps because before any birth control I was a heavy bleeder and had bad cramps. And my skin has been okay, I do get random pimples here and there but I do my best to keep my skin clear. I don’t like my skin is not 100 percent clear, I’ve notice that I’ve been breaking out more than usual recently. And the first few months I was very nauseous and had headaches. But after a few months; I felt better and normal. So far I think I'm good, really have a good experience! Please take vitamins with Any BC

Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this birth control. It is considered higher dose and its a generic of one of the older brands. I would highly recommend trying it if you are sensitive to birth control and cant find one that works for you well.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is by far the worst thing I’ve ever been on in my entire life period and the OBGYN nurse says everything is normal and I should expect three months of this…  I started eight days ago and I was put on this pill to help with light breakthrough bleeding  and cycle regulation.  The last eight days have been bad!  My stomach has been extremely bloated hard and descended with a ton of pressure and cycling painful cramps and  to me the worst part is the endless dark red sticky stringy coagulated blood clots ranging from silver dollar in size to mainly nickel and dime in size.  Bleeding through everything constantly I’ve basically been chained to the toilet for the last eight days because thier is so much blood.  I honestly thought I might have had a miscarriage because of what’s been coming out of me.  The irony is I started taking it to control the bleeding and now I’m bleeding 10x’s more 10’s worse!  I’m stopping immediately!
Junel 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this pill for 6 months possibly longer. I experienced mood swings and depression which I had never had before.

Ortho-Novum 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this birth control pill and 34 years ago I got pregnant while taking it. Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If I can stop one person from taking this, it’ll be great. One of the worse medications I have ever been on. Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I first started a different brand of birth control but a change of insurance led me to switch pharmacies to Walgreens. They gave me Aurovela Fe 1/20 and shortly after, I was having a hard time believing life was worth living. Not an exaggeration. I couldn’t pinpoint why I felt this way other than saying I just felt icky. When I finally got over one anxiety, my mind was searching for another. Absolutely miserable. When I finally decided I had to try SOMETHING to feel better, I looked up the pill and found these reviews. Even just the simple validation of knowing it was the medication causing my downward spiral has made me feel light years better. My pharmacist says it may be a whole cycle until I return to my normal self and I am beyond excited. This drug made me feel like I was going to feel awful until the day I died, then convinced me I was going to die SOON. I am upset at Walgreens for pedaling this generic drug to so many women, despite the side effects.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this medication as my first birth control pill ever. Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor recommended this this birth control as my first one because of the low hormones and I haven’t had any physical side effects at all. Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never had anxiety issues, but after starting on this pill, I stopped sleeping (3 hours a night is all can ever get) and ANXIETY!!! Alyacen 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control makes me feel extremely nauseous, headaches out of the world, chest pains, shortness of breath, I have developed TWO rashes, and so much more. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m taking birth control because of my low hormone levels due to early menopause. I’m only 38 and I’m menopausal. Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I honestly can't stand this pill. Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this birth control about two weeks ago, and let me tell you the side effects hit IMMEDIATELY! Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel Fe for almost ten years. Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So far I’ve only experienced bloating and breast soreness and fullness. I already have fibroadenomas in my breast so it make them really sore and tender. Emotions are a little higher than usual, but I still recommended

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I always thought I was just mentally unstable and crazy, to say the least. Reading these reviews made me feel so much more heard. Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I went from 1/10 version to 1/20 due to constant spotting and doctor suggesting a new to increase. I have had spotting almost daily. I also have clumpy spotting every morning. I have cramps most days. Do not recommend.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Luckily I read the reviews before starting this pill, so I knew what to look out for...however I was optimistic of Junel working for me. Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had really bad menstrual cramps around my uterus, ovaries, and colon. Larin Fe helped my cramps, eased some of my acne (I only get acne on my period), got rid of my body aches, headaches, breast tenderness, and shortened my period length.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Let your body adjust to the pill. First three months I gained 5 lbs (water weight) after I had no other side effect. Hope this helps ! I’m on my 9 month and I feel great
Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible!!! I have been bleeding nonstop for almost a month with huge clots. This is the worst OCP I have ever taken.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took for 5 months and went through a living nightmare on this birth control. Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m on my second month with Pirmella. A week and 3 days into to be exact. My moods have gotten worse I’ve been having depressive episodes. Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this for about 2 years now. Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):All I have to say is : stay AWAY from this birth control pill. I’m 44 y/o and This is the worst birth-control pill I have ever been on. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this for 2 and a half months and it’s made my otherwise well controlled anxiety flair up like never before. Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been taking this for about 4-5 Years now with no issues.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My side effects on Junel Fe: severe mood swings, diarrhea, stomach pain, low energy, fatigue.I stopped it 1 month ago and all these side effects are gone. Not for me.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I bled heavy everyday for 3 weeks straight the first month on this pill. I never felt satisfied after eating my main meals and I would end up practically snacking the entire day. Secondly, my emotions were intensified! I cried over everything and just felt a sense of sadness and anxiety. Thirdly, I loss my sex drive completely. I had no interest in sex. Finally, my partner had mentioned something about it. I decided to go off this pill and I’m so glad I did. I rather have 3-5 day heavy periods with some cramping then all these side effects from the pill! Also, my sex drive is back and sex now feels amazing again! Would I ever take this pill again?  No way.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for almost a year now and I enjoy it. I have had anything out of the ordinary happen to me. The only changes I’ve seen with my weight is loss, I haven’t gain anything.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Larin Fe 1/20 after my insurance stopped covering Lo Loestrin (which I LOVED). My mood swings are insane, I feel depressed most days, any little thing that goes wrong makes me feel very irritable and I usually end up crying. Also, I am very good at taking my pills daily, so I do not know the reason as to why my period is SO heavy and SO painful. I have been getting my period for 8-10 days every month, which is absolutely ridiculous considering I would have it for 3-4 days on lo lolestrin. I am too scared to get the arm implant, so I am going to continue taking these pills, but I am considering just stopping birth control all together as I do not feel like myself since starting Larin.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Was going great at first, I have PCOS so my gynecologist prescribed this for my extremely low estrogen but now it's not so good. Hardly had any symptoms my face cleared up, my hair grew thinner and my cycles were finally regular and not heavy but now I've noticed my anxiety is whacky. I'm more anxious and irritated and I've gained 10 pounds that I cannot seem to lose no matter what I do.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Blisovi for about 4-5 months now. I also may have experienced a *slightly* decreased sex drive, but not particularly noticeable. Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It didn't work on controlling periods,  but it did make it lighter.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Lo Estrin FE for many years, and began having irregular periods for quite some time so I was given Blisovi as a replacement. Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this pill for over 5 months it has been a terrible experience I have experience anxiety, also my face - mostly my chin has broken out extremely terribly and it took me a long time to pinpoint that this birth control was problem. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Lolo for several years.   I switched to it after another brand was no longer effective at controlling my periods.   I was pleased with this pill.  Right from the start my periods stopped.   This was great because mine were becoming horrible!   No other noticeable side effects.   Unfortunately,  what I  was naive about was that your body stops producing its own estrogen when given this outside source.   Over years of using Lolo my vagina has atrophied. Sex has become painful. I now have to see a pelvic physiotherapists to help with that and have other upcoming medical treatments to deal with the damage done.  Had I known I would end up where I am now I certainly would have looked into other options.  My Dr. didn't explain this risk and neither does the packaging.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Personally I love it. I'm 44 years old and my body is going threw the change. Junel made me feel young again.  Things were like they were when I was a teen.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am taking this birth control as medication for PCOS and Autoimmune Thyroiditis. Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been diagnosed with anxiety and depression. Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm worried seeing that the majority of the reviews are bad. Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I’m a 38 year old mom of FOUR and started this pill ONLY to stop having a period (I skip the last week of pills and go straight into taking a new pack of 3 weeks of white pills after taking my last white pill in each pack) my tubes are clamped so I literally just wanted to stop bleeding completely and my doctor ok’d it for me to do so…. It has my skin looking flawless, my mood swings and depression are completely gone after being on this BC just 5 months so far and in itself is a god send cause. I was struggling extremely hard with my moods and all around mental health it’s almost like my hormones were always out of whack after having my last child, but now are totally on track. I have lost over 10 pound and am now 5’6 and weighing 119.  My boobs did hurt REALLY bad the first two months but that has stopped and they have now grown a cup size larger… This BC has changed my life for the better and I never see myself going off of it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Lo loestrin back in May and so far so good. Pros: bigger boobs, high sex drive (I can’t go a day without thinking about sex or having sex), no periods, little to no weight gainCons: boobs are a little sore, I feel bloated a lot and I’m a little more emotional I would recommend this!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Never would I have imagined that a daily pill could cause this much change in one's mental state. Immediately when I began taking Junel Fe l I noticed a shift in my attitude; I was more irritable and short-tempered with everyone. However, I brushed this off, convincing myself that it was simply my body and hormones trying to adjust to the new drug. However, after several months in, it's like everyone around me could no longer even recognize me. I was constantly questioning my own sanity, and I couldn't figure out why. Now, after reading the reviews of other people who have had the exact same experiences as me, I will no longer be taking this pill. It's not a coincidence if several women are saying the same thing; it's a clear sign that it should not be prescribed.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Taytulla for over 4 years now. The first 3 months I had cramping and used a heating pad a lot. It did its job of preventing pregnancy. It regulated my period for the most part although there were some months I didn’t get it at all or it would be super light. However, I am having to switch birth control pills because I have had breakthrough bleeding in between my periods for the past year to two years. Other than that, my weight fluctuations have been the same, my libido has been great, and my mood has been stable. At the end of the day, it did its job with some minor side effects.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm only seeing negative reviews so I'm giving you mine. I've been on this for about a year and a half. It took my body about 3-4 months to get used to. In the beginning, I definitely held onto water weight, had very sore breasts, a low sex drive, and moderate mood swings. I had very bad acne as a teenager but am now 28 and only get the occasional breakout. This pill didn't really do anything different to my skin. My periods have always been fairly normal with moderately painful cramps, so it's nice to have the option to skip that week and even if I do go through the placebo week, the period is extremely light. I do notice that one lasting side effect is a low sex drive. However, other than that, I feel very normal and recommend this for a great birth control option.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this for about 6 months, immediately with taking it in the first month me and my boyfriend noticed mood changes. I was extremely tired, irritable, and very angry. I figured I would stick it out, because maybe I had to get used to it since it was my first time taking a birth control pill. I have a history of anxiety and depression, so I was well aware that the pill not for me may make that worse. Let’s just say I’m now on my 6th month and the anger spells got WAY more intense, I have to struggle to get out of bed and I am extremely tired after doing the smallest things. (mind you I’m a college athlete so it has nothing to do with weight) but now that we are talking about weight, I GAINED 15 POUNDS on this in just 6 months. I have never in my life gained this much weight nor struggled with my weight since I have always been an athlete all my life. I am now at my highest weight i’ve ever been. I now feel disgusting and embarrassed, my confidence is low.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Lo Loestrin Fe for 3 months.  No periods since taking this pill which is a plus. No weight gain. This pill is a plus for me.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is a nightmare birth control. Gave me terrible ovary pain and made my migraines worse. Also had what felt like period cramps from this when I wasn't on my period along with sharp chest and leg pain.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Had severe panic attacks anxiety and depression.  Severe chest pain that resulted in ER visits and consults from cardiologists.  Felt like constant afib for a month which led to shortness of breath unable to walk up a flight of stairs.  Discontinued meds immediately and felt back to normal in a few weeks.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched from my previous birth control as it stopped working for my purposes (extreme cramping caused by fibromyalgia). Since I’ve started taking this I’ve had at least two UTIs. Now I’ve had a few in the past but not since I was little. Took several minutes of digging around online to find that it is an aftermarket reported symptom and not listed in the packaging. I’ve been in near constant pain due to this drug for weeks now but I cannot stop taking it as the pain from my period can send me to the hospital and I can’t see my doctor for at least another week. Shame on this company for not making this information accessible.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Caused depression and I felt suicidal, mental health went bad.  Had a hard time with partner. I was crying, suicidal and sad.
Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Works great except for the fact that it makes my face super dry and itchy. That’s the only downfall I’ve had so far.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Reading all the reviews about this BC made me scared to take it since it was my first time ever going on BC. I was prescribed this due to my irregular cycle and extremely heavy bleeding but I’m happy to say that my periods have gotten much lighter and the migraines/headaches I used to get before my periods have gone away. I haven’t noticed any negative side effects except a couple hormonal pimples (probably because my body was getting used to using hormones). Don’t be afraid of all the negative reviews since every one’s body reacts differently (and if anything you can just switch pills)!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to this birth control when I was 15 after trying depo-provera injection and having a terrible experience and one other pill which made me throw up every day. I've now been on Junel for 6 years. I have no side effects at all and have never had a pregnancy scare. I did notice it helped stabilize my mood throughout my teenage years. Now that I am 21 I'm starting to rapidly gain weight. Not sure if that correlates with the birth control. But I've seen a lot of comments on here from short term Junel users and wanted to give some feedback from a long term user. It's been great to me and unless I find out its causing my weight gain after all this time I'll probably never switch. I also skip my periods until I start spotting then I know it's time to have one. I have no cramps, but my periods were pretty easy before Junel. My acne was never affected (i.e. I still have it). All in all this BC basically did nothing to me except keep me from getting pregnant

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on microgestin for 8 months. In that time I had horrible horrible mood swings. Extreme irritability that came out of nowhere. Anxiety through the roof, depression that made me never want to get out of bed, literally no libido. I also developed a horrible rash all over my back and on my Bikini line that my doctor just attributed to having "sensitive skin".  I did not connect the dots until I read these reviews and stopped taking it immediately.  Everything has improved drastically since NOT taking this pill for only a week. Steer clear, if you're on it currently PAY ATTENTION. I would never recommend this pill to anyone.

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Loestrin Fe 1/20 for 4 days. Worst 4 days of my life. Immediately after taking the pill I was extremely tired and felt like I had just taken NyQuil. I also experienced a massive loss of appetite and nausea. I had weird sharp headaches and knee pain in a way I had never felt before. On my 4th and final day on this awful pill, I had a MASSIVE panic attack and horrible anxiety. I do not normally have panic attacks and rarely have anxiety. But I was on the couch curled up in a ball so so sad and angry about absolutely nothing. My poor boyfriend. Anyways, I immediately stopped taking and am looking into an IUD right now. I had such a terrible experience with the hormones, I am looking to stay away from those. Everyone’s body is different and I don’t mean to scared anyone. But do your research and listen to YOUR body.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill a few months ago and I absolutely love it so far. I was on the patch for 5 years and wanted to try out a pill with a low dose. My period went from 8 days to 4 days, and my intense mood swings completely disappeared. I haven't experienced any increased appetite or any breast tenderness. If you haven't taken a previous pill with a higher dose, I wouldn't turn away from Aurovela based on all the low reviews. Every person's body is different, so you never know how it'll affect you until you try it.

I wish I did my own research before taking this pill! I have cried multiple times over how bad my acne has gotten! I have always had acne but it had always been very minimal. This pill made me have CYSTIC acne all over my chin, cheeks and even around my eyes. I’ve never been more embarrassed by my skin. I’ve even been using tretinoin and that couldn’t even help with my acne. I wish I realized sooner what this pill was doing to my skin. I DO NOT recommend this if you are an acne prone person! On to the next birth control pill *sigh*

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to this birth control after I was on Etodalac. This one didn’t give me periods only brown spotting for 4 months then all of a sudden it gave me the worst period of my life. All month round I had breast soreness, TERRIBLE cramping, terrible anxiety, and what felt like depression because I would always cry. Do not go on this if you have very bad anxiety because it made mine so bad, it’s absolutely ridiculous.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm starting my 2nd pack of this birth control. I was almost 4 months postpartum and was going through it. Depression and anxiety were at an all time high. My periods were extremely painful and long. My antidepressants just weren't helping so they doctor suggested this. I noticed a huge difference in just one week. I'm feeling back to normal again and my period this time has been SO pleasant. My acne has cleared up and I have actually lost weight. I believe this birth control has saved my life. I did experience 10 days of breakthrough bleeding, but would gladly take that over the mental and physical torture I was going through. Don't let the few bad reviews scare you into not trying this birth control, like they almost did me.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was so glad to find these reviews and to realize I am not alone! My ObGyn started me on these recently for irregular periods (more frequent; I'm in my 40's) and mood swings. I took them for about 10 days and have been feeling AWFUL. Frequent and daily crying, poor sleep, exhaustion, anxiety, bloating, nausea. (I took ortho tricyclen for many years in the past and had zero issues). I finally looked at the package insert for these (and online) for side effects, and I am quitting immediately. I threw away the three months I was given and will gladly go back to my irregular periods and mild emotional swings if this is the alternative.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel Fe for 3 months now after they discontinued Lo Loestrin  Fe 24, and I was really hoping this birth control would be similar but I have noticed an enormous amount of anxiety and paranoia while taking this pill. I feel my heart racing almost everyday, and have had multiple panic attacks. I do normally have slight anxiety, mainly social anxiety but it is insane on this pill. I also have noticed weight gain, maybe bloating although my diet and work out schedule has not changed for the last year now. I really wish I could get back on my Lo Loestrin. I also have been experiencing insomnia, crazy dreams and night sweats, which is very very annoying. I also just feel a lack of motivation to do anything and so tired no matter how much sleep I get when I’m generally running around all day and on a fast paced schedule. My best friend takes this pill and loves it but for me it’s a no go. I can’t deal with the anxiety and weight gain!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill in April and started off with some side effects. I was getting a lot more irritable just randomly, breakthrough bleeding throughout the month, and my sex drive decreased a lot. The side effects were worse during the first month I was on it but they gradually started getting better. It made my period even more irregular though and my mood started to decline a lot so I brought it up with my doctor and they said it would probably be best to change it. I didn’t have a horrible experience on this pill, but it just wasn’t the right fit for me. If you’re about to start this pill and see all the scary reviews, don’t fear because your body may react differently!!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Guys, please realize that birth control works differently for every women. I used to have 10 day long periods, extremely heavy (as in using 3-4 super tampons a day even at day 10), along with extreme pain from cramping and I lost 20 pounds because of throwing up a lot on my period. I missed school/work three times every month. Once I got on this pill, my whole life changed. I never gained weight, never lost my appetite, or had anything major happen to me ever since. No cramps or nausea, sometimes no periods but most months just spotting, and clear skin. I’ve been on this pill for 8.5 years. When I started as a teenager, my breasts got a little bigger and that was really it. The only problem I had with this pill was that I’m a little bit more emotional. I used to have no emotion like a zombie. Now I can cry to a sad rom-com movie which is more normal than before when I wouldn’t even cry at a funeral of a family member. Anyways, thanks to my doctor and this pill for everything!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first time on any birth control, so I was prepared for the worst, but honestly I had a good experience. First day I experienced some nausea. I have had on and off GERD and in the first two weeks I noticed I was feeling symptoms similar to when it flares up (bloated, burping a little stomach acid up, mild nausea). Nothing some alka-seltzer gold couldn't fix :). It subsided after the first two weeks. The week before my period I tend to have mood swings, increased anxiety, and be very sensitive, but I was doing better than usual on Junel Fe. I also feel like it reduced a bit of my anxiety. I chose not to skip my period, and I usually get debilitating period cramps, but Junel Fe pretty much erased them. I did not experience any changes to my skin, weight, or appearance. I think the reason why this site has overwhelmingly bad reviews is that those who had a bad experience feel more inclined to share it than those who had a good. Talk to your doctor for what is best for you. :)

I'm writing this teary-eyed because I have never felt so low in my life. I have had multiple panic attacks every single day, severe anxiety to the point I feel like I need to go to the hospital. I am terrified to go to sleep, terrified to be by myself but don't want to be around anybody, scary intrusive thoughts, feel like I'm literally loosing mind. I have contemplated suicide so many times over the last month, my mind races from the time I wake up to the time I go to bed. I can't sleep, can't eat. I have a 1 year old and I have developed OCD and anxiety symptoms about somebody kidnaping, drowning, sexual assault, dying, etc about her. It happened out of nowhere and it really terrifying. I've never been so desperate to run away from my own thoughts. Please, PLEASE do not take this. I stopped this birth control today I hopes that theirs a light at the end of the tunnel.  I never ever want to feel like this, ever again.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started BC ~2015 with Microgestin. Didn’t have bad side effects, lost 30lbs in 6wks working out 4-5x a week, didn’t affect my skin but never really had acne, no mood swings, hair was getting dry/brittle but thought just poor maintenance on my part. Bled consistently for 2 weeks at a time, then the bleeding would stopped for about 2-3weeks, came back for 2 weeks. Lasted about 3 months. Stopped for a year & tried other BC. Fails. Then a new doc prescribed Microgestin again this year in January. Pros - Periods are almost non existent. No weight gain. Cons - hair is THINNING OMG. Mood swings so bad like clockwork. PMS starts at the end of my 2nd week of pills. I want to cry every second of the day. I lose my temper & see red & break things like my phone lol or hair brushes. And then calm down 1 hour later. Random spotting too. I’m in therapy for this now. In addition to what I was already seeing a therapist for. I get BV a lot now too.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My dermatologist prescribed me this pill and it did help with acne but my cycle is now sooo irregular I either have my period 2 times a month (most common), have a normal period once a month (prob like 1-2 times in the 8 months I've been on it) or once I even skipped it for a whole month and I take it at the exact same time daily the biggest difference was maybe 20 minutes.  I have such bad cramps and can cry over anything which was not normal for me before this pill

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am writing this because I almost lost my life to this drug. Junel Fe should NOT be prescribed to people with a history of any mental health issues. I have never had mental health issues so bad until I started it. I felt so insecure and physically ugly. I disassociated for almost two months which if you know what dissociation is- it’s terrifying. Crippling anxiety and depression to the point where I had to quit my job. Every month my anxiety got worse and non stop panic attacks and feeling depressed even tho I had never felt depressed. I became suicidal as well and was hospitalized for it. PLS DO NOT TAKE THIS IT IS NOT WORTH THE LIVING NIGHTMARE IT PUT ME THROUGH.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve tried three different birth controls previously. I have been on Lo lo for a year now to prevent pregnancy. I wish I never started birth control because my body has rejected every single one. My periods are never on time, I never know when to expect them. Sometimes I don’t even get them which triggers my anxiety even more because I like having reassurance. The only plus side when I get them my period is super light but when I don’t get my period, I will have period symptoms for 2 weeks straight. I just took a pregnancy test and it was negative, but my boobs hurt and I’ve had horrible cramping for 2 weeks. Still no period. This would be a good birth control if I actually knew when I was getting my period

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Taytulla for two years and stopped a month ago. The first side effect was depression. It wasn’t severe and it balanced out within 2 months. My moods were stable and my period lightened up, although it never stopped (I didn’t have a very heavy flow to begin with). I gained 20 pounds and my libido suffered. Despite the minor side effects, I would’ve continued with this pill had it not been for the headaches. I had never had a migraine before starting Taytulla. I then had an ocular migraine but my doctor said it was unrelated to the pill. After that, I began to suffer from headaches 2-3 times a week and a migraine several times a month. I have not had one headache since I stopped this medication. If strokes or complex migraines run in your family or if you suffer from them already, I do NOT recommend this pill. I have read other reviews where other users began to have headaches as well, even though headaches are not a side effect listed for this medication.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have REALLY pushed this birth control to its limits and it always exceeds my expectations! I’ve been on it for 4 years now and not a single scare! So happy :)

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor decided to put me on Aurovela Fe 1/20 to help with awful menstrual cycles related to endometriosis. I’ve only been on it for 3 days and I’m experiencing the worst anxiety, depression, nausea, of my life. I honestly feel terrified because of this anxiety. I can only compare it to the depo injection I had about 18 years ago that made me incredible anxious but this feels 1,000x worse. Please do NOT take this medication. Nothing is worth feeling like this. I pray I feel like myself again in a couple of days once the hormones are out of my system. If I could give this negative stars I would. They really should take this off the market.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first form of birth control. I started it 3 months before I got married in preparation to not get pregnant. I gained weight from this drug but I also was a newlywed and covid had just hit so I’m not sure how much I can attribute the weight gain to the pill. The first month I could barely sleep but this eventually subsided on month 2. The only other issue I had was I started to have breakthrough bleeding every month around month 3 until I finally switched to something else. I switched to the patch now to hopefully have less issues with breakthrough bleeding and less weight gain (also not have to remember to take a pill every day)

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I liked that this was a low dose hormone. However, it is very expensive without insurance so keep that in mind if you’re not insured. I didn’t have a great experience on this drug. I tried a different pill before this one and was only on this one for about 3 months. I would bleed 2/4 weeks every month and it got rid of my sex drive, and I had severe vaginal dryness. I never missed a pill and was super good about taking it but I just couldn’t deal with the weight gain, sexual problems, and bleeding. However, my sister is on it and she’s only had 1 case of breakthrough bleeding on month 3.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started with the lower dose 1/20. It didn't give me my period so I asked my doctor to up my dose to 1.5/30. About 2 weeks after taking it I got my period, but about 2 weeks after I started feeling TERRIBLE side affects. I felt depressed, and started to have bad anxiety and panic attacks. I had heart palpitations and couldn't even eat anything without getting nauseous and throwing up. I lost 5 pounds in less than 2 weeks.  I thought I was just mentally unstable but after taking a break off them for 2 days I started to feel normal again. These pills were literally making me SICK. I just tried taking the lower dose of the birth control today and almost had a panic attack. Even the lower dose doesn't do me well at all.I am officially stopping this medication immediately, it's confirmed that it is bad for my body, my mind, and my overall health.  Please consider your birth control as a suspect before anything else, your every birth control can affect you differently.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got put on Junel Fe 1/20 as I told my doctor I needed a low dose birth control, I haven’t had any negative reactions to it. I do take it later at night at 10pm and that works out for me. It’s been 4 months of taking it consistently and so far I like it; makes my period super light and lasts 2-3 days.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on LoLo for 5 months now and have had an overall pretty positive experience. The only pesky side effect is spotting because of the low amount of estrogen but I found that sticking with it made the spotting eventually stop. I used to spot 5-7 days in the middle of my pack randomly, now I get super slight spotting on the 2 days of placebo that’s about it. I would recommend sticking with it for 3-4 months to see how side effects change before deciding if it’s right for you. Personally I think it’s worth it because I have no other side effects.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took it only 4 days. Everyday after taking the pill I would start breaking down crying for 4 hours at a time and feeling so anxious. My stomach would knot up. I felt so sick like how I did when I was pregnant. I felt so depressed and sad to where I felt kinda like homesick in a way because I felt so uneasy and anxious. Even though I was at home where feel so comfortable. I couldn’t even sneeze without feeling like I was going to vomit. I’ve felt severe depression to where I didn’t feel happy with anything at all. I felt so tired all the time even after having plenty of sleep. Full on breakdowns for hours upon hours. Suicidal thoughts which I have never had before. I do have anxiety but it is super mild. Thought I was going crazy until I saw these reviews. I decided to leave a review on my experience. It was so bad to the point where I refuse to go on any birth control ever again. Would rather be pregnant again TBH and this was only after 4 days!!!! Imagine taking this for months... don’t do it please.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got on this BC March 2021 after my Nexplanon expired. I am a newlywed and even though my husband and I want to have children, I want to wait at least a year to have a baby. My PCP decided to put me on Junel so I can stop at any time. Symptoms the first couple weeks were cramps, sore breast, headaches and fatigue. Today marks 3 months on this BC & I will not continue taking them. The non stop crying, panic attacks, anxiety, arguments with my spouse, sadness, depression are out of hand. I laid in bed last night and wished I was dead. I have so many suicidal thoughts and felt like I was going thru some stuff times in my marriage but after reading all these reviews and being able to relate to these other women I realize I'm not crazy. I've been feeling so alone in my dark thoughts I was scared I would end up in the hospital sooner than later. Listen to your body please and if any of this relates to you please consult you doctor. YOU ARE NOT ALONE !

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this pill. It’s crazy to me how different women’s experiences are with the same birth control. I think low dose is the way to go (for me)!! When I was previously on a higher dosage pill, Junel Fe, I had pretty bad anxiety, depression, anger, and panic attacks daily that were beyond my control. It wasn’t me and it was awful. Ever since I switched to Lo Loesterin, I’m back to my normal self AND I straight up don’t get a period anymore... I used to have heavy, painful periods so that is a major win for me. I also have much clearer skin now! And no weight gain. The ONLY thing I don’t like about this pill is that I get very dry down there - it’s not fun. But with all the benefits I’ll take it, and I’m too worried to experiment and switch off altogether or onto a different one after my first experience and knowing my natural acne and periods :( Don’t be scared off by the bad reviews- it was a blessing for me and it could be for you too!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had to change from my previous birth control, Sronx, due to it affects on my mental health. Ended up having to do the same with this one, albeit I was able to stay on this one longer. It was a slow decline, and I'm sure the winter months did not help. I slowly became more depressed and anxious, and I realized that the birth control was affecting me when I started having suicidal thoughts again (I came to this point on my first bc before and realized I had to change). Took it for about 5 months before I had to stop. Had my period maybe once in that time? I don't remember well. My skin was pretty clear. I had lost weight, but I don't know if that has to do with my anxiety on the pill. I didn't get pregnant, so it achieved it's purpose. My mood swings are gone now that I've stopped taking it. I liked this one better than my previous, but if you have mental issues, I'd recommend trying non-hormonal birth controls. Your mental health is just not worth risking.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill is terrible. Do not use this pill. This was the second pill I was put on because my insurance company stopped covering the old one. I was on this pill for 15 months, during which time I had super heavy periods every other week, horrible mood swings, and ridiculously painful cramps. Furthermore, if I took the pill at night, I woke up nauseous in the morning. Save yourself the trouble. If I could rate it zero stars, I absolutely would.

I was really scared when I got my prescription after reading all these reviews. I have been taking Mylan brand of this birth control for one month now and figured I’d drop in to say a little about the beginning. So the first 8 days, I felt so emotional. specifically I felt like crying at anything -  sad, happy, whatever it was I felt like crying. I am not typically a very emotional person so I could tell it was from the birth control. It went away during the second week. Then for the next 4-5 days I had spotting and some days a full out period and really bad cramps. It started freaking me out cause of all the reviews saying they have had a period for 3 months. After 5 days it went away. Honestly now I feel pretty great. No other changes. I’ve lost 3 lbs but I think that could just be my diet. My skin is staying clear. So I am hoping this works out. I’ll update you all in a few months

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control to help PMS symptoms and severe mood swings. The first month of taking this, I could not even leave the house! I was so bloated and gassy. After the first month, things seemed to improve, however I never got my period at the same time throughout the pack. Sometimes I didn’t get a period at all! The pill helped significantly with my mood and PMS symptoms. I only took these pills for a little over a year, as the inconsistently of my period was becoming problematic. While on the pills I gained about 10-15lbs. Within the first month of stopping the pill I lost close to 10lbs! Furthermore, this birth control was not covered under my insurance plan, which became very costly!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the 1st BC I ever went on. Took it for about 4 years. It was great for periods, which got lighter and would only last about 2-3 days. This pill really regulated my period. Had no side effects other than my libido went to TOTAL 0! Got tired of this affecting my daily life so I changed it. Other than the sex drive, it did the job of not getting me pregnant.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I am 23 this is my second birth control I took Lo Loestrin 1/10 for 3 months but my insurance doesn’t cover it anymore so I’m on this now! What I can say is this period I had no cramps! I’m on my first pack of Blisovi and my skin is great too I was afraid I would have terrible side effects but I never did with this one nor the other I took before this one either!!I have noticed though that I am very sad lately.. I never feel truly happy 100%. Maybe it’s because I just moved out of state as well recently without family. I’m not sure BUT I can say I am very emotional now. I hope it’s just a phase but if not I will have to get off of it. I have always been anxious and have some slight anxiety here and there. I don’t think that has gotten worse.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I originally was on Ortho tri cyclen. But kept getting ovarian cysts so my doctor switched me to Blisovi and the first 2 months were fine.  Then last month I only spotted for a day, than about a week and a half ago I was extremely sick, stomach cramps, almost fainting, couldn’t eat without getting sick, dizzy, lightheaded, extreme anxiety and depression even being on a higher dose of mental medication. I don’t even feel like myself and feel I’m falling out of love with the things I enjoy most. Now my period for this month is non existent. Was at the ER for the pain Friday and all tests came back perfectly fine including pregnancy test. Now the past two days my breasts are super sore. Will be getting off this immediately. I don’t recommend this because if you like being mentally healthy and getting regular periods. I thought it was just me and possibly pregnancy but I’ve only had sex on this birth control once and he didn’t even finish in me so I will be going back to my old script.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):HORRIBLE. I have been taking birth control for 7 years and have tried multiple brands. This is by far the worst one I have ever tried. I started this pill after my pharmacy changed my prescription from Bisolvi without my consent! I have been on this pill for only two weeks. I have been bleeding the entire time. I’m having awful cramping and acne. I have back pain and I am nauseous. I am diagnosed with depression and anxiety so it is normal for me to feel low on a daily basis. But oh my goodness I have been crying 2-5 times a day every single day. I am completely emotionally unstable. I am crying over everything and very jumpy/scared. If you are having problems with this pill get off of it ASAP! I am miserable and exhausted.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this pill for 5 years and while it helped my heavy periods immensely, I stopped feeling like a person. I was numb to everything- not happy or sad, I really only felt anxious or angry. I didn’t feel like myself and had no sex drive either. I’ve just gotten the IUD and didn’t realize the impact until now. If you begin feeling this way, listen to yourself you are not overthinking it! I wish I would’ve listened to my body/ family who was telling me I was acting so differently.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took the pill for seven months hoping it'll start working and it did NOT! Kept having my period on active pills.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL. This is my first ever drug review. I was on this pill for only 9 days. This pill gave me severe anxiety and intrusive thoughts that I am still dealing with almost a month after, although they’ve gotten a little better. This was the worst pill I’ve ever taken in my life. I had fatigue, heavy chest, random pains in my body, severe depression , I could not think or form a thought, anxiety and fear. And I developed scary intrusive thoughts I never had before. My libido left and I also experienced dryness I never had before. Only in 9 days! It was awful! Quit this pill and do not take it. Most of the side effects have left but I’m still having the fear and OCD and I’m scared it screwed me up permanently.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe was *fine*. I didn't love it, but it wasn't the worst birth control I was ever on. It did its job and kept me from getting pregnant, and my mood swings were not as bad as on some other birth control pills. It also did not do as well lightening my periods, I had some cramping and a few really heavy periods. All in all, I would probably recommend it, but it wouldn't be my first recommendation.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Mibelas was awful for me. I switched to it from Minastrin Fe, and I immediately felt awful. I had terrible mood swings, anxiety, and my period came back with a vengeance. I only took Mibelas for a few months before switching back to Minastrin Fe. I never got pregnant, but I was on it for so little time that I'm not even sure I had sex while using it.

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I absolutely LOVED Minastrin. I took it for about 4 years with no negative side effects. It controlled my mood swings, lightened my period, stopped my cramps, and made me feel like a person again. It is the birth control that I hold all others to, and so far, nothing has compared, not even the generic versions of it. Unfortunately, my insurance stopped covering it, and it went from $0 to $15 to $45 to $135 over about a year and a half (with prior authorizations) so I was forced to switch to another birth control. If I could afford it, I would switch back to Minastrin Fe in a heartbeat.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Really don't trust this pill although it treated my pain. This medication induces anxiety and the side effects worsen with time. Around 3 months in, I started having panic attacks. From the beginning, nausea and vomiting were problems. Eventually, projectile vomiting turned into a daily occurrence. If you're taking other meds this can affect their effectiveness. Can't wait to get off this med.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used to take  Aviane and decided to switch to Lo Loestrin because Aviane was giving me 0 sex drive and 0 libido. Well nothing changed with Lo Loestrin if anything it got worst, I’m on my 6 month and for the past 6 months  I’ve been having  2 periods every month, I I’m constantly bleeding. Why take birth control when you can’t even have sex since your always bleeding......

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control was AWFUL for me. I took it for about 7 months and it made me so depressed. I stopped hanging out with my friends because I didn’t feel like it anymore and was super clingy towards my boyfriend. I would cry at least once a day and get angry for no reason. It also made sex painful because I was dry which NEVER happened before. The pros are that it helped my periods, I didn’t get pregnant, and I lost weight. However, I went off of it two months ago and I’m doing so much better. I feel like myself again. I do not recommend this bc at ALL

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started this birth control to help with cramps, bad lower back pain, and to regulate my period.  First 3 months I had bad anxiety, mood swings, and my periods would start the week before the brown pills and then zero period during the brown pills.  I was just about to switch pills and figured I'd give it 1 more month.  Then, it all changed overnight.  I no longer have any mood swings and I think it actually has helped with any anxiety.  I have no abdominal cramping, no lower back pain.  I will still get hot flashes and night sweats right before my period starts though.  This is the first pill that has lessened my period.  Now if I wanted to I would probably only have 1 full tampon day and then spot for 3 days.  At this point I am very happy that I stuck with it and hoping each month will continue to get better.  I have now taken for 5 months.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm currently on my second month of Blisovi 1/20. I was honestly very worried to start this birth control because of how many people were saying it had a drastic change in their mood. However, so far I haven't experienced many side effects. Sometimes I'll wake up nauseous here and there, and sometimes it'll feel like I'm having PMS symptoms. I've had severe anxiety since I was 2 years old and I'm currently on 3 other medications for that. So far I've had no increase in anxiety or depression. I've also had very excruciating periods before taking Blisovi, to where I couldn't stand up straight or walk very much for the first day or 2. I was spotting for about a week after a few weeks of taking the pill, but ever since then I haven't actually gotten my period and have only had PMS symptoms which is like a cake walk compared to what I was dealing with before. I hope this helps!! (For reference, early 20's 130lbs)

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Microgestin since I was 17 because it was my form of protection from pregnancy, and now I am 25. When I first started it was great, I saw my periods come once a month - very regular which I loved. I didn't gain weight, or start getting acne. But I did noticed mood swings, it wasn't too bad. Just something I would notice before my period. I never had any issues with it after all this time, but now I am married and I am noticing a low sex drive, not sure if it is this birth control pill, or something else? I am worried of getting off it, so sudden since I have been taking it for so long. The pill is the form of birth control I have personally taken this entire time, not sure how my body react to others...

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you’re taking this and feel like you’ve lost your mind, It’s not you, it’s this god awful pill I promise. Never in my life have I had any sort of anxiety/ depression until I started this pill. Every month I noticed my anxiety increasing which eventually led to several panic attacks with disassociation that lasted for weeks. Came on here and realized it was these pills. Stopped a month and a half ago and finally have started to feel like myself again.
