I realize everyone’s body reacts differently to the pill but PLEASE discontinue this at the first sign of any mental side effect and do not keep going like I did. It got to the point where I felt suicidal just to escape how miserable I was feeling. NEVER in my life have I felt like this. I am hoping to save someone’s life by this review. If you’re feeling like I did please stop this pill and know it WILL get better. Give you body time to rebound for these toxic hormones. This pill needs to be pulled off the market NOW.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Aurovela FE 1/20 on March 12th. It came as a very impulsive decision to seek help for my out of control mood swings I would get each month before my cycle. For many years, I just thought I had depression. However my mother would always tell me to track my feelings around my cycle. Well, I decided to take that chance after another failed relationship. Since I started taking it, I’ve noticed a much better mood, and peace of mind. ALSO, I take the pill continuously. I skip the placebo week and start the next pack. Pretty much my OBGYN wants to eliminate my cycle. I have experienced breakthrough bleeding, which is normal until my body fully adjust. I don’t have tender breast, bloating or fluid retention like I did before I started the pill. Most of the reviews I’ve read seem to be from others who have taken other pills before starting this. I also take the pill with a small dose of Lexapro for anxiety and depression. I’d give it 10 stars so far..

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worst pill that has ever happened to me. Do NOT take this pill. I am 31 years old and never in my life have written a review but this pill gave me the WORST panic attacks where I thought I was going crazy, basically made me almost suicidal thinking I needed to be medicated for anxiety. I got off it last week and 2 days later!!! felt like a new person. Beware!! This birth control is so dangerous and should be taken off market in my opinion! Was the worst month of my life.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Only been on it a week. After taking it I feel severely nauseous and have vomited. I have lost 10 pounds. And my mood swings are so bad. I have no appetite or interest in food period. And have missed or left university three times in the past 5 days

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Don't take it!!! It gave me an awful rash, nausea, a yeast infection, and made me super depressed. It’s been a month and I can’t take it anymore, I’m getting off of it right now. The only good out of this pill is I didn’t get acne, have a lowered sex drive or have weight gain. Besides that I’ve felt sick everyday since taking this rubbish.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS BIRTH CONTROL!!!! I have only been on Junel FE for 4 days and I could feel my anxiety increasing each day but last night I had a full blown anxiety attacked. I couldn’t sleep AT ALL, I threw up, I had the shakes, my chest felt like I was at the top of a roller coaster about to drop down and that feeling wouldn’t go away so I had to call off work today. After googling Junel FE I absolutely cannot believe this is on the market and that it was prescribed to me even while being diagnosed with an anxiety disorder. This medicine drove me crazy.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched from the depo injection to birth control pills two months ago. I was on the depo for 6 years and noticed gradual hair loss so I decided to switch. I decided to look up reviews for this brand and saw AWFUL reviews. I was so nervous and scared just from the reviews on this page, it was causing me so much stress. Anyway I took it and I wanted to leave a good review just to say the bad things that unfortunately happened to others might not happen to you! Don't get over stressed about reading these reviews if  you haven't given the pills at least a month.  I have had a good experience over the last 2 months. The first week, my breasts were sore, but that's about it. I haven't gained weight, I haven't been anxious or depressed. Best of all, my sex drive increased significantly since being on Larin Fe 1/20. I surely hope my experience doesn't change, but so far its been a really positive transition for me.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had terrible side effects when I started this pill. I already previously had anxiety and depression but it became even worse. I tried this pill for 6 months and it never got better. During some cycles my cramps were even worse than they had been before I started this pill. I get two periods a month and have additional spotting in between that time. I started this pill to help regulate my periods, but it made them so much worse and I’m constantly bleeding.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Loestrin Fe for about 2 years due to being diagnosed with PCOS and wanting to regulate my periods. Overall, I didn't initially experience any major side effects. I noticed I gained some weight over time, especially in my boobs, but it wasn't super significant, just a few extra pounds (when I went off of the pill my boobs got smaller again so defs was from this)The main issue I had with Lo Loestrin Fe was that my cholesterol SKYROCKETED on this pill. Ladies, please get your annual physical and bloodwork done because I would never have realized if it wasn't for that! All of my cholesterol levels before BC were totally normal, but after starting this pill, my levels either doubled (for LDL or total cholesterol) or halved (for HDL). It was a super dramatic change and freaked out my doctor so she took me off of the pill right away. Looking at the side effect list, it's one that's listed as a less common side effect but please look out for it!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have tried many brands and types of BC in my 20s and all of them caused extreme mental side effects. I gave up on BC for years. Now at (34) my cycle was all out of whack spotting all the time and 2 week periods. Dr wanted me to try LoLo. I was reluctant due to past experiences with birth control but was tired of bleeding all month so I gave it a go. Not going to lie the first couple of months weren't easy. Side effects: headaches, irritability, hair loss, weight gain(10 lbs) mild acne, swollen tender breasts. These side effects subsided at the end of the 2nd month. Then I bled for 3 weeks and I wanted to quit but my Dr encouraged me to continue and reassured me my body just needed time to adjust.  I did and I am so thankful! Now: no side effects, still have the 10 lbs on but haven’t made any attempts to lose it. Breast are larger and only have mild spotting once a month for a day. My hormones needed time to adjust. If I had given up before the end of my 3rd cycle I would have given a negative review.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill when I was 13, (17 now) and trust me it was a rollercoaster but I was also super young with raging hormones when I started it which could have been a lot of why this pill was difficult for me. I started this to help my acne which it did help clear up significantly. I developed depression and anxiety that I was medicated for, but it was tolerable. I noticed I was a lot more moodier and snappy when just starting the pill. I also gained weight which wasn’t really a problem for me because I had an eating disorder at the time of starting it. This pill regulated my periods a lot and only brought them down to 4-5 days and I had absolutely no cramps or breast tenderness. I just recently switched over to a new birth control because this one stopped working for me. I’ve had a huge increase of acne that I have never seen before, not even when I hit puberty. I also bleed in between my periods which I have never had a problem with. I also have mild cramps.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control his amazing!!! I had long and extremely heavy periods (9-11 days) due to endometriosis, and horrible depression and anxiety the week before my period. I also had cramps so bad I would throw up, which caused me to stay home way more than I would’ve liked. I went on Sprintec, and while that helped make my periods more manageable and cleared my acne, it also made me more depressed, caused me to gain 20 lbs, and got rid my sex drive. When I switched, I lost the weight I had gained, got my sex drive back, and was no longer depressed!! My periods are now 2 days long, super light, and I have absolutely no cramping. I also have had no breakthrough bleeding or negative side effects besides the return of the acne I had pre-birth control. while there are some horrible reviews for Lo Loestrin Fe, most people with positive experiences aren’t writing reviews. If you are struggling with heavy periods and severe PMS, I would definitely recommend trying this birth control out!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):4 months in and I can't complain, I am on this for PCOS. My main thing is I would recommend taking a B complex.  I saw that birth controls depletes B vitamins which can cause mood swings and depression. I've taken a B complex vitamin every day along with the birth control and haven't had any mood swings. Had spotting during my second month but was expecting that while adjusting. My acne didn't get better or worse and didn't gain any weight. Always eat a little something with the pill or you'll be nauseous.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control 4 years ago and my side effects got worse and worse every year I was on it. I’ve never suffered from anxiety and it made me literally so miserable. Stressed every day to the point where I’d start to shake and get nervous over nothing. I never knew what was causing this. My cramps were also so bad. Pelvic pain and mood swings. I’d cry for an entire day and then be fine the next. Muscle aches as well due to my anxiety getting so bad. I also would become incredibly nauseous a few days before my cycle, sometimes I would even throw up. There was nights where I would constantly just sit in my bathroom from a panic attack. I also got aggravated incredibly easy. I got off of this pill. Please do not take this. Believe every side effect. It got worse and worse everyday I took it and I never thought it could be my pill making me this miserable. The only thing it did for me was prevent me from getting pregnant.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I pride myself on taking care of my 4c natural hair. This pill has made my hair become weak brittle extremely dry and damaged, and even worse it’s falling out by the handful. I’m completely devastated. I have been using this pill for 3 months. Also experiencing extreme swollen and painful breasts. Last night fluid was leaking from one breast! Extreme mood swings, depression and anxiety. Almost unable to focus which is completely outside my character. Came here to see if I was crazy and I’m clearly not judging by all of these reviews. Today I’m stopping cold turkey.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Besides stopping you from pregnancy, this does nothing to help you. This is the longest I’ve been taking it (4 months) and I had a HAPPY life changing event happen to me this month, and it triggered a series of depression, anxiety, and just a crazy emotional wreck. I haven’t eaten in days, and I have no motivation to do anything! I’ve been clingy towards my boyfriend, and I can’t stop crying for a day. I can’t even control my crying. There is absolutely nothing wrong in my life so I didn’t understand. Finally, I looked up the Junel Fe pills and quickly see this is the issue. I threw out the pills immediately. If you already have small amounts of anxiety, or anything else steer clear of this! Take a non-hormonal contraceptive instead PLEASE.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Since I’ve been on this pill I’ve been stuck in one long depressive episode. I’m bleeding for 2-3 weeks out of the month as well so that makes it better.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have just recently started this birth control. This is the second one I’ve tried and so far I love it. I will admit I was very nervous to start it after reading all of the terrible reviews. I have not been on it long but I can tell a huge change in my mood, I am usually easily irritated, cranky and tired and after I started taking it my mood has increased and I wake up more energized. The first couple of days my face and back has broken out some, not worse than anything I have had before and I do struggle with face and back acne. I expected to have some more acne while my body is adjusting to the birth control since it is hormones. So far I have not had any bad side affects besides the little acne. Obviously since this is a hormonal birth control there will be different side effects for everyone so always talk to a doctor before switching or starting something new. But do not be afraid to try it just because of some reviews, your body is different than everyone else’s on here.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this birth control for 2 months. Gave me headaches, constant cramps and nausea which I understand is somewhat common for the adjustment period however the anxiety I experienced while taking this was UNBEARABLE. An actual living nightmare. I was having a full blown panic attack every single day if not more than one, to the point where I was actually sleeping at my parents house every night because my level of functioning/mental stability was so low.  Also  it somehow managed to make my period worse than it already was. Do not recommend.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hello! I started taking this three months after my now one year old child was born. I started having uncontrollable rage at the drop of a hat. Every morning I woke up with anger so bad that my chest would hurt. I picked fights with my partner and raised my tone with my daughter way more than I should have. My periods became unpredictable on this birth control as well. Every month around my period my anxiety sky rocketed. Sore breasts and acne. NO sex drive at all. It’s day four off of this and for the first time in months I woke up feeling like myself and not a monster. -10/10 for me.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first 2 weeks I had really bad nausea and TERRIBLE mood swings where I was especially depressed and anxious. I still am feeling pretty depressed and anxious almost everyday while taking this pill but the nausea has subsided. I didn’t really notice a change in my weight but my appetite definitely decreased. I have noticed that my hair is definitely thinner and after reading the reviews again I’m realizing that this definitely could be because of the birth control. I still get my period but it is very light. I still am continuing to get cramps and nausea and my regular PMS symptoms the week where I do not take the pill and get my period and so I am planning to switch pills since it’s not helping me in this department. Overall this pill prevented pregnancy and I didn’t have any major symptoms except for mood swings but it just didn’t really do anything for me in terms of helping my PMS symptoms.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched to this birth control, previously taking Lo Lo Esterin, and now have been on this birth control for the last 2 weeks. All I have seen are negative reviews and mom told me to try it out because every birth control is different for everyone. This birth control I can already tell is horrible. I have tender breasts, terrible irritability, and I mean BAD & very emotional. The smallest things have been setting me off and I’m not normally like that at all except for 1-2 days before I begin my period. I have also noticed increased appetite and that worries me as well because I don’t want to gain weight due to a birth control. I am very upset with this situation when my old birth control was perfect for me. Do not take this birth control, it is awful and as everyone else is saying but it will turn your life for the worst.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control was awful. I have taken it 2 separate times in my life for about 6 months each and it made me feel terrible. I had really bad mood swings, my anxiety was at an all time high and it all around was just a bad experience. I switched to Junel and felt so much better in all aspects.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Great pill ! This was my first birth control ever and I was really scared since I’ve heard so many people have many different side effects from pills but I had none. it didn’t even seem like I was on a pill. I never got my period, didn’t affect my acne the only somewhat annoying thing was that it did give me sore breasts but over all 10/10

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am currently on my third week of Junel Fe 1/20. So far, no serious side effects. I am much more emotional, but it is not too bad, I’m just an easy crier now. My fingers are slightly swollen but I have had no breakthrough bleeding, headaches or nausea. I was expecting way worse. I am pleasantly surprised.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):THE WORST ! I’ve been on my period for the last 5 months and that how long I’ve been taking Hailey . I take birth control because my periods are so painful and sickening it sometimes puts me in the hospital, so my goal was to stop my periods . I used to take Junel Fe and that was THE BEST. But I moved and when my insurance ended I had to find a new one. The provider told me this was like Junel but no way it’s nothing like it. I’m breaking out. I’m bleeding everyday. I’m always feeling bloated and uncomfortable. I've been trying to loose weight and it’s definitely harder now that I’m on this birth control. I went from losing 3 pounds a month to none at all. I asked my provider for a different birth control because this just ain’t it .

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Completed my first month I’m 42, so far no negative symptoms. No issues whatsoever. This is the first time ever taking birth control pills. I plan on continuing.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):An Update from March's review. I stopped taking Tarina on April 3rd. Since then I have dropped 10 pounds, my mood and outlook on life has improved. My body shape! I didn't even realize how different my body shape was while taking the pill was. My body shape has returned to how it used to be. My body shape on the pill was extremely "hormonal"  a lot of stomach bumps and flabs, I chalked up to weight gain. But I could not understand why I went from an hourglass not taking the pill and then on the pill an apple, now I'm back to an hourglass...just more  "sand" from when I was last an hourglass shape. However, we are working on that. I am dropping weight more consistently now. I am glad I made the decision to stop taking this pill. I am now using Paragard and so far I am happy. I do NOT believe that taking the pill has no effect on weight gain and body type change. I will never go back to using hormonal birth control. I just believe they are trying to push an agenda.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the WORST birth control ever. I’ve been on Junel and Lo Estrin for 10 years and never experienced any side effects. Walgreens gave me this birth control instead of Junel in Jan and I finally called my dr to switch me back to Junel. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE acne, breast tenderness, weight gain (I’ve been the same exact weight for 7 years), terrible anxiety and sleeping issues as well as low energy. Within three days of switching back to Junel, my entire face cleared up and I’ve been able to sleep again. Hopefully breast tenderness will go away with time as well as back to my normal weight. Do NOT take this birth control as an alternative to Junel. If you use Walgreens , find a new pharmacy that will give you Junel.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on the lower does and constantly had breakthrough bleeding for a month straight so my doctor switched me to the higher dose. Within a year I gained 20 lbs. before this I never had any problem with weight gain and could always lose weight no problem. Now it is so difficult to lose any weight. It made me super depressed and I have really bad anxiety now. It completely depleted all of my sex drive.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the first method of birth control I was put on whenever I went to my gynecologist. I was sexually active with my boyfriend and wanted to stop using condoms. I feel that this pill had more negatives than positives for me. Birth control affects everyone differently; I am just sharing my experience. The only reason I switched away from this pill is that insurance stopped covering it. The Negatives:I had little to no sex drive. This led to dryness during sex. This led to problems with my sex life with my boyfriend.I had mood changes. This is expected with birth control, but I felt that I cried a lot more with this pill. The Positives:No period. If you rather have your period, get off of this birth control. I never had a period on this pill, just spotting now and then. I knew I was not pregnant because we barely had sex when I was on this. No cramps. This was helpful for me because I had very bad cramps when I had my periods before this pill.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I actually LOVE this birth control. This is my first time taking a pill for birth control & I requested for the lowest hormone dosage they could possibly give me. I feel 0% physical side effects & as for hormone & emotional, I actually feel more balanced (less depressed when my period comes around). I read all these reviews & others on different websites & got terrified that this would be absolutely horrible for me (I have PMDD & birth control is a scary guessing game a lot of the time, my body usually doesn't like  it & rejects it), but weirdly this one that everyone seems to not like, my body is liking. If you're starting to take Aurovela & coming from a higher hormone dosage I could see why your body freaked out, it's not Aurovela it's the gap of hormones that it was used to. Also, most people spend time to write bad reviews but people with good experiences don't usually take the time to write good reviews- keep that in kind if you're reading these.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):THE WORST EXPERIENCE in my life. Like others, I was on Necon for years and loved it. Then moved to a new city and the new pharmacy didn't have the Necon in stock so gave me the Nortrel instead because "it's the same exact thing". Famous last words. The worst 6 weeks of my life followed. Crippling anxiety, the worst depression (had never had depression before), heart racing, zero appetite (had to force myself to eat protein bars so, you know, I'd stay alive). Even had 2 ER trips because I thought I had a heart problem. I'd sob 6-7 times a day. Had no interest in anything and couldn't even choke down my favorite foods. Suspected Nortrel, stopped immediately, and within a week, felt like myself again. Now I take ONLY Necon and haven't had an issue since. There is something off with this pill, even though the active ingredients are the same, there are other differences. THESE CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN SOME PEOPLE. There's something fishy. Avoid if possible. It's not worth going through that nightmare.

Tarina 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):THE WORST BIRTH CONTROL EVER !!! I’m coming from a different brand of birth control. I got this brand from planned parenthood. I haven’t even been on this pill for no longer than 5 weeks and it’s been the worst, I’ve been bleeding nonstop since I started (March 25, 2021) I’ve been having mood swings, I'm super bloated, my boobs are huge and sore, I have the worst mood swings, and I’ve been super nauseous. This sucks !!!!!

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve was taking lo loestrin for about a year. It had some pros— for instance I would normally suffer from really painful menstrual cramps but with this birth control I haven’t had any since I started. Another thing I haven’t gotten my period since I started. Not even the common spotting. Which that was a little concern with me towards the end. It’s not normal. But what really made me stop taking these pills was that I broke out a lot!!!! It was ridiculous how much acne I got from this! It just took one week for my face to clear up and feel smooth after I fully stopped taking these pills! Now I have to go on the hunt again for birth control pills.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill made me spot halfway through the pack every month. I thought my body just wasn't used to it, but it happened continuously even after 7 months of use. I was a bit more irritable and emotional than usual but other than that, I had no other negative or positive symptoms.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for over a year now and I LOVE this pill. I do get my period, & lately I’ve been getting more cramps but it doesn’t bother me too much. Doesn’t make you sick if you take it & don’t eat anything before (at least for me) & no acne, no weight gain or weight loss. This pill for me has been VERY effective, although the last 2 pills do have a weird minty taste, that’s my only complaint. If you’re looking for a pregnancy prevention prescription (that still highly regulates your period), this is it!

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Junel Fe 1/20 back in March. I had taken one other type of birth control about 4 years ago (the patch) which made me a complete lunatic! I almost jumped off a bridge! For years I have always had extreme mood swings just before my period. I described my symptoms as each time I felt blue, suicidal and enraged right before my period. I also told the doctors each time this happened I was ALWAYS on my cycle. The doctor suggested I may have PMDD. I was referred to see an OBGYN who suggest I'd take Junel Fe 1/20. I was horrified to start any sort of birth control because of my experience I had on the patch several years ago. I was given instruction to take it everyday, skip the placebo pills (which start your period), and start the next pack. So ultimately there are no breaks between the packs, I consistently take the pill everyday! Pretty much, my OBGYN wants me to have no cycle so I can stop having the extreme mood swings right before I would have my cycle. I FEEL SO MUCH BETTER!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):For the first two months on Junel I noticed I was still a little extra sensitive to the smallest of things. Towards my third month on it I noticed I was having a hard time focusing on tasks, at work, and couldn't even enjoy any of my normal hobbies. Then I became very clingy towards my boyfriend (bless him) and in the past two weeks I have had the absolute worst days of my entire life. I was suddenly experiencing panic attacks, being paranoid all the time over things, lost my self confidence, felt like I was worthless, unable to sleep due to crippling paranoia and anxiety at night. I lost my appetite and felt sick all the time. I have always been an extremely happy person in life. Never have I once experienced depression or anxiety. I've been fortunate enough to not have mental illnesses, but I was beginning to think I was going insane, to the point I couldn't breathe because I was crying and panicking so hard. I stopped the pills immediately. Quickly noticed a mental improvement.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this BC for 1 year and it cleared my acne as well as regulated my mood swings. It worked great for me.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had to have a cholecystectomy (removal of the gallbladder) at the age of 18 as a result of taking this medication. I have FNH (focal nodular hyperplasia; also known as a benign tumor on the liver) as well. In addition, I have a severe inability to handle emotions now. I believe I have some sort of depression or anxiety that was not present before.That being said, I have not had a period since I started taking the medication. It has prevented pregnancy as well.

This pill was my first and now likely my last experience on a birth control pill. My symptoms began a few days after starting the pill with horrible nausea, I threw up and thought I had food poisoning. I am usually very active going to the gym, riding horses, studying, but on this pill I was constantly exhausted and wanted to do nothing but sleep all day. No matter how much sleep I got none felt like enough. I felt terrible depression and was shaking with anxiety which I had never experienced before. I consistently had headaches/light headedness/ overall mental fog. A few days later the nausea woke me up in the middle of the night out of a dead sleep, caused me to puke and kept me up for hours. I was constantly spotting and it never subsided and I have never felt more pain in my breasts that didn’t go away. Also, when I wasn’t nauseated, my appetite was insane and I would eat everything. You couldn’t pay me to stay on this pill. Worst experience of my life.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this birth control for two months now and none of the horrible side effects have calmed down. I know it is from this birth control because I just stopped taking it this week and every single symptom went away immediately. I had extreme heart palpitations, nausea (literally would throw up all the time), my period would continue for the ENTIRE month, extreme mood swings, depression, anger, and worst of all constant fatigue. I feel energetic, happy, and so much better ever since I stopped taking these pills. These pills should not be allowed on the market.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first experience on birth control and it hasn’t been too bad. I’ve had light periods, and before they were unbearable. I have had a few bladder infections but I’m working with my doctor to figure out why. I’ve lost a few pounds but I’m extremely bloated and I’m always so hot.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed this since they didn’t have Junel Fe at the time. I spoke with the pharmacist and he confirmed it’s the same as that. I took it for 1 month and it’s probably the worst birth I have ever tried. I had mood swings and it made me feel so depressed. I had constant bloating and I was throwing up every other day. I ended up finishing the month of it and right now I’m no longer taking any birth control since I’m just trying detoxify from the pill. I stopped it in December and now it’s April and I still have spotting everyday and heavy periods. All bodies are different but this one was not the one for me.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo estrin before this and switched because it wasn’t regulating my periods. I tried a full month of this before giving up because I literally lost 5 pounds a week due to not eating because of how nauseous it made me. I would puke anytime I ate a full meal. I don’t have a sensitive stomach either!! It’s not worth it if it makes you this sick. I’m switching to Vienva now, we’ll see how it goes!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for five years. Love it. Works great for me. Initially it was not easy... consistent bleeding for 3 months. I kept taking it despite the aches, migraines, and severe flow. Now, it’s my best buddy! Haven’t had a period in what feels like forever.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor convinced me to start a pill and I was hesitant because I’ve been on so many since the age of 16. I came across Junel and I absolutely LOVE it! I can skip my period! My skin is clear! I’ve struggled with depression before the pill and also my weight. I’ve lost weight since starting! I really don’t have any complaints with this pill but everyone is different! What’s best for me might not be what’s best for you and that’s okay. I will say I’m probably more moody than before but that’s understandable they are hormones!

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on birth control since 13 years old because of extremely painful and long periods. My doctor started me out on Microgestin, then my pharmacy switched me to Junel. Neither gave me side effects from what I could tell. Then, not long ago, I got switched to Blisovi. For months I've been feeling extreme, paralyzing anxiety and the darkest depression I've ever experienced (and I've struggled with depression and anxiety for as long as I can remember). So I'm getting off of it. No period pain is worse than the anxiety and depression I have been experiencing. If you struggle with depression or anxiety please stay off this medicine. Try Microgestin instead but don't believe that these two medications are comparable.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel Fe since 2018 , in the beginning I had no symptoms. I originally took it to stop the heavy cycles and cramps and it seemed to be doing just fine. Around August of 2020 I started to bleed during intercourse and it hasn’t stopped since. My doctor and gynecologist both tested me for STI’s and UTI’s and all of them came back negative. They then considered it may be my birth control causing me to become dry down there and causing friction then bleeding on my partner, which is not pleasant. I never did I get any symptoms until 2020 which is weird but the doctors claim it’s normal.  I am deciding to take a different pill before getting on the IUD I heard a lot of good things about it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on this when I was 15 for irregular, long, heavy periods.  Before this I got my period as heavy as can be for 9-12 days a month and spotted every other day I didn't have my period. I got put on this when I was in 8th grade. My periods were lessened to 3-4 days with small bleeding, didn't even have to wear a tampon. I just would get nauseous after restarting a pack every month the morning after. I gained 5 pounds the first 3 months I was on it, but then lost it. My boyfriend finishes into me, I have not gotten pregnant. I am now 20 years old and have decided to quit taking it and get an IUD. I will check back later to tell you how I feel getting off of it. I had no other side effects except nausea.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had switched over from Sprintec to this in September and at first it was fine. My periods were spotty and sometimes I would miss one. About 2-3 months in I started to get headaches all the time and I would randomly become very nauseous at night, which would keep me up for hours. I also noticed I was very irritable and the smallest thing would set me off. I have now switched to a new pill and I have felt better on this one.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on microgestin for 4 weeks now. The first couple weeks  I didn't have any bleeding, I did have digestive side effect symptoms (bloating, diarrhea, the works). I've felt a little more emotional than normal, but nothing crazy noticeable. Then starting around 2 weeks into the pill I started bleeding consistently and having random cramping. I feel like I've been on my period for 2 weeks. This hasn't gone away yet but I'm hoping it will eventually. My doctor said to stick with it for 2-3 months before deciding anything, so that's the plan right now. I feel like my acne isn't any better, if not a little worse (I have combination skin type). My breasts do feel a little fuller though (which is always nice for a small chested person like myself lol). Will update in another month!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At first it wasn’t too bad but by the second month I could immediately notice the side effects. I suffered a lot with anxiety and depression when I was going through puberty and had long since outgrown it but by the second month in this pill I literally felt like I was back in middle school. I’m a nervous wreck and sad at the same time all the time and it only gets worse the closer I get to my periods. What doesn’t help is that my periods are still fairly painful and last me almost the entire placebo week. I decided today that I’m not taking this pill anymore and am scheduling an appointment with my doctor to talk about starting a new one. Unless you are using it strictly as birth control I wouldn’t recommend this pill, even women with the strongest mental health seem to struggle emotionally while on this pill and it just isn’t worth it in my opinion.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m on the generic version of this pill and it’s the worst thing ever and have been for four months now. I am constantly anxious, depressed, nauseous, and moody. Not to mention I had two yeast infections in this time period from the pill. I’ve never had a yeast infection before. I am constantly dry down there and my boobs are always sore. I didn’t gain weight but I did loose a lot of hair. This pill is suppose to let me have sex and prevent pregnancy when since being on this pill it’s made sex miserable and painful to where I don’t even have sex anymore. Lube doesn’t even make it better.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am shocked to see so many bad reviews for this! I started on the lower dose Junel in January 2014 and experienced breakthrough bleeding on and off for a few months. It was annoying since I had just gotten married and my husband can't stand the sight of blood. So I switched to a different pill. The new pill caused depression and anxiety. I then switched to another one causing even worse anxiety. So my Dr decided that since I didn't have any emotional issues with Junel, I should just try the stronger pill. Since being on the stronger pill, I have gained a little weight (but not sure that is due to the pill rather than a happy marriage) and my hair has thinned out a little (only noticeable to me). Other than that, my emotional issues due to my birth control are GONE. I would recommend trying this pill for about 2 months before scratching it from your list, all birth control pills will take a little bit to get used to. Hope this helps!

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I stopped this pill 4 months ago and I still have side effects. When I was taking this pill, my anxiety and intrusive thoughts were horrible. I cried everyday and thought I was living a depression. Also, it gave me yeast infection 2 times and even after 4 months of stopping the pill, the yeast infections don’t stop!!!!! I never had this kind of infection before. Please, be aware of what you put in your body.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Bad! Bad! Iwouldn’t recommend, I had severe mood swings and nervous all the time, my stomach was bloated all the time while on it. This pill made me feel like I was disconnected from the world. It always made my period have clots as well and never happened to before till I got on this pills. I didn’t gain weight which is fine. I also noticed I had really bad back pain and this pill caused yeast infection!!

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):3rd week of my 1st pack and so far so good! Prior birth control I was taking made me spot during 2nd week for 5 months and finally got my Dr to switch me and BAM no bleeding in between my period so far. Wish drs would understand that they don't know our bodies the way we know.

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It’s been the best one for me so far. The only downside is I get a lot of UTIs and pH related issues. My acne is clear though and I haven’t gotten pregnant which is good lol

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I really gave this a good go, but I could barely stay awake on this. I had a stomach ache on other generic forms of this and that was tolerable but not this one it made me so nauseated I couldn't sleep a couple of the nights. I really wanted to like it but I ended up requesting the pharmacist order and switch me to Junel. I had no other side effects besides those two though. No pregnancy.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE IT!!!! My boyfriend doesn't like condoms and always wanted to stay inside. Of course I loved him and wanted to do everything to keep him happy. So, I went to my gynecologist for a consultation. I was given lo lo birth control by my gynecologist and she said there is no serious side effects - well she was wrong! I went home and immediately started to take them at the same time every day. I did experienced side effects like headaches, abdominal pains, and everything there is... but the worse happened on week 3. Bladder infection and than following to kidney infection. Now my organs are shutting down... I’m in the hospital and doctors doing everything there is to help. They think I would need kidney transplant as mine are so damaged. My boyfriend vanished and here I am left alone... Was it worth it? - NO!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I first started birth control to help with my unbearable periods. My cramps were debilitating and I had long lasting/heavy periods. It took trying a few kinds of birth control before I landed on this kind. I needed to be on a low dose of hormones due to having high blood pressure. This medication was perfect for me. My periods were very light (mostly spotting) and they came like clockwork the morning of the fourth sugar pill every month. I have been on this birth control for the last 6-7 years. The only reason I have stopped taking it is because I am now married and trying for a baby.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used this to help manage my endometriosis symptoms. It did the exact opposite for me. It put my back in 10/10 pain 24/7 . I tried it for three long months, no placebo. Took 2 to three weeks to start feeling better after discontinuing.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had extremely bad periods prior to starting meds. Throwing up every month multiple times in one night over a period of a few days. Cramps to the point of passing out and so on. I use to bleed for 8-9 days. The first three months were about the same as they were before starting the meds. My doctor said it’ll take a while to actually begin working so I gave it some time. I honestly started to loose hope for a bit but it around 4 months things were significantly better. I could go back to school, hang out again. I do still have cramps here and there as well as sore breasts however, it’s NOTHING like it was before. I’m also regular now so I’d give it a good 8/10.
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Don't let the reviews scare you. Taytulla is the ONLY birth control that I have not had a negative side effect with!

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Junel 24 for about two years and loved it, had no acne and if I did it went away quickly. Was switched to Hailey because of insurance purposes but now I break out every month. It’s kinda like I was never on birth control. It’s that out of control. I like this birth control period wise but acne wise, it’s a no from me. I’m gonna ask my dr to switch me back to Junel 24.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed Aurovela because I wanted to go on one to regulate my periods as they were long (normal a week or more) and heavy and I felt like I was anxious, pissy and impatient. I am sensitive to medication so I have always been scared to take strong medications.  Basically I got on the first day of my period and I felt fine the first week. I did start to notice I was cramping more than usual and my body definitely felt more full especially chest area. What started to get me worried was that my period went on for 14 days and was heavy everyday. I got very constipated and I ended up having to go to the doctor would prescribed me a heavy duty laxative and instructed that I should go to the ER if I don’t get better. I immediately stopped the birth control as I found some research papers that stated that hormonal changes due to birth control can inflame the colon. I’m only a 2 weeks in and I wanted to keep going but having an inflamed colon is not fun at all.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor first prescribed me Microgestin, but they were out of it so they gave me Junel. At first I was scared because of the reviews, but after 3 months of taking it everything was going quite okay. Went to get a refill and the pharmacy switched my prescription AGAIN. On day 4 and my breasts and stomach are hella sore, I feel like they’re just swelling. No headaches or rapid mood swings but I think my antidepressant is helping a bit with that. Hopefully things get better!!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on this birth control to help stop bleeding and to help regulate my periods. I just finished the first pack but for the ENTIRE MONTH my breasts have swelled and are EXTREMELY painful to the point I’m in tears. I was already diagnosed with depression and anxiety and my mood swings became even worse. And I’ve been cramping and bleeding for 2 weeks straight now and Tylenol or ibuprofen won’t help at all. I don’t recommend this birth control! There has not been ONE day on this pill that I felt ok

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hi I just wanted to put this review out there for people are really nervous about starting birth control like I was. I’m 5’6, 115lbs. I haven’t gained any weight, however, my boobs have gotten a lot bigger. My skin has always been pretty clear except for the occasional period pimples. On this birth control my skin has been very clear. However, in the beginning my skin did breakout for a few weeks, but now it’s perfect. My period hurt very badly the first time on the pack. Also, I had spotting for about a month but it could have been from a UTI I had at the same time. Normally my periods are 8 days and heavy. On this birth control it was 2-3 days and light. My emotions are completely normal as well. Once the meds regulate this is a very good birth control.Overall, I recommend this birth control and have had a very good experience on it.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been using this birth control since June of 2020 and haven't had a period since. I don't have any complaints with using it and I have no symptoms. I don't get cramps or acne or headaches. It seems to be affecting me just fine.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was only on this pill for 2 days. I could not continue taking this pill. I had constant stomach pain. Not cramp like feeling but like a feeling of fluid in my stomach. Very uncomfortable. I went on this pill to regulate my heavy periods & to gain weight & it hindered my weight gain journey cause I didn’t want to eat anymore with constant stomach pain. I also got several anxiety attacks in those two days & it made me overly stressful as I am already a stressful person.  This is my 3rd birth control I’ve tried. BC pills are just not for me, I will continue taking my iron pills and stop trying to put unnatural medication in my body.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Just want to share my positive experience using Lo Loestrin Fe. I was initially afraid to take Lo Lo, as I thought it would have the same negative effect/outcome as with other pills; however, I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to be on LoLo. My mood was fantastic (important to me as other pills had always triggered my anxiety and depression), my acne completely cleared up, and my period was much lighter/less crampy (a huge deal as I have historically had very heavy and super painful periods). If I had the option to stay on this pill, I would; however, due to personal history of high blood pressure and because I am now turning 35, my gynecologist recommended that I switch to a BC w/out estrogen. I just want to share my positive experience with taking Lo Lo for anyone out there that is exploring this option for the first time. I was on LoLo for just about 5 years.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on this after my insurance didn’t cover my Lo Loestrin Fe anymore. I’m on week three, and it’s the worst experience I have had with birth control yet. I have had horrible stomach issues, nausea, migraines, and even a really bad period. Wouldn’t advise for anyone to take this!!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this for over two years. In February 2021 I started having 2 periods per month. I just finished my period per the pill pack on 3/22/21. Then on 3/30/21 I started to bleed again. I haven't missed any pills. It is now 4/5/21 and I am still spotting dark brown. Not supposed to have my "real" period until 4/19/21. I'm currently considering just quitting this birth control and making my husband use condoms. My OB-GYN told me that this happens on this low dose birth control and that if it doesn't end on its own, I should quit taking it for a week and start a new pack or just switch to a higher dose birth control. Neither of those options sound good to me. I have headaches often, I'm always exhausted, nausea at odd times.  This  birth control isn't for me. It never used to do this to me. I don't know what changed but this is awful.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started taking this and I have lost all my energy. I have retained water and feel horrible. Not taking anymore. Need my energy and clarity back. Feel exhausted. Advise to try something else.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):IDK if I’m an actual psychopath or if this pill is making me one but I've been on it for 4 years. I’d say now I feel numb to pain and happiness, it’s ruined every relationship I’ve ever been in, I can’t control what I say or do and I used to never be like this. It magnifies all ur insecure and everything u could think of

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was hesitant to start this because of the bad reviews but decided to give it a go. After one week on the pill, I broke out into horrible hives. All over my body. I was beyond fatigued and out of it.  At first I didn’t know what the hives were from, so I started eliminated lotions, things in the house, etc. still the hives were there. I discontinued the birth control to see if that’s what it was and the hives went away. Not to mention.. I felt crazy on it. My anxiety & mood was whack. I felt depressed and anxious. The reason I went on this med was to ease my extremely painful cramping but I’m going an all natural route now/ having to seek alternative options. This birth control brand scared me from ever starting another birth control. If you can, I hear good things about lo loestrin instead of Junel Fe. Everyone’s body is different but I notice a pattern in these reviews. Good luck!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):*Please Read*28 year old female - I went on birth control for the first time >1 year ago. A few months into taking Junel Fe 1/20, I began experiencing severe anxiety, frequent panic attacks, and intrusive thoughts. I improved my diet, went to therapy, acupuncture, deleted my social media accounts, journaled more, meditated daily and none of it healed me. It did not make sense.I decided to read reviews on this birth control and found multiple sites/read over a hundred reviews of women experiencing something similar. I stopped taking this pill the following day and it's now been 1 month. The extremity of anxiety has subsided - no more suffering mentally, emotionally, and physically. I WISH I had done research prior to taking the pill my Gyno recommended. This should NOT be taken especially if you have existing mental health issues.
Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been throwing up for three days straight since I started. Can’t keep my eyes open. Exhausted. Miserable. Anxious. Never again.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worst birth control ever, bloating feeling anxious and on top of that I get my period twice a month since  I started this stuff! Please stay away from this

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started May of 2020, didn't really notice the weight gain until October. I'm heavier now than I was 9 months pregnant and heavier after giving birth. Clothes do not fit right and I cry a lot more. My appetite is thru the roof. I decided on November 30th to try and lose weight. I did not stop the birth control. I have consistently exercised 6 days a week for an hour (HIIT, Cycling, Running, Weight Training etc) and have tortured myself by restricting caloric intake to 1200 calories. Yes, only 1200...more recently 1100 calories. I have not missed ONE day. I have been extremely dedicated. I finally gave in beginning of March and bought a scale. I last weighed in November 230 pounds. I am 227. It's extremely frustrating. The only thing I can think of is this birth control. I have lost weight in the past as much as 50 pounds. I know what to do.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill was great from the start. Few months in and I had horrible breakouts. I was not typically prone to acne, prior to taking the birth control. I definitely do NOT recommend this pill if you are looking to clear up your skin! I found out a few months in that a side effect to this birth control was actually acne... talked to my gyno and switched to Nikki. My skin is now acne prone and breaks out horribly during the time of my period on my chin. Though, I am already seeing progress in my skin and it’s been 1 month on Nikki. Overall, I wouldn’t recommend this bc if you are acne prone or trying to clear your skin. But everyone’s body is different!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control on March 8th on the first day of my period and had unprotected sex 7 days after and then two days after that, both on my most fertile days. hoping it works as it should. I keep having pregnancy symptoms such as painful nausea and bloating. I’m tired all the time and have no motivation whatsoever. I have been diagnosed with depression last year and i HIGHLY recommend not to take this pill if you suffer with mental health issues !! This pill made me more suicidal than I have been in a long time, and my mood swings were horrendous. Hopefully I’m not pregnant ! but I would not recommend to those with mental health issues. It did help my acne a bit though, I will admit that.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I spent 7 years on Junel and I’m sad I can’t get those years back. The pros: clear skin, no weight gain, no periods, and obviously no pregnancyThe cons: extreme anxiety and depression, constantly feeling like I was in a fog and not really there (just going through the motions of life), no sex drive, vaginal dryness during sex, bloating after eating, nausea in the mornings, low energy, always tired, night sweats, insomnia, constipation, dry hair and skin, headaches a few times a month, very high blood pressure. I’m a completely different person since stopping and will never take hormonal contraceptives ever again.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been taking Taytulla for over a year and was doing okay on it. Then I was switched to the generic version, Gremmily. I stopped taking it because I was barely able to get in the morning without an awful migraine.

My breast were super tender. I don’t usually have acne and this caused me to break out really bad. All this in only 2 weeks. I stopped the pill and 2 days later I felt more like myself. Definitely don’t recommend.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I’ve been on it for about a month and I’ve been feeling pretty much no different. Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control since September of 2016. I loved not having a period on the pill, and how I never got pregnant but that was all. It caused constant acne, and has had me on an emotional rollercoaster. I have decided to stop taking it and not get on anything else for awhile. Everyone’s experience clearly is different, but I recommend changing or stopping bc the moment you feel off.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I thought I was crazy for thinking this Birth Control was making weird things happen to me. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Do NOT use thisIf you have a history of depression or anxiety, please find another birth control. Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):PART ONE: This is for someone who bases their decisions off of reviews (like my self). This is my first experience ever using the contraceptive pill. I wanted to put this honest review out, to ease peoples decisions. However, if you currently already use Junel or another brand I do not recommend changing your formula.  But this was my first time, and feel perfectly normal. My face has remained clear. Some minor headache an hour or two after I take the pill but shortly goes away. I take it at night so I sleep it off. My boobs are a little sore now. I haven't got to the sugar pill yet so I am curious how long my period will last and how much cramps.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before getting put on birth control, my skin was completely clear. I never did a nightly skin care routine yet my skin was glowing. Loestrin 21 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst BC I’ve ever taken. I had previously been on tri-sprintec for years, so long I lost count. Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):PLEASE READ IF YOU ARE UNDER 110 POUNDS OR AROUND THERE!!!! This pill dosage is more than your body can handle! I lost my sex drive, my ability to enjoy things, my taste in food. This pill would make me throw up and pass out constantly. I had migraines for the first time and it would also cause me to get so sick to the point I couldn’t move. I had a loss of appetite and even my hair was falling out! Anyways, he said I was crazy for lasting this long. This pill is dangerously high for women who are around my weight. I would not wish the experience I had on these pills on my worst enemy. I nearly lost my boyfriend and friends because of it. Please make sure you’re reading how much you’re putting into your body and how much your body can take!  Most importantly always remember there are other options!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hey ladies! If you are someone who has never had any problems with birth control like myself, then I totally recommend it. Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this birth control for a little over a year. It was the only pill that didn’t give me acne, make me gain any weight, or give me migraines. My therapist suggested an antidepressant but told me to get off of Blisovi first in case that was the issue. Once I decided to get off of it, my mental health was restored in the matter of a week. I didn’t know that birth control could have such a severe effect on me, and I am so relieved that I got off of it. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Uncertain about writing this because who knows what’s the stem of my declining mental health, but I stopped taking Junel FE a few weeks ago and we will see what happens. Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Well I got pregnant on it after taking the pill daily at the same time every day... so that’s great.

Balziva (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Balziva for 8 months when I was 23 and never bounced back. This medication elevated my sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) through the roof, and I started struggling with painful sex/burning from atrophy due to the dramatic reduction in free testosterone levels in my tissues. Women need to be aware that this is a common side effect of oral contraceptives, but you never hear about it from your doctor. I developed vestibulodynia, high-tone pelvic floor dysfunction, interstitial cystitis, and was finally diagnosed w/ a connective tissue disease called Sjogren's Syndrome. I'm on other meds for life for this disease, and I never had these issues before Balziva. Your hormones matter. Birth control is not a tic-tac. These medications are more extreme than most gynecologists care to acknowledge. Please consider avoiding this medication.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Not sure why there are so many negative reviews, I've had nothing but an easy time with this medication.I've been on it for about 7 years now. Initially I was on another pill but I deal with depression on and off and my period cramps were awful, so my doctor switched me to Junel because it's lower estrogen. My periods last 2-4 days and are relatively light, hardly any cramps, no acne... I've never had an issue. There's speculation that maybe it causes weight gain, but I work out regularly so it's not enough to mention.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on this birth control for almost 3 years now. Started the pill to help my terrible cramps and regulate my period which it never did regulate. When I first started the pill I had my period for a month straight at one point :/ but now I rarely ever get my period it’s still super irregular. Other than that Lolo didn't make me breakout or gain weight, but definitely make me waaay more emotional I found myself crying over little things a lot more often. Oh and never had any pregnancy scares at all while on lolo :)

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control has been very good to me. I was on Sprintec for a long time since I was 15 years old and now I’m 25 and just switched. Sprintec made me feel sick day and night. But with Blisovi Fe I feel normal I have had loss of appetite, not cause of nausea, I just don’t feel hungry so I eat less portions. No mood swings, no acne, no bloating, period is regulated there was a sex drive loss I was at a 10 now I’d say I’m at a 6, but have not tried it’s main purpose out yet about baby making.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I started this pill because my doctor said it’s worked the best for majority of her patients and it’s such a low dose. While I’m sure it works for many, it was AWFUL for me. I have anxiety to begin with and I’m a pretty emotional person as well. Well let me tell you, I couldn’t get through a day without crying about nothing and wanting to rip someone’s head off over nothing. My irritability, anxiety and every negative feeling you could think of surfaced. I had dizziness (I even fell) terrible paralyzing headaches which I’ve never experienced. Along with a straight 26 days of spotting. I think birth control just isn’t for everyone and my body is extremely routined and reacts very strongly to change. I personally would not recommend this to anyone. The emotional rollercoaster is not worth it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been taking this for about 7 months and it has made things worse. I am very open-minded when it comes to trying new birth controls. This pill has caused so much bleeding for me that I have developed anemia. I deal with heavy periods to begin with but this pill has caused me to bleed for about 2-3 weeks out of every month. I take it exactly as prescribed. It has also caused negative mental changes. Increased anxiety, paranoia, mood swings, and depression. I would say to be careful with this pill and monitor how you feel. The first three months I bled the entire time, but in the past few months I've only bled about half of the month. Will be switching in hopes to find a pill that won't have as much irregular bleeding.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill was great for taking away my cramps and backache from my period. But let me tell you emotionally it is not good at all. Soon after I started taking it I lost attraction for my long term boyfriend, like I didn’t find find him hot anymore when I have been with him for almost a year. I swear this pill messes with your feelings. I have cried so much cause I didn’t understand why I could go from being obsessed with him to not feeling anything when I’m with him. I also am experiencing sore boobs, hair loss, vaginal itchy ness and dryness (I thought I had a yeast infection). Also my sex drive has been ran over. No desire at all. Literally sucks. I really do blame this pill for how I’m feelings right now about my bf and my body in general. It ruined my life. If you struggle with anxiety or depression I’d stay far away from this pill.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible. I’ve taken Junel and microgestin for years with no issue. Pharmacy switched to this and I was eating non stop. I was constantly hungry and also feeling depressed within the first week. This has never happened to me in 15+ years on the pill. Stopped taking it after about 10 days and went back to Junel. No way I’m destroying my body and mental health so Walgreens can save a few bucks on this awful generic. Demand you stay on your previous generic and do not switch to this!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this birth control on and off for about 2+ years to help regulate my period. My period has been irregular from day one. I thought that I was the only woman experiencing severe mood swings, dark DARK thoughts, anxiety, anger, nightmares etc. but after reading a lot of the reviews I now feel validated in the way that I was feeling. I initially thought that the symptoms I listed above were coming from the stress and uncertainty of COVID and the huge shift in everyday life but after trial and error I've found that it's definitely the birth control. Being off of the birth control for a week or two has completely brought me back to myself and I haven't had any of the negative symptoms. I don't normally do reviews but wanted to share my experience and let you know that if you are experiencing these symptoms that you are NOT crazy it's the birth control, stop taking it and ask for an alternative.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I am on my 2nd pack of pills.  The first time taking the pack my period was great, light, no heavy cramps and it went from 7 to 5 days. I am on the 2nd pack and I notice around ovulation time I have gotten a random period. Now every time I use the bathroom I see pinkish discharge now. I know my period suppose to come in a week.. I hope this pill doesn't have me bleeding every other week.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been using this for a week now to regulate my period and so far so good. My breast have moved up a size and my period finally stoped (I guess my body was craving estrogen lol).

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Reading these reviews, it's crazy how much different birth controls can vary for different women. I personally had to switch from Junel Fe to Lo Loesterin and I should've done it way sooner. The previous pill gave me anxiety and depression pretty bad. I wasn't myself it felt like something was controlling me. When I switched to LoLo I went back to my happy self and have absolutely no periods, which I find very convenient. Overall win-win for me! Also, I don't think I have experienced any side effects.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Junel fe February 7 after a 10 week medical abortion. Here's my opinion •It did lighten the after abortion bleeding •I am getting more acne (I'm someone who never gets pimples so this is new)•My anxiety and depression has heightened (I've always had these problems growing up but I'm noticing I'm becoming extremely empathetic & my anxiety, I have become self conscious and more of an introvert.)•I feel like a ticking time bomb (I feel Like I'm going to cry at everything I'm very emotional  which is unlike me. I'm not sure if the birth control is at fault for ALL my emotional breakdowns)•Not change in weight but I am also trying extremely hard to lose weight so I wouldn't say it's harder or easier to lose weight• getting more headaches but usually fixable by taking a Tylenol I look Forward to updating you all on my experience. As a person who doesn't like birth control and has super sensitive hormones this birth control has not been horrible.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this for over 7 months, I’ve had no bleeding since, and have more acne on my face! It did not regulate my period as I was told it would do. I’ve also have been more upset on this birth control. But it has helped keeping cysts away, and prevents me from having horrible PMS symptoms. This birth control pill has its pros and cons.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control the same week a friend of mine did and we both instantly developed severe anxiety. I starting having regular panic attacks again (something that hadn’t happened for 3 years) and couldn’t engage in normal activities. It was unbearable for both of us so we both quit after an exhausting week. Couldn’t eat or sleep. Didn’t even have a sex drive anymore so the point was defeated. If you have any history with depression or anxiety, I advise you to not try this birth control.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Prior to taking this birth control my cycle was TERRIBLE. Throwing up, awful cramps first 5 days, heavy bleeding 7+ days.. I’ve been taking Junel a little under a year now and I love it. My cycle lasts around 3-4 days of super light bleeding and no cramps and no noticeable mood changes or weight gain. Some months I won’t even have bleeding- that’s how light it is! This is one of the many birth controls I have been on that has actually worked for me. Everyone is different and bodies all work differently so don’t rule it out if the reviews scare you!

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this pill for 4 months to help with acne and to regulate my period because it was so heavy and I would get bad cramps. While it did help with the intensity of my period, it did not help with the timing. I would get it during the 2nd or 3rd week of the pill, not during the placebo week. My acne is absolutely insane right now, I just switched pills due to it. It has never been this bad. It is cystic and painful around my jawline and chin area. The amount of topical products that I have bought to try and curb this is overwhelming. My sex drive decreased significantly. Overall, a pill that was not meant for me.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When I first started this pill it was due to spotting off of my period and hormonal changes. I was switched to a higher dose of Microgestion after taking the lower dose for a year or two. On the lower dose, my skin was the clearest it has ever been after a few months but I started getting bad migraines and terrible hot flashes on my period and so my doctor switched me to this form to see if it would help. I've been on this higher dose for probably almost 2 years now and it has gotten so bad, I've gotten the worst headaches I've ever gotten, I started getting acne on my jaw and neck where I never got it so it is solely hormone-related. I wouldn't recommend taking this pill for people starting out on their first birth control. Overall I think it is a really high dose and it might've helped with my spotting off of my period but it made everything else worse like my headaches and acne. Yet again birth control affects every person differently this is just my experience.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have tried so many different types of birth control, and I think I have found the ONE! I think this is it. I actually tried the Microgestin Fe 1.5/30, and it made me gain weight and made me super depressed. Been taking this one for about 2 months now. I've been spotting for a few weeks on and off, and haven't had an actual period which is super nice. The only side effect I noticed is tender, sore breasts, and a bit more bloating. I'm actually able to keep my weight stable by doing  calorie counting daily. Thank God it didn't affect my mood at all either.  So happy with this birth control. Also my bf and I have been having unprotected sex like every weekend and I no pregnancy scares! Hope this review helps ya!

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this birth control pill for about a year, and it caused incredible amounts of nausea for me. My body would attempt to reject it by curbing my eating habits because when I took it without food I would throw up about 5 times every 20-30 minutes in the middle of the night. If I ate something small, such as a banana, I would begin to feel nauseous about 4 hours later. It did help prevent pregnancy, but many times I used back up methods because there were many times I didn’t want to take it because of the vomiting. I also had severe mood swings, mainly resulting in irrational anger. I do consider myself someone who is more prone to anger and mood swings, but never in the way this birth control made them.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had to switch to this birth control because my insurance stopped covering Junel, my doctor told me it was the same thing but it’s not. I’ve been on this for 3 months and I have a headache everyday, moody, bloated and nauseous almost everyday. I stopped taking it because I’d rather not be on any birth control than feel the way I did. Since I’ve been off of it I’ve been feeling better than ever.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill after switching over from Sprintec--I get terrible migraines around my period so my Dr. suggested I go on a pill with less estrogen. I have been on the pill for over 4 months now and I can't stand it, I am finally taking myself off of it. I have not had my period ever since I switched over--I think the estrogen level may be too low in the pill for me, and causing a hormonal imbalance of sorts, because before I was on any pill at all, I was also having trouble getting my period, so I needed something to help induce it. I have not had period, I have been pretty emotionless, my migraines have increased (I previously had them under control -- only 3-4 a month, but now I'm back to 9-12), my libido is gone, I'm tired all day, fall asleep easy, but can't stay asleep, and my skin is dry. I ordered an at-home hormone test to hopefully see if my levels are out-of-whack, but right now, I believe the pill is causing some of these symptoms, and it is best to go off of it.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill almost cost me my relationship with my boyfriend! Horrible mood swings as soon as I started this and was on it for about 2 months. I also started experiencing severe hair loss to the point where I’m almost balding. The moods made me feel super anxious, self conscious, very irritable and felt like crying over everything! I was on Junel for the longest and it worked great. But apparently the pharmacist said they weren’t making it anymore so they switched me to Aurovela. I can't keep on taking this pill and am discontinuing it immediately! And had I seen all of these horrible reviews I never would have started taking it to begin with.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Literally THE WORST birth control. Lost my sex drive, experienced heightened anxiety, depression, weight gain, then weight loss, very bad stomach issues, bloating after every meal, diarrhea often, AWFUL.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I went on this birth control to help regulate my periods, instead I do not have a period at all. I’ve been on it for about a year and haven’t gotten it once, no complaints but makes me question if that’a safe. My skin was clear before I went on it, and now my chin is ruined from acne and scarring, I have to use so many products to help reduce the appearance of the scars. I didn’t gain any weight but my boobs did grow.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Aurovela Fe 1/20 for about 5 months now and never ever have I felt the worst in my life. I have severe insomnia, 24/7 anxiety and depression, suicidal thoughts, and constant UTIs. I just spoke my doctor to prescribe me back to Junel. I'm not myself, and it's time I do something about it. Life is short and I'll do whatever it takes to make the most of it including stop taking any medication that can alter my body. I didn't realize until I read reviews on Aurovela that I also am experiencing weight gain and enlarged breasts (similar to when I was pregnant). It's time to stop taking this medication cold turkey.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Blisovi for over a year and just recently I have decided to switch. This was my first BC so I had no clue what to expect so when I spotted nearly every month, I thought it was normal. After talking with my doctor, she told me it was obviously not, but to give it more time. It never stopped and I have basically had two periods every month for the duration of me taking it (and I take it at the same time every day). As well as spotting, I have terrible mood swings, bad cramps, bloating, and my anxiety has increased. The only positives I have about this BC is that I have no acne and I have not experienced any weight gain.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Blisove 1/20 about a year ago due to a large 5cm cyst that my doctor found. It did shrink over time and typically I don't do well with birth control but this happened to be ok - no severe side effects. After about a year or so I started to get dizziness/lightheadedness daily which I got very concerned about because I couldn't exercise or go for walks and I would feel very off balance. There were often days where I was laying down constantly. I started to take magnesium which seemed to help quite a but but it didn't go away 100%. I went to a neurologist, had a CT scan/MRI etc because no one could tell me answers. It wasn't vertigo. I went to my OB two weeks ago and stopped taking birth control because it was the only thing I hadn't stopped. I have been dizzy free for two weeks and I am hoping this is what the issue was. I had a very rough three months not knowing so I hope this post will help someone who experiences this and doesn't get answers.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started my 13 year old on this for acne ONLY. She completed one pack and her acne is worse than ever! Also, she bleed really heavy for 2 weeks. Im actually glad she doesn't have to go to school right now.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been using this birth control for 6 months and recently switched from the IUD due to getting BV continuously. My anxiety has been worst than it has been in a long time. I sleep so much more now and noticed I was slowly falling into a depression.
