I lost interest in many things and had less patience than I did before. My boobs are so sore and hurt all the time. I’m so glad I wasn’t the only one after reading the reviews I thought it was just me. I would not recommend this birth control to anyone especially if you have a history of anxiety and depression. I’m stopping the pill now that I know the causes to a lot of the side effects I have gotten.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on it a decade. No side effects to note other than irregular bleeding and spotting sometimes. But I never get a heavy period like I did before where I would soak thru super tampons for days. Definitely no weight gain (remained as thin as always). No acne. The only downside is I don’t think there’s a generic version and it’s so expensive if insurance doesn’t cover . No pregnancy or scares.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Lo Loestrin Fe for one year now and it has been ruining my life! My dr prescribed it for me because I was having extremely long and painful periods and bad acne; that’s the only thing this pill has helped with. My periods are no more than 3 days long, cramping comes and goes and I barely have any breakouts. But my sex drive is non existent, I feel horribly anxious and depressed all the time, I genuinely felt/feel like I’m losing my mind. I’ve even considered seeing a psychiatrist! I’m still on it now but I’m seriously considering switching. I hate flip flopping between pills but I want to feel like myself again, and I’m willing to suffer through the periods and breakouts for it

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have recently started this birth control back in December of 2020. I had come on this website to read reviews on what I was getting myself into. From all these reviews I was honestly expecting the worst. So far I have felt little to no side effects. I have felt great this entire time with the exception of slight nausea that went away with rest. I have felt moody but I am like that with or without medication. I started taking it to regulate my period and so far has helped me out great. I like knowing when I am going to start so I can be prepared, rather than it showing up by surprise. This pill has also caused me to lose weight, which I have been a fan of. I also have grown 2 bra sizes in the short months I have been taking this pill. Overall, my experience with Junel Fe has been a positive one, but who's to say it won't change as I continue on with it. I would like to remind you that everyone's body is different so what works for me may not work for you and vice versa.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worst birth control I have ever been on. I have gained 7 lbs, had uncontrollable crying, very irregular periods (early and 2 weeks long), awful acne, and lots of cramping/diarrhea. I really do not recommend this birth control. I’ve been on it about 5 months now.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My skin was COMPLETELY clear and I had very nice skin that I worked very hard for before taking this. I was given Blisovi because my normal birth control was out of stock. I have only been on it 2 weeks and I have HORRIBLE breakouts all over my cheeks, some on forehead. Deep cystic acne and red bumpy acne. I had to go to the dermatologist because at first I couldn't figure out what could possibly be causing this. It came out of nowhere. Nothing else has changed in my life for me to break out this bad - diet, exercise, etc is the same. I hate that I have to get this acne cleared up now all because of something I only took for 2 weeks. Be aware that it can really change your skin!!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 40 years old and was prescribed this medication by my OB. I was hesitant to take this medication after reading these reviews.  However, I have not experienced ANY of the side effects listed in the reviews.  My periods are no longer heavy, they last only a few days, my breasts are no longer tender or hurt during my cycle, and I no longer have painful periods.  The first month I did experience nauseous which almost stopped me from going further.  I sipped a coca-cola to calm my stomach and that subsided the side effect.  I just finished my third month and I feel great. No weight gain and I am no longer bloated.  I hope everyone has the same experience.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Junel FE 1/20 for two years with no issues at all.  My heavy periods were finally light and I rarely got cramps. When COVID hit Walgreens told me that this birth control was on backorder because the manufacturer was changing the formula.  Transferred my script to Giant Eagle because they had a big supply.  November 2020 rolls around and I start having a period in the middle of the pill pack.  It caused me so much anxiety and money because my doctor ordered all these tests to see why I was bleeding.  Was becoming severely depressed with the darkest thoughts I have ever had in my life.  I would cry for days for no reason.  I felt so "out of body."  After three months of on and off bleeding, horrible anxiety and depression and a host of other symptoms my husband made me go off this pill cold turkey.  All my symptoms are now gone and I feel so much better.  This pill should be taken off the market for sure!   Whatever they changed is messing with so many woman.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Junel Fe while on my period. I usually get bad cramps (not debilitating) and feel nauseous, but I can take some Midol and feel better. The first two days of taking it I felt extremely nauseous and actually threw up. My first month my period was totally regular, came during the week it was supposed too. Second month I had some random bleeding for about a week in the middle of my cycle, then I got my an extremely light, 3 day period when I was supposed get it (my week off the pills). Now I'm on my third month, I experienced the random bleeding for a week again (which is more like a period then my actual period) and my actual period is late. I don't mind it at all though besides the irregularity. Cleared my acne a bit, didn't make me gain weight or change my breast size. It also completely got rid of my cramps (and it prevents pregnancy as well). It's my first birth control so I don't really know what to look for.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had my fair share with different brands and types of BC in the course of 12 years. I choose this after completing the implanon of 3 years. I requested a BC with the lowest hormone possible. The first few months were just fine. Took a couple months to adjust to a period pattern but that was about it. ( Periods were regular and light with this pill) Then about months 5 into it things went South.  I stared developing issues I never had before: Extreme Anxiety, low sex drive ( felt like I could live forever without sex) vaginal dryness, excessive hunger, headaches 2-3 times a week and DEPRESSION. I will be discounting this pill but just because it did not work out for me, does not mean it may not work out for you!

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control when I turned 18 last year and it was honestly pretty rough for about 3 months. I cried all the time and was so irritable. I was just not myself for a while. My acne really flared up at first, and after a couple weeks it went back to normal. The mood swings never really went away and I started getting hormonal acne so I switched to a different kind. Didn't get pregnant though.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):No negatives for me, light controlled periods. I felt like myself unlike other birth controls I’ve tried. In the beginning I did feel nausea from taking them but that went away after a few weeks. Other than that it’s been great!

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for nearly 7 years. I never experienced weight gain or extra anxiety & my periods are now very predictable and only last 2 days (though they weren’t very heavy or long lasting in the first place). It has been very long since I started taking them so it’s hard to compare what I was like without them, but I do have vaginal dryness and a low sex drive which I believe is because of the pill.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worst birth control I’ve ever taken. How could this be sold to woman as a form of contraceptive? I was on it for 3 months and experienced terrible nausea, headaches, back pain, cramping. You name it. I was originally taking Junel and had no issues. I am now done taking birth control as my body can not take this anymore.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel Fe for 3 months after taking Larin Fe for 3 months. It depends so much on the person because Larin Fe was really awful for me (amplified anxiety and depression symptoms, increased acne when I was trying to have less acne, extreme increase in discharge). However, taking Larin Fe was really awesome for me personally as I have way less breakouts, no anxiety or depression symptoms, etc. The one thing I will say is that it makes me very nauseous once or twice a month (typically at bed time). Depend on your doctor and your body and not these reviews.

Hailey Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 33 and have been on BCP since I was 16 except for a few months were I chose to get pregnant.... so I have quite a history with BCP. Hailey 1/20 is by far the strangest. My doctor changed my prescription in Dec 2020 from a different brand that was similar (an insurance thing) but with Hailey I haven't had ANY periods aside from spotting for a day or 2. It is really odd because I still get the cramping, bloating and tiredness during the week I'm supposed to have my cycle but, no period.... then of course I start to freak out and run to the pharmacy for a pregnancy test. I've also been more easily agitated/angered which is out of character for me. Although I has been effective at preventing pregnancy, after 2 months I've called my doctor and asked to change my prescription again. I know some women are okay with not having a period but I NEED it, it's my reassurance.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve recently been on this birth-control for about 6 1/2 months. The first three months were of course bleeding or as the doctors would call it breakthrough bleeding. About a month ago I started having anxiety attacks I never experienced having those attacks before. This oncoming week I’ve had three panic attacks I looked up the reviews for this birth-control and come to find out the birth-control is what’s causing my anxiety attacks. My chest was tightened up, my throat felt like it was closing up, and my mind would be racing from the time I woke up to the time I went to sleep. I also am overly emotional about any and everything. Please I beg you, do more research on birth control before you just take them! If you are taking this specific birth-control please stop it only gets worse!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had my third baby back in July 2020 an after six weeks my Dr said she was putting me on a low BC because I have PCOS and ovarian cancer runs on both sides of my family. She didn't want me on a higher dose just in case. But so far I haven't really seen any side affects. I've actually finished things I've started (I have ADD so it's a struggle). I'm on month 7 and my periods are regular an on time, there normal flow not to heavy or light. But everyone's bodies are different so just because it doesn't work with one doesn't mean it won't work for someone else.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this birth control over four years. I discontinued and started with the nuvaring because of how much of a negative impact the lolo had on my mood. I would have mood swings, ranging from anger to depression and suicidal thoughts. What’s even worse is that the hormones in it caused my pH to be off balance so I was constantly either getting a yeast infection or BV EVERY MONTH. It was miserable! After speaking with my gyn she recommended going on nuvaring because it constantly gives you the same amount of estrogen and lessens the chance of you getting an infection because the hormones are constant- versus lolo is always up and down with the hormones. Since switching, I haven’t gotten any more infections, my mood is normal again and I haven’t experienced crazy back pain, cramps, etc like I did with Lolo. I would recommend anyone to try nuvaring or another birth control that ISN’T loestrin.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I tried this for two weeks and had to stop. I noticed the physical side effects such as slight nausea and tender, swollen breasts. I was not imagining the mental ones would be this bad. Since taking this birth-control I literally felt like I was losing my mind. My anxiety went through the roof and I also was thinking more irrationally. I just didn't feel right. Finally I realized it was the birth control and decided to stop. Never again.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on LoLo for at least 3 years. I love this birth control! After having bad experiences with a couple higher dosage pills (severe depression, which I had never had in my life), my doctor recommended this one because of its low hormones. My mood improved drastically, and I experienced no breakouts, nausea, or weight gain. I never get my period, which is a win for me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I thought I was LOSING MY MIND until I saw this! I was diagnosed as clinically depressed and referred to a suicide hotline yesterday, no lie. I’m not suicidal, but I’ve been depressed more depressed than I have ever been in my life the past few months. I’ve become detached, emotionless, and have lost all empathy. I cry all the time and hate being in the same room as myself. I’ve been bleeding for 4 MONTHS and I have no sex drive at all. I didn’t research Junel Fe 1/20 and depression before now because IT WASN’T LISTED AS A SIDE EFFECT. My boyfriend just suggested that I look into the pill as a leave no stone unturned thing, and voila. I’m not crazy. I’m flushing this stuff right now.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Y'ALL!!! So I had the worst experience with BC a few years back and haven't been on one since because I was so scared. I decided to give it another try years later and my doctor prescribed me Taytulla. This BC is a life changer! Completely cleared up my acne, no mental side effects (this was a big one for me), no weight gain. I mean this stuff truly is the best. At the beginning, my periods were VERY irregular but started regulating itself at pack 3. SADLY my insurance doesn't cover it any more so I will be switching but I am SO sad about it and if you are scared to try birth control again like me, this is a good place to start!

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Absolutely LOVE this medication. I had no side affects whatsoever, but anytime my doctor tried to give me a different birth control, I would have horribly long periods.

Necon 0.5/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for about 10 years. I briefly got off it to try the NuvaRing but I bled for weeks and switched back on. I will be honest with you that the first 3 months getting back on I felt depressed and suicidal, but once I realized it was the pills it was easy to keep in check. While on the pill I have no cramps, no mood swings, no acne, nothing. My period is super light (just spotting) and I usually just skip it. I do think I have a bit of vaginal dryness/ lack of lubrication so I am going to try something else but I would happily switch back to this if the new pill doesn't help what I am looking for help with.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe was my very first birth control. I got it because I read it would help with irregular periods and severe cramps. In my first 3 months of using it my periods were super light and I could actually start working again. The cramps were almost nonexistent. However, that all changed on month four: October 2020. I experienced what I call a "severe period." I was throwing up, passing out, and had labor cramps. This was pretty much normal for me before starting birth control, but after October, I decided to start skipping my periods by only taking the active pills. It was fine until December, when I started getting breakthrough bleeding. It started as just a couple days, then another time would be a few days, then it just came every day, along with cramps, and although tolerable, were still painful. It is currently February 9 2021, and I'm switching to another pill. Although Junel Fe cleared my acne, it made me more moody, gain 20lbs, and gave me abnormal breakthrough bleeding.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill Tarina Fe 1/20 for 3 years on, one year off, and another year on. I was so relieved that it didn’t cause weight gain or hair loss for me that I was willing to put up with other terrible side effects. For me personally, anxiety and fear feelings are through the roof after about 6 months of use. It’s like feeling constant nonstop terror. It goes away as soon as I stop taking the pill. Going to the doctor to explore other options. I can’t live like this forever. To say what’s good about it: no pregnancy, no weight gain or sex drive changes, light to no periods

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Blisovi Fe for about 5 months and had to get off of it because of the severe anxiety it caused. It started to feel like I lost control of my emotions and couldn’t help but be anxious and emotional all the time. Except for that I had no other side effects on Blisovi, but I would highly caution anyone taking this birth control as it seems many people face the same issue of anxiety on it.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My NP prescribed this to me after I came to her with complaints of severe PMS. However, this pill has done anything but prevent it. I’m currently in the middle of my second pack on the pill, and I’ve noticed severe changes. My depression before starting my period was bad prior to starting the pill, but the pill has heightened it. I feel so depressed now and also get much more emotional— both angry and sad (crying). The PMS feels like it lasts the entire month. My acne does not seem to be improving, either. My periods are somewhat shorter yet are irregular (it came unexpectedly 2 weeks earlier). Not to mention— I have bad physical PMS, such as headaches, nausea, and more, which I’ve never had before. In my personal opinion, this pill has done me no justice and I will be switching as soon as I can. I want to feel like myself again.

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Minastrin 24 Fe for sometime and then had a severe panic attack which made me decide to no longer take it! It is not worth it for risking your mental health if you deal with anxiety/ depression. I now have panic disorder due to what happened. I don’t recommend it.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Blisovi 24 Fe for the past 5 months to regulate my period. I have no complaints, my period has regulated. I have not experienced any side effects. I have no problems with this pill!

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control Alyacen 1/35 going on 5 years now. It has never caused me problems. No side effects. It regulated my periods, made my cramps less painful, and has done its job as far preventing pregnancy. I don't even take it at the exact same time every day and it still works.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I never write reviews for anything, but I felt like I needed to write a review for this, to help others make the decision to STOP taking this birth control (and BC in general).  While on this BC I experienced mood swings, anxiety, weight gain, migraines, dizziness, nausea, acne flare ups, and I even fainted while on this and ended up in the ER.  So I decided to stop taking this BC, and after stopping it (it's been 7 months off it now), I still don't have a regular cycle (I have not had my period in 2 months). I developed pill-induced PCOS. BC pills stop ovarian function & the bleeding you get every month on BC is NOT a real menstrual cycle.  BC stops ovulation, so when you come off the pill, you body sometimes takes a while to ovulate on its own again.  I really hope this post was able to educate those who did not know how bad birth control is for your body.  Please do yourself a favor and don't take this!
Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I gained a few pounds and I've been on my period for 3 weeks non stop

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After only being on this BC Aurovela Fe 1/20 for almost 2 months, I just found out I have a blood clot in my lung. At 27 & a mom of 5, I could have passed away in the blink of an eye. I’m in otherwise healthy condition & the only medication I’m currently taking was the bc. I wasn’t warned of this side effect and now I possibly have to spend the rest of my life on blood thinners. Please look for natural ways of BC. This stuff isn’t made for our bodies.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was taking Lo Loestrin Fe for just over 4 years. I had some positive and some negative side effects while on this medication.I usually have quite extreme PMS related dips in mood which were dulled while taking this medication. I didn't get a period at all while on LoLo which was nice. I experienced quite a bit of weight gain but it could be related to other factors. I stopped taking this medication recently after developing a blood clot in my leg. I did have varicose veins prior to taking the medication which is also a risk factor but taking hormone could have contributed to the blood clot developing.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If I could give this a -10/10 I would. I started 12 days ago and let me share my side effects that scared my ob/gyn: migraines, leg aches, hot flashes, NONEXISTENT libido, acne covering my entire face that we aren’t sure if it was acne or a reaction. Now for the mood swings- jeez I know my mood swings on my cycle but the complete and utter rage I felt from common everyday things (like if my sleeve cuffed up or something) I have never experienced anything like that while on this BC. It scared me because I didn’t know why I was getting so angry and I couldn’t calm myself down. I’m diagnosed with anxiety and depression, but it’s very very managed. I called my doc’s on call breaking down to have them prescribe anti anxiety meds and when I went in for an appointment to switch off this BC I scored a 20 out of 21 on the depression diagnostic test...a 10-12 point spike just while being on this medication. If you have mental health diagnoses DO NOT go on this brand of birth control.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Caused severe, debilitating migraines within 3 days of starting it. I tried to wait it out for 2 weeks but it kept getting worse. My doctor took my off of it. If you are experiencing migraines, please don’t suffer through it and discontinue usage, as it could have long-term effects on your health too. I stopped taking birth control after this and switched to condoms. Happy to feel like myself again. I had switched to Lo Loestrin from Larin Fe, that I had taken for a year. Larin Fe was good but caused me dryness, which is why I tried Lo Loestrin.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I like the fact that it was effective as birth control and I had no period while I was on it. I also had TERRIBLE back acne. Immediately starting Taytulla it went away. There were a few bad side affects. I was waking up nearly every day with horrible headaches. I RARELY wanted to have sex with my with my fiancé (like sex once a month IF that), and I was angry often. After awhile it dawned on me that maybe the lack of sex, headaches, and mood swings may be due to this pill. I wasn’t sure but with the okay from my husband I decided to stop taking it. Almost immediately after stopping I noticed I stopped waking up with headaches, I had sex with my husband 3 times that week, and I felt happier. Long story short, if you’re single and just looking to cure acne or have lighter periods then it might be for you. It didn’t have any awful side affects on me such as blood clots, hair loss, weight gain, or suicidal thoughts. But it had enough negative effects to be irritating

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this birth control for a month now and I’ve been having hot flashes and bad headaches that will not go away it made me cramp badly when I first started taking them ! I honestly feel like it’s time for me to stop them

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Lo Loestrin Fe was definitely not for me. I took Lolo for a little over 3 months, in which I felt nauseous almost every day, felt bloated, and lost my appetite. My acne also got a little worse. It also affected my mental health. I was way more anxious and felt down much more often than before. Sometimes it got to the point where I couldn’t get out of bed in the morning because I felt so anxious. Also, I don’t know if this is just a coincidence or not because I haven’t heard of anyone else experiencing this, but I think lolo may have also given me more canker sores. I went from getting like one every few months to having up to 8 in my mouth at a time. Not fun. After stopping lolo, I’ve noticed most of these symptoms have gone away. My appetite has come back, I am no longer nauseous, and my canker sores have gone away. I would say one of the few benefits to lolo is that I never got my period while I was on it.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve noticed a lot of comments, saying not to take it, but I feel that a lot of people don’t understand that birth control effects each person differently no matter which birth control you take. So, if you are new to any birth control do not let these comments discourage you. Listen to your body and your doctor. Personally I love this birth control and it has made my skin clear, periods lighter, no weight gain and no noticeable mental changes. But, it could always be different for the next person. If your doctor is prescribing you Junel fe, take it and try it out, if its not good for you than there are other options.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Blisovi for 4 months after previously taking a different pill for 3.5 years. I switched because my old pill was not strong enough hormonally and I would have periods that lasted over 3 months while taking that pill (no exaggeration). While Blisovi finally stopped my constant break-through bleeding, it has given me more side effects than anything I've ever taken before. The biggest issue is that I am allergic and began getting quarter-sized hives all over my body that have not gone away until I stopped the medication. My skin became extremely oily and now I have more acne than I did before starting birth control 3 years ago. I have awful mood swings and my anxiety is the worst it has been in 4 years. I had none of these problems on my old birth control. I now have to search for a THIRD birth control pill because the side effects of Blisovi are almost as bad as my vomit-inducing 10 day period that I get without BC.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched to Junel fe because I was spotting heavily in between my periods on my old prescription. I pretty much had a period all month long! On Junel fe, I had MINOR spotting when I started taking the pack, and now I have none! I have zero of the side effects discussed on here by other women. I have seen no weight gain but I am on a 1300 calorie diet, so that may be why. I love this prescription, it’s definitely worth the switch!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started the pill over 5 months ago. I dealt with very long (3 month) heavy periods. My doctor prescribe this birth control and at first it was amazing my cycles went normal etc. Then on 4th 5th month I started having headaches, emotional, then very bad chest pains at night when I laid in bed it felt like my heart was in pain. I started breaking out in hives at night. It was a total nightmare. I will not be taking these pills ever again!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I recommend trying something else. I’ve read many reviews and talked to many other women who have tried Junel Fe. I do not have a history of depression but within the first month, I was severely depressed. I could not stop crying for days. I made it through the first month but it was very hard. I almost felt like a zombie, constantly being dismal. Not to mention, I experienced all of the side effects on the list and more. It was honestly miserable. If you are prescribed this by your doctor, please do some further research before you take it. I do not think it’s for everyone.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this medication almost 2 months ago to help with hormonal acne.  While it has helped some with the hormonal acne...   My periods before now were always on time, light and about 5 days long.  NOW I am getting a HEAVY period every 6-9 days.  This pill is GARBAGE.  I would rather have the hormonal acne.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this BC. I take it the same time every day and I haven't had any problems. It made my periods lighter and has been effective. I can't believe all the bad reviews because I have tried so many other with bad outcomes and switched to this one and it was the answer to my prayers!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was originally prescribed Junel Fe 1/20 birth control due to my very painful cramps, bleeding, and after finding out I have anemia. The first month there was spotting for a couple of weeks, but then it went away. The cramps and bleeding definitely got better. This felt like a relief and I thought I was on track to making my life better. Unfortunately, halfway through my 5th month, I decided to stop taking these pills. I was experiencing very severe anxiety and depression. I normally am a pretty anxious person but I typically deal with it in my own ways. However, this was the worst of my life. I felt suicidal. I was worried about everything. I had a panic attack. I couldn't sleep well. My family and co-workers were noticing a change in my behavior and mood. It wasn't good. After I stopped taking them, a few days later I noticed I felt a lot more level-headed and less anxious. I really hope that others don't have to go through what I went through. I'm hoping this review might help someone out there.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my first month on this pill to control fibriods. The doctor prescribed this because the previous pills were giving me long and very painful periods and tons of bleeding. Well, last night I wake up with nausea, I got my period one week in advance, I'm having heavy bleeding, and strange headaches. I will stop this pill immediately. Last month without any pills I had a normal period. These pills are a mess.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this pill for 2 months and I couldn’t regret it more. I’ve bled for over half of the month since I started, sometimes with no break between the spotting and my actual period. My anxiety has gotten significantly worse. I’ve experience migraines which is something completely new to me. Rather than cramping for a few days like I normally would, I would cramp for weeks when I was spotting and on my actual period. This pill was a very bad option for me. My sister had a similar experience with this birth control but my doctor decided to put me on it despite that and it was a huge mistake.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Honestly the worst birth control I’ve been on. This is the third birth control I’ve tried, and I get two periods per month with cramps and heavy bleeding on one. I’m also SUPER hormonal—more than I ever was with just my regular period. I am depressed and super irritable and tired and hungry. Would not recommend.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this birth control for about 4 months now. I was on Ortho Tri-Cyclen for about 7 months. Mood swings, acne, bloating, anxiety you name it. I was advised to switch it a lower estrogen birth control and that’s when I started Junel Fe 1/20. I’ve had ultra light to no periods and my mood swings, bloating, anxiety GONE! I’ve had the best experience with this birth control. I’ve been on the IUD twice and nothing has been as good as this brand of birth control. I’ll get a cyst on my chin around the time I’m suppose to get my period but other than that everything has been great. I take my pill before bedtime.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill back in September to regulate my period. I seem to have more cons than pros when it comes to this BC. I have definitely experienced depression and mood swings while taking it, during my placebo week I feel the best I possibly can be. Just whenever I’m taking the pill, I find myself never in a good mood. I also never experienced cramping until I started taking these pills. I’m definitely considering switching my BC or coming off of it completely because I’m sick of not feeling like myself.

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My experience with Minastrin 24 Fe pill was horrible. I could barely sleep due to very bad headaches, it made me more anxious and I had several panic attacks. My boyfriend said that I was like two different people because the mood swings were really bad and I could go from depressed and sad to really happy and then angry for no reason. I tried it only 2 months.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've only been taking Junel Fe 1/20 for 2 months now (I have my 3rd month but I don't know if I'm going to take it.) I get my prescription online through a service, and the only reason I switched to Junel Fe was because I had to renew my subscription and they didn't pick back up where I left off. I figured I'd give it a few months and see what happened. I mostly take birth control to help with my ovarian cysts and regulation. I immediately noticed with this medication that I have a lot more pain and cramps. It also did not regulate my period, as I have missed it since I've been taking this medication. I also struggle with anxiety and it not only doubled it, but has made me feel extremely depressed. Also, I have relatively clear skin, but I've been having acne breakouts since starting. I already messaged my doctor to see about changing.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Never realized until I got off of Aurovela that it had caused my severe depression (which I never had before). It also caused me to intensly dislike my boyfriend. I had no sex drive, and sex actually felt like a chore and just made me angry. Do not take Aurovela, it will change your life in the worst way possible.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After being on Junel FE 1/20 for forever I had to switch pharmacies. The new pharmacy gave me Aurovela (which is supposed to be an appropriate substitute) without even consulting me. DO NOT let them make this switch on you if you already have issues with anxiety and depression!!!

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the 3rd time I have attempted to take birth control. I have severe ovulation issues and my DR thought trying a low dose pill would help. Aurovela Fe is absolutely awful. I’m on my 2nd month, week 2 of the pack and I’ve never experienced anxiety and mood swings this severely in my life! Sobbing crying, even having emotional breakdowns. I have GI issues already, and this pill has made them even worse. And the breast tenderness?! I thought they just hurt, but my significant other even mentioned how much larger they looked. Oh, and the bloating is also severe, like really bad. I’m 31 and I’ve never felt like my life was spiraling out of control, until I started taking this.I’m not even giving it a chance to level out. Will be stopping cold turkey. If I could give this zero stars...I would give it a negative 5.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this Loestrin 24 Fe pill for about 3 months now and all I have to say is I love that I don't get my periods as heavy anymore. I haven't noticed any changes in my acne it's still as bad as before, yet if anything it only makes me break out on my jawline. I guess you can say the only thing I'm scared about is having unprotected sex. The only side effects I've noticed are extreme nausea, I can't sleep and I've been excessively eating. This only happened around the 1st month the only thing that has continued is the nausea. This is my first time on birth control and my experience is okay.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been using Tarina Fe for just over 4 months now, and I'm pretty happy with the results! I started taking it because I was having irregular periods and I was also having some intense period cramps . My cycles have been super regular since starting Tarina, and I have been getting basically zero cramps. I've also noticed my periods are significantly shorter, they only last 2-3 days.I've only had a few side effects since starting this, and they really only lasted the first 2 months. I had some noticeable bleeding the second week of my first pack, but  and I haven't experienced any spotting since then. I also had some nausea during the first two packs, but I started taking my pill with a snack, which really helped, and by the third pack I wasn't feeling nauseous anymore. I haven't experienced any weight gain, acne, or mood changes while taking Tarina. Overall, in terms of regulating my cycle, improving cramps, and as a birth control, it's been working great!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible! I was on Larin Fe 1/20 a few years ago and forgot what it was like, so went on it again because I can’t find a birth control I like. Made me gain weight! Every month the scale started to climb for no reason, I then increased workouts and starting counting calories and nothing changed. Also have me severe breast pain...I literally had to ice them.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this birth control because I was bleeding when I was not suppose to be. I was on Junel Fe before switching to a higher dose of estrogen. At first, I loved it never had any issues. Period was regular and overall was good for me in the beginning. I have just hit a year on being on Junel Fe 1.5/30, and the past few months I had noticed when I start my new packs of birth control after my period week, I am an emotional wreck. The tiniest thing would set me off and I would be in tears and then 10 mins later I wouldn’t even understand why I was crying. Also it would make my mood swings intense getting back on it from my period week. I also feel as if my sex drive has decreased, could just be the time of the month but who knows. I personally think it is too much estrogen being put into my body once a start a new pack and then when I start my period I am like going cold turkey with no estrogen besides what is already inside my body.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill less than a week ago after my pharmacy did not have my normal Loestrin and I already have so many bad side effect symptoms. I have about 5 cystic acne pimples on my forehead, when my skin was 100% clear before taking this pill. My cramps are so bad and I am not even close to starting my period. I can not stop eating all the time I am always hungry and bloated. My mood swings are terrible and I have never struggled with depression and anxiety and it has been so bad. It has not even been a week! I am stopping this pill immediately after reading reviews and realizing that this pill is having the same effects on other people.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel 1.5/30 is the second birth control brand that I’ve taken. I switched to it because I had a constant period for 2 months on the last brand. I’m just now finishing my 3rd pack of Junel and was shocked to see all of the bad reviews. Since I’ve only been on birth control for 6 months, I didn’t notice big changes until now. I have naturally thick hair and I have noticed that I have been losing a lot more than usual. I can run my fingers through my hair and several strands will come out. My skin is pretty clear for the most part, just a few pimples here and there but nothing major. My boobs haven’t gotten any bigger sadly lol or I haven’t gained much weight. In the day I have no appetite but am starving before bed. Sometimes I can only eat a few bites and then I feel sick. Also, I am more irritable and stressed, but that could be due to other problems. I don’t think I’ve been on it long enough to notice major changes but this is my experience so far.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this Aurovela Fe 1/20 birth control the beginning of November and it was fine until like December 20 something, I wasn’t able to sleep, had major headaches, started to feel really down and think so negatively and have random breakdowns multiple times a day just crying and been having to sleep with my mom to keep me comfort. I am just now stopping this pill hoping it helps and just to take care of my mental health by exercising, keeping up with my skin care because it caused a lot of breakout and focus on my relationships with others. Please don’t get this birth control! It really changed my life and made me a different person I’m not the happy person I once was but hoping to get back to it.

Aurovela 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been on Junel 24 Fe for about a year and it had worked great for me. About two months ago, my pharmacy switched me to Aurovela 24 Fe. I have been experiencing cramping throughout my entire cycle, horrible mood swings, and hardly any sex drive. The only thing it has done correctly is prevent pregnancy as I take it every night at the same time as directed. I hope to be getting  back on Junel asap!

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on microgestin for 10 months in 2020. Prior to the pill I had a daughter in 2015, had gained 45 lbs, and had zero sex drive. When I first started the pill I did bleed for almost a whole month, but my hormonal acne (that I had suffered with for 5 years) vanished, I lost 50 lbs, my sex drive returned and I felt great. I am only off now to try for baby #2 and because I'm about to be 35 and shouldn't really be using hormonal contraceptives.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Reading the reviews on Junel 1/20 before I started did put some anxiety into me but personally speaking I’m having a pretty good experience with it. For the first 3 months I did experience some breakthrough bleeding but this was expected as my body was adjusting to the hormones and after that everything has been great. My periods are lighter and shorter, I didn’t go through mood swings, no weight gain, no vaginal dryness, no acne and (I’m not as active anymore) but no pregnancy as well. So pretty much whatever negative side effects there could have been, I thankfully didn’t get any.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Around the 2-3 month mark I started having terrible migraines almost daily. I didn’t know what it was because I drink lots of water and get good sleep and then I checked the reviews of Hailey Fe and found out this is a common side effect. It’s now my 3rd day off this brand and no more migraines!!! Although I didn’t get pregnant on this pill, I couldn’t bear this side effect. Stay away!!!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I do not recommend this birth control at all. I was only able to take it for 6 days and I'd felt some changes leading up to the last day I took it. Nausea, bad headaches, eye aches, extreme moodiness, heart palpitations, dizziness, crying for no reason, I woke up in a bad mood and by the 6th day I had had enough. I switched back to my old birth control (I took junel only because I had a zero co-pay prescription) and I will GLADLY pay 30 dollars for it over this. Every side effect was gone the day after I stopped taking it.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor put me on the Taytulla pill at age 45 to alleviate heavy periods. This pill has caused me to gain 80 pounds over the course of three years. I was constantly bloated and had puffy face. I eat clean and run 3-6 miles every day. As long as I took this pill, getting the weight off was impossible. Since stopping Taytulla couple months ago, I feel so much better and the weight is starting to come off. Please do not take this pill!!

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Have been taking Pirmella 1/35 for at least six months. Keep in mind I've tried Cyclafem 1/35 for an entire year, gained 25-30lbs and stopped after 3 months because of weight gain, and switched because 1 year later, both hormones interacted and I bled heavily for 3 weeks.I've also tried Alyacen and my body didn't LIKE it. Hormones affected my moods terribly, pharmacy switched it without telling me. These are the same generics of each other if this extra information helps.Pirmella did well for me. Because I've already had Cyclafem, it was good. No weight gain, nothing. BUT I'd get depressive and insecure before and during every period. I was breakthrough bleeding or having med-light periods every 1-2 weeks while trying to skip pills for my Pelvic Congestion Syndrome.So.. now I'm heading towards Nortrel. Hope it works similar or better. Scared of the weight gain.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this Larin Fe 1/20 birth control for a full year. The first 6 months were a roller coaster. I had random bleeding, mood swings, and I was depressed. I did not feel like myself. My OBGYN did tell me that for the first 6 months your body will need to adjust, so I was prepared. I kept asking myself when is this gonna end??? I actually got on a great routine with it (after the 6 months) and all of the above stopped. I did notice when I didn't take it at the same time for days in a row, I had random bleeding. The only thing is that my sex drive has plummeted and this is so awful. I have come to the point where I don't even want to do it anymore, and I have never been like that. I think after my last refill (this month) I am going off of it. But, in the end, it did do what it needed to. Be safe and do what is best for you. <3

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If it weren't the light menstrual cycle, I would give this 1 star. If you have pre-existing mental health issues, I do NOT recommend this birth control brand or check in with a professional while doing so. I was the most suicidal I'd been in years and was constantly anxious until I practiced exercises to regulate my breathing. I noticed my discharge was a lot heavier so watch out for that, too. Overall, BC brands affect everyone differently but please talk to a doctor about your mental health issues if you have been prescribed this brand. Unfortunately, I was prescribed Larin-Fe during the COVID-19 pandemic and communication was not as accessible.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe 1/20 was worst experience ever! First I became anxious and depressed and had no sex drive. My primary put me on anxiety medication. Then I gained so much weight that was never like me especially while dieting, then night sweats... the last straw was when I bled for a month straight... I wish I had looked up the reviews for this sooner because I would have stopped this way sooner.
Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Im 32yrs old and I’ve had zero negative side effects I’ve been on it 4 months my cycle is way lighter with less cramping

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Loestrin Fe for almost 6 years and regret ever going off of it. I never had one period, not one scare either. My skin got super clear and I only gained about 5 lbs over the course of the entire 6 years. My anxiety almost completely disappeared and now it's back horribly. I went to get my script refilled with my yearly and unfortunately my BP is to high to prescribe the same pill. I'm trying a different one for a month of two but praying my bp goes down so I can go back on it. A little more info I am mkd 30s and have a almost 6 year old child

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor and I decided to switch me over to Taytulla from my other lower dose pill in hope to lessen my periods as they were still heavy with being on the other pill for 7 months. I am a runner so this part was pretty important to me so I was not too worried when my dosage of estogren was increased. I started this pill in March and with no change in diet and exercise, I went from 105 lbs to 125 by July. This was extremely hard on my mental health as I did not know what I was doing wrong as I was still running significantly everyday and eating considerably healthy. After switching to a different pill finally in August, it is January now and I have since lost all of the weight off with again, doing nothing different with my diet and exercise. Would not recommend.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Ok, so I’ve been on blisovi fe for about a year and some change now. Never experienced so much anxiety in my life. Every day I would wake up anxious, stomach issues, etc. I finally came to the realization I’m not the only one who has felt this. I stopped a few days ago and I’m feeling mentally better. I didn’t experience any weight gain, nausea, acne or anything other anxiety. This bc may not be right for everyone. I would have stayed on if it wasn’t for the increase anxiety.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started on this Junel 1/20 birth control about 6 months ago and thought that it was great. I initially felt pretty good, no depression, it cleared up my skin, and I didn’t gain any insane amount of weight. I’ve gained maybe 5 pounds at worst. The first 2 months my periods were lighter and starting to get more regular. The next month I didn’t get my period. The following month I got it. Then last month I just got a brown spotting discharge. We use condoms and are very safe to pull out but the not so regular periods make my anxiety sky rocket. Which brought me to realize just how much this medication has increased my anxiety. I get anxious and my heart rate goes up about silly things like driving, eating, sleeping, and being home alone. Also Junel 1/20 has recently made me boobs grow a little bit. Overall it works pretty good for me. The only thing I worry about is my irregular periods and the anxiety I get. I hope in the future my periods get regular or I might switch to a different pill.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Update from my post on July 26,2020. I am now 7 months in with the Junel Fe 1.5/30 pill. Haven’t experienced any bad symptoms yet other than the first few weeks on the pill sometimes I would wake up feeling very nauseous. Other than that haven’t had anything negative other than this pill makes my periods really irregular so I never know when it is starting. Because of that I’ve missed my period 2 times and freaked out and took pregnancy test that both came out negative. Right now I’m 2 weeks late but I’m not worried because ever since I’ve been on the pill it’s always been late. So far this pill hasn’t changed my mood, hasn’t made me depressed, I’ve gained a little weight but that might just be quarantine wait since I don’t walk a lot everyday. My sexual drive decreased a lil but I have a high sexual drive so it just turned it normal lol, and no bad acne. Like I said before each pill is different for everyone :)

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill cured my acne and greasy hair issues. It lightened my periods and cramps. It did not affect my libido BUT it did cause extreme vaginal dryness making sex impossible. At 19 years old you should not have to use lube. It's a good pill for younger people with acne issues or heavy periods.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill was good in the beginning but after a few months I no longer got my period at all. Some may like this but I however prefer to feel like my body functions. My acne began to came back after 6 months and I have 0 sex drive which destroyed my relationship. Even with foreplay sex was painful and disinteresting. (For reference we'd once had a very frequent healthy sex life). Any combination pill is likely to kill your sex drive so if you don't have acne I'd recommend a progesterone only pill.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My emotions are everywhere & through the roof. My period still isn’t regulated & that was the whole reason I started taking BC. The 2nd month when I started my period, I encountered horrible acne problems. It made me feel like I gained 100lbs. Though I was alright with my period popping by for 4/7 regular period days. Month 3 happens, I still have horrible acne. It won’t clear up and this time my period last 8 days long. I also still feel like I’ve gained 100lbs. Now I’m in month 4, I started my period already way before it was supposed to. My last one ended 12/23/20 and started back up on 01/02/21. Now I’m still on it & it won’t stop. 2 weeks of being on a period is ridiculous. I’m drained. I feel sick all the time. My back aches. My head hurts constantly. I don’t know what to do anymore & I really just want my period to stop because my doctor will not see me while I’m still on my period. I just feel defeated.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this pill since late May and now it its mid January. It has been great until last month when I started experiencing mild depression. I am switching birth control, but for someone who is just starting to use birth control I will highly recommend. This is my first birth control and I loved it. Don't be scared to try it since you can easily switch to a different one if this doesn't work out. I did gain a little weight, but my skin is clear and very light periods.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I understand that everyone has different experiences with birth control but I had some pros and cons. First off I started my Blisovi Fe 1/20 pill in October so this would make it my 3rd month on it and so they say it takes 3 months for birth control to start working. Here are my Pros : it kept my period on track. I knew when I was going to get it. Before I started I would have heavy and long periods with blisovi it kept it light and short. As well as my cramps they weren’t super painful as before. Cons: I’ve had anxiety for about 2 years and this pill has really took a toll on my mental health. I’ve had crazy panic attacks. My anxiety was super high. I felt like I was going into this stage where I wasn’t able to control my emotions at some point. I felt super depressed because of the way I was feeling I wouldn’t get out of bed and was sad because this wasn’t who I was. I think if you have any emotional issues this won’t be the pill for you.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It gave me a high sex drive, bad chin acne, depression, yeast infection and I feel like I got skinnier so that I didn't gain weight I feel like I lost weight.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started Lo Loestrin Fe January 3rd, was fine the first week, no weight gain or anything- until the second week. Started my period during active pills, cramping like nobodies business, medium flow, nausea worsened than normal periods. Everyone said stick it out but my mood has been decreased significantly as well, changing to a different one Sunday.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill to try and lighten my period and regulate my cramps as well as prevent pregnancy as I am in college. I was previously on accutane but have had clear skin for the past four years. The first month on this pill my hormonal cystic acne was HORRIBLE. It also made me extremely nauseous the first month. The last three months have contained consistent headaches, horrible cramps, constant breakthrough bleeding, terribly swollen and sore boobs, and bloating. The only upside of this pill is that I didn't gain any weight and my period is only 1-2 days long and is more like spotting. I did miss it the first month though.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Honestly, terrible side effects. I gained a LOT of weight and I feel like it affected my mental health in a negative way.
Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been off it now for 6 months and can say that this because literally caused my depression 0/10

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the worst experience with birth control I have ever had. It has made extremely emotional and depressed. I did notice myself, but it was made even more clear to me by those around me. Out of now where I’d have panic attacks and even emotional outburst, I’m emotional but this was to another level and extreme. I simply just cannot recommend this to anyone and I regret taking it myself. I will be switching birth controls within this month. One I will recommend is YAZ it was good but for someone who is small like myself maybe not so much because it has water retention

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Personally, I had an okay experience with Lolo. I was on it for a couple of months. During these few months, I had gained 15-20pounds, got stretch marks around my thighs and breasts, and my boobs went from C’s to DD’s. I was very unhappy with this weight change because it was extremely drastic. I had my period only a couple of times and when I did, it was so short and light that it was as though it was never even there, which was amazing. My mood swings were the same, no change. I have been off the pills for over a year now, still haven’t been able to lose this weight or lower my cup size. I may not have given my body the ability to regulate itself to the hormones, but I really didn’t want it to get any worse than it was. I’m currently trying new birth control pills, which unfortunately have a higher dose of estrogen, but weight gain isn’t a popular side effect.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took the Junel Fe 1/20 pill for 3 months to regulate my periods and hormone levels. During that time I lost about 12 lbs. When I stopped after 3 month hoping to conceive, I never got a period! So I waiting another month, but still nothing with negative pregnancy results. This is when my stomach started getting real bloated. I mean I looked 6 months pregnant. I'm so uncomfortable. I immediately gained 5 lbs. So I just went back on it and a week into resuming all bloating went away. Now this pill did not regulate my periods....

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill made my life a nightmare! Extreme vaginal dryness, urinary problem and pain in my ovaries at 23 years old. I can't have sex anymore my vagina feels like it will tear apart.I do not recommend.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Lolo for about 7 months. Initially I was put off by all the bad reviews but because of my failed experience with the higher dosed birth control pills, I still gave it a go. Yes, I did break out a lot in the first month. Yes, my mood swings were out of control. No, I did not gain any weight, if anything I'm finding that this medicine is helping me keep my weight more stable. After 7 months  passed, I still have no weight gain, my skin cleared up so much after the first 2 months (other than the occasional pimple when my EXTREMELY light period comes), my overall mood has been elevated. Before LoLo, I had terrible mood swings and bouts of depression and sadness. Lolo has helped me regulate my hormones all together. Ladies remember, people will often times leave a bad review over a good one. I wanted to give up on my birth control because of how bad it made me feel at first, but I’m so happy I stuck it through and found a pill I absolutely LOVE.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was always on Junel or microgestin and I'm really nervous taking this new birth control Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 for the first time. I loved Junel, barely any bleeding, and mild cramps. I hope I don't have anxiety more than I do now taking this pill. I really hope I get my Junel back or have the same experience as Junel. Wish me luck

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I see a lot of these reviews sharing depression and anxiety symptoms. I have never been a person to say I struggle with those and for the most part throughout the 5 months being on it, I didn't notice anything. But looking back on it, I definitely see the correlations. It would come to me in spurts though, the sadness wasn't throughout my whole experience. But I noticed I was sad about things that I had already gotten over/accepted previously which was odd. Anyway my BIGGEST concern is the ACNE it causes. IF YOU HAVE FOR THE MOST PART CLEAR SKIN DO NOT TAKE THIS. It will ruin your skin so badly. I stopped the pill because of this. Never in my life had I had acne so badly, and within just 5 months. Also my breasts are huge and so sore, had to get new bras. Got fitted, went from an A to a borderline C they said. Never in my life..that was so crazy. Either way the acne was so bad I couldn't stand it. Not even for bigger boobs...

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Please proceed with caution if your doctor recommends this drug. I did not have a good experience. I do think that my issues might have occurred with any low-estrogen BC pill, but I really wish I hadn't tried it. I only took Junel for about 3 months before I decided it wasn't worth it anymore. About 2 weeks after starting the pill, I got a UTI. From that day on, I was on a roller coaster of back to back UTIs, BV, and yeast. UTI, BV, yeast. I've spent hundreds of dollars on medication and doctor's appointments to fix these issues, and my body still isn't right. PLEASE don't take this pill without considering the potential effects on the bladder, urinary tract, and vaginal tissue. I had no mood changes, no weight gain, and no loss of sex drive, but these were minor pros compared to the cons. I was also having two periods/month - one heavy one in the middle of the active pills, and one during the placebo week (withdrawal bleeding, I'm guessing). Please be careful!

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I didn’t have a great time on this pill. While it made my cramps subside, it did not regulate my period. however, i was only on it for a month and a half because the mental side effects were unbearable. I experienced crippling anxiety and heightened depression. I had no physical side affects aside from occasional mild headaches.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill over two years ago because every other pill causes my blood pressure to skyrocket. My blood pressure medicine was quadrupled, but has (mostly) managed my bp while on this medicine.  I am extremely depressed & at times borderline suicidal on this pill.  I have PMDD & it has gotten much, much worse on this pill. Anxiety is through the roof, I have gained weight (5-7 lbs I just can't get off & I go to the gym and run half marathons regularly). I don't sleep. I feel myself being a crazy, moody human but can't stop myself. I wonder what on earth is wrong with me & then realized it's this pill.  In two weeks I am getting an IUD & I can't wait to not have to deal with awful side effects. As far as preventing pregnancy, it is a 10. I have never had a pregnancy scare. My periods are erratic, my cramps are at times off the charts & nothing makes them better. I've never had a problem with either. Dear western medicine: women deserve better than this to prevent pregnancy.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this Junel Fe for almost 4 years, I had a 6 month gap after 2 years and boy was my life way better back then. I was definitely more motivated to do things. This pill makes me a depressed girl with vag problems. I get yeast infections more than I should, I barely eat any food that it’s becoming extremely unhealthy, I cry so much. My sex drive is extremely low. My symptoms of feeling sad and constant need to pee and reoccurring yeast infections. My periods are SO irregular it’s really annoying not knowing when I’ll get it. I lost a lot of weight and when I informed my obgyn she told me that’s not something I should be complaining about. Always looking at the cup half empty. This Junel Fe is definitely not worth all the side affects and complications in the long run. I honestly thought it was my mental health. But it wasn’t. Because that 6 month gap between stopping it and going back on it, was the happiest 6 months of my life. Avoid this birth control.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to this birth control after being on Lo Loestrin Fe for about 6 months because of insurance reasons. My period is extremely inconsistent on this birth control, where as on loestrin I would always get at least a light period. I like to get my period so I know I’m not pregnant, but I only get it every couple of months now. Also I will randomly spot bleed even if I haven’t missed my birth control, and I get very nauseas for weeks at a time. This nausea will go away for a couple weeks, and then come back. I have taken multiple pregnancy tests when I miss my period because of this and my symptoms, but it turns out it’s just from the birth control. This birth control isn’t horrible and doesn’t affect my mood, but physically it’s annoying.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel Fe 24 birth control for almost 2 years now. Ive have had no issues with it. Before I started my periods were irregular and nothing made sense. My doctor took my off my old birth control and started me on this one and I've never had any issues with it. I have gained some weight but I've been at a steady weight for a little over a year now. I recommend it but yet again everyone's body is different.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wish I would have read these reviews to spare myself the heartache that this drug caused me. The first few months I was constantly cramping but I was convinced my body was simply adjusting to a new hormonal birth control. About 7 months in, I started convincing myself that people didn’t like me. About 9 months in, I started having full blown depressive episodes. I have never experienced anything like it. I am very self aware and generally in a good mood, I recognized almost immediately that it had to be due to my period as it came approximately a week and a half before my period. I felt empty. I stopped doing things I enjoyed, I wanted to cry over everything (and I have thick-skin), I was having severe anxiety attacks. It was awful and I feel sorry for myself that I ever had to experience such whole-hearted sadness when it could have been avoided by not taking this drug. I am one month off of it and I feel myself getting back to normal. Spare yourself and don’t take this.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):this birth control *destroyed* me. I have never been hormonal or emotional to literally everything before. I have been on this for about 6 months and in those six months my urge to have sex has completely diminished, I cry at everything, I’m angry all the time, etc. I seriously would stay away from this pill as long as you live. I’m having to go off of it because it’s ruining my relationship. Seriously stay away from this pill, if I could go lower than 1 star I would

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I would not recommend this BC. I was on microgestin & absolutely loved it. This not so much. It broke my face out so bad. (I’ve never had acne, so I’m not sure if this is normal or not)... I could literally feel the pimples come out on my face. It burned so bad that I had to put ice on it. It makes me cramp so bad. Last month, I cramped so bad that I thought I was having a miscarriage. I was literally in tears. An hour later I was bleeding & was only on the beginning of week 3 pills. Today, it has me so crampy & sick feeling. I’m done with this brand.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this for 2ish years. I don’t know much about birth control, but I’ve been wondering if this is the reason I’m having so many issues. My mood is up and down and has been for a while. I’ve gained about 80 lbs in 2 years regardless of what I’ve done to lose weight. I’m going to talk with my doc about it because this is not ok and hasn’t been for a while.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Only on this for a week, and cannot stop uncontrollably eating. It is terrible, and have gained lots of weight.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The week before Thanksgiving I started Aurovela, I experienced 24 hour nausea, oversleeping (one day, slept 15 hours!), I could not keep my eyes open for anything. I was vomiting 2 -3 times a day, usually only stomach acid or water because I couldn't keep food down. I had cold sweats and my entire body was achy. Worst out of all of this was my anxiety and depression. I don't remember the last time my anxiety was as bad as it was. It was terrifying. I had initially thought I may have had food poisoning. During my second week I was examining everything that could be contributing to my being sick, the only one thing was the birth control. My doctor stopped me immediately, told me to wait until my next menstrual cycle and then she gave me a lower dose. I was very skeptical, and for good reason. I started it 3 days ago and am already experiencing the same symptoms. I will contact her and discontinue use. The increase in anxiety and depression was surely the worst part of it all. Be aware.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel 1/20 about 4 months ago after years of debating whether or not I wanted to mess with my hormones and risk making my acne and depression worse. The first two months sucked, emotionally. I would get very depressed during the placebo week for some reason, but I've always struggled with anxiety and depression so it wasn't something new and might not have been correlated to the pill. It has somewhat improved my skin, and I went from being an oily mess to having more dry/normal-looking skin. I still get a pimple or two every month, which I'm okay with.No significant changes with weight or sex drive...yet.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m switching to Azurette not sure it will help. I’ve been depressed, weight gain and have the worst mood swings. I can’t control my mood. I cry about everything and something so little can set me off. I don’t feel like myself anymore. I hope this works because if not I might just stop.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my very first time taking birth control. The pill was very easy to take I did not have physical symptoms stated in the reviews except for sore breast occasionally. One thing I absolutely did not like on this pill was the mood swings. This would have been the perfect pill if I didn’t affect my mood. I have fallen into near deep anxiety and depression half way through the second month. My boyfriend and my friends even noticed it. I wouldn’t recommend this pill to anyone who was previously depressed. I have attempted suicide on this pill just grateful my boyfriend was there that day.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill December 8th when I started my 1st period after having my daughter and this pill has my period all out of whack. It is going on 4 weeks with this period and let's just say I'm over it. I'm about to stop this pill. DON'T TAKE THIS BIRTH CONTROL!!!!!!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Blisovi 24 Fe for about 4 months now and it’s honestly been fine for me. I’ve read bad reviews and have been scared, but as any birth control, you have to be willing to wait out the first few months and let your body adjust to the pill. For me, my periods are light, and come on the second brown pill and lasts maybe 3 days. In the first 2 months and sometimes now I do get upset easier, but it’s nothing crazy. This pill keeps my skin clear for the most part except when I’m taking the brown pills I do experience some pimples. As far as contraception, it’s been good to me. I do feel like I’m bloated sometimes, but with any pill your body weight may fluctuate. But I have no serious problems with this pill! Allow your body 3-6 months to adjust before freaking out.

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Loestrin 1/20 in the middle of November and I did not experience any weight gain, my weight stayed the same, however I did notice more acne on my back as well as a few on my face, they went away however but I still noticed that my skin was breaking out more which defeated the purpose of taking the pill since I mainly like taking it for acne control. The worst side effect was bleeding for more than 2 and a half weeks almost 3 weeks on this pill. In the middle of December, I started bleeding even though I take the pills at the same time every single day. This is annoying, will be switching to a new pill once this pack is finished. Overall I would say that it is a good pill despite the constant bleeding which is annoying.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):In the past 5 years, I have been on two different birth control pills. I decided to switch to Junel Fe because the other pill wasn’t helping with my period. This pill, however, was a huge mistake. I have been on it for a short time but it has made me extremely depressed. I have never has mental health issues in the past, and as soon as I started taking this pill I noticed huge mood swings. I cry all the time, and I am extremely emotional. I would not recommend this to anyone.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst birth control I’ve ever!! I asked my dr to switch bc because after being on Ortho Tri Cycl Lo for 9 years I started to get migraines.  She told me to change it to Lo Lo I waited and decided to give it a try.  11 days later I started spotting, cramping and bleeding.  My face started to breakout.  Never had any issues with a birth control.   I stopped taking them. So please stay way from these pills

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was previously on Microgestin for 5 years prior to this. The only reason for the switch is because Walmart doesn’t always carry the same generic. I didn’t realize it then, but realize now the awful side effects this caused me. ‘They’ say all genetics are the same, but I don’t believe that for a second. Microgestin was great. Junel gave me regular yeast infections, lots of bloating and water retention, more acne, and did nothing to help my pre menopausal symptoms (night sweats and hot flashes). It also made me way more emotional than I normally am. I hated this pill and wish I would have put two and two together more quickly.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this birth control pill Lo Loestrin Fe for five years or more and have no complaints and no side effects besides, no periods. To me that's a win and if you're worried about not getting your's, relax. It will all be worth it. Downside is when I got off the pill momentarily, my period came back x10! It hurt like anything and hopefully after my new script I overcome ever having one again. I will always appreciate this lovely birth control and hold dear to my heart!

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Loestrin Fe 1/20 was my first experience with birth control at age 20. I initially wanted to start birth control to help my hormonal acne, as well as start contraception, and my doctor prescribed this one. My experience with Loestrin Fe 1/20 was ok. I didn't have any side effects that were too bad- no weight gain, no nausea or headaches, no bloating, no mood changes. However, by breasts were sore the entire time I was on this pill and after three months it was not helping my acne. In fact, it may have made it slightly worse. I did not have a horrible experience with this pill, and it did its job of preventing pregnancy. A lot of doctors will prescribe this brand if its your first time on BC, so it's worth trying it out for a few months before you decide if you want to switch or not. I ended up switching because of the acne issue. Apparently norethindrone acetate is one type of progestin hormone that can cause acne, oops.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to this a couple of years ago when I would end up in a insurance plan that did not cover the Minastrin generic I’d taken for some time. Breakthrough bleeding was an issue on and off for about a year. Tanked my libido from the beginning. Have battled to control weight with diet and exercise for the first time ever. The weight and libido issues have caused anxiety in themselves. I probably put up with this one much longer than I should have. I’m back in a insurance plan that covers the Minastrin generic, so I’m headed back to it. My doctor told me these drugs are the same and they are very very most certainly not. Be your own advocate!

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is hands down the worst birth control I have ever used. My mood swings are so awful and I feel like I’m PMSing 24/7. I am horribly bloated and cramping all the time. I can’t stop eating either and when I finally do stop, I am nauseous as anything. I never used to be moody and ever since I started taking this pill, I am so irritable and always feel like crying. I want my Junel back!!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Junel Fe almost a year ago, and it hasn’t been bad except for the fact that it does not control my acne like I was told it would. I was previously on Yaz, which was amazing and kept my skin looking like porcelain, but switched due to it causing me to bleed a lot. My doctor said Junel would keep me acne free, but it has caused me to break out bad. I get clusters of white heads on my chin and my forehead and the weekly pimple somewhere on my face. I hate it. It has also caused my sex drive to drop significantly. I’m gonna give Yaz another shot and take my chances. Good at preventing pregnancy, but not for treating acne.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I originally went on Microgestin to help control acne, and it did the opposite for me.
