I’m in month 4 and my acne is worse than before I started. Overall, the first month contained a lot of mood swings, bleeding for a few weeks, and very tender breasts. All of the other side effects have lightened but my hormonal acne is a lot worse. It might work for some people just didn’t work for me!

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before I started Tarina Fe my weight would fluctuate between 94-96 pounds. When I started my first month I started eating a lot more and I got very emotional. Now on the 3rd week of the 2nd month I finally hit 100 pounds, my boobs are sore and I’ve also been extremely sleepy on both packs.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have endometriosis so my gyno recommended this birth control to me. It wasn’t bad at first, but since my body was adjusting the first month’s period lasted me for 3 weeks but spotting and mild cramps. I am now on my fourth month and I spot for a day or two and no cramps whatsoever. I love this part about this BC, but I finally realized how much it affected my mental health. My anxiety and depression has sky rocketed to the point where I am getting actual chest pains from my anxiety. I already have bipolar disorder type 2 and this did not work well with it at all. I don’t recommend if you have preexisting mental health issues, but if you don’t it’s a great pill - no bleeding, no cramps, no weight gain/loss, no acne. I’ll give it a 2 because of how everything else worked so well besides the mental health issues - they are so awful.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After many years on Lo Loestrin I started to experience break-through bleeding so my doctor switched me to Junel & then my pharmacy switched me to Aurovela. This was several months ago & they have been some of the worst months of my life. I've always had anxiety but I've never experienced this level of anxiety & depression before. My mood has been all over the place & I've generally just felt horrible (low energy, frequent nausea, etc.). A couple days ago I ended up in the ER with dangerously high blood pressure (I've never had problems with blood pressure & have always run low). The switch to Aurovela occurred right when the symptoms started, but I had experienced some major life changes around the same time, so it was only recently that I realized everything I've been experiencing is due to this medication. After seeing these reviews & doing some research, I am certain this pill is responsible for everything I've been going through & I will be stopping this birth control immediately.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for quite a while due to extreme cramps and excessive bleeding. It has been good to me but I thought I was the only one that experienced low libido while taking this birth control.  That's the only problem I have with it but besides that I have had no other problems.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Whoaaa, so glad I'm not alone with all of these side effects!! After having my last baby I dealt with unbearable periods and cramps while ovulating, to the point it was getting in the way with every day life. Was checked for Endo and was cleared of that so my OB prescribed Junel Fe to me. First couple months seemed great! Very light and almost non existent cramps. After a few months migraine after migraine. Lashing out at my family for no reason, depression, felt like nothing in life mattered, and absolutely NO sex drive. The thought of sex made me feel sick to my stomach ( my poor husband lol ). After discussing with my husband that I felt the pill was to blame for all of this I stopped taking it. A little over a week later I am feeling amazing and am even starting to think about sex again. Yippy. Just hoping not to get pregnant lol . All in all...if this is prescribed to you please ask for something else!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Because of the timing of starting this birth control and everything going on in my life, it took me a while to catch on to the side effects of this pill. While on it, I was way more anxious and depressed than I’ve felt in a long time. The week before my period, I’ve never really been the super emotional type, but on this pill, I was unrecognizable. I was extremely depressed and emotional, blew up fights with my boyfriend, and just generally acting crazy. Looking back at how I acted it’s like I’m not even looking at myself. When I finally thought back to when that started, I realized it was when I started this pill. While the pill didn’t cause any weight gain or other negative side effects for me, my mental state was in a very dark place on these. Because I was on it so long, I can say that these side effects don’t eventually go away, they just get worse. With all the other options out there, I could not recommend this pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst BC ever!! I got on this pill with high hopes of having little to no periods. I bleed 3 weeks out of the month with horrible cramping and very bloated. I never had acne in my life but once I started taking Lolo I’ve had horrific acne all over my face! I look like a pre teen! Very moody and no sex drive

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control Junel Fe 1/20 for 2 1/2 almost 3 years. The first 2 years were great. Cleared up my acne, no PMS symptoms, period was light, no side effects. This past year or 1/2 year, I have had nothing but issues. Periods are a bit heavier & irregular, for the first time I got migraines 3 days in a row with some nausea. I also have started having panic attacks, a bit of depression, & anxiety, which is so unlike me. Thinking about going off of this.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'M on day 19 of breakthrough bleeding. My doctor said to double up until the bleeding stops and I’m on day 5 of doubling up with no stopping. No other side effects other than the bleeding won’t go away

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the first birth control I ever took at 17. Initially I had so mood changes but nothing significant. At one point the pharmacy started providing me with a different generic version and then a completely different brand which caused issues. I tried to increase my estrogen to help with hormonal acne (taking Sprintec then Estarylla) I have returned to taking this brand name birth control and everything is better. I get minimal breakouts and my anxiety has decreased as well. I have not noticed any changes in my libido, however no birth control has affected it. I really like this low estrogen option.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on lo loestrin for 5 months.  I haven’t been on birth control for more than 5 yrs because of family history of breast cancer, and awful side effects when I’ve tried them before (IUD gave me ovarian cysts) I decided to take this birth control bc I was diagnosed with PCOS and PMDD and as I was having irregular periods and severe PMS symptoms. I wanted to try and regulate when I got my period, so my mood would be more stable.  This birth control was wonderful for me.   No nausea, or other annoying side effects and my PMS anger settled after about 3 months.    My periods when I am not taking birth control are heavy and last 7 days. On it it’s about 3-4 days and heavy for the first 2 days.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When I started this, I had no symptoms aside from decreased appetite. Not nausea, just no desire to eat. That didn’t last long. I thought everything was ok, but a few weeks in I started getting deep cystic acne, I gave it 4 months to go away (because that’s what I was told) and it only got worse. My used to be clear skin is not completely scarred, I was miserable, face itched and bled, and I’m about to start accutane. My free birth control has cost me over 1000$ in other medical expenses to control the acne it caused.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Ok, so I started this pill September of this yearIt Dec 24 - almost Christmas  and I am total not feeling the Christmas spirit.This pill has made me gain incredible amount of weight, my breast hurt like anything to touch, period has been 2 weeks on (I was taking this to regulate my period),  I feel tired, I do not want to hang out or be seen by anyone.I am in my room 24/7.I really want to stop this pill

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is a terrible birth control. I take this for ovarian cysts but I think my cysts ruptures are less painful than the period cramps I get when taking this. Makes my periods way longer than what they were before. I feel like my hair is thinning and I have the worst mood swings possible.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've only been on this birth control Alyacen for one month and have been bleeding every day since I started these pills. My breast have also gotten very big and tender. The headaches and nausea are minimal.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After a couple months of taking this birth control pill, I had extreme anxiety and depression. I have never had anxiety or depression before in my life. This medication made me feel awful to the point I was so anxious I literally felt like my body was growing cancer. I started reading reviews and they were very similar to how I was feeling.  I stopped taking it and am feeling so much better!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on LoLo for 4 months now but have decided to stop taking it. I experienced severe mood swings while on this pill and it was starting to affect myself and the people around me. I was much quicker to anger and tearfulness at seemingly trivial things. I would have random bouts of crying once a week at least. My patience level decreased significantly and I am usually a very patient, calm individual when not on this specific brand of pill. Some positives I do have to mention and that I liked about this pill was that it did not decrease my libido like other brands I have tried in the past. Also, I did not experience depression or weight gain. I had high hopes for this brand but for now, I will be taking a break from birth control altogether and am already feeling happier and more stable off of it.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got switched from Junel to this about 3 months ago. I got my normal, barely there, periods like I did with Junel. I'm getting off birth control completely after this for other reasons, but I definitely did not enjoy how I felt emotionally with Aurovela while I was on it!

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I mostly love this pill, mostly. I have been using it continuously for the past two years, and out of those two years I've probably had my period about 6 times. With taking it continuously, I am not supposed to get my period. It's GREAT for a few months, you feel great, very good protection against conception, and easy. But, every now and then I will start to bleed randomly. If I keep taking the pill while bleeding, there is brown blood that will linger for about 2 weeks, BUT if its my actual if I stop my medicine for about 5-7 days, I can let myself have a period, and then start over. I really don't like it when I start spotting and bleeding randomly, with no clue. Has ruined underwear, and been embarrassing. I would say it's a  I really like it / really don't like it relationship with this birth control. It works spectacular against pregnancy, and is great for a little bit, until your vagina has enough and decides it needs to have a period, even though technically it isn't necessary.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this for a month and a half. First month I was so nauseous and had horrible headaches. Also had been super anxious and emotional. Start of my my second pill pack I got borderline cystic acne out of nowhere. I just switched back to my old birth control. I googled the reviews tonight and saw that 80% had a negative effects no wonder I feel and look like this. I can’t believe anyone thought to prescribe this to me this I’m actually livid. 4 days before Christmas and I have over 25 pimples on my face. When I say last Friday my skin was clean I’m not kidding. Livid.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this pill so much. I’ve never had such a good experience with birth control before. My side effect symptoms have been so small that I barely notice them, very little to no bleeding/spotting through the 2 months I’ve been on it, even in the starting weeks which was always a huge problem for me on other forms of bc. My skin has cleared up, my libido has increased, no weight gain, no mood swings, no depression.. only negative I’ve noticed so far is my energy levels are sometimes pretty low. It’s important to remember when reading reviews that every woman’s body responds differently to bc so don’t get scared from the bad reviews! You could be lucky and finally find the one that works perfectly for your body!

Pros: This medication really helped my horrible PMS symptoms I barely even have a period while I'm on this (which is great for me, I work in healthcare and don't have time for periods to get in the way). I bleed two days at most and don't have cramps like before. Cons: I was pretty moody the first month but that settled down by the second pack. My acne didn't improve, it might be slightly worse.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Was on this pill from 17 years til I was 20. Helped clear my acne and eliminated my periods, BUT caused major vaginal dryness and pain during sex. Not worth it to me. Switched to Liletta IUD which gave me horrible hormonal acne and I am now looking to go back to the pill, but a higher dose which I hope will help with the dryness and pain.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve be experiencing break through bleeding for 3 weeks straight; since my Dr. switched me to this brand.  I’m looking to switch to another brand ASAP.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is horrible. I was switched to it from another and have had numerous side effects. Do not take this product. It has made me uncontrollably emotional for no reason and cause weight gain. Stay away.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo for almost 3 months when I had to stop because my acne was had slightly increased (already had acne to begin with). I would advise anyone considering this pill to trust their doctor. It’s the lowest hormones available on the market I believe and everyone may react differently to it and it’s really about how you handle it. Not to discount anyone’s negative experience, I just know I got scared after reading some of these reviews. I enjoyed having a shorter and lighter period and it seemed like I had less cramps. If you are worried about weight gain, it could cause an increase in appetite but for me it suppressed my appetite. I already had acne to begin with so the only reason I stopped is there are other pills approved to treat hormonal acne like Yaz.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this pill because it takes my appetite away and that's a good thing. No breast tenderness. No break through bleeding or nausea. Thats good but even if I were that no appetite thing is the bomb diggaty!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe 1/20 was the worst experience ever. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Don’t do it. Nausea, headaches (severe), heard about the spotting didn’t think it would happen to me but it did, cramps/abdominal pain. Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this pill for ~2 months. It works great for preventing pregnancy. However, if you're pretty mentally stable, I think it's a great option! It didn't make my periods heavy and constant like Nexplanon did.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed Lo Lo for heavy bleeding and bad period cramps. I wanted to give the pill a chance. I started the pill about 3 1/2 months prior. Aside from that, I am depressed and I feel out of it all the time. I was never depressed in my life. I have extreme mood swings. It's like one second I'm elated and the next second I'm crying. I have nausea, bloating, and constipation everyday. Lo lo doesn't fit me. I really wanted to give it a try but I'm cutting it off

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hi. So I’m so very annoyed so I’m just saying STOP taking this birth control now!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Everyone's body is different but for me Blisovi side effect was getting too much for me to handle. I think I should start with the pros because not everything was bad. PRO: I liked how it kept me on schedule. Period change from 6 days to 4 and lighter flow. I have a family history of diabetes so I try to make sure my weight is manageable. At first I correlated to Covid and being stuck indoors so I ended up doing more cardio outside almost everyday but for the life of me couldn't change my weight. Went from 130 to 150 pounds and I'm 23 with a history of consistent weight before I took the pill. If I took a break for a couple of days I'd gain all the weight back plus more. Lastly, my sex drive was nonexistent. I've been on the Blisovi Fe 1/20 for 8 months now and decided another birth control method is best for me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking it for 2 month because I'm in a different country and can't access my usual brand but for these two months I've been bleeding randomly and extremely heavily. Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible. Absolutely horrible. My pharmacy switch me from Junel to Aurovela. But I know it takes months for your body to chill out on this stuff so I’m gonna wait it out.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It’s been working well for me besides the nausea and bloating. Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started out on Necon back in the 80's worked great but was taken off the market.  No side effects and perfect skin as well. Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I know everyone has different reactions but I was on this birth control Aurovela Fe 1/20 for two months and it was awful. I just didn’t feel like myself at all. Affter being off of it for only about a week I feel 10 times better!

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am currently on week four taking Aurovela because my pharmacist couldn’t get my normal birth control in (Junel Fe 24). Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The only good thing about this Aurovela Fe 1/20 pill is that I haven't experience any bloating or weight gain but it has been giving me bad breakouts and very dry skin and my Junel had never let my skin feel tight at all.
Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DONT DO IT! Please refrain from using this. I’ve only been on it for 5 days and I have symptoms of extreme nausea, and the WORST headaches.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel is the worst birth control I have ever taken. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Ladies do not take this medication. The month I began this Lo Loestrin Fe pill my life became a bit of a nightmare. Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I didn’t like this  Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 pill at all I get my period twice a month and it makes me bleed a lot also makes me gain weight and makes me anxious and depressed. I will start the patch in 1 week and I hope its better for me.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had the worst symptoms while taking Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 for the last 3 months. Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had good experience with Aurovela Fe 1.5/30, not spotting or getting pregnant.  On the other end, I have been taking it for about a month and I have NEVER broke out this bad.  I have massive, deep pimples in very obvious places.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before starting Lo Loestrin, I read a lot of horrible reviews about it and was a bit nervous to try it. I will warn you, though, this birth control did make me very emotional and I experienced a reduced sex drive. These aren't dealbreakers for me, but may be for someone else.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Microgestin 1/20 for about a year, I started the beginning of 2020.
