I’ve been sexually active this past month too, so I’m really hoping I don’t end up pregnant.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Ever since I started taking Junel fe, I’ve been having mood swings and I would get really irritated easily & emotional at times. Is only been a month and I am going to stop taking it. I know I should give it more time to work but I cannot deal with the dark thoughts. I’m anxious more & feel depressed. My mental health is more important than this.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was wary of taking Aurovela Fe 1/20 at first as I normally take Junel 1/2 FE until my pharmacy had to give me this one due to shortage. During the first month I hadn't had any problems with bloating, weight gain, or sudden mood swings but at nearly the third week I did experienced some bad chin acne till the end of my days.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 24 and have been on this Junel Fe 24 pill for 6 years with no issues. Here's the thing  you need to give your birth control way more than 1-3 months before judging it. You will never find a good one if you switch them that often!!! Unless you're having a serious reaction to it, then wait it out 3 months until it regulates. This pill didn't make me gain weight or have any more acne than a 24 year old should have. Yes of course vaginal dryness is an issue.... if you're taking any birth control with progesterone in it you are going to have this issue. The whole purpose of this medication is to thicken your cervical secretions so that it can trap sperm better. No birth control is perfect but I promise this is a good one if you give it some time.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Aurovela Fe 1/20 has made me have severe anxiety, and I have never had anxiety before. I have had some bouts of depression over the years, also managed it without meds though. This made the episodes more frequent and into deeper depression. I also would get migraines that would last for 2-3 days at a time, that wouldn't resolve with tylenol/advil/excedrin which is also odd for me. Had random mensural cramps as well, all through the month. When it was the week of my period, it would be heavy, cramps, migraines, nausea, and sore achy legs.

Kaitlib Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I actually really loved this birth control Kaitlib Fe. I had no side effects, it helped clear up my face, no weight gain and the pill is chewable which is sooooo convenient. However, the hormone dosage was not high enough and I kept ovulating which for me causes SIGNIFICANT pain. It is probably a good think I can't conceive naturally because I probably would have ended up pregnant. It is a lower dose of hormones so it is much easier on your body.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Tried switching from Mono-linyah to this Larin Fe 1/20. I was on this for 2 months and was spotting the whole time. Plus I gained 5 pounds. Frustrating. But I didn't get pregnant. So it works haha

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Aurovela Fe 1/20 for almost 2 months now. Please, please, please if you have a history of anxiety or depression ask your doctor to try a different birth control method. My anxiety has increased severely and I’m beginning to feel very depressed again. I’ve been thinking of self harm as well as suicide again and I’m having trouble with over sleeping, not eating enough, I’m crying constantly and I’m losing my motivation for everything. Please be careful if you decide to try this birth control and contact your doctor immediately if you begin feeling these symptoms. DO NOT WAIT!

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am on my second pack in Week 3 and I would describe my experience with Tarina as not bad. When I was on the first pack I definitely experienced those mood swings that everyone was talking about. I got mad easily and became very emotional. But I noticed once I started my second pack my mood swings calmed down a bit. I guess it was just my body adjusting to it. I haven't experienced any sudden weight gain. I am currently working out and eating right so maybe that's a plus. One negative thing I will say though is that it has made my acne WORST even though it says it's supposed to clear it. I have been experiencing maskne (mask acne from wearing covid masks) but it wasn't as bad as it's been since I started taking Tarina. Overall, it's okay. I will continue using it.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control pill Junel Fe 24 gave me HORRIBLE ACNE! I was previously on generic Ortho-tricyclin Lo but switched to Junel after I had mild side effects. The first month was fine, but as soon as month two came I started getting painful cystic acne and white heads. By month 3 it's the worst it's ever been. I'm 30 years old and so embarrassed to show my skin, but the worst part is the pain its causing me! My periods are super short on this pill as well (2-3 days). After month 3 I went back on Ortho-tricyclin Lo and also went on Spironolactone. Worst BC experience ever.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 31 years old and started the pill for the first time in my adult life. Well I’m on month 5 and it has been a roller coaster and all I can think is when does it end, when do I feel normal again? Month 1, I bled for 4 weeks straight. Month 2, I had horrible nausea and when I did eat I had the worst heart burn. Month 3, I had the most vivid detailed dreams. Month 4 I felt like things were getting a bit better but now I’m almost thru month 5 and I just cry all the time. I know my body pretty well and what triggers my stomach inflammation but here I am bloated all the time. I have no energy or desire to do anything. My sex drive has plummeted completely. The only thing this pill has done is shorten my period from 7 to 4 days but those 4 days are awful and heavy. I plan to finish the 6 month pack and look for an alternative because it is not for me.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 pill for 11 days and had intense panic attacks, increased depression and super dark thoughts. I couldn't sleep and I barely ate or drank anything because my anxiety was so high. A family member had to call in sick to work on the last day I took it because they were afraid to leave me alone. Constant crying spells after the 6th day of taking the pill and also very intense rage that wasn't justified. I don't think it's a very good pill; I've been on a few and didn't experience anything like this. Another very bad side effect I didn't have on any other pills is my blood pressure went from high side of normal to level 2 hypertension. I don't know if that's from the medicine or from the constant panic I felt. Would not recommend.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wanted to add to the less scary comment section for if you were a nervous first time user like me looking at other people’s experiences! I have been on Hailey FE for about 5 months. The first month, I gained 10 pounds but mainly just water weight/bloat. Which is expected I think? I went through a few cycles when my skin was worse than normal, but nothing too too bad. My moods were fairly normal (I am prone to anxiety and sadness) it only got really bad for one week near my birthday (so could have been to do with that outside variable). All in all, it could have been worse! My periods are super light with hardly any cramping, and no pregnancy! So yay! Give it a go(:

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):OMG DO NOT TAKE THIS Junel Fe 24 PILL!!! I started this pill it was going ok and then suddenly I had no desire for sex at all which is unlike me because I’ve always had a high sex drive. I told my dr about it he was like that’s ok that’s a side effect. This pill made sex awful and painful because it made me dry. Therefore, I took it upon myself to stop the pill, well now I will not stop bleeding it’s not just a little blood it’s heavy like very heavy bleeding. My dr told me if I started my pill back it will stop the bleeding. I refuse to start that pill back I will just let the bleeding run it’s course and hopefully it stops soon because I am finally getting back to my pre pill sex drive.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Tarina Fe 1/20 since planned parenthood prescribed it to me. And I LOVED IT! Gave me 0 problems ever. No side effects, my acne cleared up and my skin was glowing, I felt great, absolutely no problems. I see reviews about hair loss but I have insanely ridiculous thick hair that it would be very very difficult for me to notice that one. But as far as I can say this was the best birth control I ever been on! It was my first ever one I ever taken. I was on Tarina in 2018 for a year until I was switched (they told to me and said it was discontinued *planned parenthood*) and they switched me to Blisovi Fe 1/20... IF YOU GET PRESCRIBED BLISOVI FE DO NOT TAKE IT! It’s awful, gave me cystic acne, moodiness to the point of losing myself as a person and human being. But Tarina is great!!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this since towards the end of October and I have had very few problems. The only side effects I am experiencing is brown breakthrough bleeding/spotting, it’s not unbearable but it does get quite annoying. I haven’t had any mood changes so far and my skin seems to be getting better by the week. I haven’t tested the effectiveness of the prevention of pregnancy yet but I am confident that my doctor chose a good brand for me.

Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After 5 years of taking tri-estarylla, I was put on this Nortrel 7/7/7 birth control because of new insurance and a new doctor.I got pregnant on Nortel 7/7/7 on my third pack of taking it correctly. During the months of taking it: I was emotional and easily agitated. (I suffer with depression and bipolar 2 but my symptoms were out of the norm for myself). I also had severe headaches/ migraines.Every person is different and we all react differently to every med, but I know how to take birth control and to get pregnant on it was an emotion rollercoaster. My husband and I have a beautiful baby, but I can't in good faith recommend to give this pill a chance if it can't even prevent pregnancy.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Junel Fe 1/20 after I realized I needed to regulate my hormones. I would get nausea and diarrhea every time I was anxious. My first month on this pill, I felt amazing. The stomach problems went away. I didn't bleed that month, just brown discharge. I also noticed I had acne again which my face was spotless prior to the pill. The second month was the worst. I had bad nausea, had to pull over while driving to puke later at night (fixed by taking the pill at a later time). I was constantly miserable and sick every day. My sex drive was gone and I got a yeast infection the week before sugar pills. I didn't get my period and got brown spotting. The third month wasn't bad, no nausea but acne got worse. Over the three months I gained 15 lbs. It seems to be going back to normal now with my weight slowly but I still have no sex drive, I'm bloated, and feel like I'm getting another yeast infection (the week before the sugar pill). I'm hoping it will turn around but I am not a fan.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This medication Nortrel 1/35 has really work well for me, I started taking it when I was 20 and have used it as my primary source of BC. I suppose I was lucky but I have not experienced any of the commonly mentioned side affects other than some mild cramping the 1 month I took it as my body adjusted to the hormones. Since then, ten years later, I have not had any weight gain, headaches or nausea and I can’t say that it has effects my mood either. My periods went from 8 heavy days of nightmare periods to 3 to 4 days of using a liner with only an occasional cramping. Most importantly after a decade of use I have not become pregnant or had a single pregnancy scare.This pill has worked very well for me

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Junel Fe 1/20 for 6 months, it was prescribed to me to help with my (moderate) acne and also to help with my painful uncomfortable periods. The first two months my bleeding was very irregular but it stabilized after 3 months. In regards to helping with menstration it’s great! However it did virtually nothing for my skin and actually made my skin break out more frequently on my chin and around my mouth area.  I recently switched my birth control to Nikki, which is a generic form of Yaz. If you struggle with hormonal acne like me, I would not take Junel for that. Take a birth control pill that contains a progestin that’s anti-androgenic (Like Nikki, Yaz, Beyaz, ortho-tri-cyclen). In regards to mood on this pill (Junel) I didn’t really notice a difference. I did notice that I lost weight on this pill, perhaps it’s just a coincidence. And this pill lowered my libido substantially. That’s the side effect that does kind of suck. Overall I wouldn’t really recommend this pill.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 24 and took this BC Larin Fe 1/20 for 3 months, I can see the negatives. In the first month I was experiencing random light bleeding directly after taking the pill, definite mood changes (much more irritable), and chest pain. The second month I noticed that my acne was getting worse (I do have acne prone skin) I was hoping birth control would help my breakouts but instead gave me worse acne on my cheeks and chin (I never got acne on my chin badly before). My side effects in the third month are what made me decide to switch BC pills. I noticed that my hair was definitely falling out more than usual. I have thick hair as it is, but noticed in the shower my hands were literally covered in hair on wash days, which I have never experienced prior to this BC. I'm actually SCARED to wash my hair, seeing how much falls out. My last week on the pill I also experienced intense headaches out of no where. The pros to Larin fe 1/20 are that my periods are super light and short and that I am not pregnant.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After about 3-4 months of taking Aurovela Fe 1.5/30, I’ve decided to stop as I finally correlated what I’ve recently been feeling/experiencing with taking this pill. I was taking Junel Fe but was switched to this because of spotting. I’ve experienced waves of depression and more anxiety. I read that it interacts with duloxetine, which is what I’m currently taking for depression.  I’ve also been retaining more water and can’t seem to get rid of it. I eat a low carb diet and drink lots of water. I didn’t have this issue until taking it.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):What people are saying about this medication is true. I am only 2 weeks in on Loestrin 24 Fe and my face and body is noticeably different. I'm heavier and I also have acne on my forehead. I'm bleeding still and I'm also still in pain. I am discounting and addressing my issues through diet and exercise.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love Blisovi Fe 1.5/30. I was taking it for over a year and never had a problem. Not only did it prevent pregnancy, my skin was great, had no mood swings, had no weight gain or any other negative side effects. I had a lapse in insurance and ended up getting my birth control from Planned Parenthood for about 4 months. They didn’t carry Blisolvi, so I got the equivalent dosage of Chateal and I was immediately in shambles, with bad mood swings, bad headaches, and BAD SKIN. Although, it did do its job of preventing pregnancy. I finally got back on insurance got blisovi again! I’ve only taken about half of my first pack on Blisovi and it has already corrected my mood and cleared up my skin. It is crazy how sensitive our bodies are and how different we all are. Blisovi works for me, but there is no review you will read that will tell you one way or another how a pill will work for you. You just have to try figure out what works for your body.
Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):bruh do not take Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 I have been shaking and nauseous for days, this is  worst birth control pill I’ve ever been on

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you have a history of depression and/or anxiety, this birth control pill Aurovela Fe 1/20 may make it worse. I have depression and anxiety that I have been treated for for 5 years now and been stable on medication. I have been taking microgestin fe 1/20 for about 3 years now and my pharmacy ran out of everything and this was their only option. Within 3 weeks I am experiencing depression and anxiety similar to when I was first diagnosed with depression and wasn’t in treatment for it. It’s awful. I feel terrible, Aurovela Fe 1/20 has given med side effects of me bing extremely bloated, my boobs are insanely huge and so sore, I have acne break outs in 6 places on my face and all over my chest and collar bone area. This pill is absolutely awful and I hate how it makes me feel. The pharmacist assured me it was all the same active ingredients and I shouldn't notice a change. Well when I’m 3 weeks into it and having suicidal thoughts return for the first time in 5 years and this has been the only change, I beg to differ.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I tried two other pills (that were higher estrogen) and the patch prior to taking this pill, and I have to say this one is much better. I used to get horrible nausea, low sex drive, uncontrollable mood swings, and weight gain on the other pills and I have not experienced this with Tarina Fe! I have been on this pill for a month now so I am just finishing my first pack. I am taking it for pregnancy prevention, minor acne, painful periods and horrible pms, as well as flare ups from a painful bladder syndrome I have called interstitial cystitis. So far it has made a significant difference in helping all these things, and the only bad symptoms I experienced that I can deal with are tender breasts, water retention, minor headaches, worsened anxiety and low moods tend to feel lower. I also noticed a decrease in appetite but it was only at the very beginning. Again it is only the first month so I expect these symptoms to just lessen as I continue taking the pill.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control since August 2020. I have never used the pill before I’ve always used long term birth controls. I like how I know exactly when my period of going to start but I noticed that on the week that I don’t take the pills I am extremely emotional. I find myself crying all the time, extremely depressed. Emotional rollercoaster. If you have mental health issues maybe this pill is not for you. Which I should look into changing soon as well.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control gave me the worst acne I have had in a long time cystic acne all over my jaw and cheeks. It affects everyone differently but I am now trying a different one after being on this one for 4 months it was fine for mood.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking Taytulla for about a year now. For the past half of this year I would get my period either every 10 days or every two weeks. Cramps are still unbearable. NOT A FAN!!!!!

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got on this pill around 3 years ago to help with horrible periods that would make me cancel all plans because of the pain I was in. I would bleed for around 8 days heavily before this pill. When I first started taking Microgestin 1/20, I spotted for around 2 weeks, and a month later for a week, but that was it. I have no had a period since after those two weeks of the pill. I skip my period and it helps SO much. I did have some mood swings and still some bloating, but those are the only side effects I have noticed. Overall I love this and it’s made my life so much easier! (I sometimes take it an hour to two hours late on accident, but it doesn’t effect me any.)

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):45 yrs old, Dr recommended Taytulla to lessen heavy periods. I’m a runner and it is extremely important that I continue being active, yet my heavy cycle was a HUGE problem!I’m finishing my 3rd month on Taytulla and decided today I’m done with it!!!Side effects: Gained 10 pounds, absolute exhaustion, lost interest in being active and became slightly depressed. Also lost ALL libido!!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After seeing how many people on Larin Fe 1/20 shared the same side effects symptoms that I had, I wouldn’t recommend this pill to anyone. The first few weeks, I felt more anxious and depressed than normal, but I didn’t make the connection. I was also having bad dreams almost every night. It was only when I started to feel nauseous daily and constantly on the verge of tears, spending hours crying over an inexplicable feeling of sadness and doom, that I realized this pill was causing it (I rarely cry normally). It magnifies every tiny upset or anxiety or annoyance; I can feel myself acting irrationally and unfairly towards people, but I can’t stop. I had some other stressors the past week and the pill blew them up to 10x their intensity and I had a horrible panic attack. I’m normally an even keeled person; this pill has turned me into someone else. I’ve stopped taking it and can’t wait until the effects wear off. Don’t take this pill. Try Tri-Sprintec instead.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on this Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 because I have extremely bad menstrual cramps. It was effective at stopping the pain for the most part, but I had a lot of negative side effects. Horrible headaches, acne, fatigue, mood swings, depression, and dizziness are all things I started experiencing when starting this pill. These things are not things I experienced before starting this pill. I had light periods and the bleeding would stop for a week, but then I would spot from then until my next period came. Probably wouldn’t recommend this pill to anyone, but it works different for everyone.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill to stop ovulations and hopefully regulate my PMDD.  I was really hesitant because I've had terrible experiences with birth control in the past.  Yaz, specifically, put me in a flat out depression for 3 months.  I've been on this BC for the last 3 months consistently, minus a week that breakthrough was causing bleeding and cramping that I stopped for 4 days to relieve.  My moods are amazing, I haven't felt a single outburst in the last 3 months.  My sex drive is incredibly high, and my boyfriend is grateful.  I feel like I have me back, and suggested for anyone who's had problems with other birth controls.

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took only one month of Aurovela Fe 1/20 birth control pill. Within that one month, I had the worst depression and anxiety of my entire life. I couldn’t sleep or eat. I was nauseous almost 24 hours of the day. I even threw up after the first time I took it. I was given this pill when my pharmacy didn’t have my regular pill, and went back almost once a week to see if I could get the original pill I was on. On top of all that, I take the birth control to get rid of my acne, and it didn’t even help with that.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control Hailey 24 Fe started off really good. Noticed my minor acne going away and actually felt that my self esteem went up. Never got pregnant which is great. However within the first pill of my second month I threw up twice in that week. Then I started have horrible migraines where I lose my vision. At first I brushed them off and thought it was because my body was adjusting but well into the fourth month of using it I was still having those migraines every week or more. As of right now typing I have a migraine. I am getting off of it after my last pill. I don’t know if this will help anyone but this is how my experience was.

Nortrel 0.5/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Today marks 4 months on birth control. My body has not felt the same since the day I started taking it. I no longer have cramps on my periods, that last up to 2 weeks now. Although I do not have cramps during my period, the newly formed ovarian cysts cramp me up a bit. Also the constant bloating and digestion pains aren't the best. There is a pro, I'm not pregnant.. that I know of. I've found that constantly chugging cranberry juice while downing ibuprophen has helped with my unwanted cramps in my uterus.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):4 months on this birth control pill Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (my first time using birth control) and I gained about 15 pounds, have sore breasts constantly, and get REALLY cranky and mean one week a month (not associated with my period though...)It helped regulate my periods, but I decided to go off it due to the other effects (side effects outweighed the regulating of period)

Aurovela Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been taking Microgestin or Junel with no problems for over 5 years when my pharmacy switched to Aurovela. By week 3, I was fighting severe and life altering depression, anxiety, self loathing, and feeling overwhelmed. When I called my pharmacy to switch back, I was told they have received many such complaints about Aurovela.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL. My daughter had to take this pill because she was having very irregular cycles (6 week long period, 2 weeks off, then a month long). She had a beautiful complexion before and was happy and outgoing. Almost a year on this pill, and her skin is ruined and she’s very moody. She now has horrible acne (we’ve spent hundreds of dollars at dermatologist, they now want her to start Accutane). I’m hoping they will switch her pill, because this was the WORST decision ever. I wish I would have read all these reviews before letting her doctor prescribe it. I’m also annoyed the dermatologist never considered this as the cause of her continuously worsening acne.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have taken this birth control for a few months now and I haven’t seen much change in my period, but I am becoming extremely depressed. I have had mental health problems in the past, but they have magnified so much with this pill. I worry about my week off from taking the pill because that’s when I feel depressed and I have suicidal thoughts. It is good at preventing pregnancy, but not good for your mental health. I do not suggest this pill.
Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm just now starting to take it since I'm on my cycle. Wish me luck that it works please

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on HJunel fe 1/20 for 4 months. It was $45 every 3 months. It started off just fine. I felt great, no weight gain, no acne, my breasts were constantly sore and I grew in size but it wasn’t too much to complain for. My periods also improved. I noticed I was a bit more emotional but didn’t worry too much because I already have anxiety and thought it would level out. Month 4 hit me bad. I woke up after the first week and just cried. For some reason I felt hopeless in the world and no matter what I did I didn’t feel better. I tried vitamin b 12, changing my diet, nothing worked. After weeks of debating, I switched to Lutera which is a different progestin and I am finishing my first month and feel 100% better. I’m still emotional before my period but that is nothing out of the ordinary. Junel did it’s job at preventing pregnancy but the cost of my mental health was not worth it

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I been on birth control for the last 3 years ,  and this is the WORSE experience, the first 2 weeks on Junel Fe 1/20 I been vomiting and feeling sick eventually I started feeling more tired than usual and having panic attacks , I was about to finish the first pack when the situation got worse from panic attacks to crying for hours for no reason.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):TAKE SOMETHING ELSE! It's not worth your life!I've been on this birth control since December of 2019 (today is 10/16/2020). I experienced the weight gain, but kept taking it due to the effectiveness of the birth control itself. About a month ago, I began experiencing bad headaches that would come on in the evenings. After 3 hours and multiple tests in the ER, I was told I was being admitted due to having a double pulmonary embolism (2 blood clots) in my right lung. The next morning, the doctor came in and told me that I need to immediately stop taking Tarina, due to that being the cause of the clots. Now, I have to spend the next 6 months at minimum on Eliquist and Xeralto and simply hope they are effective. I can't pick up my 3 year old and am basically restricted to a light-duty lifestyle until I have a medical green light. PLEASE, please, reconsider taking this birth control. There are so many other options that do not have PE's as a side effect - rare or not.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for 4, maybe 5 years. I take it so that I only have my period a few times a year, as mine previously were so heavy that I was super anemic. I haven’t ever had any issues with it, works great for me. My periods are still heavy and last almost 2 weeks, similar to before the pill. But it’s manageable only having it two or three times a year. I do have to take it almost exactly at the same time every day, even an hour difference can cause spotting or a period to start. I also saw someone say they have to pee right after they take it, and I realized I do the same..overall, very happy.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill Larin Fe 1/20 since March of 2020 and it's the first pill I've ever used as a contraceptive. Initially, I experienced terrible waves of nausea while on it alongside nightmarish mood swings that would leave me absolutely depressed and near suicidal over the smallest things. Nearly 7 months later though, almost none of these symptoms exist. My mood swings are occasional and far easier to handle and I have no nausea. Furthermore, this birth control made my period much lighter and shorter which is a huge plus for me. It's been wonderful at keeping me from getting pregnant despite having had unprotected sex a number of times while on it. Ultimately, this pill works differently for everyone and hopefully many who use it in the future will have the same overall successes that I have had with it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wanted to get on birth control to regulate my period but please please PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS. I gained 30 pounds in a 3 month timespan because it caused my appetite to sky rocket. My appetite went back to normal after stopping it thank goodness. I had my period for 20 days straight, broke my eczema out on my face really bad, acne everywhere, constant headaches, my mood was horrid, and I felt so exhausted 24/7. I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone. But again, everyone’s body is different so it might work for you! But still, be weary.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel Fe almost a year ago. I always heard horror stories on the internet and through friends about birth control pills. For the first few months it was fine, my periods were regular just did not last as long and were not so heavy. About, 4-5 months after taking it I missed 3 periods in a row. Then I got my period again for the next 3 months, and it was super heavy and was lasting 8 days or more. At first, I brushed it off and did not even think it was the pills doing this. I’ve also gained almost 20lbs. When I started to realize it could be because of my BC, I brushed it off because I tend to be a hypochondriac/overthinker. I didn’t realize what this pill was doing to my anxiety/mental health until my best friend, family and boyfriend noticed. I’ve always been a super happy, no stress, easy going person. I was lashing out on people for no reason and had the craziest mood swings. It works for a contraceptive though!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this medication not even for a week. I been nauseous for the past 3 days straight. Today I feel unbalanced and unable to  focus on the computer screen. Last night I suffer unbearable cramps. The listed long term side effect are wild, like 4 or 5 different cancers like what human been would suggest someone to take this horrible drug. This medication isn’t worth the risk. I'd rather be pregnant

I was really excited to get back on birth control after my second baby but that quickly changed. The biggest thing for me was absolutely no sex drive and it was starting to effect my relationship. My boyfriend and I had a great sex life before I started taking this birth control. I gained a lot of weight and no matter how much I worked out, I couldn’t lose it. It gave me such strong cravings that it reminded me of my pregnancies. My depression was so terrible and it made me so unmotivated which is not good being a stay at home mom with 2 young kids. I highly do not recommend.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the WORST pill out there. I was on Desetta 1/35 for years and had to switch pharmacies and they gave me Nortrel 1/35. I had extreme nausea that woke me up out of my sleep and caused me to throw up every morning. And no it was not morning sickness I had multiple pregnancy tests and blood tests done. I do not recommend this pill at all I’ve never had a medication make me feel so sick.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):READ IF YOU HAVE ANXIETY. I started this BC because my OB boasted about it being low hormone and helping my anxiety even out a bit from having too much estrogen in my previous BC pill. I started it with high hopes and quickly felt my anxiety sky rocket within days. I’ve always struggled with mild anxiety and this BC spiked it to the worst it had ever been. I tried sticking it out but I made it one month on this pill and said I’m done. I had horrific anxiety, crying spells, I had panic attacks (which I never had), and overall felt horrible. I now have the IUD Kyleena and I wish I had gotten an IUD all along. Never again will I go on the pill. They messed my body up. Not worth it. Please be careful when deciding if BC pills are right for you. I wish this brand would be removed from the market.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Amazing! The beginning was rough! Nausea, diarrhea, extreme fatigue! But after a month, got used to it. High sex drive! I’ve never had so much sex drive like this before. My boyfriend loves it! I’m very happy with it so far.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Larin Fe 1/20 for about 2 weeks now and I’ve got to say that it is the worst I’ve ever felt on any birth control. Horrible nausea shortly after taking it and increased anxiety and constant panicky and on verge of tears feeling. I am a person that never dreams or remembers any dreams at least and  ever since starting this pill I have had nightmares almost every night and wake up in a panic in the middle of the night and resume nightmares when going back to sleep till morning.  Insane mood swings and frequent hot flashes. Zero sex drive so in that case it is effective as birth control because it makes you not want to do anything at all. Not worth it. Only going to go to end of this pack to not throw off my cycle completely and I am never taking it again. Should be taken off market after seeing all of the other negative reviews about it too. Scary stuff.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My experience with Junel Fe 1/20 has been ok just been spotting on pill days and not having a period or should I say break through bleeding on  placebo week.  I'm not sure if that is normal and I been taking it for a month and one week I been very hot and emotional, hungry and major fatigue.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So unlike everyone else’s comments here, I LOVE Tarina. The last birth control made me so actually sick 24/7, I couldn’t get out of bed. With Tarina I’ve had a small amount of break outs (masks add onto that) and a bit of weight gain (quarantine too) my breasts have been a tad sore every couple of weeks but it isn’t terrible. My periods are shorter, my cramps aren’t as bad until I'm on my period, but they still aren’t nearly as bad, I can take 1 pill of pamprin and be fine. I have noticed I’m a bit moodier before my periods but, again pamprin or any PMS pill can help with that. Everyone’s body is different! Just try it, after a couple of months if it’s not working for you, go see your doctor or whomever. Also starting Tarina, I wasn’t nauseated but I was a bit moody, and had mild cramps off and on for a few weeks with a few zits here and there, but that’s just from a huge rush of estrogen our bodies will be accepting!

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on lolo for a year now and I totally love it. I’ve never experienced any side effects besides weight gain, which is pretty common when taking birth control and I’ve also been home from school all summer. I have the lightest and shortest periods now, sometimes I don’t even have one. I love having no periods especially since I used to have terrible cramps and heavy bleeding, although it is bad for pregnancy scares. I was on tri-previfem before lolo and I absolutely  ire3ally don't! I had the worst side affects especially with the yeast infections that would never go away. Lolo was the only pill that worked for me and it is amazing!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control made me break out really bad with cystic acne. I noticed weight loss. About 10 pounds. (This could just be related to stress though) I also did notice more anxiety than normal. I’ve been taking this pill for almost 3 months and have not received a period (my period is usually super normal and comes exactly to the date, but not since I started Junel)  My doctor is switching me to sprintec, hopefully this will help with the acne and will regulate my period.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this birth control for about 2 months. The side effects were AWFUL, I've used other birth control but none like this. I developed cystic acne and became an anxious and depressed mess. I cried almost every day and so easily. PLEASE do not take this birth control!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Couldn’t get through the first week of taking it. Crazy intense nausea and vomiting every night/morning, even when taken with a meal. Don’t recommend it to anyone.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control pill Junel Fe 24 has been the worse thing that was ever happened to my body. My doctor told me that it was going to help with my acne, which I didn't have, it made it worse. Told me the pill would make my sex life more fun. Well, that was the biggest lie of the planet. A few months in sex became painful. My vag was so dry that it became impossible to have sex without lube. Clitoral sex didn't feel good bc it became painful. Bc my vag was so dry I started bleeding after sex. I lost all my sex drive. I was crying and having anxiety attacks every couple of days. I thought my relationship was going down the drain bc of this pill. I didn't even feel anything when I was touched by my boyfriend and I used to feel happy explosions from his touch. I thought I was going crazy. I'll never trust my doctor's opinion again and I'm doing my own research before I let something do this to my body again because I really this feeling. I didn't get pregnant but I sure paid the price of losing myself.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Junel Fe 1/20 for one month. Within 2 weeks I was throwing up everyday (up to 30 times) I couldn’t keep anything down and I was soo sick I couldn’t even get out of bed, I quickly put two and two together and realized it was the birth control. I stopped it and felt better the next day. It would make me deathly sick for like 16 hours! I also bled nonstop extremely heavily for 12 days and still going..
Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my 3rd package of the pill. So far I love it! No symptoms and I missed a period. On top of that, no mood swings.

Necon 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Was prescribed Necon 1/35  twice for having irregular bleeding as a teen and in my early twenties.  In my twenties was worse and the situation I’m talking about. My problem before birth control was I’d go months without any period or bleeding and suddenly I would bleed for months straight with no cramps or pain.  I started this and both times a couple months in, during my placebo pills I had my period like I was supposed to, but the amount of bleeding was insane and the pain was worse than labor pains (especially my second time on it). I passed a clot literally the size of a softball, no joke.  I got into bath tub and within minutes water was red.  I about bled to death. I quit taking immediately.  I haven’t touched birth control pills since and I never will.  They work for many people, but not for me. The risks of birth control are not worth it for me.  I could have died.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Pirmella for about 4 months now. My periods are significantly lighter and then have stopped all together now. I’ve been taking them everyday on time. Pros: My skin is flawless, short/no periods. Cons: My moods have been up and down, i’ve gained weight. Overall it’s a pretty good birth control to be on. Please remember that everyone is different & everyone’s bodies respond differently to birth control. I give this a 9/10 so far.
a little weight gain, no mood swings but really bad break through bleeding. Stuck it out for 4 months and still no improvement, had to change brand at the end

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am taking birth control for PMDD, and I had just switched to Blisovi since my pharmacy did not have any other brands available at that moment. I was already dealing with anxiety and depression, but Blisovi made it so much worse. I started having suicidal thoughts all the time and more panic attacks and I was only on Blisovi for 2 weeks. I will never use this again.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking Junel 1/20 for 2 years now. Thought I loved it, but recently I ran out so I haven't taken it for about a week and I've noticed something I didn't even realize was missing.... MY SEX DRIVE! since I stopped taking it I want to jump my boyfriend like crazy and I hadn't even noticed its been months since we were last intimate. It didn't really clear up my acne like previous birth controls have. Weird thing is my chin got really dry? And I didn't think it was due to the birth control but coincidentally its not as dry since I haven't been taking Junel and its fall. My mood has been so stable and good!!!! I'm so emotional and irrational not on birth control and I have noticed I've been able to let things go! And it has been great. Such a great feeling! I'm so easy going. For me not having a period is a huge!! Bonus. Idk if I want to go back on it or not.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I really didn't like this Nortrel 1/35 pill. I was on Pirmella 1/35 for about three years but had to switch to a different pill due to the virus(I now get my pills from Nurx). This was "the closest thing they had to Pirmella". Bad, lingering headaches, weight gain, longer and heavier periods, and horrible acne. I never had any of these on my original pill. I also get numbness and tingling in my fingers and hands on this pill. I haven't got pregnant yet, so that's the only positive thing.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started June Fe four months ago and never had a period on the days I took the hormone free iron pills. The first month I had lots of breakthrough bleeding and bled two weeks threw up almost everyday, had headaches daily, The second month bled four days thought ohhh yes! I can get used to this, couple weeks later into the third month I bled for two weeks again in mid pack, face broke out to the point of scaring, my thoughts have been awful. I’ve been anxious and then going into the fourth month I was emotionally unstable, crying, raging, I am a step mom of four kids and a mom to a daughter of my own I can’t be acting like this or bleeding to the point I think I’m bleeding out, I was supposed to start a pack Friday before Labor Day and I didn’t , I’m not and won’t ever again. I don’t recommend it to anyone. Now hopefully I won’t get knocked up lol

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the 3rd generic I have been on. When my pharmacy switched me to Aurovela, I started bleeding through all of the active pills, and I don’t bleed on the last week of the pack. Worst pill I have ever been on . Bleeding for 3 weeks each month is horrible!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my 12th day taking Larin Fe 1/20 and my period has started the same day I started this medication.I for the last 3 days I have been feeling nauseous and light headed. I am still heavily bleeding. My doctor game me the medicine for nausea and vomiting. There is no way I can continue this medicine. But she said no matter what, don't stop taking it at least a month. I feel like they are testing this medication me. It is not worth it.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My OB/GYN Prescribed Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 to me after finding out I had a large fibroid (12cm). I took this everyday for two months to stop my periods before my surgery because I was suffering from uterine fibroids. Heavy bleeding, large clots, painful cramps and urgency to pee every 20 mins! The first month I skipped my period, it was great however the following month I had abnormal heavy bleeding and I bleed every day for the whole month! Not sure if it was caused by this pill or my fibroid getting worse but it is now 3 weeks post surgery and I’ve completely stopped taking this pill. I won’t be taking it again. Thank goodness my insurance paid for it because I feel like it didn’t work for me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never had such a bad experience ! I have been on multiple birth controls my whole life and this one made me feel  so low. I was on Yaz and loved it but was taken off it due to high DVT risk . They gave me this garbage and I noticed I was more anxious and then during my placebo/period week I got the most crippling depressive dark thoughts. I just felt like what's the point and life wasn't worth it. I blew it off at first thinking I must be becoming depressed. But every month this continued for the next 3 months. Same horrible crushing depression. My Dr. said to come off it and stay off any b.c for at least 2 months. I would NEVER recommend this to anyone.

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):let me just start out by saying, WOW.If I wanted a prescription that aggressively shook my hormones and emotions down to my core, this would have been my #1 choice..(And yes, I did mind the excessive breakouts of blemishes/cystic acne that accompanied it.)My mental clarity was in danger.Woman to woman, I HIGHLY recommend against! We're better than that.

Balziva (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched from Junel to this Balziva and things started out with no side effects.  About 3 months in I had to go to the doctor because I was bleeding heavily in the middle of my pack.  My uterus was completely filled with blood and I continued to bleed extremely heavily for 2 weeks until I started a new brand of the pill.  They said I was having a hormonal storm something seen more in menopause ( I am 21)

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Blisovi 24 Fe for about 5 months after switching from Tri-Lo-Sprintec which made my moods crazy. Blisovi 24 Fe has been nothing but good to me. I don’t get acne, I haven’t gotten pregnant (knock on wood) and my periods have become very light and only about 2 days long. Occasionally I experience headaches and nausea but any birth control will do that to you so I don’t find it a big deal. My moods have been much better and less fluctuating overall. I guess everyone really just reacts differently to it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS BIRTH CONTROL. I literally have never written a review for anything in 19 years of my life, but I needed to warn everyone researching birth controls to steer clear from this medication, especially if you are acne prone. I am on my second course of Accutane because of this awful drug. It absolutely ruined my skin, and gave me the worst cystic, hormonal acne, which I have never had in my life. It also gave me the most irregular periods that would last for weeks on and off, and made me so sad, tired, and unmotivated all the time. My cramps and mood were affected in the worst way possible, the only minor plus of this is that I didn't gain any weight. I wish I never gave this birth control a try, and I really tried to push through and see if my body would get used to it, but after 5 months, it wasn't really worth it. Please don't let this medication do its damage to your body like it did to mine and many others. It's the worst.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this Larin Fe 1/20  birth control for a year. I always struggled with anxiety and depression so at first I didn’t realize the side effects . As months passed I started experiencing extreme rage and crying spats. I hated myself and fell into a deep depression hole and didn’t go out for months. I spoke up to my best friends about it and one of them was on the same brand and said she experienced the same exact issues, she just thought she was going through a phase. We are both off it now and immediately went back to our normal selves. Highly recommend trying a different brand. We are both on the xulane patch now and at first its a little rough but now that my body has adjusted to it I can live normally. If you naturally have mental health problems I encourage you to try a different form of birth control, Larin Fe probably isn't for you either.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I only had a period every 6 months if at all on Lo Loestrin Fe. I had acne, some weight gain, and my vag was dry all the time, 0 sex drive and it wasn't normal. I took it from 16 to 18 y/o. Would rate it more than 1 for no pregnancy but I never had sex on it. I am now in my 20s and take Femynor and I love it so much, no issues

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I went through the wringer with this birth control Junel Fe 1/20. I was on tri femynor before and it caused dryness so I switched to  Junel Fe 1/20 and it destroyed my body and my mental health plummeted because I was dealing with yeast infections back to back I could not have sex without worrying about getting a yeast infection. Definitely did not work for me

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve taken this birth control for 2.5 years and have had a great experience with it. It has prevented pregnancy and completely cleared my hormonal acne within the first year of using it. The only downside has been that my period cramps and symptoms are much worse than they were off birth control. However, I now only lightly bleed 2-3 days instead of heavily bleeding for 5-7 days.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Blisovi Fe for a little over 4 months. The first 2 months on this pill I felt zero side effects except for light brown spotting around the week I would normally have my period and during the placebo week. Then beginning the next 2 months the side effects began to reveal themselves. I experienced a significantly decreased libido, no interest in my partner or sex, painful sex (during and sometimes after), mysterious pelvic pain, random nausea, mental fog, subdued emotions, an overall feeling of sadness that couldn’t be explained, and unbearable migraines on the second day of the placebo weeks which left me immobile for the entire day. The only benefits were that it cleared up my acne and protected me against pregnancy. This pill was not for me and I will be switching. For reference, I’m in my early 20’s and weigh 132lbs.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took Blisovi Fe 1/20 for 10 months. Just stopped it now.  My sex drive while taking it was non existent. Gained 10 pounds and no matter how much diet and exercise I do it doesn't go away.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):For me this Tarina Fe 1/20 is the ABSOLUTE WORST PILL EVER I just got off of it after 2 whole years starting when I was 16 years old. Before taking this pill I was happy and skinny with minor depression and anxiety that I've had my entire life and as soon as I went on this pill and everyday for the last 2 years I've had the worst depression EVER. I cry everyday and I have anxiety attacks, everything makes me cry and I had such bad anxiety I was diagnosed with tachycardia because my AVERAGE HEART-RATE WAS 150. I still have acne and cramps just not as bad. I got hives from heat exposure, bloating, spotting, no sleep, chest pains, muscle spams, dehydration, vaginal dryness . literally every negative side effect but ENHANCED .

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):PLEASE READ BEFORE STARTING LO LOESTRIN FE!My dermatologist had me on Yaz for 8 months for my acne. It was amazing until I got migraines. After that, gynecologist switched me to Lo Loestrin Fe. Within two weeks I started getting acne all over my body. I got my period before I finished all 28 pills, I got cramps, I became extremely irritable and my period was heavy. I do not recommend this birth control brand. I don’t use birth control to prevent pregnancy so I can’t speak for that. However, if you’re on birth control to regulate your cycle and help your acne, talk to your doctor about going on a different brand of birth control pills.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm not too sure how to rate it, so aim going with a 7. I am taking it for HRT and severe moods with PMS. It has helped my moods immensely! I am so pleased with this. However, I have acne now and I never have acne so I know it’s from this. I am on my second month. I am also finding it hard to lose weight,  but this could be from drinking alcohol. I’m not fully sure. I will stick with it though and I'm really hoping the acne and weight issues go away.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Don’t let the reviews scare you too much! I read through these before starting junel and I was TERRIFIED. However, I’ve been taking it for a few months and so far it’s been pretty good! I am a little bit more emotional, but other than that everything is basically normal. I was also super nervous that my stomach would hurt all the time and I’d gain weight, but I actually lost weight and I feel fine!!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Junel fe 1/20 for one year. I had never been on birth control before starting Junel. When I first started it, I experienced very mild nausea so I took it at night right before bed and that fixed that problem. My periods have always been short but very heavy, 3-4 days with medium-heavy bleeding. Junel didn’t really affect that, but it made my breasts extremely sore. It cleared up my acne, only a small break out during the placebo week. But let me tell you... the emotional roller coaster has been a nightmare. It didn’t start until about 3 months in. I would not be able to sleep at night and just cry out of unexplainable anger or sadness. I would get really really angry for no reason. Dwell on things that made me upset and become so irritable I couldn’t express what I was feeling because I didn’t even know where it was coming from. Anxiety and depression worsened the longer I was on Junel. It was terrible. I’m onto something new and prob won’t go back to Junel.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Please read!!!!! I was on Lo Loestrin Fe for a little over a year. After six months I started getting chronic yeast infections. From January to July I had over 12 yeast infections. I always had a constant uncomfortable itch and I couldn’t find out why. I was in and out of the doctors weekly. I finally thought about maybe it being my birth control pills. Sure enough I found some reviews connecting this Lo Loestrin Fe BC to women developing yeast infections. I also did not have a period and that scared me. I’ve been off of it for THREE weeks now and my yeast infections and itch are GONE! I’m hoping this is helpful! I’m waiting another month before going on a new pill to ensure the hormones are out of my body.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had very bad experiences in the past with birth control  pills (depression, weight gain etc...). I tried Lo Loestrin Fe after the birth of my daughter and was happily surprised how well my body reacted to it. I took it for 2 years and then stopped as I wanted to have a second child. Will get back to it soon. After stopping it, my periods came back as well as bad PMS. It seems like everyone has a different reaction to it, so I would suggest to test it and see with your OBGYN if this one is good for you. Because when it works it is a true relief to be able to rely on a birth control that your body likes.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been using Junel Fe 1/20 for about 5 months. I started taking it to help with PMDD, endometriosis, and fibroids. It makes me exhausted during the day and I've started having bad dreams that have progressively gotten worse to the point that they are full blown horror. I have also become progressively more emotional with alternating rage and severe depression. I had the most terrifying nightmare I've ever had last night and woke up feeling like I was losing my mind, that there was no reason to live, and I couldn't shake the feelings of dread and impending doom. Thank goodness I know this is not right and I'm not crazy. After doing my research, I've found that I'm not alone. This happens more than science would like to admit. Although it eased my symptoms from fibroids and endometriosis, it caused side effects that most definitely outweighed any benefits (and it never helped the PMDD). I WILL NEVER TAKE THAT PILL AGAIN. NEVER, EVER, EVER.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this Blisovi 24 Fe pill for around 8 months now and before this I was around 115 pounds and since then I have gained over 20 pounds and am around 137 now. I cannot fit in a lot of my clothes anymore and have always had a fast metabolism, but this is the most weight I have gained in my whole life in such a short time. I got on it to try and help with my periods and of course not get pregnant and at first it kind of helped make my periods lighter, but recently I was on my period for almost 2 weeks and it was heavy every day, I had severe cramping and no painkillers really helped me. I have since stopped this pill for about a week now to try and get back to how I was before and have lost like 3 pounds already. I DO NOT recommend this pill unless maybe you are really underweight maybe. But still the side effects are awful.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took a while for my periods to become regular on Taytulla after having paraguard  but they finally did and were only 1-3 days and some months none at all. I’m 31 and definitely hasn’t helped my acne which makes me frustrated but to not have a period or have a light one is a win...

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on this pill by my obgyn for my extremely painful and irregular periods and because I’m going off to college soon. This is the first time I’ve ever taken any form of birth control so I didn’t really know what to expect. I took the pill for a little over a week and a half before stopping because I started feeling some extreme side effects. I was having severe anxiety, depression, and suicidal thoughts to the point where I had to be prescribed anti-anxiety meds to get me through the day. I couldn’t eat or sleep and some days I couldn’t even pull myself out of bed. I ended up losing about 10-15 pounds. This was the scariest and darkest moment of my life, it felt like I would never get better. It took me months to actually feel like myself again. I definitely do not recommend this pill to anyone, there is better options out there for you.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just finished my 4th month on this Junel Fe 1/20 pill and have been so keen to start a new one. Since the beginning, I’ve had horrible cramps that keep me up all night. The weird thing is that they start about a week before my period. My breasts have been so sore constantly and it scares me. Last night I couldn’t lean forward because it hurt so bad. I’ve been getting yeast infections which I never got before this pill. Not to mention, I’ve been on different pills for over 10 years and have never had issues until this one. I’ve also gained 15 lbs. Not sure if that’s because of the birth control, but that’s when it started, no matter how hard I’d work to lose weight. I’ve never struggled with my weight before. I can’t wait too switch back to one that I trust.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to Junel 1/20 after being on another pill for years. Everyone convinced me to switch, as I was tired and a bit moody on my other pill. However stitching to Junel has been a huge regret. I couldn’t last longer than 3 months on it. When I first started, I threw up several mornings and felt so sick. My skin (jaw/chin) broke out terribly, and I’ve NEVER broken out on my chin before. My periods were heavy and cramps were unbelievably painful. I was constantly crying and my rage was out of control. I have a short temper, but I have never seen myself turn into such a raging angry person over the tiniest things than I did on this pill. My anxiety was awful, my nipples were in so much pain and super sensitive (this got better after the first month or so). Always groggy and tired. Hair loss. Can’t really think of one positive of this pill. Everyone’s different, and I’ve had several friends who love this pill. But I gave it 3 months and couldn’t handle any more of it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was previously on Sprintec, and didn't realize how depressed Sprintec made me feel until I switched to Lo Loestrin Fe. This one is sooo much better for me! I don't notice any side effects other than a slightly decreased sex drive. I no longer get a period, which is a plus. Not much to say other than it treats me well.
Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel was great for me

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I can’t even begin to understand how this Loestrin 24 Fe is even consider Medicine. First, previously my mental health was in great place. Larin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Larin Fe 1.5/30 has been my second experience on birth control, after I had a terrible 9 month long experience with the depo shot. It cleared up my acne for the most part; I still get a few spots here and there but I'm not blaming the pill. I don't see any negative effects on my weight or appetite. I love this pill, I've never had a problem with it and even when I have been inconsistent and possibly a little irresponsible, I still haven't gotten pregnant, so that's why I love this pill. However, since I am really bad at remembering to take it on time, I'm considering switching to an IUD.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My first month on Larin Fe 1/20 was no problems the 2nd month the breast pain and horrible ,fatigue and headaches out of no where started . Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor prescribed this  Blisovi Fe 1/20 BC pill  because I have  secondary amenorrhea. This didn’t go away til a WHOLE day has passed, I also had a loss of appetite because of this pill, couldn’t eat regular (healthy) food right to relief the nausea a bit  for 2 1/2 days. (in my opinion) this pill isn’t the ‘safest’... so I’d think twice before taking this.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Currently on this birth control Junel 1/20 for about 4 months now and realized this birth control made my acne HORRIBLE. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If your doctor prescribes this to you, tell them you need a different one and DO NOT TAKE IT! Brevicon (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I don’t recommend, constantly exhausted on this pill Brevicon, if you miss a pill, spot for weeks on end.  Feels like I’m constantly pms’ing from it.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Junel fe 1/20 for 9 years and loved it, never had a single issue on it even when I first started. Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed this birth control Tarina Fe 1/20 after giving birth to my daughter (I was taking Sprintec before pregnancy). I am not a fan of  Tarina Fe 1/20, side effects are I’ve gained significant weight, mood swings are terrible, and my period lasts longer than usual. I’d say the only plus is that it does help with menstrual cramps - I can’t feel a thing and it has cleared my skin. I’ll be taking this for another few months before asking my doctor to switch me back to Sprintec.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first day I started Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 my anxiety started skyrocketing. Every day I was on it for the week after that I had to make and large effort to ward off panic attacks and to manage my physical symptoms. My libido also decreased, likely in part because I was feeling so bad but also in part I think due to the hormones. This pill did not work for me. Since stopping it I feel like my normal self again.

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Loestrin Fe 1/20 is the best birth control pill I’ve tried. I was able to skip my periods (not take the placebo pills) and that made me not have any more PMS headaches. No depression or irritable moods like I has on Ortho Tri Cyclen. I did develop high blood pressure after 3 years on it when I went through a time of stress. Not sure if due to the pill, but get regular blood pressure checks if you take any birth control pills as it can be a side effect.

Larin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):On Larin 1/20 I had really bad mood swings.. so bad that I had to switch birth controls. I became lazy and I didn’t want anything. I became very emotional but I didn’t gain weight.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before I was on the Junel Fe 1.5/30 pill I read these reviews and was so so scared with all the negative things people were experiencing because this was my first time being on birth control. The positive effects I have had were that my breast grew a little bigger (I'd probably say I went up from a B to a C cup), my period has completely stopped with only slight spotting, and I haven't seen any changes with gaining weight, no hair loss, no mood changes, and etc. So far so good! Just remember that everyone's experience is different. You'll find the best pill for you :)

Microgestin 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this Microgestin 1.5/30 for 2 years now and it’s been amazing! To this day its been amazing. They’re about 2-5 days long now, with light to medium bleeding (medium for me is a super instead of a regular tampon was needed). It’s great I highly recommend. I’ll say it takes a minute for your period to come around , took me 7 months to get a steady cycle finally. Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill for 5 days and still very heavy bleeding how long does it take for that to stop?

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):PLEASE READ IF YOU STRUGGLE WITH MENTAL HEALTH!! I was on Lo Lo for a little over a year and a half. Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I did not do well on this pill, my pharmacy suddenly switched me over to this drug about 4 months ago. Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I began taking this birth control when I was 17 (I am now 20) because my periods were normally 10-15 days long, very heavy, and very painful. I also experienced symptoms like migraines, bloating, and swelling in my breasts, but my periods were much more bearable. Overall it accomplished what I initially wanted, but I think it’s caused me more harm than good.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was very nervous to start this pill due to the large amount of negative comments about it. For me, this pill has definitely decreased my appetite. Don't let the negative reviews scare you away, it reacts differently for everyone!

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Prior to Pirmella, I had an irregular period and it was almost a MONTH of heavy bleeding (became anemic). Took the pills and the bleeding stopped. Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):A good friend of mine's daughter just recently died from Larin Fe side affects. Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking birth control at 17 due to a genetic condition I have (Familial Mediterranean Fever). Since I was 15-16, every month my period (the estrogen rise and drop) would trigger an episode. I did my research and got on birth control to stop my periods and since then (I am almost 19) I RARELY experience episodes.  Overall, birth control has completely changed my life for the better. Yet, aside from the fact that birth control has prevented my episodes for the most part, I experienced extreme depression, anxiety, and disassociation (brain fog, forgetfulness) the first three months I was on it. Over the course of those three months, it gradually got better. I am no longer depressed, forgetful, or disassociated, but I do experience mood swings, outbursts, occasional anxiety, and I cry very very easily. I have noticed that recently my emotions have gotten worse and I've been on this for a year and a half. I may speak with my doctor, but the pros weigh out the cons.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After stopping breastfeeding my doctor said I needed to switch bc from mini pill to something else. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):AMAZED. I cannot say enough great things about this birth control. Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 46 & started having my period every other week with excessive bleeding. My OB wanted to regulate. Loestrin 21 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Chances are if you are reading this review it is because you were like me. Larin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When I first started taking this BC I liked the fact that I had 0 side effects like I did with the last few I tried. Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Larin FE back in Nov 2019. First time being on BC. Struggled with hormonal acne and just wanted better protection with my sex life. Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started using this Junel 1/20 a couple months after having my first baby. At first it made me pretty nauseous the first couple of months. Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):One month on this Loestrin Fe 1/20 dosage and so far it hasn’t been too bad. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am anemic and would pass out on my period from blood loss. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve tried several types of birth control and this was the only one that didn’t give me terrible side effects. I works very well. The generic brand, Lerin was terrible for me but the brand name was great!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hi everyone, well I took this pill Junel Fe 1.5/30 for about 6 months no side effects however it’s left me with no period. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Don’t let reviews scare you off, I know that they are different for everyone  but when I read these before I started taking it I was terrified. Periods so much better and I was very scared of the hormones making me crazy but they did not at all. This birth control is great

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This will be my 3rd year on this birth control Junel 1/20  & it has worked well for me so far. I was prescribed this my freshman year of college & I am now a senior. It did an amazing job of regulating my period & making them super light & short. As of this year, I’ve noticed that nothing with my periods has been consistent. In January & February my period was heavy & lasted a full week - this never happened before. In March, I completely missed my period - also has never happened before. In April & May my period came as normal but this month my boobs have been very sore & tender for weeks. I am not pregnant (got my period + negative tests), I am starting to wonder if the pill is causing all of these changes. My hormones have never been this bad & I am starting to get so much anxiety recently. Hoping to talk to my doctor to see what’s up. Overall, this really did work for me when I was younger. In my 20’s now and wondering if it’s time to switch it up & get a new medication.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor switched me to this pill to try to relieve perimenopausal symptoms by giving me more estrogen. While I don't have night sweats anymore, that gives it a 2 rating. But my periods are extremely painful and mid-cycle I get extreme cramps too with spotting. I also immediately gained 5+ lbs. It's been almost 6 months and this is the worst!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe1/20 has been absolutely awful for me. The first few weeks I felt mostly okay, my sex drive was normal and I felt a little more emotional than normal but nothing too extreme. Then I had the most intense body aches I’d ever experienced. I was unable to move from my bed for almost a week. No position was comfortable, nothing helped, and I just cried all day. I experienced a lot of breakthrough bleeding and my breasts became incredibly sensitive and sore and have stayed like that the entire time I’ve been on the pill. The second month in I started experiencing intense panic attacks and OCD like symptoms as well as severe depression. This has lasted through the third and forth months and I haven’t gone a day without weeping or having a panic attack in two months. My appetite has been gone for about a month now too. Zero sex drive, lots of dryness. Overall it’s been absolutely awful and I would not recommend at all. I’ve never been so mentally unstable in my life.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The Tarina Fe 1/20 was the first birth control pill I’ve gotten on. It wasn’t too bad. All though I gained around 10 or 15 pounds after being on it for a year (recently just started the Blisovi Fe pill), it did clear up my acne pretty good. But I would get very emotional at times where I would literally tear up for the slightest thing then become moody the next second. My period was only 4 days instead of being 7 days and I would get cramps but they weren’t too bad and my periods weren’t too heavy but not too light. Also my sex drive didn’t decreased! Hopefully this helps someone! :)

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):READ IF YOU'RE A YOUNG WOMAN LOOKING FOR BIRTH CONTROL!!  I’ve been on Lo loestrin Fe for a year now, and I really like it. I had no acne breakouts, weight gain, and no serious depression or anything. The only thing is that sometimes I will cry a lot and become a bit sensitive. I started lolo for prevent pregnancy and everything has been good so far. I have not gotten my period, or spotted once since being on this pill which is a bit strange but the doctor said it was normal. I would definitely recommend this to anyone young (I am 18) if you are looking for a pill. I know reviews can be really intimidating but you really have to try the pills for yourself and see what is best for your body!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible. Do not recommend. At all. Save yourself.Just started month 3 and it has been AWFUL. So glad I found this.
