Sex was great until this pill!My Side Effects: major vaginal dryness (going on 3 months), no sex drive/interest/pleasure, breast tenderness/PAIN/enlargement, nausea, headache, bloating, fetal-position cramps, mental changes/mood swings, trouble concentrating, tired/weak ALL of the time, irritable, anxious, discouraged, I could go on.I was starting to question myself, my body, my mind, my relationship, felt like I just could NOT get better. I'm disappointed it took me so long to realize this was the only change. Good thing is I'm not pregnant.. but hard to get pregnant when you can't have sex (insert shrug emoji)

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill Junel Fe 1/20 for 6 months because my insurance stopped covering my previous birth control. I’ve been on birth control for about 6 years now and I’ve never experienced any weird side effects until I was switched to this pill. I began to suffer from migraines every time I was on my placebo pills, breasts were super tender before I got my period, I didn’t feel like myself got mood swings and irritated by things that us usually wouldn’t bother me. Also lost my sex drive ALOT. Overall my experience has been great and I’ve chosen to switch to a different birth control pill.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on this generic Ministren for a while now. I didn't have any side effects transitioning onto Mibelas, as it is the same amount of active ingredient. I love this pill because I don't suffer severe PMS symptoms and I do not get pregnant. I also rarely get a period at all. I jokingly refer to it as being "on my fake period" because I do not bleed. I do get a little moody or anxious 2 days before I start the sugar pills. However I immediately feel better once I start a new pill pack. I normally wait the 4 days to allow my body to reset but even so, I don't bleed. I am 30 now and have been on BC for almost the majority of my life. It's a luxury to not worry about becoming pregnant.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started on this BC Blisovi 24 Fe after having my 3rd child. She’s a year old and within the last year I have developed severe anxiety, depression, outbursts and mood swings. To the point I feel like I’m going crazy and I can’t get a grip. I’ve been so up and down. I had no idea why I felt like this until I stopped taking it for a week and a half then started back and all my symptoms came back.  It’s taken a toll on my kids, my marriage and myself as I kept thinking I wasn’t worthy of being a wife, mom and I just didn’t want to be here! I’m so glad I figured out it was the birth control making me feel this way cause I have been on a down hill spiral!!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe was my first birth control and at first it worked really well for me. However, I soon noticed that it made my acne terrible. My periods started to get more irregular, they almost never came on my placebo week. It also made me cry almost daily for no reason, I was just really sad all of the time. When I stopped taking it my acne decreased and I didn’t feel the urge to cry all of them time. Works differently for everyone, but it wasn’t terrible compared to other birth controls I’ve taken.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I’ve been using this for about 4 months and it’s been really good for me and has helped me with my acne I haven’t gained any weight my periods are better I definitely would recommend this one but it may not be the best for you but for me it’s perfect I haven’t gotten pregnant while being on it and I do the pull out method

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I experienced weight gain, water retention and enlarged uterus. However, the acne cleared and I did not experience any mood swings as I have done with other birth controls.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was only on this BC for a month and I had to stop. I was on Natazia for 8-ish years, and after some issues with my period being inconsistent my obgyn suggested to switch. My mood swings were insane. I was happy one second and then insanely mad the next. I would stay mad for days, and the smallest things would irritate me. I’ve been off this BC for a week, and I’m already feeling more like myself. I still get agitated now and then, but I’m also still on my period, so I’m just contributing that to PMS. I didn’t gain weight, but I also didn’t lose weight. I’m on weight control medicine to help me lose weight, and generally I lose around 10 pounds a month, but this month I lost nothing and I honestly contribute that to the BC. This pill is making me strongly considering getting off of BC for good or to go back to Natazia and deal with inconsistent periods. I do NOT recommend.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First month on Lo Lo was great, bad side effects started hitting month 2. Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for a year now. My skin is clear and I haven’t had a pregnancy. Because of this I have been pretty happy with it until I realized I gained 25 lbs. For perspective, I started at 115 so 25 lbs is a huge gain for me. I started researching side effects of this birth control and I realized that this is likely the cause of other issues in my life. My sex drive has been at an all time low. I don’t want to give or receive oral, sex feels like a chore, and I’m not even turned on by the thought of it anymore. Additionally, my breasts are constantly sore. Lastly, I had to get prescribed an anxiety medication a few months ago. I have always had anxiety but I have been able to keep it under control until recently. If I was cognizant of these symptoms a while back I would’ve stopped. I’m so discouraged that this birth control could’ve disrupted my relationship and my self esteem.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst pill ever. Taken it for the past 5 months- causes weight gain and depression, but the worst thing is that I am bleeding CONSTANTLY. I will literally bleed 22 days of the month and spot for another 6. I'm about ready to tear my uterus out.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was extremely skeptical to start taking birth control. I have struggled with pretty severe anxiety, depression, mood swings, and suicidal tendencies for a long time. After reading many negative reviews of a variety of brands, I was very reluctant to try it. I've been taking Blisovi 24 Fe for a month now and I am shocked by the results. I am the happiest and most even-tempered I have been in a very long time! I no longer have moods swings, I have not had any suicidal thoughts, and my depression and anxiety have slowly faded away. I have been prescribed actual anti-depression/anxiety meds in the past which only made me worse, so I am so shocked that this pill actually helped me! I don't think there's any telling how you will react to the pill or a certain brand of it until you try it. But if you are scared to, don't be! I'm so happy I decided to push past my fears and give it a try! Worst comes to worst, you can just stop taking it.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This Blisovi Fe 1/20 pill was awful for me. I always took Microgestin but CVS switched me to this because it’s what they keep in stock. I assumed that since it’s a generic for the same birth control as Microgestin that everything would be fine. It took me a few months to realize it, but the switch to Blisovi was the cause for my awful hormonal acne breakouts and yeast infections! I had NEVER experienced a yeast infection before, but I had three within the 6 months I was on this pill. When I spoke to my doctor she told me that generics for name brand pills all have the same active ingredients, but they have different inactive ingredients which explains why it affected me. Needless to say I switched back to Microgestin and it’s worth the headache of arguing with CVS to get it.

Necon 0.5/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This BC changed my life and not for the better. No weight gain, but the mood swings are AWFUL. I’m a big empath, so I’ve always cried easily, but never like this. I’m talking tears in 2.5 seconds over the littlest things. I also think my PMS has worsened severely. The first three months put my skin through absolute hell and I’ve never been one for breakouts. I started this because I was having menstrual migraines on my previous pill that I had taken for 5+ years. My doctor suggested switching it up. I’ve now been on this for 9 months, and I’m prepared to switch when these last 3 months are up. If you are an emotional person, it is no not worth it! I’m also on no other medications.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took blisovi for 1 week and stopped. This drug effected me very badly. Symptoms:1. Pulse hear in ears2. Swollen feet2. Felt like I was punched in the Adams apple and my voice became hoarse.5. I cried for absolutely no reason6. I wanted to dump my fiance of 4 years because suddenly I thought he was useless. I also wanted to get rid of my friends... it changed my perception of people and increased anxiety and overthinking7. I also had weird interactive nightmares if I was even able to fall asleep.After stopping this I went back to normal and life was good again. Thankfully my friends and fiance are still in my life and I feel better.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After a long time of being off birth control, I decided it was time to go back on in an effort to help my Endometriosis which had become 20 times worse since having my baby. I was drawn to Lo Lo due to it being an ultra low dose pill with the lowest estrogen on the market. I only made it a month before I had to stop. It made me exhausted all day long even when I switched to taking at night to try and counteract that. It gave me weird leg cramps but worse than that, it also gave me horrible anxiety and panic attacks. I went from never struggling with panic attacks to calling an ambulance on myself in the grocery store because I literally couldn’t breathe. It was embarrassing and awful. I had to stop that day. As soon as I did, no more panic attacks. Everyone is different and everyone will react to differently to this pill. It just didn’t work for me. Currently trialing another pill with a different progestin in it

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m a healthy 21 year old NON SMOKING female, After being on Junel Fe going on 2 years I developed super intense migraines non stop for a month, eventually it led to me not being able to keep food or liquid down for 3 days straight. When I had went to the hospital I was in critical condition and they ran a MRI; they notice I had a very large blood clot in my brain and a minimal stroke. I was on no other medications other than birth control. The professionals knew that I indeed had this blood clot thanks to my birth control Junel FE 1/20 . A year later I am happy to say with the help of Coumadin (Blood thinner medication) my clot is now gone. Always ask the risks of taking these medications and please do your research. Three positive things I can say about the medication was the fact my cramps weren’t terrible, my period was shortened and It was always on time.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I absolutely hate this medication. They gave it to me because my Junel Fe was on backorder. I didn't use this for the purpose of preventing pregnancy, but it didn't even work for the things I needed it for. Everyone is different, but I have never experienced such dark emotions in my life, and this was a horrible experience.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Nortrel about three months ago and have gained 30 pounds, completely lost my appetite, and also restart my period the second I stop taking my pills and the exact same time. I was on Marlissa before this and while it gave me more anxiety it was nowhere as bad as Nortrel.
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The worst pill ever , I been having period with heavy flow twice a month.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just started my third month of Junel Fe 1/20. The first month I was very nauseous, especially at night, even though my doctor told me to take it at night to avoid nausea. I still experience the nausea, but not as often as I did the first month and I avoid eating gooey, creamy things in the evening around the time I take my pill, which I notice does help a lot. However, if it’s really bothering me, a dose of pepto bismol usually does the trick. I feel that my skin is breaking out more often than normal.. not badly, but I definitely notice it. Usually I only get 1 or two small pimples around my period but now I get 4 each month, especially around my chin. My periods are definitely lighter and only last about 4-5 days but I’m still experiencing cramping. I didn’t notice any mood swings or weight gain.. I actually feel sexier these past couple of weeks. Sex drive is the same, energy levels are the same.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Now what I wasn’t expecting is the AMAZING things it did to my FACE FEATURES!!!! I have had a weird face elongation the last year and a half and I was like yeah I guess it’s a part of growing a little old ( I’m 25 y/o) but still was annoyed of what my face looked like, after starting this pill I have noticed my face bones were shifting back in and up and thought maybe It’s all in my mind, but then I would take close-up selfies with no makeup or anything and compare them to other selfies I took couple days ago and the difference is SHOCKING !!! I have always had a pretty round feminine face which I thought I was never getting back after that whole year and a half of  weird elongation !! I can finally say I got my 22 y/o face back and really can’t stop looking in the mirror, feels like I had a surgery or something lol

I will be asking about switching from junel asap, hopefully a different pill will give me back my sex drive? besides the negative side effects, I’m not pregnant, so that’s good.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Honestly Junel FE 1.5/30  is the best birth control I've ever had! No side effects. I’ve been taking this bc for about 4 years now and it’s great! I have not taken any other birth control because I love this one so much !

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):wishing I would have read reviews on Junel Fe 1.5/30 before taking this pill. Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the WORST birth control I have ever taken. I have been between 3 different types due to insurance. Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this birth control Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 for 3 months now I must admit this is the best birth control pill ever my weight says the same haven’t had any headaches my boobs are sore sometimes my period was normally heavy but now I’m 2 days if that spotting I highly recommend best decision I made

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Taytulla for almost a year now and overall I do really like it! Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control since November, and so far I have had a good experience. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have PCOS and my doctor decided to put me on this and try it out. Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for almost 5 years now. No weight gain, no negative side effects, and super light periods. I can’t imagine taking anything else!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had to go off of Blisovi for anxiety/depression that the pill caused me to have after about 7-8 months of being on it without any previous mental health history before then. I took a break from birth control pills to let my body re-regulate without the birth control and went on fluoxetine to help control the anxiety. I went off of fluoxetine and was prescribed Junel even though it's a generic from Blisovi, and was told there is still a slight a chance I wouldn't notice any side effects with this pill. However, after being on the pill for a week and 1/2 I stopped mid-pack because I already had two days in a row this week where I felt a random spike in anxiety and struggled to feel as motivated. I noticed myself a lot more down and moody for no reason as well. Do not be afraid to prioritize your mental health over anything, because I would rather experience the most painful periods and always use condoms over ever having the same feeling that Blisovi and Junel made me feel ever again.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this birth control Junel Fe 1/20  for 3 months it worked however the side effect for me was it made my acne worse. Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill worked well for me. I was first put on the pill to help heavy periods and for contraception. I’ve tried various brands with bad side effects until this one that I was on for 2 years.Loestrin really agreed with me! I didn’t get any spotting, no skin problems and I found it easier to lose weight with a small amount of effort. It didn’t help much with my heavy periods but no pill has. It was good being able to control when my period came. You have to be quite accurate with when you take it everyday though. You also have to give it about 4 months to settle. The mini pill before this which was horrific. The mini pill gave me oily skin, acne and greasy hair within hours of washing. Loestrin was a relief and stopped all those symptoms.  I’ve now been off the pill for a year as I wasn’t having sex that much and wanted to see what I’m like natural after 10 years of various pill taking. It’s made me realise how much Loestrin helped with my skin and weight!

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you have bad hormonal acne, please read! Recently, I have been dealing with terrible hormonal acne around my mouth and chin, basically my whole lower face was absolutely terrible. After using  Clindamycin Phosphate and Tretinin gel along with Minocycline topical for 2-3 months I saw no result. Finally asked the Dr to prescribe me birth control and within 3 weeks of using it, I began seeing some improvement. It’s now two months later (still early) but my skin has changed DRASTICALLY. I now have hardly any active acne, maybe 2 or 3 bumps overall. Now, the rest of my past acne is just fading acne scars now. I am still using the other treatments paired with this birth control, but I did not start seeing improvements until I began taking this pill. My skin is getting so much better. I will update this in a few months when hopefully my acne is gone. If you have bad acne, take the leap of faith! :)

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this medication for almost 6 months. This pill finally stabilized my periods. Everything was going good until the 4-5th month I began experiencing a horrible increase in appetite. I noticed I gained weight on my face and that my acne got much worse especially on my neck (which I never used to get). Being such a low dosage, I didn’t expect for this pill to have such a high impact on my body but I was wrong. Birth control works differently on everyone but I still would not recommend this pill.
Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Tarina Fe 1/20  for close to 2 months and I puke every night because of it I don’t know if that’s normal but it’s very annoying

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):5 months ago I got on Junel to regulate my irregular/heavy periods which never happened and the last two months I was on it I had 2 very long breakthrough periods that lasted from 14-21 days. This was the first BC I had ever taken so the hormones was something I was not used to but did adjust to, I noticed I was more emotional and would get upset about things more than ever but eventually that passed but I did have more energy. I didn’t really gain weight but I did notice that I would eat more than usual. As far as acne I would get a pimple here and there but never bad breakouts. Junel did help decrease the pain in my cramps, it never shortened my period but it did make it lighter. It caused my boobs to always be tender all the time, it also decreased my libido. Overall I don't hate Junel it just didn’t really work out for me. The only reason I am being taken off of Junel is because of the breakthrough bleeding and was advised that isn’t normal for that to happen so often.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Great experience throughout 4 years of use - the first and only form of BC I’ve ever used. Starting on BC I was prescribed Minastrin 24 Fe, then sometimes I get sent generic, sometimes Mibelas 24 Fe (it’s all exactly the same, just different manufacturers). Slight mood swings and spotting in the first few months starting out, but felt totally normal again soon after. No weight gain, no unusual skin reactions, nothing. Going 4 years strong and the experience taking this BC has been seamless in my life. Unfortunately, usually only the rare few dissatisfied individuals leave reviews, so I wanted to speak up to praise this product.

Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Just say No!I am not able to sleep at nightAlways tired probably bc I can’t sleep Have headaches I’m always hotMy appetite increased No sex driveJust say NO, but I guess everyone is different. Not for me.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is the best! I had pretty bad acne, maybe borderline cystic, and ever since starting this birth control Mirabelas 24 FE , my skin has been clear! It also helped me put on weight because I was on the skinnier than average side. I also don’t get period, which I’m not sure if that’s a good or bad thing, but for me, it’s good because I get zero cramps as opposed to the TERRIBLE cramps I used to get. Just consult with your Gyno first!

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill Tarina FE 1/20 for almost two years now. I have never been on a pill where I still felt like myself. The first few months I was on it, it took some time for my body to handle the hormones and some nausea, but afterwards I was fine. I also lost close to 15 lbs when starting the pill, I will say the only bad thing about it was not having a big appetite, the longer I was on it however, that changed. I also have my period regularly on the sugar pill week, and experience no side effects to it anymore. I love this pill/form of birth control, I have never been on a form of birth control where I didn’t feel overwhelmed with emotions, Tarina Fe on the other hand has allowed my mental health to remain as was, even while on it. I’m happy, feel energized, and I will never go back to another form of pill or birth control ever again.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this medicine  Nortrel 1/35 in January 2020 it is now April 2020 and I have gained 20 pounds since being on this medication. I will be stopping after this pack is over. When I initially started I had the worst cramps and nausea. It did get better and served its  purpose.  But a side effect of weight gain is not my favorite.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I began taking LoLo to help with severe PMS symptoms. I was totally fine the first 3 weeks of taking my first pack but as I started into my 4th week I began breaking out in a rash all over my arms, legs, and even my ears. Literally overnight I got horrible stomach cramps and breast tenderness that was so bad it kept me from sleeping. And it never went away! My appetite has been through the roof and I'm constantly tired. Not only did it not help my symptoms it made things 10 times worse. After two months of being in constant pain I can't take it anymore. I'll be moving on to something else.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):One of the worst birth controls. I’ve been on Larin fe for a month now and I’ve already gained 6 pounds. I always feel bloated and myself esteemed has dropped to a whopping zero. I was on Junel fe before this but my insurance stopped covering And they said this was the generic brand but that doesn’t seem right. I’ve been crying about myself, I’m always worried about my weight and it’s horrible. Definitely not recommend but at least I’m not pregnant even though I feel and look it.

Aurovela Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this birth control for 2 months now!! I really like! I am 21 and I have been so nervous to get on birth control for forever. So far, I have not had any side effects other than my breasts being sore. I definitely recommend this for birth control.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wanna start by saying EVERYONE has a different body. My sister takes the generic brand of Loestrin and LOVES IT!! My friend got the shot and swears by it. I only took the pills for 12 days and I’m stopping MID PACK. Here is what I noticed. 1. I was getting cramps and they hurt kind of bad. 2. I was nauseous and didn’t want to eat sometimes because I was scared to vomit. 3. I have started spotting and not stopped yet 4. I am breaking out again and I have always struggled with acne. I got my skin clear a bout a year ago with spironolactone and epiduo so seeing my skin sh*t itself in 12 days was the one of the last straws. LASTLY my mother said she gained weight on BC so considering genetics I wanted to keep my body how it was.  I  called a pharmacist and he told me the worst thing that would happen if stopped mid pack would be mood swings due to an imbalance of hormones. Good luck ladies !!

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been on less strong pills before switching to this one, and I wish I never switched. This pill is absolutely awful. Prolonged bleeding and continuous spotting, terrible. TERRIBLE. constipation and bloating, and extreme anxiety and depression. Only pro is that my skin has been doing better. I wouldn’t give this pill to my worst enemy.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My 18 year old daughter was prescribed Larin Fe 1/20 to control cramping and acne.  This was in May 2019.  In September 2019 while at college she was complaining of shortness of breath. The school's health center gave her  an inhaler.  By October she was having trouble breathing walking around campus.  On October 18th she called me and said she couldn't walk to her bathroom without feeling like she couldn't breathe.  She went to the heath center, which sent her directly to the Emergency Room.  She was diagnosed with bilateral Pulmonary Embolisms!!!!   All a result of taking this drug.  She had no other social or medical factors that would have given her these embolisms.  She ended up in a cardiac cath lab and ICU to pump medicine into her lungs to dissolve these clots.  DO NOT TAKE THIS MEDICINE.  If this could happen to my daughter, who was a very active, athletic 18 year old - who never smoked or vaped and no family or medical history - this could happen to you!!!!

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this  Tarina Fe 1/20 pill for 4 months now. My periods have definitely become a lot lighter since taking the pill. They were irregular for the first two months but the last couple of months they have been normal and are lighter than they used to be. The pill has caused me to gain some weight (about 5 pounds) since I started taking it. This all happened within the first month and my weight has stayed the same since. The pill does cause some random cramps. But it does everything it’s supposed to do.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have taken this birth control before and I was not a huge fan so I decided that when I need to start taking it again I would. After about 6 months I decided to get back on birth control. This time around less than a week later I started experiencing horrible mood swings. I have depression and multiple anxiety disorders and since starting this pill it made them all so much worse. I also got really bad sweats and my acne got worse. I didn’t notice any weight changes. I also experienced spotting this time around which was odd. I would not recommend this to a friend.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking Junel fe for almost 3 months now and the only problem I’ve had was sore breasts. My period came the first month but the second month I only bled the first day and spotted throughout the rest of the 7 days. I also had mood swings the first month but after that I was fine.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wanted to share my experience with this birth control because of the bad reviews. I’ve been on it for about two months now and the only bad side effect I’ve had is sore breasts (they are REALLY sore before my period, to the point I need to put ice on them). Other than that, I’ve really liked this pill. I’m a 23 y/o with an average diet and I workout 3-4 times a week. I haven’t had any weight gain or issues with cravings on it yet. My sex drive doesn't feel like it’s changed, but I also have a pretty high one so maybe it’s just become more normal.  I had some light spotting when I first started the pill but it regulated quickly. I previously took Camilla and spotted ALL the time, even after using the pill religiously for a year. My gynecologist said it’s possible on June that I’ll get to the point where I have no periods at all. Overall, I’ve had a pretty good experience so I would just recommend trying it if your doctor thinks it could work best with your body.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I recently had to switch to this birth control Junel Fe 24 from Lo Loestrin because my insurance would no longer cover it. Btw Lo Loestrin wasn’t good for me either. It made me severely depressed and anxious.  Anyways, I’m towards the end of my second pack and I haven’t got my period once. My sex drive is also low and every time I have sex it hurts so bad (which I read is a side effect of this pill) I'm switching to a different birth control brand and if that doesn’t work out for me I’m seriously gonna freak out

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been using NuvaRing for the past 7 years which I loved. I'm about to lose my insurance so I decided to make the switch back to the pill for a cheaper out of pocket expense. I heard horror stories about this pill but wanted to share my experience since it's been nothing but great! Although I loved NuvaRing, I had zero sex drive and was constantly bloated whether I was on my period or not. Since starting Junel, the bloating has stopped and my sex drive is up. I haven't noticed any mood swings or increased anxiety or sadness. I do experience breakouts but only when I'm on the week break before my next pack. My period is about 4 days long, it immediately starts, like a couple hours after the first placebo, but again it only lasts 3-4 days. All in all, this pill has been really effective for me. I know everyones experience with birth control is different but wanted to share a positive experience about this pill specifically.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 Saved my skin! I never had problematic skin, but I changed my birth control a few months back to blisovi fe 1.5/30 and it caused me to have enlarged, swollen cystic pimples. I was hopeless, nothing was working. I finally decided to change birth controls again, realizing my skin problems arose after going on blisovi. My skin is now finally clearing up after going on this birth control. I haven’t had any bad side effects!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the first time I've ever tried birth control in order to curb my PMDD symptoms. In terms of doing that, I wasn't getting depressed and suicidal like I usually would a week before my period (I was still agitated tho. That might tie into me getting off my anxiety meds). I experienced no nausea but what I did experience were longer periods. I was taking it continuously with no breaks (advised by my OBGYN) but the first two months I had 7 day periods (albeit light). And then.....my third month.....17 days in counting I have had my period.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m 20 and I’m on my second pack of this pill Tarina, just started the third row. Ever since I started this pack, my acne has become VERY bad. My jaw is full of acne and there’s some above it on my lower cheeks. I’m happy that we’re being advised to stay indoors because I would be so embarrassed if people saw me this way. HOWEVER, I started taking this because of cramps and this pill made my last period a breeze. I didn’t even have to take any pain relievers(!!!)

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m not great with keeping a SPECIFIC time but I always take this pill between 11:30am and 12pm. This pill should take about 3-6 months to regulate in your body. Within those months it’s normal to feel some mood swings, slight changes in period, &/or weight gain so don’t worry. Prior to this pill, my periods were 5-7 days tops. First period while being on this pill lasted 2 weeks, the second lasted a week. From the third month moving forward my periods last about 3-5 days tops with no ovulation. My period dates also shift a bit. I didn’t notice any mood swings until about the 6th month. To today I sometimes feel sad or depressed & I won’t know why. I also cry a lot easier now. It’s nothing I’m concerned over tho, not too bad, & the mood swings are easy for me to quickly get over. Positive side effect: my breasts have gotten noticeably bigger. My bf has also finished in me multiple times with no pregnancy outcome so the pill has been doing it’s job. I’d recommend

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This medication Mirelas 24 Fe is HORRIBLE. This took months off of my life that I will never ever get back. This put me through the worst 2 depressive episodes I have ever experiences. Not being able to THINK, not being able to function, literally in a daze, not being able to do basic things like shower, this thing made me emotionally numb for months. The only 2 times I have had these episodes were while I was put on this as a generic because they ran out of my real pill. This pill is a monster I will never go near it again. I would not wish my experience on my WORST enemy

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Lalrin FE 1/20 doesn’t work like it should. I’ve been on it for 7 months and I’ve just started missing periods. I’m also having a lot of symptoms of pregnancy that I haven’t been having until now. I also took every single pill and haven’t missed any days. The only side affects I had were headaches and I guess my appetite.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hello. I’ve been on Junel 1/20 for about 10 months now. It has been wonderful, besides the fact that my period won’t regulate. Before starting this pill I had a period every month around the same time and now I get it every other month only lasting about 4 days. On the months I don’t get it I spot for about 2 days. I’ve taken pregnancy tests even though I use this pill religiously as well as condoms and the results are negative. I don’t know if I should  switch to another because being sexually active it’s very reassuring getting a period every month knowing you’re not pregnant.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My insurance had changed my usual pill to this one  Microgestin Fe 1/20 due to insurance and it has been terrible. I have constant depression and anxiety. I'm always angry over small things and it does not even help my heavy periods/cramping which is what I take the pill for. I will be switching again and paying the difference just so I don't have to go through this anymore.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):*UPDATEIt is now March and I had to switch off the Junel bc I was getting severe chest / heart pains and had to get an EKG. I wanted to write about the symptoms I had for those months. Well, my pharmacy unexpectedly switched me to Microgestin the second month because Junel was "backordered". I was always extremely tired, nauseas and had a continuous splitting headache. Also I'm usually a person who is ALWAYS trying to have sex and since I was on Junel/Microgestin I am NEVER thinking of sex. No sex drive at all. Really sucks. Also because of my PCOS I still have severe bloating and pain. So the BC hasn't helped with that either but I understand it takes time. So now because of the chest pains/ other symptoms I am currently taking LoLoestrin. I am genuinely an anxious person so my gyno said this might help with my anxiety as well as my other issues. Hopefully this pill will be different. The chest pains have lowered but still kind of remain. I will update again. Hope this helps ladies.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Bilsovi after my pharmacy switched me from taytulla. I was only on it for a month and a half. Aside from the fact my skin was completely clear, the side effects were horrible for me. I gained some weight and my mood swings were horrible. I've never in my life experienced severe anxiety until taking this pill. I genuinely thought I was going crazy. I never struggled with panic attacks until this pill. Every morning I woke up anxious. I also experienced really bad cramping and pelvic pain. And mild breast tenderness. I ended up convincing myself I was pregnant. I’ve been off of it for a week now and I feel like my normal self. I’d be cautious on this one.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill June Fe 1/20 for a little over three months now after I got switched from Larin. I never had any major side effects - no headaches, nausea, breast tenderness, etc. My cramping has reduced slightly, but not as much as hoped. The biggest problem is if I ever forget to take the pill and have to take two in one day I end up with severe nausea and vomiting, even if they’re spread apart.
Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This medication made me SO depressed. I gained 40 lbs, cried every day, and had extremely irregular periods for the 5 months I was on it.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the first time I tried birth control and it was actually awesome. I’ll now be trying a new pill which I’m a little worried about because I feel like it won’t compare to Taytulla. The side effects I noticed were larger breasts, shorter and lighter period and fewer if any cramps at all. It was probably the best pill you can get with the fewest side effects

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill since September. Love the low dose hormone vs regular. I don’t feel moody or anxious compared to past pills but I have had a few days where I feel nauseous and can’t figure out why. Not sure if it’s the pill. No side effects except MASSIVE weight gain. My appetite is out of control and I am constantly bloated. I have put on 20+ pounds since I started and am freaking out about it. Not sure what to do, I don’t want to keep gaining.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was skeptical of this birth control after reading reviews, but decided to give it a shot anyway. I started taking it toward the tail end of my period, and everything seemed okay, a little nausea but nothing too bad. But then two days after my period ended, I started bleeding again. HEAVY. Almost scary amounts of blood, especially considering my normal period was a bit heavier than usual as well. I was also insanely bloated compared to usual. The thing that’s making me quit is the mood changes. I burst into tears for no reason, which is SO unlike me, and I find myself being rude and on a short fuse out of nowhere. This is the first time I’ve taken birth control since I was a teenager, and it’s definitely been a terrible experience. I wouldn’t recommend.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Lo Lo for a year and two months and it is great! This was my first experience with birth control pills and it went perfectly fine. I used to have very bad/heavy periods, but now I get my period for maybe two or three days each month (no cramps!!). My body did take a while to adjust though, so I had breakthrough bleeding for the first 6 months or so. I had no other negative side effects other than maybe feeling way more emotional.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just start taking this birth control Lo Lo, and honestly I am so depressed I never felt this way in my life. I missed two days of work because I couldn’t even move from my bed I have been spotting since I’ve been taking the pills. I'm on my 12th pill I don’t think I’m gonna take it anymore

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am almost through my third month of Junel Fe, and I feel a lot better than I did when I was taking Taytulla. On Taytulla, I developed a phobia, had anxiety attacks regularly, and experienced the worst depression of my life! After taking a year off from birth control, I am taking this and my periods are very light, my cramps are not as painful, my acne is GONE, and no depression and minimal anxiety.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Junel Fe for about 5 months and haven’t found the relief I was searching for. First month went on without a breeze, but since then it’s been a disaster. My cramps have lessened but still are a nuisance and require medication to allow me to function proper. My cycle is completely irregular, I haven’t had period while on my placebo pills the entire time I’ve been on Junel. I bleed on my active pills each month and it’s still not regular or consistent. Which terrifies me thinking my birth control is not effective. My mood is ALL over the place and my anxiety has been through the roof. My skin has sorta cleared up but I contribute that to me not wearing makeup anymore. I contacted my doctor to change pills. This was my first time using BC and this experience was far from what I wanted. I kept giving it time so my body could adjust however I didn’t want to suffer anymore. Hopefully I can find something that really fits my needs and doesn’t make things worse.

Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this birth control Nortrel for about 8 years and gained weight on it ( went from 115lb to 137lb in two years) and had to stop it due to high blood pressure. Had bad acne and oily skin also. Mad me extremely moody and decreased my sex drive sometimes. The only positive was it kept me from getting pregnant.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am a healthy 20 yr old. I've only been on birth control for a little over a year now. Previous to Junel Fe 1.5/30 I was on Blisovi. But last time I went to get my prescription filled they gave me Junel instead. I've just completed my second pack. In this second month I've really been struggling, these past couple of weeks I am nauseated every day, usually at night. I've lost my appetite completely, I rarely eat anymore. This is REALLY starting to worry me. I'm losing weight, my breast size has increased. I have terrible anxiousness and I feel so in my head, depressed with scary dark thoughts (not like me at ALL). I also feel very detached/unemotional. TMI I don't think I'm pregnant but I've been having irregular periods, they come close to the middle of the pack instead of during the inactive pills. My periods are all dark blood (black and brown) and usually very clotted looking. I'm not bashing this pill I just don't think it's really agreeing with my body. I hope this helps someone!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was hesitant to start this pill  Lo Loestrin Fe because I had never taken any before and read many negative reviews online. However, I have been on the pill for a month and have had a pretty good experience so far. The only side effects I’ve had have been some spotting and occasional mood swings (but rare! And nothing unmanageable). Best of luck to everyone thinking about trying it and a reminder that everyone’s experience is unique!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started on Sprintec and had a horrible experience. I was having 2-3 periods a month and my whole body itched. So I switched to Lo Lo per my Dr. I’m halfway through the first pack and yes there have been some side effects. My sex drive has not changed at all. No acne. No migraines thus far. No breakthrough bleeding. However there have been like two days where I was majorly depressed but that was while I was on my period so could have been hormone related. As of now I haven’t had any more depression. Don’t listen to the bad reviews. People who review it badly, well it just wasn’t for them. Just like Sprintec wasn’t for me at all. BC is a waiting game of finding what’s right and so far this one is definitely right for me!

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Loestrin FE 1/10 but unfortunately lost my job/health insurance so I was stuck with generic Microgestin 1.5/30 in the mean time. I loved Lo Lo and barely experienced any side effects on that so I was heartbroken to have to switch. Had pretty much every symptom in the book within the first month of Microgestin... acne flared up, EXTREMELY bloaty and gassy- felt like it took forever for food to digest, also felt like I had an extra layer of fat/water retention in my abdomen area, and omg the mood swings!! Awful...  I was beyond irritable and wanted to cry all the time. Had really bad cramping the first couple weeks too... like cramping comparable to PMS. This is a pretty big jump in hormone dosage compared to what I’m used to and I don’t think I’ll be taking another month of this, it’s not worth it in my opinion, even short term. I’ll probably just wait until I have insurance again to go back on Lo Lo.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Although I had positive experiences with this birth control Junel Fe 1/20 like no breakthrough bleeding, no mood changes, etc. I got pregnant. I did not miss any pills, was not on an antibiotic or any medication that could have interfered with the birth control and took it at the same time every day. Therefore I would not rate this as an overly effective birth control pill. I am starting it again now 1 month after delivering our unplanned (yet very loved) baby, but my husband also had a vasectomy.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Switched from generic pill (on it for several years) to Junel FE after a computer error at GYN. Figured I would be fine as I never had any problems with the pill. Month 1 okay, months 2&3 no period and extremely on edge. Not pregnant, just no period. Switched back to generic and immediately felt better and got my period regularly again.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My pharmacy switched me to Junel after my old pill was discontinued. I was on it for two months. The first month, I had the worst breakouts of my life all around my mouth; blind pimples that were incredibly painful and I couldn't pop for weeks. I have never had bad acne and it all started after starting Junel. In the second month, I had breakthrough bleeding a few days before my period should have started (I have never experienced this before). Once my placebo pills started, I had clumpy brown discharge for the first 3 days and then my period finally started on the 4th day (never experienced the clumpy discharge the first few days of the placebo pills). After starting Junel, I became irritated by the smallest things. Everything made me cry, I was screaming at my boyfriend over stupid situations, and my emotions being all over the place have taken a huge toll on my relationship. I get that everyone reacts differently to birth control pills, but this one is honestly terrible.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I definitely started noticing that my ANXIETY has been through the roof since I was switched to Blisovi 24 fe. I have never been an anxious person but being a mother of 2 daughters, I just assumed it was normal to be stressed all the time, but it has changed me. I feel like I have developed social anxiety, as well. All of these things that I couldn't explain... Then, I see the reviews at a 3.2!! WOW!! That is the WORST RATING on this site!!!! I am switching to Sprintec today. Please don't ignore your symptoms! If you feel different in your own body, listen to your intuition!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started lo Loestrin 10 days ago. It has been great so far. No spotting, bleeding, or side effects except I felt nauseous for two day around lunch time... I will update soon. I had the mirena for 3 years and it was great, but then I started having hot flashes for the last year and couldn't figure it out. I knew it had to be related to the IUD.. When they removed it the hot flashes went away. Also, I had this chronic back pain like it was my SI joint and my right foot would go numb sometimes.. I had 4 SI injections and switched jobs. But it didn't help. When they removed the IUD it went away!!! Dr. Said it must have been on a nerve in uterus.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill fJujnel Fe 1/20 or over a year and I have honestly had no issues with it whatsoever! I was on the mini-pill previously and that was tough with having a rare and unpredictable period so I switched to a combo pill. I was honestly so skeptical at first because this doesn’t have the best reviews on here but honestly everything has been good for the past year! This allowed my hormones to be regular, helped to clear up my skin, and best of all prevent pregnancy without any horrible side effects. I did have breakthrough bleeding for a month or two there but it hasn’t come back since the beginning. Starting this new birth control was scary with all the possible side effects and some of these review horror stories, but it was a good choice. Personally, I have had no issues with this birth control and would not hesitate to recommend it to a friend. As I said before, I have had no issues and will stay on this pill for hopefully years to come.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Just about to start my 4th month pill pack in a couple days. My first month I noticed I was more emotional and just so sensitive. I spotted a bit during the placebo pills that first month. The next month I was fine mood wise and didn’t spot during the placebo pills. Two weeks into the 3rd pill pack and I was noticing I was moody, my boobs hurt, and I was so bloated. It felt like I was PMSing. I now have a heavier than normal when on the pill but still lighter than a regular period (just much heavier than if I was spotting) and this is all happening few days before the placebo pills. I take the pill every day at the same time. I can’t wait to see my doctor to discuss a better birth control option because i can see from the reviews and my experience, this isn’t a great one.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):On Junel Fe 1/20 for one month so far.My face acne cleared up, but then I got back acne, hoping it will go away..Losing my appetite, feel like I'm eating just to survive. No weight gain yet. It hasn't affected my emotions like other pills have (yet), although I eat healthy and exercise 4-5 times a week. I think this helps with how your body responds to the pills hormones.Three periods in one month, that sucked. Mostly spotting. Hoping next month will be better.I will update this review. I think the pill is worth it so far.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Junel FE for over 8 years. It was given to me in middle school because I had such horrible cramps I couldn't leave my house. Middle school and high school I didn't really have side effects. My sophomore year of college it started to give me vaginal burning and dryness. The dryness stayed, but the vaginal burning would come and go. I noticed I had frequent yeast infections throughout high school and college on the pill. I finally stopped Junel last month because it gave me breast cysts after over 8 years of use. For the last three months that I was on Junel, I had extreme breast pain every single day of the month. The last month that I was on birth control the pain in my breasts was so bad that I would cry out in pain everyday. Off it a month and my breast pain is gone, my headaches have significantly improved. At 22 it gave me painful breasts and cysts so I had to stop it for fear of getting breast cancer. Also, gave me horrible anxiety during last year on it.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for about 1-2 years. During the first week, I was horribly nauseous and I broke out all over cheeks. HOWEVER, it got a lot better for me at least and I rarely get acne (although I didn’t take it for that and I didn’t have severe acne before starting it). I take anti-anxiety pills as well so if I do get sad, I don’t assume it’s due to my pill. It regulates my period and has helped with my cramps. I hope my review helps :)

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first birth control and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. My skin was clear and my cramps weren't bad before taking this birth control. After about 3 weeks of taking it, I started breaking out and getting the worst cramps of my life. I kept on getting nonstop, painful breakouts that wouldn't go away. This pill has also caused me to have terrible mood swings, I've gained 5 lbs in 2 months, and I have been depressed and have had heightened anxiety. Wish I never took this pill!!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this BC Lo Lo in September and have since gained 27 pounds despite a healthy diet and exercise. I have little to no energy, experience several depression days a month and just don’t feel like myself at all anymore. I also cramp basically all month but barely bleed when my period comes around.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had a very positive experience on Blisovi. I took it for approximately 3 years, and just switched over to the Nexplanon implant because I wanted something a little more fool-proof as far as birth control goes. Blisovi helped manage my PMS symptoms significantly and I experienced no negative mental health or physical side effects from taking it. My periods were very light and lasted 4 days.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So, I used to be on Junel Fe, which worked great for me. I didnt notice any side effects at all, so to hear so many having trouble finding a decent BC was shocking. Unfortunately, my pharmacy stopped carrying it, without notice, so I had to look elsewhere. I transferred to one that was supposed to have it, yet they just gave me Blisovi fe instead. I didn't mind it, at first. But I have had the worse experience on this pill. Every bad side effect you can imagine. I constantly will get random nausea and bad head aches. I used to be in the low 120s in weight and am now 133 pounds. That is crazy to put on, when my diet has been consistent for years. I don't recommend this pill for anyone. Some may be okay to take it, but I don't think it's worth the time.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Omg thank god I read all these reviews .  This pill has made me get so depressed , nothing makes me happy anymore and I was thinking of going to a psychiatrist!!!! This is the worst feeling ever I felt helpless and cried a lot .  I am calling my doctor tomorrow and letting her know .  Thank you to all for the reviews because this feeling isn’t good .  I kept trying to talk myself out of it and trying not to cry in front of people for no reason .

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just took this pill for 2 days and the side effects were awful. I was very depressed/sad and had really dark thoughts.Glad I read the reviews and figured out this pill was causing it. Horrible!!!!

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I  hated being on this birth control. I switch from the patch that was throwing my liver out of control. My doctor suggested this low dose birth control. I thought this will be awesome. I was horribly wrong. I went from having a period once a month to bleeding heavily every 2 weeks. After about a month I started losing a lot of hair, I called my doctor he said it could take a few months to normalize. Finally started having a period once a month but I would start when I still had 8 days of active pills left. Then it went to nothing for 3 months, great right? Then bam 2 week heavy period, cramps for days. I noticed my skin was having more breakouts that wouldn't go away. My under control depression went crazy. Biggest mood swings one minute I'm happy go lucky the next I'm a rage case the next moment I'm uncontrollably sad. I finally couldn't handle it and got put on a different birth control. I know every women is different. But this one def. wasn't for me.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this birth control!!! I’ve been taking it for over 2 years now! I also deal with depression and anxiety, but this medication has done nothing to enhance it! I have not gained weight with this pill as I have with others in the past! My hair has changed texture completely and is now shinier and better than it has ever been!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I almost been on this pill for almost a month and I don't know if its just me but I take my pill at night. And then feel depression in the morning and now feeling anxiety I don't even know why because my life is great! The only thing I could think right now is this new pill I just started. As a kid I used to have depression and anxiety  I haven’t felt those sad feelings in about 10years now. My doctor said to give it about 3 months but after seeing other people’s reviews & info on this pill . I just don’t know might stop before it’s gets bad off because the side effects is already rubbing off on me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I got on this pill bc all my friends have babies and I was like now way. Lol. No. So I just want to say my first 4 days went great. Skin was clearing. Appetite curbed. Great. Day 5 hit and so did the dizziness and migraines and random nausea. I ignored it because all my friends said it’s normal. Then I got my period again. Extremely dark blood. Now, day 6 I’m ending taking it. When I say my body is a 12/10 on pain I mean I can’t leave bed without puking. I’ve cried all day. Leaking dark brown blood. No sex drive AT ALL. Migraines. Everything. Worst decision ever. I can’t even eat. I’m hoping I can recover quickly from this torture I put my poor body through.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on birth control pills for 24 years My gynecologist put me on this brand A birth control the first 4 to 5 months were wonderful I had no breakthrough bleeding no. Then on my six pack I had my period for six days stopped for 10 and here I am having breakthrough bleeding yet again this pill makes me emotionally unsteady don’t want to have sex seeing my gynecologist this Wednesday to switch it again I don’t recommend this pill

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After 3 different birth control pills my OB decided to put me on low estrogen so I got Lo Lo. I had gained about 20 pounds off of past birth controls - not directly from the pill they just made me hungrier - but being on this pill I've lost about 15 pounds of it. I’m less lethargic on this pill and my sex drive has remained fine. The only negative is that if I miss a pill even just for an hour or two and take it the next morning I bleed. But then I don’t get my period on my period week, very strange but it doesn’t cause too many problems because it’s extremely light when it does come. A little bit of breakouts here and there but this is by far the best birth control I’ve been on, I feel more like myself on it.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I honestly would not recommend this BC. I decided after 2 years without BC I would get back on to see if it helped my skin. My skin had the usual break out from periods and from stress but was always tolerable and never really bothered me. I used to take Tarina FE which, and when I went for my doctors visit she prescribed me this one which I was okay with starting, Blisovi FE.  I began taking the BC and I started breaking out HORRIBLY. I thought it was just something that my body had to adjust but after the first month it started to feel like every time I took the pill a pimple would form. Cystic pimples. I’ve never been so depressed in my life. I seriously wish I never started this, there isn’t a day I don’t cry. Do not recommend.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have a disease called Empty Sella Syndrome & basically my  Pituitary gland is flattened by an enlarged brain making my horomes non-existent & have no estrogen. I was miserable for a long time. They started me on Estrogen/progesterone tablets but it did nothing to increase my estrogen because it was not absorbing through my stomach due to my Gastroparesis, then they switched me to Estrogen injections/Progesterone tablets which increased my estrogen but after a month or so I ended up getting my period for 4 months straight & nothing was stopping it & if I missed my injections I would be miserable with mood swings, hot flashes, & exhaustion. Turned out this was because the injections were making my estrogen to high. I then started Junel Fe 24 & was able to stop the Injections/Progesterone & only have to take the Junel Fe 24. I have no more postmenopausal symptoms & my period only comes on the designated days. This medication changed my life for the better when nothing else was working!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Ok. This pill has its ups and downs. The first week of taking this pill... I felt fine. When it came to the end of the month though I was in a downright spiral. I mean wow. I had the worst mood swings on top of already ongoing depression and anxiety. I was crying like crazy and I honestly couldn’t see the good in any situation. I saw someone compare it to having paranoia and , yeah that’s exactly what it felt like. I started taking everything my boyfriend and others said to me to heart and it really put me in a bad place. I confided in my therapist and my gyno to figure out why I was feeling this way and they  let me know this feeling was natural and to give it some time. It’s been about 4-5 months on this pill and honestly I feel fine. So if your worried about the mood swings don’t take this pill but if you think you can wait it out I say go for it. It’s been doing me justice this far.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got the Skyla IUD and loved it. When that expired and it was time to get it removed, I opted for the Mirena IUD because it lasted longer. WORST MISTAKE EVER! There were too much hormones. I kept it for over a year hoping my body would adjust, but I couldn’t stand it any longer. I was depressed, anxious, insecure, sad, and my mood swings were so bad I thought I was bi-polar. My boyfriend could hardly recognize the girl he met prior to the Mirena. My doctor didn’t seem to fully believe the Mirena was causing this, but I am 110% certain. I started Junel immediately after removing the IUD and have felt a huge weight of relief. I’m smiling again, I no longer want to rage at every person who annoys me, and my relationship is healthy once again. I read a lot of reviews saying they hated this pill, and maybe it’s because my body was already super accustomed to hormones, but I love it! The bleeding at first was SEVERE but some iron pills and rest cleared it up.
Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This made me super depressed, no energy.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):From the start, I had major side effects while on Lo Loestrin Fe. It started with headaches, back pain and anxiety. My provider encouraged me to continue to take the medication for a few more months as my body should adjust. After 4 months on this medication, I had enough.  I have never felt more irritable, anxious and bloated in my life. My appetite was out of control.  This pill was definitely effective but my body did not respond well to it.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Works fine. not pregnant so that's good.  A little more emotional than usual but nothing major! no overall weight gain but my boobs got bigger ;) it's important to remember everyone's experience will be different!

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Microgestin 1/20 FE last year. I got a years supply so I didn't have to worry about switching, and it was one of the most depressing years I have experienced. I didn't blame the pill for my daily super dark thoughts until I switched pills 2 weeks ago, and since then I have had zero suicidal thoughts or impulses. In my experience Microgestin increases depression and dark thoughts exponentially. One plus is that I did not get pregnant while on it.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this pill for 2 months now and I'm stopping today. The first month wasn't that bad I had a little water retention but it went away eventually and every now and then I was a bit moody but from going from not being an emotional person at all to being moody was already enough to make me want to stop but I decided to go another month just to see if my body would get use to it. The second month was the most emotional month of my entire life I've never had so many terrible mood swings to the point my boyfriend doesn't even know who I am anymore. I've cried about everyday taking the pill this month and could not wait to just finish the pack. I did not gain any weight being on the pill but I believe that's because I'm consistent in the gym but I did notice the way my body stored fat changed slightly.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor increased my dose of Junel to the 1.5/30 28 day and I started having awful tension headaches. The headaches were over my eyes so I thought I had a sinus infection. After 3 weeks of headaches on most days ( getting no relief from Motrin, excedrin etc) I realized it was from the hormonal increase in the Junel. I’ve also noticed that my appetite has increased this month. It’s not a good pill for me, I've never experienced headaches like this from any other bc pill.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Was put on this pill for my poly cystic ovarian and metabolic syndrome after all other birth control pills (BCP) made me an emotional wreck. This brand on the first month made me cry over an empty jar of pickles and I would also experience  sudden emotional outbursts which I  were the same as the other bcps. I also experienced very painful periods to the point the only thing I could do was lay in bed in a fetal position. The second month I noticed a burning sensation and the hair on the top of my head was falling out. I told my doctor and he all but blew me off telling me that there was less than 1% probability of me experiencing these types of side effect from my bcp. I am not only taking myself off of this HORRIBLE  pill, I am also switching doctors.STAY AWAY FROM THIS PILL!!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is absolutely lovely. I take the 1/20 dose because I know higher doses can make people feel off. Anyway, the first month I took it I broke out in pimples, my breasts got tender but it all cleared with in 2 weeks. My periods started becoming irregular due to a hormonal imbalance. (No I do not have PCOS). But it regulated my period for the first month of use. Now I am on month 2 and I am still fine. Also, this pill has not made me gain weight. Coming from a woman taking this who currently has extra weight on her. I take control in what I am eating so that I  don't gain weight. I haven't gained any weight,  I've actually lost a few pounds. But that's because I am fairly active and I have a healthy diet. I do treat myself

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I loved everything about this pill Lo Loestrin Fe, but one major thing. I had the most horrible acne I have ever had in my life. My face, back and chest. I gave it 3 months and each month it kept getting worse and worse and the previous acne was not disappearing but just staying. I didn't want to switch off this pill because I loved everything else about it. But  I couldn't take the acne any longer.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill Taytulla for 1 1/2 months. After 2 weeks acne was becoming present. The acne started to get so bad that I didn’t want to leave the house. I started noticing I was tired all the time, my mood swing were frequent, I wasn’t myself. I missed my period entirely which I was told by my doctor may happen. Two days ago I was feeling light-headed, I got hot flashes, I didn’t have an appetite and I felt extreme anxiety for no reason. I was terrified because I didn’t know what was happening to me. I had been on another birth control for 14 years (no issues) up until I had a baby two years ago then I got on this. Worst decision. I stopped taking this halfway through the pill pack. The side effects are horrible. Based on my experience and these reviews I would never recommend.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Larin 1.5/30 for maybe two and a half months. At first I didn’t notice any real side effects, but eventually they all started to creep in. It started with my breasts becoming swollen and tender to the touch, and they’ve been uncomfortably tender for about two straight months now. My appetite has decreased dramatically, and some days I barely eat at all. I feel like I’ve definitely lost some weight due to that and I’m terrified of it getting worse because I’m trying to actually gain some weight right now. I randomly get headaches and some small cramps, but nothing too bad. I would say the worst part about all of this is the anxiety and mood swings I’ve had. I already have anxiety, but since taking this birth control it’s gotten much worse. I will say though it is HIGHLY effective at preventing pregnancy.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The 1st month on Junel Fe 1/20 was fine and the only side effect was breakthrough bleeding.2nd month I had a panic attack where I experienced disassociation (I have never experienced anything close to this before) and intense anxiety. I figured that it was just the result of dehydration and stress but in retrospect I should’ve considered that my birth control may have been the cause. 3rd month I felt anxious, extremely depressed & hopeless, and had no appetite. I had times of disassociation which was frankly terrifying. This is not like me.Towards the end of my 3rd month I decided to stop taking birth control. I am four days off of it and have started to feel a bit better. My doctor told me that these symptoms stem from birth control. I suggest considering different options if you have a history of mental health issues. I know everyone’s body reacts differently so this is just my experience. I am sending you all love & sincerely hope this birth control works for you.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am a medical student so I have studied OCPs and various side effects that are expected. But even my education couldn’t prepare me for the months of HORROR I experienced. I had sore nipples but knew it was my body adjusting to the increased estrogen so I tolerated it, what I didn’t expect was this empty feeling unlike anything I’ve ever felt. Also I felt irrational rage and my mood was explosive. I felt like I was going crazy, little things would irritate me and I would be emotional rather than cope. I thought it’s stress from medical school, but I’ve always had stress and dealt with. Prior to Junel I was on Microgestin for 10+ years. I stopped Junel a month ago, I am back to feeling like myself. Junel is so dangerous..I am a happy easy going person with a lot going on for me in life but it made me feel so worthless and at those darkest moments even suicidal please avoid. I know everyone reacts differently but if you read reviews you can see a pattern

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never been on birth control and was always kind of opposed to it given the horror stories of side effects I had heard of. However, my gyno talked me in to trying Taytulla. I was so nervous to try it, especially after reading some of these reviews, but honestly I am so glad I did. I just finished the first month and so far the only side effect I've noticed is an increase in appetite. That's it! No nausea, mood changes, headaches, or anything like that. There was one day with some random, very minimal spotting. Right now I'm on my first period since starting Taytulla and it is drastically a lighter flow, which is really nice. Another perk I've noticed is clearer skin. It has only been one month, so I really hope things continue this way and no worse side effects present themselves. Based on my experience so far I would definitely recommend it, but it seems it's different for everyone.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Lo Loestrin Fe for a little over seven months and have had cystic/hormonal acne, and irregular periods that caused a few pregnancy scares. I'm currently in the process of changing my birth control.
Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Bled for a very long time, didn't help with the cramps. But did help with pregnancy prevention

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Loestsrin 24 Fe is horrible pill. It did not regulate me at all....I didn’t have my period for 6 months I thought I was going crazy, then my period would show up when I was taking the active pills such a horrible pill

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this birth-control about 4 months ago and it’s horrible. I constantly feel angry all of the time and I don’t even know why. It has even made my acne  much worse. I would not recommend!

Larin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My former gyno is a team gyno for a volleyball team in one of our state’s universities. After I miscarried around 10 weeks, I went to him because the post-pregnancy hormones combined with my tricyclic birth control was exacerbating my PMDD to the point of suicidal ideation for 2 weeks/month. Larin is a good option, he said, because the dose of estrogen stays consistent, unlike the tricyclic. He also advised that Larin is a fantastic BC option for athletes (I no longer play sports but I’m in the gym 4-6 days a week). Turned out he was absolute correct - I started only having periods every few months and now I’ve not had one in about 8 months. I love it. It also dialled PMDD waaaay back, obviously. The only complaint I have is that I sometimes have random period cramps throughout the month but otherwise Larin has been fantastic for me.

Ortho-Novum 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had started taking ortho novum in 2011-2015. I felt extremely nauseous when I first started taking it but that subsided. It was great while I was on it. Clear skin, light periods and no bad side effects. When I got off it to try to start a family my periods had become irregular and was unable to get pregnant for two years and was diagnosed with PCOS at the age of 24. I was in shock. I do believe this pill caused my infertility issues. When I did get pregnant two years later I was able  to get pregnant again in less than a year so I no longer had PCOS and my periods were regular. I would not recommend taking this if you want to have kids in the future. It may cause infertility issues afterwards like in my case.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on birth control on and off for the last 17 years. This is by far the worst one yet. The only positive thing I can say about it is I didn’t get pregnant. However, I felt like I was. I have been on Junel FE for years with no trouble. My pharmacy was out of it and assured me Larin FE was the same exact thing. I beg to differ. By day 5 I was so nauseous and felt horrible. I was ready to fall into bed by 7:30 utterly exhausted which was not normal for me. The nausea was horrendous. I actually lost 5lbs in 12 days because I couldn’t really eat. My anxiety went through the roof which hasn’t happened in a very long time. To the point I had a horrible panic attack in the middle of the night, which hadn’t been normal for me in a while. Don’t even get me started on the headache. Whew. I stopped taking it because my doctor called my script in somewhere else and within 36 hours I was back to my normal self. I would avoid Larin at all costs.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had negative reactions to hormonal birth control in the past, so I decided to try an ultra low dose pill. I am on my 4th month now and it's been a waking nightmare. I am constantly having anxiety attacks and bouts of depression. This birth control has made me break out severely on my chin, as others have mentioned as well. I would NOT recommend trying this medication.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After taking Taytulla I developed serious blood clots in my lungs which led to a pulmonary embolism. I didn’t show many side affects until the blood clots  grew in size. I’m a healthy 18 year old who’s never had health problems before so be careful. If left untreated you can have a stroke or even die. My first sign that something was wrong was extreme shortness of breath and an extremely fast heart beat. I was hospitalized and now will be on blood thinners for the next 3 months to help them go away.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to this birth control after 3 weeks of spotting on my previous one that was after I had been on it for a few months. I was on this birth control for about 5 days and ended up switching back to my old one! I had never felt more horrible than I did on this pill! I got no sleep due to my throbbing headache that was so bad I couldn't even move my eyes up or down without feeling like someone was hitting the back of my head with a hammer. The nausea was terrible as well! I felt dizzy and like I was going to faint on this pill. I ended up stopping as quickly as possible when driving became unsafe for me due to the side effects I experienced from this pill.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I’m 32 after taking a break from IUD which I had for 10 years I decided to give the birth control a try Tarina  this pill has me super emotional,  hungry  it’s been 3 months and I’m bleeding on and off, and it’s so annoying so with that being said back on the IUD I go ! Thumbs down

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was so scared to take Junel Fe 1/20 after reading all of the reviews. However, I am happy that I did.
