The first month I had experienced a lot of breakthrough bleeding as my body was adjusting to the pill, but now I have my period regularly and it is almost nothing! It is super light, and just enough to let me know I am not pregnant. I didn't experience any side effect symptoms with this pill either, no weight gain like everyone says... however I am fairly active and eat pretty clean. I would give this a try before taking any of these reviews into consideration, everyones body is different!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I only started taking Blisovi Fe 1/20  3 weeks ago and I have cried at least twice every day since.  I am an emotional wreck and it’s ruining my relationship. Maybe that’s how it’s an effective form of birth control, it just makes you so emotional and depressed that your partner doesn’t want anything to do with you. I advice against it. OH but I did gain 10lbs and big boobs out of it!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control Junel Fe 1.5/30 for 3 months now, it is good at regulating my period and preventing pregnancy however, I am extremely emotional and angry all the time and I have gained weight. I cry more easily now and I lose my temper pretty easy. I would say my acne has actually gotten WORSE and my appetite has definitely increased. Sex drive however has not been affected. Do not recommend if you already suffer from anxiety/depression.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I follow a very natural, clean, plant based lifestyle and the idea of using hormonal birth control scared the LIFE out of me. I didn’t want to get pregnant anytime soon and the idea of an IUD was out of the question so I decided to give this birth control pill a try. I have been on it for over a month now and have ZERO side effects. I got my period this month, lighter than usual. I know I have only been on it for 1 month and have only finished 1 pack, but I am truly happy with this BC and glad I gave it a try! I am already onto my second pack. I had no side effects. Don’t let the scary reviews scare you away! I was SOOO hesitant to try and so glad I did. Give it a chance for 1 month. I recommend this BC and hope that the second pack continues to show me no side effects!!
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst pill I have ever been over. I was on Junel three months before noticing my hair thinning and coming out. Do not recommend!!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel FE for almost a year and a half and I am MISERABLE. My gyno did the right thing and put me on a low dose but after being on it for so long I have noticed some side effects. Weight gain, extreme headaches, my personality and emotions definitely changed. The one thing that helped was my period became a lot lighter but I did have  a 1 month where I skipped a period. I am done feeling this way so I have an appointment with my gyno to insert an IUD :(
Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started taking it and been getting so angry for no reason at night... I've never had this from any other birth control.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My entire stint with this birth control Junel Fe 24 has been awful. I’ve experienced every terrible side effect in the book - mood swings, weight gain, bloating, acne, you name it. I have felt incredibly depressed the whole time I’ve taken it, and my mood is all over the place - I actually cried for several hours when my succulent lost a leaf. My period is painful, and I apparently will not stop bleeding. Worst birth control I’ve been on so far.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on lolo  since grade 10 to stop A 3 MONTH STRAIGHT heavy bleeding period. Once I started lolo for about a month I never got another period, which is great!! (Do you know how much money I’m saving not buying pads or tampons?? Or having to worry about getting your period??) I have now been on it for 5 years and it has been great with no side effects. I would 100% recommend if you have heavy terrible periods and want really light periods or no periods. Just remember every body reacts differently and sometimes it takes a couple months to start working!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control 5 months ago after Demulen was discontinued, which I was on for about 4 years and loved. I have not had a period since I started taking Lolo. I would prefer to have a period for 3 days just for the reassurance but I'm not complaining too much. I have experienced no weight gain, no mood swings, but maybe a slightly lower libido. Overall I think it is pretty good!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):For me, this pill is bad. Yes, it's prevented pregnancy, but the side effects were not worth it when there are other good options on the market that work for me. Side effects:- depression and anxiety during pms- extreme emotional sensitivity/weeping for no reason- migraines all of a sudden- decreased sex driveI will never go back. Blisovi worked way better for me.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Absolutely horrible! Will not recommend to anyone. I had my period either every week or every two weeks for the the 3 months I was on it, crazy high and low mood swings, nausea, dizzy spells, low mood most days and leg pain for the first month, so bad that after work most days I couldn’t stand. Hate this birth control and switching to patch hopefully it’s better

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was diagnosed with endometriosis last July/August. I decided to go with the pill to see if it helped at all before getting something more permanent, and for a couple of months it did. It took two months to fully regulate my period, but once it finally did I had almost no pain and an extremely light period.  Tt was a great. Flash forward to my 5/6th month on this pill...what a change. I have no sex drive, I’m back to having period pain, I even had cramps a few days ago that made me think a cyst had ruptured because the pain was so intense. I’m not sure what to make of this pill. I had absolutely 0 side effects when starting it, I haven’t gotten pregnant, and it did help me for a little bit, so I guess it deserves something

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I absolutely love this birth control! I haven’t had any problem with acne (but I never did before I was put on the pill) and no pregnancy scares at all! I’ve been taking this pill for about 2 years so my body is definitely adjusted but it took about 3-4 months before my body was fully adjusted!!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Would not recommend! This is my first birth control & I’ve been on it for 3 months. I take the pill everyday without skipping any days & I have non stop break through bleeding. I started this pill to prevent pregnancy but honestly what’s the point if I can even have sex because I’m constantly bleeding. I’m also having terrible mood swings. I cry almost everyday & have been feeling very depressed.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So!! I started this birth control because I had been having migraines with my last brand, and I will say right now I would take the migraines over this monstrosity. I have been taking this for around seven months now and am about to change because of the side effects, alone. I have had two periods every month, one around halfway through the pack and one at the end. I gave it a grace period of three months to make sure it wasn't my body just getting used to it. While I haven't had migraines around my period anymore at all, I have become depressed. I have never felt like this before but I will often just start feeling upset and can't explain why. My sex drive dropped severely as a result, as well. I lost a lot of my energy and would just prefer to lay in bed. I forced myself to work out, go to therapy, and eat better but to no avail. I will say that this doesn't seem to be a common side effect for most users, and I am prone to anxiety, so do what you will with that.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Have endometriosis and took microgestin 1/20 continuously for no periods. Haven’t gotten my period since but experienced extreme moodiness and slight depression the first 4 months. Spotted everyday for 5 months as well, with slight cramping... I took it like a champ cause most birth control will cause this. It’s been 6 months now and all the side effects went away and I’m perfectly normal and happy now with no periods.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Went on this about a year ago, it cleared my skin, had no weight gain, and very light periods. Some breakthrough bleeding in the beginning but that’s normal. Unfortunately, for the past few months, I have gotten 2 periods each month that are heavier than my periods before I started birth control. The worst part is that it has completely wrecked my mood, I cry at least once a day, I have no energy, and never feel like myself. I have had no history of mental health issues, but this genuinely makes me depressed.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on the  Blisovi pill for 7 months now and it recently got bad. I started the pill due to my very long and irregular periods. At first it seemed as if nothing had changed but then over time my periods shortened and have been the most painful they have ever been. I’m still very irregular and still having painful cramps (that kept me up all night) as well as my emotions, that have gone through the roof. Crying every night, bad mood swings and weight loss( I was already 10 pounds underweight). I’m constantly angry at the people I love for no reason and the only explanation is the pill. My acne was never really bad but I did find that my chest and back broke out more than usual. I plan to stop taking this!!!

Larin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used to be on Minastrin 24 Fe; last summer I started Larin. I didn't initially have any issues with it, my only complaint was that I wouldn't always get my periods at the "right" time but I attributed that to the fact that I had just started taking the pill and my body was getting used to it again. That happened to me with Minastrin; I assumed it was the same now. It hasn't gotten any better though and has actually gotten worse. I don't really get periods on Larin which is mostly ok, but for pregnancy scares I'd just rather have a period. I still get the cramps, and I get cramps during the period week AND during week 2 of the pack. Usually they're not too terrible but this month the non-period cramps have been crippling. I've also been getting headaches more often but I'm not 100% sure that's caused by the medication. I can't even say they're worth it because they prevent pregnancy because I haven't had to test that yet. Looks like I'll be trying a different birth control soon!

Briellyn (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm taking this to calm my ovaries down as I seem to have period type symptoms all month long the last year or so with actual pain in my ovaries. Thus far, Briellyn only seems to be exacerbating all the symptoms. I've been bleeding (with tissue) and cramping heavily each day for two weeks. I'm retaining so much water, I can actively feel myself expanding. My digestion problems are worse. I read that this may happen for the next two months before things get better.  I will stick it out until then, with some iron pills.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control gave me no side effects at first. After about two months I got a yeast infection due to the hormones changing the habitat in my vagina. Since that first yeast infection sex has hurt and made me bleed every single time since. And every third week I seem to get a yeast infection. Need to switch ASAP I’m sick of vaginal itching and painful sex.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got on this pill to regulate my periods because I had mild PCOS. However, I will be switching pill brands since on this medication I have had cramps but no period, despite taking the pill regularly and at the same time. Apparently this is common for this pill, but I prefer having a period. I also realized I gained around 10-15 pounds after getting on this pill and getting the weight off is difficult. I grew fatter facially and in my stomach. I also noticed an increase of acne not only on my face but also on my back which has never been a problem before. I look forward to switching my pill in the next few days and hope for better results!

Femcon Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Ortho Tri cylen for years and years with no issues but a gyno said I should try this instead. I took it for about two years and had to get off. My mood swings were out of control the days before my period. I thought it was work stress it, etc but once I switched back life was chill again. Plus it was $$ bc there was no generic for it at the time.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Love this birth control Blisovi Fe ! I keep an alarm on my phone to remind me every night. It helps us not get pregnant and I love that it also makes my periods not so bad and my skin clear! Loving the new packaging as well!!! It’s smaller and the sleeve is perfect!!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The Lo Loestrin was my first birth control I've ever taken and I love it. The only side effects I’ve experienced were extremely sore breasts about 3 months in which lasted a week or two, random breakthrough bleeding the first 3 months, headaches but tolerable, and I have noticed an increase of anxiety during the night time that will come randomly. The only time this pill has altered my mood is during the days I’m on my period which even happened before starting birth control. However, I do find myself slightly moodier now during those days. As for my cramps, I haven’t noticed a change in them being any less intense than they were prior to starting the pill but I do have lighter and shorter periods. I do think this pill is doing a great job and serving its purpose with only minor side effects that are tolerable. I've been on it for 4 months now and I’m about to start my 5th.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love Loestrin. I was on it for 2 years in my 20s with great success—very regular, minimal bleeding (sometimes barely a period), few side effects. The reason I went off of it was that I decided to get a Paragard IUD. After five years with the horrible pain and cramping of the Paragard, I got it taken out. Then my doctor had me try two other birth control pills that I never adjusted to. I went back on Loestrin two years ago, and it’s still great.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):On Lo Loestrin Fe I became depressed, and was in chronic pain that I couldn’t work or even get out of bed, I would wake up in the middle of the night screaming in pain that even laying in the fetal position wouldn’t help. Not even pain medication would help. I went to several gynecologist before someone diagnosed it as complications from this medication. My fiancé and I couldn’t even have sex while I was on this medication, it caused me so much pain that even a normal gynecology visit would have me crying in pain. Once I stopped taking the medication I no longer had pain, my fiancé and mine sex life is back, my family and friends even say I seem so much happier because I no longer felt depressed. I don’t recommend this medication at all. Not only is it horrible for your mental health and physical health but it is horribly priced, I paid $90 a month for it and that’s with a discount from Walgreens. I also gained 40 pounds in 10 months while on it. I regret ever going on this medication
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst pill ever, I  bled on and off for22 days with cramping - horrible.
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I stopped getting my periods, my acne went away and my mood swings died down

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched from Junel FE to Blisovi FE due to a change in my prescription drug coverage. (Both are generic drugs for Lo eastrin.) I've been taking Blisovi for three months, and have not experienced any negative side effects. No break through bleeding, headaches, acne, nausea, or weight changes. I'm not sure if this is because I switched from one generic equivalent to another, but my experience has been very positive. My periods seem to be even lighter than when I was on Junel, and come like clock work. I was nervous to try Blisovi after reading all of the negative reviews, but I feel people tend to share negative experiences more than the positive ones.This drug works and is affordable. Give it a try!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on the medication for 4 months. In the beginning, my period was fine. As time went on, my period got lighter and lighter and was eventually 2 days long. Usually I have a 4 day period so this freaked me out. I also had yellow/brown discharge. I took pregnancy tests and had blood work done and I'm not pregnant. I was very emotional from start to finish. I cried every week, nearly daily. My depression and anxiety was at it's worst in a while. The only good thing it did for me was I guess lighten my periods (way too much) and clear up my acne perfectly.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I hated my experience with Taytulla. 2 weeks in to starting the pills I was hit with severe depression and anxiety. I gained about 15 lbs and my face exploded with acne. I have previously never struggled with any of this on other forms of birth control and was shocked when it happened. I have since dropped the medication and feel like my old self again. Be cautious when taking this.  It works but the side affects made it not worth it.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first month of Junel, I was bleeding for a like 2 and a half weeks straight. It was super annoying but after the first pack, it stopped. I did experience a little bit of gain weight but it wasn’t noticeable at all. I saw a decrease in my sex drive, that’s a downside with this pill. I would be more dry than usual which was annoying at times. I also got in this pill because I had BAD acne, and this pill cleared it up tremendously. It took about 3 packs of the pill for me to see a huge improvement. And once it did, it was just going up from there. I recently got off it because I did mess up on it and I started bleeding on my active pills and I started breaking out again so I had to switch. But it may be my fault or my body just rejected this BC... who knows. I wouldn’t give this BC a bad rating since it cleared most of my skin and it’s nowhere near as bad compared to what my skin was before this birth control!!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this to control my periods and hopefully get some relief.  I had taken this years ago , for a few months and I didn’t have any issues.... this time however was the opposite . I had so much break through bleeding, legit getting my periods every 2 weeks type of thing.  I pushed through taking it 3 months , on my fourth pack now and I had my period on Jan 10 for 5 days, I got it again this past Friday Jan 24.  I had enough , it obviously isn’t working for me. My breast got so tender and swollen, cramps didn’t get any relief , I’m super sensitive, I’m moody, and  the bleeding alone was so uncomfortable . It wasn’t worth taking it. I’m trying a new birth control now , I had to call my doctor and ask for a change . I really don’t recommend. If it helps I’m 25 and 170lbsNo major health issues other than seasonal allergies

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took it for four months and it made me get two periods a month, I also got acne when I would take it and my breakouts would clear during my sugar pill week. I also got really bad insomnia for the entire last month. Switching!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I also used to take Junel but I stopped around Sept 2019 because of my high blood pressure  so I started taking Lo Lo esterin fe on Jan 10th 2020 . I never had any problems with birth control pills but I must say, I started bleeding a week before I was due on Jan 24th instead of the 31st. Even though it’s really light idk if this is a period or just bleeding between periods but wow my ovaries feel so heavy and feel like they will explode . I’ve never felt this but I hope it’s just my body getting used the hormones. I also just got diagnosed with PCOS :*(.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to Taytulla birth control at the end of December. I had always had my period on time. I took it for a month, and was very nauseous, and crampy the entire time. It got rid of my period completely, and made me very paranoid. I also blacked out one morning because my blood pressure dropped from this pill. I do not recommend.

Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is only my 3rd day and I have very bad migraines and sleepiness is a slight issue I do seem more tired than usual.  I'm having a lil trouble controlling my emotions I've cried a few times. My appetite isn't really an issue for me , I actually lose interest in my  food before I'm half way done especially breakfast food(s) . But idk how this is going to affect me in school or during practice(s) .

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this Lo loestrin Pill for almost 3 months due to heavy periods and also to prevent pregnancy. I don’t know if this is normal but on the placebo pills I get very light brownish blood looking, and one day was just very light blood. I get headaches sometimes and feel light headed and nauseous sometimes. But overall the pill is fine. I would just like to get a real period to indicate that I’m not pregnant.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Taytulla for around 8 months and honestly have NO idea how I did it for that long. I went from Minastrin to Taytulla due to insurance issues and had THE WORST transition. I had severe depression, my anxiety was worse than it already is to the point where I would cry all the time, I had insane mood swings, I was ALWAYS angry, headaches, ACNE which I have never had in my life, and I gained weight. The depression was so bad to the point where I was suicidal. After that I switched back to Minastrin and my life was so much better. DO NOT TAKE THIS!!!!!!!!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):LADIES. If you have had a bad pill experience, I hear you. Comments on how even if you’re having side effects like bad periods, migraines, weight gain, anxiety, or depression that you haven’t been on it long enough to tell, need to stop. It absolutely isn’t ok to invalidate someone’s experience because they didn’t go through the 3 months of hell that is somehow a standard. If you’re having these side effects, they aren’t ok and your body is trying to clue you in. I was on birth control for 5 years, lolo for over half of that. I thought the good luck on not having your life ruined! mentality was ok. Then the anxiety, depression, and ER visits hit. Nearly a year of my life was gone. It landed me on Prozac temporarily. I’ve never had mental health issues before in my life. I’m 5 months off the pill and am now feeling more like myself. My message is this: listen to your body. If something isn’t right, whether it be after a week or a year, it isn’t. Trust yourself.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Tarina for almost two weeks and I’ve experience zero side effects. My period was shorter (only 4 days instead of 7) and lighter, I had no cramps, my acne is subsided, and I feel completely normal almost to the point where I was wondering if it was even working. I read so many terrible/scary reviews about this birth control but the few that were good kept me willing to try it. I know not everyone’s bodies are the same and I may be one of the few who have a positive experience, but I just wanted to come on here and say that I  love it! hopefully someone reading this will find it worth a shot (you can always switch, but you might be like me and have no side effects!)

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After reading pages of comments, I feel better. Being off of BC for 10 years and 3 kids later, I started having very heavy periods and extreme PMS. Talked to my doctor and she recommended Junel Fe. I’ve been on it for 5 months and it confuses me. I did have acne the first 2 months but that cleared up. I bleed every 2-3 weeks for anywhere from 5-12 days and it’s extremely annoying. Sex drive is down. And I saw that other women experience dryness so I don’t feel crazy anymore. It did improve my PMS and made my bleeding so much lighter thankfully but I’m really tired of bleeding. As I write this, I’m on day 10 of bleeding. And I’ve only had two months within the past 5 months that my period actually started when I started the iron pills. I have an appointment with a new doctor in a few days and hopefully we can find something that works for me. I’m not using BC as a contraceptive but a mood stabilizer and To lessen the heaviness. Cross your fingers for me

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this 6 weeks after having my son in June 2019. I had minimal bleeding after giving birth and then stopped all together, two days after starting this birth control I bleed for two weeks straight with very bad pains. I have endometriosis so this is what I was prescribed to stop my periods so I would have as much pain. September 2019 I started bleeding again, only 6 days this time. I made sure to take my pill at the same time everyday because they said maybe that’s why I was bleeding. As of right now, January 24th 2020, I have been bleeding for 21 days so far. THREE WEEKS of non stop period and I’m still taking the pill everyday at the same time but it still hasn’t stopped. I know this may work for some people period wise it doesn’t work for me I guess.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worst birth control I have ever used. My breasts ache, it makes me cry uncontrollably, makes me have mood swings and a buzzing feeling in my girl parts.  I have spoken to other friends that have used it and they continued to take it even after the crazy symptoms. They levelled out in 3 months. Really? ! My male OBGYN will not change it so I stopped taking it and within 2 weeks feel drastically better. I have since changed doctors because of him not changing the pill. Obviously there is a kickback involved.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It is very important to understand that everyone's body reacts differently to different methods of hormonal birth control. My doctor told me to at least give it a try and after 3 months if I was having bad problems she'd switch me. The initial adjustment part had a few minor rough spots that in no way severely affected my day to day life: mainly I had some moodiness, and I had some light irregular bleeding. But all that totally cleared up after the second month of being on it, and now I have no symptoms at all. I haven't gotten pregnant, and my periods are lighter and shorter which is a huge bonus I wasn't expecting. If you are feeling unsure about this birth control talk to your doctor, don't be scared away by negative reviews. Maybe you will react badly but maybe you won't, however you have to try it to find out. I just wanted to throw this review out here to say this birth control has worked like a gem for me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I'm writing this review to help others. This pill works great for preventing pregnancy, But if you already have problems with anxiety and depression I don't recommend taking this pill. I've been taking Junel fe for about 9 months now and it has caused me to become very moody, angry, very depressed and anxious, low energy, and very little sex drive. Now I've had regular periods, not very painful period, very light period, I do have some acne but not bad. Again if you already have depression or anxiety, I do not recommend this pill, but did great for my periods and preventing pregnancy.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have not had good luck with any birth control pills, but I  think it's safe to say Larin has been the worst.  I have taken this pill multiple times throughout the last few years.  Recently, I have had major depression and anxiety that seems to be a side effect of this pill.  The hormonal imbalance makes me feel like I could be pregnant even though I'm not.  PMS exists for three weeks out of the month for me while I have been on this birth control.  My periods have been lighter on this pill though.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My first period was so short 3 days and spotting, which was concerning. Then on the next month it’s also light and cramping , it’s made me extremely bloated and terrible moods. It’s did however make my periods lighter. I’ve never felt more bloated since starting this, and definitely am going to switch when I go to the doctors

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've taken this birth control 4 months. I've had headaches the entire time and it's raised my blood pressure immensely. I have a long history of bad side effects with birth control and Dr recommend this lower dose. Overall it has been the best I've taken in years as far as depressive side effects being better. But my anxiety seems worse. Also I've not had a period since I started which is nice since I had breakthrough bleeding with everything else I've taken. So although there are positive things, I am going to stop taking it due to health reasons such as the high blood pressure and non-stop headaches.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My pharmacy suggested I try Alyacen because it was much cheaper than my former BC and was supposed to be the equivalent. I have only been on this BC for 8 days and already gained 6 lbs, I’ve been bleeding and cramping everyday and my moodiness is through the roof!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for about a year and a half and I haven’t had any side effects. I take it as I’m supposed to, but even if I have missed a day I also didn’t have any.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had a terrible experience on this birth control pill. I thought I was losing my mind, it completely exacerbated my anxiety and depression to the point where I had paranoia. I was seeking a psychiatrist to be medicated because of how terrible I felt. I didn't realize this pill was causing all of the above issues until my pharmacist switched me over to Mylan, a generic form of ortho tri cyclen. After being on Mylan for a month, I feel like myself and realized it was blisovi 24 fe that made me feel psychotic.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I noticed this birth control giving me depression and it basically ruined my life. I had my period for 3 months straight it did however make it a bit lighter but I tested it out for 6 months before getting getting rid of it. Everyone is different and I’ve had friends on this one and they had a perfectly fine experience with it.

Gildess Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My favorite birth control I've ever taken. I had no period and no acne. My skin was amazing. I discontinued it to start a family but I will be getting on it after the baby.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on this pill microgestin Fe 1/20 for over 12 years, was off of it for 10 months to get pregnant, started it again after and it has been the BEST... I have no complaints on it

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this pill Lo Loestrin Fe. Before taking this I tried paragard IUD and it was just too painful to continue using. I was scared to use the pill because I always had trouble sleeping even in my early 20s. I was worried I would gain weight. To my surprise I lost weight with this pill about 10 pounds. I sleep better with this pill then without it. I found out in another online report the estrogen can increase serotonin. I needed more of that. I do not have periods on this pill but that’s not a problem. No other side effects. I will never go back to paragard
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this birth control for exactly two weeks and it gave acne and I had my period ever since I started taking it I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS BIRTH CONTROL

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control back in November and I’ve had every side effect you can imagine from insomnia to depression severe anxiety rash and abdominal pain THE very last straw was when I got my cycle this month (January) for 3 days and it was barely anything also brown the entire time and my stomach was STILL hurting so I stopped taking them January 8th, 2 days later my cycle came on full blown very heavy stayed on for 3 days minor cramping and now today is January 18th and I’ve been cramping for 2 days off and on having abdominal pain so I guess my body is trying to adjust so yeah this experience has been the absolute worst! I do not recommend.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just started Lo Loestrin Fe on December 31st 2019. I had been c taking Junel Fe, but was switched to a lower dose of hormones cause of high blood pressure. I’ve got to say I hope it gets better soon cause I started bleeding in the middle of the pack and cramping and my uterus is shedding it’s uncomfortable and painful. I hope my body gets used to it and this bleeding isn’t a current thing.

This birth control has been HORRIBLE. I am normally on Microgestin and have been for years. Recently my pharmacy was out of the Microgestin and had me go onto this. I was prescribed this BC last year too and remember the nausea and the headaches, the weight gain and the mental fog. But this time it is much worse. I have discontinued taking it. So disappointed. Even when I told the pharmacist my symptoms she said it’s normal, deal with them or don’t take it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my first birth control and the only reason I began taking it was to help my heavy and painful periods. It did make my period almost non existent and pain free! However, I gained 10 pounds within 2 months and began to feel horrible nausea, dizzy, and completely out of it.
Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Honestly, I did not notice a lot of side effects. But it also  did not help at all with cramps or heavy flow at all

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My experience with Lo Loesterin Fe has not been great. I’ve gotten a lot of acne, had terrible mood swings, and I am so nauseous everyday to the point that I don’t want to eat or move. I originally was prescribed this birth control to help regulate my periods and it has not helped at all. This birth control may work great for some and not so great for others.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I remember using BC in high school by the name of loestrin 24 fe to control irregular period cycling. It had given me the most intense mood swings, I lost my libido, and became miserable. Years later I was going to try it again but mistook the name for Lo Loestrin . I figured I'd give it a try and see how it goes. Today is literally my second day on the stuff and I literally feel like I was given a muscle relaxant. Way sleepy, mind is fuzzy. Forgot my phone in places unintentionally. Wasn't expecting this. I'll continue to observe my reaction. After getting more sleep, I feel better but that hazy feeling was just unexpected.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill was suggested by my doctor to regulate heavy bleeding during my period.  Month one was fine...I had a light period for a few days.  However, 18 days later I got my period again, and this time it lasted 12 days.  Not to mention I had uncontrollable anger, felt very tense, and was overall moody and negative.  I also started to have very dark thoughts that were not at all normal for me.  The worst part was that my anger was affecting my kids.  I always felt on edge like I was ready to explode.  After period #2 was over, it came back 18 days later for another 12 days.  I was also horribly bloated to the point of not fitting into my clothes properly.  Given the horrible mood swings, disturbing thoughts, and relentless anger I was experiencing I stopped taking the pill during the last week of my 3rd pack.  Within 2 days the bloating started to subside, and I started to feel like myself again.  No more constant anger and moodiness.  I would not recommend this pill to anyone!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This Taytulla  pill was awful for me! I have never had anxiety before and this pill made it happen. I would literally have anxiety when I was talking to my friends. It also dried out my lips. I had dry flaky skin on and around my lips. I would never recommend this to anyone!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was previously on Sprintec for my endometriosis, but my bleeding wouldn’t subside until I switched to this Lo Loestrin fe. It completely stopped that issue but boy did it give me other awful side effect. I have major hot flashes, depression, mood swings, high blood pressure and feel like I’m going to faint after barely any exercise . Absolutely ruined me. I had to go to the hospital today to make sure I was okay and I’m having to go back to something else. I know everyone’s bodies are different so it may work for you but it def did not for me. Would not recommend!

Hailey 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 27, tried this pill for over a year (been on BC since I was 15 trying to find one that doesn't make me hate my life), the only great thing about it for me was that it works well as birth control. The first 3 months my cycle was normal on it, but after that it was SO irregular. Gave me terrible cystic acne, and also acne on my back (which is very rare for me). Basically my new mantra was "another day another cyst" because basically everyday a new one would appear and they take FOREVER to clear up and hurt so bad!!  I work out 3 times a week and have an active lifestyle and mostly eat healthy, haven't gained weight but I'd imagine I would've if I wasn't active. Besides not being able to lose weight and having terrible skin, and abnormal bleeding, I definitely felt moody and like my hormones were imbalanced on this pill. I started taking "Nikki" a few weeks ago, and am starting to feel better and have had no breakouts, so hopefully that does the trick.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It made me throw up a lot, light headed and made my periods more painful.  My period lasted 9 days with spotting in the beginning and the whole time; terrible cramps. I was put on it before I was diagnosed with polycystic ovarian syndrome. I threw up the pill and had to take two the next day and I felt sick the whole day. Wasn’t very fun. My acne wasn’t too bad or good. Good luck to anyone who takes it. I hope it works well for you! :)

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve taken the pill before - no issues. I went back on it Dec 2019 because my doctor suggested it to resolve a cyst on one of my ovaries. My doctor prescribed Yaz but my pharmacy gave me a generic, Nikki. I was on it for 6 weeks before I couldn’t stand it and she switched me to Junel Fe. Nikki caused depression, anxiety, crying jags, migraines and nausea for the 1st month. Those eased after I started the 2nd pack but then my period wouldn’t stop. I stopped taking Nikki and started the Junel Fe on the first Sunday after my period. 3+ plus weeks later, I'm STILL bleeding. Now I’m getting my 'real' period since I’m it’s the inactive week. I’ve had constant bleeding, plus severe cramping and back pain for over a week. I've also had severe bloating which is also causing abdominal discomfort. I haven't had a lot of the emotional side effects that others have mentioned - which is about the only good thing I can say for the experience. I don’t recommend this or any other pill.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I myself freak out and read all these reviews and that’s why I stayed off of birth control for like 7 years and have continued to suffer from PCOS (hope it’s not endo but we’ll see with time hopefully) and I finally did it and took the pill! I had no choice really. I had a severely painful ovarian cyst pop after sex (not my first time) and I decided it was enough of going to the hospital and suffering. I started this pill a week ago and I’ll update as much as I can .. so far I had some foggy days in the beginning and felt pretty weird but then it went away and the nausea has been on and off (which they say is normal) I do drink a lot of herbal tea already so that has probably been helping it (peppermint/etc) and now my only complaints are this random brown discharge today(first time kinda) and itchy/burning bumps/pimples that keep popping up everywhere the past few days. I do have sensitive skin already but I hope I get used to this pill. I am on the second week! Will report back soon

Loestrin 21 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The devil in disguiseI never experienced anxiety problems before taking this joke of a pill and soon I found myself taking sick days because of extreme panic attacks. It caused very unpredictable mood swings. Made me very irritable and irrational. My boyfriend even compared my behaviour to the jokers-had the highest highs and the lowest lows. The way it made me act was scary to me and those around me. I felt possessed and I had no control over my emotions. I'm usually a chill person and this pill made me angry and upset at things which I wouldn't typically bat an eyelid at.  The first month was actually ok and I thought it would stay that way. It got much worse after a month. Was lead to believe symptoms would improve after 3 months but they only continued to get more and more severe. Worst 4 months of my life taking this pill. Writing this to prevent another woman experiencing what I did- I wouldn't wish this experience on my worst enemy. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Reading all of these DO NOT TAKE THIS BIRTH CONTROL comments is so frustrating. Everyone has a different experience on birth control because hormones affects everyone’s body differently. What works for you might not work for someone else, considering we all metabolize drugs differently, which can be attributed to genetics . I was first on Junel Fe and switched to Nexplanon because I didn’t want to remember to take a pill, and Nexplanon was awful. Now I’m back on Junel Fe as of a week ago and when I was on it before I was on Nexplanon, it was amazing. No pregnancy, regular periods, no side effects. But that’s because I reacted well to Junel Fe and not Nexplanon. But I’m not going to tell people not to go on Nexplanon ever, because as I said, EVERYONES BODY REACTS DIFFERENTLY. So all I’m saying is I loved this BC, and some others don’t, but you won’t know how your body react without trying it.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control destroyed my mental state, after being on it for a month I started to spiral into depression and suicidal thoughts, no interest in the activities I used to love like doing art or going on adventures. I would go into a rage or break down sobbing over the smallest things. Hot flashes all the time, breaking out on my chin and nose. I hate this birth control so much, I'm now off it and I'm never taking the pill again because of this experience, I'll be finding an alternative BC.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Reading these comments are actually the most scary things I think anyone trying a new birth control could do. I have been on lo loestrin fe for 5 years now and honestly I have very little remembrance of what I was like before the pill so I could be biased, but I feel that I have had a pretty good experience. I rarely have my period and when I do it is super light (maybe 3-4 days). I never broke out. I didn’t gain weight. I would say I am super emotional, but I also never thought to blame it on the birth control. After 5 years of feeling certain ways I also know how to control my emotions and blame it on hormones. I am now switching to a new birth control for one of the reasons being just in the past 6 months I have experienced cramps getting worse and a bit of breakthrough bleeding and honestly I just want to try something new! Each birth control is different for everyone and I know it takes time to adjust so I would definitely say give it a try!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched from Sprintec to LoLo, as the Sprintec gave me migraine 2x’s a week. I’ve got to say this has been a pretty great birth control! My periods have completely stopped and I only have a few headaches here and there.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first few months of taking LoLo caused extreme nausea and irritability. My period disappeared for the first two months then after about three months of taking it, BAM breakthrough bleeding nearly every day of every month. I have a full on period during the middle of my pack and don't get a period aside from spotting at the end of my pack. I'm still irritable and just feel overall unwell on it. I've also gained about 5-10 pounds. I hate this medication and am making a doctor appointment soon to either switch brands or get off BC completely.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking this pill for over 2 years. At first I had spotting between periods but now all of that has gone away. I do not get a period anymore. The only time that I bleed is when I have missed a pill or 2. The major complaint that I have is that I weighed 120lbs when I first started this pill. Now I am 160lbs. So...I've gained 40lbs within 2 years. I am hungry all of the time..even after eating a whole meal. Since I don't receive a period maybe my body is tricked into believing its already pregnant...hence my increased appetite. This is the first time I've been on birth control longterm. Other than that I have no other issues with the pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After a horrible experience with the Mirena IUD, I was put on LoLoestrin. In the 3 months I’ve been on it, it’s effectively regulated my period and significantly reduced the bleeding and excruciating cramps! BUT I’ve gained 10lbs since starting this medication and I’m only continuing to gain. I’m nearly positive this is due to the drug because before this, I had been essentially the same weight for over 5 years. I don’t think I’ll continue to take it for this reason.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Would not recommend this birth control if you are looking for something to clear your acne. I was on Zarah for about 2 years with no issues and clear skin until I read there were some health concerns about it (and Yaz, Yasmin, etc). It was a big mistake to switch from Zarah. I would say I've put on a little weight but really nothing noticeable to anyone but myself (probably no more like 4-5lbs) and I do a vigorous HIIT workout 4x a week so there is really no other reason I should have been gaining weight. I am switching to Beyaz next week after my inactive week. I am getting married in 6 months so clear skin is a must. That being said, everyone's experience with birth control is different! I cannot stress that enough! I have tried 10 different brands of BC (a lot on the recommendation of other women) that did not work for me but others raved about. You just have to try out one until you finally find one you like. Praying Beyaz is that one for me!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I do not recommend this birth control, especially for those who suffer from acne. In my case I have cystic acne. This birth control caused me extreme breakouts. I am past the two month period and still experiencing uncontrollable breakouts. This birth control was enough to revert my post Accutane clear skin. If you are seeking help for acne as well as a good birth control, STAY AWAY this is not for you.
Junel 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've taken birth control for 20 years and never experienced spotting between periods until this brand. I'm going to request Microgestrin from now on.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Junel Fe 1/20 for 10 months, and it has sucked! When I first started taking the pill I had a period for like 10 days, and it was super heavy. My gynecologist put me on this for my PCOS, and it’s my first time ever taking birth control. This pill has made me over emotional, angry, and I cry like a lot. It has worsened my depression, and it also has made my hair grow back faster like underneath my chin. I’ve even noticed hair growing in places that it shouldn’t be. I get severe headaches and my heart races a lot on this medication. I am quitting this birth control, and I will not try any new ones. I do not recommend this birth control at all.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this birth control for two months. It worked okay with effectiveness, however I had breakthrough bleeding the entire time on Lo Loestrin Fe, and never bled on the placebo pills. It also caused me to have tons of breakouts and nausea. After two months, I was over it and switched to Portia. My body adjusted quickly with hardly any side effects, just a few breakouts before my placebo pills.
Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this BC for 10 years , since I was 16 and never had a pregnancy , a symptom or a problem. It works good !

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control and spotted for the first 3 months but have has no problems since taking it. I used to get very heavy periods and now very light to no periods. No more back pain or being unable to walk. I am very grateful for this birth control!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I was recommended to take this birth control because I have a cyst on my ovary. They are trying to see if birth control would stop it from growing. I'm 24 never was on birth control never had a pregnancy scare nothing. I've been taking this birth control since Oct 2019. And it been the worst. The first month wasn't that bad second month until now has been awful my boobs are extremely sore and enlarged they never stop hurting. I will take my bra off and have to grab them because that's how bad they hurt! The period situation I have been spotting with cramps for 2 weeks now it's annoying because u don't have a clue when it's going to stop. I get headaches I don't really ea,t mood swings are bad, in a horrible state of depression and it's just like you can't tell what the  is wrong with u ! I called my gyn doctor and waiting for my appointment to get off of it and back to how I was living before ... birth control is bad for ur body anyway just have safe sex
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve taken this pill for 2 days & I feel so nauseous & just totally out of it... Definitely wouldn’t recommend this pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):lots of ppl seem to hate on lolo bc theyve tried it for a few weeks and base their judgement off of that.. with birth control you need to take it for a few months before making any judgement on it as it gets used to your body and see how your body handles it... ive seen ppl complaining about the same stuff ive gone through in the beginning tooi was told to take my first pill on the sunday of my period.. i then got my period for 2 weeks.. after the first month i have NOT gotten a period since, no blood, no cramps, no headache, no wacky acne.. yes its safe bc i have doctors in the fam who even recommended lolo..EVERY! BODY! IS! DIFF!giving this drug a few weeks to do its thing & expecting such high results is setting yourself up for failure.. let it actually get used to your body for a few months.. if it still doesnt work after a few months, switch it.. if you stuck through a bit of your hormones changing and the pill actually getting used to your body and now it works, then :) !

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started Lo Loestrin Fe 3 months ago to prevent pregnancy and help with period cramps. I have a long, painful history with birth control pills. I have tried at least 5 different brands and every one of them made me extremely nauseous, until now. My personal pros for this pill include: no cramps, no nausea like others have caused, no headaches, more appetite, weight gain (which I needed). My cons: mood swings, skipped my period (I like to have my period so I know that I’m not pregnant), sore breasts but only for a couple days before my period, slightly lower sex drive and fatigue. Everyone is different and everyone’s body reacts differently to different medicines, but I personally would recommend this one if you’ve had trouble with nausea on birth control pills. I take it around the same time every night and so far it’s been effective.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Personally I love this contraceptive! I think it is a great help for women with extremely painful cramps, and a heavy flow. I have not experienced any weight gain thankfully but sadly no weight loss either

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I went on this birth control following my IUD being removed. This birth control caused me to get migraines weekly and scary chest tightness. I took it for as long as I could stand but the side effects weren't going away. Once I stopped taking this, the headaches and chest tightness stopped.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control  Blisovi Fe for about 3 months now, and I definitely saw something different in me. For some reason I’ve been very sad lately, as I am already on depression medication (Lexapro) and it makes it 10x worse. Blisovi Fe makes me have very thick ovulation, but when it gets time for me to start my period, it doesn’t start until like the 3rd day of taking the brown pills, and it LASTS FOR 1 day , literally the lightest ever. I mean, it’s good and all but sometimes it scares me with the way my body slowly reacts to it.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If I could give 0/10 I would! At first I was on the Nexplanon which caused non-stop bleeding! Doctors told me to wait it out because my body needed to get used it it, well it never did. So, they prescribed me the Junel to regulate the bleeding. Well, that didn’t work so I started taking the pill by it’s self. I’ve never been so big or depressed in my life and definitely hated everything about the pill. Constant breakthrough bleeding and cramping. Definitely don’t recommend!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I really like this birth control.  I was on Ortho Tricyclin Low for 8 or 9 years.  When they discontinued it about a year ago I was pretty bummed.  I was given a few different of the generic versions of Ortho Triycyclin Low- but I had bad physical and emotional reactions to them.  I asked my gyno for Lo Loestrin and have been really happy with it.  I might have initially gained 2-3 pounds (lol or maybe it was just winter fat!) but I quickly got the weight off.  Since then I haven’t had a single side effect besides never having my period.  I miss the normalcy of it- I guess, and I end up taking a pregnancy test every few months (mostly just cause I’m a little neurotic).  But anyways, I really like this birth control over all.  I was initially quite scared when I read the negative  reviews, so I figured I’d throw a positive review in here to even it out.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Avoid like a plague. I have a fibroid I just discovered last month it's about 8cm ish. Had a normal cycle before getting on this pill. Just normal cramping first and second day (same experience since I was 12 years) and a normal cycle. Doc put me on this to slow fibroid growth. Worst month ever esp during the holidays. I have never had acne, I started breaking out, I have in general a high pain tolerance but the pain was so much I had to go to the ER.I experienced pain in areas that had never cramped before. Can we talk about how bloated this makes you feel. Mentally I felt very foggy. I have never been on bc and I am not returning back to it because if this horrible experience. Of course bc depends on your body but This bc is a nuisance please avoid

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am on my second pack and 3rd row of medication I have depression and anxiety and started the pill because my PMS was horrible and it was really irregular. My doctor put me on this medication and the non-physical aspects of my PMS were reduced greatly and even the physical aspects were reduced. I was so happy. I had breakthrough bleeding and abnormal discharge but then started having some heavier breakthrough bleeding which was a little strange. It cleared up my acne significantly as well. I started having nausea and stomach aches this past week and I don’t know if that’s because of my eating habits/stress or because of the medication. I also had just today some breakthrough bleeding like a light period with dark almost brown colored blood and cramps. I assumed this was just because of the medicine and it didn’t really affect me too bad today.I have been so incredibly happy on it, it pretty much changed my entire life. I feel like a whole new person.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So it worked, meaning I didn’t get pregnant. But, it messed me up big time. Let me tell you, it ruined my sex drive & anytime my boyfriend and I had sex it would feel like sandpaper was being rubbed down there. I suffer from anxiety, but my panic attacks were HORRIBLE on this birth control. I couldn’t keep weight on for the life of me. I see a lot of people talk about weight gain but I dropped 13 pounds from being on this stuff. It must’ve been the anxiety or not having an appetite. Lastly, I had recurring BV 3 times within the 4 1/2 months  as a side effect when I was on Blisovi.  I stopped taking it a few weeks ago because I kept thinking I had so much wrong with me and was willing to try whatever to see. My mom told me to stop taking the birth control and ever since... I’ve been feeling so much better. My anxiety has calmed down a lot. My sex life is back and better. The BV hasn’t returned and I’ve had an actual appetite since. Birth control sucks, and I hated my experience with Blisovi.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It really helps lighten my periods and it keeps me from cramping but the package is really irritating as it does not flip like the other birth controls and you have to put it in a little cardboard wallet thing.
Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):All I havge to say is I will no longer be taking this pill EVER AGAIN -IT IS THE WORST

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am only writing this review to let other women know that Lo loestrin fe gave me major depression and suicidal thoughts. It also raised my blood pressure significantly. If you have issues with mental health, I ask that you be cautious of this pill.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Honestly, I read all these comments about how this birth control would make me depressed, gain weight, have horrible mood swings, etc... but I've been taking it for almost 2 months now and I've had none of these side effects. I really don't see a problem with this oral contraceptive but yet again we are all different and react differently to medications. My personal experience has been that I did notice breakthrough bleeding within the 2 weeks on the pill but it only lasted 3 days and it was very light. I have also read about people not getting their period but I have gotten mine right on schedule and it has been very light and basically just spotting. I originally started this pill to lighten my period and cramps and it has been very effective.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this pill for about 9 months and have had no problems at all. I used to have pretty annoying acne, but over time this pill has slowed down the amount of pimples I get. My period is VERY predictable. During my no pill week, I start with 2 days of no period, 4 days of light to medium flow, one day with no period, then start a new pack. That’s how it’s worked for months and I’m grateful. No cramps, no breakthrough bleeding, no super heavy flow, no nausea, no headaches or anything like that. I feel like my face has gotten chubbier but I haven’t gained any actual weight so not sure what to make of that. In terms of mood, I’ve always been a very emotional person so I won’t attribute that to Junel. I’ve been anxious and depressed for years, and I don’t think this has made it any better or worse.
Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Pirmella has reduced cramping, Significantly lightened periods, cleared acne.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Well I’m 18 , I started using Lo Loestrin Fe , due to the fact I had bad acne I’ve never been on birth control pills I was always scared of side affects and reviews I've seen are just horrible :/ I've been on this pill for about a week and a half and I’ve already started to notice mood swings it’s really not the best but , it has cleared some of my acne !

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After experiencing breakthrough bleeding on Tri-Sprintec, my doctor switched me to Junel Fe. The first 2-3 months I had no side effects and was experiencing normal periods. By the end of month 3, I went off the deep end. My anxiety and paranoia has been SO unbelievably horrible for the past 3 weeks and my skin is the worst it’s been. I’ve never been one to suffer from anxiety or depression, but this pill is no joke ruining my life. My stomach is consistently in knots, my heart never stops racing, and I’ve had to seriously force feed myself due to no having no appetite. The only time I feel normal is when I’m sleeping. Thank god I came on here and read others similar experiences because I was ready to check myself into a psych ward. I’m 5 pills into my fourth pack and have to stop taking them. I’d rather have my period for a month straight than take Junel Fe. If you end up trying them, don’t worry, you’re not going psychotic. It’s just these hideous pills!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just started taking birth control again at the beginning of the year, after not using it for almost 10 years. I got put on lo loestrin Fe after I tried Yaz. I loved Yaz, but it gave me horrible migraines, nothing helped them either. After my 3 months of Lo lo, the pill was ok, I would still get bad cramps around my period, and my headaches got better, but didn’t go away. I still have them daily but they aren't as intense. I also felt a bit more in a irritable mood while I was on it. I just started my first pack of the mini pill, I hope these ones work out better!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got ONE depo shot and it made me bleed for over a year. Also made my periods 20 days long when I finally started having them again, and they were just all out of whack. My doctor prescribed me this to see if it helped and it helped so much. But honestly, it’s not even worth it for how it makes you feel. My depression is awful and I honestly just don’t even feel like myself anymore. My fiancé even tells me I changed I’m gonna stop taking it. I can’t take feeling like this anymore.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe 1/20 DROVE ME INSANE, my anxiety and depression got so bad and I actually considered cutting myself again after being clean for probably 8 years. Made it harder for me to lose weight. I was getting 2 periods a month. Acne did not get better or worse really. This pack GAVE me menstrual cramps whereas before I hardly ever got them

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this medication for a little over a year in high school as my period pain was keeping me home. This pill only contributed to making my cramps worse and made me incredibly emotional and irritable. The low dose of hormone is appealing but you should not underestimate the effect the medicine can have on your mental and physical health. I'm so glad to feel like myself again and have centralized hormones with my IUD.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First month on this birth control and I absolutely love it. I switched from orsythia to Junel 1/20 FE and it has been a god send. I’ve had mild acne, nothing too crazy, as of yet no breakthrough bleeding either. I don’t feel as bloated on this birth control which was a big issue before. I did gain weight on Orsythia, will have to wait and see how Junel works in that aspect. I am on Wellbutrin for mild depression so I can’t quite say if this birth control has affected my mood, as I’m technically on an antidepressant. All in all, I’m happy to have found this bc, I plan to stay on it. Will update if anything changes.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe 1/20 is the Worst experience on any meds I have ever taken.  In the nine days I was able to stand taking this BC, I dealt with all the usual - sore chest, constipation, bloated belly, weight gain, & heightened sadness with no external cause.  This is all to be expected & may have worked itself out over time. However, the scariest side effect by day two was excruciating pain that over the course of at the least the next two weeks traveled from my shoulder, to my neck, to mid back, to my lower left back, to my groin, & settled into my mid lower back.  I was in excruciating pain at times & was not able to drive for fear I would pass out. Needless to say, I missed work time & it significantly impacted the holiday season for me & my family in a very negative way.  I was afraid I would not be able to walk normally again. After a week off this medication, I am only in moderate pain & can walk & drive, but in pain.  At least I know I am not going become disabled.  This experience was truly horrifying.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Larin Fe 1/20 has been kinda good so far, I was recently switched to this brand from my other brand Junel fe 1/20. On this new brand Larin, I have had horrible headaches & random cramps throughout the month. I did have a pregnancy scare because I had some symptoms of pregnancy due to the switch of brands but it turns out that Larin did do its job at preventing pregnancy. My periods are much lighter & I don’t have much cramping when I get them. Overall Larin is great! Just gotta let your body get used to it after a few packs!

Cyclafem 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Absolutely horrible! Started this and after a month I started having panic attacks and was extremely depressed. Stopped taking it 2 weeks ago and I’m just now starting to see the light at the end of the tunnel!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first month on this pill was great. Slowly little side affects started popping up like getting baby burps which is something I noticed another review said. It causes me to have tiny little burps about every 30 minutes and I’ve never experienced that before now. It’s also made me fairly gassy. Worst of all, it’s made me retain a lot of water weight to the point where I am drinking more water than I have in the past and my urine is still fairly dark in the morning. My hands feel swollen when I wake up in the morning from the water weight and my clothes are not fitting on my legs/lower half anymore. People have told me my legs look swollen from the water weight. I have half a pack left and I am considering stopping it even before then because the affects are bad. If I didn’t have these affects then I would think the pill was good because I have not experienced any emotional or mental issues like depression while taking this. It’s also made my period lighter.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking my Junel 1/20 for almost a month now, I just have my placebo pills left for next week. I haven’t noticed any bloating or weight gain. However I have noticed a little more acne, temper is a little worse, and it sometimes makes me nausea. The biggest issue I am having is becoming very dizzy at times, mostly at night when I lay down for bed. I was wondering if anyone else is having the same issue or if I might be getting dizzy for other health reasons. Thanks!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control over 2 months ago and today I had to call it quits. Everything was great for the first month except for some occasional mood swings. But those mood swings increased so much by the 2nd month. I constantly feel angry all the time and I don’t even know why. I absolutely hate feeling this way. My poor husband had spent the last 2 months getting yelled at by me all the time for no reason which is so not like me. But I gave it a 5 because mood swings were the only side effect I got from this birth control in the past couple months I’ve been taking it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The only complaint I have about this birth control is that I get my period twice a month when taking this. Other than that I had no other side effects.

Ortho-Novum 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Otho-Novum 1/35  (ON1/35) when I was 15 yrs to regulate my periods and reduce bleeding (was bleeding for 2 weeks before the pill) this worked to do both.  I had no cramping and it almost stopped my bleeding completely.  Now years later I tried to get pregnant.  I've tried horomones, ovulation tracking, IUI and nothing works.  This pill stops the release of eggs.  My issues now are no egg production and the ones I have are not released.  I would suggest menstrual cups to anyone looking to regulate period flow/days bleeding and anything other then a hormone treatment to control pregnancy, acne, and moods...that is if you want a family some day.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):THIS PILL IS THE WORST!!!!! Im a freshman in college and have been on it for almost three months but I'm stopping it today, I can't take it anymore. I am so depressed to the point where I have spent the entire day crying on what is supposed to be a nice and relaxing family vacation!! I have terrible mood swings, gained 10lbs, my skin is breaking out, and gotten depression (which I have had before while not taking BC) which has only been increasing during my time on the pill! I read the terrible reviews and at first thought Blisovi 24 fe wasn't too bad but after three months I am experiencing almost everything that everyone else who hated this pill experienced. The only plus is that my boobs got bigger lol. But seriously do not take this

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Initially when I first started Larin I didn’t mind it. Didn’t affect my depression or anxiety and I didn’t have any acne. The reason for the low rating is one of the side affects of taking this pill is yeast infections. After the first month of the pack I noticed I was itchy down there and couldn’t understand why till I read it was one of the side affects of this birth control. I stopped taking it because it’s not worth the headache! Which is a bummer because I didn’t have any other problems with side affects except this one.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At 40 years old my period was heavy and my iron was crashing. I had never taken BC before because I already struggle with weight. After months of dealing with a heavy period, I decided it was time. I explained my weight gain and acne fears (yes I breakout easily) to her and she told me that Lolo FE would be the best for me. I’m on month four and my skin is horrible. I’ve had to have laser treatments just to calm the inflammation down & I started having debilitating anxiety. This stuff is poison. I am angry at the gyn for even prescribing it!

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control (BC) pill called Mibelas 24 Fe about 5 months ago. This is the first BC I’ve ever had. 1st month I had awful side effects (breast tenderness, migraine, and felt like I was going crazy) and for the first 2 months I had breakthrough bleeding. After the first month, those side effects went away. As someone who bled very heavily prior to BC, I have had no cramps and light bleeding while on Mibelas. I believe this is my 5th month and I have not bled at all this month... & I have never missed a dose. I know BC can cause amenorrhea but as someone who had very regular periods prior to starting the drug and is sexually active, having my period regularly is a nice peace of mind.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this birth control Lo Loestrin  FE about 2 years and a half and I’m really pleased . At first I was worried because of all side effect on the list but I didn’t have any . I really love them . Many people here say do not take them and they shouldn’t say that . People have different reactions to birth control methods due to how your body reacts and every body is different . Don’t be scared to try them out and if you have side effects simply change method .

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):On this  Junel Fe 1/20 pill for 3 years The first 3 months I had spotting if I were late for a pill by a few hours. It would last until my next period. I also had bloating. My mood was improved after the first few months (I used to get major depression and was moody). My sex drive decreased, still is, but it’s not terrible. After year 1 everything was regular except occasional missed period. Now I get it every month, varying lengths but no heavy bleeding and hardly any cramps. I did gain weight, but I was underweight before and could manage my weight if I tried. I gained 25 lbs approx. Overall this pill makes my life a lot easier with my period, my emotional state, and for me weight gain and enlarged breasts were a positive. One time, I got terrible pain in my stomach randomly, I figured my body was adjusting to the pill but it may not have been. In the first months, you might get weird or annoying symptoms or side effects but they often dissipate. If you cannot function on it though, by all means discontinue.

Vyfemla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this birth control besides the fact that I bleed post intercourse for several days, miss a pill breakthrough bleeding the next day. I’ve never bled so easily while taking the pill. But my skins clear and I feel great.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took Lo Loestrin fe for 5 months, wanted to regulate my periods. First  few days of taking it, I was getting bad headaches & got acne on face only, period stopped coming till 3rd month & was followed by bleeding for 2 weeks, by 4th month acne was gone, headaches continued, had extreme anxiety & depression, was getting moody, lost weight, appetite was almost gone. By the 4th month, had gotten my period which lasted a week with painful cramps, a week & a half later again with breakthrough bleeding & this time was very heavy with passing blood clots. Felt very weak & miserable, I took it exactly the same time every day & never missed a dose, still had headaches & vomiting, breakthrough bleeding was getting heavy & was not stopping at all, I could barely make it through the 5th month, I felt weak and tired also, so spoke to my doc & told her that I’m stopping this pill. Been a week now since I stopped taking this pill and I still feel weak and shaky.This medicine is not for me at all.
Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible hair loss after 3 months of starting Loestrin 24 . Stopped taking it because of it.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this birth control in June 2019 to help with my severe cramps and heavy periods. For the first few months, the only side effects I experienced were breast tenderness and I was veryyy emotional, but it was tolerable. It definitely helped with my periods. After 4 months being on this pill, the side effects got way worse. For the last two months, my anxiety and depression spiked like crazy. I woke up in the middle of EVERY night with horrible anxiety and couldn’t fall back asleep. It got so bad to the point that I went to the hospital, thinking something was physically wrong with me. I also haven’t  gotten my period for the past two months, which was a little weird. Reading these reviews, now I understand. I stopped taking the pill for about 3 weeks now and I do sometimes get nauseous, but my mental health has definitely improved. I feel much better and can’t wait for everything to be back to normal. Will definitely try a different brand of birth control soon

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):HORRIBLE CRAMPING. I started taking this Lo Loestrin fe  6 weeks postpartum so I expected my hormones to be even more messed up than they already were. I always had really bad cramps: before, during, and after pregnancy. I bled for the first two weeks taking this (pp bleeding had already stopped) and oh dear! I feel like I'm in labor again every day. I'm constantly in a state of mild cramping and every half hour or so its like a strong contraction coming on. Why?! I talk to my midwife and she told me it is very common with this birth control. I didn't make it through the 3 month period.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After years of mirena I switched to this pill. I had been on the pill when I was younger and had mild side effects initially, but this pill is the worst. I've been taking it for almost 2 months and have missed 3 days of work from being so sick. I've actually lost weight from the constant nauseousness and occasional vomiting. Also headaches, boobs hurt, mood swings, no energy, little sex drive. I finally called my dr and we're switching to another pill. Based on other reviews, it sounds like my experience in not uncommon. My boyfriend finally convinced me to get off this pill and said he just wants his girlfriend back.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had the mirena for 3 years. It was the first birth control I've used since I got married 3 years ago... It was wonderful except after a year I started getting hot flashes. I suffered for a bit longer and then had it removed. Hot flashes gone!!! I was given microgestin. I took it for 16 days and bleed for 16 days. Full blown, heavy bleeding, huge clots, thought I would expel my uterus. lol. Dr. said keep taking and if I feel like I'm going to pass out come to the office. I didn't listen and stopped the pills. 3 days later no blood. I've never bleed like this in my life.
