Not sure why it made me bleed. Wish I understood this since it's supposed to make you not... Anyways I'm going to take a break for a couple months and maybe try a different pill...

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m fairly active (workout at least 3x/week cardio and weightlifting) and have a good diet (fruits + yogurt for breakfast, chicken + rice for dinner, no fast food/snacks/sodas), and I don’t smoke or use tobacco.Side Effects:First week I was on Junel, I immediately got hormonal acne around my mouth and forehead, I was able to improve it 99% with ACV + water 1:3 mixture. Every now and then I get a small break out, nothing major.However, I noticed a major decrease in my sex drive, it‘s nonexistent no matter how active I am through the week.I do experience RARE achey headaches but they go away quickly with excedrin and don’t tend to come back. I’m not sure how related these headaches are to Junel since they come and go without a distinct pattern, but I stay hydrated every day.I have noticed I get small bouts of frustration and crying, but RARELY.Positives:This is one of the first BC brands that I don’t experience seasonal depression with.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first time on birth control. My first 3 months I had this horrible nausea that caused me to stop eating, I adjusted the time I was taking the pill to see if that would do anything, instead of taking it in the afternoon I started taking at night before I went to bed. This helped dramatically, except when I started a new pack the first week during sometime in the week I got this horrible nausea that caused me to not be able to eat or go to school, it also caused my stomach to be very sensitive for the rest of the day. Regardless I continued to take it and these last 3 months have been the worst of my life. School has been very stressful and the pill has only made things worse I have never in my life had bad anxiety or depression, I’m a very positive person but school along with this pill has cause extreme anxiety and depressive episodes for me. For the first time in my life I had mental breakdowns wherever I went, cry myself to sleep at night, and have really dark thoughts

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for a month now. I was never really the type of person to get a lot of acne but ever since I started on this pill I’ve got super bad acne & hate my skin. I was light bleeding for over 2 weeks. I have gained a little over 10 pounds since I started because I'm constantly wanting food. Before I started this birth control I weighted 115, now I weigh 127 in one month. Another thing is I'm always tired no matter how much I sleep. The only plus side is that my cramps aren't as bad anymore.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Honestly this birth control gives the worst cramps in the world and I’m still spotting after one month of taking it its so annoying so technically my period hasn't left and I'm sick of it and I have to continue it till I can get in to see my  obgyn -  ridiculous

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My wife has been taking birth control for over a year and out of the blue, her doctor switched her to Junel Fe. After only working for 3 hours, she is exhausted and cranky.She also gained a bit of weight. We go to the gym 3 times a week but she never sees any progress with her weight. She also hasn’t been dealing with her stress well at all. And she has been getting very anxious to the point where she can’t sleep at night.And the nausea...she gets car sick easily, but it has been getting worse. After reading these reviews, I will get her to read it and suggest  she stop taking it. I hope within the next couple weeks, she starts to feel better.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking Taytulla pill for about four months now and my anxiety is unbearable, I did not realize it was related to this birth control until reading all the comments about anxiety. I feel as if I can’t breath and my heart will explode, my period on the pill is lighter but it is NOT worth it.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have high testosterone and polycystic ovary syndrome so I was told that birth control would help. I want kids in the future that’s what matters to me more than anything. I went on this birth control Junel Fe 1/20. It has been too weeks and I have been terrible on it. I am aggravated, I hate everything around me. I am tired. I am bleeding. I am breaking out more then I already was. I Don’t feel myself I am miserable. I don’t think any woman should go on birth control. This is the most terrible experience I’ve ever had. Do NOT get this birth control if you are considering going on one.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control Lo Loestrin Fe was fine for a month, but by month three I was having horrible depression and mood swings. Other than that I didn’t experience any other side effects. My period was very light (almost nonexistent). Weight stayed pretty consistent, and it did help with my PMS cravings! However, mood and feeling like I’d rather not live was NOT worth staying on this pill! Will try another. Everyone is different!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took brand Microgestin for a year and it was the WORSE. I had yeast infections CONSTANTLY. My periods would last over a week. I had horrible moods, and bad cramping. My sex drive was low and when I was in the mood, I was as dry as a desert! Sex was incredibly painful, and I absolutely hated it. Well a couple of months ago my insurance stopped covering the brand Microgestin and they switched me to Junel 1.5/30. I was afraid at first, but now I'm pleasantly surprised! I haven't had any yeast infections. My periods only last about 3 days, and my moods are NORMAL! My sex drive is up, and it's not painful! I'm so sorry to all those that have had really bad experiences. I'm glad I was able to find a BC that was right for me. We all have different bodies, and they react differently of course. I hope you all can find a suitable BC that is right for YOUR body!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The pharmacy filled my birth control prescription with Blisovi without telling me that they switched me from my normal BC (Larin), and I've had nothing but problems!! I've been so moody since starting it, I'm breaking out with more pimples than I ever had before, and I've had a period every other week for the past 2 months! My periods have always been normal, so getting 2 in a month worried me but I let it go as I was stressed. The next 2 weeks I got a 3rd one so I called my gyno and went in for an appointment. I've had other kinds of pills before, and none have been as bad as this one. The worst thing is that they couldn't put me back on Larin until I finished the 3rd month of this because I got a 3 month prescription when I got it filled! I can't WAIT to get back to my old prescription because this is just horrible! I've been fatigued extra the past few weeks as well likely because I'm already anemic and losing extra blood on these extra periods isn't helping.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My periods were getting shorter and heavier and a gyno put me on LoLo to get it under control, even after I had told her that I don't do well on most BC pills.  She said to give it three months and see how it goes.  I went from getting my period for 10 days every 23 days to 8 days every 14 days.  I had to leave work often due to dizziness, lack of concentration, and exhaustion. I cried/sobbed myself to sleep almost every night, and didn't want to hang out with anyone.  If I had more than 1 beer when I actually did go out with friends, I would black out.  Every single day for 3 months I had watery diarrhea and headaches.  I should have stopped sooner, but was advised to let my body get used to it.  The day I stopped, I was back to my normal self, and felt better immediately. I will never EVER use this drug again or recommend to anyone.

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At first, this pill made me very nauseous and I want to say that's the only negative side effect that I've experienced. It has helped my hormonal acne tremendously, I have struggled with acne my whole life and although it hasn't cleared it up all the way, I definitely saw a lot less of it. Seeing other reviews, I'm relieved that I'm not the only one that has very light or no period while on this birth control. (I'm not complaining, but it's a little scary when you're sexually active!)

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was one of my first times trying a birth control pill so my doctor prescribed me Lo Loestrin because of the lower dosage of hormones. I hesitated to start taking it for about two weeks because of the terrible reviews I had read. I finally decided to start taking it because I needed to be protected. All of my fears came true plus more.after the first week I was spotting consistently every day with cramps and I still am even after stopping the pill. My mood swings and depression was worse than it’s been in four years. Everyones body reacts in their own way to different medications so you’ll only really know if it works for you if you try it out. I couldn’t even get past the first month..the side affects for me have been so annoying that it’s not even worth it for me to wait it out because I’m not sure that it will get better. I called my doctor and they switched me to a new birth control which I haven’t started taking yet because I’m terrified to feel like this again.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I found Junel  Fe 1.5/30 pretty good ,  Idid not have any of the side effects that people keep talking about. I didn't take this BC for 3 months after it was prescribed because I was so scared of the side effects, but I have none, remember birth control is super common and a majority of people don't have any side effects at all . Noticed a bit of increased appetite and less sex drive but overall I do not feel a difference at all. My periods are so so so much better and it helped a lot with my iron deficiency. I'm also on Zoloft and have severe anxiety and It didn't make a difference and the Zoloft still works how it worked before I started BC, I don't have any anxiety at all with these 2 drugs. Just don't knock it till you try it!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this birth control Blisovi 24 Fe for about 4 months , and it works great at regulating my periods. I now have a steady cycle and no cramps or PMS at all, but it literally ruined the last couple months of my life by ruining with my mental health. I’ve struggled with depression and anxiety before going on the pill, and it was 100x magnified by this birth control, I cry over every little thing and am so depressed and anxious that I cant do my work or go to school. Switching off ASAP

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Take this pill Blisovi 24 FE if you want to experience weight gain, acne, depression, unexplainable sadness, and essentially having two periods a month with the amount of spotting that it causes. Please don’t take this brand of birth control.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Larin Fe 1/20 was my first experience with birth control and it is so so so bad. Random cramping. I also am always constipated don't have a bm for as long as a week sometimes! And I am so depressed and I cry over every thing, I also go from mildly annoyed to feeling rage at the drop of the hat which is not fair to my loved ones. My weight keeps fluctuating even though I'm on a very calorie restrictive diet. Its all bad - don't do it.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):They switched the Blisovi Fe birth control I was taking to this, so I started taking this birth control about a month ago or so and it’s terrible. I had to change my tampon every 40 minutes basically. This has been a very bad experience for me. It seems like I’m taking these pills everyday for no reason. Just to bleed more. It’ll be different for everyone, but this was my terrible experience.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am starting my second week of being on this pill (this is my first time trying any forms of birth control) and it has given me bad acid reflux, nausea to the point where I threw up some blood one morning. Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hello; this is my first month on Junel. I’m currently on my last week which is the non active pills. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Lo Lo estrin for 3 years while I was an undergrad. I was starting an OCP for the first time and the pill worked well for me. My moderate facial acne did not improve much but my back did clear up some. I was on the medication without problems for years then went off the medication. I didn't get my period at all on the pill so I wanted to make sure everything was "working". Started my cycles again and was reassured so I went back on the pill. When I restarted the pill, within a week my back cleared but I also started to have some problems with anxiety/depression/paranoia/racing heartbeat. It was noticeably worse 2-3 days after drinking alcohol and was worse when I would drink coffee. I stayed on the pill and after 4-5 weeks of not drinking alcohol or coffee or tea, I have not had these severe problems.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been taking Junel since July of 2019 and the first week I bled for 2 straight weeks heavy then I skipped 1 period the next month then had 1 normal period in October and a really short one in November and now nothing. I went back to the pill from the Mirena so I would have a period because I hate how bloated I was on the Mirena and now I'm feeling that way again and I hate it!!!! My dr won't change my pills without seeing me and I can't always just get in there to see them.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Works! The only disappointment is the breakouts I continually get. Overall did what it was supposed to despite that. Have seen minimal weight gain, and I work out quite a bit, however I assume it is water weight. I did bleed randomly the first 3 months but after that nothing. Overall, no other side effects have occurred.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed this medication to help control heavy periods and acne. Since taking this pill for over 6 months I haven’t had a real period since the first month of taking it. Sometimes I do still get very emotional during the sugar pill week and I find I feel better if I skip the sugar pills and just keep taking the real thing, which doesn’t hurt to do as long as you don’t do it every single month, as I understand at least. I haven’t noticed any mood changes or depression that I didn’t have before taking this medication and it hasn’t worsened my existing depression and anxiety. I have gained weight since using this pill but I think that’s my own fault and not the pills. I do feel more bloated often though, which still isn’t that big of a deal.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control isn't the best, my periods don't correlate with the time on the pack and I usually get it two weeks into my active pills. I also have become a crazy emotional person, I cry all the time and it is exhausting. I am hopefully getting off of it soon and I hope I am able to find an option that doesn't make me super depressed.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):For me, the time on this pill was a nightmare. I took this pill for 2 years until the start of 2019. Then, took a six month break because I thought the creeping anxiety and depression I'd experienced might be linked to the pill.I went back on Microgestin in June 2019 and things seemed okay. Until September. Suddenly, I felt like my head was in a constant fog again. It started making me anxious, I couldn’t think straight. I started to feel numb, mentally. Like I couldn’t be happy. Then, I started snapping at my partner who I absolutely adore, and realized it was happening again.Long story short, if you’re not feeling like yourself, don’t hesitate to try switching or stopping pills (with a doctor’s advice of course). I’ve had three instances now of feeling like myself again after stopping a birth control pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this pill for 2 and 1/2 years. My period only come every other month, I've had no breakthrough bleeding. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to this birth control from Tri-Sprintec  to Junel fe after my previous birth control stopped working in terms of acne. This medicine has improved my acne significantly! My only complaint is that my period WILL NOT become regular! I have been on this medication for 6-9 months and still can’t count on whether or not I will even get a period or 2 in a month; when on my other birth control it was like clockwork, literally down to the hour.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worst birth control  due to it causing bleeding  but it seems that every week I'm bleeding  and the headaches are the worst. Don't let your doctor recommend  these.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Taytulla for a little over a month, and I would have kept taking it but I developed the side effect of  a DVT!!! I would have kept taking this medication had I not, but after getting this diagnosis I am not touching any form of birth control pill ever again! Some of the other reviews mentioned weight gain, hair loss, and anxiety/depression but I never experienced these, could be because I wasn’t on it for too long. It actually did seem to help with my anxiety though. I did experience some spotting and cramping but I have been experiencing menstrual issues prior to the pill so this was no big deal for me. I would have rated this higher, because it worked pretty well, but for the fact that I could have died I wouldn’t recommend. This however should be taken with a grain of salt though because everyone’s body is different and is going to react differently!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It is horrible!! I’m on the 28 day pack & only lasted a week on it. I would have severe migraines & terrible mood swings. I’m not an overly-emotional person but I was crying because I couldn’t peel an orange. This pill makes me sad & sensitive… don’t recommend.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill October 23rd 2019 and I had my period the 2nd week of being on it and now its time for my period and it hasn't come, I was worried but I read some of the reviews and seen that people didn't have it, I was expecting my period because my doctor told me that it would take 3-4 months to actually change my cycle. But I'll be happy to not have a period. But I do have really bad headaches,t hey are getting better tho. I also had mood swings for the first month, but why I only give it a 5/10 is that my depression and anxiety is super bad. It doesn't help that I'm a freshman in college and I'm pretty stressed. So my mental health already wasn't the greatest but now that I've read others reviews on this medication and seen that it caused it to increase I understand why I've been so down lately.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL!!! I took it for a week and it gave me a lot of chest pressure and a rapid heart rate, and super nauseous, I couldn’t sleep for 4 nights straight because of my rapid heart rate. I did not like the feeling that I was going through, I truly do not recommend this birth control.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this birth control about 5 months ago and I’m not too sure about it. My face has been breaking out more, compared to the other pills I have taken, my periods are extremely light, cramps and back pain every month, mood swings and headaches. I do not recommend this birth control at all, there are definitely better options for you.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Taytulla for 3 months and have had my period since I started taking the pill. (That’s a fourth of the year!) I have had cramps the entire time as well. About 2 years ago I was on Taytulla and had no problems up until the last month of taking it. I had terrible mood swings and awful cramps. So my doctor recommended I try it again and have had awful results. I do not recommend this form of birth control.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The worst pill ever! Please don't take it! I've never had such bad cramps in whole my life. Just finished first pack and not going to take it anymore.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hello, I am currently 19 years old and have been on the Junel Fe 1.5/30 pill for 6 years (yes sounds crazy). Awful long periods have run in my family for generations. I would have my period every month for about 12 days and very, very heavy. I bled through a maxi pad,  panty pad, underwear, undershorts, AND regular shorts after one hour. Once I started the pill my periods immediately lightened. Since I was put on it when I was younger I did not know about side effects and I believe that’s why I don’t have any.  The only thing that happens to me is that my stomach feels a little weak the morning after I take a new pill of the month, but this happens because of all the hormones re entering your body after a week with sugar pills.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking Larin Fe 1/20 birth control for about 4-5 months. I have sex about 3-5 times a week if not more and I know it’s suppose to be very effective with preventing pregnancy. However, since I’ve been taking this one, it has been making me miss periods and scaring me having me nervous that I’m pregnant. I haven’t had my period last month and the month before I got my period for the first time since a month. Hopefully I get it this month. I also have been crazy emotional and depressed almost everyday and HORRIBLE mood swings. I get aggravated over little things then perfectly fine the next. But it is different for everyone

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Taytulla at the advice of my Gyn because of my heavy and painful periods, which were awful. After having a D and C, and a  year later a uterine biopsy I thought I should start something to help with the low progesterone. Mirena was not an option because I didn’t  want that in my body. For the first 5 days I had no issues with Taytulla but the bleeding then continued for 14 days, but not heavy like my old periods. Then I noticed I couldn’t sleep well, my anxiety is high and I’m cranky and moody. My heart feels like it’s going to come out of my chest and has been occurring since after the first week of taking this. I also have cramps with it. I am not going to continue taking this stuff. The side effects are dangerous and life threatening. I don’t know what my options are but I’ll finish this pack, and call my dr today for something else or nothing at all.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never had a problem with this BC! Just normal regulated period, my Cysts are gone which was the reason for taking the medication. Just normal every day life, it is like I don't even take it! But I do every day!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Was diagnosed with endometrial hyperplasia and fibroid tumor so gynecologist gave me Taytulla to try.  I took this birth control for 4 or 5 months, it caused a lot of side effects.  Mood swings, insomnia was the worst, bled everyday because I was trying to avoid a period only taking active pills pack to pack, very emotional, and also had severe hot flashes, When I stopped the pill and had a period it was a lot lighter but the side effects aren't worth it.
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the only and first birth control I’ve ever used but, I know for a fact this pill gives me terrible downs and makes my anxiety out of control.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m very emotional & depressed. I feel LOW. All I want to do is lay down & eat. I’ve been sleeping longer. I have no energy. It’s making my endo cramps worse. Just horrible. I haven’t been on it long but I’m feeling worse day by day.  I switched to this birth control as  the last birth control I was own gave me severe acne. And when I stopped it started to clear up.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is by far the worst birth control pill I have ever used.  After 6 straight days of a severe headache that would not go away for anything I could take no more.  Within hours of stopping this pill the headache went away completely with no need for any other medication.  I have since thrown the remainder of my pills in the garbage and that is where they belong. I would not recommend this pill to anyone, not even my worst enemy.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worst birth control I have ever been on. I have been on many different brands and also other generics for Loestrin fe and I have never had side effects like this. I’ve been taking this for 4 months now because I was trying to give it a fair chance but I have never have worse cramps in my life (which is saying a lot considering I have endometriosis) they even wake me up when I am sleeping. I bled like a normal period for half of my second and my whole third month- which resulted in my having a decidual cast that is rare and was extremely painful. (Google it) aside from that I have had bad bloating, brain fog and headaches. I never review things but I felt it important to share my experience since I read these similar reviews and didn’t listen.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on a tri-sprintec bc for about 7 years until I turned 25 and started to become super emotional and not able to control  my emotions so I  talked to my dr about switching. She suggested Lo Loestrin which is a significantly lower dose of hormones. I was fine for the first month and a half I felt nauseous during my period week but wanted to give my body time to adjust. By the time I made it to the end of month 3 I was getting a yeast infection every month during my period week, I was so nauseous I was throwing up, had constant anxiety to the point where I wasn’t eating. I went to the doctor got tested for everything took yeast infection meds, UTI antibiotics, and have tried everything to relieve being this uncomfortable that I think is vulvodynia. I finally stopped taking it after 4 months of pain. Follow your gut, if you feel like something is wrong talk to your doctor immediately the longer I went the worse it’s gotten

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Three star because I did not experience any moodswings, depression, or weight gain like I have in the past using other birth control. It did cut my lubrication and it was very painful to have sex. I honestly did not want to believe it was the birth control that was causing dryness but once I stopped taking it I realized it was.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I never feel compelled to review anything but this pill ruined me so badly that I feel I need to. I only lasted 2 weeks taking this pill. When on Junel Fe 1/20 had horrible head aches, nausea, and depression. I cried constantly for no reason I blew up on people for no reason, and my skin began to break out horribly. The worst part was the bloating. I have been bloated day and night for over a week. My weight is up from the water weight. I’m so uncomfortable 24/7. I stopped taking the pill and am now withdrawal bleeding heavy blood with the worst cramps I’ve ever had in my life. DO NOT take this birth control. It is ruining my life.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never ever had an issue with birth control. However, I had stopped them because they stopped giving me Ortho Tri Cyclen and the ones I was taking after started giving me lots of spotting. After 5-7 years I want to say of not taking contraceptives, my period began to be irregular. So I went to a clinic, got prescribed Junel Fe 1/20 and, oh my Lord! I bled for 4 weeks non stop. It started off week and got worse. Clots everywhere, took 4 wipes to see less blood after I used the restroom, and I only saw red when I peed. So I went to a different doctor due to being in a different state, told them my issue and I was taken off that pill. They prescribed me a new one but I decided to put them off until my period left and started a new cycle. Maybe Junel Fe will help other women but not me. I was extremely depressed, my heart beats would sometimes beat so hard and sounded loud, I felt weak and dizzy. I've stopped taking them.

Necon 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm giving this  Necon 1/35 a  rating 3/10 only because I didn't get pregnant & didn't get a period. BUT this drug made me gain 20 lbs in 2 months with no lifestyle change, and I was extremely sensitive to the sun which my doctor did not warn me about. I have olive complexion, almost never burn... spent 1 day outside in FL on a partly cloudy day & ended up with HORRIBLE sun burn my skin was melting off my body it was terrible.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):great experience so far with Lo Loestrin Fe !! All I  have experienced is increased libido, energy, cramping, headache, and a little nausea along with carb cravings besides that it’s great <3

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill since April of last year, it is now November 2019. Six months ago I experienced a dramatic change in my weight. I walked around with a feeling of being bloated even without eating a meal. Nothing had changed in my life concerning my diet. I eliminated eating meats to see if that would help me lose a few pounds. That didn’t help as much as I wanted because the weight stayed and the feeling of being bloated was still there. I did a self evaluation and realized the only thing I take daily is my birth control pill. I looked up reviews to see similar experiences and that immediately made me reach out to my doctor.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):READ THIS IF YOU ARE SENSITIVE TO MEDICATIONS OR HAVE DEPRESSION! Everyone is different in how their bodies metabolize medications. I am very sensitive to side effects. My doctor suggested this pill with the lowest amount of estrogen in hopes that it wouldn't cause too many side effects. At 22 years old, I already struggle with depression & regular migraines. The only thing this pill did for me was decrease my headaches. I was on it for one month & my depression was seemingly worse than it ever had been. I had constant really dark thoughts life just didn't seem worth it. I stopped the pill immediately & was admitted to a psychiatric hospital. A couple weeks off the pill & everything went back to baseline. Even if you don't have depression, this is a MAJOR side effect that is not properly addressed. A lot of people have reached out to me telling me they had a very similar experience. Again, everyones experience is different, just be careful and do your research, as with any birth control.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking Junel Fe 1/20 for 2 years and lately I’ve been having breakthrough bleeding between periods and horrible breast tenderness. My breasts feel lumpy and I have no sex drive. I’ve also been really short tempered and total mood change. I’m going to switch.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):10 years off of birth control. I started taking Junel 1/20 2 weeks ago and have been having breakthrough bleeding everyday since. I’m getting married soon and was hoping this would stop my period from coming on my wedding weekend but there’s been brownish red discharge every from the start.Prior to this pill I was regulating normally and had a doctors appointment to check everything out right before they sent me to pick up the pills. Not sure if this is normal but it’s a huge inconvenience and added insecurity leading to my big day.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It was the WORST experience I’ve had. I’ve had anxiety since my senior year of high school (2017); when taking the birth control (Started December 2018) it worsened my anxiety and I developed mood changes and depression during my sophomore year of college. I would be crying almost every day and even had a really thought. I stopped taking it around March or April 2019 and have been completely fine ever since. Hopefully the new BC I get won’t give me these problems like Blisovi. Also, the first time I got Blisovi it was covered but then after the third month the pharmacy only covered less than half the price so I ended up paying $30.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Lolo birth control for two years. Physically, aside from the bloating and constipation I experience for about a week of the month, it has been good. My skin Is better, I experienced no weight change, and I do not get my period at all. But this pill has changed who I am mentally, there is no in-between with my mood, I am either extremely happy and energetic, or I am dull, irritable and mentally drained. Before I started taking Lolo birth control, I was not an emotional person, now I cry over spilt milk.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Lo Loestrin was causing spotting which turned into severe bleeding and cramping that became unbearable so went with Taytulla. Pros: no acne, good libido, no mood swings, no weight gain, no preggo. First month just minor cramping when period came.  Month 2 cramped throughout the month started spotting two days before my withdrawal bleeding. 3rd month.. HORRIBLE. My cramps were so bad to the point of crying and hunched over in PAIN with so much inflammation. When it was time for the next pack I couldn’t take the pill..  I realized I have estrogen dominance unknowingly and I think this pill made it worse. Is everybody different with the pill? Yes. So if it works for you great. If you are having symptoms DON'T IGNORE the signs and don’t let a doc tell you this is normal. And if you have underlying issues get checked out first and healed possibly before taking the pill. The pill only mask issues you have. Hence when you off the pill your issues are still there.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Bloating, EXTREME fatigue, weight gain, breakouts, no periods

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this pill for about 6 months now and up until this point it had been great. My period is two days long only brown spotting which is incredible given they used to be so heavy but I have never cramped before this and it is such excruciating pain I thought I was going into labor with the child I am not even pregnant with. I thought I was going to throw up for two straight days, had severe back pain, and right now I'm watching my stomach bloat like crazy I believe from cramping but who knows. I don't know if I recommend it since my previous experience was great but everyone should be aware of the side effects and that they may get them.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used to be on Larin 24 fe. It was okay..I had problems before with a bcp causing bad yeast infections every month so I switched to nexplanon the arm implant and it gave me cystic acne which I never had before. I then decided to have it removed and to try Larin pill which helped with the acne problem a little, but when I moved to Fl I was told I had to take Junel and that it was the same thing...ITS NOT THE SAME THING DONT LISTEN TO THEM IF IT WORKS FOR YOU!! Junel made me break out so much around my jaw and chin and also gave me anxiety and anger problems. Just switch to a new bcp last week :) (took Junel for 5 months before I could find clinic to switch me)

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this medication Lo Loestrin Fe for about 3 months and haven't really experienced any side effects. My periods got a lot lighter to the point I wonder if it is a period at all. But it's working, I'm not pregnant. I didn't give it a higher rating because I was hoping to see some help with my acne, but no change there.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After seeing some of the reviews on here I’m shocked to see how many negative side affects many women are experiencing. I’ve been taking Junel for about a year and a half now and at the beginning I would only have a period for about 3 days and that was only for a couple of months. After that I didn’t have a period at all. Until I missed a pill accidentally and took two to try and make up for it, I was spotting for almost over two weeks. My doctor told me there was nothing to be worried about so I continued to take the pill and haven’t noticed any significant side affects. However, I will say that it has been extremely difficult for me to loose very much weight, I play soccer and I’m very active all of the time but I’m still 185 pounds at 19 years old and for me that’s just unacceptable. I think my eating habits are mostly to blame but I can’t rule out that my pills could be contributing to that. I think this is a great pill if you don’t want to have a period.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My gyn gave me this pill and I took it for two weeks!!!!! I mean I know bodies are different but this did not work for me ! I was SOOOOO bloated I wish I could just describe how bad it was here... everybody thought I was pregnant! And it made me feel so down and depressed! I would literally get mad at everything so quickly! I stopped taking it after 2 weeks...

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Taytulla for about three or four months. During the time I was on it, my regular period got longer by about three days and I started having a period every twice a month additionally they occurred at different times each month. I had awful mood swings and my skin broke out terribly. This birth control was so awful for me that I stopped taking it all together. However, I have a friend that takes it and they've had no bad side effects.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I will say this, it wasn't as non-problematic as Trinessa was (which is discontinued) BUT it is definitely not as horrible as Tri-sprintec was (which gave me extremely vaginal dryness and moodiness). I'm a petite 22 year old and it's been 4 months now. It helped reduce my vaginal dryness close to normal but I did notice that my moodiness is still there. Also, I am not sure if this issue is at fault to the birth control or my boyfriend but I get extreme pelvic pain after rough intercourse which never really happened before (I'm going to consult with my doctor on that note). As far as my period, it is very light (2-3 days) but I've always had light periods. It doesn't help my cramping as much as Trinessa did which I can live with (before BC my cramps would be so bad that I had to throw up or couldn't move and would call of work kind of BAD). I did notice that I am gradually getting shoulder acne again but I have remedies for it. Anyhow, overall my experience was OKAY.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started on Microgestin  1/20 2 months ago to treat menstrual migraines that were sending me to the hospital. I have always suffered with cramps during my period to the point where I would break out in a sweat and faint from the pain. I was bed ridden for days on end and also experienced heavy periods that required a new pad every 2 hours. I had not been on any other birth control pills in years and I notice a difference the first month taking them. I did not experience any sort of negative side effects aside from increased appetite which I don't mind. My cramps are virtually gone, my pain level is basically non existant aside from a bit of dull ache for an hour or 2 at the beginning of my cycle. Breast tenderness is gone and my periods are so light I would call it spotting that lasts 4 days or so. I haven't been taking this medication very long but it's done wonders for me. I recommend them highly for anyone experiencing what I have mentioned above.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you have had or currently have depression and anxiety, then Lo Loestrin Fe will definitely exacerbate your symptoms. I usually take YAZ birth control for the sole purpose of clearing my cystic acne which has worked wonders w/o side effects. But after seeing a new GYN, she recommended that I switch to the Lo Loestrin saying that all B/C is the same and will clear my acne eventually. First 2 weeks in, I was not my self. I became increasingly moodier. I found myself so angry and sad all the time, even cried myself to sleep every single night. I have never experienced suicidal thoughts since 6 years ago back in college. Even my husband has pointed out that I was not myself and acted out strangely in social events. I have also been breaking out more than usual especially on my cheeks that my usual Benzoyl Peroxide cream 10% was no longer effective. I immediately switched back to YAZ. 1 week later I was completely normal.  No mood swings and no more random crying spells.  I will never take Lo Loestrin again.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve only been on Junel Fe 1/20  for almost 2 weeks. I never write reviews but always read them. So far my experience has been positive. I was very hesitant to go on a  birth control (BC) medicine because of how it made me feel in the past (Yaz), but after 3 kids and extremely heavy periods, I was desperate for relief. I started taking it the Sunday after my period began and it lightened my normally heavy period within days. However, I’m still spotting and it’s been almost 2 weeks (normally my period is 7 days and incredibly heavy). I assume this will only last until my hormones and body regulates. The most positive thing about this is that I still feel completely normal emotionally and on  even keel when in the past this kind of medicine would make me weepy and angry. I am very happy with it so far and have high hopes for my period to be lighter and more regular! I’ll stick with it.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was taking Marlissa birth control pill for 4 years before it started giving me headaches. My doctor prescribed me this instead. It’s been almost a year and my cramps came back worse than ever before, I’ve been having tons of anxiety which I now know is a side effect after reading these reviews. I’ve been spotting with cramps in between periods bad enough to bleed through my underwear during a workout. I asked to go back on my old pill.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started taking this pill Taytulla because it was a lower dose than my normal birth control. In the beginning I had started bleeding for a couple of weeks. It was ok, I could deal with it. Then after a while I started getting yeast infections. Back to back. As soon as I finished clearing up one yeast infection, I got another one right after. The only thing I had put into my body was the pill. I felt like I was going crazy. I would stay up all night, unable to sleep due to random anxiety building up in me. As soon as I stopped taking Taytulla, all these problems completely ceased. I would not recommend Taytulla  to ANYONE. Take your chances.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I would give this birth control a rating of 0 if I could! This is the absolutely the WORST medicine I’ve ever taken in my whole life!!! This is the first birth control I’ve been on and it has done nothing good for me. This pill gave me excruciating cramps (worse cramps than I had before taking lo loestrin fe), terrible mood swings, and I have had breakthrough bleeding 3 weeks out of the month for the past YEAR. It’s almost as if my body has never adjusted to this low dosage medicine. I had anxiety/depression before I started taking this medicine and this past year has been absolutely awful for me emotionally and mentally. This is NOT the right birth control for you if you already have anxiety or depression. I cannot believe I have waited this long to realize all of my problems came from this birth control.  I do not recommend at all.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hi, I feel compelled to write a review after my horrible experience with this drug Junel Fe 1/20. I’ve taken it for a year and have just stopped. The first month I was plagued with intense nausea and headaches, which subsided. After that I started having severe anxiety, panic attacks, mood swings, crying spells and chalked it up to several life changes (moving, wedding, etc.) However my condition worsened and I was at a therapist weekly who diagnosed me with depression. By this point I felt like a shell of my former self and decided to stop taking the pill as it’s the only medication I’m on. I’ve been off 2 weeks and can see notable differences in my temperament and energy levels. I can’t wait for it to completely flush out so I can be myself again. Please don’t take this drug as long as I did if you face any of the above.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never in my life had such serious side affects with any prescription like I have with this. I took it for a total of 10 days before I had to stop. At day 4, I had 3 pretty severe anxiety attacks, days 4-10 I experienced really bad mood swings, hard crying for no reason and at day 10, I was put into the deepest depression I've ever experienced to the point where I had to go to a friends house as I was worried about self harm. I am serious. The most horrific feelings and I'm on day 2 of not taking it and I'm nauseous, have a headache that won't go away and my chest hurts from the anxiety that I am feeling.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Junel Fe for about 3 months. I already suffer from anxiety but after taking this pill, it has been so hard for me to leave the house or just do normal daily tasks. My anxiety has gotten so much worse. I have been moody and even meaner. I feel like I’m a completely different person. The only good thing about this pill is that my periods now only last about 3 days and my periods are light and not heavy anymore. This was my first experience with birth control and after these 3 months of anxiety, mood swings, my sex drive completely disappearing, I decided to stop. My sex drive has gone down so fast. Me and my husband have not had sex in a whole month and I have no desire to have sex or do any sexual activities. I’m scared about the side effects of going off. I also started taking herbal remedy  to  help boost my sex drive and they are good for women’s health. I have taken those for 2 days and I already feel a little better.

Loestrin 21 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I went on this pill after trying reclipsen/apri which made me unbelievably sad and had awful mood swings. This pill so far has been great except that I have breakthrough bleeding all the time. Even taking the pill on the DOT everyday. I believe it is just my body getting used to the low dose but it is awful. I have yet to notice any awful depression symptoms though!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At 47 years old my gynecologist changed my birth control pill to Lo Loestrin Fe because of two fibroids she found in my uterus.   I’ve taken so many different birth control pills in my lifetime and generic birth control pills that were AWEFUL!  That said, Lo Loestrin Fe has exceeded my expectations for over two years.  The first three months are always an adjustment but after that my mood significantly improved (more calm, less rage), less hungry (compared with generic BC) and no problems with my skin (my skin was fine on generic as well).  I spotted at first but now never get a period and it’s a dream.  Everyone is different but being on this birth control pill has been a very positive experience for me.  Only wish it was prescribed to me sooner!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I been on this pill for 3 months now and let me tell you I been extra moody, nauseous and not feeling like I used to be. I used to have so much energy and now I feel so tired and have migraines/dizziness . I'll get cramps in lower abdominal area 2 weeks prior to my period and also I'll wake up the next morning soaked in sweat. I don't like these side effects. Today I decided to throw the packet away. I'll def be using another birth control method. I want to feel like me again.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill  Larin Fe 1/20 almost make two weeks ago. This is my first time ever using birth control. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you’re like me, you went on here looking at reviews before you started LoLo (Lo Loestrin FE) and psyched yourself out from negative reviews. A gyno recommended starting LoLo, a low hormone dosage. I had concerns for birth control but two months in and I can say that I’m happy with it so far! Surprisingly nothing has changed in regards to the negative effects. Like you most likely already know, LoLo will probably have you skip your period all together. For me, true. If you’re sexually active, this may give some scare. No cramps, no crazy periods. Also my skin stayed the same, maybe better? I never had crazy acne and no weight gain from this either. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control Junel Fe 1/20 for 1 week after not taking any birth control for over 2 years. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I did not realize that the pack required skipping a week so starting a new pack each go meant no period for me! Feel great just wayyy more tired than with Sprintec. But good stuff. I also take it at 10pm.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this medication Junel Fe 1/20 or almost a year with very little side effects. About a year in, I became overwhelmed with SEVERE anxiety. It was getting in the way of my ability to function. I was planning a wedding and starting a new job, so I thought that was the reason for the anxiety.  I also completely missed my period for 2 months in a row (which has never happened.) Even though I took the pill like clockwork, I was terrified I was pregnant. I took many tests and they all came back negative. Convinced I was pregnant anyway, I stopped taking the pill until I could get in to see a doctor to confirm it. About two days later, I got a period. In about a week, my severe anxiety was pretty much gone. I’m not saying that this is or will be everyone’s experience. I just want you to know that if you are feeling overly anxious or depressed, don’t rule anything out. I thought that since I had been on this pill for a year with no symptoms, it couldn’t be the pill. Trust your body!

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this birth control pill in 1999 when I was 18. I took it for 6 months before I decided to stop using it. I did not have any problems with acne or cramps during use, but a serious increase in both directly after stopping. The problem for me was extreme nausea, depression, weight gain, mid cycle bleeding, and dryness. I now realize that taking hormonal birth control, especially before having children, causes many bad side effects long term. I would not recommend any hormonal birth control pills for anyone, and wish I had never taken any.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Have gained 12 lbs the past four months on this! Pharmacy switched it on me.. finally had enough! Going back to necon 777 or whatever I can get closer to ASAP!

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):As a 21 year old woman, I’ve taken this pill for some four years now after becoming sexually active and truly have had little to no problems. I never had acne prone skin even in my teens but pill didn’t make it worse. I never had head aches, nausea or other common side effects. My period was always pretty light with minimal cramping, and after taking this pill for some years now I haven’t gotten my period in maybe two years. IT IS AWESOME. My insurance even covers it so that it’s free for me. The only con with this pill is my lowered sex drive (though I was never really an animal anyway), and vaginal dryness. Definitely would recommend.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla is the first BC pill I’ve been on and I’ve had a generally positive experience (Currently 6 months)-Lost weight after starting it-Light or no periodsBe aware-1st month bleed for about 10 days, but that is normal for starting bc.. didn’t happen again-experienced heightened anxiety during months 2-4, but situations in my life were actually stressful so though I think taytulla increased the anxiety I would’ve normally felt in that situation, I don’t think it caused it and it went away when my problems did.

At the end of next week I'm supposed to take the inactive pill to "start my period".  I'm considering stop using it.  I had used pills for my painful periods before with almost none side effects.

The only good thing is that I'm not pregnant, but the symptoms are similar to pregnancy, so it still makes me think I'm pregnant.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this Tarina Fe 1/20 pill for 1 month and wow... I’ve experienced chest, back and under arm pain. I had some acne on my forehead that was red-white heads and some red dots on my chin. Again, TMI, my discharge was thick and milky white and came in large amounts daily. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Junel FE for about 8 months. The first 2-3 months was ok. Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Every body is different and I’m not saying this is a bad pill, it just didn’t work for me. I’m hoping this review can ease some other girls’ minds who are experiencing the same thing as me. I was put on this pill because my insurance no longer covered my usual brand Junel Fe and was told Larin was the same thing, just different packaging. 3-4 days into the pack, I started getting nauseous and anxious every day. I would gag at the smell of certain things and my breasts hurt. I was convinced I was pregnant, which made my anxiety skyrocket. Turns out Larin Fe did its job preventing pregnancy, but the side affects were terrible. I threw up for the first time since being on this pill today, and will be stopping immediately.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got put on this BC 7 months ago after having complications with my past BC. Then in July, I started having irregular spotting and it hasn't stopped since. I am currently in a 22 day period right now and I am about to lose my mind. I'm definitely calling my doctor first thing Monday morning to get switched to something else.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was given Junel Fe 24 as my first birth control about 3 1/2 months ago. I've always been pretty in control of my emotions, but these pills made me feel out of control.I was okay, a little skeptical, for the first month because the cramps during my first period on birth control got WORSE. I began to notice that my cravings right before my cycle were absolutely CRAZY. I wanted to eat everything and anything I could get my hands on. I have never experienced cravings that bad. My mood swings were terrible too. My sex drive was almost nonexistent and I felt a lot of anxiety. My breasts got larger.. and you're probably thinking that doesn't sound too terrible. Wrong! I'm seeing my OBGYN soon because I think all those bad hormones in this birth control started to cause a sore/tender spot on my right chest that might turn into a cyst. I recently switched birth control to one that all my siblings have and I have been on it for two weeks now.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on this medication Taytulla for about three months. My libido is non exist and it has hurt my relationship. So it works but the side effects make me want to get off and just do the withdrawal method

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am birth control newbie; only other BC I've tried is NuvaRing (which is way better the Junel). I've been on Junel for less than a month. I had a Sunday start during my cycle. My cycle is pretty regular and lasts 5-7 days (no longer) but with the Sunday start I continued to ooze dark icky blood for an additional 4 days! I did some research and realized this was because I wasn't taking it at the same time every day. So I started taking it religiously at 7am and the bleeding finally stopped on the 11th day! However, with a week of active pills left I've started bleeding (WHAT) again. Also, my sex drive is way down and I'm very dry.  I've stopped Junel Fe as of this morning even before the pack finished (good riddance). Also, the first week my emotions were all over the place and still are but I'm managing it better. I've also been very itchy and breaking out in hives didn't think it was related to Junel but we'll see now that I'm off it.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First things first, I've been on a lot of different birth control brands. The only complaint I have is that I spotted a little bit before my period for the first couple of months but that's because my body was still going through the adjustment period. I'm actually kind of shocked by all of the negative reviews. I haven't experienced any of them and I've had nothing but good come from this pill. It's also helped my cramps which is what I use birth control primarily for.

Ortho-Novum 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was 17 years old when I asked my Mom to put me on the pill. I was prescribed Ortho Novum 1/28. I then got  re-prescribed Ortho Novum 1/28When I was about 27 I started to bleed a lot. It continued that for years.I got married at 30 and tried to get pregnant. We tried for 6 years with  hormones, artificial insemination, the whole gamut. I had huge fibroid tumors and had seven surgeries to remove them. Nothing worked. Finally at 37 I had emergency surgery for a full hysterectomy. I believe that taking Ortho Novum 1/28 for years caused my infertility and years of bleeding, physical pain and emotional pain.All between 1988- 2007. I'm really interested in who experienced similar situations.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill Tarina FE 1/20 isn’t too bad. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After being on Loestrin for 10 years my OB switched me to Taytulla in July and it’s now mid October and I have gained 20 pounds on a near perfect diet, with weight lifting and cardio 5-6 days a week with no changes to lifestyle except this awful pill. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Wow, the experience I’ve had on this is so horrible. I’ve been taking Junel Fe for four months, and this is my last week because I’m switching. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DONT TAKE IT!!!! I’ve been on it for a few years and until reading reviews I had no idea it was my birth control. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control seemed great.  Started it in June to control endometriosis and had very few problems with mood etc. It completely stopped my periods. I had a lot of hair to begin with, I've lost probably 40 percent of my hair.  Would really suggest trying another pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Trinessa Lo for a year which was not the worst until it was discontinued and I was switched to Tri Lo Sprintec. It made me so angry and destroyed my libido completely. It also made me constantly hungry and I gained around 15 pounds on it. My doctor suggested I try Lo Loestrin Fe. I have taken it for about 4 days and feel like a changed person. I finally feel like myself again. My libido feels like it’s coming back and I am no longer over eating or moody. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this pill for one month. I missed my period, I don't know why. I've been moody and craving food. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed Taytulla by my doctor to see if it would help with my seizures. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I read a ton of these reviews and none of them quite described my experience - truly everyone reacts differently on this pill. I also love that I no longer get cyclical breast pain and tenderness - my breasts were slightly more tender during the first few months, but they never really hurt anymore. Overall, I really like this pill. I haven’t gained any weight, had an increase in acne, or experienced increased anxiety or depression - all things I was scared of when I started taking it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this birth control about 10 years ago for 6 months straight. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking the pill a few months after my baby was born 3 years ago. Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got switched to this somehow in the transition to Nurx, and my pharmacy gave me this- I'm still trying to sort it out and not blaming anyone. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):3 YEAR USER: I suffer from endometriosis and my doctor prescribed me this medication after trying several other forms. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I HATE THIS PILL. I have massive diarrhea everyday! Also I am so moody

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL! I started Lo Loestrin Fe when I was 17 due to extremely random periods. Vulvodynia is nerve pain and damage on your vulva! I was miserable! Turns out Lo Lo gave me the side effects  both of these issues; vulvodynia and gallbladder disease. 6 months after stopping this pill my vulvodynia was GONE! Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for almost 2 years now & I love it. I originally inquired about an IUD so that way I never had to worry about pregnancy, side effects, & getting periods as well. My gynecologist suggested I start this pill to help & suggested I skip the week where my cycle would usually begin & to start a new pack so that I wouldn’t have to worry about periods all together (like you would with an IUD). I thought it would cause me to bloat/cramp but it has been 2 years since I have had a period, I’m not pregnant nor ever had a pregnancy scare (& we’re quite regular), I haven’t experienced any cramping/spotting, mood swings, & I haven’t gained any sudden weight since beginning this. I think this pills success varies from individual to individual, but I will say for me it’s been amazing & I would recommend to at least giving it a try(but ask an MD first).

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Junel for almost two years and wow, those first 3 months were TERRIBLE! The nausea, anxiety, mood swings.. it was insane! Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I would give this a zero if possible. This is the first birth control pill I have ever taken and I started it a year and a half ago after about 10 months of use I started to get stabbing pains in my abdomen and back that would last for hours and usually was accompanied by me throwing up. Fast forward to today and I believe it is the cause of my gallstones! The listed side effects of birth control are gallstones so be very careful and just get an IUD which is hormone-free! Seriously it's not worth developing gallstones then having surgery to get your gallbladder removed!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I made it one month on this. I had been on a different birth control but my OBGYN switched me to this one. I am normally a very unemotional person but this made me anxious constantly and depressed all in one. My blood pressure also sky rocketed, and I normally have very low bp. I kept trying to mind over matter but I couldn't do it anymore. It was worse than being on nothing, and that's REALLY saying something.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):On Junel Fe 1/20 Periods became manageable and I was finally able to wear a tampon without bleeding through. Cramps also went away. I’ve taken the pill religiously for 2 years now and I cannot complain. However I recommend taking it with food because it can cause nausea.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill literally made me crazy.I was prescribed this pill to regulate my periods and of course before taking I looked at the reviews. I was already kind of iffy but I thought I would give it a try because my doctor really recommended it. Two weeks in:My appetite was becoming insane. Like I was hungry all the time.I have fits of rage anything and everything annoyed me.Extreme bloating and constipation. I’ve been off it for a bit and my body is still recovering. And worst of all. It gave me two periods in a month. Never again. It works for some but this was not for me.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wanted to share my experience because when I researched Lo Lo I found negative/horrible reviews.  I was taken off my BC when my new obgyn realized I had been on it for over 16 years straight. I took a year off of BC & my periods were getting so bad that we began to think I had endo. I was throwing up, crying, back aches, migraines.... So, I had to try something. I gave in and tried Lo Lo. The first month I bled/spotted the last 3 wks of the pack, had cramps & I was so bloated - very bloated. However, by the second pack I was thinning out again, I did not have period & I did not have any cramps. I'm now on my third pack & things are going normal. I don't like not having a period, I hope I get one after another month on the pill. I hear I won't though.  Please do not be scared to try the pill. Everyone is different. You have to give it 3 months to see if it is right for you. I wanted to quit at 1 month with bloating & pain...but I gave it a longer try & I am glad I did.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Junel for a little over four years now. This birth control, I didn’t gain any weight but it did make my boobs a size bigger. My acne is minimal (but I am also prescribed other acne face washes and stuff to keep my skin clear). My periods are to a T every month, periods are light, & I haven’t had cramps since before I started. I have had absolutely no complaints until this past year. Now My sex drive is completely gone and its nearly impossible for me to reach orgasm. The only thing I can think of is my birth control doing this. Other than that I think this pill is awesome, but the lack of sex drive is super concerning for me since I do have a long term boyfriend and its just not there anymore.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was placed on this birth control after my periods started to become very irregular. At 35 years old, this is the first time that I have tried any type of birth control. So my OB/GYN prescribe me Lo Loestrin Fe. I was on this birth control for 5 months before I switched to Junel Fe 1/20. The Lo Loestrin Fe  was too low of a dose for me. Before taking it I never passed menstrual clots & while taking Lo Lorestrin Fe I passed several medium to large menstrual clots a day. I had heavy breakthrough bleeding every day, every month, for 3 weeks straight for 5 MONTHS straight. I was completely miserable.The only reason that I am giving it two stars is because it made any blemishes on my face disappear. I tried to give my body 6 months to adjust but I could only make it to the 5th month. The breakthrough bleeding & the debilitating cramps I couldn’t handle anymore. I have switched to Junel Fe 1/20 and I feel so much better.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL IF YOU WANT TO LIVE! I've taken birth control pills from my teen years to my early 30s. I got off of them for awhile. My OB-GYN prescribed Taytulla 3/31/18. I had my cycle in mid-March. I took Taytulla for nearly a year. I didn't have a cycle for the entire time that I was on this pill and I thought that was odd since I never had that experience with any other BC pill. My doctor said it was okay so I kept taking it. I had shortness of breath, severe sweating and then passed out and had to go to the ER in February 2019. The ER admitted me for DVT (deep vien thrombosis) and PE (pulmonary embolism). I had blood clots in my legs and both lungs. It was due to this birth control pill. I literally almost died! It's now September 2019 and I am still on blood thinners to treat the blood clots in my legs (thankful the more dangerous ones in my lungs went away shortly after starting the blood thinners). My cycle still hasn't returned. Lastly, I lost 10lbs immediately after stopping the pill.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hello all, I took Taytulla for 3 months and finished my last pack 2 weeks ago. The past 3 months I....*have had shorter cycles but spotting in between cycles each month so shorter cycles mean nothing to me if I’m just going to spot all month.*increase in headaches*NO SEX DRIVE, like at all! This is NOT normal! Especially for us newlyweds who waited

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Larin for 4 months now. The first few days I was really really sick, then side effects went down to light cramping all the time which was annoying but not horrible. Now I have almost no side effects. No change in acne or weight for me personally.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Microgestin Fe 1/20 for 10 years now without stopping. I have had zero issues while being on it, Very short periods (last 3-4 days max) I do still have cramping while on my period but nothing crazy, and no acne except for your random pimples once in a blue moon. I am about to go off of this BC, but it was great for me!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This horrible birth control Junel Fe 1.5/30 nearly killed me, I was in agonizing excruciating pelvic pain and suffering from inflammation, my stomach bloated into the shape of a watermelon and I lap swim and run on the treadmill daily and eat fruits and vegetables. This birth control pill also gave me migraine headaches daily and nightly and  I suffered from extreme insomnia and would get sleepy at 5:00am.  It's absolutely horrible. I stopped taking it and all these horrible symptoms went away. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HORRIBLE DRUG/BIRTH CONTROL PILL.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been reading a lot of these reviews and unfortunately have read that most people have really bad experiences with this birth control. Personally, this is the first birth control I have taken that hasn’t completely ruined my life. My boobs have gotten bigger, I’m finally filling out, my acne is clearing up, and I haven’t had any nausea/depression. Strangely, while most reviewers have noticed a decrease in sex drive, mine has increased and vaginal dryness is not a thing for me. I think it is safe to say that this form of bc is not for everyone, but it is worth a shot.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Had a wonderful experience on this Junel Fe 24  birth control! I didn’t experience any major side effects that people usually say that makes birth control sound scary or horrible. My periods before weren't super heavy and are even more manageable now. I plan on continuing my use with this birth control.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst birth control I’ve ever been on and that says a lot considering the Depo shot completely screwed up my hormones... I started Taytulla to regulate my periods and my entire body is broke out in hives.... not to mention the stupid mood swings and depression...

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 45 year old that for 20 plus years was on Ortho Triclen but the manufacturer Janssen stopped producing this pill.  Insurance company tried putting me on several different generic pills with awful side affects.  Dr put my LoLo.  Just finished 2nd month.  Since start of this pill I have not gotten my period, my moods have maintained relatively same except for week I should get my period.  This is normal for me.  I have notice that I have gotten back acne.  Hope this improves.  Best part is I have lost 10 pounds.  Now just to get insurance to cover this pill.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking Junel Fe24 for almost two years because my cramps were so bad to the point where I would throw up and get a fever. I highly recommend this brand, I don't get any cramps, I get a super light period and my acne has really cleared up. But, some down sides to it are: low sex drive, weight gain, and sometimes being moody. I know I kind of contradicted myself up there but I really enjoy the aspect of having no cramps. Unfortunately, its great for me but can be horrible for you...

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I decided to switch to Loloestrin FE after being on Beyaz for 2 months. I felt fine at the start but by the week before my period I began to feel really down. Then one day I had a panic attack. This has never happened to me before. It freaked me out so I stopped taking it altogether. For the next month I felt ok but by my next period all hell broke loose. What followed was a month of extreme anxiety. I felt as though I was in mourning. I had multiple panic attacks. I went to a doctor and was prescribed xanax. I began looking into psychiatrists and researching anxiety meds, thinking I was broken for life. I took time off work and devoted all my energy to trying to get better. I am pleased to say that 2 months after stopping, I finally felt like me again. This pill traumatized me and greatly disrupted my life. It's especially dangerous for women who are prone to anxiety/depression. If you are experiencing something similar just know that it will be ok and things will get better.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is the worst thing that’s ever happened to me. I started taking it as soon as I started my sophomore year of college and I have never been more anxious and depressed in my life. I have panic attacks, nausea, weight loss, heart palpitations, brain fog, my vision has been blurry, I get dizzy a lot, the list could honestly go on. These symptoms started within the first week of taking this pill and I also missed my last period and I’m not pregnant. Avoid this birth control at ALL costs!!!!!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill is 100% great. Since I started to take it I only had my period once. No changes in my weigh, body or face. For those who says that the acne got worse, I recommend go to a dermatologist... doesn’t have to do with this pills. Although the pill has my hair and skin so bright and beautiful. My doctor was right, this pill is good.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I originally started this pill May of last year. I was on it for 2.5 months and those first 2.5 months were awful. I’m normally a very confident and optimistic person, but those first two months I had terrible anxiety, panic attacks, horrible mood swings which caused a breakup with my (then) boyfriend of a year, and irregular periods. I stopped and started taking them again around March or April of this year. Ever since then, my period is almost nonexistent as I rarely ever get one, forcing me to buy a lot of pregnancy tests out of fear (all came back negative), I have terrible acne and some sort of dermatitis around my nose that began appearing after a month or two of taking, water weight (gain/lose 4 pounds) that fluctuates, and a decreased Libido, which is a lot coming from a hormonal teen.  I’m regular with taking my pill, occasionally being late by an hour, but usually am late (when it does happen) by 20 min or so. I’m switching

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was so nervous reading the reviews, but I've had a great experience so far! My last prescription made me so nauseous I had to stop mid-pack (it was my first birth control experience too). I was scared to try Junel-Fe but I really love it so far! I've been more bloated than usual and my boobs have been sore, but other than that I am okay! Been taking at night to reduce nausea and that's been helpful, but sometimes I'll get a little dizzy during the day. Usually doesnt last long & can resume normal activities!

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Okay so this is MY experience with Nortrel 1/35. (Meaning my body reacts differently than yours on this birth control)So I got on this BC because of the depo. I was bleeding nonstop for 5 months. My gyno prescribed me this since it was a high dose and was sure my bleeding would stop. It definitely worked as it should. I stopped bleeding and I get my period at the end of the month. My period now only lasts 3/4 days instead of 7/8, from before I took any type of birth control. Now the cons of this. My mood is HORRIBLE. I cry for any little thing, everything bothers me. It even affected my relationship. If you’re currently depressed and have anxiety I do not recommend it. I have never felt so low of myself. It’s emotionally and mentally exhausting.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):With Taytulla I had breakthrough bleeding on top of the period I already have. Severe  anxiety and depression. I cry at every little thing. I have to finish this pack and then I'm switching to something else. I can't wait. I guess the only good thing it did was prevent me from getting pregnant.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Lo Loestrin FE for 5 years and love it, I have had no side effects and its been working perfectly for my body!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Lo Loestrin Fe 5 months ago due to my irregular periods. I had months where my period just didn't go away and then disappeared for a while. I can say that my period regulated in some way but it took a while to my body to "adapt", I would say three months. I skipped one pill in my first month and it was a nightmare. I had the most painful cramps of my whole life (I'm 44). So my advice to all my friend out there--DO NOT FORGET A PILL --ever--.In my 4th package I also had a lot of days with a heavy (not so heavy than before taking the pill) period that last more than two weeks but that went away with a 5 days (3/day) Ibuprofen 800 mg treatmentNow my doctor wants me to switch to another pill, but I have been Ok since the Ibuprofen, no spotting or anything. One thing I do have is I am depressed, I feel insecure, angry and unhappy. I am normally a calm person and I just don't feel like myself anymore. I am still considering if switching or not.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Do not take this birth control. It’s been a little over a month and my depression is out of control. That is not normal for me. I am not a depressed person and I will be calling my doctor tomorrow to get off this pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I could not be happier with this birth control!
