I was on it previously for 4ish years, stopped for a little, and have been back on it for about a year now. It is the BEST! I have virtually no side effects and am so pleased. My skin went through a little adjustment period the first few months around my period but nothing major at all. My weight didn’t change a bit. I suffer from clinical depression and this pill has not seemed to have any effects. The only thing I don’t like (oddly) is that after about 9 months, I stopped getting my period. It’s just made me a little concerned that I’m pregnant but then tests are always negative. My boobs might have grown a little at first but I think it is negligible at this point. Like I said, I couldn’t be happier! The low dose has really worked well for me and I would highly recommend.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill because of heavy and out of wack periods I'm all for something that's going to make my periods lighter and more bearable I started this pill on the 8th of this month its now the 24th with no sign of my period  stopping. I've gain 15 pounds I can't sleep and I've been on a full fledge period since I started taking this pill my acne has gotten worse. I've been having nausea and cramps like you wouldn't believe I would not recommend this for anyone I am beside myself and very disappointed with this current situation

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First I started taking tri-lo-estarylla and it was the worst experience of my life. I cried every day and got so depressed until I ended up in a mental hospital. That is where I found out that these pills made me go EXTRA depressed. I stopped using these pills almost a year ago and told myself I am never taking birth control again. Since then I haven’t but I had irregular periods for years so my doctor told me to take birth control to stimulate my hormones. So, two weeks ago I started taking Junel Fe and the only side effects is that I  don’t have any emotions and I am SUPER sexually aroused.  Also My mom cried to me yesterday and I had no emotions towards it at all and my boyfriend who I love I don’t feel anything towards to. I feel no attachment to anyone at all anymore and I don’t like this. I am going to give this pill a shot for the rest of the month but if I am going to feel like this for a little longer I am throwing it out

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Prevented me from ever being pregnant, but had to stop taking it because I've been heavily bleeding for over a week on this medication and it is month 4 now of me taking it. I took it the same time every day and never missed a pill. Made me bloated, get headaches, and want to cry every night. Happy to be switching to a new birth control because this was a mess.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):this pill destroyed my insides. Plus had my stomach not just feeling like I was getting stabbed , but made weird sizzling noises .

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):For the first 3 months this pill gave me acne, but it cleared up and now my skin looks better than before I started the pill. I also haven’t had a period since I started lo Loestrin fe, which is a major plus for me! But most of all, I was extremely surprised that this pill has actually improved my mood. I’ve had depression since I was 12, and antidepressants helped a little bit, but I was still struggling. After taking this pill, I started noticing a significant increase in my mood and quality of life!  I’m amazed, I never thought I’d be able to feel normal! I was hesitant to get on a birth control in fear of worsening my depression but it turned out to be my solution. The only negative side effect I have is frequent headaches, about 3 days a week. But they’re mild enough, and the pros outweigh the cons.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have gained 30 pounds, over the past year and a half. Have high blood pressure and would deal with serious mood swings and ankle swelling just recently. I switched to a progestin only birth control last week. After reading these reviews I just realized that this birth control had caused all of the issues I was having.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking this pill for a little over 4 months now. I've noticed a big change in my mental state. I'm usually a very chill and down to earth person and usually don't get super anxious or sad. I like never cry. But this pill has made me so sad and over think and super anxious that I've been having to take anxiety pills. I wouldn't recommend this pill if you have anxiety or depression running in your family, chances are you're a carrier of it. And trust me it'll come out during this pill. I've also been skipping my periods every month and been getting them half way through the pack like 10 days later than I'm supposed to get them. Not too happy with this pill. The only good thing is the weight. This pill has help me lose weight and keep it off. Other than that I can't say I like anything else. I'm also in college trying to get my nursing degree. I don't have time for this unwanted depression and anxiety. Nursing school is hard as it is.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I decided to write a review as I have been on this for 4 years. The first year was great. But slowly after that I noticed my mood and sex drive did a COMPLETE 180.  I have never been more angry and sad in my life and my sex drive in non existent. I still get a period on the same day every month which doesn't bother me too much. This pill is good at clearing acne and preventing pregnancy but that's pretty much it.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I've been on this pill for two months now at first it was a little rough. I was nauseous and felt like I was going to throw up. Every time I ate my stomach hurt like anything. Then about the third row down it went all away. Now my face  still gets acne and for some odd reason my face is dry as well. Never use to be like that smh. And I've gained weight on this. I was almost down to my pre pregnancy weight then bam almost gained all the weight back which was about 30 pounds. I've had one period no cramps which is ok. I haven't had a period yet for the second month though

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this for just over a month and I actually like it. The first week, I had some nausea and the second week some bleeding and light cramping that lasted around 8 days. But since then, no side effects. One thing I was worried about was weight gain but since starting Blisovi 24 fe, I’ve actually lost around 5 lbs. My period was lighter than it’s ever been, super light. I also had no PMS or period symptoms. Would recommend but I feel like the experience is different for everyone.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started this because I had a lapse in insurance so pill pack sent me these for cheap. Well, after two months my acne has never even worse, I gained 30lbs (tested thyroid because it was such a dramatic gain), my mood swings suck, period is constantly spotty, and I have no appetite/constant nausea. I wouldn't recommend this pill.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started using the Junel Fe 1/20 about a year ago. For the first I want to say three months I felt horrible side effects. I was throwing up, I was anxious, I was really terrible as a person and I just did not know what to do. My face broke out in severe acne and my periods were heavier and longer than before I even went on it. Aside from those three months though it has only been uphill. I hardly ever break out, I sometimes am nervous and anxious ( but I mean cmon isn’t everyone a little) and I throw up only once in a while in the mornings. Also the biggest plus, I am not pregnant! Definitely sticking with this pill. :)

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):PLEASE READ IF YOU ARE CONFLICTED. I’ve taken birth control before and I remember my first pill was pretty high in dosage and made me crazy. I vowed I’d NEVER go back on birth control. However, I decided to give it another go 2 years later. My doctor prescribed me Junel & honestly I luv it. I remember looking up this brand and became instantly terrified. I won’t lie the first 30 days of this pill were bad. I was so nauseas, had breast pain, bloated, any symptom you can get, I got intensely. But after the 1st month all my symptoms were gone. My period has never been skipped due to the pill. It comes the 3rd Friday of every month like clock work. (which was amazing since I’ve always had an irregular period) my periods are light-med and last 2-3 days. This pill is amazing. I haven’t gained weight from the pill, haven’t missed a period or had crazy mood swings. I was so scared to go on this pill but I’m truly glad I did. If you just wait up the 30-60 days of awfulness, you won’t regret

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this pill when I got my first boyfriend in beginning college. first I thought my irrational mood swings were because of the new relationship/the boy was a handful. Noticed my mood was all around better when I stopped it when we ended. I would start it again when I would start dating people again just to be safe. I realized my mood was unstable specifically I was on the pill, it wasn’t the boy or the relationship. I am a naturally chill person and it made me very sensitive and overreactive to things I normally would just brush off. It did an excellent job of preventing pregnancy though- this is the only form of birth control my partner and I ever used. After a while I noticed that no matter how much I exercised or dieted there was always that little bit of fat on my lower stomach that I couldn’t get rid of. As soon as I would get off the pill, continuing the same healthy habits, I found myself able to lose it. It would come right back after a couple weeks of taking it again. J

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Everything started off great, and now it’s like boom depression. Bloating. No period which is causing my body to react in all these crazy way. Crying, can’t sleep because my anxiety is so high because of it. Not working for me

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this BC for 10 months now. It did take probably 5-6 months for my cycle to regulate and if I miss a day where previous pills I'd just double up the next day and be fine. But if I do this on Junel I will start my period the next day regardless of where I am on my pack. That's the only negative effects I've had. This is my 7th brand after struggling with dark thoughts, nausea and REALLY bad adult acne on the others. All of those symptoms were direct result of being on birth control. Junel has completely cleared my acne and I haven't noticed any emotional changes. My cycle is also a lot lighter and shorter than naturally. Maybe something to try if you're struggling with multiple other brands.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was dreading starting this birthcontrol of horror stories online & feared it'd worsen my anxiety/depression. The first 2 weeks were bad; chills, shakiness, body ache, nausea, crying, bloated, & swollen boobs. My dr. said to give it time & symptoms will ease as my body adjusts, & said to take it nightly to sleep thru the nausea. After first 2 weeks I was ok & I've taken it for 9 months with out issue, but: 1.) I take it nightly & if I wake up to use the bathroom in the middle of the night I'm nauseous & often dry heave. I'm often nauseous next morning too. 2.) I've not had a period since starting it. First few months I had spotting & the past 3 months I've had no period at all. My Dr. said it's common & I don't mind but miss knowing I'm not pregnant each month. It hasn't worsened my mental health & maybe even helps regulate my mood (having no period and no PMS). It's a very low dose & I feel anything stronger would give me more adverse symptoms, so I'm sticking with it because my body tolerates it relatively well.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this Alyacen 1/35 for 3 months. I really liked it! I hardly had any side effects. I did have breast tenderness and a little bit of acne around my period but nothing that wasn’t manageable. Sadly, my pharmacy doesn’t carry it anymore so I got switched to a generic brand called Cyclafem and I have had horrible depression and the nastiest chin acne!  (Cyclafem comes in  Cyclafem 1/35 strength and Cyclafem 0.5/35 strength , and also Cyclafem 7/7/7 with is a different formula - so need to check which mine was)

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've had a similar experience to another reviewer - the manufacturer, Janssen, of my previous pill brand name Ortho Tri-cyclen stopped making it so I decided to try this since it was a low dose pill. I'm on my second pack but getting off - never in my life have I felt depressed but I started feeling moody, easily agitated, angry at the little things, not motivated to go to work, SUPER tired and wanting to sleep even after a full night's of sleep. I started getting a little acne on my back and chest too. Nothing bad is going on in my life at all and there have been no changes besides being on this pill.  This pill did not work for me, I was going to try to stay on for a 3rd month but it's clearly not working for me so I am getting off!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My experience was good. My acne cleared up, menstrual cycle light, no mood swings. I have been taking the birth control pill at the same time everyday.Taking the pill at different times of the day could cause hormonal imbalance in return cause all this bad symptoms.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Within days, I felt my entire mood begin to switch.  I have never had dark thoughts like I began to have when taking Junel Fe. Extreme anger isn’t even the best to describe it, you can tie your own shoes the wrong way and it would make me mad. Anxiety at an all time high where my mind would run wild or I would even be sometimes too anxious to get out of bed or out of my car to go into work. I didn’t gain any actual weight (sometimes water weight) but I always felt heavy, bloated and down right disgusting. The mood changes and water weight aren’t even the worst. I would experience a lot of break through bleeding but it wasn’t spotting, it was a full on period, and HEAVY !! It was like a monster period, super heavy and would last for days !! I also experienced cramping randomly throughout the month and not just close to/during my period. I do not recommend this birth control unless you want to start turning green and become the Hulk.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking this pill Lo Loestrin Fe for about 2 months and I can't wait to switch them . I've gained soooo much weight and broke out badly. Mind you , I've never dealt with acne problems. Different strokes for different folks but this pill is not for me.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control worked well for controlling my period but my emotional state was in absolute shambles. For 8+ months I had horrible anxiety and would cry about almost everything which I blamed on myself just being an emotional person. After not taking the pills for a few weeks I feel like a whole new person and I am not nearly as emotional or sad all the time. Would not recommend.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve only been taking this birth control for about 2 and a half months, but it has already significantly decreased my acne. I used to get 5-7 pimples a week and now I have none! I decided to take this after having had horrible pain due to an ovarian cyst and often small little pains during ovulation. So far, I have not had any pain and my period is incredibly light-almost as if I don’t have one. I was afraid of possible weight gain, but none has happened. This birth control works so well for me.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Lo Lo for about 4 years. I’ve never been on any other form of birth control and would be reluctant to switch because my body handles this one so well. I had no changes in weight, mood, sex drive, skin or any other common side effects. There was a brief period of about 4 months where I noticed I was extremely emotional on the days of the white pill but that has basically stopped entirely. After starting this pill I had my period normally for the next couple months but it has stopped entirely and I have not had it for almost 4 years. From what I understand having spoken to my doctors I’ve been told this is fine. I see a lot of mixed reviews on here pertaining to this birth control pill but I absolutely adore it, and so long as nothing changes I could be on this pill for a long time!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Junel Fe 1/20 for a while now. Decided to write a review because I know when I was googling b.c.’s I’d get nervous from all the negative reviews. I’ve only ever been on pills and have tried quite a few but have been sticking to this one because it works fine for the most part. I do feel like I’ve noticed holding water retention and bloating a lot more than with my microgestin fe which I loved. Junel fe hasn’t had any effects on my weight or appetite though and I’ve always had oily/combo skin but notice it’s sometimes more oily when I’m nearing my period. Overall I’d say for me, a 18 year old girl, it works and I get nervous reading bad reviews but the truth is it’ll work for some and not for others. I’d say try it out because it may work perfectly fine for you!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched to Junel Fe 1/20 after Portia was constantly making me cry. I was on Junel Fe 1/20 for about 7 months. The first five months I did not get a period when I’ve always gotten one on all of the other birth control I was on. I wasn’t used to this and thought I was pregnant so I constantly took pregnancy tests but they were all negative. My nurse practitioner assured me that some women don’t get a period at all while on birth control. Upon further internet research, it seems like this is a known brand for making your periods disappear and I wish I was told this. I had to request (yet again) another birth control as this one was making me cry and very emotional the week before the placebo/sugar pill week. I have been diagnosed with dysthymia or persistent depressive disorder so I’m not sure if that plays a huge factor but there have been birth controls where I’ve had less emotional symptoms. I would be full on sobbing and having a mental breakdown with Junel Fe 1/20.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this for a little over a year. I got on this pill to lessen my bleeding and cramps. For that purpose it is great and I still have normal periods that are not too heavy and cramps but in the past year I have gained almost 30 pounds and  I work out 5 times a week for multiple hours each time and eat a normal diet. I haven’t changed anything since I started taking it but now I’m going to have to find new birth control and work out and diet to lose all of this excess weight. I do not recommend Blisovi Fe 1/20 I have 100% resented my body due to this medication 130-155lbs in 13 months

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the first birth control I've ever taken, and I was very nervous about possible side effects, especially after reading reviews. I've now taken Lo Loestrin FE for over three months, and am pleased to say I noticed no mental side effects, my acne cleared up slightly, and there wasn't a weight gain. But....I took it because I have really bad cramps, like debilitating ones, and this didn't really help. It only made the cramps last several MORE days than normal, although the pain was more dull than the usual knife wrenching. Also, for the first two months my period came several days before the pill pack was supposed to allow it. This last month it came when it was supposed to, but I have now started a second period, a week after the last one ended. I think I am going to switch to one with slightly higher dosage, but for a gentle starting pill this was great.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking the Junel Fe 1.5/30 for two years now. This is the first and only birth control  pill I’ve taken, so I can’t compare it to any other experience. I suffered from severe panic-attack inducing cramps before I took Junel Fe, and I never have had any bad cramps since then. I have a regular, light flow with this pill with no pregnancy scares thus far. My face has cleared up almost completely and it’s the best it’s ever looked. This pill amplified my anxiety for the first few months, but I hadn’t associated it with the pill so I never stopped using it. However, after two years my anxiety and depression are completely gone... I’m not sure if I should associate that with the pill, though. I was kind of shocked to see so many negative reviews. But everyone’s experience is different. All I wanted was to stop having such painful periods.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When starting Junel Fe, I was super bloated every morning and night (it was constant throughout the time I took it but not always extreme). I took this nightly before going to bed. My period had shortened but it always started early and would last for maybe 4 days. However I experienced more cramping. I soon noticed I would be completely apathetic or hard headed for days until randomly I’d have bursts of anxiety attacks. These attacks lasted me quite a while and it was nonstop crying for hours. I was also more easily angered/impatient with my boyfriend. I do not recommend if you have mental health problems :( Also this made my discharge thick and barely enough. I might’ve had bacterial problems but I’m pretty new to it so I was unsure. It made sex unpleasant due to my dryness. It was pretty uncomfortable and I’ve been off of it for more than a month, planning to switch at my next doctors visit.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm almost a year on the birth control Microgestin Fe 1/20 . It has helped my very heavy periods calm down and not be as long. I'm in my mid 40s and was tired of the CSI Miami crime scene that my monthly would bring. Also this has helped my night sweats. I really have no complaints with this. Mind you I'm a healthy non smoker and exercise daily. If you smoke or are overweight maybe take the mini pill. My sister is also taking this for the same reasons. It takes many months for full effect. I hope this review helps someone. Please talk to your doctor if you have heavy periods. I waited many years.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Had to stop taking it cause I wasn’t even this sad when my dog died. It’s a 10 tho cause I didn’t get pregnant.
Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill Junel Fe is way better than my previous pill . Helps with acne and my anxiety isn’t affected by it.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before I started the Blisovi Fe 1/20 pill I read the reviews and was scared to take it because there are so many bad reviews. Everyone is different so I understand what works for one, might not work for another. This was my very first time taking birth control of any kind. I decided to try it because my ovulation, PMDD, and period were absolutely unbearable. I took Blisovi Fe and was pleased to not feel any side effects. After just one month I had great relief, no PMS/PMDD pain or sharp stabbing pains during my withdrawal bleeding (4th week) of the pill pack.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've had bad luck with birth control over the years. Got prego on a generic pill. Tried Implanon, awful side effects. 3 years of that, tried Mirena. No side effects. No pregnancy. Then it "fell out" and caused hormone problems. Bleeding heavily. Couldn't work for weeks at a time. Only thing that made the bleeding stop was the Depo shot. Some years later, missed a shot and had my 2nd baby. When the bleeding started again went back to Depo. But couldn't lose weight. Tried coming off Depo last year and using a BC pill and nearly ended up in the hospital. Had to get 1 more shot. Waited 3 months for the cycle to end. Then gyno started me on Lo Loestrin Fe for the 1st time in 8 years I have had regular periods that only last 3-5 days with no crazy bleeding.  Lost 32 lbs since finally coming off Depo and no serious changes to my depression or anxiety. The only down side is I get my period during the 3rd week of my pack,  but at least its consistent. Finally feel normal and wont ever use another BC again!

Microgestin 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love my birth control! I have been taking Microgestin for 4 years. Since taking it, my crippling periods have reduced from 1.5 weeks of pain to 4 days of controllable discomfort. I did not gain weight, but my breasts and butt did increase in size. It also did not make my acne any better or worse which to me is acceptable. I will say I was on  Microgestin Fe 1/20 at first which didn't allow me to skip periods even if I followed the rules to plan a month ahead. I switched to the higher dose  Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 to be able to do so, but with this one, I can skip periods simply by continuing to take the active pills without the month ahead preparation. I don't know if this would work for other girls as my period has always been irregular and super finicky. Anyway, this pill has worked great for me.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My insurance company tried to get my pharmacist to switch my prescription to Blisovi even though I am a long term happy Microgestin user. As many of you know, switching birth controls (even ones that are supposed to be medically equivalent) can result in a lot of side effects which I did not want to risk. I called the pharmacist and asked her to switch back the prescription even if it had to be ordered. She then checked and found the Microgestin is covered by my insurance in the first place! The switch occurred because Blisovi is cheaper and my insurance company wanted to save money. While I think its reprehensible that insurance is ever involved in the drug decision-making, DO NOT LET THEM SWITCH YOUR MEDICATIONS WITHOUT YOUR PERMISSION. With the Affordable Care Act most generic birth controls are covered by insurance including Microgestin. I found checking prescriptions online before traveling to the pharmacy helps a lot, so you are not rushed to a decision.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got on these pills to help regulate my periods. Before I started I used to bleed for a week straight skip a day and then bleed another week. It was really annoying but there was no cramping, but light blood almost everyday. About a week after taking Larin Fe I started feeling extremely depressed, lower self esteem, I would be crying for absolutely no reason. But along with that it has made me bleed way more now where I have to change my tampon nearly every hour and pads around 2 hours. I’ve gotten excruciating cramps and pains so unbearable I will be crying for an hour. I wake up to them in the morning and nights so strong I cannot go back to sleep. I’ve been told to take 2400 mg of ibuprofen daily to help with the bleeding and cramps but it honestly isn’t enough. I hate feeling like this and I really don’t know what to do.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):NOPE! Do not take this if you suffer from anxiety or depression because you will get worse. I have panic attacks every day, I overthink, cannot concentrate in uni classes because of the anxiety, picking fights with my friends and family, and the list goes on. It has cleared my acne but not my attitude. My sex drive is garbage now too. I regret taking this pill. I am scared to continue taking this pill and I don't not know when to stop taking it.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have an existing history of anxiety but cannot put into words how terrible this pill made me feel. So anxious I would cry multiple times a day over NOTHING! Extreme anxiety and anger over the smallest things, followed by an emotional breakdown, a horrible pattern of self hate. Anxiety so bad I couldn’t eat, and when I did I’d have acid reflux. So emotionally sensitive it took nothing to send me over the edge. My vagina was so sensitive and dry it itched CONSTANTLY. So dry I couldn’t even have sex without lube which in turn gave me even more irritation. My vagina would swell randomly, I had brown sludge with chunks of pink tissue coming out of me the entire first month. Got bacterial vaginosis three times in the 2.5 months I was on this pill and had to go on antibiotics 2x. As soon as it would heal it would come back so easy. I have just switched to a lower estrogen pill and looking forward to seeing if I can get myself back again. DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL!!!!!!!

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I thought I was the only one experiencing such negative side effects on this birth control but after reading all the reviews it makes sense to me. I was only on Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 for about three months but I was the most miserable I have ever been. I had constant mood swings and was always crying . I had low energy, no excitement for anything , and angry for no reason! I would have headaches almost every week. Everyone could tell something was wrong with me and I thought I was going insane but really it was the pill. It made my periods more painful and my cramps were worse. I would stay away from this pill.

Pirmella 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking the lower dose Pirmella for a few months now, and it has been working out great.  My periods are regular now, and I don’t have to worry about pregnancy.  The only negative side effect I have experienced is sore breasts which went away after the first month.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I never leave comments but this I need to with Blisovi 24 FE. I’ve been on this for a month and I have to stop it. This is the only birth control I’ve ever been on and quite frankly I never want to take it again. I took it for heavy bleeding and it made my period last for 2 weeks with still constant spotting. Five pound weight gain, constantly bloated like every day. It has made me beyond emotional and anxious too. I’ve been crying over the silliest things and I don’t feel like myself at all. I will never take this again.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for one year and three months so far. My experience seems contrary to the other posts on here and I wanted to give another perspective. In the beginning, I noticed the hormonal changes- I would, and still do cry much more easily than before taking this pill, when I was on no medication. I noticed that I would become more easily frustrated, and also that my self esteem was less than before taking this pill. However, after a few months I got used to the estrogen and began to deal with my changing emotions. I have not noticed any physical changes while taking this pill, as in, it did not make me gain weight, or give me acne. I have kept up the same relatively healthy lifestyle. My periods are 4 days instead of 3, but they are regular, and I have barely noticeable cramping. I used to have to take Tylenol, now I do not.  TMI- The blood is dark and coagulated instead of bright red. Overall, it does what it’s supposed to do and I’m not pregnant

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking birth control for almost 3 years now and Lo Loestrin Fe by far has been the best for my body. I gained no extra weight except my breasts grew a full cup size. My initial problem with birth control was the moodiness I was feeling. It was way overwhelming and I was constantly irritable, and my period was still heavy. I switched to Lo loestrin about a year ago and everything has been much better. My period has gone away completely along with the cramps. I feel a normal amount of moodiness around the end of the pack but not overwhelming. would definitely recommend, but know that it can be different for everyone.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started using Junel Fe 1/20 for birth control  after my insurance switched me from Microgestin Fe 1/20. It’s been almost a year and I’ve got to say Junel has made my period unpredictable and inconsistent. When I first began, I bled right away, probably break through bleeding. Then I got my period on time once, super light. Then a few times I would start bleeding in the middle of the month. Then once I only bled for a day or less. Most of the times it’s super duper light, like just discharge. Once or twice it was a regular flow. It never starts in the same day of the week either. This month, my period is really late or it hasn’t come yet. For a young woman like me, this is scary! I’d consider switching to something more reliable..

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve only been taking Junel Fe 1/20 for 3 weeks but it’s honestly taken me for a wild ride. This birth control has amplified my anxiety x100. I’ve managed to get 3 panic attacks in one week. I’ve been on two different birth controls before this one and didn’t have any anxiety or depression issues. The only reason I’m giving it a 2 instead of a 1 is because it cleared up my acne. Other than that all it’s done is make me super emotional and have horrible anxiety.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used Lo Loestrin Fe in an attempt to manage painful periods.  My periods weren't as painfu on them l but I spotted heavily for most of the 3 months I took it and had two periods per month the last two months I took it.  It also caused some pretty bad depression. I've had depression before but nothing this severe. It built up slowly and definitely peaked in severity at the 3rd month. Otherwise I had minimal side effects after the first month. My face stayed clear, not nauseous or sore or very crampy.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Similar to the GarbagePill writer. My doc asked what I was on before I got pregnant which was Taytulla. After my 6 week check up and then 2 week follow up, I asked for a strong birth control since I wasn’t breast feeding anymore. She prescribed me Junel Fe without my knowledge (thought I was getting Taytulla again) which is supposed to be generic for taytulla too, it is supposedly the same strength hormones just for 21 days instead of Taytulla 24 days? It took a week before I began to get hives on my thighs, back, butt, pretty much everywhere. I also experienced a dry itchy vagina! I thought maybe my laundry or body soap was the cause so I switched to sensitive skin stuff. Nope still continued to get hives and itch that’s when it finally dawned on me that I was fine before I started taking this pill. Scheduled an appointment to get checked out and hopefully get Taytulla brand

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Literally put me in such a dark place, I think I cried every day for months on this pill. I talked to my doctor and she said I maybe needed therapy. I switched birth controls just Incase because a friend suggested that might be the issue and right when I switched I felt like a weight was lifted and I turned completely back to my happy self!! Basically I feel like doctors often don’t talk about the mental side effects of birth control pills a lot. So if you are ever depressed and think it’s that, don’t let anyone talk you out of switching! But everyone’s body is different so it might work for you. My favorite is amethyst/lybrel since it has one of the lowest doses of estrogen you can get in a combination pill- for me less estrogen = less side effects! I feel great now!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I decided to share after reading 4 pages of reviews in case this is helpful to anyone. I was on Taytulla for a year before switching to Blisovi for insurance reasons. I would like to clarify that I live a fairly unhealthy lifestyle. I've lost ~10 pounds since I started this pill, still unsure if that's related or not. I started an antidepressant 2 months before I started my BC, so I was having some trouble telling the side affects of the two medicines apart. With Blisovi, my first two periods came at weird times as my body was adjusting to the pill, but I haven't gotten a period at all for the last two months (I took a test, I'm not pregnant). I haven't experienced any back pain or headaches at all. However, my mental state has definitely changed over these past 4 months, but I'm unsure how much of that has been caused by the pill. I haven't had any acne problems. All in all I don't THINK it has caused me any problems-wanted to post this in case any one else was feeling the same way.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the third oral contraceptive I have been put on in my lifetime (I am 24) I am on my third month on LoLo  (Lo Loestrin Fe) and was hoping by now my body would be adjusted to it, but I have had a week of spotting in the middle of each pack. I am currently halfway through my third pack and am bleeding enough to need a tampon. I still have been getting a light/medium period at the end of the pack as well so basically I am getting my period twice a month. The only positive thing so far is that I have lost about 7 pounds while on it, but I am not sure if that is because of the birth control. I have also had 3 anxiety attacks since starting this pill and it has given me more acne around my chin. I wanted to give this pill a fair chance before leaving my review but being at almost 3 full months on it I do not believe it is for me and will be switching to something that hopefully does not make me bleed so much.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just started this pill and it is my first time starting birth control. I've just started my first pack and have had no negative experiences with it so far. My doctor told me it will take 3 months for my body to get used to the medication and taking the pill at the same time everyday has been slightly challenging for me, but I've shifted my time to be a little later and it seems to be working better for me. During my first month, I was spotting for the first week, had bright red more period like bleeding the next few days, but then I stopped spotting completely by week 3. After this, when I started taking the placebos, I started to spot again, although very little. I have been used to having very heavy periods with intense cramps for the first day, but those have seemed to subside after taking this pill. My skin is clearer with no darkening spots and my mood during my time of the month seems to be much more pleasant.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used Junel fe for a little over a year. It worked perfectly most of the time. It was my first ever birth control so it did cause some abnormal bleeding in the first few months. It was fine after that. I didn’t notice many side effects until a few months ago. I started my period in the middle of my pack and I thought it was just a one time thing. However, my periods have now been two weeks long and started in the middle of my pack. I switched pills because the periods were painful and so long! Hopefully my new pill works better!

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Only giving this  birth control 2 stars because my cycle NEVER regulated. Took at the same time everyday for 5 months, and never stopped having break through bleeding on the second week of every new cycle. The bleeding would last a few days. Then sometimes my period never came when it was suppose to. Very frustrating! Also, I’ve never had issues with acne in the past, but while using Junel I kept getting tiny white heads on my cheeks. Other than that, I didn’t get pregnant so I guess that’s one plus.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First birth control medicine and the worst thing ever. Went on the regulate periods. That was the only issue I ever had. Now after being on it for 7 months here is what’s happening: increased heart rate, headaches, anxiety, and constant breakthrough bleeding for 10+ days a month on top to the actual period I get.Called doctor and they just keep telling me it takes a while for your body to adjust to birth control. That is ridiculous since it has already been 7 months. Hoping to either get new medicine or I will be done with birth control pills for good.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this med for a little over two years for acne and stopped it because it completely killed my sex drive!! I was completely dry and it was killing my relationship with my bf, however, THIS IS THE ONLY THING THAT HAS WORKED FOR MY ACNE!!! Literally does wonders for acne and cleared my skin so fast! I have combo skin and breakout frequently around my chin and forehead. I’ve tried soooo many high end products for acne and skin care, tried everything in the book such as drinking more water, eliminating dairy, etc. But the only thing that has consistently kept my acne away is this birth control!! It does completely kill sex drive for me, but having clear skin is worth it! Also makes my periods super light// nonexistent sometimes! Occasionally get hot flashes at night with this and during the beginning when my body was still getting used to it. But nothing too crazy. Overall I recommend this birth control to anyone! I have so many friends who take it and also love it!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control straight up ruined my life. I would wake up every morning with crippling anxiety/depression, I could not eat, I was constantly nauseous and vomiting. And it took me months to realize the Blisovi 24 was the problem, so by the time I quit taking it I had already developed a vitamin D deficiency and was extremely low in progesterone, both of which can greatly affect your moods. Seriously, try ANY other birth control before this one. They should not be allowed to sell this stuff.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Like most people, my insurance stopped covering my Taytulla so my GYN put me on this and said it was the generic. I've only been on it 3 weeks, and within the first week I was already feeling gross and bloated. I already feel like I’ve gained 5 pounds, and I eat really good and work out. The headaches are horrendous to the point they make me nauseous and feel like I need to vomit. Hopefully the side effects get better!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horribly emotional, one minute I'm ripping my husband's head off and I'm crying at everything. My stomach and ankles are bloated and my anxiety is through the roof. I'm stopping immediately.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I didn't gain weight or have any mood issues while on Taytulla. I took it for 5 months. However, during that time my hair started falling out (lost about 30% of it!) and my nails started splitting. Also, at first I'd have some breakthrough bleeding. Maybe once every couple of weeks. Then it became a daily thing - for like 6 weeks. Finally thought it might be the pills and went to my doctor. Sure enough. Switched to one with a different progesterone and all the problems started to go away within a month (still waiting for my hair to grow back but it stopped falling out!). Also, my insurance didn't cover it and even with the discount card from the drug mfg it was ridiculously expensive.
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla stopped my period from killing me, but made me SEVERELY depressed. Absolute worst I'd ever been.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So the last month and a half I have had anxiety and mood swings through the dang roof. My poor fiancé has been having it so rough. I thought something was seriously wrong with me and I was about to call my family doctor to schedule an appointment (anxiety is normal for me, but not at this level by far). Everything and everyone makes me soooo mad and emotional. I’m not normally a cow! I’m a happy person! Reading these comments and putting two and two together is such a relief because I’m not going crazy! I’m going to talk to my OB very soon. Good luck ladies.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Okay ladies do NOT use this birth control. I’m currently still on  Blisovi 24 Fe  and I hate it!! it has made me depressed, break out, gain weight, have an irregular period and have an extremely low sex drive. The only upside is that it has made my periods shorter. I began this birth control because my cramps were horrible and my periods were heavy & lasted 8 days, it hasn’t helped with anything besides shortening it. I had a 3 day period a few days ago and I’ve been off for a couple days now & I’m already cramping again!!! there’s so many better options

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My experience with this pill was horrible. The first month was fine besides some nausea and minor weight gain (mostly in breasts). By the second pack I was an emotional wreck. All my underlying depression and PTSD came back tenfold. I cry all the time, and I never used to cry. My anxiety is horrible-and it had been under control before I started this pill. I started taking it because I have PCOS and hadn’t had a period in 10 months. I will say it did regulate my cycle and I haven’t had any skin issues, cramps, or migraines...but wow nothing would make this pill worth it.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worked great, no side effects.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was off BC for awhile and asked my doctor to put me back on Lo Loestrin. Instead, without clarifying with me, she puts me on Junel Fe which is supposedly the generic version. I’ve been on it for about four days and I have already broken out in hives and have an extremely itchy, dry, and sensitive vagina to the point where I can’t sleep at night. In fact the whole reason I am writing this review is because I have been up all night with the itchiest vagina I have ever had in my entire life. I also have never had hives before and it took me a bit to realize this was all due to Junel fe after reading these reviews. Interestingly enough hives and itching as a side effect aren’t even listed for Lo Loestrin while they are listed for Junel Fe so I don’t know how these two can be considered the same when I had no issues with the latter. Do NOT take this pill as a replacement for Lo Loestrin. They are not the same and have different side effects. This pill is terrible.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel FE over 2 weeks ago. I have constant headaches that would not respond to medication. Also I'm depressed most of the time.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on the Blisovi Fe 1/20 pill to treat PCOS. This pill was awful. The pill made my face breakout out way more than usual, I had a lot of mood swings and I was sad a lot, also gave me horrible cramps. The only good thing about this pill was that it regulated my periods, other than that it was horrible.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I gave this a try for about 2 months, and was waiting for the side effects to wear off, but they did not. Lo Loestrin Fe pill made me extremely exhausted, to the point where I could sleep for 10 hours and need to sleep again hours after waking up. I did not have the energy to get out of bed and would have to force myself to do simple daily tasks, and made me feel depressed. My skin broke out very bad about 2 weeks into the medication, and continues to be worse than it was before starting this medication. I have also gained weight, even though I feel I have been eating less, I will get extremely hungry at weird times during the night. I think I will just stop taking birth control all together at this point because I can’t continue to feel this bad. I would definitely recommend going with a different birth control, such as YAZ.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the first birth control I’ve been on and I’ve been taking it for 6 months. This birth control lowered my sex drive so badly it started affecting my relationship with my husband. It also gave me TERRIBLE mood swings- I’ll be super happy and literally one second later I’ll get extremely annoyed. I recommend NOT taking this

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you have a family history of mental illness stay FAR away from this pill, Junel Fe 1/20. I never showed any signs of depression until I started this pill and I am stopping after a year of taking it because I cannot do it anymore. I work out 7 days a week with an average diet and still have experienced weight gain and my skin is the worst it has ever been. I also have not had actual blood in my periods since I started taking it. This has nearly scared me away from all birth control pills entirely. Don’t put yourself through this, there are better meds on the market.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this pill Junel Fe 1/20  for about 9 months. The first 3 months were the worse with mood swings, depression, and anxiety. My body took 3 months to get into a groove, but after that it's been smooth sailing. No weight gain, acne cleared up, LIGHT and painless periods, and no pregnancy scares. I would recommend! Don't let the negative reviews scare you. Everyone's body is different and will react differently depending on how you take care of your body.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to this pill from vienva.  It was great for about two weeks my skin was glowing no other symptoms and by the third week my hair was falling out in clumps. My scalp actually is sore because my hair is coming out. What’s scary is I’ve only finished one pack. I got a sample of Taytulla the brand name to hold me over for a wedding for a month and then I’m stopping and being done with BC.  This is not worth it when your hair brush is filled with hair after brushing through it once. Don’t take this... didn’t think the hair loss would happen to me and it did.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):- 1.5 months since I started taking Blisovi- 28 years old - Last time on BC was 10-years ago due to horrifying side effects on Ortho Tri-Cyclen Lo (negative stars)- Week 1 on Blisovi: Nausea and weak - Week 2: on Blisovi: Extreme drowsiness and exhaustion - Week 3: on Blisovi: Large Appetite and cravings - Entire time on Blisovi: Mild acne, just a few pimples here and there- I’ve been very carefully watching my diet and trying to stay hydrated so be aware and cautious of the side effects to stay ahead of the weight gain and so forth- I have not lost or gained weight— for me that’s ok! - Most Negative Effect: Development of Melasma (darkening of skin spots on face) **If Melasma doesn’t get better, I will switch. I will update my review when I got 3-months.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Over the years I have been sensitive to the hormones in BC pills so my Dr. prescribed me Lo Loestrin Fe in hopes of a better option because its low dose. I have been taking this pill for 3 months, I committed to 3 months to allow my body to adjust. The first month was okay, I noticed my hunger increase but I figured that was a side effect I could adjust to. By the second month I had become extremely tired, irritable, and very depressed. My eyes hurt and are blurry, my period has become irregular and lasts on and off for 8 consecutive days. I have gotten 3 yeast infections since starting the pill. I'm super hungry ALL THE TIME, and have gained 10lbs that will not come come off! I am going to be stopping this pill at the end of the pack  (as per recommendation) and looking into copper IUD. I literally cannot wait to get off this garbage and get my life back!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill with the expectation that it would minimize my period and fibroids.  I was regular,  5 days was my usual,  with 3 heavy days... I am on day 21, yes, 21 bleeding, spotting, and pain.  Tampon daily, or pads. I  would have preferred staying with the issue I had. Now I have messed up my hormones. My body is fighting with me. Again 21 daysssssss

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this generic version of Minastrin 24 Fe for a couple years? I don't remember exactly. I really love it. I'm surprised at all the other reviews, but everyone has different biological makeup that causes them to react differently to things. I may have gained a little weight, but honestly I needed it so it wasn't noticeable. I was already a sad person and didn't notice any differences in my mood after starting the pill, I even had a period of being very happy with life hahah. I want to say it has helped with my skin. Minastrin stopped my periods, but I would still spot sometimes. I don't get periods at all with Mibelas. Is this normal? Unsure, but it's better than bleeding all the time and having cramps that make me miserable. I'm thankful that my body is kind to me and lets me have this positive experience. I hope everyone is able to find something that works well for them, too.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor decided to put me on this pill because I was basically having 2 periods a month taking Beyaz. I honestly knew nothing much about lo lo before taking it but my doctor told me she had high hopes giving me this pill. So far I’m halfway through my second pack and haven’t had any negative symptoms. I suffer from anxiety and depression and neither of those have gotten worse since I’ve been taking this pill. I’m also super petite and workout daily so weight gain is always a concern for me and if anything I’ve lost a couple pounds since I’ve been on this pill. I wanted to share my experience because I do see there are a lot of negative reviews and I wanted to share my positive one. The only reason I didn’t give this pill 10 stars is because I haven’t gotten my period since taking it and although I love not having one, I am sexually active so it makes me a little nervous. But all in all so far so good. I’m 26 for reference.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Tried birth control for the first time and LOLO was not for me! Started off ok with minor cramps and nausea nothing too crazy. I was on it about a month and a week. Decided to stop due to my anxiety being the worst it’s been! Some days it was bearable other days I almost felt like I was about to have an anxiety attack! If you suffer from anxiety you know how bad this feels. Definitely would not recommend this type of birth control to anybody who suffers from anxiety. The only thing I loved was my acne cleared up with this but not worth the anxiety attacks!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used to take Lo Loestrin Fe 1/20 for like 6 years, then saw a new gynecologist who likely wrote down my prescription wrong and I ended up getting Blisovi 1/20. I’ve been taking it for the last 10 months and have had a generally negative experience. Pros: seems to have cleared up moderate acne, especially on my chest. Cons: cramps and heavy period for the first few months. Extremely low to nonexistent sex drive. Gained about 12lbs in the first two months with no lifestyle/diet change and now I can’t lose any weight, even after healthy eating at a caloric deficit and working out 5+ days a week for several months.  Also have Mood swings. Overall, this is just an okay birth control. I’m trying to change back to Lo Loestrin but I’m worried about my acne coming back! The weight gain and low sex drive on Blisovi is a huge negative though.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel Fe for about 10 days now. I started bleeding two days ago(day 8) out of no where. It wasn’t spotting. It was dark red heavy flow, I thought it would go away but the same thing happened when I woke up the next morning. Blood down my thighs. I haven’t been on birth control for 2 years so I figured my body needed to get used to it. I realized that the past 5 days I have been feeling depressed and unmotivated. It’s quite upsetting, I was very moody today but that could just be normal. After reading these reviews I am stopping the BC. I do not want this to spiral.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worst BC to exist. I was on ortho for about 7 months and it was perfect, my terrible acne cleared up and I didn’t notice any other changes until I had a 23 day long period and started breaking out badly again. I stopped taking it and wasn’t on any sort of BC for about 3 months. My gyno put me on Blisovi in the beginning of March but I was afraid to take it due to the terrible reviews. I started taking it early April and by the 3rd week my acne had tripled, even going to my back, neck, etc. I had feelings of depression that I have never even felt before and cried more in those 3 weeks than I ever had before. I gave it another week to finish my cycle and had the worst cramps and heaviest period I’ve had. I haven’t been on BC in 4 months bc it was so terrible. Good luck ladies

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I usually don’t write reviews, but wanted to share a piece of advice. It’s more so common sense but birth control newbies (like myself) aren’t used to taking pills daily and can easily forget. I’ve done a lot of research on this pill before and after I’ve began taking them (finishing week 3). Cut to the chase- I began heavier than normal spotting with dark brown blood which I’ve come to find is breakthrough bleeding and the reason is due to me missing my doses here and there (literally every other day).. but I did read that if u miss a dose, take two the following evening. Once I realized breakthrough bleeding is more common when u miss doses, I set a reminder to take and after taking 3 days in a row, it’s stopped completely! I haven’t experienced any of the other symptoms as discussed fortunately and like many have said, see how it works for YOUR body and give it at least a month to regulate. So far so good!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):TERRIBLE!!! Caused migraine episodes that would not go away! My friend also got pregnant while on this medication and she took it exactly as prescribed.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on it for 8 years without any issues. I do not have a period while on Microgestin Fe 1.4/30 , but according to my OBGYN this is ok -- plus, what's there to complain about?! It did not cause me to gain weight like previous pills I have been on.  If you're looking to clear up your skin, this is probably not the best choice. I did not notice a difference while taking it (as opposed to other pills I have taken that have cleared up skin well). Overall, I am happy with Microgestin Fe 1.5/30

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just got off Lo Loestrin Fe. Was on it for a year and my period still never regulated. I was extra emotional and had intense anxiety on it. I also have had clear skin before but for some reason after 9 months on it my skin has been consistently breaking out so I just stopped taking it. I have endometriosis and it did stop my cramps from being super painful but my period was all over the place and the acne won't go away. Only pros were that it did prevent pregnancy and no weight gain but I'm sad this did not end up working out for me. The acne was my main issue I just want the breakouts to stop.  Trying Viorele next

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I understand birth control is different for every person- but from my experience you should avoid this birth control or be very careful/prepared before taking it. The first two weeks I gained 7 pounds, had horrible acne, and was so tired. I knew my body was going through a hormonal change so I decided to ride out the first month. By the end of the first month I developed extreme, crippling anxiety and depression. Nothing brought me joy, I panicked about everything, I cried for no reason, and had no motivation to do anything. I’d even wake up 5-6 times a night in extreme panics about nothing. This pill honestly almost ruined my life. I just finished my first month and I am never taking it again. I can’t risk how much worse it could get if I stayed on this pill any longer. If you want to try for yourself and notice any extreme symptoms within the first few weeks I would recommend stopping immediately!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My pharmacist started giving me Junel Fe 120 almost 3 months ago, rather than Larin Fe 120 (which I was using for almost a year). I take birth control not only for its intended purpose, but also because my body is prone to large ovarian cysts. About a week or so in I started getting zits. For the record, I have never had acne, not even in my pre-teen/teen years. I'd get one or two maybe every few months but that was it. The acne got worse and worse, but I thought if I stuck with Junel Fe my skin would even out. Maybe I just needed to get used to it? Three months later, every inch of my face is covered with swollen, itchy, PAINFUL acne. I can't even rub my eyes without wincing in pain. I was on the phone with my doctor and my pharmacy for over an hour this morning BEGGING to be given literally anything but Junel Fe for my next month of pills.  In the meantime, my remaining pills have gone in the trash. I'd honestly rather risk the ovarian cysts than take Junel Fe ever again.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I do have a history of depression, migraines and am currently 44 years and am going through Peri menopause. (I have fairly mild Peri menopause symptoms currently. Occasional night sweats and my period is still fairly regular with monthly frequency differing by only a couple days each month.) Please use Lo Loestrin  caution when you start this because by the beginning of my third week I started waking up at night with the worst night sweats I have ever had. My clothes and hair  were completely soaked, so much I felt like I had just shower. I also woke in the middle of the night running to the bathroom to vomit and thought I was sick because I had been feeling nausea for days. I became extremely irritable and starting spotting and came down with one of the worst migraines I have had in a long time. Once the migraine hit I went into a severe depression and have been crying for a week. I stopped taking the birth control two days ago. Hope this helps.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control honestly does not deserve all the negative reviews. I've been on it for 3 years and have had no side effects. My sex drive is lower but I think that has more to do with being a mom and not a selfish young adult anymore than it does with this medicine. I haven't had a period in the last two years and it has been absolute bliss, no more ruined birthdays, anniversaries, beach vacations etc. I was  anemic in the past and my periods used to be so debilitating that I would have to call out of work for the first day every month. I also suffered from cold induced urticaria since I was 7 years old and this birth control has somehow made that ailment completely vanish, now I can go places without a jacket or swim in cold water and not have my body break out in hives. I seriously love this birth control it has changed my life in incredible ways that I didn't even think we're possible.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am going on month 3 of this. I have gained 15lbs, I am moody and unstable/irrational. I honestly was about to go to a doctor to get put on depression medication until I saw these reviews, because I’ve been through my fair share of stuff and I have never felt this way in my life. I have no interest in things and I have zero energy. I’m a registered nurse and am relatively healthy but I am truly struggling to stay on top of a proper diet and exercise on this medicine. It’s crazy I go from being so nauseated I can hardly eat to binge eating enough for a family of 4. I’ve also never in my life had boobs, my husband can’t believe how big they are, but it’s not even like he’s enjoying them because they’re so sore I want to cry even when our dogs bump or hit them. I haven’t had bad skin since college (poor diet, dorm living, sleeping with make up) and guess what my skin is worse than it’s ever been before. I only have 1 week left on this and it cannot come soon enough.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m on the 3 month of using this birth control and everything has been pretty good so far. My first month using Blisovi Fe I had light spotting for about a week but that is normal. After the first pack I have not had any more spotting. My periods are normally short for 4-5 days without birth control but using Blisovi Fe had mad my periods even shorter (about 3 days) also, it made my periods even lighter then normal which is a plus. Haven’t gotten pregnant so that’s good too!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got on Lo when I was 19 because I had terrible cramps, acne and heavy, long bleeding. It worked wonders no anxiety, shorter periods, my acne nearly all went away, no breast tenderness or growth, however I did have water retention and weight gain 5 lbs (lost it when I came off the pill). After a year I began bleeding during ovulating and during the regular schedule. I tried for another 4 months to see if that was a once occurrence but continued for the next 4 months. Soon my body adapted to the pill (I feel) and my periods were getting longer and the ovulation bleeding continued. (So I was bleeding twice a month). I am now off the Lo Loestrin and on Milli.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill made me extremely irritable with feelings of rage over very little things (like the sound of my husband chewing) on a consistent basis. I had no sex drive and gained five pounds. I started it right before my wedding and the way it made me feel and react almost ruined my marriage. As soon as I went off it, all of the above went away and my husband is thrilled to have his wife back!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After reading all those comments, I feel blessed that this birth control works perfectly for me and I have zero issues. I have had a laparotomy myomectomy surgery few years ago and I have been bleeding so heavily since, that I wasn't even able to leave my house for 20 minutes because I would bleed through my pants.... my periods would be 2 or 3 weeks long, extreme bleeding, and I have tried other brands/shots with no results. I started this one a year ago, bled for the first whole month, and was getting desperate, but my periods stopped altogether and I haven't had one since the first pack.My skin is perfect, so no issues there.My hair was falling out a bit, but then I went vegan and my hair was good again.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Junel Fe 1/20 for about a year. I have previously been on another birth control pill for about 7 months then stopped for almost 2 years and got on this after I was sexually active again. My previous pill gave me regular periods during my sugar pills week. On the Junel, I almost never got my period. I had my period once this entire year and I get very light spotting on my second week of hormonal pills. It was initially odd not to get my period, but I had a check up recently with my doctor. She knew my side effects before I even told her. She said it is completely normal because this is a low hormone pill so it doesn't have enough hormones to induce a period for some woman? It was somewhere along the lines of that.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you're asking me, absolutely do NOT under ANY circumstances take this birth control. I cannot begin to explain to you how badly this medication screwed my body over. Supposedly, I talked to my doctor about how painful my period was (I have absolutely no recollection of this event) and got switched to this off my old brand back in 2017. I cannot tell you how much it ruined my life, honest to god. I got the worst cystic acne I've ever had in my life. It was mortifying. I wore a surgical mask to classes because it was so unbelievably bad. I had the most intense cramps I've ever had to the point I was actually crying when I've never had issues with cramps before. I was on it for 3 months and it never got any better until I told my doctor and she switched the medication. Immediately it cleared up. My skin is still horribly dented from the acne scars. I'm taking the time to write this now because my skin is breaking out again it's reminded me: DO. NOT. TAKE. THIS.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never written a review in my life but I felt it was necessary this time so maybe I can help and or prevent somebody having to go through what I went through. My doctor prescribed Lo Loestrin to three months ago. When I first started it I LOVED it. No side effects. unfortunately that all came to an end. I woke up one morning having a HORRIBLE panic attack . I’ve never experience anxiety this way in my life. I felt horrible and absolutely MISERABLE. I would cry, sweat through my clothes, lash out and everyone around me and my heart would race all day long. After reading reviews I quickly connected the two of what was wrong with me. I understand some people have had amazing results with this pill but I was NOT one of them. I would NOT recommend even trying to figure out if it will work for you. It isn’t worth it, there are a lot of other options out there but I am begging you all do not try this garbage.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After using Junel Fe 1/20 for nearly 3 months and  then switching to progesterone pills, I can happily say that this messed me up.I never thought I would be one to starve herself or to cry near daily over almost anything. I was such a sensitive, emotional wreck and I decided to get off mid-pack when I started to have really dark  thoughts. However, I am happy to see I am not the only one who has experienced this due to Junel Fe.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Microgestin before it switched to Junel fe. I had gotten on the pill because of irregular periods and severe migraines around my period. I started taking this in December and by the end of Janurary I had full on depression and my anxiety was through the roof. I got into massive arguments with friends and family over nothing. I had no control over my emotions. It’s taken me almost 6 months to get to a spot where getting up everyday isn’t a battle. I went to a therapist for the first time in my life because I felt so out of control. This pill also increased and worsened my migraines which is incredibly frustrating. I’m not sure how a pill like this is on the market. I’d warn anyone who has any sort of anxiety or family history of depression to stay far away from this pill. I don’t feel like myself anymore and the worst part is I’ll have to try another birth control just to try to feel like myself again. I’m so disappointed in this pill.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am not happy with this medication Loestrin 24 Fe. I switched birth control pills as my last pill made me gain 10lbs in a short amount of time. I lost it all after I went off that pill within a few months. After about 3 weeks on this particular pill, I knew it would be normal for my chest to be tender and my body felt a mess, but wasn’t expecting to develop acne on my jawline and neck, especially since I have never had acne before. My skin is now really oily when I typically have dry skin. I thought it was because the time of year and its warm but I’ve never had this issue throughout my life and I’m in my 30’s. Here come to find out after looking online, it seems like other people have the same problem, glad to see this thread and to know I’m not the only one. I’m on my last pill, and I will not be taking this anymore. Hopefully my skin clears up fast.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this medication for 5 months, gained 28 pounds and couldn’t lose weight no matter how hard I tried. I also got acne, mostly on my back which I never had before, and my ankles looked really swollen. I also had really bad anxiety. Since stopping this medicine all of those problems have resided and the Pounds are falling back off.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this Lo Loestrin Fe pill for less than a month and had very noticeable side effects. I know that the rule of thumb for new meds is 3 months, but I couldn’t do it! Awful mood swings, increase in anxiety, bad dreams, headaches & acne!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I began this June Fe 1/20  pill about 6 months ago for help with cramping and I no longer wanted to guess when my period would come.  No side effects at all.  I am 39.   No weight gain or breakouts.  Works great.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first month of being on it, my emotions were high and my cramps were worse then ever before when I got my period . I’ve always had and irregular period but after being on it for a few months and having a set schedule of knowing exactly when I’m gonna get my period, it’s been amazing. My periods are 10x lighter then they were and my cramps are no longer bad, my acne has cleared up and it’s been great. I  incorporated taking the pill into my nightly routine, so now it’s become more of a habit.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had Mirena for a year and a half and didn't like the way it made me feel so July 16th 2019 I got it out and started Junel Fe 1/20  the next day. I started my period 2 days later and it was so heavy I was bleeding through the tampons at least once a day. This is my 2nd month taking it and haven't missed a pill but no period. Cramping sore boobs and headaches but nothing. I'm debating on calling my dr to switch to something else. I have 0 energy and 0 sex drive. Not liking it so far at all

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m 18 and I started taking this almost 2 years ago when I became sexually active. Since then I’ve had at least 3 pregnancy scares due to the fact I went almost 3 months with no period and honestly as great as that sounds when you’re a sexually active 16 year old that stuff freaks you out. I’m pretty sure it also caused me to gain weight since I weighed around 130-140 and now I weigh around 160. Also barely ever get my period during the placebo/ off week which also drives me insane considering I have a tendency to freak out. Also it has made me feel super nauseous the last couple of months and my boobs are tender a lot which again FREAKS ME OUT. So in conclusion I finally went to my gynecologist and told her I couldn’t handle feeling like that anymore and I’m finally switching to another pill which will hopefully make my periods more believable.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Taytulla in March, the first few months were okay, I noticed a slight change in my behavior but I bounced back from that. It’s now late August and I’ve gained 8 pounds. It doesn’t seem like much but it’s noticeable to me. I used to never gain any weight, I would eat whatever I wanted and be totally fine. I’m eating healthier than ever and if I eat a full 3 meals in a day I will gain 4 lbs by the end of the day, and if I continue that the next day my weight only increases from there. I work out and stay active but nothing helps. The only way to maintain my weight now is by eating way less than I normally would which is obviously not healthy. I’m stopping  it in a few days once I finish my sugar pills and hopefully my weight will go back to normal soon. It’s not the same for everyone but Taytulla was not for me, the only upside I experienced was the regular periods which I could do without.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been taken Microgestin for 2 years lost my insurance and had to take a break from my birth control. Finally got my insurance about 6 month break. I went to see my doctor and she gave me Lo Loestrin I took that for 3 months but got no periods and no side effects. I wanted at least a light period to know I’m not pregnant. I was then given this Blisovi. First week was bad with nausea and headaches. It was horrible but the third week it got extremely bad. I started to get vertigo and it absolutely wrecked my month. I went to a concert had one drink and almost fainted. I’ve taken 1/20 before but something about this BC is not working.  Good luck ladies hope this helps.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My insurance switched me to the Mibelas 24 Fe  without warning and my experience has been awful. I've been in full blown depression (which I have never experienced), anxiety, numbness, mood swings, and anger outburst, my periods are back & heavy and painful.  Also became extremely sensitive to the sun and burned when I never did before. I am a therapist so at first I was worried maybe it was something wrong with me so I tried managing my depression symptoms other ways but it never worked. It was relieving to here this medication is known for these emotional changes. I'm getting off of this medication immediately

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this Lo Loestrin Fe birth control when I was 18 and am now 25. When I first started this pill I had break through bleeding/spotting all the time for probably for the first 6 months. It wasn’t the best, but I stuck it out to let my body adjust. I love this pill now. No weight changes, no period, it’s as if my body isn’t taking anything but I’m protected from getting pregnant. Overall, everyone’s body is different. You can’t try a birth control based on someone else’s experience. What works for someone’s body might not work for you and vice versa. This pill has worked amazingly for me and I love it. But you should try it for yourself and see how your body reacts.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Like many others on here, I was swapped onto  the Mirbelas 24 Fe pill due to insurance reasons. I have nothing that good to say about this pill. I’ve noticed-increase in anxiety-weight gain of around 15 pounds-heavier periods-longer lasting periods-irregularly in periods-more headaches-sore breasts-cramps (never had cramps before taking this) -cystic acne

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve truly loved this birth control Junel Fe 1/20. The first few months I had some symptoms like breast tenderness, headaches, and was more emotional than usual  but they weren’t severe symptoms by any means and by the third month they were gone. My period comes on time each month like clockwork and is MUCH lighter than it has ever been. Cramps are less painful and any PMS symptoms are just generally more bearable. Plus, best of all, no pregnancy here! :)
