Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The reviews really scared me and I wasn't going to start taking Junel Fe 1/20. However, I had none of these horrible side effects whatsoever, only a few mild hormonal pimples. Try it out and don't let the comments steer you away from it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control  Lo Loestrin Fe (norethindrone acetate 1 mg and ethinyl estradiol 0.010 mg) for 2 years and I love it. For me personally I haven't had any bad experiences with this birth control. Just be prepared to possibly go months without having a period and sometimes not even spotting. I would recommend this birth control.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After years of an IUD I was on Lutera (levonorgestrel 0.100 mg and ethinyl estradiol 0.020 mg) as my first oral birth control pill. I basically went nuts. My hormones and emotions were of of whack and I desperately needed something new. Moved onto Junel 1/20 (norethindrone acetate 1 mg and ethinyl estradiol 0.020 mg)  which has  norethindrone as the progestin instead of levonorgestrel.Junel 1/20 is the best! It’s been 3/4 months now :- no weight gain- mood stability -lightest period ever - small spotting - I feel happy and content- basically doesn’t feel like I’m on any birth control - best change I’ve ever made

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had to switch to this one (Junel Fe 24 = norethindrone acetate 1mg and ethinyl estradiol 0.02mg) after taking Lo Loestrin (norethindrone Acetate 1mg, Ethinyl Estradiol 0.01mg) because my insurance wasn’t covering it. I took it for four days and got the most excruciating migraines I’ve ever had. It was debilitating and I couldn’t leave my house or do anything for three days, once I stopped taking it they went away immediately.  I wasn't even aware they were different strength in the Ethinyl Estradiol the Junel was twice as much.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I don’t normally write reviews for things but I had to take time to do this. I was on Microgestin before it switched to Junel fe. I had gotten on the pill because of irregular periods and very severe migraines around my period. I started taking this in December and by the end of Janurary I had full on depression and my anxiety was through the roof. I had no control over my emotions. I stopped taking this pill a week after I noticed the drastic change in my mood. It’s taken me almost 6 months to get to a spot where getting up everyday isn’t a battle. I went to a therapist for the first time in my life because my emotions were so out of control. This pill also increased and worsened my migraines. I don’t feel like myself anymore and the worst part is I’ll have to try another birth control just to try to feel like myself again. This drug should not be on the market. I’d happily pay more for my BC if it meant me not going through anything like this again.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My OBGYN prescribed me Lolo 5 months ago. I am 19 years old and I went on the pill mainly for contraceptive purposes, but I was also hoping for it to help clear my skin of hormonal acne/breakouts. Boy was this not the pill for me. My acne is worse than ever, all over my cheeks, chin and jawline. In addition to this, I have been experiencing a lot of hair loss. No balding by any means, but the hair fall has been heavy and my hair is not as thick as it once was. The only thing I can say is that it stopped my period and I experienced no water retention, anxiety or depression. However, the acne and hair loss is a major deal breaker for me and has been messing with my self esteem

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was only taking this birth control for 6 days. I decided to  start birth control for really bad cramps and my acne.Cramps weren’t bad my acne started to clear up which was great but nah I couldn’t even go through a full week.I would cry for no reason, I lost 10 pounds in 6 days, I had really bad anxiety and mood swings. The mood swings were very bad I think that was the worst part being mad about everything and anything I went on vacation the week I started my birth control and my family told me I looked mad most of the time.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I know I shouldn’t even be reviewing this medication (I’ve literally only taken it for 4 days) — I read the reviews & thought to myself everyone reacts differently to meds & most people who have a great experience are less likely to write a review than those who have a terrible one. I’m on day 4 & I’m not sure I can even last another week never mind 3 months. I’m almost 30 and have been on Loestrin & Sprintec in the past (with little to no issues). My first 2 days were fine, today I feel like I’m dying. I’m nauseous & cramping, can’t get out of bed, I’m already bleeding, I’m bloated and up 4.5lbs of water weight, I’m crying at literally everything (unlike me), I’m exhausted. I must be having a bad reaction...holy heck, I am miserable. I know I should just wait it out, but I’m bed ridden with two toddlers and can’t deal with this whatsoever. Will update if I decide to let my body level out & stick through the 3 month side effect phase.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on a form of  birth control called Mibelas for 9 years and then started to have slight breakthrough bleeding a few times per month.  Dr switched me to Junel and it was fine the first month but then started having very frequent breakthrough bleeding and cramps over the last 4 months.   It’s going to be different for every person but it’s not great for me. Approaching 50 in a year or so and ready to be done with the pill!!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My 13 year old daughter took Blisovi because she doesn't get periods for more than 3 months and as soon as she takes it at bedtime she feels her chest hurting. She is the sweetest person and she was so grumpy irritated  and could not sleep. Her summer was so hard. She would cry for no reason and could not stop. If she missed a pill she would get a period. I will make sure that she stops Blisovi Fe I/20 and I'm taking her to the heart doctor to make sure it didn't cause any damages to her.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):While I haven’t taken this for long, I am not a fan. However, I am extremely sensitive to hormonal changes, so take that for what you will. It did take away substantially from my painful cramps, but I was still in pain with no relief from OTC pain medicine. The mood swings were horrible. I have rarely felt something so emotionally exhausting. My depression was severely aggravated, giving me super dark thoughts and nightmares. I had never experienced that before. I was miserable. When I stopped taking this, it wasn’t soon enough. If you have a mental illness or history with suicidal ideation/if you are highly sensitive/prone to medications and their side effects, I wouldn’t take this, but that is purely my experience.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ll give a little medical background first before I tell my experience. 28 years old. Fairly active. Was placed on the pill at 15 years old to control my PMDD and anxiety. I switched to this pill in January after thinking I needed a switch to control some anxiety. This pill has ruined my life. I thought it was stabilizing my mood, it actually increased my anxiety and made me have no emotion towards anything! After my 3 month trial my pharmacy switched me to the generic form of this pill. This switch made me realize that my anxiety was out of control. I’d cry at the drop of a dime. Over nothing. Paranoid. Nervous. Awful. I was switched back to the microgestin and the anxiety persisted. Skipped 3 periods so far. Constant migraines. It’s been one of the worst experiences I’ve ever had. Switching next month. Beware if you are prone to anxiety and depression. This pill amplified it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The week I started taking this pill I started breaking out terribly on my chin. I should have stopped it then, but I decided that I should ride it out. 3 months later my skin is so bad I had to pay $400 to get laser done so that I don’t cry every time I look at myself. I’ve stopped the pill now. That was the biggest side effect for me, everyone is different. If you start breaking out I would suggest to get off this pill immediately.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I (27) was prescribed this for acne control. Within 3 days of being on Lo Lo my skin was 10X worse than it was before I got on it. The acne on my chin spread up my jawline with new cystic spots popping up by the day. I took it for a month to see if it was an adjustment period but nothing has changed. My chin has been in a continuous breakout for 4 weeks. True to the packaging, I’ve had light spotting the last week of the pill pack but nothing unbearable. In terms of other side effects, I noticed the first week I had major bloating. Like looked 3 months pregnant bloating but that went away within 8-9 days. This hasn’t triggered migraines nor did I see any obvious weight gain. My breasts were tender but again, nothing unbearable. Obviously this pill isn’t for me but as with these kinds of things, there’s only one way to find out. Everyone’s body is different but from the previous reviews I’ve read, I’m not at all surprised by my side effects.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on the Junel Fe 1/20  birth control for a year and a half. I first went on because I have PCOS. This birth control has done what I wanted it to, prevent pregnancy, reduce pain and heaviness of periods, regulate my periods, and manage hair growth and other symptoms related to PCOS. The problem is the side effects, I haven't had any weight gain just bloating but I have developed IBS symptoms which I have never had any GI problems before. This is the biggest issue for me because constant constipation/diarrhea has prohibited me from certain events or opportunities and has just added a lot more stress to my life. I also have a lower sex drive and just generally weird mood swings, I'll be relatively emotionless and then small things will either really annoys me  or make me start crying, etc. Overall this pill wasn't awful but I'm trying a new one with less hormones to see if it is a better fit for me.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is an amazing match for me. I started this pill 4 months ago and was honestly scared - lots of my friends told me about their weight gain, anxiety, and sudden waves of sadness. This pill has had no impact on my emotional state and I personally have lost 16 pounds (with no lifestyle change.) Overall my periods are really light, I’m happy, and protected ! Love this pill.

Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I only took this birth control pills for 3 days and had to stop right away, I started to experience bad anxiety and depression and my doctor advised me to stop taking them. I am also on Wellbutrin for depression and not sure if they interact but I highly recommend to not take this if you have anxiety and depression and take Wellbutrin as well.. I cried non stop and never felt so sad in my life

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on LoLo Estrogen Fe for 2 years now and I really like it. The only mood swings I ever had occurred during the first week which is expected and then they subsided. No weight gain which was my MAIN concern. However, I bleed twice a month, first on my period half way through the pack (super weird time to get my period) and then spotting and the end of the pack. I don't want to tell my gyro about this issue because I don't want her to take me off of this because I'm afraid another BC will make me gain weight and I'm very particular about staying a size 2. So the bleeding and spotting is my only complaint and also slight acne but I'm hoping if I eat healthier the acne will go away and its really not that bad compared to other girls that I've seen on different brands of BC. I love the fact that this is the lowest dose BC on the market because I was terrified of putting hormones in my body. I definitely recommend this for young petite girls who want to maintain their weight.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Reading the reviews on Lo Loestrin birth control medication terrified me to try it! HOWEVER I gave it a chance and it is the first and only birth control I've been on! The first month I did have breast pain and mood swings but I stuck with it and now I’m about three months in and the breast pain has gone away and I only have mood swings for the first week of a new pack and it’s well worth it! My stress and pregnancy scares are done for! My only other bothersome side effect would be nausea however I’ve found that if I eat around the time I take the medicine, I’m usually okay! If you’re on the fence about this pill I think you should definitely give it a chance! Good Luck!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I recently lost my virginity and I decided it would be best to get on birth control. I have been on this pill for the past five months and didn’t start to develop severe side effects til my 4th round. I have had a constant UTI that later turned out to be a yeast infection all summer, I have developed migraines which is not something that happens to me, and I have had dramatic hair loss. I have normal thick wavy hair and I usually would lose hair here or there but now it’s to the point where I have to vacuum my hardwood floors cause sweeping doesn’t help anymore. I also have had my anxiety heighten and I cry more easily now. I have never felt defeated by a small pill in my entire life. My sex drive is high but I don’t feel myself enjoying it the way I used to. I gained 10 pounds on this pill as well. I've reached out to my doctor and begged for a switch. Please don’t take this pill

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 because my periods were so heavy and painful. The only positive thing this medication has done is pretty much taken away my period cramps and made my actual period so light I only needed a liner. I’ve been on it for two months, but I’m going to switch to a more mild birth control because MY BOOBS ARE KILLING ME! For the past week are so, I can’t even sleep on my stomach! This has never happened to me before. They’re also swollen. It made my acne much worse as well, and I’m getting random cramps at night.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was only on the Larin Fe 1/20 pill for a month and it was awful. It ruined my mental health. I am not a very emotional person and I began to sob every day.  It caused me to have very dark thoughts. Please do not take

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have taken this Lo Loestrin Fe pill for about 2 years. At first it seemed to work fine - light periods, no hormonal acne, and I never got pregnant. Then after about 6 months, the side effects started kicking in. I have never been a depressed person but I started to get really down, and extremely anxious and angry about the smallest things. I feel like it really affected my mental health. A lot of mood swings. Hormonal acne would flare up every month and spotting would happen all the time - I would never know when it was going to happen. Sometimes I wasn't sure if it was my actual period or spotting and it could happen 3-4 times every month. Wouldn't recommend. I am switching off this pill ASAP.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT take this birth control!! It is a nightmare!! The first couple months  on Blisovi 24 Fe were fine but starting around month 6 I was so depressed, wanted to sleep all day not motivated. HORRIBLE mood swings, NO sex drive at all!! The worst acne I have ever experienced! I have never had acne until I started this pill. I have been off this birth control for two days and already feel 100x better! Find another pill to take because this is not worth it!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking Blisovi Fe 1/20 for 5 days. I used to take Lo loestrin years ago, now that I started birth control again my doctor prescribed me Blisovi. The first day was good no side effects. The second day I felt a little tired and did not have an appetite. The third day, Sunday, I felt horrible. I had a very bad migraine, was nauseous, threw up I felt horrible. On Monday I felt a bit better, I was still nauseous, did not have an appetite, but the headache was gone. Today, day five, I feel better, I still feel very tired but no nausea and my appetite is back.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this birth control for about four months now and it’s been good to me so far. The first month my emotions were heightened a little bit but since then I’m back to normal. My periods are so light and I’ve only gained a couple pounds, which honestly is probably not even because of this birth control. Would recommend

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was taking Lo Loestrin for 3 years before starting Blisovi (had to stop because my insurance no longer covered it Lo Loestrin) and let me just say it was the worst month of my life. I already suffer from anxiety and depression but this made me so much worse, the most depressed I’ve been in about two years. The whole month was a fog filled with anger, huge mood swings, acne like no other, and being able to cry over literally anything. I’m not an angry person and I don’t get mad but every little thing would really annoy me or make me cry uncontrollably. I was so weak I wouldn’t get out of bed, and had insomnia. I got off it and am trying a different pill now so let’s hope that works.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first time taking birth control pills, I wanted my (quite regular) period to not come during my wedding and honeymoon. BIG. MISTAKE. As a result of this pill, I got cystic acne for the first time in my life. I got terrible mood swings and the feeling of hopelessness and depression for the first time in my life. And now my skin looks horrible for the wedding. Great.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got on this pill Microgestin 1/20  so I wouldn’t have periods, as I was basically bedridden during that time of the month. I missed one pill in June and took one pill 6 hours late a month later in July. It is mid August and I have been spotting with cramps for a little over two months. I have absolutely no sex drive. It’s completely disappeared and that’s hard for me as I am in a long term relationship with my boyfriend. I love him so much and want to be intimate with him, but I just have zero libido for it. I also feel like I’m crazy. My emotions have been all out of whack. I’m either sad, angry, or numb. My last birth control lowered my sex drive and made my emotions funky sometimes but it was NOTHING compared to this. Would not recommend to my worst enemy. I give it a 2 out of 10 because I’m not pregnant which is the ONLY upside.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I had to switch from Taytulla to Junel Fe because my insurance doesn’t cover it anymore. At first it was okay. Very very light periods for maybe 3 days. Then after a few months I stopped getting periods and now I’m completely off birth control (it freaked me out not getting one) and I still haven’t gotten a period after 2 months. I wouldn’t take this birth contol if you worry when you don’t have one either. I’ve made an appointment to switch to a new one ASAP

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst experience of my life. Before taking Junel Fe I had been 130 pounds with minimal acne and a genuinely happy person.This medication has made me gain 40 pounds in a year, caused me to have horrible acne prone skin that I’ve never had before, and have very depressed/suicidal thoughts. This birth control is a real self confidence killer.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this pill because I had irregular periods and was really tired and thought it is going to help me. After the third day of taking it, I started having nausea, vomiting and headache. Then started having very bad mood swings to the point that I would get mad at every single person around me. It gave me anxiety, depression and every bad side effect you can think of. I will never take this pill again.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):LoLo has had its ups and downs. In 1st month, I had some breakouts, spotting, mild cramping, and mood swings. That went away after 1-2 months, and while the side effects were there they were tolerable. I've always had very painful period cramps, which this pill took care of,  and gave me an insanely light period every month in comparison to how mine were before starting LoLo (a huge plus and made the initial side effects worth it to me). Now, almost 6 months into being on it, I've decided to switch. The past couple months I've had weight gain, bloating/water retention, a SEVERE dip in my sex drive, ability to naturally lubricate, and pain during sex. None of these things have been a problem for me in the past. I've struggled to gain weight before, never once had any issues with libido or anything that affected my sex life in the slightest. This was a great pill until these issues started coming up. I'd still recommend to someone looking for a decent low dose BC pill, but be wary.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Do not go on this birth control!! This birth control Tarina fe 1/20 has cost me hundreds of dollars at the OBGYN because of a dry/clumpy bleeding problem after sex. My doctor didn’t know what it was so I had to spend money on tests and an ultrasound to find out everything looks great. Turns out it was my birth control. SWITCH! I would suggest if you don’t want that all over you and your partner (it’s embarrassing) I would very highly suggest you chose a different pill.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched from another low estrogen pill and have not had my period since switching. Haven’t missed a pill. Is this normal ...Also terrible mood swings zero sex drive

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started the Nortrel 1/35 birth control a week ago and have been nauseous ever since!!! I have no appetite, everything makes me nauseous. I have HORRIBLE mood swings and starting to get cystic acne. I was on depo shot in 2017 but got off after reading many horror stories. I decided on the pill because It was the safest form to me. Despite all the horror stories I can say my experience on depo wasn’t nearly as bad as being on the pills and definitely thinking about switching back!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Switched my birth control hoping to help my acne. I know it takes at least 3 months for the birth control to kick in but I couldn’t handle the side effects. I was on the Lo Loestrin Fe birth control for 4 weeks. I got a lot of breakouts around my chin. I popped a pimple on my cheek and it bruised. I didn’t even squeeze it that hard. I got really hungry when it was time to eat. I was in a bad mood every day. I’m a very sensitive person but the medicine made it worst. I cried about everything. I tried to stay on it longer but I had to switch. I was so depressed. I got swapped to aviane and have been taking it for 2 weeks now. My acne has cleared up. I don’t get hungry and my mood swings have stopped!

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I dont like this Microgestin 1/20 birth control at all. Since taking this med, my acne has gotten so bad. It doesn't make my face oily, but I am getting so much acne around my jawline and down my neck which is new for me. My skin just feels so gross! My boobs are also constantly swollen. I lack energy. I've been depressed. I haven't been myself! So happy that I finally realized it was this birth control, because I will never take this stuff again! Awful!!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had to be switched to Blisovi Fe after almost having a stroke on Loryna. My body already produces high levels of estrogen, so my doctor figured this would mitigate my symptoms. I’ve been using Blisovi Fe for almost two years, and the only symptoms I have are spotting and a little nausea—but only when I miss doses and have to double-up. Otherwise, my libido and mood have been unaffected, unless you count only having four periods or so a year. Everyone’s body is different—always talk to your doctor if you’re having side-effects.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took these pills for two weeks to regulate bleeding from my copper IUD, and it was a complete disaster. I didn’t experience any weight gain, but I was consistently nauseous and my clear face turned into a pepperoni pizza. I also experienced intense mood swings during my last three days on Nortrel. I would not recommend this birth control to anyone. I would rather deal with heavy and irregular periods than out the rest of my body through the gauntlet.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor gave me a 3 month sample of Lolo to help with period cramps. I guess it did help because I DID NOT GET MY PERIOD FOR THE FULL 3 MONTHS. I was already feeling a little "blue" before going on bc but Lolo made it 1000000x worse. I was depressed and in such a dark place. After the 3 months were up I switched to Alysena. I've only been on it for less than a month but I'm already seeing improvements in my mood. Lolo did make me gain a little bit of weight but I'm underweight so it was actually a plus for me. If you're feeling depressed or moody, I really recommend looking for a better birth control. I'm sure there is one out there for everyone.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So far it’s made me nauseous and light headed the whole time I’ve been using it. My first period was way heavier than normal (about five super tampons within 8 hours) and lasted nine days which is four days longer than normal. A week after my first period ended I had bleeding that was heavier than normal spotting and so far has been going on for four days. I know I need to keep taking it for my body to get used to it but I am DREADING it. My doctor says I need to use it for three more months before I can switch

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe 24 isn't my first birth control I've been on. I was on Lo Loestrin Fe for about 8 months, and always had irregular bleeding due to an ovarian cyst. Not sure if the birth control irritated it, or if it was there all along. Anyways, I've now been on Junel Fe 24 for about 3 weeks, and I love it. My acne has cleared up, and my cyst is gone!! Definitely don't think I'll be switching anytime soon. I haven't had anything but good symptoms from this birth control.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Junel for around 9 months now, but I've been considering switching because I have trouble remembering to take the pill. The BC cleared up my acne for the most part, and I don't really get sick feeling. It was easy to settle into, but I also get crazy mood swings and have been seeing a therapist to counteract this. My depression/anxiety have worsened, but at times they level out/or I reach extreme ḧigh. I have trouble taking it on time as I said before, which might also have something to do with the imbalance of hormones/mood swings. My breasts stay tender and have been for pretty much the past 9 months, and my periods range from nonexistent to very heavy and painful. I do feel tired nearly constantly, but again, I have other factors that could be causing this. My teeth and gums have a heightened sensitivity as well, not a fan of that, but I also have IBS and it is seemingly unaffected or worsened by this BC. I trust this medication despite some of the side effects.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 19 years old and have been on Junel 1/20 since I was 16 years old due to really heavy periods where I was bleeding through super tampons in 30 minutes. I thought I would share my experience since there seem to be a ton of bad reviews and wanted to shed some light. No side effects! Weight gain was zero. It has made my boobs bigger. Sex drive actually increased. no acne. I take the pill continuously due to my horrible periods and I never get a period unexpectedly. This is also a very low dose birth control that I was put on because high dose pills make me throw up so if you have that issue I suggest this medication! I highly suggest you give it a shot! I was so worried when I started it due to all the negative reviews but everyone is different and it doesn’t hurt to try because you can’t always change :)

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this birth control for over 2 years now and I LOVE it. I haven't had a period since I started taking this pill and I barely have any acne. The pill however did make me gain a few pounds but that's pretty standard for birth control. My insurance does not cover my birth control and luckily, this product is extremely affordable! I highly recommend this product.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It's honestly amazing for me. I used to get my period twice a month, horrible pain, heavy flow, and it was just the worst. I was hesitant to get on Birth Control but since I tired Lo Loestrin Fe  I only get my period once a month, less flow, some cramping but nothing compared to what it was before. Yes, I did feel nausea for the first or two months but that was it, I didn't gain weight, my body had to adjust to it so I did break out a little but now I don't really have breakouts at all.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill has treated me well the past 29 months. First month was rough with my body getting used to it (I bled every day), but after that, there were no issues. Some months, I barely even get a period. I do cramp more on Taytulla, but I never experienced cramps outside of birth control, so I guess my body is just different in that way. They're not horrible cramps though. I am only discontinuing because I don't have insurance anymore, so I'm not spending $200 on a brand name bc pill.

Larin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have used this bc for over 10 years. I am almost 33 years old. I have never had a pregnancy scare. Always had my menstrual cycle on time to almost the second. Biggest problem for me is my incredibly terrible Melasma ( face skin discoloration)  I've had problems with for years now. Absolutely have a hard time getting vcd rid of it maybe its permanent? I just got out of the hospital for a heart attack with a small blood clot in my heart due to smoking and taking this medicine. I've discontinued medication because of it.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Not worth it for me with the side effects. Constant headaches, mood swings and depression, heavy bleeding and clots from half dollar to golfball in size, accompanied by painful cramps. Made me feel wiped out and killed my sex drive. My doctor put me on a lower dose birth control pill but I’ve still had constant bleeding and clots for the past two weeks.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have PMDD, this did not work for me and I only took it 5 days. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla  is my first birthcontrol pill that I’ve used. The first day I took it, I became VERY nauseated. The first two weeks were fine, my skin got a little better, not a lot of side effects. But then I started randomly bleeding, and it kept getting heavier and heavier. I have now been heavily bleeding for 5 days straight and there’s no sign that it’s going to stop. The cramps that go along with it have been terrible, and stopped me from being able to keep up with my usually gym routine. This pill also has made me cry nearly everyday this week, and I’m not usually an emotional person like that. This is possibly one of the worst decisions I have made to take it, and if I could give 0 stars I would. Absolutely awful side effects!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m on my 6th month on this pill. I’ve never been on birth control before and I can truly say I hate it.The side effects started with the worst breast tenderness. I couldn’t even lay on my side because my arm would make them hurt. Next, I began to gain 5 pounds a week. I worked hard before my wedding to look my best now my weight is 20 pounds up. I have seen mixed feedback on the correlation of birth control and weight gain. I truly believe the hormones have ruined my metabolism. The weight is in my hips and stomach. It has made me so upset.Worst of all is that this is my third period in 35 days. It’s extremely heavy and hurts tremendously. I am no longer going to take this pill and will be looking into a copper IUD.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was taking this pill for about 6 months and was liking not getting a period. Well turns out I was 6 weeks pregnant and had no idea. My husband and I had sex one time in that time frame- due to nursing and having an 18 month old in our room. I took the pill regularly before bed each night. BE CAREFUL!  We weren’t ready for a third baby already!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed this because because of ovarian cysts (2cm). Low dosage by the way. I was prescribed to use it for a 3 month course. First month everything seemed okay. By the second month, midway, I was having mood swings, very irritable and easily offended, migraines, tachycardia and insomnia. I’m not sure why I was having those side effects. So I stopped using it and I was fine. Decided to start the third card and had to stop because all the cyst symptoms came back. So I’m due to see my gyno to let her know that it’s not going to work. Need to try something else. I just endured my heavy bleeding and painful period. May try natural methods but praying I’m healed from this condition.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this birth control for about 6 months now & this is the first birth control I’ve ever been prescribed, & it has been a nightmare. Loestrin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Despite being a low hormone birth control, I have found a similar amount of side effects compared with other higher hormonal bc pill methods. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am constantly nauseous and in severe pain in my entire abdominal and lower back area. I have not had the weight gain mentioned in previous comments, probably because I am only able to stomach about a dozen bites of food a day for the past 5 months. I am now bleeding between 15-20 days a month, unable to eat, and having severe intense labour-like cramps every day. This medication is unsafe and must be immediately removed from all pharmacy shelves. I am stopping them immediately, no matter what supposed experts tell me. I know my own body, and I feel like I am dying because of a pill. I am not mentally unstable-just flabbergasted that it is still being given to women.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is pure TRASH I got brown spots all over my forehead insane cystic acne on my arms back and chin never had pimples ever. I went to see a dermatologist no answers for my acne until I saw my doctor and he realized what I was on I’m on day 5 off of it and got my period instantly my period has not been the same dark dark blood getting my period about 3x a month my first month on I bled for 3 weeks straight. HORRIBLE never taking ANY bc this one did it for me for good

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I hated Lolo. At first it was fine and I would get my period during the two placebo pills, but it did not help my cramps. They were still bad. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first time on birth control and I had an awful experience my acne came back and I had awful awful mood swings also my migraines got worse when I just fixed them. Another thing I gained 5 pounds in a month from this highly don’t recommend!!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill makes me have bad dreams every night along with mood swings on a daily basis. I don’t recommend it

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking Lo Lo for a year now to help with long, heavy periods. Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been switched over to this BC was previously on Kelnor. I’ve tried many in my day but this one really threw me for a loop. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):LOLO made me crazy. Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am on my second month of taking Junel Fe 1/20. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This medication has been great. I used to have heavy periods, terrible mood swings, and pre-menstrual cramping. Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started off on the lower dose and I hated it! It made me moody and I had lots of breakthrough bleeding. And the cramping is not bad at all compared to what I went through when I wasn’t on this pill. I’ve been on it for a very long time now and no pregnancies or terrible periods. Definitely works for me
Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):On the Larin Fe 1/20 it made me gain about 30 pounds in under two months and gave me horrible acid reflux, but at least I’m not pregnant.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Do NOT take this birth control. I’ve been having my period for a month ( which is normal when taking BC because it will eventually regulate) I have only been taking this for a month and a half. I have never been more depressed in my whole life. Crying three times a day. Extreme suicidal thoughts and fits of rage that I have never experienced. For some people it worked well, but I feel like it is a hit or miss. Definitely a miss for me. Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wanted to like this so much as I love how it has lower estrogen. First month was great, did have some heavy cramping on placebos but no period. I also had very heavy clear discharge through out the days, trouble sleeping, puffed veins and higher blood pressure.  I just feel like I wasted 3 months and now have to start on something with higher estrogen.  I used this to help my heavy periods not have multiple in a month. Hoping for better results.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Omg I wish I saw this before I went on this. I took birth control before never have I ever felt like this. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I do not recommend this pill, I am back on Lo Lo Esterin Fe with no issues. Taytulla gave me severe anxiety, panic attacks and depression which I had never had before. It stopped almost immediately after I ceased taking it.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When I started taking this medication, my period got crazy heavy to the point I almost passed out. I bled THROUGH a tampon AND thick panties! Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Got on this pill in January. It is almost August and I’ve had breakthrough bleeding nearly every month. Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):this is literally the worst BC I've ever been on. Ever. I have never experienced the worst mood swings/depression/anxiety before this pill. Do not take this.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this BC for almost two years and when I took it at the beginning I loved it! And I really don’t know what to do.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel FE 24 a little over a year ago when my Gyno recommended it to me after I complained about heavy, painful periods and acne. She told me it’s her favorite BC pill to prescribe, and I see why. This is the first BC pill I’ve taken, so I have nothing to compare it to other than horror stories I’ve heard from friends, but I quite like this one. I’ve had no issues other than some minor weight gain (less than 10 lbs), my periods aren’t painful anymore, and I haven’t had an acne breakout since I started taking it! I used to have a pretty irregular cycle - it was not unusual for me to go two or three months without a period - and while they only lasted 4-5 days, I’d bleed so heavily that I had to wear a bad as backup to a heavy tampon if I knew I’d be out for more than a couple of hours. Couple that with breakouts at every period, and cramps so painful it was hard to get out of bed, I needed a solution, and for me, it was this pill.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this birth control for 4 months.  First month was fine, then I started noticing that my sex drive was not as active as usual. (I usually have a pretty high sex drive). The second month I noticed a couple dark spots on my face that just came out of nowhere. Not too mention I am very aware of my skin, especially on my face.  I continued for the 3rd month thinking things would eventually go back to normal and my body would start feeling better. I was wrong! By the 4 month I noticed feeling very depressed and tired all the time. I am an active person, gym 4-5 times a week. My workouts just wasn't like it use to be, I was fatigued and I didn't feel like myself at all. The spots on my face got darker and bigger.  I decided to stop the pills and just deal with my cramping and heavy bleeding. After further discussion with my Doctor I have just decided to move forward with a Endometrial Ablation as I don't plan on having any more children. No more hormones for me!!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Gave me anxiety, made me break out, kept me up all night so I was exhausted in the morning, and made me gain a few pounds. I will be switching back to my previous birth control pill.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had a shaky experience with this birth control. Positives: no weight gain, anxiety, depression, or pregnancy Negatives: if I forget to take a pill I will start to spot and start my period within 8-10 hours of forgetting and my cycle will be messed up the rest of the month. I also have drastically noticed a decrease in my sex drive. Mood swings and hormonal acne are definitely still there before I start my period.  I’ve given this pill 6 months, time to try something new!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor told me to take birth control since I have extremely painful periods. I am 20 years old and have never taken birth control. I only took it for 3 days and immediately decided to stop. I did not experience any symptoms the first day. The second day I had mild anxiety however, the third day was insane. I had constant anxiety throughout the day, had exhaustion  and an extreme mood swing. I know it was because of the birth control because I have never acted like that in my life. I stopped taking it the next day and I am still suffering from anxiety. I have not been on the pill long enough to see long term effects but the anxiety is not worth it. I felt so out of control and so angry at nothing. I am glad people reviewed this birth control so I know I was not over reacting. Some women who reviewed this also said they experienced anxiety and had mood swings. Again, not everyone may experience this. Perhaps it’s a nice birth control to try but it is not the right one for me.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When I first started taking the pill I don’t notice nothing until a month later I start noticing my personality change I became real mean and low patience with my kids I new something was wrong I kept picking fights with my baby father over really small things like I should be taking bipolar meds or something I gained a lot of weight in my stomach area also I couldn’t really get sleep at night because I felt so depressed and stressed I will never prefer this birth control to no one all these side affects from one little small pill it’s not that serious just use protection

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Alyacen for 4 years to control heaving bleeding after pregnancies, my doc said it was the best BC at treating this. Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If I could rate this a 0 I would. My insurance stopped covering Kaitlib and I was going to have to pay $90/ month. Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This stuff is the worst. I was put on it to prevent ovarian cysts. But my hair is falling out, my acne is horrible, I have anxiety, insomnia, mood swings, crying spells, and dark thoughts. I’d rather just HAVE cyst ruptures honestly and they’re so painful. :( Be careful what you put in your body ladies.. I’d advise you avoid this BC at all costs.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I always had horrible periods that were very heavy and came with seriously bad cramps. Sometimes I’d be in so much pain I'd have to skip school and work. This pill helped A LOT for my period. After only a month it’s way lighter and my cramps are still there but basically non existent after what they used to be. BUT major downside is my change in mood. I have no motivation to do anything, and always grumpy. I can never pinpoint why. I'm almost 100% sure it’s because of this pill bc the mood I’m in every month is almost exact. The first week I’m fine. The second I’m crying all the time and in such a dark place. The next my temper is so short. Biggest downside and making me consider another option.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this for birth control. I didn’t read the reviews but just went with the recommendation of my doctor. I’m glad I did that so I wasn’t paranoid and looking to overanalyze everything. I had some abdominal pain week 1. My weight has remained steady. Appetite the same. No mood swings. Acne has improved but my skin is still far from perfect. Whenever I take the placebo pills my acne flares up again. But I can’t complain. So far so good!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I find this birth control good. You’re going to have side effects with every medication you’re just going to have to get over it. I have been on this birth control for 4 or 5 years now and I love it. After about a year or two my periods have stopped completely. I do have low sex drive but oh well just another way the birth control works is how I think of it. It will take time for your body to adjust. I recommend if there are a few side effect in the begining to just see if they stick around. It will take any birth control 6 months to a year to get used to your body. It’s free with my insurance.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):LOVE Lo Loestrin Fe. It stopped my period all together with all the pain that went with it. Yes, I did gain like 10 pounds but it went to all the right spots plus I have a pretty healthy lifestyle so it didn’t bother me. Birth control is going to make you gain weight there’s no avoiding that but it’s usually no more than 3-10 pounds, all bodies are different. I was 120 before birth control and now I’m slightly under 130 because I kept my healthy diet. I exercise regularly & stay on top of my shape. If you notice weight change FIX IT don’t complain.  The pill gave me some bigger boobs (32B-36B) which I’m not complaining about & some more booty. No headaches no cramps no nausea no nothing. I literally felt no change whatsoever with this pill. I love it and I wouldn’t change it.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was first on loestrin from March to June and I recently hopped on Blisolvi Fe 1.5/30  because I changed pharmacy and they didn’t carry my original. Since I’ve been taking this pill it’s good but not as great as Loestrin. I sometimes cramp and spot here and there which I am not used to. I still continue to have no period but it’s alright. No major weight gain or acne. It’s ok nothing really wrong with it but I do wish I had my old prescription.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on this pill for my low estrogen and it did the job but not without some unfortunate side effects. The first week I started taking it, my blood sugar would drop suddenly almost every day and I would almost pass out if I didn't sit down and eat something immediately. I have never had issues with blood sugar before in my life, and I have noticed it only happens when I am taking this pill. I also have horrible anxiety attacks and frequent heart palpitations, which has also never happened to me before. Regarding weight, I have found that I lost several pounds instead of gained (maybe the anxiety?). There are times I feel hungry no matter how much I eat, and other times I feel like I'm going to explode despite having eaten nothing at all. All in all, the pill did what it said it would and more...maybe another prescription is in order.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 32 and suffer from fibroids which give me heavy painful periods and very sore breasts, so my doctor prescribed me this pill. May I remind you I have been off any BC for almost 3 years but my periods have become unbearable. I have been on Lo Loestrin for about a month now and have just gotten my period for the second time this month. Only one week apart to be exact. The first month I had very mild spotting almost for 3 full weeks but it was bearable using a pantyliner. My first period on the pill was a dream compared to not being on the pill. I bled for 4 days and it stopped immediately when I started my new pack. I had high hopes for month two. I have bad cramps and also noticed I went up a cup size which I’m not thrilled about and my breasts are constantly sore and huge feeling. I am contacting my OB to see if I should continue. I have tried so many pills but they have all given me terrible side effects and heard this one didn’t. Fingers crossed my hormones even out!!!

Gildess Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):BEWARE! I wish I could give it no rating! The worst birth control I've used! I've never suffered from depression or anxiety but after about a month of using this I would have random panic attacks, outbursts, and cry myself to sleep! Everyone reacts differently to birth control but this was by far the worst!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Not for me. They say give it 3 months, but I have a heart condition so I decided to stop taking this pill and try another. I got chest pain/pressure and occasional breathlessness. I don't know if it's because it was affecting my heart or if these were side-effects from the anxiety I got on this pill. I have occasional anxiety, but being on this pill made me very anxious almost every day. I had a lot of spotting, but they say that's expected for the first 3 months. I also went from only being moody right before my period, to being moody almost all the time. I felt angry and emotional very often. The only pro FOR ME was that it made my usually very heavy periods become extremely light, which was awesome but not worth all the other side effects I experienced. Don't be scared if you were prescribed this pill, give it a shot but pay close attention to your body while taking it. Finding the right birth control can be very hit or miss and everyone is different.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just finished my first month on Junel Fe 1/20. So far the only side effects are lack of sex drive and no emotions. Which is not normal for me. I have had an increase in appetite but no weight gain. The first 3 weeks my breast were super sore but that went away. I only took 2 days of the iron pill just because it causes bowel issues for me. But my period has been crazy light and no cramps which is great. Probably not going to take it anymore just due to lack of sex drive and no emotions.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Tarina Fe 1/20 for lighter, shorter periods. So far, I've bled almost every day since I started taking this (2 months ago). I've noticed a bit of hair loss, eczema breakouts (which I haven't had this badly in YEARS), depression, mood swings, decreased sex drive, increased appetite and weight gain, and I can't sleep at ALL. I'm done taking this as of today, and I don't intend to touch it ever again! The only slight upside was I went up a bra size, but my chest hurts all the time now so that's a 50/50 win regardless. I would not recommend even trying this!

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on birth control since I’m 15 years old (now 23 years old) because of the chronic pain and bloating I would get on my periods not to mention the very heavy flow. I’ve been on 4 different pills. I was taking Necon for 3 years, which was my favorite pill. Unfortunately, my pharmacy said the manufacturers  were no longer making Necon and I had to switch to the generic brand of Nortrel. I’ve now been on Nortrel for about 2.5 years. I have only one complaint and it is a very crucial one... I receive HORRIBLE migraines. Other than that I react okay to the pill. My mood is fine. I don’t PMS. My flow is light. Periods last 3-4 days. I could say weight gain, but I’m not going to blame my overeating on a pill... that’s just me being unhealthy. As fast as I gain the weight, I can lose the weight so that’s the issue. It’s only those darn migraines. When they hit... they hit hard.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla has been super effective for me! I’ve tried dozens of birth controls and this is the first one that’s cleared my acne and given me regular periods! I wouldn’t say I’ve gained any abnormal weight, I’ve only grown in breast size which I’m okay with. But remember that this is a review personal to me, others say it’s the worst bc out there... every body is different and you shouldn’t rely on a website review to determine ur bc.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This Larin Fe 1/20 is amazing. I went on it because I have extremely bad cystic acne. I’ve only been taking it for 2 weeks and I notice a difference already. The only side effect I have is probably just mood swings. I was on Enskyce before this for about a year and it was the worst.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Most def would recommend! Been taking Blisolvi for about a year. I have no side effects, it actually has cleared my acne and I have had no issues with this BC. Additionally, it has definitely regulated my cycles.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):HORRIBLE!! My obgyn offered this to help regulate my irregular menstrual cycle- I have had to call off work for how bad my cramps were and how depressed and anxious I have been. I wasn't sure it was the pill till I googled the reviews. Kicking myself for not doing it before. I woke up last night gasping for air and in a sweat panicked and crying. Considered all my pills trashed!!!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Junel Fe when I was told to and I immediately experienced bleeding. I bled for a month straight before my cycle started straightening out. My sex drive was basically nonexistent after I started the pill and the mood swings were unlike anything I’ve ever experienced. I was extremely depressed and would go through fits of rage. Worst birth control I have taken.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never struggled with acne...until now.  Ever since starting this BC Pirmella 1/35  I have horrible cystic acne around my mouth chin and jaw line. I have also gained weight- despite my normal workout routine. I would not recommend.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill Lo Loestrin Fe for about a month. Before I started the pill I didn’t get my period for 4 months. After being on the pill for 3 weeks I got my period. I take the pill at the same time every day and I don’t have any crazy symptoms , I have been bleeding for 5 days so I’m waiting to see how long it last. But I have not suffered any wild symptoms! I do recommend taking the pill if you don’t like it you could always stop whenever. Remember not everyone will have the same symptoms so don’t get discouraged by what you see on here because when I first saw these reviews I was very scared to try the pill but I decided to do it anyways.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After the year or so I've been on the pill I've only had my period once. But it  has increased my sex drive.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After taking the 1st dosage, I happen to do research on the birth control pill and I read the reviews on this site. I was really scared to continue taking the birth control because of the reviews, but I'm happy that I continued. I am on week 3 of my 1st pack, and yo be honest, the only two things that I have experienced is very mild acne (and that was in the 1st week), and also after week 2, I began my period (taking the pill because of amenorrhea). I'm 36 years old and I've never had period cramps when I did have a regular period, but with this pill, I have mild cramps, and the flow is medium. My period usually lasts for 7 days, and I'm on day 5 just now starting with a medium flow after it's been really lite....so I'm not sure how long this will last. So far, no nausea or any sickness. I also have not gained weight. I'm generally a healthy eater so when hunger strike, I down some quinoa/kale and fruits and etc....

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT USE THIS ! Day three of using this birth control, my skin broke out into terrible red white heads. All over my face, the next morning I woke up to rashes all over my neck, if you want to save your face and sanity do not ever use this birthcontrol.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Loestrin for 3 months. During those 3 months, I developed horrible acne. I’ve never had issues with acne, so when I started getting huge breakouts that wouldn’t go away all along my chin and jawline, I wasn’t too thrilled. No matter what acne products I used, the breakouts would not go away. Additionally, this stopped my periods entirely. Before, I was taking the pill Junel, and I was having light, regular periods that indicated I wasn’t pregnant, which is always a relief. I had no way of knowing with this birth control since I never had a period. My face is starting to finally clear up after a month of being off of this pill, and I finally had my period again. I would not recommend this pill at all.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill is horrible! I’ve been feeling extremely dizzy to the point that I pass out. I’ve been really shaky and my ovary is killing me. To make it worse now I have been bleeding dark brown blood! Never take this poison!!!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for about 4 months now. It is the worst pill I have ever taken. The only positive thing about it is my periods last maybe 4 days and are very light. The negatives... I can't control my acne breakouts.. I have NO sex drive.. I have constant mood swings.. I feel like I'm a teenager again. I also have headaches and I have trouble staying asleep at night. It just makes me feel NOT MYSELF. I made an appointment with my gyno for a visit. I am never using this birth control again. I thought I was crazy but I read other reviews and I guess I have a lot in common with many others that have taken this pill before. Its horrible! I am grateful for those people that it helps but this is definitely not the pill for me.

Nortrel 0.5/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking nortrel for 6 years and have been the first contraceptive pills I have ever tried. I am 30 years old and have not had any problem or side effects. No weight gain at all. Probably the only thing would be a lighter period lasting 3 days but I won’t complain about that.
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this pill the only thing I don’t like is my periods come out of no where but that’s it

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I hated birthcontrol, I tried lutera before and made me go crazy, I had really dark  thoughts, I was miserable crying everyday and I had very short temper I was in my room all day crying. So I spotted after 3 weeks of use. And I refused to try any other birth control  until my doctor mentioned Lo Loestrin Fe. I was very scared of it but honesty I haven’t experienced any side effects on it at all and it made my period come back after few months of not it having it. And one more thing it cleared all my acne. Please guys give it a try and don’t listen to negative reviews.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the best pill that I have been on and have been on this more than 5 years. First of all a very low dose of estrogen, it helps with my peri menopausal symptoms and cysts on overies. There is no nausea, no weight gain, no moodiness, and I probably only get my period 2-3 times a year. I will say you must take at the exact same time everyday if you don’t you will definitely spot or risk bleeding. I just set my phone alarm as a reminder . I highly recommend this pill.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I absolutely hate it. Took it for 1.5 weeks and stopped because I was bleeding; and I still am. It’s been three weeks of bleeding now. I’m miserable. Mood changes (for the worst) Generally feeling more irritable than usual, probably because I haven’t stopped bleeding for three weeks. It’s not worth wrecking your body over. NEVER AGAIN.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Absolutely loved this birthcontrol Taytulla. I’m so sad my insurance no longer covers this medication anymore. The first two packs I did have spotting, anxiety and weight gain but after that I was back to normal with a healthier diet. I definitely recommend and I hope I can get back on this one ASAP

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve spent so much money on pregnancy tests because this birth control makes me feel pregnant weight gain boobs getting bigger , nauseous , body cramps , migraines and I have very light bleeding for only a days month  it scares me !

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Taytulla after I had my first child and it was good for about a month and then I started gaining a whole bunch of weight and I didn't know why. I did not eat much junk and I had a pretty balanced diet, but with all the weight gain my doc prescribed me a diet pill. It worked, but I never lost more then 10lb. Now my husband and I are trying to conceive and have been off the pill for 5 months, but I have not had  one period, no spotting nothing. I feel like this pill messed up my ovulation. Idk if that is even possible, but once I got off the pill I did lose some weight, but still no period.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am a perimenopausal mom of 2 teens and was having painful long periods with a lot of cramping. I'm in my early 40s and my doctor had me try this pill about a year and a half ago. I made it 5 months and got off of it. Pros...why I gave it a 4 out of 10 and not a 1. It did stop my painful cramps and shortened my period to about 3-4 days and was light. It also stopped my hot flashes and mild night sweats. Cons...my breasts grew 2 sizes within a couple months and hurt the whole first month. I put on 20lbs over 3 months. I have never had a weight issue in my entire life. I am 5'9" and an athletic build. I was the same size I was before I had my two kids until I went on this pill. I tried increasing my workouts and eating very healthy and couldn't lose a lb until I went off this pill. Dropped 10lbs right away. Took me months to lose the rest. I finally went in and had an ablation for my cramps and period issues and it was the best thing I ever did.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Was on this BC for 6 months, and it was the first pill I had taken for a long period of time. Cleared my acne miraculously, got a lot of comments about how clear my skin was! I did however gain a little weight (like 5lbs) and was incredibly moody. I don’t typically cry very often, but this medication made me burst into tears at the slightest thing. My periods became incredibly light and would last for a day if that. Never had any other issues.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this birth control  Alyacen for months now and like many commenters have had issues with weight gain and mood. I already suffer from depression/anxiety but my depression has been so severe after starting this birth control that I hardly move most days. Also, it did not occur to me until reading through these comments that my sex drive is almost nonexistent lately.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):These Tarina Fe pills are obviously different for everyone and everyones body takes it in differently. I’ve been on the pill for a year now and I’ve never had any real side effect other than depression and terrible anxiety. Recently I started to get irregular periods and I finally came to the conclusion that these pills are not it for me anymore. I felt like constantly crying and I was basically intolerable. I did drop weight easily and never really gained weight nor did I have acne but the bleeding really wouldn’t stop. I’m not gonna tell you to not try it but if you start to feel yourself depressed and distant please switch asap

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking birth control because my cramps were awful and my periods were very heavy. Junel Fe helped a lot with the cramps and made my periods much lighter, but it made me really depressed. I figured it was maybe just a rut, but it went on for a couple weeks and I realized something wasn’t right. I started to have awful mood swings and was crying at least once a day. This went on for a couple months and I ended up switching to a different birth control because the mood swings and depression were not worth it.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill was not a good fit for me. I experience many side effects that I have never experienced before, at least not like this. I was on Lutera before for three months, then used Junel for four months. Immediately after switching to Junel, my libido was basically non-existent. I was bloated all the time, and gained 5 pounds (even though I had been the same weight for almost 1.5 years). I was experiencing some mood swings in the evening, but not like when I was on Lutera. Junel claims to help with acne, but it did not help with my acne at all. While taking this pill, I experienced more acne than I had for like three or four years, but it did not affect acne to any extreme. I am switching to Ocella next week. Hopefully that will be a better experience.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill 5 months ago (I had an iud before) and at first I had minimal symptoms and my periods were very normal. Now I get super emotional and feel crazy. My breasts hurt really bad and I've noticed it gives me really bad anxiety. Not to mention my period just stopped, which was frightening to see because it was regular every month before.

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Absolutely horrible experience on this pill. I was previously on Loestrin and switched due to insurance purposes. This gave me HORRIBLE anxiety (no sleep, heart palpitations, shooting chest pain and numbing arm sensations). To the point I went and got an EKG due to concern - the anxiety symptoms significantly subsided once I was off the pill. Would not recommend

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When I took the first pack of Microgestin Fe 1.5/30  I was very nauseous, had tender breasts, and gained extra 10 lbs, which was great since I used to weigh 95 lbs! I also had spotting and had heavy bleeding more towards the afternoon for over a month. I was a bit concerned but after that my periods have been light, cramps have been light as well & I have a regular period! As for a year using it, I enjoy it! I may have a few times of the month with nausea, but I'm sure it's due to sometimes of taking it too late later that day. I have some sad moments which are 2x a month so its minimal. I'm still at the same weight that I gained. I rarely have those intense side effects it claims. Every body is different though, but definitely give it six months to fully see how it works for you.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Initially wanted a tubal ligation/hysterectomy because I have extremely painful endometriosis in addition to the fact that my partner and I are set on never having kids. The gyne didn't believe my resolution and insisted upon this pill. I took it for about a year and 1/2. At first cleared up my acne and mitigated period pain. later, towards the one year mark it worsened my acne to the point where I'd wake up every morning with at least 1 new pimple. My depression also worsened so much I almost had a suicide attempt (never attempted in my life prior to taking this pill) and experienced mild psychosis. I'm not saying this will happen for everyone, Lo Loestrin Fe has obviously worked for some people. This is just my experience.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill back in 2016. I mainly took it to control heavy and painful menstrual bleeding. From the beginning the warning signs were there (migraines, swelling in my hands and feet) but nothing that alarmed me to see my doctor. Fast forward to now and I have been in a depressive episode for about 2 weeks

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this when i was a senior in high school (17 1/2 years old). I had no problems until about a year later. I have been constantly tired, my muscles have been twitching, I cry over everything, and I have no sex drive. At 19 years old, I’m coming up with excuses to not have sex with my boyfriend. It’s horrible. I thought I was going crazy until I read these comments and I’m glad to know it’s just this birth control. I’m definitely talking to my gyno about switching next month when I go.

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I started taking these and they were fine. I didn't have any complaints and then the 2nd week in I started bleeding everyday, I felt bloated and weak all the time. Had absolutely no energy. They haven't changed my mood at all and have also cleared up my skin, but I wouldn't recommend.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Okay so.. despite all of the negative reviews I wanted to be yet another positive review for those who are unsure whether to try this birth control or not. Here’s the thing, and you’ll hear this over and over... everyone’s bodies are different. So don’t just go by someone else’s experience! I followed this motto and for that reason I’ve actually tried this birth control and I couldn’t be happier! I mean I am pretty much on day 7 now and I haven’t felt any of the symptoms people say. Before I started this bc I was on Yasmin and then Reclipsen. Which I didn’t realize had higher doses of estrogen in them which is probably why my body didn’t like it as much. Unfortunately these gave me leg cramps and sensations in my hands :( however they might work for others! Anyways, still early days on Blisovi and I’ve been symptom free. I’ll keep y’all updated on this journey which I’m sure will be a blast x

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):On Microgestin Fe 1/20 Absolutely horrible! Mentally, I was a complete wreck and struggled to feel happy or excited for anything. I was depressed and upset 24/7 and would get angry for the dumbest reasons. I felt so hopeless, I lost interest in everyday tasks/activities. I broke out like crazy on my chin and have always had clear skin. I thankfully switched to Junel FE which has been great.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have an unlimited appetite and struggle to feel full. As long as I limit what’s on my plate (aka portion sizes) and exercise often, weight gain is not an issue. I’ve experienced minimal weight gain (less than 1 lb/month). Skin is clearer than it’s ever been. No mood swings. Overall, I’m impressed with Junel. Very effective contraceptive! Microgestin was a nightmare for me and did horrible things to my body. Happy to have switched!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill for almost two years. I have had daily headaches! It improved my periods (used to be very heavy and very painful) but some months I wouldn't have a period and every once in a while I would have a heavy few days. I weight 115 pounds when I started this pill and now I weight 150 pounds. The weight gain was fast and all in my stomach so people often ask me if I'm pregnant. I had excessive hair loss on this pill as well. So embarrassing! I have been off of this pill for about a week (and I didn't take the last week of 'sugar' pills)  now and my face has broken out on my chin, my hair is no longer falling out in clumps, no headaches since quitting, and my weight has gone down 2 pounds.
Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):No problems. It reduced my periods and cramps, worked effectively as birth control, and I didn't experience any side effects.
Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this birth control. I haven't struggled with any side effects and it greatly reduced the flow of my period and cramps.
Melodetta 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m on this Melodetta 24 and getting pain from taking this. I’m going to go to the hospital because I shouldn’t have stomach pain from this

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Lo Loestrin Fe nearly landed me in the hospital.I tried LLF for one week. Turns out that my body is extremely sensitive to estrogen changes, but I did not know this until AFTER LLF put me in essentially a crisis situation. After about a week of taking LLF, I started to experience EXTREME anxiety, 0-100% suicidal thoughts out of nowhere, and bizarre paranoid thoughts. I have always had some moderate anxiety issues, but NEVER any problems like this until I had started LLF. I felt nauseous and couldn't eat/sleep properly for days. I had to go under close watch of my OB/Gyn and a psychiatrist as they switched me off of these meds, and I was almost hospitalized because of it. All in all, it took me 2 weeks to get the med out of my system and MONTHS of multiple anxiety meds to bring my anxiety levels back to normal. The whole experience was scarring and it took a long time to recover from it-- stay away!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started this pill and immediately began bleeding for 2 weeks straight.. Bled through my vacation and also was passing large thick blood clots almost like skin. My cramps increased and overall, I do not recommend. I am still bleeding.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking lo loestrin for just under a year now. It didn't give me nearly as many side effects as NuvaRing. Besides occasional hot flashes, I've had a good experience taking lo lo. My one concern is that I've only had 2 or 3 periods for an entire year. I'm not sure if that's normal.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this Blisovi 24 FE after Minastrin became unavailable on my insurance. Previously, I was on Loestrin 24 FE and all of these birth controls have had the same effect. I used to have extremely heavy periods without bc and now I almost don't have a period at all. Seriously no negative side effects, no weight gain, acne, etc. I'm surprised to see such negative reviews.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Junel for about 6 months and did not have a good experience. I had been taking Microgestin which I loved and my insurance company switched me to Junel. Microgestin cleared my acne, no noticeable mood swings and did it's job at preventing pregnancy. With Junel, I noticed a huge increase in general irritation with everyone and everything. I also started to become angry much more easily than ever before. I started to gain quite a bit of weight in my stomach and my acne started to come back. Junel is effective at preventing pregnancy, but the side effects are not worth it for me. I have already switched to a different form of birth control in the last few weeks and I feel much better. I feel much more calm and more like myself emotionally. If you have the option, I'd go with Microgestin instead.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have tried numerous birth controls over the past couple years, I had a problem where I would be on my period for 3 months straight off for a month or so then my period would come again for another straight three months and birth control is the only help. Junel Fe has been wonderful for me, my periods are short and light and at most they last for four days, no side effects at all this has worked wonderful for me.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Birth control is different for everyone. Been on this for a few months and no noticeable changes in weight or acne. Only issue is if I forget to take it for a day or two, I’ll spot for the next few days.Maybe the only side effect is more depressed mood and increase in headaches but that could also be attributed to changes in life style. Hard to tell.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I went on Junel Fe for about 1-2 years after my insurance no longer covered Lo Loestrin. I have PCOS and this was recommended by my OBGYN. I experienced some side effects such as nausea and stomach aches. The overall experience was okay, it did the job and made my periods lighter and less frequent. I ended up switching back to Lo Loestrin when my insurance covered it again.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed junel fe to regulate my periods, so I could try and get pregnant next year. I have very heavy irregular periods and they last for 2-3 weeks. The first few days were okay. I went to the gym on day 3 and afterwards I had anxiety that ended up becoming a full on panic attack. I went to the hospital because I thought I was dying. Doctors ran tests and said I was fine but to follow up with doctor. I've had anxiety and depression since. I went to the doctor who prescribed me antidepressants and said that might be my birth control but I should try to stay on it until my body adjust. It's been 3 weeks and I'm almost done with my first pack and I can't  do this anymore. I'm so depressed, I can't even do my job. I've also started my period already before I finished the pack and it's super heavy. I really don't recommend this birth control.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was diagnosed with PCOS at age 15 and was recommended by my OBGYN to take this birth control pill. I did experience mild nausea in the adjustment period but the symptoms did go away. I’ve been using it for over 5 years and it seems to work for me. My periods are very light and some months I don’t get one at all.
