I also tried Junel Fe for a brief period (when my insurance stopped covering Lo Loestrin) and I tried the Nuvaring as well, but this pill was still the best option that I have tried.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst birth control on the planet. I experienced every negative side effect immediately after starting it (nausea, headaches, bloating, fatigue, complete brain fog, dizzy, horrible cystic acne), and now, after deciding to completely quit it 4 months later due to these side effects, I got diagnosed with a DVT. A freaking BLOOD CLOT in my leg, after being on this for only 4 months. And, after reading other reviews, it doesn't sound like I am the only one who has experienced this. Hundreds of dollars later for tests and medication, now I have to take blood thinners for 3 months. STAY away from this mediation!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Taytulla for a few months. It's a good birth control. I get some nausea from this medicine I believe. Sometimes if I'm not expected to smell food it smells really nasty to me. I believe that has to do with the nausea side effect, however it's not extreme. It's been good for preventing pregnancy. I used to have bad acne and heavy periods. My acne has cleared up completely and my periods are very light. One month I'll have a light painless period and the next month I'll have a light painful period it just depends. My flow is always light. I gained some weight, not much but noticeable. I was 115 pounds now I stay around 120. Other than the slight nausea I feel good. I used to be on Junel Fe and I had to switch to Taytulla because I was having 2 periods a month on Junel for over a year. I only have one period a month of Taytulla lasting 4 days and sometimes I skip a month... Its ok if you miss one period.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill for almost 1 year. It’s the first BC pill I’ve ever taken and it regulated my periods. I used to only get my period about 6-8 times a year and this pill helped with that. I took it every day on time and it’s very effective at preventing pregnancy. I didn’t get any bad side effects which is great. I did however gain 10 lbs and I’m not complaining because I needed it and now I’m at a steady weight. I just switched to Junel Fe and now I’m sad because Microgestin changed my life and made me feel more confident.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on this for about 5 years. Never have had any problems or side effects. It’s effective for hormone regulation and birth control. Never have been on any other birth control.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm almost done with my third month on Lo Loestrin Fe. I'm going to first start by saying that I'm so grateful for this pill because my body doesn't do well on a high dose of estrogen. Before I switched to LoLo, I was on the pill Sronyx and that stripped away my sex drive for a good year. But since I've started taking this new pill, my sex drive has been relatively normal.I took a break from birth control for about a month and my face broke out like crazy. But once I started taking LoLo it basically completely cleared up my acne. I've never seen my face get so clear in such little time. I also haven't had weight gain on this pill. The only thing I haven't liked is spotting. But I assume the reason why I'm spotting is because my body is going through an adjustment period and my bodies not used to the lower amount of estrogen from being on a higher dose before. Hopefully it'll go away with time.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on the lower dose of this and had spotting which is why I was prescribed this higher dose. I still had spotting and am now on a different pill that has been working so much better. On this pill I did feel a bit sad, had a lot of mood swings, and had a lot of bloating that completely went down once I stopped this pill. I also had no change in my acne. I wouldn't really recommend this pill. A pharmacist told me that this is an older generation pill and that there are newer pills on the market that don't cause these side effects and I have found that to be true!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have tried regular birth control in the past but it has always made me extremely angry to the point of having violent images. Just.. not okay. Blisovi Fe does not give me those side effects. So far, finishing up my first pack, I haven't had any side effects. My PCOS abdominal pains are incredibly lightened and I haven't had any breakouts or tummy issues.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first two months were okay.  Spotted a week before my period everyday but I expected that. Third month was by far the most terrifying experience of my life. I started my period before I got to the placebo and once I got to the placebo I started getting a handful of clotted chunks of blood on top of a heavy flow that was filling up a pad and a tampon every twenty minutes. I called the emergency line to reach my doctor but she was in surgery. The nurse I spoke to told me to go to the emergency room asap. Anyways, I survived month 3 and I'm hoping my body will adjust to it eventually.

Norinyl 1+35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill is AMAZING for me. Barely any acne, periods only go for 2 days and are light and regular, doesn’t affect my libido. I have been so mood affected by the other stuff I have tried and Norinyl 1 +35  does not affect my mood at all, only a little pms once a month. I just feel good! Also its only $13.50 for 4 months.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am very sensitive and frequently have issues with medication, but I have had no side effects whatsoever with Blisovi. In fact, I have had a ton of really great benefits which may or may not be due to the medication. I was concerned about weight gain on the pill but managed to go from 130 to 110 lbs in just a few months (obviously due to lifestyle/eating changes but weight loss was super easy and not hindered by the pill). My skin also cleared up nearly 100% within a few months of going on the pill. I used to have really bad acne on my face, neck, back, and chest, and it is GONE now. I used to have to wear heavy Kat Von D foundation and concealer just to cover up acne but I have stopped wearing makeup altogether now and literally do not new foundation at all. My periods and related symptoms are also NONEXISTENT. I never have to wear more than an ultra light liner for a day or two now.

Loestrin 21 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took one month of this pill and immediately broke out with acne worse than I’ve had in years. I also had early breakthrough period for days. Going back to my other brand.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):All birth control has to be given at least a couple of months for the side effects to subside. KEEP THAT IN MIND! At first, I felt nauseous for the first week or so right after taking the pills but it subsided. I felt my body adjusting hormonally each day the first couple of weeks or so. My mood adjusted as well especially during the first period on the pill I cried so much ! I’m fine now after two months, I get a very light period, I get a little moody during my period but not as much as I used when I wasn’t on birth control.Birth control prevents pregnancy and side effects should be expected, wait them out. Everyone’s experience is completely different. Vitamin B has helped with mood and energy too as recommended by my doctor.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This medication was given to me as a generic for Cyclafem.  The first few days were fine but after that I've cried, been moody, fought with my fiance, felt angry, depressive, and generally moody.  I have taken birth control of different varieties for ten plus years and would NEVER recommend this medication.  It has gotten to the point where I asked my obgyn to get me off of it as soon as this pack runs out.

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on many different birth control pills (Linessa, Diane-35, Yasmin, Lolo, Orthocyclen, Alesse, Seasonale, Trinessa) and this pill was by far the worst. I have endometriosis and this made my pelvic pain UNBEARABLE. I also have a litany of mood disorders and this made me feel blunt and emotionless one moment, and then extremely depressed, and then insanely angry the next moment. I've never had a birth control create such violent changes in me, and I've been on various BC pills for upwards of ten years. I felt like myself the day after I stopped taking it. That being said - BC works differently for everyone.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worked in that I didn’t get pregnant.But came with weight gain, headaches, loss of sex drive, and moodiness/depression.  These came as a gradual onset so it took me a while to figure out the cause.  But I just stopped taking it a few days ago and already noticed I feel better.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS MEDICINE, if you do and experience side effects such as nausea, unstable moods, depression, low to NO sex drive, constantly fatigued, constant yeast issues, brain fog, and your Dr. tells you it has nothing to do with the birth control and recommends  you staying on it,  and  also blames the side affects on something else and sends you for blood work after blood work all while getting PERFECT results back.  GET A DIFFERENT DR AND STOP TAKING THIS BIRTH CONTROL IMMEDIATELY. I stupidly trusted my Dr. for YEARS when she told me it was impossible these side affects are from this birth control. When I finally got the sense to just do the research myself it was clear as day that this IS the reason I have been experiencing the side affects mentioned above to the point where it has been noticeable to my family and friends.  I have stopped taking this birth control and cannot wait to see the improvements.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on and off birth control now for two years. I first tried Mylan which is a brand of Yasmin. I never gave the pill the full three months because of how depressed I constantly felt. I started taking Lo Loestrin Fe almost a month ago and so far haven’t had any symptoms of depression, acne, weight gain, or breast enlargement. I take the pill every day at the same time and so far I have only noticed some inconsistent bleeding in between my last period and my next scheduled period. Other than that, which is normal, I am enjoying Lo Lo!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Wow!  I can’t believe the bad experiences.  I’ve been taking this for a long time.  I started it because of endometriosis and not birth control as I had my tubes tied after my second child.  This has helped to control my cysts.  I am a very active person and watch what I eat.  I have a tendency to be heavy and this hasn’t affected my weight.  In fact, with activity and calorie control I have lost a lot of weight since starting this medicine.  I of course don’t thank the medicine for that, I contribute that to exercise and food intake, but what I’m saying is that the meds didn’t make me gain weight.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the first birth control I’ve been on and it is HORRIBLE. Would never recommend to anyone for any reason. My anxiety is at an all time high and my migraines are worse.I’ve also become more depressed by the day. Awful awful mood swings. Totally not worth it. Don’t try it!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Obviously with birth control pills you need to find one that's right for you so what's right for some might not work for everyone. That being said, don't be scared off by a lot of the negative reviews. I got on Blisovi Fe 1/20 to skip my period and it does the job nicely. Aside from spotting in the first month, I've been period-free. I've been on another pill before, I don't remember what it was called but I have never experienced any negative symptoms with that one or this pill either. No break-outs, no weight-gain, no extra hair in odd places, and I haven't gotten pregnant either. Aside from not having a period, literally nothing has changed for me.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was given this prescription to help with VERY mild acne at the time, but mostly to help with my irregular cycle and unusually long periods. The first month I was taking this my period lasted about 4 or 5 weeks after, much longer than the usual week/week and a half. I also noticed how my acne specifically on my chin and jawline worsened, which was disappointing as I was sure this pill would help get rid of my acne not make it worse. My cramps are terrible around this time, and my breasts hurt so much it’s nearly unbearable. I am 4 months in and I am never taking this again, the only good thing about this is that after the first period the rest are short and regulated. Would not recommend this to anyone unless you can put up with the pain and cramps and acne.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I read the reviews on Junel Fe 1/20  last year and got nervous, so I decided not to take it. After a false pregnancy scare, I finally went on board with trying it. I took it for two weeks and I got horrible acne (although I did have to stop my acne medicine, but when I forgot to take it occasionally anyways my breakouts were not this bad), felt more irritated, still have no sex drive, and I think it made me depressed, but I also had a stressful situation prior with my bf, so not sure which it was. I was on it for 2 weeks and a week and a half into the active pills I got a period which was still like another week and a half till the sugar/iron pills so I don't know what was happening. I got off it and hope to return to normal soon.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the fourth birth control I’ve been on and I do not recommend this to anyone. While taking this BC, I started to get extremely bloated, nauseous, had constant migraines, and I was extremely emotional about everything. I also caught myself slipping into a depression, I had high anxiety, and lacked all motivation. I have zero history of depression and anxiety so I really didn’t know how this felt. I have naturally low blood pressure and I would wake up or go throughout the day and my blood pressure would sky rocket. I truly have nothing positive to say about this BC. Look into other BCs if you’re going to get onto one or onto a new one.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Any company that has no customer service or contact information is usually a red flag and something we should have regarded. Seems to be nice alternative to other products, but the price is ludicrous. It costs less to raise a child than to take this medication for prevention.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel Fe 1/20  for about a year. I haven't gotten a period in that entire time. Some spotting here and there but never a full-blown "it's that time of the month" period. I started getting horrible headaches as soon as I started this pill. I recently stopped taking this pill in May (because I wanted to regulate my cycle again and get my period/ also start trying to get pregnant) and yet to have my period come back and its almost July. I've read that sometimes it can take upwards to a year for your period to return. Junel Fe 1/20 worked in that I didn't get pregnant, it moderately controlled my acne and I didn't have any weight gain with it. But now my period isn't coming back seemingly anytime soon now that I'm off the pill and that concerns me. I will not return to using this even if I consider going back on the pill. Everyone's body is different and reacts differently to medications, but I suggest trying another brand of birth control before this one!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am getting married! I am very self conscious of weight gain, side effects, and making sure everything falls into place. I have no need to take the pill until a month from my wedding, but I thought: I’m introducing hormones into my body I know I will have side effects. How I handled taking it: 1. I take it at night before I sleep (I still feel side effects because it happens) 2. I drink water 3. I keep a diary!!! My entry of the first seven pills;I started taking Taytulla on June 17th. The most common side effect I had was headaches. I had a little nausea, I noticed after my fifth pill I did have ovary pain. I didn’t gain weight during the first week- I lost weight because I’m trying to! I went down two healthy pounds! My first week was a success!Today I began my second week of Taytulla. I still have my diary of small entries of how I react so I plan to continue this so I can update you! My measurements are 29-26-34 for reference and my weight is 113!

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill has been great for my forever long, heavy, peri menopausal periods.  I’ve been taking them for over a year (started them at age 46) and other than making my breasts tender I have no complaints.  My very light period shows up every couple of months and lasts about three days.  Doctor said this was normal for low dose pills.  I’m hoping to be able to take these until I hit menopause.  I sleep better and am much more pleasant to be around.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First two months were awesome! Just finished the third month and have been bleeding for two and a half weeks. Very hopeful that month four will be better.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe 24 is a good birth control have a ton of discharge but thats pretty much it.I get barely any bleeding now, versus before my periods were 5 days and heavy.No crampsNo acneSo far no babies but we pull out tooI love it

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for 2 years and I am so glad I saw these reviews. I’ve suffered with unprompted anxiety, but I always thought it was normal. I have gained weight, my acne around PMS is absolutely horrible, my back hurts, and the nausea is so hard to manage. I will never be taking this pill again. Please listen to the reviews and know you aren’t going crazy!!!

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was taking a different brand for 25 yrs, it helped my PCOS symptoms and for general birth control. My pharmacy ran out of the other brand and switched to Primella 1/35 as a substitute because the dosage was the same. 4 months into taking this medication I have landed in the hospital with a massive DVT in my leg.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was originally on Junel but my pharmacy changed it to Blisovi. I figured all would be fine since it should basically be the same thing just generics of each other. Well, I was wrong. So wrong. I only took it for a month because of how sick it made me. Constant nausea to the point if dry heaving. Headaches which of course did not help the nausea. I wanted to try to give it a month but I couldn't take the last two active pills because I was so sick. The day after I stopped taking it, I felt about 80% better. And two days after I stopped, I felt 100% normal. I will never recommend this to anyone. I know every person is different but this was the worst experience I've ever had in my 12 years of taking birth control.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel Fe almost 2 months ago now & I would never recommend it to anyone. Ever since starting it I feel so depressed. It’s become a daily thing for me to get overly irritated and lash out at everyone around me and cry about absolutely nothing. My mood swings are horrible, the times when I am in a good mood are short lived and right back to feel sad and unmotivated. I have never had any major acne problems my whole life, now I break out pretty often. Already in the short amount of time I’ve started this birth control I’ve gained a lot of weight all in my stomach area and cannot lose it from working out either, not to mention that I’m 19 years old and have the sex drive of a 70 year old. Everyone’s body reacts to things differently but I really wish I would have came here and read most of the other reviews before starting this pill, would have really saved me from going through all this.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Microgestin for about a year after trying 3-4 different birth controls. It was perfect, it regulated my period, got rid of my acne, and worked well as a birth control. One day I picked it up, and found out that I had been switched over to Blisovi since my pharmacy did not carry microgestin any longer. I asked if I could have some ordered and wait for more, and the pharmacist told me that I could not switch back. I have been on Blisovi since this past October and have gained 45 pounds. I have immense migraines and really heavy periods every 2 weeks, that last a week or longer. I have tried everything to shed the weight but nothing has worked. On top of that, my anxiety (which is another condition I am being treated for) has been at least 10 times worse. Do not let your pharmacist switch you. Everything has changed and gone so badly since I got switched.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this BC for a year now . Everything started out what seemed to be okay . Then things slowly started to get worse . My mood swing had changed tremendously , I had no motivation to do anything . I had never had depression in-till I tock this BC along with panic attacks . I also seemed to lose all sex drive and I’m only 22 . I don’t recommend taking this BC  . I didn’t do me any favors what so ever .

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve have been on Junel 1/20 for about six months. I was on Aviane which I really liked had no complaints. I got a new doctor who switched me to Junel (no at all the same)  I had a really heavy period for the full 7 days for the first month. After that haven’t had a period since. Which is my favorite thing about it. The only side effect I’m experiencing just recently is vaginal dryness, even when I’m in the mood. Which is a bummer cause I haven’t experienced that till now.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my 5th month being on Junel Fe. At first, I got nausea and my doctor told me to take at night with a snack which helped a lot. Not getting nausea anymore. My periods are so much lighter but sometimes longer. I had no other side effects from this medication.  Everyone's body reacts different to meds so do not listen to others until you try it. I am going to continue taking it and hopefully it will help me get through perimenopause because my periods were awful before taking this. I couldn't walk without blood pouring out of me. I recommend this pill.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have Stage III endometriosis and have had two surgeries in two years. I was put on Nortrel continuously for the past few years and never had endo symptoms, no sore breasts, no period or spotting, and overall didn’t feel emotional or anything. Unlike most here my pharmacy gave me Necon saying it’s the same (it is the generic).. even though the binders aren’t. And I had two weeks of sore breasts and just started my period for the first time in two years. Terrible pain and issues. So I would take anybody’s opinion with a grain of salt, even mine. It fully depends on how your body metabolizes ALL of the ingredients not just the active ones! Ratings on medications can only get you so far without trying it, unfortunately.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The Blisovi Fe 1/20 pill is absolute garbage. In the first few days of taking it and I've already gained 4 pounds. I have head aches every night so far and feeling super sick to the point of wanting to throw up. In the evenings my mood swings have been ridiculous!!!! My PMS weeks are usually bad and like this is my first week on this pack and it feels like I am going through PMS. I suggest switching. I'm already done with this pill after I finish this pack. Thanks for the unnecessary anxiety ,depression and weight gain. No thanks.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched from Tarina Fe to Microgestin after starting to see a new doctor. This doctor told me the two brands were generics of each other ie. comparable. I had zero problem on Tarina multiple years. This new pill gave me SEVERE side effects. I was on it for 5 months and started having side effects immediately. I was always bloated, gained weight, broke out, had drastic mood changes, abdominal pain, no periods and consistent yeast infections which was new to me. Finally I just couldn’t handle it anymore I stopped taking it. I had stabbing pain in my uterus for about a week while detoxing the pill. It’s been 5 months off and my body has had a tough time readjusting. My periods are still inconsistent and my hormones are trying to balance themselves out. My mom had issues on this pill too, severe headaches that were a sign of a near stroke. Thank goodness she went to the doctor just in time and got off the pill and is feeling better now. I DO NOT recommend this pill to ANYONE.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this medication since I was 15. I had awful and very long periods and had to skip a lot of PE class at the time because of it being so bad. I eventually started this medication and the problems immediately went away within a few weeks of taking it. I’ve always had anxiety and weight issues so I attributed it to my family history and my own history, not the medication. Everyone has their own risks but I think I’m much happier on this pill than I would be without it. The only think I notice is that I only get my period if I’m with new people or under stress. Otherwise I don’t get any spotting or bleeding for months. I also am not sexually active so the bleeding was more of a worry for me. Everyone reacts differently to medications and just because someone doesn’t rate a 10, doesn’t mean it doesn’t work for you.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Necon in my 20s and had no issues.  I just restarted last week, but I am 47 now.  I thought I was just having a bad week, but my moodiness is awful.  Extreme anger and frustration over the littlest things.  Sleeping only 2-3 hrs a night and that's with the help of benadryl, melatonin, and ambien.  Gained 5 pounds.  No motivation to work out.  Craving carbs and naps.  I need to stop taking this med and see what happens.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS! This was the WORST medication I have ever been prescribed and I have been prescribed A LOT! Within 1 week on this pill my mood swings were horrible, I had to move a chair into my bathroom because I was throwing up and retching so bad from it, I had to sit down. After the 2nd week I became beyond depressed and suicidal thoughts were non stop! Even in my darkest days of depression I have NEVER felt so completely devastated by life. I immediately stopped it and went back to Lo Loestrin, even tho my insurance doesn't cover it! Within 36 hrs of being off the pill I returned completely to normal!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took my first pill before at night and after 2 hours of taking it, I started to feel dizzy. I could not sleep very well that night either. The next day (about 12 hrs later) I got diarrhea, and had really bad nausea and migraine. It caused me to vomit all day long. I couldn't eat or drink anything without throwing it up. I was getting dehydrated and I had to go to the ER later that night to get fluids. I'm never taking this again!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on Junel to for endometrosis.  My period was regulated and didn't think I had any side effects for a while.  In 2016 I started having dizziness and would go blind in one eye each time a spell came on.  I had a racing heart and sweats and  was diagnosed with vertigo and was sent for  rehab but the therapist said it didn't seem like vertigo to him.  In 2018 I had a major heart attack out of the blue. No cholesterol issues, BP was always normal. I had a heart cath and  a ruptured artery and 2nd heart attack during the procedure leading me to emergency  heart surgery. I had respiratory failure and was  on a breathing machine until next day. The dr said my arteries looked good and speculated it was a clotting issue.  The hematologist came in and asked me how long I had been on Junel and told me she had seen cases like mine from Junel.  I have a lot of heart damage that I'm told will never be healed. I'm on a medication trial right now to see if I can avoid a defibrillator.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL!! I have been on this pill for 2 1/2 weeks because my pharmacy thought it necessary to send me the generic version of the already generic birth control pill my script was written for (Junel). I have gained weight, been bloated, broken out, had anxiety everyday, had severe cramping and nausea. The bloating, cramping and nausea started well before 10 days prior to due date of my period.  I have since called my dr and gotten him to correct the pharmacies ridiculous requests and am going back on Junel which IMO was great. I am currently 4 1/2 months pp and am using this as a form of birth control so I do my all these unnecessary side effects. Terrible medication.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Although it has made my periods very light, it has caused weight gain. Even going to the gym 3-5 times her week and having an active job has not helped.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the first birth control I’ve been on, and from the first 2 pills I took, I knew that this wasn’t going to work out for me,, but I continued for 2 packs. Yes, it did help my bloating, but my periods were still painful, my once clear skin broke out like never before, and my anxiety sky-rocketed and I got several anxiety attacks throughout my use of this pill. I went through two packs but I knew I had to stop, I have now switched to Gianvi for help with the acne, which THIS pill gave me. I would NOT recommend this to anybody.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe 1/20 is the first birth control I am trying ever. I started it in the beginning of March. I used to have cramps that would have me throwing up and all that jazz. This helped with it, I will still occasionally get cramps though. The first menstrual period I got lasted about 15 days with spotting in the last 5 days. My second menstrual period began, oh, about 30 days ago now. I am still spotting and have been for the past 15 days!! Besides this awfulness, I have not gained any weight, I have no more acne than I did before. Occasionally I will get angry or sad for no reason. Same goes for sex drive, some days I am really feeling it while other days I want to do nothing.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched from lo Loestrin to Nuva ring, and once Jan 2018 rolled around my new insurance only paid for generic brands so I switched to Junel Fe. The first month I cried for no reason and was irritated and angry. The first few months I had cystic acne on my chin and I gained 20+ pounds on this pill. By June (6 months later) I started dieting on a 1000 calorie diet and lost no weight, instead I gained an additional 8 pounds. In November I was still crying for no reason. I had a regular period most months on this pill. It prevented pregnancy but I was bloated constantly and my boobs got bigger. I had a yeast infection every cycle. I called my doctor once I got new insurance and switched to Lo Loestrin. I just finished my first 28 day pack of lo Loestrin and I am already not experiencing any mood swings and I’m down 5 pounds. No more acne this month or bloating. When taking Junel fe just be aware of any changes! Listen to those close to you if they notice weight gain or mood swings.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m 48, I took Junel Fe 1/20 for irregular period, no gain weight, no pimples , no depression,  but I got melasma on my face, the rest I said is good, it change my life for better!

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The ONLY good thing about this birth control pill is that it made my period lighter and shorter. This pill has given me terrible acne. I take amazing care of my skin and always have. I rarely would ever get a single zit on my face or body, and if I did it was minor. I have had awful, even painful, acne appear all over my face, back, and shoulders. No matter what I do, I cannot get it to go away. I also have had terrible mood swings. I am generally a very happy, positive person but this pill has caused me to be angry, moody, and even led me to having an emotional outburst out of nowhere. My boyfriend, who I have been with for over four years, said he has never seen me act this way. I highly advise everyone to stay away from this pill, unless you are that desperate to minimize your period symptoms and you are okay with dealing with the many negative side effects that have truly effected my everyday life.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This Lo Loestrin Fe BC is great! My former pill would cause constant bleeding - I switched to Lo Loestrin a year and a half ago and I have had no periods, no spotting, no headaches/migraines, no weight gain, and only slight increase in depression/mood and slight gain in boob size. This medication is EXPENSIVE, there is a savings card currently, but be aware it ends June 30 2019. With my former insurance + savings card it was $25/month. New insurance + savings card it's $60/month. Once savings card expires, current insurance it is $250/month and no insurance its $160/month. To me, for no periods and no worries, its worth it.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I just finished my first month of these pills, and I was pretty nervous at first. To start things off I have never reacted well to birth control pills in the past. With this pill though I didn’t really notice any negative side effects so far. I’m not the most active person, but I haven’t really noticed any weight gain. I take my pills in the evening to avoid any nausea. I do bloat while taking this medication but nothing that can’t be resolved with healthier eating and a gasX lol. Every pill is going to affect woman differently. This one just seems to be the one that my body with tolerate.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Awful. Gained 7 pounds in 6 weeks and I’m not a person who gains a ton of weight real easy. I have had the worst acne I have ever had, very swollen all over my body.  Night sweats, weird dreams, bloating, low libido. Horrible, horrible, horrible.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been on Lo Loestrin Fe for years with no problems, recently my doctor switched me to Blisovi 24 FE and am now on month two - they are not even the same pills. I am throwing these pills away today. I’ve never had anxiety and depression until being on this pill. Today at work I randomly burst into tears. I DO NOT DO THIS. I have zero sex drive to the point I don’t even want to hug my husband anymore. I have heart palpitations and a constant brain fog. Please do yourself a favor a stay away from this birth control THERES BETTER OPTIONS. I don’t even recognize myself anymore and I’ve always been a confident woman. Currently crying while writing this.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this pill for no more than a week before I all of a sudden got this sensation of tightness in my chest along with hotness on my chest, neck, and face. This sensation continued for another WEEK before I ended up in the hospital because I had a panic attack that had messed with my veins-and to this day they continue to do so and worsen. All of a sudden my veins began to become visible right before my eyes. Even one of the veins in my right hand below my thumb was pulsating and so large that it was visible all the way up between my thumb and index finger. The cramping was excruciating. It continues 8 months later. I can see my veins dilate-shrink and enlarged. When they shrink they cause my arms and hands to swell and loose color because of poor circulation. I was perfectly healthy before I took bc and now I have anxiety-which I’ve NEVER EVER had before-that incites extreme anxiety and panic. Depression can be controlled, anxiety/panic cannot. My body is destroyed.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I been on Lo Loestrin Fe for two months now. My doctor recommended due to cysts and endometriosis. I was having chronic cramps through the month before taking the pill and since starting this pill My cramps have gone down to two days. I have taken other pills before were I have gain weight and feel super nauseous. Doctor recommended to take this one at night instead of during the day & haven't felt nauseous at all. Only thing is do not skip a pill because you will see spotting and will get cramps.  I haven't had any mood swings or skin breakouts so far.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst birth control EVER! I’ve been moody, nauseous, no appetite, dizzy, weak and hot. How is this pill even FDA approved?

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got on Lo Loestrin about two years ago. I had to stop taking it for a few months due to developing migraines with aura which can cause you a stroke if you’re on the combo pill. The migraines stopped and I got back on LoLo. I never got a period on the birth control. Like never.. which was very nerve wracking. It was not until I ended up in the hospital with chest paint that I learned birth control can increase your risk of clotting by 3x! Thankfully no clot, but I had to undergo extra tests just because of LoLo. I am only 21 years old and this pill could have killed me twice! Got off and my moods have NEVER BEEN BETTER!! I feel like a completely new person

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started the Junel 1/20 pill over a week ago then started my period . My periods used to be like 4-6 Days no it is  past the 8th day and my period still hasn’t stopped . Going to call a doctor to see how long it’ll be before my period stops . I read other reviews and it says it won’t stop for after a month then after that you won’t have one at all . So I’m just going to call the doctor and wait and see the results.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I highly do not recommend Lo Loestrin FE birth control. I spotted half of the entire first pack, which I know is common, but I've never experienced it before. I have had daily headaches. My breasts have been extremely tender, and have grown almost a full cup size. The worst is the anxiety. My anxiety has been through the roof and completely uncontrollable. I went a year on an entire bottle of Xanax and since I've started this, I've probably used half of a bottle throughout a month because I've had so much nervousness and anxiety. Anxiety attacks galore. I never attributed this to birth control before, but I had these symptoms before when I was on birth control for 10 years and thought it was just me. It's not me. It's the birth control. I wouldn't even consider it, if I were you. Also lack ant motivation to do anything or to be social, and I'm typically a very extroverted person.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was so scared to start this given the horrible comments and reviews on this site. I almost switched before I even started! Thankfully I didn’t because I have had zero issues with this Blisovi 24 FE. I have always been prone to anxiety and been in and out of therapy for it for 12 years. I’m actually the least anxious I’ve ever been since starting this. Still have those days, but who doesn’t :) If you’re considering getting on Blisovi, please listen to your doctor if they believe it is the right fit for you and don’t let these comments deter you! Also- know the risks involved with any types of hormonal birth control.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started these pills 2 months ago after getting my IUD removed. I am not a smoker, but I have blood clots in my lungs from this Blisovi Fe 1/20 birth control. I am miserable. I didn't get pregnant, but I almost died.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I never write reviews but for the last 4 months since I’ve gotten off I’ve had the worst acne. I’ve NEVER even had a pimple. In my entire life and getting off was (I thought a great decision) horrible. I had mood swings like crazy. The acne around my jawline and mouth looks terrible. I’ve tried everything to get rid of it. My emotions around my cycle were all over the place. Uncontrollable actually. I hate what (this) birth control did to my body.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Wow, this birth control made me have SEXUAL DYSFUNCTION!!! I’m 22 and couldn’t have sex, it altered the way I felt about sex, not wanting to be touched, grossed out by the fact my boyfriend wanted to have sex. I had no sensitivity on my body. I thought I was losing my mind. Completely no libido

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At first I was skeptical of going on a higher dosage. I have noticed weight gain and acne, but I believe they were due to other issues not the birth control. My periods got lighter again, and my cramps and period only lasted about 3 days compared to 7-8 on the lower dose. I will be going back to my doctor soon just to check up on it since it's been about 3 months. But all in all, I don't think this birth control has done anything but its job. I only give it a 7 because its been about 3 months but with added stress.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Awful, I used to be on Sronyx and then Levonorgestrel for awhile when my gyno switched me to Blisovi (saying it would make my period more regular and shorter). It's been the worst birth control experience I've had in the 6 or 7 years I've been on birth control. It didn't really have any effect on my acne (I did notice more red spots though), but it affected my weight and emotions like CRAZY. I've been on it for 6 months with no improvement (if anything the symptoms are getting worse). No dietary or exercise changes and yet I keep gaining weight and getting stretch marks. I find myself constantly crying at nothing, and I've noticed circulatory changes too. I've always had bad circulation but on this pill I find myself with more bruises than ever before. It also made my period all out of whack. I would miss a period, have random outbursts of spotting, and to make matters worse I was still cramping badly. Do not recommend but it may work for the right people.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Necon in my 20s-30s.   I am 40 now and have been on Nortrel  (generic of Nortrel) for 3 months.  My pros: regular, 3-4 day periods, light flow, no to little acne, intense sex drive in week 3 (no dryness here), no depression/anxiety or lack of sleep (I take clonazepam), rare headaches, rare spotting.  My cons: extreme bloating (Midol helps), weight gain/ increased appetite, mood swings, irritability, fatigue, cramps, nausea (I take ondansetran), gas, backaches (I take 800 mg Ibuprofen).  Besides weight gain, there are 2 cons that can be age vs the pill.   I see cellulite on my legs and my hair is thinning.   I noticed most reviews are from girls younger than me so I can’t compare.  I love the light, short, regular periods.  I am able to live with the majority of my cons.  I am looking at ways to diet & become more active.  Take at your own risk but note your symptoms.  See what you can live with, medicate (if you are okay with it-it helps).  For me this is not the best but it's not the worst either.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I didn’t experience one good thing with this medicine. I have never had a problem with acne until I started this pill. It was uncontrollable. I gained 11 pounds in 3 months even with being extra cautious with what I was eating. I slowly started slipping into depression and having really bad anxiety attacks. I was extremely nauseated at the beginning. My heart rate was always extremely fast. I cried ALL the time. There is not a single good thing about this pill!

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched from Aviane onto Microgestin after the former caused awful side effects like constant bleeding, irritability, cramping and breast swelling. Unfortunately, Microgestin didn't work out for me, seeing as I've had the exact same issues with Aviane except a little worse on this pill. The weight gain was worse, my skin looked good, but I wasn't prone to break outs anyway. It's an effective birth control, but I can't handle the side effects. It also completely zapped my energy.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Oh wow. A BIG NO from me. I switched pharmacies and insurance and was told Mibelas 24 FE was basically the generic form of Minastrin 24 fe, BUT for me it is  NOT THE SAME. I have had such bad emotional side effects for the last three weeks since starting it I thought I was basically completely insane. I have been so severely depressed, laying on the floor for hours any time I am not at work (going to take breaks at work to lay down on the bathroom floor and cry), I have gotten such bad anxiety that I was convinced several people close to me "suddenly hated me", and had 1 panic attack and 3 anxiety attacks in one week. My therapist said he had no idea what was wrong with me and suddenly we realized the only thing different in the last three weeks was that I was taking the "generic" form of my birth control instead of the regular... so I looked up Mibelas, and turns out MANY people switching from Minastrin are having the same exact issues

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this continuously due to horrible heavy periods that would leave me doubled over in pain and changing my tampon every 45 minutes. I spotted and bled every single day for the first SIX MONTHS on this pill. I finally just stopped taking it for a week when I started cramping and bleeding more heavily. I just let my body have a full period and then began taking it like normal and the bleeding issues stopped completely. It has helped with my acne and I have never had any noticeable anxiety or depression due to the pill. My biggest complaint is that over the course of 8 months, I have gained over 30 pounds and my diet and activity levels have actually improved since I began taking it. And it isn't just your typical bloating, I've noticed fat in places where I've never had it before in my life. I've found it incredibly hard to lose the extra weight, the only way to lose even a tiny bit is to basically starve myself for a week and then it immediately comes back.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the first birth control I had ever been on, spotting in the beginning and I will say the positives is that I get my period for like a day and always know when it's coming. However, I've always had some depression issues but right up until I started taking this medicine I was the most mentally healthy I have ever been. As soon as I started taking birth control my moods drastically changes and I have such anxiety about everything, cry all the time and everything scares and worries me and I lost drive and focus to do almost anything, wouldn't recommend if you already have hormone issues and imbalances because this throws you for a loop and makes you go crazy and I feel bad for the people who have to deal with it and see the changes in me, because I used to be able to feel happy and now it's harder. Need a new birth control soon to level out my moods and I can start feeling like myself again.
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla is the best birth control I’ve been on. Light to no periods, one day of cramps never bad.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Microgestrin Fe 1/20 for about 3 years. I've tried many other brands or generics like Junel Fe 1/20 which is a form of Microgestrin.  But Junel made me gain weight and get depressed. Microgestrin, however, has never given me any problems at all. I start and finish my period on the exact same days every month. My periods are so light and so manageable. I've had no problem with weight gain or mood swings with this pill. I am so sad to see this pill go on back order. I highly recommend. This is the only pill I have completely loved and not had any problems on. I am a 20 year old girl and in college so it's very important I'm on a good pill that doesn't get in the way of my mental health for my studies. I love this pill and sad to see it go.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this birth control for two weeks and experienced mood swings, cramps, an infection and spots of bleeding. I immediately asked for a change in medicine.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on thia Lo Loestrin Fe pill for three months so far and honestly I am soooo relieved to not have any bad side effects. My mood hasn't really changed and I didn't gain weight (two of my concerns). It has cleared up my acne a little bit and I haven't had my period at all in the three months I've been on it (which is totally fine by me). I haven't even had any spotting. Honestly, this has been the best thing to happen to me! I was so nervous to go on birth control in case of negative side effects. This is my first form of birth control and I'm 24 years old. I think my boobs got a tiny bit bigger, too. I would highly recommend this pill!  For those reading all the negative reviews and being nervous, keep in mind, most people who have negative experiences are more likely to leave a review than those who have positive experiences. I remember reading them and being so nervous to start it but I've had nothing but positive things :)

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this for 2 years since I was 18 and have had a great experience. My doctor started me off on Taytulla and I had so much anxiety from it. It cleared my skin, my boobs did grow a little, and I don’t notice a change in weight gain at all. Protects from pregnancy. I started the pill to help with acne and to help with me being emotional the week before my period, during, and the week after which left me with one good week out of the month where I wouldn’t cry everything! It fixed it after a month and my skin after about 2 months. One side affect I noticed was my skin did not tan the same and I was more prone to burning. Now that it’s been 2 years, this side affect has subsided. But so has it’s positive affects. I feel like I break out more now than I did in the past 2 years and that I am starting to be more emotional like I used to be for a longer amount of time around my period. Might just be the point I’m at in life but figured i’d share!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Blisovi FE 1/20 birth control since late 2017 and it has been a wonderful experience for me. My acne has drastically reduced, I no longer have cramps, and my periods are extremely light. I luckily haven't experienced any of the symptoms that others have shared on this website, no anxiety, depression or any bad changes. Every single body is different therefore I recommend you try it and see how it works for your body.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before taking June FE 1/20 I read almost all the reviews online. Majority of the reviews were bad which caused me to become worried about taking it. I then realized everyone’s body is completely different and may have different reactions to the pill. So I thought I should try it out for myself. I’ve been on the pill since October 2018 to this day and so far I’ve only had one bad side effect, chest pain. The chest pain isn’t that bad, but it does come and go. I was worried about having anxiety attacks because I do suffer from anxiety, but my anxiety has been pretty much the same, nothing crazy. Another side effect I have noticed is breast growth, which is fine by me because I was an A cup. I would advise other females to take it and see how your body reacts to it. Don’t be scared and remember that everyone is different. Once you start taking it, look out for the side effects and if you have any, consult your doctor/Gyn right away! Good luck :)

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taking Blisovi Fe 1/20 as my first time birth control. 1. No weight gain if anything I've lost weight while on this, not saying it's due to the pill but that's the only thing I've noticed about my weight.2. No hair loss, my hair has been fine.3. My face cleared up of little pimples I used to get throughout the month.4. My periods are 3 days at the most and are light.5. I've noticed an increase in my sex drive.6. I've always been on the smaller side when it came to my boobs, they've gotten bigger since I started taking this pill. Nothing crazy but enough to notice a difference.Down sides.1. I'm bipolar so this pill did mess with my anxiety/mood pretty bad the first two months but once I got past the adjustment period it's been good, occasionally it can get to be a bit much but nothing I can't deal with.2. My cramps haven't changed they're still just as painful. 3. During my period my breasts get super tender to the point of being uncomfortable in my bra. Hope this helps. ✌

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on the Junel Fe 1/20  pill for almost 3 months! I switched from Taytulla and was very scared considering I loved Taytulla. Fortunately I transitioned to this pill with ease. Prevents pregnancy and I've seen no significant side effects. Among all these bad reviews I can say I love this pill! No weight gain.. helps with acne. No mood swings. Give it a try!  PS these pills contain the same active ingredients at the same strength the only difference is Junel is 21 days of active tabs, 7 days of inactive tabs, whereas Taytulla is 24 days active tabs and 4 days inactive tabs, and Taytulla is a capsule

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used to take Microgestin with no problems. I was switch to the generic Loesterin and took it for close to two years before I realized that it was the cause of my anxiety,  depression,  anger, mood swings,  hypertension, the list goes on.  I never struggled with any of these issues before when I took the Microgestin but I just thought it was stress related. Since I had been on birth control for years with no problems I never suspected the pill.  I stopped taking the pill in March and I can finally  say I'm feeling like myself again.  I wish I would've put the pieces together sooner and stopped taking this pill when I first noticed symptoms.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on several different forms of the pill for the last 5 years. I have been on this one for the past 6 months and it is hands down, the worst one to date. It gave me mood swings, no sex drive at all, horrible migraines, nausea, bloating, anxiety, and depression. I stopped taking it completely 2 weeks ago and have already noticed a huge difference. Yes this pill is great at preventing pregnancy but that's about it and the side effects are not worth it. Please do not take this pill.

Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Nortrel 7/7/7 birth control for less than a month. At first, everything was fine and I was only bloated. After a week, my appetite increased and I gained 10 lbs from eating more. I've been getting horrible headaches since starting it. I've been having terrible mood swings and have snapped at people for no reason or for petty things. It's almost cost me my relationship with my fiance. I can't sleep right anymore despite me taking my medication for insomnia (currently running on 4 hours of sleep, actually). I break out randomly on my forehead, chin, and chest. But hey, I'm not pregnant. It's not worth the side effects in my opinion.  Make sure to let your doctor know if you suffer from depression, anxiety, BPD, etc. because this pill with mess with you bad. I will be switching back to my previous pill since I was better off on that one.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill is absolutely awful. On Junel Fe 1/20 I am spotting non-stop, cramps, breaking out, horrendous migraines, bloated, and zero sex drive. Prior to starting this, I was off BC pills for about 6 months and felt great, doc said I need to take BC because I take this other med that you cannot get pregnant on. Not worth all the horrible side effects, will use condoms.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Ive been on Junel Fe 1/20 for around two years. It really helped clear up my acne but I always have occasional break outs around my period. I take it at night versus my other medicines (antidepressant, anxiety, thyroid) in the morning. Beforehand, I thought I may have had endometriosis, but it lightened my period and reduced my menstrual pains. I normally last around 2-4 days

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Don’t listen to the bad reviews! As someone else stated, people who have good experiences tend to not leave a review. I was terrified to take this Blisovi Fe 1.3/30 birth control because of all the bad reviews. I took the risk anyway and I’ve had literally zero of the horrible symptoms others reported (apart from a mild headache the first couple days). I have PCOS, I feel like the hirsutism (unwanted facial hair) has slowed and I’m losing weight (although I am watching my food). Give it a shot!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is  awful.  Took it for 15 days and started having SEVERE anxiety throughout the day. (Side note: I take anti-anxiety medicine and have not felt that horrible since my primary care and iIgot my anxiety under control in Nov-Jan).  I also became an angry, emotional basket case.  The side effects ended within three-five days after I stopped taking it.  My ob said the b.c. hormones effect each person differently, pending which rx, hormones, and dose you’re on.  I was switched to Beyaz and smooth sailing 10 days in.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Do not take this pill, after 2 months I am changing due to weight gain, anger, mood swings, extreme exhaustion to the point where I can't stay awake past 9pm. I do not feel like myself, I have awful anxiety that I have never had before, the exhaustion is to the point where getting through the day has become an issue.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Junel 1/20 for a year now, and I'll be switching off of it next month. There have been quite a few symptoms that I have now traced back to this. 1) weight gain! 20 lbs in 3 months. I haven't gained any extra since then, but I have started a drastic workout program and started eating better and I can't lose it. 2) No sex drive at all. 3) Moodiness. My poor husband. In all, it's not horrible, but it's not right for me.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):ABSOLUTELY DO NOT TAKE THIS birthcontrol unless you want to have severe migraines, anxiety, fast heart rate, mood swings, and an upset stomach everyday! I took for 2 months and finally ruled this out and ran out of options. As soon as I stopped taking this BC my life returned back to normal. Thank gosh!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this birth control for almost a year now and I’m not really a fan. I’ve gotten headaches every day since I started taking the pill, my body is releasing old blood instead of new and I’ve gained weight and haven’t been able to get it off. I’ve tried dieting and exercising and nothing is working. Hopefully I can get prescribed a new one but  I don’t recommend this birth control

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel since 2014. I use to have really bad periods, heavy bleeding and terrible cramps that made walking and completing tasks unbearable. Junel helped regulate my cycle by lightening  the bleeding and cramps. The only downfall to this is the massive weight gain. I’ve gained over 50lbs since starting this pill and my breast will not stop growing. I went from a D cup to a H cup.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hi I  have just had my second pill, its my first time using this. Omg I've been feeling so bad I been having nausea and dizziness and I feel indigestion and a lot of saliva in my mouth and at the same time dryness too, its horrible, theres no way I can take another pill my doctor sent me this because of my cystic problem but I rather find another way to treat them or I recommend to have a hormone test before. When read the reviews I got scare until I read a very nice one so I decided to start mine only 2 pills I feel I’m dying.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on the pill  Blisovi Fe 1/20for about 3 months now and I really like it! I’m only taking it to avoid pregnancy and have regular periods. It’s the first form of birth control I have ever tried. I have no really bad side effects. It just doesn’t personally help me with cramps. But my period only last 2/3 days and it’s super light! and I’m just more emotional than I was before but nothing dramatic. I think it’s a great first time birth control use

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla has been wonderful to me. I am saddened that my new insurance no longer covers this medication but I wanted to leave a review. This medication has been  by far one of the best I have been on. I managed to lose 10 lbs while on this medication with nutrition advice from a professional so I can say it didn't cause me to gain any weight. I had no other side effects. I would definitely recommend.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel Fe for the first three months which gave me mood swings and then the pharmacy randomly started giving me Blisovi which I've had for 9 months. Blisovi gave me less of the mood swings -- which were never a problem before but I kept getting headaches. I started logging them and I would nearly get one small one a day, at least. I completely weened myself off of caffeine too, so I'm sure that's not the issue either. Now I'm back on Junel Fe. Junel Fe made my periods more irregular. I skipped for 90 days and then had a 12 day period...anyway, no headaches but I'm back to being needlessly sensitive now. I might talk to my doctor and try something else. My insurance only covers them if I get them mailed to my house...so when I needed an early prescription because of a vacation they charged me out of pocket ($44.00).

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Lolo, in my opinion, isn’t too terrible, but there are some pretty terrible things about it. I’ve been on it for 7 months and for the 3rd through the 4th months I was on the pills, I had a constant period. I’m 5’9 and have been 130-135 lbs since I was 14 years old. I’m 18 now and for the first 3 months I remained the same weight, but now on the 7th I am 23 lbs over my normal weight and no dieting or amount of exercise has helped to lose the weight. I am constantly hungry and try to fill the hunger with healthier things than with carbs, but yet I am still gaining weight. I have doubled in bra size and now wear a large in pants when 4 months ago I wore a small. The pills help with my mood swings. I rarely have them, but if I ever miss a pill, I go crazy. This is the only pill I’ve been able to take that keeps my skin clear though.  Overall I could go either way on whether I like this pill or not. It has pros and cons but the weight gain is getting out of control.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I absolutely hate these pills. I was on it for FOUR months. It would have been three months but my pharmacy messed up my order so I tolerated another month of it. I have never been so irritated and moody in my entire life. I have not had a period in the fourth months as well so to some, that might be a good thing. I would not recommend these pills.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Amazing. Though I take this pill everyday in the morning, and it’s so great. I haven’t gotten my period in eight months now (no, I am not pregnant), no more cramps, no more buying pads, it’s a relief! Also, I have not gotten any side effects such as headaches, weight gain, depression etc. The low dose of estrogen doesn’t mess with your body too much. Highly recommend.

Junel 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took the Junel 1.5/30 contraceptive pill for 8 months and I would have to say that I was not satisfied. In fact, I was happy to switch to a different brand this month because the symptoms were so bad. Junel was the first pill I had ever taken and I would say the only things it helped me with were to stop pregnancy and regulation of my period . I started on the lower dose one and I actually increased my dosage to 1.5/30 thinking it would help the side effects, but it didn’t. I just regulated more. I originally went on the pill to help with acne and I would say it got slightly better, but I still got heavy breakouts 2 weeks before my period. The worst part I would have to say, though, were the mood swings. Before birth control, I was NEVER a moody person. This pill caused me to have terrible mood swings to the point of having bad thoughts and being enraged at minuscule things. This pill also enhanced my anxiety when I was on the lower dose as well. Overall, I would say this pill did not work for me, but maybe it will work for some of you.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel for a little while now and was prescribed it to help with my ovarian cysts. It has been an effective contraceptive and preventive thus far for me without any side effects unlike listed by many others. Birth control is just tricky and different ones work for different people, many others do not work for me whereas this one does.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When I first started the pill I was having extreme mood swings and then all of sudden I got really depressed and became unmotivated. I don’t recommend this brand at all to anyone

Minastrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Great pill - Minastrin 24 Fe it is the first one EVER to work for me. I had tried probably 15 others and always had break thru bleeding every day or throwing up. So I was so thrilled to start this one! Sadly my insurance doesn’t cover it and so I was paying out of pocket. I had a great price for awhile then that coupon expired and it  cost me close to $200. A generic by Allergen became available for $100. But now I can’t afford it. So I am on nothing. With no birth control pill I have terrible periods that last a long time and horrible cramping. On Minastrin I had no pain, minimal bleeding and was very happy. I laugh at the review that says on it a week and gained weight... whatever!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this Lo Lestrin Fe pill for three months, gave me wicked anxiety and made me super emotional all the time so I ended up stopping birth control all together (I've been on two others) because by the end of three months it had started really affecting my school and social life. I also didn't get my period for the three months I was on it or for another two months after stopping birth control altogether which didn't help with the anxiety. It also made my acne worse from occasional pimples to consistent full face breakouts which I was really not a fan of; at the age of 21 I thought I was past that. Everything cleared up within a few weeks off the drug.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've encountered so many problems with this pill. Constant infections after intercourse. Smelly discharge before and after periods. Headaches, high blood pressure, mood swings, depression, anxiety, irregular periods, intense anger, zero sex drive. The thought of having sex with my partner was repulsive. It's a massive mess. I was on it for almost a year. Good thing I found out what was happening. It almost cost me to lose my child's father. It can ruin relationships. Terrible experience.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Junel Fe 1/20 for a year & half. I can say that Junel does it’s job at preventing pregnancy. It has helped my periods become regular & has helped my acne! I’m super thankful for Junel.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Our insurance carrier stopped covering the brand  we usually have so I have to change pills.  That said, this pill worked for preventing pregnancy (awesome!) but did have some side effects. 1. Breast size increase— about 1 1/2 cup size2. I am pretty slim and gained about 5 -7 extra pounds in hips/bum/tummy in 6 months. 3.  Moodiness-  now I have read about others depression and anxiety issues and often wonder if maybe they were present before in the person etc.  I was not, but just felt waayyy more triggered by things if that makes sense.3.  Hormonal acne really bad around the 6-7th pack.  Huge bummer.. ready to switch at this point.Would I take again? Probably not.  There are many pills out there to try if one isn't the best for for you.  Give it time and listen to your body.
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If I miss a single pill I start bleeding like I'm on my period for over a week every time. I bleed about 3 weeks every month..

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Taytulla for two months and had to stop due to side effects.  My blood pressure was high about 178/114 and my pulse was about 120 to 130. I started developing chest pains and shortness of breath and had to go to the emergency room. I had to wear a halter monitor for three days to record my heart activity. I also developed insomnia and anxiety and had to to take anti anxiety medication.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst thing ever. First I hate all birth controls but my doctor insisted on it since I had 1 ovarian cyst. I asked not to have this one since I had it last time. The pill makes me very depressed and feel very aggressive and I've been sick the whole time on it. I called to try and switch and was told I haven't taken it long enough to get used to it? But I've taken the exact same one twice and last time I took myself off of it I bleed for 3 months straight. I don't think that's supposed to be normal. Moral of it I need to find a better doctor and never touch this stupid pill ever again.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Since I started taking the Junel Fe 1/20 pill, I have gained weight, had bad cravings and have not gotten my period for FOUR months now despite taking it everyday at the same time! This pill is terrible. I will not recommend it!

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I haven’t had much problems with Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 birth control. Occasionally I do spot a bit early but could be from taking it at different times of the day. I started this birth control a few years ago and didn’t notice getting acne or gaining a lot of weight. Pretty content with it!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor recommended that I start taking this pill two months ago to help with  perimenopause . In the first six weeks I have had three periods that lasted one week each and the last one was so heavy that I bled through my clothes. I have had terrible lower abdominal cramps everyday and have had to take pain medication to stop it. I cannot eat anything because the cramps hurt so severely, yet I have gained 10 lbs without eating. My breasts are suddenly growing and my bras are all too small despite having been the same size for the last 18 yrs. My sex drive completely went away. I called my doctor and the nurse said to give it more time (6-months) to adjust, but I don’t know if I can handle it. My moods have also been more intense and difficult to control. I don’t know whether this will go away or get worse. I don’t know what to do.

Loestrin 21 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this birth control Loestrin 21 1/20 compared to Yaz, Ortho-Tri-Cyclen, Mirena, Seasonique, Depo provera I do get mild headaches but no weight gain or acne. I was on it for Endometriosis and it was great

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Lolo about 3 weeks ago now for relief of my PCOS symptoms. Everything was good, no spotting, very little acne, slight mood swings and no other side effects. Then once I started getting closer to the end of my pack all hell broke loose, I'm not even done my regular pills yet and Ive been having bleeding like my regular period and the worst cramps I've ever had in my life. The pain is so bad that I had to leave work early a few times just because I couldn't handle the pain. The only side effect I've had on the pills are these horrible cramps but other than that this pill is doing its job. This pill is different for everyone as is every pill, but personally I'm going to look into taking a different pill as this one is causing me too much discomfort.
Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Gave me the worst/smelliest gas I ever had in my life. Had to discontinue use because of severe deathly flatulence.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I haven’t had my period on this pill except once for the three years I’ve been taking it (and I don’t skip the placebo pills), which is absolutely amazing!!The only drawback is that it gives me mood swings sometimes (I’ll start bawling for no reason at all or over the smallest thing- which I had never done before the pill) but it’s so worth not having a period!! It’s also cleared up my acne. I was most scared of weight gain on birth control and I’ve had none of that.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on the Junel 1/20  pill for 5 years so I'm going to be honest. I gained some weight (my eating habits don't help), headaches and migraines are more frequent. Back and neck pain that I never had that isn't due to the weight gain. Slim to none when it comes to sex drive. My acne never got bad though, that's a plus. I got on this pill because I never had regular periods, and when I did have a period it was heavy flow for two weeks at a time. I haven't had a cycle since being in this pill. I know all of this sounds negative, but I do enjoy being on this pill for it's strength and peace of mind. It won't work for everyone, but in my case, I don't think I would want to be on another pill.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this Blisovi Fe 1.5/30   birth control for 3 months before I had to change. I did not feel like myself and I felt like I was living outside of my body. I started having panic attacks multiple times a week and it almost cost my relationship with my amazing boyfriend. I became very depressed and anxious that the smallest things made me freak out. I couldn't think ahead about my life or even the week without having a panic attack. I do not recommend this birth control.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I don't have too many complaints about this birth control. I Switched from Kariva to Junel  Fe 1/20 because I was constantly breakthrough bleeding on Kariva, very moody. I'm now on my fourth cycle. Haven't had my period since I started which I'm not really complaining, took a couple of pregnancy tests all negative. It has improved my acne a lot. I have gained around 10 pounds and been struggling to keep it off. I've had  little to no anxiety, been a lot more stable no mood swings. However on the period week which is iron pills, my stomach gets really upset I'm not sure why, however it is manageable. Overall I would say give it a try.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Loestrin Fe for about 3 years. Although Lo Loestrin Fe did stop cramping and gave me a little to no bleeding monthly periods, the mental health dip that I took was not worth it. Within the first year, my family and friends noticed I was moody and possibly depressed. I knew I was anxious and began having panic attacks. I was  prescribed antidepressants and lived the next two years very out of it and sad. The last year on this birth control I started having migraines. The migraines were debilitating. My gut instinct told me to stop taking the birth control after doing some research. Within the first 6 months of not taking this birth control I started to feel like myself again and the migraines went away. I am happier then ever and loving life! I have decided to go the hormone-less route. I've had the copper IUD for about a year now and I love it! I’m sure the Lo Loestrin works for some but for me, it did not.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got this Blisovi Fe 1/20 birth control for prevention of another ovarian cyst bursting. Before this, the only other birth control I had for any period of time was Implanon implant. The implanon didn’t agree with my body but I kept it the full 3 years anyway to prevent pregnancy. Blisovi Fe  1/20 doesn’t really agree with me either. I’ve been on it for 6-7 months and I get horrible nausea if I don’t take it before bed. I get headaches all the time now. I’ve lost my appetite almost completely. Today I had such extreme nausea that was only relieved by throwing up three times. My sleeping pattern is all out of whack. I'm not 100% sure this pill is to blame but it’s the only thing I’ve been doing different lately. I tried the NuvaRing for a while as well and that didn’t agree with me either. Not sure what I’ll do.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):For what it's worth, I started this already  having high anxiety and bipolar compounded with an eating disorder - so the points about weight gain and mood swings were pretty freaky to me.I started taking it due to endomitriosis-related period pain.Junel Fe 1/20  has worked perfectly for me; the only change I've noticed is that I don't spend a week in bed barfing from the pain.If you have bipolar II and are worried about the complaints of anxiety/depression worse, give it a try. It worked just fine for me alongside Latuda.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe 1/20  seems to be one of the only packs of birth control my insurance wants to cover and it's making me really sick. I've already thrown up once today. I only take Junel Fe 1/20 because I can't afford the other generic brands like Blisovi Fe 1/20, Loestrin FE 1/20, Microgestin Fe 1/20    packs. Yes I also use condoms but I'm also on the pill because I'm taking all precautions possible not to get pregnant

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve had my fair share of experiences with birth controls from the migraines everyday to bleeding for weeks at a time to anxiety to depression.
