Taytulla was my last try at it & I must say I’m pleasantly surprised I was on a generic of the same dosage and had a list of issues none of which I have now with this birth control! On Taytulla I have no anxiety no migraines no depression I had mild spotting getting used to it but now everything is fine, my horrible periods are now only about 4 days. I will say that cramping is still really bad but way lighter ! I love this birth control, life saver!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking this Blisovi Fe 1/20 birth control since 2017 and it has helped. After reading the negative reviews, I was shocked to see how many people didn't like it. I take my pill at 7:30 every day and have had no negative side effects, as far as I know. I have never vomited, got depressed,  or had severe bloating etc. My period has actually stopped completely with a little spotting every several months or so. But my acne has drastically reduced as it is pretty much gone! And I no longer feel the horrible cramps I used to feel during my period. This pill does everything it is supposed to correctly. But everyone is different :)

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):On Taytulla for 3 years and stopped 1.5 months ago. Here were the side effects I was having. Little to no period. Gained 20 pounds in just 1 year with a total of 40 pounds to date, frequent migraines, constipation, mood swings, agitation. In the 1.5 months that I’ve been off of Taytulla I have less migraines/headaches. Have more frequent bowel movements and my mood is a little more stable. My weight hasn’t changed yet but I do see a difference in my way I look and feel. Why didn’t I stop sooner? I honestly didn’t put two and two together. I didn’t keep track of the side affects. At the time not many reviews on this product was out. Everyone is different.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Sooooo... I’ve tried every kind of birth control known to (wo)man. Implant, IUD, the worst — depo, mini pills, combo pills, 7 different pills to be extract. Tarina was the latest. I have now been off of it for 10 days. I’ve shed pounds & water weight, I’m no longer a short fuse, I can think straight again, I’m not stuttering over my words anymore, I don’t go into full blown rage out of nowhere, I don’t want to eat 24/7, my face has cleared, my hair isn’t coming out in clumps.  I truly thought depo was the worst, but now it’s a close second to Tarina. Avoid this BC at ALL COSTS. Unless you want to be a  rude, angry, bloated, bald, bloated, pimply cow. It is the WORST. Oh and I bled ALL THE TIME.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this pill for many years and never had any problems - no headaches, no weight changes, good mood. I stopped taking it for pregnancy and breastfeeding and when I came back to it I started having very heavy periods and missing just one pill caused me to have my period - even with taking pills after the missed one. If I wrote it before my pregnancy I would have given it a 10

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control  because it was low in estrogen and all the other birth control I have tried would make me bleed constantly. I was only 2 weeks in and I started to bleed again so I stopped. My issue though is the TERRIBLE acne this has caused me. I'm relieved to see that there are others who share the same issue. I have never had acne this severe, I am so embarrassed to show my skin. I seriously just want to hide, I feel disgusting. I've broken so badly on my chin, back and slightly on my chest. I went to the dermatologist to seek relief, but it's still going to take much time to heal. This has by far been the worst birth control I have ever taken. I would not recommend this.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Due to moving, changing doctors, and being out of town (and away from my husband for 10 days) my original BC Rx lapsed. My new doctor gave me samples of Taytulla to use in the meantime while we get everything squared away for an IUD insertion. I have been taking the pills for almost a month and this last week I have been so nauseous, gassy, and irritable. The only time I have felt this way was when I was pregnant with my two kiddos. I genuinely thought I was pregnant. I took two pregnancy tests (days apart) and both were negative. I was certain I was pregnant, my mom and husband were convinced too. After the second negative prego test, I started looking up more information about this type of BC. My gosh. I wish I would have known sooner. I have felt awful for a week now, to the point of knocking me right down in bed. Not to mention the emotional strain it has caused. This is by far the WORST BC I have ever tried. This is bad news bears. Never again.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I don't like Junel Fe24 at all. I am towards the end of my first pack so the past few weeks I’ve been spotting... the entire time. I haven’t started my period yet but it’s only the first day of me taking the brown pills. I just know once I finish I’m not taking anymore. The breakthrough bleeding is just too much. I have gone through so many panty liners this month than I have in a year. It’s very inconvenient. I will be calling my ob/gyn and finding something else. Other than that I haven’t had any other symptoms but I’d rather take those other symptoms over this.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been using Junel FE for birth control for about 10 years. I have never had any issues. The light, short periods have been great. No mood swings, no side effects at all. My doc is about to switch me to another and I’m quite sad to switch!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was only on the Junel 1/20  pill for a week and I had to stop taking it. It made me so sick all day everyday, although I only threw up once during that period I was constantly nauseous, I got bloated, my mood swings were terrible. Like bouncing off the walls terrible and my face broke out so bad. I know the pill effects everyone differently but I do not recommend this pill.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to this Junel Fe 1.5/30 birth control after my last one was discontinued and it IS AWFUL. I constantly am having stomach cramping and vaginal dryness. I will not be taking any of it until i get a different birth control.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My doctor gave me the prescription for this pill Blisovi 24 FE and I started taking them without reading the reviews. I’m actually surprised at the negative experience most of the people here had! Then I remember that every body reacts differently to every medication, and I might have gotten really lucky with this one. I am about to start my second pack, and so far, I’ve had no problems at all with this pill. When I first started taking them, the only side effect I noticed was headaches that lasted for only a few days. After that, everything was fine and normal. My weight has stayed the same, and I’ve had no breakouts on my face. I can’t say what this pill has in store for me in the future, but so far, it’s been uneventful and easy. If you’re reading this and you are still unsure, I’d say just take it anyway and see if it works for you and your body. The negative reviews may seem overwhelming and terrifying, but keep in mind that there are people who had a positive experience with it.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this Taytulla birth control for 6 months, the first month I was okay my boobs got a little bigger and I noticed a little bit of weight loss. After that around the second month I began to have severe anxiety, I would come home from classes at least 3 times a week and have an anxiety attack. I felt like I lost myself and couldn't be happy. I did not know if it was the BC at the time but going off it was one of the best decisions I've ever done.

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this Junel Fe 24 birthe control pills for 3 years now and have not had a problem. I just don't like how there are 7 inactive pills which means my period lasts 7 days, that always feels like forever. I haven't had any bad experiences with this medication. My face didn't break out, no intense cramps, just normal PMS symptoms when I am on my period. I would recommend this pill for anyone looking for a low dose birth control.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taytulla two weeks ago since the very first day I started it I have been dizzy and nauseous, it's gotten worse with each passing day. I have cramping every day since I started it, back and chest pain. I've also had nightmares every night since starting it. I feel like I'm constantly in a fog and can't focus. I decided to take it at night last night thinking maybe I'll just sleep through the dizziness and nausea and be ok during the day but that was not the case. I kept waking up feeling like I was going to be sick but was too dizzy to get out of bed, and I had the most terrifying dreams I've had in my life. I'm discontinuing the pack I can't live like this for another two weeks that's how badly it's effecting my life. I would definitely not recommend this birth control. I've tried many different birth controls in my life due to endometriosis and this is by far the worst one I've ever taken!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Omg this birth control was a disgrace, I can’t believe it’s FDA approved. I felt so depressed and soo anxious to the point where I was crying all the time and I couldn’t even get to sleep at night. I tried to make myself at least finish the first pack but I couldn’t. I’ve never felt such profound sorrow in my life. Mood returned to normal after discontinuing.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Would give Lo Loestrin Fe a 10 but I sometimes get skin breakouts and irregular periods with this. It does curb my appetite as well as stop binge eating symptoms. I actually take it for binge eating. However, it sometimes leaves me tired but definitely have gradually lost weight slowly going back on it. Once I go off, I gained the 15 I lost but it takes 2 weeks to get back to rights. definitely the best BC pill on the market!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):To keep this short and sweet, because of this birth control Junel Fe 1.5/30 I got a blood clot in my lung and had to be admitted to the hospital and be put on blood thinners. This pill is the actually so awful, between the 24/7 period cramps, rapid mood swings and super dark thoughts, and nearly puking everyday for a week and two days. May 7th 2019 marks the day an ER doctor told me I had a blood clot due to the Junel, two ER docs questioned me on why was I even taking this so, stay the away from this. And NEVER EVER take this.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):One month on Taytulla, and it’s my first time using birth control (to regulate my period). I’ve had my period for 11 days now and it’s continuing. The blood flow hasn’t been terrible, and I would like for my period to end now. Cramps have been bad. Light headache that has been ongoing since I started this pill. Anxiety and depression worsened. My mood swings are all over the place. The only pro is that I did not get pregnant only one week into the pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this Lo Loestrin  birth control for 6 months and absolutely hated it. Within the first 2 months I was having break through bleeding multiple times a week and after the second month I stopped getting a period for 2 1/2 months and suddenly started a heavy painful period again, weekly. Not to mention how terribly moody I was, I actually felt like I was going crazy. Sad, happy, and extremely angry within 10 minutes as well as extreme nausea and appetite loss.  I decided to wait it out, hopeful that my body would eventually get used too this but I can’t do it anymore and decided to switch pills finally which I am happy about as I was not covered for these and was paying over 100$ for 3 months of pills on top of all of that.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Larin Fe has quite a few pros, but for me they do not outweigh the cons.I’ve been taking this for 4 months and this is my experience.Pros:-Protects well against pregnancy.-Acne has decreased.-I haven’t gained any weight so far.-My periods have become extremely light and short, only 3 days long.Cons:-Slight cramps throughout the whole month. -Pretty much every time I eat, and sometimes even if I don’t eat, I have terrible acid reflux. I have taken an acid reducer almost every day. I am assuming it’s from the pill because it never used to be this bad-Depression. This is what’s making this pill not worth it to me. I have had anxiety in the past but I’ve never cried this much, not even while PMSing. My husband wants to know why I’m crying but sometimes there’s nothing I can tell him because I have no idea why I’m crying. I will be in a great mood and be having a conversation and suddenly my voice will start shaking and I’ll be in tears.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe was my first birth control pill a few years ago, now looking back I'd realized it gave me horrible side effects. I gained about 30 pounds, had anxiety (heart racing), depression, mood swings, and an insane appetite. I switched to Sprintec and had a good experience on that one.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this for 2 years and felt emotionally up and down constantly. I was depressed and would feel angry all the time. I would feel intense anger or depression and it felt like a hole I couldn't climb out of for days at a time. It dawned on me after all that time that it could be an effect of the pill. I stopped the pill and felt back to my old self soon after.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 5'5 150lbs normally. I was diagnosed with Endometriosis and PCOS within a 2 month span. Suffering with intense pain between cycles and fluid was in my lower abdomen according to an MRI. Tarina Fe is not the best when it comes to mood swings, but it's worked for the endometriosis pain and now my cycles are light to nonexistent. It is big on water retention which causes weight gain. I wasn't sweating well during my workouts and not peeing as much water as I consumed which scared me for awhile. The effect was my abdomen would bloat, I wear waist beads so I notice it more.  No amount of diet change and exercise worked to get that 10-15lb fluctuation down. I spiked at 167lbs. Doctor thought I was going in on hamburgers or something for awhile. When I stopped the birth control for a one month period (after 6 months on it) the weight fell off like melted butter. Once I started back its creeped up again. My skin has cleared up a bit. I haven't noticed any pigmentation problems.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Positive: I never once got pregnant while on Taytulla & my  period that used to be 8-9 days went down to 4 days! I have huge ovarian cysts that were blocking blood flow to my left ovary which in turned caused me to have my period once every other month or so. After many years I was happy that for once I wasn't in pain and that everything was finally consistent.Cons: It takes about a month or so to get use to the hormones. My stomach every night felt ice cold and in the morning I was so nauseated. Once that went away I noticed I gained about 5 lbs. Asked doc & he said it should go away...Here I am about a year later and have gone from 130 lb to 175 lb. And lets not even mention not even two months into taking this OC I have had a severe yeast infection on & off for the last 7-8 months or so. Overall between the physical systems and the fact that it has made my depression more serve (diagnosed with MDD about 10 years ago) I am calling quits. I am barely 23, I want to enjoy being a young women.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 32 and have never been on birth control but decided to give it a try because my periods have always been bad and recently my ovulation has turned painful too. My gyno prescribed Blisovi Fe and I started taking the pills the Sunday after my period started. Within 12 hours I had horrible nausea and vomiting. Then came the anxiety, headache that wouldn't go away, fatigue, and constipation. I felt like I wanted to jump out of my own skin. It made me feel crazy. After 2 pills I stopped, and now nearly 48 hours later I still have a headache and horrible fatigue.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel because I was on Lo LoEstrin and had horrible anxiety, mood swings & was miserable but I took it for 5 years because it was the only birth control that didn’t make me super sick! I got on here to read the reviews & was horrified and almost didn’t take it. IM SO GLAD I DECIDED TO TAKE IT ANYWAYS. I’m 22 y/o 5’5 about 110-115 pounds when I’m not on birth control. Now I’ve been on it for almost 2 months and have not gained any weight, my boobs may have gotten like half a size better. I’m 113lb in the morning & 115lb at night. On Lo Loestrin I was a constant 120lb. My crazy moods are better. I don’t have acne like everyone says in there reviews (I  take biotin every night and have for months because my acne is pretty bad). I’m not a heavy bleeder and this pill has worked great for me. I am literally the most sensitive person to anything hormonal so if it can work for me, don’t be afraid to try it because of bad reviews!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Taytulla pill for almost 2 years now and I can certainly relate to most of your side effects. However, I am very happy with the results, less painful periods and less blood flow that only lasts for 2 days at the most. Some months I have not even bleed at all. I was prescribed this pill to slow down my endometriosis and so far so good. Good advise, DO NOT USE YOUR INSURANCE!! Get the manufacturer coupons online and Walmart takes them, I pay $25.00 for 3 months supply, $65.00 at the most.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):For as long as I can remember I struggled with terrible PMS symptoms such as increased anxiety, depression, bloating, and cramping. I also had very heavy periods that lasted 6-7 days. Since starting Junel Fe pill I can honestly say my PMS symptoms have vastly improved. Under my doctors orders I am taking the pill continuously (skipping placebo's). So I have not had my period this month which has been a huge burden lifted. I have had minimal spotting for a couple of days but only enough to need a pantyliner. I have tried several other types of pills throughout my adult life and this is the only one I have been able to tolerate.  I have not experienced significant weight gain but have noticed a bit of a bloated feeling as well as some mild breakouts on my chest and face.  My breasts have increased in size, which has been nice as I'm normally a small B cup. I expect all of these side effects to dissipate after 3 months as according to my doctor it takes that long for the body to adjust.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel is by far the worst pill I have ever been on. I was not one to believe that switching a brand name for another brand would have any effect on me since the hormone level would stay the same. Guess again. My pharmacy switched my pill after my 3 month trial of microgestin 1.5/30 after I had finally levelled out after 3 months, I had no anxiety, my period regular. Well I got Junel in its place and it’s been a living nightmare. I was placed on the pill 15 years ago for anxiety and depression. Junel made me feel like I was on the verge of a mental break down daily, anxiety ridden, Uninterested in almost everything. Inside my head felt chaotic 24/7. And that was only one month of being on it. I’m a sound human being, it’s crazy what this medicine can do. My doctor has written me a prescription for only Microgestin. Beware.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this Larin Fe birth control for five months after being traumatized from depo provera. I literally begged my doctor for the BC pill with the lowest complaints and dosage. It’s been a miracle. So the Larin did did clear up my skin (maybe one to two zits a month), my periods are lighter but now consistent, no weight gain, no severe mood swings except right before my period... the only complaint is I cramp most of the month on it, light cramping but still kind of obnoxious. I still am very happy with this birth control thus far.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Microgestin Fe made my periods much lighter even to the point where I would skip one or two periods in between, helped my acne some over time although it did not clear it up completely but it was better than before. Also a few more headaches here and there. Only negative  thing I noticed, which could be due to other things, was my energy has been lower. Overall not too bad.

Larin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is Larin Fe is worst birth control... I've been on my period for almost a month, when normally my cycle only last 5 days. I have light cramps everyday, the bleeding is VERY heavy and it's completely zapped my energy.. I do not recommend!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took Junel Fe for about 1.25 years. Everything was fine (besides 2 random hot flashes in the beginning) for a while until about 1 year after I started taking it. Didn’t have my period for 84 days (Jan-May) and I got really freaked out and kept taking pregnancy tests which were all coming back negative. Apparently it can make you stop having a period after a while, which I cannot handle. Then I got my period again and was in some of the worst pain of my life. Switched to Larin, but I’m a little worried cuz a lot of people are reporting having more anxiety on it. I guess we’ll see...

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on this birth control because they stop making the birth control that was on originally. So my doctor prescribed me taytulla left for 2 months to try and the first month was amazing! My cycle came and I have no problem then I started my second pack of birth control after a week of taking it my cycle has started (again). I thought nothing of it until my cycle lasted 11 days. And then I started up my birth control again and then we get a half later I started my cycle yet again. I had to get my prescription refilled and then I had to pay out-of-pocket $176 because my health insurance did not cover it. So I bought it started it my cycle started the very next day after I started birth control. I am now on day 12 of my cycle and I'm furious.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I think what a lot of women need to keep in mind is that all our bodies differ. Birth control is tricky. Doctors prescribe what they think is best and, sometimes, that’s not the case. It’s only unfortunate that we have to subject our bodies to something that can potentially endanger us at the say of our doctor. Really, there is no perfect, super effective birth control without another saying otherwise. So, here I am, part of that small percentage, that loves Microgestin Fe birth control. I’ve been on it for three years. No complaints. No weird side effects and have I gotten pregnant. What’s awesome, is that my period is very timely—I LOVE knowing even it’ll arrive (I get it every month, always on a Tuesday or Wednesday, no later than) and it only lasts 3, 4 days at most. If you’re sexually active, this has proven helpful in maintaining a very strict schedule with your menstrual cycle. Microgestin  birth control  is a winner in my book.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I Haven’t had many problems with Blisovi  other than bad headaches and nausea when I take the pill wrong(miss a day or take it late ). The Blisovi is great for me, it helped my periods regulate and not be so heavy, also it cleared my acne right up .

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Personally I really love Lo Loestrin and I wanted to give a positive review as so many are negative. For those who want to know how effective is Lo Loestrin - it is great. I’ve been on it for a few years and it has given me such freedom with very light and short periods, I really had no side effects. I may have lost some weight but nothing significant, my skin is great, and I haven’t had cramps in years. It’s greatly improved my quality of life.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve taken this for a month now.  The only real side effect I notice is I gained tons of water weight.  Like 10 pounds worth despite changing nothing with my diet.  I get a little moody the first week, nothing crazy.  I was prescribed this because my periods were so heavy, I was constantly anemic.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking Junel for a little over 6 months now. When I first started taking it I had a light period for over 2 weeks straight. Since then I haven’t had a period at all. While I enjoy that, I find it really odd. Will definitely be making an appointment soon with my doctor.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Don't take Blisovi Fe 1/20, just don't do it, seriously it's not worth it. I was on this for TWO DAYS. Keep in mind, I have absolutely NO PRIOR HISTORY OF DEPRESSION OR ANXIETY!!!! I took this pill on Sunday night. I woke up Monday with the worst depression I've ever had, to the point where I thought I was going to do something harmful to myself. I took it again Monday night, and woke up Tuesday in the GREATEST MOOD... annnddd then it crashed BAD. Today was my first day off of it, and I am a depressed and anxious MESS. I hope that I return to normal. Don't take this. Seriously. I'm only 18 and I feel like I've completely hit rock bottom.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have only been on Taytulla for 5 days and I had a major emotional breakdown today and realized my anxiety has been getting worse and worse daily! Today was the worst I have ever been and usually I'm a pretty calm soul! My husband said you need to get off that BC immediately. I have had a tubal and was given samples of this to try to control my periods which are irregular and usually last 2 weeks. I'd rather have a 2 week long horrible period then put my family through me acting the way I did today. I'll be flushing the rest of these samples. Back to the drawing board doc.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this Lo Loestrin birth control to lessen cramps, prevent heavy bleeding & to halt the growth of cysts & polyps which I am prone to. Within the first few days I had light bleeding which is normal. In addition, my breasts were very tender for months which is also normal. The positives of this medication is my mood was very balanced, I did not experience emotional PMS symptoms anymore, & my period was very light & short. I personally could not tolerate the breast tenderness & constant break through bleeding. I lasted about four to six months on this birth control before switching.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m giving this a 4 only because: A.) didn’t get pregnant / B.) periods were little to none with almost no cramping. However, the depression and pure exhausted that comes with this pill is unbearable. I was on it for three years and thought it was just me. I was on antidepressants, I didn’t feel better until my doctor recommended going off of birth control to try. I was SO tired, couldn’t get out of bed some days to brush my teeth. Everything turned out to be fine after I stopped taking Lo Loestrin. Also - my back ached for months after stopping this BC. Didn’t experience any skin breakouts after stopping. Decent birth control if you don’t already have problems with depression or anxiety.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After reading some pretty bad reviews on here I was pretty hesitant to try this, but after being on Mibelas for about two years I started having stomach pain and breakthrough bleeding, so my dr prescribed this. Only been on it for a month but I feel great!! Had a little cramping and spotting in between periods but nothing crazy. Everyone is different when it comes to birth control, so don’t let negative reviews stop you from trying it! It also takes your body about 3 months to really adjust to the hormones anyways. Good luck out there!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I wish I could rate Junel Fe a 0, but I cannot. I developed really itchy skin, then it turned into hives EVERYWHERE on my body. I became extremely angry, anxious and depressed on this. I have never felt this way over a birth control  pill. The hives have taken over my body and I have gone to get looked at and turns out I'm allergic to it. My skin was perfect before and now its rough, dry & full of hives. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PILL AT AL COSTS!!!!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I began this pill and within 3 to 4 days of starting it, my lips began to swell and  turn patchy red with disturbed blood vessels. It felt like my lips were on fire. I did not eat ANYTHING new or try ANY new products that involved my lips other than this pill.I really hate this pill.I talked to my doctor.I am getting off this pill ASAP. Allergic reactions beware... -____-

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The only think worst than the 2 week long period (followed by a yeast infection) is my mood. I'm crying multiple times a day-- even at work. My anxiety is through the roof, causing stress and depression, which in my case leads to gastrointestinal issues (nausea and diarrhea). I've only been on this pill for a little while and I cannot wait to get off.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the only birth control I've ever taken. I've been on Lo Loestrin Fe for almost a year now. The first few months were definitely an adjustment for my body. I experienced inconsistent light spotting for weeks at a time and it took my body awhile to regulate.  After the first initial months, this problem improved significantly. Overall I think the pill works very well, my periods are short lasting 2-3 days and they are also extremely light, and the cramps I used to get are almost non existent. I experienced almost none of the expansive range of side effects people often report. My weight maintained, no breakouts, or shifts in mood. If you can stick out the first initial months, its worth it, in my opinion!

Gildess Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 27 and had been on the same birth control since I was 15 years old. After having a baby that brand was discontinued and my insurance sent me Gildess. Within a few months I started having really bad anxiety. Eventually I started having panic attacks before work ( ER nurse). My midwife wanted to put me on anxiety medication and I didn't like that. Instead I impulsively quit my job that I worked so hard to get. I've always been an anxious person but never this bad. Looking back I think it's all related to the birth control. I exercise daily and eat pretty healthy and still have about a 3lb weight fluctuation throughout my cycle with awful bloating. It's bad enough that for 1-2 weeks throughout my cycle I have to wear a size bigger in my pants. The mood swings are awful. I tend to be level headed but now catch myself feeling grumpy about things that normally wouldn't bother me. One week I have a lot of energy and the next I don't sleep well have night sweats and feel depressed.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill is the worst! Never been a fan of birth control. Doctor recommended it due to my extreme menstrual cycles with heavy bleeding and cramps - you know the kind of 'call out of work type pain'. I gained weight within 3 months and bleed for 3.5 months consecutively with cramping and major mood swings! My doctor insisted that I remain on it. I decided to stop this pill. I feel back to my happy self and the irregular periods have stopped! I've even loss weight. This pill is an absolute NO for me!!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Blisovi Fe 1/20 has worked as a birth control method. However, I've experienced mood swings which are very unusual for me. Before the pill I had irregular periods and at first the periods became more timely and lately I have missed my period for the last 4 months and I am not pregnant (I've checked). I've not noticed any change with my weight, face skin, or sex drive.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I usually don't write reviews for things,  I just read them most of the time... but I felt that I should leave a comment after seeing how most of the other reviews were negative. I've been taking Taytulla for 4 going on 5 years now! I've never had issues really other than usually around the middle of my cycle I will bleed a little bit for a day. Other than that this birth control has been great! I never experienced sickness, and I never lost/gained a ton of weight. I overall think this birth control is great especially for women who have low hormone levels and need a boost to get them back where they need to be.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):AWFUL. I NEVER EVER post reviews but felt compelled to write about my experience. I’m 5’5 and have weighed 120 lbs the past 20 yrs. I never dieted or was a health nut about food whatsoever. I typically ate what I wanted to in moderation. After changing to Blisovi I put on 8 lbs in 6 mos and just could not shed the lbs. Clothes that I have worn for 20 yrs no longer fit; my body shape has really expanded in the waist & thighs. My insurance had stopped sending me Junel 24 and substituted this brand. I didn’t think a lot about it at the time as they say the formulation is the same. Finally a month ago I connected the dots and am switching back to Junel 24 FE. I’m hoping my body reverts back to what it used to look like soon. Birth controls affects people differently, but avoid this altogether or have a heightened awareness as to side effects if you start taking it. It’s interesting to read other comments about brain fog as well as that has also been a problem for me the last several months.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Lo Lestrin Fe for about 2 years now.  In the beginning everything was great.  No mood swings, no weight gain,  no depression or anxiety. However, that has changed. I've gained 30 pounds, even with dieting and exercise the weight isn't coming off. I weighed 134lb when I started the pill, now I'm 157lb. In addition to the weight gain, I developed chronic hives, which I have a prescription for. At times I do get depressed, so I made the decision to stop taking the pills.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first time I took this I was on it for a year. When I went in for my annual I told my Dr. I had horrible crippling depression and anxiety and we both thought it was due to all my life changes (graduating nursing school, getting a new job, moving out of my parents house, planning a wedding). When I told her I was having breakthrough bleeding on this pill, she switched me to a different pill. My depression and anxiety immediately got better. I recently started taking it again (after pregnancy and breastfeeding). I’ve only been on it 2 months and the depression is horrible. I have thoughts of self harm and am just so down. I’m ALWAYS hungry and tired. I know this pill doesn’t have the same effects on everyone, but just be careful and aware of these possible side effects before getting on this pill. I believed by my doctor that these symptoms were not in any way related to the pill, and clearly they are.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched from Lo Loestrin Fe to Blisovi 24 Fe about a year ago and thank goodness I did. In the short time I was on Lo Loestrin Fe I had mood swings, exhaustion, depression, and I just didn’t feel like myself. When I switched to Blisovi 24 Fe all of those emotional problems went away and I feel like myself again.Also my periods are a ton lighter than before, I used to have about 6 day periods with heavy cramping and now I have light periods with no cramping that only last about 2 days.I haven’t had any issues with acne. I have gained about 10 pounds in the year that I’ve been on the pill so that would be my only complaint. Overall I feel healthy on this bc.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I went on Lo Loestrin Fe when I first got married. I was only on it for a few months due to the cost and during that time I was constantly having mood swings, exhaustion, and depression. I felt crazy. I switched to a different birth control  (Blisovi 24 Fe) and those issues pretty much stopped soon after  and I’ve been on the new birth control for a year and haven’t experienced those issues with it. I know everyone’s body responds differently, but I would NEVER go on this bc ever again.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Lo Loestrin FE is a very solid birth control, the side effects took a while to go away but when they did I had no problems. After the first 3 months, and for 3 months, I was nauseous all day every day and spot bleeding constantly, but since month 6 I have had no problems, except for missing my period for 103 days. That was weird but who knows why (I got my period now so it wasn't pregnancy). If you can stick out the side effects I would recommend, but also keep in mind that you'll get side effects with any birth control you're on. Just stick with it. Also, the last 4 reminder pills in a pack taste like root beer. Pretty neat

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My side effects on Taytulla are depression, uncontrollable emotional swings, irritable, weight gain, random periods, headaches, appetite change, cramps, weird discharge, and fatigue. My insurance covered most of the prescription. It still came out to $60 a month. This drug is not worth the money or your time.

Melodetta 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I gained 30 pounds once I started taking Melodetta 24 Fe birth control. My appetite dramatically increased and I felt I was always hungry. I also had SEVERE boob pain while taking this pill. I couldn't even brush something against my boobs accidentally without horrible pain. The boob pain was the worst side effect.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ll start off by saying this pill gave  me all the side effects but at least I didn't get pregnant, which was the point. I’ve gained 17 pounds of weight in the 8 months I’ve been on it, I'm ALWAYS bloated, my anxiety is on 1000, and it’s hard for me to do simple tasks without being overwhelmed by my emotions. Other than the weight gain, anxiety, and extreme mood swings, the pill did what it was supposed to do. Every body reacts differently.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Had the worst side effects ever on Junel Fe1/20 with severe migraines every single day. I was nauseous as well. I had to go to emergency care once because my blood pressure was high. They said it was my birth control and to get off of it immediately. I’m very healthy and have never felt anything that this birth control  (BC) made me feel!! Worst BC ever!! I did not feel like myself and nothing seemed to help. That’s how bad it was!! I was seeing a therapist for about a month because my hormones were so messed up. I was depressed and had severe anxiety.

Loestrin 21 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This  Loestrin pill is terrible! The first week of taking it caused me to have unbelievable dizziness and nausea to a point where I thought I was going to collapse! I became snappy, irritated and depressed every single day and I would have the odd spot that was very sore on my chin, forehead and cheeks that took longer to heal than when I wasn’t on this pill. Strange pin prick spots that were very sore appeared on my fingers and toes after visiting the doctor twice they could only put it down to this pill. After another 6 months of taking this pill I suddenly had migraines which landed me in the doctors twice and a hospital visit as I thought I was having a stroke! I have now discontinued this pill due to this and I am now happy, head pain free and feel absolutely amazing! I should have stopped taking this pill a long time ago! Please be careful if your prescribed with this pill and stop immediately if you have any sickness or dizziness as that’s just the start of it all!
Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I don’t know what’s in this stuff but I have no appetite, my boobs won’t stop getting bigger, and my libido is off the charts. Wow!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Terrible acne, depression, moodiness, and severe bleeding. After less than a week of taking this. I do not recommend for people that have a hard time taking hormones, even the low doses effected my body terribly

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Honestly never had a problem with Junel Fe1/20.  I have been on it for 4 years, never gained weight, cleared up my acne, and never gave me mood swings. I use it continuously (never have period) and it has been great. Tbh, give it a shot and use it for longer than 3 months and you'll be fine.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible! I have gained almost 10lbs in two months of being on Taytulla. Heavier periods and cramps as well. I am waiting to finish this pack before I stop and I really hope this weight will come off as fast as it went on.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve used birth control for over 10 years. I’ve used Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 for majority of that time. I’ve also used the patch (no complaints other than it would give me a small rash on the area that I applied it on). Microgestin Fe 1/20 was my least favorite. I didn’t get my period the first 4 months. I gained weighed (10-15 pounds). I hit the gym everyday for about 2 hours. I ran 5-7 miles a day, ate clean and I could not lose the weight. I had mood swings. I just got off it. As soon as I went back to Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (my regular birth control)  I dropped all the weight, my period came back, and my mood swings went away. I’ve always been regular. Please read reviews before you try something.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you want to know how severe these side effects can get-keep reading. So I’ve been on Junel for two months now. This past week both my mom and dad stayed home from work because I became suicidal, manic, and more ANGRY THAN I HAVE EVER BEEN FOR A WEEK STRAIGHT literally for no reason. I broke my new iPhone 8 Plus ( for no reason) and then started ripping my hair out bc I was so distraught) I cry for no reason. I panic to the point that my throat feels like it’s closing up. I can’t stay in a store more than 5 minutes because the anxiety starts to turn into a panic attack and I just start staring at the floor.. etc etc.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started having panic attacks during the placebo pill week of taking Nortrel 1/35. I am not one to have panic attacks... at all. Just recently, (over a year after the panic attacks started), I realized I was switched to this from my original Necon around the time I started having the attacks. My doctor switched me back to Necon, I took the first pill and the next day... panic attack. I've been reading women say they have panic attacks when they're taking this. Mine is the opposite. I have them when I'm not on it. How weird is that? I'm thinking it's going to take a total readjustment of my body to get over it but these panic attacks are debilitating. I dont know what to do. I feel so helpless and stuck.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was hesitant from trying birth control again but this pill really helped me and didn't give me any harsh side affects. I'm sensitive to medication but this helped decrease my painful cramps to the point I didn't cramp at all. My skin cleared up, I lost weight,  no major mood swings or depressing symptoms.  Some birth contols like Trinessa, Yaz, and Ortho Tri Cyclin gave me major negative side effects. Lo Loestrin  Fe is an ultra low dosage which is why I think it worked with me. Anyways and I'm not on it any more since my insurance changed. Kinda sad about it.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL! Believe every negative side effect. Paranoia, extreme anger, acne, severe cramping, fluctuate between no sleep to extreme fatigue. The list goes on. It’s awful. Worst experience of my life.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm being generous of giving this a 2, because it seems to affect some others differently. I'm 3 weeks in, have bled for a week and a half now, have serious cramps, nausea, and out of body mood/temper. Was on Ortho Tri Cyclin back in the day and was fine. Never understood others when they said birth control drove them crazy. I now see what them mean!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel Fe 1/20 been okay. At first I was ungodly nauseated every day, so I started taking it at night before bed and I think that's helped. Also, I got extremely depressed at first, which was awful. But, it's slowly easing up. Sex drive has  entirely  gone though. That's my biggest complaint. Acne is much much much better. But my sex drive is shot, even when I'm trying to be intimate, it's just not the same. Otherwise after the first 3 weeks this pill seems to be working fine, took a little while to work out the kinks, but I'm getting there. I hope my sex life rebounds.
Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking this pill for 1year I noticed I’ve lost weight and bleed a lot

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this pill for two years and it made my period shorter and lessened the cramps. I decided to stop putting hormones in my body and after one week, I was a different person! Not depressed anymore and much more optimistic. I would never go back to taking this pill.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was given Junel Fe 1/20 twice by my pharmacy because "they can give out generic unless your doctor said you can't", and it has made my life a living nightmare. I was unbelievably moody, I had an increased appetite, and I developed a splenic infarct (blood clot in my spleen). I would never recommend this to anyone

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Terrible!!! Constant migraines. On Taytulla birth control I’ve had two periods each month. I still bleed just as much. If I’m not on my period I spot every other day. I also have had super bad anxiety attacks as well as depression. Switching off this birth control this week!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):6 months ago I was switched from Glidess to this. After switching I had absolutely no sex drive & was moody. 3 months after I started this medication I had gained 10 lbs (I work with a trainer & eat healthy) & started to become sick. I had horrible cramps with constipation or diarrhea & nausea every day. I went to see a specialist & was advised to take tests to see what was wrong (really expensive)! I finally made the connection that it could possibly be my birth control even though my pharmacist & doctor said there was 0 chance that was it. I stopped taking this pill & days later I was fine. No more cramping, diarrhea or constipation, nausea, and bloating. (I’m losing weight back to my normal self) My sex drive is back to normal too. I wrote this so others who have the same issue can be warned. I thought I had celiacs, a food allergy, or an intestinal issue, that’s how sick I was. This pill ruined my life for 6 months.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on Junel Fe 1/20 at age 18. It did what it was supposed to- regulate my periods. I don’t think I experienced many side effects aside from one- insane weight gain. I know it’s said that birth control doesn’t cause weight gain, but I don’t think it makes sense otherwise that I gained about FOURTY POUNDS in a few months. Since stopping, my weight has stabilized but I haven’t lost it- I’m hoping this summer I’ll be able to knock off some of the weight. Before Junel I was underweight and pretty thin- now I have stretch marks, don’t fit into my clothes, and have a gut. Not a fan- would rather have seasonal horrific periods then have that weight gain.

Larin 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on many different pills and this is the worst. For almost the whole 2nd month I had horrible PMS pain and my period lasted for TWO WEEKS!!!!!! I normally have quite heavy periods (with large clots) and I get pretty bad back pain from them, but what this pill caused was so much worse. I would think it was over and then go to the restroom and my underwear had blood in it. I woke up every morning with horrendous back pain which is not normal for me (for some reason I've always gotten back pain from my period instead of cramping in the upper pubic area, but I've never had it this severe). I feel exhausted and unmotivated. All I want to do is sleep. My stomach is upset most of the day. All of this happened while I was on holiday in Europe. Needless to say I'm done with this pill. I'm on the last week of the 3rd month so I'm going to finish it out even though I feel horrible. I've never had side effects from birth control, nothing even close to this.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I had been taking Junel 24 Fe for a few years now and at the beginning of the year was switched to Blisovi for I was told Junel was no longer on the market. I loved Junel. I had no weight issues, medicine worked as intended.Now that I'm on Blisovi, I have gained close to 30 pounds in a matter of 3 months. I was gaining roughly 2 pounds a week at the beginning and now gaining 4 or 5 pounds a week. I never had many issues with my weight. 115ish at 5'1. I'm now at 152lb at my latest weigh in. This is the most I ever weighed in my life. And I'm considered obese. Besides that, my mood swings have been terrible. I used to never fight with my boyfriend and now constantly do and I hate it. We used get along so well. I have also been extremely paranoid about so many things that it makes me physically sick. I would not recommend this medication to anyone unless it's your only option for BC.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am almost done with my first pack of this birth control to help with my irregular & painful periods. It has helped with pain and not caused me any pain BUT I have gotten horrible acne on my chest and chin & my face skin has been super red and itchy. I am so glad to see other people are experiencing this. I will no longer be taking this medicine.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT shy away from Blisovi Fe 1/20 by horrible reviews. Most people are usually only motivated to post a review when having a bad experience with a birth control, people who are satisfied, usually do not share their experience. However, I've been taking this for about a year now, and it has controlled my PMS by like 95% and has lightened my period almost completely. I have acne-prone skin, and iIcan confidently tell you that my face, as well as my friend's skin, has completely cleared up after a month of using this BC. Experience may definitely vary between people, but my friend who uses blisovi fe 1/20 has such a positive experience and recommended it to me, and I can say the same. I have not seen any noticeable weight gain or weight loss. Give it a try for at least 2-3 months before trying something else! It takes a month or so for your body to get used to the hormonal changes, and may not experience full benefits until then.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Loestrin Fe for about 6 years, for bad periods but decided to take a break in 2015. I have not been able to go back on it. This last time I was on it for about 2 1/2 months. My anxiety and depression were through the roof, I started having acne at 44 years old. When I realized I had to stop it immediately is that I started having extreme back pain and aches all over my body. I went to the doctor and didn't come up with anything. So, I have stopped it. I am day 3 off of it and I woke up with the worse migraine, I guess my body is readjusting.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been using this birth control for over 2 years, and at this point I feel like I have seen no new side effects. I like that it has made me period very light and lasting only about 4 days, and that it has cleared my skin. I came to realize recently though, that my 30+ pounds of weight gain has been due to the birth control— I never had that big of an appetite before taking this and now it is never satisfied. It also has not helped my terrible migraines that I get while PMSing. On my period, I tend to be depressive and get into a really dark place. I know that medications affect people differently, but if you’re prone to those kinds of thoughts I would definitely avoid this medication.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS MEDICATION. I started Nortrel 1/35 in Dec 2017.  I became extremely anxious, depressed, extremely moody and would go from happy to sad or mad in a matter of seconds. I stopped taking this in January 2019, and all of the side effects subsided. Not realizing it was from the birth control, I started back up on it two weeks ago and I have been breaking out so bad, my moods are all over the place, my anxiety is worse than ever. I decided to look up reviews because starting this pill again was the only recent change in my life and now it all makes sense. I’ve also gained 5lbs in the two weeks I’ve been back on it and started my period yesterday when I’m not supposed to have my period for another full week. This pill is awful!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I only went through 3 rows of Blisovi Fe 1/20 and my face broke out in painful acne!!!! Horrible acne. I had night sweats and weird dreams. Hungry all the time! Not worth it for me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Junel Fe 1/20 for 2 weeks, and I changed instantly as a person, my personality changed dramatically, I didn’t even know who I was after being on this, I got depressed, I cried for no reason, I felt really crazy from it. As soon as I stopped taking it I felt instantly better, I became myself again.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on Blisovi FE when they discontinued Microgestrin and the only reason I am giving it 3 starts is because it prevented me from pregnancy which is the main goal of birth control pills. I was on this pill for about 6 months until I started to feel sick everyday - major brain fog, dizziness everyday, exhausted, abdominal swelling and more. Never did I think it was the Blisovi because I had been just fine for 6 months. After being on this pill over a year I have finally found my answer to all my symptoms as I got off this pill and feel normal again - it messed up my entire body. I would see if this works for you but know what side effects it has.
Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT USE IF PRONE TO HEADACHESThis birth control gave me a migraine every night

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm currently on my 6th month of taking Lo Loestrin Fe for heavy periods, and it has definitely made my life better.  I spotted daily the entire first month.  The 1st few months my period was definitely shorter and lighter, but I had some crazy cramps.  The cramps are much better now, lessened over time.  I haven't really experienced any psychological effects, I feel like it has stabilized my mood more.  A few times I forgot and took the pill late and experienced nausea and bleeding.  So I definitely recommend taking it regularly at the same time every day, or you will experience side effects!  Overall it has worked well for me.. I have a much easier to deal with period that lasts about 3 days, I have a lot more energy because I'm not anemic anymore, I'm spending less on pads/tampons, my hair seems to be a bit thicker, and I haven't experienced any negative effects on my skin.  It is also fully covered through my CVS Caremark insurance.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Please, please, please, avoid this pill. I was given this pill around the age of 34 because my periods became very irregular and heavy. I took this pill for 3 months and I gained 30 lbs. I just started feeling heavier and heavier. I stopped after 3 months of taking it and I started having chest pains and losing my breath frequently. I now have hypertension that I can't get rid of even after losing the weight I gained. I'm not a fit fanatic but I do eat well and exercise some. I'm now on 60 mg daily of blood pressure medicine and I blame this pill! This pill forever altered my life and I can't wait for a class action lawsuit to follow for poisoning us!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 38 years old and this is the first birth control I've ever tried.  My gynecologist recommended it for my crazy PMS and sudden onset of adult acne. I was absolutely terrified to start it especially after reading some of the horrific reviews of the side effects, but I realized all of the side effects that others were experiencing were what I was already experiencing without the birth control.  I decided to give it a try and I am so glad I did.  The first few weeks were slighty slightly unpleasant. I had a headache every day and a lot of unwanted spotting, but I remember my Dr telling me to give it time.  I am now going into my second month and I feel better than ever.  My period only lasted one day. I had zero cramps and zero  psycho episodes of PMS. My anxiety is almost non existent. Everyone reacts differently. I encourage you to find out how it works for you because had I  listened to the scary reviews  I wouldn't be feeling as great as I  do now.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been taking Blisovi Fe for about a month and I noticed after the first 2 days of taking it that it increased my appetite like I always wanted to eat was never full. Then after a week of taking it I noticed that I had diarrhea at least 3 times a day and that alone drained me. All of the little energy I did have the longer I took it the more  the energy disappeared. I realized that it wasn’t the food I’d been eating it was the birth control.  Then I started feeling sickkkkkk to my stomach the worst stomach aches EVER in my upper abdomen, lost sleep I wouldn’t recommend this birth control to my worst enemy I have a 3 year old and a 9 month old that I have to take care of and on top of the Diarrhea loss of sleep at night and the severe stomach pain I’ve decided to discontinue using this birth control it’s not worth my health.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Lo Loestrin Fe for two months for PCOS. I had a great experience. The biggest side effect I had was very noticeable water retention, and I gained about 6 pounds. However, it was truly a lifesaver and reduced my PCOS symptoms amazingly.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the first birth control I have ever been on and I was skeptical after reading all the bad reviews before ever even trying it. I let the first pick sit unopened on my nightstand for almost 2 months before finally working up the nerve to take the first pull. Everyone’s body reacts differently to different hormones. So far I’ve been on Blisolvi Fe 1/20 for 3 months and haven’t had any major side effects. The only cons I can think of is that I spot a lot and I have noticed an increase of appetite, especially cravings for unhealthy foods so that’s weird. Even if your birth control is making you hungry, you ultimately control what you put in your body (even if it feel like you don't!). If you eat healthy and stay active you should have no problems. I had bad hormonal acne and now it’s pretty much all gone. It’s also helped with my period cramping. Don’t let the negative reviews scare you away because you may be pleasantly surprised. If you don’t like it, just try something different :)

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill because my lower dosage was giving me issues but I will try that pill again.  This pill, Junel Fe, is absolutely horrific.  If I'm not spotting, I have a yeast infection.  There is no break for me. Once the yeast infection is gone, I get my period. Then the cycle continues. I have had THREE yeast infections in the past month and a half. Talked to my gyno and she said this is probably what is causing the yeast infections, as there is a higher dose of estrogen. Definitely would not recommend. The stars are only because it did prevent pregnancy.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My OBGYN prescribed this specific pill for me because I haven’t been on birth control since I was 19 ( I’m 25 now). He said it would be easy going for me because  it’s basically the mildest form of  BC I can take.  My first month on the pill was rough, I felt so nauseous especially the hour before I’m suppose to take my BC. I had constant headaches & tender breast (the doctor warned me of that & said it should subside after the 1st month, it didn’t). My breast grew after the 2nd month on the pill, but my anxiety also heightened. I had 3 panic attacks during my 2nd month. I was thankful that my period was lighter. Haven’t had sex since I’ve been on the pill, I’d say it has lowered my sex drive only because it’s made me so depressed, anxious and forgetful that I don’t even think about sex. I’m too moody. 3rd month was awful and I hit a real low, I’ve become more critical of myself, and unhappy with everything in my life.

Lomedia 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I tried this birth control a few months for shorter and lighter periods. Plus my previous pill lo ogestrel gave me horrible headaches all month to the point I was tired.  Lomedia did do its job as far as that. I had 4 day long periods, which was the shortest ever with me. My periods were almost always 6-7 days with or without birth control. But the cramps the first 2 days were so bad I could barely get out of bed. And my cramps even before my pill days were never bad. I gave it 3 months. Never subsided. So I was switched back to lutera. The only reason I gave it a 5 was for short periods and no weight gain.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The absolute WORST! I've experienced headaches, depression, anxiety, high blood pressure, sweats, low sex drive and fatigue.  PLEASE TAKE THIS PILL OFF THE MARKET.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first two months on Taytulla were smooth sailing. I already suffer from anxiety so it was fairly normal to feel anxious and anxiety. I started my third pack and I have been nauseous and throwing up every single day for the last two weeks. I’ve dropped 15 pounds and unable to hold anything down for the first three hours in the morning. This sent me to the ER due to dehydration and lack of appetite. I have discontinued Taytulla and am working with my doctor in finding a BC that works for me.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Taytulla birth control and instantly started getting the worst anxiety in my entire life. Sadly, I have enough things going on that I wasn't able to pinpoint it to this medicine right away. I wenton two anxiety meds which made my anxiety even worse. The bottom line is, as soon as I quit Taytulla, my life returned to normal after a few days. It was the single worst experience I've ever had in my entire life.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So what I found in the first month was that my period was at the same time cuz my body was still adjusting to the pill. During the second month, I got my period for 3 weeks!!! From the second week until the start of the third pack of pills!!!! Not just light spotting, full on period. My acne was ok, but I got a lot of it on my back since I started taking it which is frustrating. I’ve noticed that I have A LOT of mood swings. I feel almost bipolar in the fact that my mood goes from super happy and chatty to just crying and not talking at all. The mood swings have been difficult on not just me but my boyfriend has a hard time maintaining these two drastic changes, he does great at trying but it sucks.I hate how grumpy I get an hour or two after I take the pill when I would be having the best time with my boyfriend anyways, this pill has helped me to NOT become pregnant and it does it’s job. My body just isn’t having it lol

While I was on the combination birth control pill for 2 years and 7 months, age 40 (July 2015 start) I started to deal with nausea 2 years exactly after being on it. I then started to deal with anxiety and getting extremely irritated. My libido crashed too, literally. I became extremely tired with hot and cold flashes, palpitations and balance/vertigo issues at 2 years and 7 months. It was the worst nightmare putting my entire life on hold, dropping out of college and literally missing days of work and going to the ER like 3 times to figure out what was wrong. Not one doctor could give me an answer until I discovered a naturopathic doctor who was able to help with all my symptoms. I am currently still dealing with vertigo.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This BC made me sick. I’ve had severe stomach pains and vomiting. I don’t recommend.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I like this pill Loestrin 24 Fe, I do not have mood swings, weight gain or acne. So far it has pretty much stopped my periods each month. I just get very very light spotting for 2 - 3 days instead of a full blown period. I've been on other pills and I like this one better.
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have only been using this rubbish for 3 weeks now, and it made my severe acne 10 times worse and I gained over 15 pounds...
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):With Taytulla I had insomnia, migraine, depression, severe cramps, period with heavy flow twice a month. I do not recommend this drug. Stay away

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Blisovi Fe 1/20 as my first birth control and was only on it for 10 days. At first I didn't think I had any side effects, but the more I thought about it the more I realized that  the little things that were off about me had to be related to this birth control. I haven't been able to sleep very well; I keep having strange dreams that wake me up several times a night. I've been easily agitated and anxious. My stomach is constantly upset when I eat but I don't really have much of an appetite. I've decided to stop taking this medication and will be requesting to be put on a different pill. I read these reviews before starting it and should have listened.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking this birth control for a couple of months and it has been an emotional rollercoaster. Shortness of breath, nausea, weight gain, horrible menstrual cramps, periods in between periods. Its been awful.. I would not recommend this pill to anyone.
Briellyn (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Briellyn gave me HORRIBLE cystic acne. Would not recommend.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first experience with birth control ever. The only reason I'm not giving it a 0 is because I didn't get pregnant the two years I was on it. However I did managed to gain 100lbs (no joke) taking this and many other weird health issues arose taking this. I've NEVER had such an issue with my weight or my health. Once I got off it "shockingly" my health has improved.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this pill for 7 months, I started to breakthrough bleed after month 3 every 2 weeks.  I thought this would go away but it got worse so I am switching to a different pill.  No huge side effects with this pill but it under performed and made me stressed about its effectiveness the whole time.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you have an anxiety disorder do not take Taytulla birth control. I have it and taking the first pill my heart rate increased, I was shaking sweating and felt really bad. Probably it works for people without an anxiety  disorder. But it is not for me!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):IF YOU HAVE ANXIETY/DEPRESSION TO NOT TAKE BLISOVI FE 1/20!!! Seriously, I went into horrible mood swings and would constantly be at a low or a high. Irritability was so bad I couldn't be around anyone without going off on them. The boob soreness was constant and it made me have large amounts of acne. I also found an increased appetite on this and gained a total of 20 pounds! I just recently switched and my mood has gone back to how I was before.... it's absolutely insane what this did to me. Please take this into consideration as I don't wish this on anyone. Absolutely the worst 6 months, I thought I lost my mind.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is horrible I been on my period for two weeks and it’s horrible. I started on this pill when my last cycle begin and I haven’t came off yet. I stopped taking these pills and I will never take these pills again. After this horrible experience I will never get back on birth control pills again

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was taking Junel 1/20 for 3 months . First month went very well and I had no side effects hence I continued taking pills . It is working well to prevent pregnancy but on the 2nd month I felt side effects of it . I was very moody and could easily start crying all of sudden. I experienced some bleeding between periods which didn't make me feel comfortable but I knew it was a side effect so I didn't pay much attention to it . One night during making love we noticed bleeding again. And it kept bothering me for the next 2 days . And on the 3rd month of taking pills my breast became very tender and I experienced pain and lump in the breast . I went for ultrasound everything seems well so far but my gut feeling tell me to stop taking this pills because I don't like what it s doing to my body .

Layolis Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for the better part of a year. I switched from something else bc I was having horrible periods. I should have just dealt with that birth control I have had the worst side effects being on this pill. First off, never had a problem with having sex and now I do. It burns every time after now. I’ve had on and off UTIs/yeast infections. Never happened before. Last one I had was 10 years ago prior to this birth control. I have to take a supplement to control it. Also, probably the scariest thing is I have a weird vaginal discharge that would come out every time I urinate. I have an ob appointment April 10. Hopefully can get on something else then.
Ortho-Novum 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is an awful pill that made me depressed and have crying fits for no reason. These issues went away as soon as I went off it.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control about two months ago. Within the first two weeks on the pill, I was spotting everyday and experiencing terrible abdominal pain. I thought nothing of it, and continued taking it. A week later, my anxiety started to build up. I was having frequent panic attacks, and angry episodes. I would lash out at everyone around me; my friends, my family. And I started to complain about everything my boyfriend did, I was never happy. One little thing would tick me off and I would be down about it for the entire day, or sometimes the entire week. I CANNOT stress enough how angry the pill made me, I was pushing everyone away. My experience with this brand of birth control was not great, and I would not recommend it if you have experienced these side effects with different birth controls, or if you are prone to depression.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It’s been two months since I’ve been on this new birth control. The first month I didn’t really have any side effects other then my acne flaring up and a super light period. The second month my acne calmed down, and my period was a little heavier but here comes the side effects. I started having horrible nightmares, and waking up drenched in sweat. I would have hot flashes all through the day, and I was extremely tired. My anxiety was high and I had mood swings. I couldn’t figure out what was wrong with me, I wanted to go to the ER because I felt like I could barely breathe, and the hot flashes were so intense I was scared I was going to pass out. I realized it was the birth control! I was skeptical of these bad reviews from people when I researched the pill before taking it, but sadly it’s true! Horrible experience. I gave 2 stars because my acne did clear up a bit and it prevented pregnancy.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I actually haven’t had any problems with Taytulla. I got a 3 month sample pack from my doctor. I had the implanon for about 4 years before this with many issues. On Tatyulla my periods have been only around 4 days long which has been an amazing change. I just called to get a refill because I ran out of the samples packs and it was $323 with my insurance which I think is insane so I will be switching to a different pill that’s more affordable. But besides the price the pill worked great for me with no negative side effects.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control was the worst I have ever been on. It was the first one I ever tried and made me gain 25 pounds in about 2 months. It was horrible and I still haven't been able to lose the weight. I do not recommend whatsoever

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on it for nearly two months now. First month was fine, and my period was amazing. I normally have AWFUL periods with so much pain I vomit and HEAVY bleeding but the pill made all of that stop. But now going on month two there isn't a day that goes by where I don't feel ill. Dizzy, nauseous, headaches, mood swings, really weird dissociation, abdominal pain and cramping – I'm going to stop taking the pill immediately because I can't take it. I would rather have a week a month of an awful period than feeling like this everyday. I might try another kind of birth control but I'm hesitant because I don't want to go through this again, and I'm only using it to regulate my period so I'm honestly not sure if it's worth it.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill definitely has some benefits and disadvantages. First three months, I was extremely moody and bleed for about a month straight but once everything levelled out I was fine. No period and no mood swings. BUT since then, I have trouble with vaginal dryness even when I'm really in mood so that sucks and I missed the pill twice during break and now I've had this unexplained discharge for about 3 months
Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been taking  Lo Loestrin Fe for three months now and haven't had any problems so far. I like it only had a period once for three days.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Blisovi 24 Fe birth control 4 months ago, at first everything seemed ok but these last 2 months have been horrible. I am 30 years old and I have NEVER had any issues with acne. Now I'm constantly finding new bumps popping up around my chin and forehead. The last 8 or so days left in my pack I feel like complete crap. My stomach constantly cramps, I feel constipated, I feel nauseous, I have headaches, I feel tired and I'm constantly hungry. I'm bloated all of the time. My doctor has now changed me to Junel ... hoping for better luck .

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This - Junel Fe 24 - my first birth control pill I've taken in my life. I began my pill on a the Sunday which was the 5th day of my period. The first week was fine except for nausea and a small breakout on my forehead. Everything was just peachy until the second week of taking these pills, I began having brown breakthrough bleeding ever since and it has not stopped! It's annoying having to constantly wear and buy panty-liners. Hopefully my body adjusts in time and the bleeding goes away.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Overall this was not the birth control for me. I am super active and always felt really good about my body. I’m 18 years old and Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 was my first BC. I gained weight, broke out, experienced horrible mood swings (I honestly cried all the time), and my periods felt worse than before. I was on this pill for 5 months and it was not great. I felt so sad and the mood swings were causing me to ruin relationships with those around me. I’ve been taking Taytulla for 4 months now and I have been having a great experience with it. I know everyone’s body reacts differently but just thought I should share my experience with this pill. My new gyno  also said this was too high of a dosage for me and I should’ve never been put on this BC.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla is the third birth control I've tried and I love it. I barely get a period anymore (light spotting) which is great for me because I used to experience really heavy bleeding and awful cramps. I've experienced some changes in appetite but with no weight gain, my anxiety hasn't worsened (a severe side effect of another pill I was on), and my cramps are relatively non-existent. I plan on continuing to use this birth control for a long time.

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This  Primella birth control is great,  pretty much no periods just slight cramping. I used to have very heavy, painful periods. No weight gain and seems to help acne too. I'm on my 3rd pack and suddenly starting to get so emotional and down feeling.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Taytulla  made me get my period for 20 out of the 30 days in a month.  I've been on it for three-four months and at first my skin was the same and now I'm breaking out like crazy. I went on bc to help my skin and this made it worse. I'm also exhausted all the time now so I'm going to call my doctor and see how to get off this pill

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Okay so Lo Loestrin Fe gave me literally the worst acne of my life, I'm not being dramatic, this was awful. Got switched off of it for a while because of it. If you think you won't get acne because of this you are wrong. I still have acne left over from this and I've been off of it for a few months. Ruined my face. Good luck!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have never had a single side effect and taytulla is the only birth control that I have ever used! I have been on it for over a year and a half and it works great for me!! The only thing I’ve noticed is that I haven’t really had my period the way I used to (no, I’m not pregnant :) ) but other than that, I love it!
