Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was so skeptical to begin taking this because I read the reviews beforehand but after being on it for a full month now, I can say I think I found the one. My boobs grew just enough, light period, and virtually no cramps. I used to not even be able to get out of bed because of my cramps and it is so nice to be able to actually function the first couple days of my period.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Junel Fe for almost a month and I CAN'T STOP BLEEDING! On top of the ruined underwear and annoyance, I have experienced lower abdominal discomfort (light cramping), headaches, low libido, and my anxiety has spiked. It has been a nightmare, I plan on talking to my doctor ASAP because nothing about this situation is pleasant.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched from the Depo shot to Taytulla because I had been bleeding everyday since I started it the depo. 4 days into starting Taytulla I stopped bleeding! My periods are now very regular and I have not had any side effects other than tender breasts. No cramps, no mood swings, anxiety/depression etc. Many people said that they gained weight on this pill but my weight has not changed at all. I’ve only been on this pill for 3 months so if anything changes I’ll give an update! Overall this birth control is doing everything right.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My original prescription was for Microgestin which I’ve been taking for 4 years. When I was given Blisovi, I asked my doctor was assured it was the same formula so I began my first month supply without fear. I began waking up every morning so nauseous that I felt like passing out. I thought it was from skipping breakfast, so I made sure to eat every morning, no change. I waited it out and see if it would pass in month 2 when body fully adjusts. Nope, I was nauseous still & became very irritable. I started going to bed early, but still woke up angry. My mood swings started to affect my bf’s mental health. I thought it was stress so I sought out help to control my anger & anxiety. I got so depressed, I forgot to start month 3. Within a week I noticed I felt less irritated & anxious & my nausea disappeared. My mind clear, I started up month 3 and the next morning it started again. Seeing these reviews has given me so much relief to know I’m not the only one going through this.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took Taytulla for about 2 months before I started to experience INSANE vaginal pains. Pains that felt like a UTI. I was 18 and felt like I had a UTI every single day. I was in constant pain and my sex drive completely ended due to not wanting to enhance the pain. After about 2 and a half months in I stopped taking it. The pains lessened slightly but were still there. I've gone to countless doctors for these pains and I've had multiple different diagnoses. After consulting a urologist, she determined my digestive organs aren't working together. This is an effect of Taytulla that I live with every day. Now I have to take Flomax and a laxative every day just to have normal functioning organs and no pain. After doing my research I believe its because of such high dosages. Taytulla has completely ruined my body to the point where I can't function without pills. These side effects are still around after almost a year, and will be around likely for the rest of my life.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Has to switch to this after being on Loestrin for years because it got too expensive. First month no symptoms, second and third month I got my period twice. Gained weight and broke out which never happened before Loestrin or during. Would feel sick during my period. Emotions of depression and anxiety would kick in severely before and during my period. Since I would get it twice a month, I would only feel slightly normal a week out of the month. Cramps were insanely painful. Breast became so painful by the third month, just wearing a shirt or bra hurt. I am so glad I found these reviews because I thought I was losing it. After much research I stopped taking Junel the second I realized it was the cause.

Necon 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Used to think it was harmless and used Necon for many years. I got a benign brain tumor called a meningioma. My Testosterone was very high in the meningioma that they removed....which necon has plenty of. Honestly if I could go back in time I would ask my husband to have a vasectomy rather than putting this drug repeatedly in my body. Be careful with HRT as well (hormone replacement therapy) pushed on women during menopause. I have 2 friends with breast cancer after taking it. Stay safe.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed Microgestin 1.5/30 (no breaks or placebos) after Trinessa stopped working for my severe period pain/heavy bleeding. The first month I had cramps every single day with no period the entire month. Month 2 came along with a period that lasted 21 days with mild cramps. I contemplated stopping the pill but I didn’t know if it would make things better or worse. I was also extremely fatigued and emotional/depressed. Now I’m in month 3, my breast are super tender every day mainly in the mornings and I’m only a B cup. I haven’t gotten another period but I experienced very light spotting from skipping a pill for just one day — I ended up doubling up the following day. I have no acne but I also never had acne, no weight gain and no headaches out of my norm. So I’m going to continue to give this brand more time to see how my body responds in the upcoming months.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this birth control back in April for 4 months. I didn’t have any horrible symptoms, and I got my period normally. Until I started feeling bloated and nauseous. That’s until my dr told me I was pregnant. I had taken the pill EVERY day at the exact same time. This pill failed on me. I was happy I didn’t have horrible symptoms. However, since it failed me, I was very disappointed and upset. I honestly don’t recommend this pill for anyone trying to prevent pregnancy.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DON'T TAKE THIS BIRTH CONTROL!! I started taking Taytulla about one month ago. About a week in, all the symptoms and side effects started to show up. I was extremely nauseous, my depression and anxiety went through the roof and made me feel absolutely terrible. I was having crying episodes and felt anxious about life and relationships. I also have been bleeding for 8+ days with really bad abdominal cramps. I just recently stopped taking it yesterday. My anxiety and depression are still present, my gyno said it could take a month for my hormones to regulate. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE.

Dasetta 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Dasetta for about a year and a half. I switched to this when I was 17 because I wanted my period pains to stop. After being on it for 5 months, I got my very first yeast infection and had no idea what it was at first. Then 3 months later I started getting both UTI’s and yeast infections at least every 2-3 weeks. Me or my doctor couldn’t figure out what the problem was and I suggested a new birth control which she then thought of nexplanon. Honestly this pill was great besides the down thereissues. I had a high sex drive, skin was baby clear and smooth and my periods were almost nonexistent.

Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this for 15 years. It gave me high blood pressure and increased heart rate 102-108bpm.  No moods swings or pregnancies. Regulated my period, reduced my cramps, and made my endometriosis go away. I switched to another BC and the high blood pressure stopped and the heart rate is at 100bpm.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on LoLoestrin for a year and eventually stopped taking it because of how crazy it made me. My menstrual cycles have always been very bad so my gyno recommended I be on birth control. Shortly, after I stopped the LoLoestrin Fe, I got pregnant for my son. So after I had my son, my periods started to be excruciating again so I started the Junel Fe 20. I have been on it for almost 2 months now and I have never had worse side effects in my life. Extreme anger, anxiety towards everyone around me. I do not recommend this medication to anyone. Maybe my body just doesn't do well with birth control, but I need something to control my heavy periods.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill for five years. It made my sex drive non existent. I’m 22 years old and that is not normal! It also caused me to get cystic acne on my chin and jawline. I am switching to Gianvi to treat my acne.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Lo Loestrin Fe was my first birth control pill. Pros: it made my cycle 28 days long. My cycle used to be 25 days so I got a few extra days....yay! Cons: It is expensive and worse of all it made me crazy. I have no history of anxiety or depression but while on this medication I felt like I was losing my mind. I had panic attacks, paranoia and the worst anger outbursts I have ever had. I am the type of person who gets angry and goes silent but while on this med I was psycho. I could literally feel myself losing control but could not stop myself from yelling and screaming. Poor hubby suggested that I should stop it and I did. I can’t believe how happy I am. Literally in a matter of days my mental status is so much improved. No more anxiety or paranoia. Yay! I was on it for 6 months btw.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):TAKE CAUTION. My 18-year-old daughter was prescribed Taytulla three weeks ago. She checked herself into a psych ward today. She never had signs of depression. I am convinced it is this drug. She won't be taking the medication tonight; we will see how she feels tomorrow. This drug has been on the market for less than 2 years. Never again. Report side effects to the FDA: https://www.accessdata.fda.gov/scripts/medwatch/index.cfm?action=reporting.home

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Loestrine for three years and was prescribed Junel after my insurance would no longer cover Loestrine. I just stopped taking Junel after four years of being on it and I am happy I did. I lost all desire to have sex, often I felt nothing. Sex was more like a chore to please my fiancé rather than actually enjoying it. I often told my GYNO how I felt and she never once offered to switch. I knew at 27 years old this is not normal, I should not have a decreased sex drive at my age. Now that I am off it (only being a week), I feel so much better and actually want to have sex, rather than pleasing my fiancé. I don't recommend this pill at all.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill about 8 months ago. I would not recommend this to anyone with anxiety or depression. I felt absolutely lifeless everyday for months, my head was in a fog and I could not concentrate in class because I was completely exhausted. I believe this pill also triggers my anxiety immensely, I have constant anxiety that I never had previously. It made me incredibly irritable about everything and anything, my family has noticed it having a drastic change in my mood. I also experienced: headaches, irregular bleeding, breast lumpiness, breast pain.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After not having a period for 2 months andIi wasn't pregnant my doctor put me on birth control to try to bring my period back and regulate it. He prescribed me Lo Loestrin FE after being on it for 4 weeks my period did return thank goodness. I've been on it for about 4 months now and I love it the only thing I don't like is the price even with my insurance its $140 a month which is way too high and I have really bad cramps when I'm on my cycle. Due to the price of it unfortunately I have to switch to something else but I wish I didn't have too.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched to Blisovi when my doctor increased my dosage after 6 years on reclipsen. After 2 months, I am still having headaches, extreme breast pain, back pain, random spotting (usually 2 weeks before my period is supposed to happen). I have never missed a period in 16 years and didn't have one once I started this pill, but have  spotted and had cramps and breast pain throughout the pack. The side effects are terrible. I'm active and eat healthy, but still have constant bloating, breast discomfort and I'm exhausted. Trying to get on a new pill as soon as possible. I I won't give this another month.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on this medicine for extreme cramping and heavy periods. I can say that this particular BC has been helpful in making my pain less severe and lightening my periods ! On the other hand I absolutely HATE the side effects. It makes me so moody and depressed and just not myself. I end up getting headaches once a week and all I want to do is sleep. It seems like my appetite fluctuates a lot more now than it used too. It seems like my PMS has gotten way worse on this medication. I’ve been on it for about 10 months so it’s not just settling into the hormones.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I personally love this pill, I have been on it for about 5 months now and I haven’t had my period since I switched my pill from taytulla (which is basically the same thing but my insurance didn’t cover it anymore). No breast increase or tenderness, no dizziness of headaches, no blood spotting, it’s great! I

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):STAY AWAY!!! SAVE YOURSELF. After taking this BC I began to experience depression & anxiety, then I began to bleed for 10 + days. This then caused me to stress even more because bleeding for a month isn’t enjoyable so my mood decreased even more. Due to this BC I’ve had to be prescribed anxiety & depression meds & was referred to a counsellor. I’d honestly rather be pregnant than deal with constant bleeding & mental health issues.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My dr gave me Junel Fe for my horrible periods due to fibroids. First month was awful. Major headaches, felt like I was PMS'ing 24 hours a day the entire month, major depression, hunger, and cystic breakouts. But my period came during placebo week and I have never experienced such a light period before. Second month had improvement on ALL side effects. Period was still light but it came for a couple days, stopped, then came back. Third month, headaches and PMS symptoms are gone except for the period week, and my skin is perfectly clear!!! Super light period and minor cramping. No breakthrough bleeding but I am very diligent about taking the pill at the same time each night. I set an alarm on my phone so I don't forget. Over all I have been very happy with results. You do have to suffer through a couple months of adjustment, but after that it clears up. The benefits outweigh the negatives. I even started a low carb diet and have lost 11 pounds so far while taking this BCP.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At first this was great, but I would have some breakfast through bleeding, fast forward to a year later and I've had 3 periods in a month, I get very emotional and I am constantly cramping and I never did before I started this pill. I would not recommend.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Although Taytulla worked in preventing pregnancy, I've been miserable the past two months. Starting with nausea and sharp pains in my stomach, exhaustion, and no appetite, to wanting to eat everything in sight. Then, missing my period for the second round of pills and feeling a false sense of pregnancy so took two tests, both negative. I don't recommend this pill to anyone with anxiety or depression. Feelings of sickness heightened both.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had an awful experience with this birth control and after reading other reviews it makes me feel better to know I am not alone. I had been on Loestrin for around five years and was prescribed Junel as a replacement but had to stop taking it after about ten days. I broke out in itchy hives all over my torso and arms and had to get a steroid to get them to clear up. I also was having problems with my contacts staying in my eyes and with seeing out of them when they were in. This was extremely confusing until I read that is a common side-effect as well. DO NOT take this medication--ask for an alternative!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill for around two years now and it’s been amazing. I was on a different one prior and it made me so sick and depressed, but none of that now! My periods are only three days and very light with minimal cramping. I originally went on birth control for my cramps and this was seriously such a blessing.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Am i pregnant? No. Do I hate my body? Yes. I haven't stopped taking this birth control yet but boy, I am READY to stop. I'm solely taking it until I can get an appointment with my doctor and switch to something else and am trying not to get pregnant in the meantime. I went on Junel and in the beginning it seemed fine, but I got acne out the wazoo in my jaw area and started getting cystic acne around my face that HURT. I gained probably 5-10 pounds as well and my nausea was so unbelievably horrendous, I had to resort to leftover zofran I had from a prior stomach flu. I went off of it for a couple months and tried sprintec but I had a full on period in the middle of the pack and bled so much it was unreal, so I went back on Junel in an effort to get that under control and have needed to switch to something new ever since. This was the first bc I've been on birth control ever so I know I still need some trial and error and I'll be looking into something new

Nortrel 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this pill a month ago after switching from novium 777  it was a great pill I had no side effects but a super light period. While taking nortrel 777 I was nausea when I first started taking them but hasn't happen since the first week. It didn't  make the cramps go aways. Although other than that it seems to be working fine.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on lolo for 2 years and had no major issues with it other than it caused me acne. I've always had slightly oilier skin but it got much worse with lolo. I'd say  I had no acne for only 1 month per year in total, most of the year there was some sort of acne issue which was driving me nuts after those 2 years. The acne got just terrible during stressful times (such  as exam periods at the university) so I had to switch to something else. Moreover, I had to wash my hair every single day. Hopefully I will have more luck with the new pills but otherwise lolo is a solid choice - no weight gain, no mood swings, no pregnancies lol(o)

Balziva (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control pill going on about 2 months now. The pill was suppose to stop my menstrual cycle due to severe cramps and inability to function when on my cycle. I originally was on Vyflema but the prescription changed when I went to different pharmacy and how the regime was suppose to be taken changed as well. Problems started as minor spotting and very mild cramps to continuous spotting/bleeding and cramps everyday for the past 3 weeks. I thought at first it was because my body was trying to get use to skipping the placebo pills from the first pack however everyday the bleeding and cramping got worse during the second pack. I called my doctor today to have me switched to something else.

Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am 26 years old and this is my first time ever taking birth control. I started taking this particular one 3 weeks ago to help me have a lighter period but I am now on the 7 th day of my period (it usually lasts 5 days). I think I’m done taking BC period ! I tried and honestly can’t stand to have such a long period and cramps throughout my entire cycle.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill has done wonders for me. Looking at different reviews had me scared to get on any birth control, but when it comes to Junel, it has treated me well. No side effects at all and I've been taking it for almost two years now. My period is very much, painless and light. I recommend at least trying it because everyone is different. And, Junel could cause you pain or like me, it could be great. If it does cause you pain, you just stop taking it.

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Everybody’s body is different so what might be my side effects might not be yours. I started this pill 08/2018, by 10/2018 I gained 20lbs. The depression & lack of motivation the pill caused helped the weight gain. I stopped going to the gym & eating right. Because of my PCOS I have to be on birth control EVERY DAY. My out of balance hormones with these extra hormones really threw me out of wack. I scored high on the depression screen during my physical, met with a nutritionist & started therapy, nothing changed. I switched to Otrho-Tri-cyclen, I KID YOU NOT, 3 days after I was feel my normal self. I got my motivation back, depression has lessened, back at the gym, & working on my eating. Please don’t take this med if you are experiencing any negative symptoms. It is YOUR BODY! Only YOU know when something isn’t right. You have every right as a woman to request a new med. Be sure to ask your Dr. to write on your script no substitute.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control on and off for the past 8 years (I didn’t have insurance for a short period of time in between jobs). The only complaint I have is that Lo Loestrin is $150 a month out of pocket with no insurance which is absolutely insane! Even with insurance, it’s $40 a month! Other than that, from my experience, I’ve had no weight gain. I have had lighter and shorter periods, improvement with acne, no cramps. I recommend Lo Loestrin, I do not recommend Loestrin 24 Fe. That one was an absolute nightmare for me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I initially came to this website when I knew I would be taking this drug and I got worried after seeing all the dramatic reviews here. Honestly this drug has caused me little to no side effects. Everyone is different I suppose. I am just getting through my first pack. I recommend taking it at night if you’re worried about nausea or drowsiness, and plus it’s easier to remember then. In my first month I have had no change to my sex drive, if anything I had an increase. I did notice my discharge is only or mostly white. And my breasts do feel heavier and are sensitive. I broke out with maybe one or two pimples at first and now my skin is completely clear. It is a bit drier than usual. I highly recommend this as a birth control and for period cramps. My period on this is so light and painless- which was one of the main reasons for my use.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Junel Fe and my insurance changed and I’m on blisovi Fe and it’s the same pill but generic. I love it! I used to have really bad cramps were I would have to go home from school or work and take a hot bath for hours. If I didn’t take an Advil as soon as I got my period I was in for a horrible day. When I started this birth control I get light cramps that are tolerable and I don’t need to take Advil it have a heating pad. I only have my period for 2 or 3 days and then it’s done.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Junel FE for around 7 years to treat severe menstrual cramps possibly caused by endometriosis, and it has worked extremely well for me. It blew my mind at 14 when this little pill immediately and completely ended my excruciating chronic pain. I took the placebo weeks at first and over time my bleeding was almost gone as well, just a little bit of brown blood, which the doctor said was normal. Sometimes I would stop taking it to see if it affected my mood, and nothing would change for me. I've never had any weight problems either. I briefly tried other forms of birth control but Junel FE worked best for me.Sometimes I still get mild cramps at random times, and I suspect some of my digestive issues are related to endometriosis, but I don't really see those as side effects as much as Junel FE being 95% effective. Junel FE worked extremely well for me to treat severe menstrual cramps, and I experienced no side effects.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Wooowww reading all of these Jenel Fe reviews has answered a lot of my questions. I've wondered why I've had migraines out of nowhere and pressure in my head and feeling like I'm living with my head in the clouds. On top of that. The anger and the general lack of the ability to feel anything other than The depression which has never been so bad before. And the breast pain, I get these lumps and they're so painful i cant even touch my boobs. I need to change my pills asap. I was also on microgestin before this and I mean I had breast pain a little and mood swings close to that time but nothing like this. It has literally made me despise my boyfriend.. And not want him to touch me at all. Zero sex drive. I cannot believe I didn't think of this stupid pill.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I tried taking this pill for a few weeks and I didn’t really notice any side effects right away. As soon as I got my period I noticed I was having extreme mood swings which was not normal for me at all. I felt extreme depression from this pill and as soon as I stopped taking it IStarted to feel normalAgain.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was taking a different brand of birth control before Blisovi. That birth control had me on my period for about 2 and a half weeks and it drove me insane. My doctor then prescribed Blisovi and luckily it cause my period to stop. But ONLY FOR 1 AND A HALF DAYS. I’m am currently still bleeding. I’ve bern bleeding for almost a week. I log my periods, but for the past few days it would be weird. One day I’d be bleeding, the next day I wouldn’t. Last night I didn’t bleed at all, this morning I have sever cramps and major blood clots coming out.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this medication for acne purposes. I used to take the same brand but with a lower hormone level, and after six months I was getting two week long periods while taking the pills (as in not in my placebo pill week), so my doctor upped my hormone level. From the moment I started it, I immediately broke out in the worst, incurable acne I’ve ever had. I have gone to the dermatologist to fix it, and I have only been on medications that dry out my skin, but leave me with the same acne. I also gain an immense amount of weight, that no matter how much of a healthy diet or exercise I’m on, I can’t seem to shed. I am planning on switching birth controls ASAP.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I would NOT recommend Blisovi Fe to ANYONE. The only reason that I switched to this pill to begin with is because my insurance company stopped covering name brands. The first few months I thought the weight gain and mood swings were just side effects of having a baby earlier, and that they would subside after the first few months. Boy, was I wrong. I gained almost 40 lbs in 6 months, my depression and anxiety have both skyrocketed, and it’s come to the point that I can’t even take care of my son to my best ability because I get such terrible back pain and headaches. Not to mention that breakthrough bleeding has become a normal and frequent occurrence from month to month. Despite the fact that it’s managed to prevent pregnancy and somewhat regulate my period, I cannot wait to get to my doctor and get off this pill. If you are considering Blisovi fe as a contraceptive, start considering otherwise. Do NOT take this birth control, it will ruin your life.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this pill for exactly 3 months. Everything was great on this pill, no PMS, light periods, no spotting between periods, no mood swings. The reason I am giving this a 7/10 is because it gave me TERRIBLE hormonal acne. I had large, painful, cystic acne on my jaw line and back. My whole life, even as a teen, I NEVER had problems with acne. Once I started this pill I began getting acne the first month, with it progressively getting worse and worse with time, the 3rd month developing acne on my back. I asked my gyno if this side effect would go away if I stuck it out a little longer and she told me she honestly had no clue. Since stopping this pill my acne is already beginning to heal, I am going to try the Nuvaring now as it’s low dose, and I’ve heard if anything it has a positive effect on acne.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill for about 4 months and have not had any bad experiences. I have gained weight but it is because I eat like a pig and don't exercise! I have some cramping around when I will get a period but that's about it. My periods are VERY light and sometimes only a bit of spotting. Some breast tenderness and a bit of moodiness...but nothing that isn't manageable. I'm very happy with this one.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I started taking Junel Fe after I gave birth. I was on Loestrin 24 for years and apparently it’s discontinued. I have been having non stop leg cramps, chest pains and severe anxiety.. My Dr’s. are basically telling me it postpartum anxiety but I don’t feel that’s it. I feel like this birth control is making me crazy. I’m going to stop it tonight in the hopes that’s what’s causing all my problems. I’m so glad I read these reviews now I know other women are going through the exact same symptoms. My Dr even put me on anxiety meds which I haven’t taken yet. If it all has been caused by this birth control I’m going to be extremely upset!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Reading so many BC reviews I was terrified of starting it. From the mood swings/gain weight/horrible cramps. I'm already a temperamental person so I did not need something to elevate that. So far, I have been on Taytulla for 1 month and the first 2 weeks were great. No nausea, no headaches, NOTHING. Week 3, I had NO desire to have sex. Taytulla was certainly doing its job! I don't know if it was the stress of work/school, or I no longer wanted to be with that person, or if I didn't find them attractive anymore, or if it was just the pill overall. I did not experience any anxiousness/depression. Everything is back to normal right now. In regards to cost, apparently my insurance didn't cover it, BUT my doctor did give me a sample and with that sample came a little savings card, registered online and got 3 months for $25. I had an activation code but you can go to their website and it gives you the same information to sign up. So far I'm a happy camper with this pill.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for about 6 months now. I haven’t had any negative side effects apart from breakthrough bleeding during the first few months. Please keep in mind that everyone’s experience on this birth control will be different, so don’t let the negative reviews scare you!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I literally hate this birth control. It gave me horrible stomach bloating and made my sex drive completely shut off. The absolute worst thing was that I kept getting yeast infections. I had 15 infections in a time span of 1 year. I couldn’t figure out what was wrong w me so finally stopped taking this BC and I haven't had one since. Avoid this BC at all costs.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this medication 3 weeks ago. I've been struggling with terrible endometriosis pains for years and I finally decided to do something about it. I take these pills continuously with zero breaks and zero placebos. I have had absolutely no spotting. I have slight cramps occasionally but they fade quickly. I am slightly more hormonal but it is barely noticeable. I have gained weight, however, I was on steroids for a week and a half as well which could be the main contributor there. My skin is completely cleared up. I take this pill at the exact same time every single day.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for 6 years now and it’s been the best one I’ve been on. I was a Guinea pig for the first year with different pills but this was the one that worked the best for me. I’ve only had 1 or 2 breakthrough bleeds (mostly from user error) and periods have been lighter over time with a significant decrease in cramping, bloating, etc. it’s gotten my periods predictable down to the day. As far as birth control, I used it for 1+ years as my only form of birth control with no scares.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill has not helped me from the start. Just writing this comment to tell you what happened to me. I have been nauseous (to a serious extreme), depressed, anxious, tired, dizzy (I fainted) ya fainted passed out on the ground peed my pants while it happened too?! At 23 years old perfectly healthy human.. Might work different for you but just sharing my experience.Also been on it for 4+ months because I know your body needs to adjust. Well people that did not happen for me everything just kept getting worse. This pills a no go from me. Time for me to try my 4th birth control starting to think birth control just isn’t for me.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Do not take this if you have a preexisting mental condition! If you’re a young adult take the estroven otc to soothe cramps, watch weight, and manage acne. I was prescribed this certain combination because of my anemia and I haven’t felt so depressed since I was 16. Take the IUD so the hormones only go to your reproductive system and not your circulatory to your reproductive. Talk to your gyno or pcp if you even feel immensely tired after one day of use!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been taking Microgestin for over a decade and was switched to Junel several months ago for no known reason. Everything was fine until 4 or 5 months had passed. I began feeling overly anxious and depressed about anything and everything. I had no appetite. I started breaking out all over my face. I was miserably constipated. I had to jump through a lot of hoops, but I got back on my old microgestin. I don’t understand why anyone is able to just switch your medications without even alerting you, but this has been the worst experience I’ve had with any medication.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this pill for exactly a month now and I say it’s great! I have very little side effects the one I notice the most is spotting. I took the pill the first day of my period and ever since then I’ve been spotting but that is normal and should go away in a couple months. I have been more hungry I’d say but haven’t noticed any weight gain which it good. My acne hasn’t been as bad as it was before but I still get some here and there which doesn’t really bother me. And that’s about it for the side effects. Also I got my period when it says I was supposed too. I would definitely recommend.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hi all,Thought I would share my experience of this BC. Prior to taking this, I was prescribed Larin FE. The dosing I needed was d/c from Larin, leaving my OB to prescribe me with Blisovi. I was a bit nervous prior to starting the new BC because of all the bad reviews and side effects associated with it on here. However, I have been taking Blisovi for about a month now and have experienced little to no side effects stated from other users. I had a small amount of acne and break outs appear but combatted them with some extra skin care for a few weeks. Along with some mild cramping, nothing serious. I figured seeing as though most happy customers don't post their experiences online, I would do so! I have not been on this medication as long as some other commenters, but have not experienced nearly any side effects in comparison!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This needs to be recalled. I’ve never had headaches like I do with this medication. Nausea, unreal hunger, anxiety, panic. Absolutely awful. I would not recommend to anyone.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Honestly, my experience has been great. I've had close to no side effects. I take the pill at 5pm and eat dinner shortly after to prevent nausea. Occasionally I'll feel a wave, but I'll just eat something, drink tea, or go to bed and all is well. I am purposely skipping my period by consistently taking this and have had no spotting, although I felt cramps on a couple days during when it was supposed to be. Other than that, it's been great! Will update if need be in a couple months.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used to take Lo Loestrin but switched to Blisovi about 2 years ago because my insurance stopped covering LoLo. As far as preventing pregnancy, this pill has worked great, but everything else about it is terrible. I have persistent acne on my chin (including bad cysts), but worst of all is my anxiety has been through the roof since I started taking this brand. I'm constantly anxious, irritable, tired, depressed... I never in a million years experienced moods like this. It's affecting my relationship and my mental health overall has completely gone down the drain. I've set up an appointment with my OGBYN to see if I can get off this stuff ASAP.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this for 4 months. At first great, boobs grew 2 cup sizes, no acne, & when it came time for my period I only had some spotting. However, 3 weeks into taking it I had to go to the ER cause I thought I had a blood clot. My left arm was numb and swelling, went to the ER & luckily everything was fine. 2 months later I developed severe anxiety & blood pressure was scary high. My heart rate was 142 at the doctors & they were so concerned that they made me stay until it lowered & told me that if it goes back up to go to the ER. Gained 10 pounds & had severe bloating and water retention in my calves. I started dating my current boyfriend while on this and he says that the person I was on this pill is not someone who he would date. I had NO emotions, I literally felt nothing and he tells me that I acted like a zombie. Now  I'm off it my boyfriend tells me that I’m a totally different person. This pill will probably work for someone who is very healthy and has no history of mental health issues.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First 3 months of getting used to, I was constantly nauseated and I was very moody. A few months in I developed acid reflux because of it. I also got my period twice a month. After 11 days of taking my placebo’s, I’d start my period. It honestly did not suit my body well and I would do a lot of research before taking this because it might have too much estrogen for you.

I HATE this pill! I was originally on one type of birth control for acne and my menstrual cramps. I stopped that because it made me retain weight but other than that it was very effective in doing the things I needed it to. I asked my doctor to switch me pills to see if I could get the same results minus the weight retention and I got switched to this. Literally my worst decision ever. I have terrible stomach cramps around my period. I bleed heavier than normal. I rarely eat, and its terrible. I'll be hungry and as soon as I eat I feel terrible all over again. I never had stomach cramps or felt nauseous before birth control or with the old pill.  This new pill has me all jacked up and I hate it. I've taken it for 2 months.  I'm getting switched back to the old pill because I can't take these symptoms.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worse birth control I have ever used. I used Taytulla for 5 months. At first, my skin cleared up my periods were light, and my hormones were under control. Then I had migraines, constant headaches nauseous and my hormones changed. I had really dark thoughts, depression and anxiety and severe mood swings. Sex drive went way down. Then really painful sex. I did research on Taytulla and saw similar experiences. After 5 months of taking it I stopped  and my symptoms improved days after stopping. Except painful sex. I went to my ob/gyn and was diagnosed with lichen sclerosis This is an autoimmune disease that can be triggered later in life and can be triggered by high levels of hormones. There is no cure and only treatments that can be used to help reduce the pain while having sex. DO NOT USE Taytulla. Get your partner to use condoms. Women shouldn’t deal with this. My husband now where’s condoms, and I will never use birth control ever again in my life.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Took this pill for about 6 and half weeks. I started taking it for heavy periods. It totally cured that problem in the first month...hardly had a period at all. HOWEVER, I progressively began to experience more and more anxiety. It culminated on a vacation and I thought that I would have to return home. My heart was racing and I felt like I was experiencing huge releases of adrenaline -- like when you're startled. The feeling would come in go in severity multiple times a day out of the blue. It became so unbearable that I called the doctor's office while I was on vacation. The nurse advised me to stop taking the medication that day and suggested that it may have altered my thyroid levels. It took two days for me to feel half way normal again. Now, a week later, I feel much, much better. While the effect of the pill on my period was amazing, it is simply not worth the side effects for me.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on taytulla and had to switch to this bc because of my insurance change :( I finished my first pack and so far not bad. My face is still clear and no weight gain. The only con is my stomach has been feeling weird, I've had some bad diarrhea since starting on Blisovi... If it doesn't go away I will be switching.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the worst birth control I've ever been on. I asked my doc for Loestrin 24 since it's worked for me perfectly in the past, but this generic microgestin was so so bad for me. Only 7 days in, I have HORRID acne. Migraines every day, all day. My depression has gone from mild to severe. I'm fatigued, mood swings, on day 7 of bright red bleeding with no end in sight. I'm not taking any more of this medicine. I do NOT recommend.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on a few different pills over the last 25 years. This is the first pill I have asked to change. I gave it three months like the doctor said after switching from the mini pill (nursing prior to this). The first two months I had my period for two weeks at different points in the months. My face had acne everywhere, just in time for a formal family affair. And I have begun getting migraine headaches. Today I finally called and asked to switch because I have had my period for two weeks and it isn’t stopping. The doctor switched me and now I have to go for a pelvic sono to see what in the world is going on. Had no problems prior to going on this medicine. I do not recommend this pill.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Blisovi a little over a year ago. It was the first BC I had tried and so far the only bad side effects I've noticed are weight gain, which was minimal to begin with, and increased headaches. I was previously experiencing depression and anxiety and I have not noticed an increase to that. Honestly, it's not a bad medication for it's intended purpose. It has definitely helped with preventing pregnancy and stabilizing my periods. I read a lot of the bad reviews and I think the problems are just specific to the individual people.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):BEWARE OF THIS BIRTH  CONTROL!!!!! I  was put on this birth control to restart my period and within a week I developed Melasma on both of my cheeks and upper lip! I immediately stopped taking it.  I have spent thousands of dollars to get rid of the Melasma from chemical peels, bleaching agents, lasers, and they all worked for awhile, until the Melasma would always return, This birth control destroyed  my life!

Generess Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this birth control for about 4 years and stopped roughly four months ago. I feel 1000x better being off birth control. As for effectiveness, this pill gets an A+. I missed pills often and skipped days (terrible, I know), and never got pregnant. However, the side effects were eventually unbearable for me. I have always been an anxious person, but on this BC, my anxiety was amplified. I would wake up 1-2x a month in the middle of the night with my heart racing and would feel extremely nauseous. I had a headache for about two weeks after starting a new pack and would get a horrible headache if I skipped a pill. I had horrible nausea while on this pill also. I was very moody on the pill and felt an inexplicable rage occasionally that I could not control. Overall, I feel much much better with NO birth control. The side effects make it not worth it to me - 4 months later all side effects are gone.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I hate it. I only tried it a few days and it gave me the worst anxiety and depression that I thought of killing myself. I had the worst leg cramps in the world. I don’t recommend it.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this pill for about 5 months. No bad symptoms except a lower sex drive, but it was manageable. I started to have irregular bleeding so I switched to two pills over the course of 3 months, both of which made me severely depressed. I am hoping to get back on microgestin since although there were symptoms, none of them compared to what the other pills put me through.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking junel/loestrin about a month or so ago. I've had anxiety my whole life, but after being on this for one month I found myself in the ER having an anxiety attack. I'm now on anxiety meds bc everyday I fear NOTHING BUT EVERYTHING it makes my heart rate go so fast and give me that feeling of standing on a ledge! I can't take it! I thought ok it's bc I'm getting used to it, but it's messing with my mental health now and my everyday life. It has made me break out all over my face and also I have been spotting now for 10 day .... I called my doctor today to have me switched off of this. I can't say I don't recommend this, I just don't think it was for me ...

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this medication for two weeks now. I have experienced a lot of positive results. My skin did start with a few break outs but they cleared up within a couple of days. My skin is now extremely clear. I have not experienced spotting or cramping before my period. I was on Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 prior to blisovi and after a 1 year hiatus from birth control I decided to try LO LOESTRIN.  It was terrible !! So I called my doctor to put me on micro again and when I got to the pharmacy they gave me blisovi. So far it’s great!

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Obviously, Everyone is different and believe me I’ve had my fare share of horror stories of  birth control side effects in the past, but it’s been almost two years and this brand has been a life saver’ for me! The first two packs the only complaint was about a half an hour of nausea in the evening, I take it at ten in the morning so if this worries you take it at night and sleep through it! It was nothing I couldn’t handle and once I adjusted after about 2 months I haven’t had an issue since, 3 day very light periods, which before I was using about 5 super plus a day! Now I’m like bring it on! I save money on tampons and Advil. Also, my skin was fine before and still great after, no noticeable change in weight gain, no decrease in sex drive,  no negatives what so ever! But again everyone is different, this is just how it effected me!

Alyacen 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've taken this pill for 3 years now, and the benefits keep getting better and better! Before birth control I used to bleed through super tampons and maxi pads (both at the same time) for at least 4 days. After 3 years of Alyacen (or cyclafem depending on what the pharmacy gives me) my periods only last ONE day and are so light that I could get away with only using a liner. When I originally started the pill it did make me break out a lot, so I'll give it 9 stars instead of 10, but once my body adjusted to the medicine my skin was fine! I have absolutely no side effects while using this medicine, and I will continue to use it for as long as I need it

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Blisovi for almost 4 months now. I have tried probably at least 5 different birth controls (within the last 10 years) so I am very aware of side effects that come with each one. I was scared to switch from junel because I loved it and it gave me no side effects, BUT my periods have always been 8-10 days long. Not full blown, but they take forever to finish. My doctor recommended we try this one. I don't think this BC is bad, but I did have a full 2 1/2 weeks where I was full blown bleeding (not my period and not spotting) which was annoying and I started to realize I have gained a lot of weight. Probably at least 10 pounds which sucks because I have been working so hard to keep the weight I had lost off. I think it is impossible to get the extra weight off while I am on this one so I will be switching to a new one. Other than those two side effects, I did not experience anything crazy like I did with Microgestin (WORST BC EVER-MADE ME CRAZY DEPRESSED AND SUICIDAL).

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm 26 years old and have been on birth control pills since I was 16. I have never had children and weigh 115 lbs. I had always taken a low hormone pill previously and had no notable side effects on or off the pill. For the past 4 months I've been on Taytulla and its a nightmare. My PMS symptoms are out of control. I cry all the time now, especially a week or 2 before my period, I will have multiple full-scale, sobbing episodes. This is not normal for me at all. My nipples are so sore they can't be touched almost all month. I spot in between my periods now. I have bled heavily (almost like my period starting) after pretty mild and well-lubricated sex. I realized this month that Taytulla is a really high dose of estrogen/estradiol (1mg) and my old birth control had 0.035 mg!! That is a HUGE difference in estrogen. Also it costs $170 per month without insurance! I'm getting off it next week when my cycle ends. Good riddance.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel Fe a year ago. I contracted mono a month after I started taking the contraceptive, so any symptoms present I assumed were from the virus. Months after recovering from mono I had weird symptoms: fatigue, low blood sugar after workouts, high anxiety, headaches, brain fog, depression, shakiness. I assumed these symptoms were from having mono. It wasn't until 2 weeks ago the fatigue became strong I was convinced I had CFS. I went to the doctor and asked if it could be my birth control causing this and she said no. I got tested for mono reoccurrence along with 6 other blood tests checking for autoimmune diseases which all came back negative... Days later one of my friends mentioned it may be my birth control and I immediately stopped taking it. Now only 8 days later and I am starting to feel normal and healthy. The listed symptoms have subsided and I don't feel nearly as tired. I never imagined it was birth control related I'd never recommend this product to anyone.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill for three years now and I’m super happy I decided to give it a shot! I used to be on the pill (Dianne 35) and had horrible nausea. With this pill I never experienced any nausea, just breast tenderness in the first couple months of use. This pill has stabilized my moods, cleared up all acne, and even allowed me to go up a cup size! I used to have full seven day periods that would leave me feeling unwell and now I rarely ever get a period, which I’m totally fine with! Overall I highly recommend trying this pill if you’re considering it. I’m 25, 5’4 and 105lbs for reference.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Junel last month for the first time only because microgestin fe 1/20 was on back order. The pharmacist told me that the Junel had the same ingredients at microgestin but I beg to differ  in its affect on me because I had anxiety, my mouth was dry, and I was sweating. This stuff was horrible...never again!!! Thank God my pharmacy got the microgestin back in but without the iron

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on Blisovi ge 1/20 3 weeks now have horrible headaches that last 2-3 days at a time and Tylenol  only subside the headache would not recommend going on a different pill

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Well recently i switched from junel fe to northridrone .35mg.  I had started junel in sept. Last year. Due to insurance change. I have pcos so i take birth control to control it. Well junel seemed to be okay.but i got migraines alot.but none of it started then this all started arounr 7 months on that pill.....well recently i was hospitlized for a pulmanary embolism.....both sides of my lungs... they believe from junel....i likely had it in my legs and didnt notice last month.! I could have died had i blew off the fact i couldnt breath. Junel worked for bleeding and cramps. But im on premenent migraine meds and on blood thinners and almost lost my life. I was on birth control for so long. I NEVER had issues til junel. This junel needs to be recalled. It seems it causes issues and premenent ones at that. My biggest problem is i have fsmily history of headaches. But i get migraines.. and magically started with this bc i believe this junel did it all to me. I do not advise it at all.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this for endometriosis continuously for two years. I never once had a period the entire time, and that’s the only reason I’m not giving this score a 1. This stuff caused my blood pressure to sky rocket. I have never had issues with my blood pressure, and 6 months into taking this my blood pressure began spiking. I was scared to get off of it because my periods are so bad, but I discontinued this medication because my blood pressure was dangerously high for the last three months of taking it. I finally just agreed to let my doc discontinue it, she said she had never seen a healthy 21 year old have blood pressure that high from birth control: 165/130 was the day we decided to stop taking it. I’m on Norethindrone now and all is well, BP is back to a perfect level.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on this birth control for the last 6 months, and  it has  affected my life for the worse. I was okay the first two months (in fact, my boyfriend even checked in with me to see if I was having any bad effects, and I was consciously aware that I was not). But then it hit. and it hit BAD. Weight gain of 5 pounds in 2 months, despite daily exercise and healthy eating habits. Mood swings like no other - I found myself crying at work, in the car, before I went to bed. All the time. I thought something was wrong with me. And then I got awful back pain after 3 months in - so much that I even bought a new mattress thinking that was the problem. This pill has caused NOTHING but problems. Do not recommend; if your doctor prescribes it because it's covered by insurance, ASK FOR SOMETHING ELSE.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My Dr prescribed me this BC because of my anemia and to regulate my period. This was the first BC I ever used, at first I hated the spotting for 14 days after starting the first pack. But after that I absolutely loved this BC. I stopped getting my period after 3 months. Before starting Loestrin my period was extremely heavy and lasting 5 days. After using Loestrin my period was extremely light, no weight gain, and  lasting 3 days. The only reason I stopped using it was because my insurance stopped covering it. But I HIGHLY recommended to this BC to anyone.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started using this pill 3 months after my babies delivery . The day I took this pill, I found decrease in milk supply. I got severe headache,  stomach ulcer too and severe hairfall. I took this pill for 3 weeks,  the result is no breastmilk now I am fully formula feeding,  severe headache , stomach pain,  hairfall. So friends pls don't take this pill. I seriously stressed and depressed because of this.
Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Works great, I've had no negative side effects.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This my first time ever taking birth control and my mood swings have been so terrible I feel bad for anyone around me. I relapsed on cutting, my depression became worse and this is horrible. I want to switch or not use birth control at all!

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I took this for around 6 months and I'm not pregnant yet. I'm moving to a different pill because it mainly caused some depression and weird mood swings. I didn't see a change in my weight and my skin did clear slightly. My breasts grew about a cup. It's an effective pill, just not for me because of the effects it had on my mood.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I read so many negative reviews about this Birth Control and I was terrified to start it as a result. The first month was pretty hard. The side effects varied by day. I started feeling them after 5 days of starting and I became a bit depressed for 2 or 3 days after that. I had a bit of depressive fluctuations (like one hour intervals) for about a week afterwards and then they stopped completely. After that, I had a bit of a grace period before experiencing unexplainable anxiety. That lasted for about a week and I was EXTREMELY tempted to stop this medication at this point. A lot of my friends/family had told me to finish the first month's worth and then decide. I am very glad that I decided to stick it out. Every one of my side effects went away right at the end of my first month. My periods are so much better (lighter, easier). Yes, the first month is very hard. However, the side effects are temporary. It does just come down to how long your body takes to adjust.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Been on this for two weeks and it has finally help me shed those pounds I've gained from hormonal  imbalanceI have to say say I have experienced some pimples I usually have crystal clear skin..Extremely tired and very low appetite.Very low sex drive.!

The first few months on this pill, I had breakthrough bleeding almost constantly, but at month 4 the periods became more regular. This BC cleared my acne and lessened my severe cramping issues so that I was able to function during that time of the month. The length of my period decreased from 10 days to 3 days. The only drawback is that a year later, I've found that my period has entirely stopped, and if you have anxiety as I do, it can be worrisome. Luckily not pregnant! Note that I've taken this pill at the same time each day (within an hour) since I started 1.5 years ago. An expensive, but worthwhile investment!!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had never taken birth control before and was extremely hesitant to because I’m not a fan of the idea of putting more hormones into your body. And after taking this I don’t think I will again for a while. I only took it for a week but during that week I developed extreme anxiety to the point where it was affecting my focus. My friends even noticed and said they thought I had ADHD and none of my thoughts made sense. Also during the second week I started bleeding and the cramps and blood were about as bad as having a heavy period where you don’t want to move. Only reason I didn’t give it a 1 is because it did give me more energy during the day and it’s the only time I’ve ever been on a good sleep schedule. Not sure if that’s directly related but it seems like it.

Nortrel 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have not had a good experience with this brand. Like others, I used to take Necon, which I liked then got switched to this brand. Since the switch I have noticed an increase in anxiety and mild depression. I am a teacher so that comes with enough stress. This medication seemed to worsen it. I have never experienced such high levels of anxiety. After reading the reviews of this mediation I see now how it can affect some people. I am not going to continue with this brand.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It caused extreme anxiety and depression . Once was off of it for just one week felt extreme relief . Totally alters lifestyle . Hardley got periods but did spot .

Pirmella 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this birth control mid July and started having TIA's and September 13 I had a stroke a lost function to my right side of my body. It has come back but has been very hard and I had to quit my job.

Necon 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on this for about 3 years. This summer I was getting really depressed and my anxiety was at an all time high before I would get my period. My doctor put me on antidepressants and wanted to monitor me. After the summer was over I felt like I had symptoms of hormonal imbalance. Random light cramps during any week that I wasn’t on my period. Headaches, acne flare ups, brittle and weak nails, my hair seemed to fall out more often, weight gain, tired all the time, longer periods. I think my birth control has stopped working for me. Let’s just hope I’m not pregnant lol. After my next period I’ll be taking yazmin instead. Necon was fantastic while it lasted.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking Junel Fe 1/20 for almost a year . I’ve gained weight, am bloated , have zero sex drive , had itchy dry vagina, panic attacks , anxiety, boobs ache all the time,  break through bleeding and a general constant tiredness. After reading through other reviews I feel less crazy. The only good thing about Junel is it’s free on my insurance plan. I called my obgyn today to get back on minastrin 24 fe - which I loved and am now going to pay out of pocket for because .... I lost weight on it. Had zero break through bleeding , loved that it is a mint flavored chewable too. Oh and I felt normal on it. DON’T take Junel it’s garbage!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on Taytulla for about 10 months, and I've been enjoying it! The main thing that I've noticed is gradual weight loss, not complaining at all. Overall I've been positive and much more confident in myself. A negative is if I am late taking the pill, I will get major cramps, but that might be an every pill thing. Another thing is my mood does change, not often, but I notice it on occasion. It has not affected my work and stress level while I'm in school, but my libido has been low. This is my first time taking birth control, so I'm not sure what is related to the pill and what isn't, but for it being my first time, I'd say I lucked out compared to a lot of the reviews

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm having migraines constantly, been spotting even when I'm continuously take the pill to not have a period, my body hurts and I don't have the strength to do anything most of the time , I'm depressed more than usual and I have a mental illness since birth which has gotten worse. I can't function properly and I have  a high phobia of blood and needles. This pill has been nothing but hell on earth to my body I want off it asap. It is no thanks to me being switched to this pill by moving to a new state now my Dr wants me to see a physiatrist which is not needed - I don't need any more bad pills in my life and this is one of them time to switch fast

Generess Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Generess in 2011, when I was 15. I was originally prescribed this for major dysmenorrhea that would always interfere with school and normal life. When I first started taking it, I had terrible anxiety and nausea. I'm sure me being 15 and in the throws of puberty didn't help the matter. Anyways, that levelled out, and the worst thing that would happen was I would spot if I took the pill late. Now that I'm older and I've been on it so long, I'm not sure it is right for me anymore. My periods are getting heavy again and it has started affecting my mood again. I've had tests done so it isn't an underlying health problem, so I just think it's time to switch to something else. Overall though, I would recommend this.

Balziva (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve taken this birth control for 4 months now. I have irregular bleeding and cramping from it. It seems like I’m always bleeding than not. Didn’t work for me.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my first time on birth control . My first two-three months on Lo I experienced  mild cystic acne to my chin area and slight weight gain ,6 pounds at the most . I think most of my weight went to my boobs :) . The acne resolved after three months or so , now my skin is clear for the most part . My weight is pretty steady however my breast get very sore and heavy during certain times of the month . Overall it seems to be good compared to what I’ve heard of from other BC,  Most importantly it decreased my bleeding which is why I started . Periods are very light lasting about 3 days . I’m on my 6th month , can’t complain!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've only been on this pill for four days, so I can't provide a complete review just yet.  I haven't experienced any physical side effects yet, however I will say that I think it's having a notable impact on my mood.  I'm prone to depression already, but not anxiety.  I'm finding that I have a constant feeling of anxiety over nothing whatsoever, and little things that wouldn't bother me are really stressing me out.  I actually had a panic attack yesterday, which is very uncommon for me, especially since my life is generally stress-free right now.  I am going to finish the pack just to see if my body adjusts, but I will say don't be surprised if you feel this way on this pill.  If you're severely anxious the potential side effect might be too much of a risk for you.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I actually really like this pill. It's the first birth control I ever went on, and it's helped me a lot. I don't breakout hardly ever and there is almost no cramping anymore. A lot of reviews here are pretty negative which really surprised me because I've been on it for almost a year and there have been almost no bad things. My periods don't always come, and there is a little breakthrough bleeding, but other than that it's awesome

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Went on Taytulla to help with very heavy bleeding.I’ve stopping my 3rd packet of Taytulla today.  I looked so big in the pictures from one of my best friend’s weddings.  Very depressing after torturing myself with wedding prep...  All my life,  I’ve enjoyed working out, but since starting Taytulla, I haven’t.While Taytulla cleared up my mild acne & made my period light, IT IS NOT WORTH IT for me to continue on this.Light bleeding for 1/2 the month, constantly feeling hungry, limiting diet to veggies to try to unsuccessfully fit into clothes, depression, no longer enjoying lifelong activities = LIVING IN  A HIDEOUS STATE OF MIND...Taytulla was not right for me.  Everyone’s different...

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before I started this medication,I had read reviews of it and I was horrified. It's now been a year and 4 months that I've been on Junel Fe and I honestly haven't encountered any issues. Before I was on birth control, I was depressed, had anxiety attacks very often, always tired, had my period for at least 6 days and had a lot of cramping. I never had any issues with having acne. Ever since I started I feel like a whole new person. Zero anxiety attacks, no longer depressed, very light periods that last 3 days (at most), NO cramping at all, and still no issues with acne. I constantly see reviews that other people leave saying that they're constantly nauseous or having headaches or gaining weight, but I personally haven't had any of these issues. Although this medication doesn't work well for some people it works perfectly for me!! Don't let other reviews discourage you. I almost didn't start using this medication due to the bad reviews I had read. I'm also glad I'm not pregnant :)

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking birth control about a year ago and got prescribed Sprintec. I had no symptoms other than a 6-7 day period when they were 3-4 days before starting the pill. I told my OBGYN this after taking Sprintec for 10 months and she thought it would be best to try another pill, that’s when she prescribed Taytulla. I would 100% not recommend this birth control to anyone. I have been on Taytulla for 4 months now and every month I will start bleeding a week after taking my placebo pills and continue to bleed until I reach the next set of placebo pills. For the last 3 months, I have had 3 week periods and then 1 week off. I have also noticed extreme weight gain in these four months and am constantly bloated along with daily headaches. I am switching back to Sprintec and NEVER taking Taytulla again.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was placed on the pill to help with PMS symptoms.The first month was not bad, I am working on the second month but I feel like I don't like my boyfriend certain days, no drive for life or usual activities that I normally like. Very depressed and anxious at times, crying at the drop of a hat and feeling worse in the second month. I know it takes about three months for hormones to normalize so I am going to continue taking this medication. I have intermittent days that are good but for the most part, bad. I was placed on yaz before junel fe and went crazy. I may just be sensitive to bc but all I know is I cant take much more.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At first, the birth control seemed great. The good: No weight gain, acne cleared up, and I also did not get my period on Lolo. The bad: headaches, 0 sex drive, (tmi) it thinned the skin around my vulva and opening of my vagina (during certain times of the month) which made it so painful to have sex. Would recommend if you want to try Lolo for acne, and don't want to get your period.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this pill for a little over a month now. I've gain 13 pounds since I started with this pill. Which is a whole lot for only a little over a month of use. Truth be told I love the weight gain. Couldn't be more happier with my weight. Other then that I don't have any other side effects. I see many are talking about the weight gain because its real. So if your not expecting to pack on some extra pounds this isn't for you.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was easily the worst medication I have ever been on, no competition at all. I know birth control is trial and error, but holy moly. I tried Junel Fe 1.5/30 for 3 months and I wish I could get them back. Not only did my boobs hurt 24/7 for the entire duration of it, but I was stressed over EVERYTHING the entire time. Truly the worst part about it though was that I lost so much hair and gained 5 pounds. The only benefit is that I never had a child, so seeing that this is the purpose of the medication, I'll give it a 3 rating haha.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Update: I previously wrote a review for Taytulla that I thought was befitting at the time. So fast forward, I’m 6 months in and I swear I’m starting to have nausea, vomiting, headaches, mood swings, NO SEX DRIVE whatsoever, and I’ve gained 17 pounds. Now the funny thing about the weight gain is that I follow a strict diet, work out at 4 times a week, and walk on average 12 miles a day on my job. I constantly feel bloated and I’m not doing anything different than I was when I first started them. My doctor said it’s water weight and retention, but carrying around the extra weight is making me feel bad physically, as well as being a mental challenge when I feel like I’m working out and watching what I eat is all in vain. Just know that these symptoms can hit you at any time.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been using taytulla for just over 6 months. It is by far the best experience I have had so far using birthday control. Other birth control left me with a wide range of emotions and random crying, I consulted my obgyn and she recommended taytulla, which has a lower estrogen level. I feel like a happier person, and my emotions are much more stable! The only side effect I have experienced was weight gain, I live a very active lifestyle and gained about 7lbs.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Love it! Best BC I've ever been on in the past decade. It works perfectly for my body.My moods are better than ever, my period is light, water weight gain subsiding after a few months, and was easy to get on, unlike some higher estrogen pills that have given me bad side effects ie. headache, intense breast tenderness, mood swings the first 3 months - this didn't happen with Taytulla. It was the easiest transition I've ever had. I love it! I have PCOS, so I'm thinking it may be helpful for those suffering from this. I would definitely recommend this BC despite what some reviews say, I've had the opposite experience. I feel much more even with my moods throughout the month and days, unlike usual with or with out birthcontrol.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Horrible headaches, nausea and stomach pain. Sharp stomach pain off and on all day. Not the same as microgestin. I didn’t have these side effects with microgestin.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this pill when I moved in with my husband, as a form of contraception. I have never smoked, and at the time I was 25, 5’6, and 115 lbs (totally healthy). The pill cleared up my acne, made my period light and painless, and made my boobs look great! However, after taking this pill for a year, I decided to stop because I realized that it was the cause of my severe migraines/auras, and also the cause of my extreme fatigue. I was driving at night, when all of a sudden I experienced the worst headache of my life, accompanied by blurred vision, and and ringing in my ears. After visiting the ER, I decided to no longer use birth control pills.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):this birth control gave me terrible skin!!!! before starting it, I read multiple reviews saying the same thing, but i tried it anyways. i completed a pack & I couldn’t take it anymore, so i got switched to Trinessa. other than the horrible acne, i did not experience any nausea or mood swings. i have never had acne prone skin & had very clear skin before starting this pill. now i have bumps all over my forehead & several spots across my chin and both cheeks. it got so bad that i had to order an acne treatment (which has helped incredibly)!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First week extreme nausea..made me question if I was pregnant. I can’t hold down any solid food. Only hot tea and soup, which only help a little bit. I’m not sure if this is for me.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ll say this is not a pill for everybody. I switched to this pill 3 months ago, and I’ve gained 6 pounds already, even though I keep a really good diet. My mood swings more than usual and little things makes me very angry. I feel tired all the time even after sleeping 8 or 9 hrs.  My legs hurt during the day and my ankles are swollen 24/7. I thought that was my fault for not being active enough, but now that I’m seeing these comments I know that I’m not alone. Thanks everybody for sharing their experience, things make more sense now.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control has changed my life.  I have had extremely bad cramps and fatigue due to my period for years and tried different types of bc, vitamins, pain medication, etc. prescribed by my doctor and this ACTUALLY worked.  The first month had some minor side effects because my body was adjusting, but nothing too bad.  My cramps used to make me sick and I have fainted in public a number of times as well, but now my cramps have completely vanished and I feel like I have control of my life again for the first time since I was 14.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've tried so many different brands and types of birth control throughout my life and this is the only one that didn't give me any side effects whatsoever.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Junel in April of 2017, so it's been a little over a year. I'm 26 / 5'5 / 135 lbs. Not gonna lie, for the first 5 months I was totally fine and happy with the pill.   I didn't see acne, didn't gain too much weight (2lbs at most). Then... I gain 25+ POUNDS IN THE LAST YEAR. & 2-3 days before my period I become this complete witch and I'm so emotional and cry over everything and anything. I have never in my life had these types of symptoms before my period. I'm going to my gyno today to change my pill to something low(er). I didn't realize that the weight gain and episodes were from my birth control until it just hit me a month ago and I started to research it. Now I guess I gotta do some trial and error with new pills but what sucks is my side effects didn't kick in until months later. Now that I read reviews with other women having the same emotions and weight gain... It all makes sense. Makes me feel a little better that I'm not ACTUALLY crazy lol.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched to these because Microgestin wasn’t available any longer and Junel is supposed to be the same. I took the pill Sunday morning and started feeling odd Monday night. By Tuesday I was afraid I was having a heart attack. I had all the symptoms and my pulse was 20-30bpm higher than usual.
