Over the next 4 days doctors had me have an EKG, a CAT scan for blood clots and numerous blood tests. Thursday it occurred to me that my med had changed even though it was supposed to be just a brand name change- something I told a nurse in routine questions but no one thought twice about. I stopped taking it Friday and by Saturday my pulse started to return to normal. Today is Monday and my pulse still spikes higher than it should when I do something even lightly strenuous, I’m fatigued, and my chest still aches but I’m slowly feeling like myself. Junel is NOT the same as Microgestin or Loestrin either one, no matter what it’s supposed to be.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My experience was terrible, the first 3 months were the worst.. nose bleeds with blood clots, vomiting, constant terrible nausea... couldn’t sleep because of all of the above and waves of heat. I figured it was just me and was to be expected from the adjusting period as this was my first time on BC. But it continued for months, the nosebleeds ended & so did the vomiting, but the terrible nausea stayed and so did the heat waves. It did start to regulate my period for a few months, but after a few I started to get terrible cramps again, and two periods in each month. They are now even more irregular than before I began BC. I only learned today that other people have had terrible experiences with this too, I figured it was just me. I would DEFINITELY not recommend this pill.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control worked amazingly well, until about 6 months in. I experienced a substantial worsening of my anxiety symptoms at about that time. Since doctors always say that anxiety side effects will peak at the beginning and then go away, it took me months to realize that the birth control might be causing it. And what do you know, one month off of this drug and I am feeling way better, almost back to normal. I can actually talk to strangers without wanting to launch myself into the sun. Just be careful if you take this drug, the side effects can come later.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control a week ago and the first couple of days were good besides the spotting. Now it's the 7th day and I'm bleeding like its my regular period when it's not supposed to be. The past 2 days I have had really bad depression and  thoughts. I have depression but this BC is making it so much worse for me. I also have been noticing acne coming up around my jaw line which I never really got it there until now. So I am stopping this BC, I was hesitant in taking it anyways because I have had bad experiences with mood swings on 2 other types as well. BC just isn't for me I guess .
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Have used this for a month. Extreme headaches, nausea and my acne has returned. Not a fan.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking this pill a month ago to prevent pregnancy.  I normally take breaks from BC pills bcuz I have random physical side effects.  My go to BC pill has always been microgestin and it has always worked just fine other than the normal weight gain side effect.   My friends and family noticed a significant change in my behavior.  My thoughts are erratic but my mood is consistently low.  I overthink everything and cannot sleep which leaves me fatigued all day.  I’ve been working out and stay fit and healthy but yet I’m gaining weight despite the hours in the gym.  My mind and body need a break!!! I do not recommend this pill.  I was doing so good before I started this BC. Worst month ever and I’m not starting a new pack.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I recently switched from taytulla to this horrible pill. Although it is cheaper. I have noticed extreme weight gain and acne, but worst of all extreme anxiety and depression! Which I have never experienced before. Horrible symptoms in just one cycle of this pill. I wish there was something else to take for the light periods that doesn’t cost $175 per month with insurance. I feel like women are discriminated against with all of this hoopla. Unfair

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After having a copper IUD for four years, I went on Taytulla after my doctor recommended I get my IUD removed.  I didn't experience any noteworthy side effects.  I didn't gain weight, experience acne, or have mood swings.  The first month I spotted some when my period was supposed to come, but after the first month my period completely stopped.  I was worried at first that I might be pregnant, I even took a few pregnancy tests, but they were always negative.  I still get some cramping and other PMS symptoms when on the placebo pills, but I don't bleed.  I would consider this a benefit to Taytulla.  The only reason I'm switching brands is that I got new insurance, and Taytulla is $50 a month, so I'm trying a lower cost option.  If that one doesn't work out, I will definitely switch back to Taytulla.

Balziva (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had a bad experience with Balziva. One week after starting new pack I would start spotting which will not stop until the end of the pack. I would not recommend.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I love this pill! It has been my saving grace. Two years ago I used to have heavy periods with painful cramping that had me out for days and would make me throw up from the pain. I no longer even have a period. I also used to become very aggressive, depressed and even violent during PMS. I could not control any of my emotions and became a different person. Now I feel more mellow all throughout the month. Highly recommend this birth control

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Started breakthrough bleeding out of nowhere with this medication. Within three days of starting it, still bleeding heavily almost two weeks later. Not happy with this at all. My last pill was way better.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So after being on this pill for a year and a half I see all of these horrible comments about it but honestly I think it’s amazing, acne was gone periods were lighter and less painful (mind you I had severe cramps that made it impossible to move, I’m sure lots of females know exactly what I mean) and it fixed all of these problems for me.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS! I was prescribed Lo Loestrin Fe to regulate my periods.  The first few weeks I had terrible headaches and dizziness.  Sunday (three weeks after starting) I woke up with no feeling in the left side of my face or arm.  I went to the emergency room and they said it was a side effect of the birth control. I have been off for two days and feeling is starting to come back and dizziness improving.  The Dr's said if I didnt' stop taking when I did I could of had a stroke.  Luckily I stopped in time.  Tell all your friends to try a different BC pill or get off if you currently take.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL!!!! my doctor gave me this for hormonal acne and heavy cramps.  On my 3rd week of taking this ( the week right before my period when I normally break out) I had THE WORST BREAKOUTS of my life. It is like I woke up with a full face of cystic acne. Within 2 days I went from a few to literally 26 pimples. 26! It hurt to smile and I didn't leave the house for a whole week because I was so embarrassed. If that wasn't enough, I was so depressed while on this I was crying uncontrollably at least once daily and when my period came it was the most painful and heavy period I've EVER had. Seems like it did the literal opposite of what I started it for. Very disappointed. I wish I would have done my own research on this pill before ever starting as literally every review I've found is bad. if your thinking of taking this please do your research!!

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've just started my third month of this pill, and it has been a complete disaster. This is also my first time taking birth control. A couple weeks ago I thought about trying something different since it has been making me cry about every little stress in life and has also made me anxious about everything. I'm in my first semester of college and this pill has not made it easier. I am currently dealing with some relationship problems, but I would never typically feel this depressed about anything. I'm so much happier than this. The only good thing I've experienced with this pill is the barely there period. This pill is destroying my happiness and ruining me as a person. Due to all of the anxiety and depression, I haven't been eating as much as I should, so I've lost weight. I would not recommend this pill to anyone.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this birth control for 5 years now.  My doctor prescribed it to me because my flow was severely heavy and that coupled with my anemia led to me passing out a lot. Also before I began it I had cramps so painful that I would miss work or school because I couldn't get out of the fetal position. The first thing I noticed when I originally went on it was the cramps went away. After 4 months of being on it my period it started to lessen. After the first year I went from 5 days of heavy flow and 2 days average flow to 3 days heavy flow and then it lessened over the course of the week. Now I have 3 days of normal flow and light spotting the rest of the week. I never gained weight or had any anxiety attacks. Honestly his pill is great.
Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Severe weight gain other than that it's pretty good.  I gained almost 15 pounds in 2 months any 1 else have this problem

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill was nightmarish. My doctor recommended it to me, and it made me a crazy person. Panic attacks daily, self harm, depression, dark thoughts. I’ve never been like that, and I haven’t been like that since I got off. It seems like other people had similar experiences. Onto the next pill, I suppose.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before Junel, I (5', 90 lbs) was put on Vienva for severe cramps as well as a birth control method, and soon after experienced severe (worsened) depression; though it did help with my cramps and decreased my flow. The depression got so bad that I asked my doctor to switch to a lower dose, and Junel's been working just fine. I think I have been on it for 5-6 months now, and I do still have depressive episodes but I also had them before getting on any hormonal medication, so it's hard to say whether or not Junel causes/worsens it. My cramps still show up here and there for a few hours when my period starts, but they're MUCH better than before. I'm lucky to be able to say that my weight and acne levels have been about the same since starting.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Ive been taking this for almost 3 months (on my last week from the 3rd month) and I have NOT had my period yet. 1st month I mean I didn’t really get the side effects, my cramps and headaches were a bit more bad than before but nothing too bad. Sex drive is still the same, love having sex. But no period slight spotting for 2-3 days that’s it. Second month no period at all same  cramps and headache and a bit of diarrhea (very uncomfortable). On my 3rd month sticking with it because of doctors recommendation. If I don’t get my period this month I may switch because not getting my period freaks me out lol. I have taken other birth control pills (when I was 18 so I forgot the name) but I did not have these effects I got my period the second month it was very light but it was there lol. I may stick around for the 4th month to see if I’ll feel better but so far I’m not really happy about this pill

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is garbage! I was having problems figuring out what was wrong with me, then I read everyones reviews. 2 months in on this pill, Since wallgreens said they did not have my other pill available they said this was the same. I noticed severe changes in how I feel.  It was horrible. Breasts hurt so bad, headaches, gaining tons of weight, facial swelling and water retention ,depression, food cravings like never before, mood swings etc. This pill is the worst. I hate it, I will never take it again. I gained 12 pounds in the few weeks on it or more. I am very unhappy. This pill needs to be taken off the market, this is absolutely the worst. I am so angry. Please do not take this. FDA needs to remove this from the market. It's dangerous.

Junel 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Junel 1.5/30 has been working really well for me for over 3 years. I hardly ever get a period (1-2 times a year max) and I never experience cramping anymore. Also I haven't gotten pregnant so I know it's working! I know everyone is different but this pill has been perfect for me!

Loestrin 21 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):After trying several different combined pills, this one is by far the best. I suffer from moderate acne that would flare up every month to the point I felt so self-conscious I wouldn't want to leave the house. 3 months later and my skin is completely clear, not even so much as a tiny pimple. Along with the acne I had before, I also had very heavy and painful periods-also gone. I now have 3 days of light, pain- free bleeding every month and my mood is better than ever. I would definitely recommend this pill!

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I went on Blisovi for birth control over three months ago. In the past I have been on Gildess and requested something similar when I restarted birth control this time around. I can only say really good things about this pill. I have had no side effects at all. The first month I had some slightly irregular spotting and bleeding but I had started the prescription on what I thought was the first day of my period but ended up being an unusual early spotting that then stopped and my period started a few days later. However, after the first month, my periods have been lighter than normal without any increase in PMS symptoms. Bonus has been that I have also seen a decrease in pre period breakouts (but for me these were minimal prior to starting birth control). I know a lot of negative reviews are posted, but know that not everyone has a bad time on this pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this birth control about two weeks ago for awful periods and an ovarian cyst.  So far this pill has made me incredibly nauseous, agitated, and constantly hungry. I’m not sure if these are normal side effects, but I’m hoping for the best. I’m half way done with the first pack.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My pharmacy randomly switched me from Microgestin to Junel after a year and since switching 4 weeks ago I've had terrible night sweats causing me to have to change clothes and sheets because I'm soaked, extreme bloating and weight gain of about 5 pounds, acne and greasy skin (I've never had acne in my life except an occasional pimple), terrible cramps (never been much of a cramper), and also mood swings. I had zero of these side effects on Microgestin and will be talking to my doctor about prescribing me ONLY Microgestin and not giving the pharmacy the freedom to randomly switch me even though it has "the same active ingredients."

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):First time ever taking BC and I was on this pill for 5 months. The only symptom I had for a while was being very emotional. I completely stopped having a period in the 3rd month which I enjoyed. In the 4th month, I got really hot tempered for about 2 weeks then I mellowed out for a while. In the 5th month I started having symptoms of depression... always crying for no reason, sleeping and not eating. I stopped taking them because it was a struggle to be that depressed. I did NOT have any weight gain, acne problems, or libido decrease.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It took a solid 3 months for my body to adjust to this pill. I had heavy periods, lots of spotting, and mood swings but once I adjusted I loved it! I was on yaz for a long time and it gave me severe anxiety and flushed skin. Switching to lo Loestrin Fe cleared the anxiety and skin problems up immediately! THE ONLY REASON I AM GOING OFF THIS MEDICATION IS THE COST.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Initially, I was placed on birth control due to irregular periods that lasted 10-11 days. I started with a different prescription and it literally had no effect after 3 months. My periods were still irregular and they were still 11 days. So, my doctor switched me to Junel. I never really attributed the changes in myself to my medication so it was odd to start noticing things. I love Junel for its purpose, preventing pregnancy and regulating and lightening my period (now only 6-7 days). The only side effects I have noticed in myself would be a major increase in emotions, an increase in breast size and vaginal dryness. I was NEVER an emotional person but I pretty much tear up about ANYTHING slightly sad. The emotional side is a bit annoying but it can be dealt with. Otherwise, this medication has suited its purpose for me over these past 2 years.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I used this prescription for 6 months and I'd say overall it was okay, but more negative than positive. During the first two months, I had very bad acne which I don't usually have a problem with. I was able to control it by taking vitamin B supplements everyday, but some days were worse than others. I do believe that this brand causes weight gain. I had extremely bad fluctuations with weight and gained 10 pounds despite not changing my diet. I was able to lose this 10 pounds in the last couple months by eating less. I switched to a new brand last month and I've noticed I'm actually losing weight being back on my normal diet before taking Microgestin.The only pro was its effectiveness at period cramping. It was practically non-existent and flow was very light. After 3 days of being on the sugar pills, my period usually stopped early.

Ortho-Novum 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got off this pill for a few months because I realized how bloated and moody I was 2 weeks before my cycle. Even though this helped lighten up my cycle and shorten it. Anyway I got back on it this month and after the first day I immediately noticed my mood swings and my craving for food. This is crazy. I am going to finish this pack out because and only because I need my cycle to come on the day its supposed to but after this I am not going to take 7/7/7 any more. Crazy how this effects you physically and emotionally. I am also not motivated to do anything...again crazy.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):27 years old. I have been on this for 3 years and decided to give it up for good. There are definitely pros and cons, but for me the cons are too much.Pros:-no period in 3 years-no cramps-cleared all of my acne-didn't get pregnantCons:-anxiety-depression-extreme brain fog daily (like you're just walking around in a dream)-mood swings (happy for a few hours, then sad for hours, then happy)-makes my face very dry and not able to retain moisture-Fat/water retention on my stomach....I gained 10 pounds on it (I've never had fat/water on my stomach but this medicine has me with a constant chubby belly that never goes away even with diet and exercise)It just isn't worth it anymore, I want to feel normal again.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve taken this pill about 5 years and I love it. My weight is maintained, my skin is clear and less oily, I have a perfectly scheduled period. I started taking it at 16 as contraceptive and super bad periods. Before taking it I had a 10 day, heavy flow, bad cramps that I was prescribed to Vicodin for. Junel saves lives, I never want to stop taking it. I can say I’ve had a very low sex drive, but I’m okay with that.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on birth control since age 18, started with one that was horrible. Switched doctors have been taking Lo Loestrin for 2 years and didn’t get my period which was great. I always had very heavy periods which is why my dr had me go on it. I went off of it for the past year because I wasn’t very good at taking it at the same time every day due to my schedule. I started again this month mid cycle and am experiencing nausea and loss of appetite which hopefully will go away once my body gets used to it next month after my period. This birth control is the best I’ve been on and I love not getting my period and spending money on heavy flow pads every month.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If you have any history of depression or anxiety, please please avoid this BC. Yes it gave me a light and short flow with no break outs, but is that worth your mental health? Some months on this pill were fine or ok, but after about 9 months I started developing horrible mood swings and eventually severe depression. I know my body very well and there is a definite link between BC and depression.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for a few months and my complaints are the weight gain is out of this world I feel as if it’s making my metabolism go nuts. It’s not too bad but not great either, I feel more moodier and extremely self conscious about almost everything now, and lastly the acne my skin isn’t horrible but it never looked  this bad before. I changed up my routine a bit and I feel as if nothing is working or changing the state of my skin. Very annoying

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this pill for 4 days.  I experienced extreme nausea, to the point where I had to hide in the back at work because I thought I was going to throw up. Second day I had a panic attack which I haven't experienced in years. Second, third, and fourth day I cannot stop crying over everything little thing. I'm sad, irritable, and just feeling weird.  Sometimes I feel good and other times I feel terrible. This is my first time on birth control but already I'm having a bad experience. I guess I have to wait it out but I'll be on the phone with my doctor tomorrow because this added stress isn't needed

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started lo loestrin Fe about 5 months ago, which I hated so much, gained about 10 pounds and was constantly tired and mood swings were crazy. It was so expensive too, so I switched to Junel fe 1/20 at first I loved it (the first three months) Now I just started my 4th month pack and I've had the worst cramping and nausea the week before my period and ever since I got my period AND even when my period is gone, its so uncomfortable. My periods are lighter than ever and I've had no acne. But this cramping and mood swings and sad thoughts are just about enough to stop taking BC.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for a while now, my pharmacy switched me from Junel fe and I genuinely thought everything happening to me was my own fault and that something was wrong with me. I started taking birth control for ovarian cysts and mild endometriosis. After doing tons of research I’ve been finding that the crazy amount of hair loss, weight gain (I went from 120 to 130 in a short period) and cystic acne on my jawline and back is all from this pill.  I’ve been so down and out from the way this pill has made me look and feel. Not to mention the back pain, anxiety, depression, low libido, and general lack of interest in my normal hobbies. I’m quitting immediately.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I'm about to start my third month on this pill, and so far it's been pretty rocky. Since I've started this pill, my anxiety has been everywhere. I've had terrible migraines and stomach aches every time I've taken this pill - they'd usually kick in about an hour or two after I took it. Also, my period didn't arrive on the second month which freaked me out a little, but thats normal. The only reason I'm on this bc is to get an IUD after this third month, and I'm ecstatic to not have this added anxiety. Truly will be a weight of my shoulders.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Second month on Junel fe. I'm 35yrs old never on birthcontrol before, this is my first time ever. Cons: horrible acne (never had acne before),  cramps, painful intercourse (never had before this) First month on it I had nausea, as I'm finishing the second month it has subsided. First period started really light and got heavier which was a bit disappointing, was under the impression that this would help lessen the heaviness. Pros: Prevents pregnancy. Loss of appetite. I will give this a total of 3 months but will probably switch if the acne persists and periods don't get lighter.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Taytulla for about 8 months now and let me tell you. It’s been a roller coaster ride. My original birthcontrol I was on I never had any side effects or anything wrong except from gaining a little bit of weight. The doctor switched my birth control to Taytulla and it’s literally been the worse thing ever! I am a very happy person and this pill made me extremely depressed and also my anxiety went skyrocket and thru the roof! I thought I was like this cause I went thru a breakup after 4 years but no! After reading the reviews it all makes sense. I am definitely stopping the pill and do NOT recommend Taytulla to anyone!

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Before I got on LoLo I had periods that would keep me down for 3 days at a time. I would miss school and fall behind in my classes because of this. I was given a higher dosage pain medicine and it nearly killed me (literally).  I was prescribed LoLo and after 2 months, it stopped my periods completely. I went about 2 years without having a period and I felt AMAZING. Within the last 4 months, I've had some AWFUL periods - almost as if I had never been on the pills. High amounts of stress, panic and anxiety attacks have been happening to me lately and because of that my cramps have been slightly crippling. Last month, I wasn't even under any stress and my period started. I feel like the Lolo is doing what it should be doing now and I just have been spoiled by not having a period at all for so long. To be honest, I feel like while I'm on the pills I should not have such heavy periods and it is very frustrating to be in such a pain even while on a medicine that should be preventing it..

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was prescribed Microgestin 1.5/30 and like everyone else, received Blisovi. I never tried the Microgestin, but my doctor recommended I switch for acne and spotting. I took it at night the first day, and woke up the next day so nauseated I had to call out of work. I still experience a little nausea here and there with it but nothing to that extent. I feel like my moods are really evened out and my acne is clearing, no spotting yet. Maybe I was just on a terrible birth control before but, I think blisovi is pretty great. I don't think I'll even switch to the Microgestin. Not everyone has a bad experience with it I guess! Don't worry about the reviews and try it for yourself.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started this pill about 2 & 1/2 years ago, I am realizing now that I gained 25 pounds in that time. My mood swings are awful... really good highs and really bad lows. I never had a big appetite but now eat everything even when I am not hungry. Junel fe was prescribed to me for my really awful cramps, my slight acne, and my heavy flow. It made my acne a lot worse but helped with the cramps and heavy flow for a while. I am also anemic so the iron was supposed to help me feel less faint and weak but did not really work. It was a lot more effective in the first year, but once being on it for too long I think my body just got used to it and I began to see all the problems I had in the beginning.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on Junel Fe for about two months and it has shortened my period and made my cramps easier to deal with but I’ve experienced EXTREME nausea. There are certain days where all I can think about is how nauseous I am. I also have experienced mood swings, anxiety, inability to focus, fatigue, and almost constant bleeding all throughout the month. 6/10 sort of recommend.
Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):it's great, zero side effects for me

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My insurance switched me to this pill from lo loestrin Fe. I had migraines the first few weeks and horrible cramps. My doctor said to just stick with it. It's been a few months and the migraines and cramps are gone but now worried about my lack of libido. I'm only 25.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Worst mistake of my life was starting this birth control. A week into it I started having chest pains and throwing up. I’ve been to the ER twice after thinking I’m having a heart attack. I can’t sleep. I can’t function correctly. Constant fear of panic and anxiety attacks. Hard to breath. I stopped taking the pill yesterday. I took it for 12 days and I hope and pray I return back to myself soon after taking it. This pill doesn’t even deserve one star :(

Cyclafem 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was taking a different brand of birth control (same dose of hormones), when my pharmacist refilled it with Cyclafem. Within days, I was having migraines and I was bloated, nauseous, and, scariest of all, deeply depressed. Because I had gotten a 3-month supply, I couldn't go back to my old brand without going to the doc, getting a new script, and paying out of pocket. The side effects of Cyclafem were so bad that, after 5 weeks, that's what I did.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It was horrible. I bled for 23 days straight. I had to stop taking the pills after 2 weeks because of the non stop bleeding/spotting and I had gained 10 pounds in 2 weeks. I was 102.8 when I started, and in 14 days I was 112.8. Way too many hormones in that pill. Do not take this!

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This BC is horrible! I realized I was getting depressed everyday and my mood swings are bad. I was starting to think iIwas bipolar but after reading similar reviews  I know I'm not crazy - it is just the Blisovi

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My previous birth control got discontinued and I was prescribed Junel FE. Within the first two months I gained 30 pounds and my acne has been worse than it’s ever been. I’ve been taking birth control pills since I was thirteen and I’ve never had problems until Junel. I do not recommend!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this medication for nearly 2 months. In these 2 months, I have experience extreme fatigue, anxiety, and depression. I also experienced some of the most painful cramps I have ever had during the first month.  I struggled with anxiety and depression prior to going on Junel Fe 1/20, but not to this extreme. I'm going to continue with this pill for another month or two in hopes that I might finish adjusting to this pill and feel ok again. My hopes are not high though. This pill is probably not the best choice for me and might not be the best choice for a lot of women......

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this birth control for over a year and have never experienced any symptoms or side effects. I started using this birth control because I was starting Accutane to cure hormonal acne that never went away after I got my IUD taken out. I have never used any other oral birth control pills but I have used the Implanon and the Mirena and the experience with the pills has been much better for me.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill for about 6 months now. I was scared at first because of the reviews but thought I would give it a try. My periods come when they aren't supposed too, and then have almost completely stopped (which freaks me out). I have horrible headaches, that are just getting more frequent, and my acne has gotten worse. It's not a lot of acne, but its frequent, in the same spot and cyst like.  Needless  to say, it does it's job, but not the right one for me.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Hate this birth control! Terrible for acne prone skin, causes horrible hormonal acne. I never get my period anymore and randomly spot. Getting off of this pill asap.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve only been taking this pill for about a month but so far I am very happy with the results. I was very nervous to start Junel based off the other reviews but I’ve have a fairly positive experience. Before taking Junel I would get terrible cramps (that would cause me to cancel plans/ responsibilities) and extremely heavy periods. I now only have very minor if any cramping at all during my period and a significantly lighter flow. The only semi problem I’ve experienced is a little acne but I’m sure this is just because my body is normalizing to the hormones and hope this begins to go away. I hope this helps and reduces some of your nerves about this pill :)

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Coming from someone who already struggles with bipolar and anxiety, this made me feel like I was losing my mind. I’ve been in a mental hospital and felt more sane. The cramping and vomiting were the cherry on top. If you struggle from mental health issues please please stay away from this.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DO NOT TAKE THIS PILL.It's horrible & I got bad side effects from it. Lots of rapid weight gain after about a month of using it.I gained 10 pounds in one month & I have lost my appetite.I also had lethargy & I'm always tired.I also missed my period altogether last month & I am stressed out about potential pregnancy.Do yourself a favor & avoid this pill altogether.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on this BC for 6 weeks after having a tubal pregnancy and a fallopian tube removed. For 3 weeks I've been having severe panic attacks. I get agitated, can't focus and have racing thoughts. I didn't consider that the BC could be to blame until last night when I realized that's the only thing that's changed. I did research on this drug and I'm relieved to discover that other women feel the same way. Don't get me wrong, I'd rather NONE of us feel this way EVER, but it's nice to know I'm not alone. Holy balls. I stopped taking this immediately. Besides the AWFUL anxiety, I've also experienced nearly non-stop bleeding, headaches, nausea and fatigue. It could take a while for my body to "accept" these things and level out, but I'm not willing to feel this way any longer. This BC is HORRIBLE, at least for me. I'm going to just switch to condoms. I don't want to chance trying another drug that can mess with my hormones, my emotions, my physical well-being and my life.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have had extremely painful heavy periods since the start of my 20's. This pill has gotten rid of my cramps and made my period lighter. It has also cleared up the hormonal acne on my chin and I actually feel less bloated on this pill. The negative side effects I have experienced are spotting, horrible headaches the first few months and breast tenderness.The jury is still out on mood swings and possible hair loss because I struggle with depression / anxiety and have low iron so its hard to tell how much - if any - of that is coming from the birth control.Birth Control is a mine field for us women and what works for one could be horrible for another. I haven't tried any other scripts in fear of trading off for worse side effects. Most of the bad side effects came at times when I was not consistent with taking the pill and I don't want to get an IUD. I would recommend to give it a good three months of accurate consecutive dosage before giving the next one a go.

Larin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m about to switch from this to something else. I’ve been extremely depressed. I’m using an outgoing person. Never been too lazy. But since I’ve started this pill I’ve been not wanting to do anything but sleep and I’ve been really depressed. I’ve also gained a lot of weight. I was 128lb then within the 2 months and a half I’ve been taking the pill I’ve gained 15 pounds. Not happy about that at all. I’m also very sensitive and get upset really easy. I’ve never really been like that before the pill. Headaches are another problem. It seems like I always have a headache. This is my experience with the pill. I honestly don’t recommend it.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I’ve been on birth control for about 3 years now. A year ago I switched gynos and she put me on a new pill (junel fe). At first everything was fine. But I developed MAJOR anxiety, was having attacks daily. Couldn’t control my emotions. Gained a little bit of weight but not much at all. After being on it for almost a year now my face has been breaking out HORRIBLY. I never even had this much acne in high school. Yes periods were shorter, and only had one day of heavy bleeding. I would get bad cramps the week before, the week of, and the week after my period. One other thing it increased was my migraines. The ONLY good thing that came from this pill was keeping me from being pregnant, but it’s not worth it and I am switching ASAP.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the very first birth control I had ever been put on. My OBGYN recommended it so I gave it a try & told me to come back in about a month or so & to see how my body handled it. It was about a week into taking it is when I started feeling nauseous 24/7. I could not even get near food without feeling like I was going to throw up; therefore I lost weight. This pill made my anxiety & depression SKY ROCKET!! The smallest little things made me cry or have anxiety for no reason, I was not happy for a long time because of this birth control. My boobs hurt SO bad on this pill so much that I had to wear only sports bras because even walking down a staircase made me feel like I got punched in each boob. My period was VERY irregular, I rarely bled on my 4 placebo pills, I only ever bled randomly, there was no regularity whatsoever.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started on this pill about two years ago because I requested my doctor give me a low hormone pill that wouldn't give me crazy side effects. I almost instantly noticed I started to gain weight with it but I couldn't say how much because it's always seeming to fluctuate. I would still get a light 3 day period at the same time each month, which is fine because I didn't want any pregnancy scares. Within the past year I've been experiencing the worst PMS I've ever had, and it was already bad before the pill. I have extreme fatigue and mood swings that are starting to interfere with daily life, my breasts seem to almost always be tender and swollen even after my period, and my skin texture has been fluctuating as well. Recently it seems like I always have several spots on my face when I used to only break out on my period. Hoping to switch to something else soon.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):As someone who has a very heavy period, cramps have always been a problem. I was put on this BC by a doctor from urgent care & it honestly was life changing. My periods were lighter, but they were still pretty lengthy (5 days.. better than 7 lol). It also regulated my period. I never really broke out that bad, just a couple spots here and there... this helped with acne.. I only broke out on my period. The only downside is that it gets you very depressed... I would recommend this to someone who is new to birth control! :)

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This stuff is the worst. I have ovarian cysts so this is what my gyno recommended. I have been on it for 8 months or so and had spotting between periods for several months and now I haven’t had a period in 3 months.. sounds great right? Not so much. I am constantly bloated and uncomfortable.. my depression, insomnia, and anxiety are worse than ever, as well as my acne. I wouldn’t recommend this to my worst enemy.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have always been a positive and out going person, only had acne when my period came, and I was looking to get on birth control, so my doctor prescribed this.  Now for the month that I’ve been on it, it’s been terrible. My acne is worse than when I was in high school and I have developed severe sadness and anxiety, which is miserable since I know I haven’t always been like that. I understand every body is different, but me feeling constant sadness and anxiety so suddenly had me look into this and I read how I wasn’t the only one with a bad experience. On to the next pill

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Although I have not been on this birth control long, I have had no major problems. I was nervous starting this birth control for one reason being I’ve never taken birth control before, another reason is that the reviews were so bad. Within the first week of taking it my skin has looked really clear, my usual bloating has gone away, and I have had no major issues that made me scared to take this birth control at first. I have been slightly more emotional and Another side effect I have is my stomach issues, I either feel not hungry sometimes or I have diarrhea but it’s nothing as bad as some other women have been through. It will take some time for my body to start getting used to this. Overall I was skeptical of this but it works for me, but I know everyone’s body will react to it differently. Hope you it works for everyone!!

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been taking Blisovi for a month now, and I haven’t really had any negative things happen to me besides some weight gain (but that’s probably because I don’t exercise so whoops). The doctor said your body needs at least 3-4 months to adjust to the hormones though, so hopefully everything will go back to normal. Earlier on, I did experience a little bit of nausea, but it went away after the 3rd week. ALSO, it does do its job on protecting from pregnancy. I had an accident around the twelfth day of me taking birth control, and my doctor said to wait a month before having unprotected sex so I was super scared that I might’ve been pregnant. But then I got my period and was relieved. Definitely follow what your doctor says though so you don’t stress too much!! A bunch of sites say that you’re protected after 7 days of use, but for extra safety I’d wait until at least a month of using it. Overall though, Blisovi has been a good first time birth control for me.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking it because I had ovarian cyst ruptures and the pill stopped them. I got severely depressed and lost a majority of my hair. I made the decision to go off of it after a year and a half and I definitely see results. My mood is fantastic and my hair is growing back at a fast rate. Definitely want to warn people about the side-effects if this pill.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on LoLo for 4 miserable months! During those 4 months I spotted and or bled heavily for 3 weeks out of the month, stopped bleeding only while on the first week of the pack. I was also severely depressed and had 3 horrible panic attacks, one was so bad I was take to the ER. My anxiety while on LoLo got to a point where simple everyday tasks like going to the grocery or taking my kids out was impossible for me. I felt lightheaded/dizzy and fatigued on a daily basis. After numerous visits and phone calls to my OBGYN she finally took me off this pill and my mood has changed dramatically I now feel I’m back to my normal self. LoLo was a nightmare for me!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was switched to this medication because every year I tend to "outgrow" a medication and get non-stop periods. But this one was by far the worst out of the 10 I've ever been on over the past 10 years. I got acne so severe that I had to go on Accutane and at age 28, that's really embarrassing and my face is still covered in scars. I never had acne before this medication. Also, the cramping all month never went away, constant spotting, etc. Mood swings, bloating, crazy weight gain. And anxiety and migraines like you couldn't believe. I wouldn't give this medication to my worst enemy.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Not horrible- first 3 week of taking it experienced pretty awful mood swings and borderline depression for a week. However, by the 4th week this all cleared up and I felt back to normal! No acne, no weight gain, nothing from there on :)

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control made me gain about 15 lbs, gave me horrible cystic acne, and oily hair in the six month span I was taking it. Before I realized the pill was causing this I considered Accutane, that’s how bad the acne was. It did prevent pregnancy so that’s why I’m giving it two stars. Two weeks after I stopped taking it my skin, hair, and body started to return to normal. Though I’m left with a face covered in scars and acne marks.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control messed with my mood very severely. I had mood swings, sank into a deep depression about 3 months into me taking the pill, and my anxiety skyrocketed. As a person who already deals with anxiety this medicine did not help. I also had very irregular periods, and sometimes it wouldn’t come for a month or two at a time which was pretty concerning when sexually active. I’ve had bad headaches and cramps throughout the time I’ve been on this pill, which is about 9 months, but otherwise it worked just fine. However, I’m definitely going to get switched off of it.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Not sure it it helped with endometriosis symptoms but I can say this. I had used it for at least 4 months I have noticed my thyroid problems has improved fairly well; on the other hand, I'm super moody and depressed ( which has decreased some over the month, but still a problem). 2nd I'm super regular person with my periods and my period has gone away already twice and still gives me some PMS symptoms  which sucks bc they actually last for weeks on and off.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):DON’T DO IT. I read the reviews here and I thought well everybody is different so I started taking it. I started spotting a week into it and cramping. Not only that but I went CRAZY. I was mad all the time, for no reason  and I would snap for everything. I started randomly getting sad to the point that I was depressed. I wasn’t myself. Don’t do it. Don’t be like me a month later regretting not listening to these reviews.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Alright, so I've been taking this for a month, and I was stoked about it first because I love taking birth control, until going on 3 weeks later and I am still on my period, I've had really bad constant mood swings, high anxiety and extremely high depression. I thought that it was normal me being me, and I thought that the period was just all me.  I was trying to keep all negative thoughts out of my head because before I started taking this, I was fine. No anxiety, no depression, 6 day long periods, and my anger was controlled. I read the reviews, and now I know what all of this is from so I thank everyone for the reviews! I am quitting this immediately and switching to a different one

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Unfortunately did not have a good experience with this pill.  Was given a prescription for this after being off of hormonal birth control for 10 years due to getting emotional side effects (I had previously tried 3 different brands), I wanted to see if I could find something that might work for me.  After only 2 weeks I was severely depressed and started having such severe panic attacks (which I'm not prone to) that I had to be put on medical leave from work.  In addition I had extreme fatigue, brain fog, and heavy breakthrough bleeding that lasted 2.5 weeks.I stopped taking it at the end of the first pack and within a couple weeks I felt normal again.Obviously everyone's body is different, but I don't think I would recommend this brand to anyone who may have had depression/anxiety on other hormonal birth control, I'm not sure that this one actually lessens these side effects as it claims to.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The first year I was on this was fine. I had no period, no weight gain. My acne didn't clear up, but didn't get worse either. However, the second year, my mood swings and depression and anxiety went off the charts. I've cried like I've never cried before, there's been days I was ready to just crawl into a hole and never come out, I would get really irritated with my significant other and friends- over nothing. Upon some research and talking to friends, this isn't out of the ordinary.  I'm switching off of it this cycle, and hoping that something else works better for me.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been on taytulla for more than 6 month and it has been the worst experience of my life. I've had constant migraines, no sex drive, my anxiety and depression has been through the roof, my period is non existent which I don't think is normal or healthy. I've been so nauseaous and so moody it's crazy. I DO NOT recommend this pill to anyone. Stay far away from it as possible. I am hoping to look for another pill or maybe an IUD.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on a different birth control for 2 years but decided to stop because I wanted to stop my period. I have been on taytulla for only a week and have never in my life experienced this kind of depression. My anxiety is also through the roof and I’ve been very nauseous. I have no energy to do anything and fell behind on my work drastically. Wanted to wait this out but it’s ruining relationships around me and overall not worth it. This has affected me mentally so horribly I’m taking immediate action to get off of it. I would not recommend

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):In the last 3 months while taking this pill, I have gained weight (my mom keeps asking me why I look pregnant...I'm also 21 years old), my acne came back after years of clear skin, my depression and anxiety exploded out of nowhere (my therapist hasn't seen me in months because I was doing so well), I am overly emotional and cry for hours over nothing (and my Dr wanted me to go on this pill to reduce this, whoops), and the comments on this page make so much sense to why this is happening to me. It sounds like half of the people on this pill do really well or REALLY  badly. When I told my doctor about my mood swings she told me to try another pill which gave me an allergic reaction and, even after the steroid shot, I'm still in a constant wave of slight discomfort. It might be from this pill, not too sure. I am getting off this pill at the end of my cycle and I'll either try something new or not go on at all because I am sick of this constant battle with myself.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):At 18 I went on birth control to help with menstrual cramp that would cause me to miss school they’d get to bad. I was on microgestin for TEN YEARS and never had a problem. Last year after switching PCPs I was put in to Junel Fe. I experience major mood swing, random emotional outbursts, lost my motivation to do pretty much anything active, and devloped anxiety.. the problems didn’t stop there. This past July I was admitted to the hospital with a pulmonary embolism (blood clot in the lung) that almost killed me. All from switching to Junel Fe.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have a very mild case of PCOS so my gyno was practically begging me to begin a birth control. That being said, I have always had very negative experiences with birth control pills and hadn’t used one in years because of that. But I thought, maybe my body has changed. STICK WITH YOUR INSTINCTS PEOPLE! I Immediately began the consistent spotting, cramping, had painful gas and bloating and my breasts were so swollen they felt like I was breastfeeding. The acne began around week 3 what seemed completely out of nowhere and I was covered in it. I didn’t suffer insomnia but the moodiness and sensitivity definitely increased as well a vaginal dryness (I am 23 and NEVER had that problem before). After the acne began I couldn’t take it anymore, it didn’t seem worth it to put my body through it. I stopped taking the pill almost through an entire pack, and I woke up in the middle of the night after 2 days of stopping it, bleeding so much. What is this pill?!?!

Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Doctor switched me to Junel Fe after being on Taytulla for months. I don’t have many good things to say about Junel Fe. My face is worse than it has ever been. It made my hair dry and it has started to fall out. And I have had terrible cramping from the beginning.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on LoLoestrin for 3 years and finally discontinued it in June 2018.  The entire time I was on it I noticed a lot of mood swings and anxiety but didn’t really much of it for the first 2 years.  Then within the last year it started to get worse and worse, I was crying all of the time, constantly sad and arguing with my husband a lot!  I had turned into someone that I was not and I started thinking about what could be causing this!?  I decided to stop the pills and I’m starting to feel like myself again! The mood swings and sadness gradually stopped! I know these pills effect everyone differently but unfortunately this one was not the one for me.  I’m trying an IUD next so we will see how that goes!

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I've been on this birth control for about 10 months. Everything was totally fine, I had shorter and less painful periods, no mood swings (actually less mood swings than before), no weight gain. I used this to treat PCOs. The only complaint was an upset stomach almost all the time which was preferable to all the PCOs symptoms. But recently I've noticed that this medicine causes me to get lots of lumps in my breasts. I found one just yesterday thats not like the rest: its bigger and in a location I've never had any texture in before and its not mirrored in the other breast. I have some breast cancer in my family so now I am a constant nervous wreck about getting breast cancer. I'm probably going to stop taking these pills soon once I talk to my doctor.
Junel Fe 24 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the best BC for me. I have zero side effects I love it ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on microgestin and one day went to Walgreens and gave me this and told me it was the same thing. It definitely was NOT. On microgestin I had 0 problems at all but since taking Junel fe my skin has become worse than it was in middle school and gave me painful cystic acne all over my face that will not go a away. I’ve been taking this for 4-5 months though and planning to switch. Only pro is that I didn’t get pregnant.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m on my third month of Loestrin and so far I can’t complain much. It’s definitely improved my acne. I still get a few breakouts right before my period starts but this is still a dramatic improvement from the pizza face I was dealing with before starting this pill. I’m also still spotting the week before my period but it seems to be going away slowly. Other than that, no mood swings, my weight is still the same, and periods are lighter and shorter with minimal cramping. If things keep going the way they are, I’ll probably stick to this birth control.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Lo Loesterin for 7 months. It did make my periods super light and they would only last a day. In August I did not get a period which I don't like. This birth control gave me horrible acne. I usually only break out right before my period but my acne was all the time and it was cystic acne at that. I didn't really have any cramps at all. I am now on month 7 and I'm experiencing break through bleeding which is a little heavier than normal. My GYN is changing me to Junel since this may not be enough hormones for me. This birth control was okay. I just can't deal with the acne and my face was oily all of the time! Not to mention I think it was causing my hair to shed more than normal. I can't wait to switch. Every one is different though so keep hanging in there!

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was my first time being on birth control, I started in late May. This birth control is literally giving me acne. Before I had pretty good skin, I only broke out during my period and now it’s acne 24/7. I have heard your skin gets worse before it gets better but I’ve been on it for like 4 months I feel like my body has adjusted. I also get more headaches but the one pro (other than preventing pregnancy) is that my period is lighter and less cramps but I don’t know if it’s worth this additional acne. I’m gonna try another birth control and hopefully not ruin my body.

Junel 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’ve been on this pill for about maybe 5 months. I used to take microgestin which made me extremely tired all the time. When I started Junel I noticed immediate appetite increase, and I’ve gained a lot of weight. Also, I almost never get acne and this makes me break out constantly. I don’t feel depressed or tired like I used to but I want to switch due to weight gain and acne, this pill does nothing for my cramps either, still the same pain as before. I don’t recommend this pill.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've been taking Blisovi fe 1/20 for just about 3 weeks now and I have been bleeding not spotting but bleeding some days heavy some not so heavy.  So since the second week, so about 2 weeks now I've been bleeding. I haven't had any side effects really other then being a little moody and I think that's because of this annoying bleeding, I know it takes your body time to adjust to birth control but I've been on BC before and I've never gone through this.  I've read all the reviews on this birth control and I haven't seen or read one good thing. I'm stopping this birth control and requesting something different.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have always read reviews on different birth controls and it has always scared me. I started taking Junel Fe 1/20 about 2+ weeks ago, and so far I have had barely any issues. I’ve only dealt with tender breasts and spotting so far, but other than that I’ve noticed no major changes. Birth control is all about finding the right pill for you! Don’t be scared to try it because of what you read online.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking birth control pills  for over 3 years without an issue and recently switched to the Junel Fe brand in March out of convenience/insurance. I didn't think there was an issue at first, but this medication has produced increasingly worse side effects as the months have passed. I have gotten to the point where my bleeding, pain, emotions, and exhaustion are worse than they have ever been in my entire life. I have gained a ton of weight and experience 24/7 extreme PMS symptoms even when my period is over a week away. The only good thing Junel Fe has done is keep me from getting pregnant.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Yaz for over 10 years. Started experiencing debilitating cramps during sex and after bowel movements about 2 years ago. Doc thought I may have endometriosis, but recommended I try a lower dose birth control first before doing any invasive testing. Let me tell you...I wish I knew about this pill a long time ago! Within the first week, my cramps subsided, my mood got increasingly better, and I enjoy sex now for the first time in a long time. I really hope there is someone out there that reads this amongst all of the negative reviews. I had zero negative side effects and have been on it for 6 months now. Taytulla saved my marriage! Insurance pays 100% as well with most carriers which is a nice added bonus :)

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Well almost a year on this bc, and at first I thought it was great. Needless did I really pay attention. 4-6mths into now re-thinking back I started having anxiety?!! Never before experienced this. My acne took a toll and I’m almost a year on this and I’m not happy at all. I have no reason to feel not happy. Anxiety through the roof, chest pains, constant acne, Oiler skin. Now reading the reviews after trying absolutely everything I could. Didn’t think birth control could even make you feel this depressed... sounds like I’m not the only one.

Mibelas 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I've enjoyed this medicine just as much as Minastrin.  Sometimes people can react to different additives/etc.  I've had that happen before.  The active ingredients are the same, however.  My periods are very light, regular, minimal cramping, etc.  It's great.  I love that they're only a few days also.  I've been on many brands and the only ones that have gone well for me are Yasmine, Minastrin, and Mibelas.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I spent the past 4 years on Lo lo estrogen. Initially, I gained 15 pounds--but I chalked it up to growing as I was 15 when I started it. I started out 3-4 days a week with a personal trainer and completely revamped my diet as a way of combating this--but nothing seemed to help me shed the incredible amount of weight I had gained. I went off my pill before summer and immediately dropped 15 pounds in a single month, with absolutely no changes in my diet and exercise. I felt as if my mood improved tremendously--my tiredness was gone, my sex drive was restored, and of course, my weight dropped. DO NOT recommend this medication.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have always struggled with depression, but after stopping this pill for just a couple weeks, I can see how much the birth control was to blame. It wasn't until a failed suicide attempt that resulted in someone mentioning that maybe my birth control is contributing to my extreme emotions that I stopped taking it and boom, I'm a different person. I'm truly so sad I spent the last two years of my life struggling because of how messed up this medication made my emotions. I wouldn't suggest it to my worst enemy.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on Taytulla for 2 years now to control Endometriosis. It is a great alternative to the hysterectomy that several Drs have recommended. I've had light spotting maybe 3 times in 2 years. With 2 having been these last 2 months. I see several complaints about them causing mood swings. It's a hormone. It will do that. They don't work if you don't take them regularly which means the same time every day. Nothing is a miracle drug. If it doesn't work for you, talk to your doctor and try something else. There are far cheaper medications than this one. However, I am happy with this product. It's pretty much the same outcome as the depo shot and this doesn't hurt my bone mass

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been taking this medication for 6 months I HATE IT. My periods have always been extremely painful.  I used to be on aviane and I loved it.  My dr put me on this medication. From reading other reviews I finally feel like I'm justified. My side affects have been horrible.  Breasts very tender, extremely depressed,  mood swings,  and I feel like I have the flu all the time. Cravings are horrible I just want to eat everything, I have gained about 10 lbs which makes my mood even worse. As I type this review I'm bundled up in a blanket with a heating pad and with a horrible headache. I feel like there is no relief and I constantly complaining and I cry about everything WHICH IS SO UNLIKE ME. I'm trying to think maybe this will pass but my husband and my family can't go on with my emotional rollercoaster any longer I think I'm going to stop taking this medication.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):The 1st week of being on this BC, I experienced nausea and anxiety. I started to experience some acne, which was normal to what I experience on my period. I also had no cramps during my 1st period which was amazing compared to the very painful cramps I have had my whole life. During the 1st week of the 2nd month, I had extreme anxiety and depressive thoughts. I tried breaking up with my boyfriend (who is amazing) for very irrational reasons. I also was having some cystic acne.  As the month went on, I started to feel better except for a few times I became extremely sad and depressed when I drank alcohol. Currently, I am halfway through my third month and my acne has cleared up. I have not had much anxiety or any other issues. I am very active and have not gained any weight while taking this BC. Overall, I am happy with my life and my relationships. My advice is to not let all the negative reviews get to you, try it for yourself, and keep in my mind the importance of a healthy lifestyle.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Okay so I was previously on another brand of birth control under my moms insurance for two years (which was great). Then my mom passed away and I was switched over to my dads insurance (not so great) so they switched me over on Junel. The pill was fine at first I was on this for two years I’d have panic attacks about once a month really high anxiety. But into my second year around October my depression and anxiety got significantly worse and I was having anxiety attacks daily. I’d try so hard to be happy and go out I’d feel that dizzy like a dream feeling for those three weeks in and I’d just get so sad for no particular reason. I don’t know if it was a bad batch or if it was my body’s reaction (because everyone’s body reacts to things different) . Yet, it made me feel bad enough to just stop it. And now I’ve haven’t had any attacks since (about a year later) .

Cyclafem 1/35 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I got really anxious and broke out when I was taking this birth control. Another weird side effect was after two months I kept spotting every day and it changed the color of my blood.  Even when it was my normal period it was always a really dark brown color. I didn't like bleeding every day so I stopped taking the pill. Good for not getting me pregnant but bad for everything else haha.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Obviously, this is just my experience . I wasn't pleased with this birth control. I was put on it, after wanting to start birth control again after taking couple years break from it. I've never had any bad side effects from birth control- until this one. My side effects were similar to pregnancy symptoms- I even took a few tests while on this birth control because it was that bad! I did give this pill a chance (3 months), but then decided I couldn't do it anymore. I did switch to another pill (Tri-Sprintec) and had 0 side effects because of it. I can say, my doctor was surprised I had a bad reaction to it- normally everyone she put it on loved it.

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I asked my GYN to give me a low dose BC pill because my period cramps are the worst. I've been on this since July and honestly some things I've experienced are a decreased libido and my breast grew from a 38B to a 40C. I have intermittent vaginal aching. I don't know if me always wanting to snack is from the pill cause I have always been a foodie.

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on this after my Mirena (which migrated) and didn’t want to do another IUD. Was on lo lo a year and didn’t have a good experience. I never missed a pill and took it the same time every day! I had breast pain constantly. My acne was so much worse on this, like I was a teenager again. My periods were very irregular, sometimes I wouldn’t get it and sometimes I would get it 2-4 weeks straight. Didn’t matter where I was in my pill pack either. The worse part was how much worse it made my anxiety. I didn’t realize until I started tracking it and noticing on my placebo pills my anxiety went down. Ever since I’ve stopped it my anxiety is almost GONE, my skin has cleared up significantly, my breast pain went away. I know some people who this worked for and some it didn’t. Unfortunately I gave it a good go to see if it would get better and it didn’t. Oh & my insurance didn’t cover this & there’s no generic. they do have a coupon card online.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):It’s my 3rd week using Taytulla. I have severe depression and mood swings. I am not myself at all and people around me are noticing it. After taking the pill in the morning I feel so nauseous and sometimes I would even vomit. I was thinking that I should finish the 3 month sample and see if my body will adjust, but now I am not so sure.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I am on week 2 and have been experience onset of severe fatigue and nausea on and off. I'm working through it but I haven't had this kind of side effects before when taking birth control pills.  I'm going to weather through it and see if it gets better. My gp said it should take 3 months to adjust and  then we will re- evaluate if I should adjust dosage or try a different one.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is the second birth control I've been on and I love it. I've been taking Junel Fe consistently for about a year. It has helped my mood swings during my PMS week, did not make me gain weight, made my boobs seem fuller, did not make me break out in acne, and has overall been very effective for me. I got on birth control because of how painful my periods were, now I only get a period that lasts about 2 or 3 days, I still do get cramps but they are not painful at all, my biggest problem with my periods. The only negative for this pill is that I have noticed a decreased libido, but I will take that over a painful period or pregnancy.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill was great at first I thought. But I was having irregular periods and after 6 months I started suffering from anxiety and depression. I then realized it could be the pill. And after reading all these reviews that are similar, it gives me a huge relief. I’m stopping the pill and switching.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This product has had such a negative impact on me. I’ve always been in and around 110 pounds but I immediately gained 20 on LoLo that won’t come off. I have zero sex drive and my anxiety + depression has worsened. I also haven’t gotten my period in 2 years which is not very comforting. The bloating and stomach cramps are daily, literally no way of minimizing that.
Tarina Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Bleed almost everyday ... definitely got to switch

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):If I could give this a 0 I would. She told me it would take up to three months for my body to adjust. 3 months exactly I stopped taking it. Anxiety, depression, not quite suicidal but I definitely wouldn't have cared if I died, hair falling out, zero sex drive, violent angry outbursts (I hit my sister for bumping into me), and a NON STOP PERIOD! I was miserable, this pill was absolute hell.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill is the worst. I was switched from Vienva to Blisovi about two months ago. I didn’t even have another period this month so I’ve been stressing that I’m pregnant but I’ve taken many tests and they’re all negative. Between last month and this month I had mysterious bleeding for about a week, I feel nauseous most of the time, extremely fatigued, depressed and I’ve noticed my anxiety has gotten worse. I had it before but I felt like I was getting better especially socially but it’s just getting worse now. I’ve lost interest in a lot of things because I have no energy no matter how much I sleep. My acne has gotten worse on the lower half of my face near my mouth and chin. I’m going to switch back to vienva soon so hopefully I will feel better. I’m not myself. I strongly think it is this pill.

Microgestin Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I switched to this from Sprintec because I wanted to be able to skip periods.
