I could only stay on it for a little over a month though because it affects my moods so badly and has not helped with acne like my previous prescription did. I have been getting so irrationally angry about stupid things and cry every day so I am now switching because its become too much. Besides that, I actually lost a few pounds on this medication and didn’t notice any effects on sex drive or lubrication.

Microgestin Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):When I first became sexually active, I started on Microgestin.  The nausea during the first couple months was unbearable and it resulted in losing 10 pounds.  After the nausea cleared, I became so violently emotional that I couldn't take it anymore.  This pill made my life a nightmare!

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):To start off, I have been on this birth control for a little over a year. I have felt absolutely amazing on it until recently a few months back, I started having incredible anxiety, heart palpitations and lack of motivation, etc. Out of nowhere. Even to this day, I still feel like I'm in a constant state of panic and worry. I mean, to the point where it has affected literally everything in my daily life. I have always had anxiety, but NEVER like this. I also have Hashimoto's and I thought  maybe it was my thyroid medication that had caused me to feel this way. Test after test, and more blood work but nothing showed up. I have been so caught up thinking about my thyroid medication, that I completely forgot about it potentially being my BC. After reading the reviews, I realized that this may be the case. I had visited my Ob-gyne prior to reading these reviews and my plan is to take a "pill holiday" off of birth control pills for 2-3 months then see how I feel. Hope this helps!

Loestrin 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control has given me so many pimples around my chin and I had perfectly clear skin before. I have no other side effect except for acne from this birth control and I hate it> I'd rather be nauseous from my other pill than this!  I can't wait to get off of it. Don't try this if you have sensitive skin

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on Mylan prior to this and I had nothing but actual positive side effect (weird huh?) anyways out of the blue I go and pick up my prescription to find out it was switched to Blisovi™ 24 Fe & at first everything was fine .. until like a month after where I noticed I had really bad fatigue, then came the hair loss, then towards the end started breaking out ... To the point where I couldn’t take it anymore, I would wake up tired and stay tired all day long and not to mention the horrible feeling on constantly shedding clumps of hair. Please do not take this ladies!

Pirmella 7/7/7 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This medicine changed me into a completely different person; I did not feel like myself at ALL, because I wasn’t. I was told it took about three months to adjust; I felt a little better after three months but still was not myself. I had zero energy, roller coaster of emotions, crazy mood swings and migraines. My husband begged me to switch because the change was so bad. I pretty much accepted that his is how birth control makes women feel, but that is not true. My doctor switched me today to an estrogen only pill. I hope the switch will have me feeling like myself again! I have to be careful when taking birth control because I have vascular disease and am at a higher risk of blood clots. Hope I can help someone else who is experiencing what I have! If you don’t feel right, tell your doctor.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This was the first birth control I was ever on and stayed on it for about 2 years continuously (no periods). I loved this pill in the beginning and had no noticeable side effects for the first year except that it cleared my horrible cystic acne. In the second year I was taking it I experienced a significant drop in libido and it was impossible to have sex without extreme pain and bleeding, and to me this defeated the whole point of being on birth control to prevent pregnancy from sex. So I decided to take a break from it for a few months and my cystic acne came back leaving lots of scars so I started again. The pain and dryness came back and my acne did not go away after 2 months so I decided to try and change it. I just switched to Aviane with a few side effects but I've heard that it makes acne worse so I'm hoping to find a pill that works for me someday!

Microgestin 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control helped all of my physical symptoms from PMDD and endometriosis, no longer did I cramp and swell all over like a balloon 3 weeks before my period (I was bloating up to 10 lbs almost), my near constant fatigue went away. My breasts grew like 2 cups sizes but they hurt all the time. Also, my scalp hair grew like crazy, it was thicker and fuller than it had been since I was a teenager and my skin was literally GLOWING. I thought I had found the answer to my problems until I slowly began to cry over nothing all the time, have insane anger and lash out at others irrationally... I was so depressed and down after 9 months being on this medication. I even tried to physically attack somebody while drinking which I have never done before, I stopped this medication immediately then. I also had white discharge all the time . If you become depressed on this or sensitive to things like this DO NOT TAKE THIS.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was put on Taytulla about 5 or 6 months ago after switching from less than 3 weeks on Kariva (which made me feel insane, depressed and was having harmful thoughts). Taytulla was an easy switch! I felt like myself again, my skin cleared, I had absolutely no adverse reactions and no cramping. Without birth control pills I am incredibly moody, &  suffer from PMDD, heavy flow, debilitating cramps & irregular cycles. I loved Taytulla until  4 weeks ago, when my hair started falling, my skin was breaking out and I was battling insomnia. Inactive pills come around and my period is the heaviest it’s ever been on birth control: just last month I had a single period day, and now I’m 3 days into another pack of Taytulla AND STILL BLEEDING!!! Calling my gyno today to switch. I’m on BC more for hormone regulation to control PMDD and severe cramping and irregularity than I am for actual birth control, and if it doesn’t do it’s job after a while, what’s the point?

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I want to break down in tears right now because after reading all these reviews I know I’m not alone. My pharm switched me to blisovi after microgestin, and my depression and anger are THROUGH THE ROOF. My anger is hurting other people so bad that I’m seeking anger management. Maybe I should save myself the money and just stop taking this pill because it has to be the problem

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started Blisovi Fe 1/20 about 2 1/2 months ago and so far its...okay? They say to give birth control about 3-4 months so your body can adjust to the hormones, that's what I'm doing. So far my breasts have been super tender and I have the occasional period cramps when I'm not even on my period. I don't break out or have any mood swings but I feel nauseated from time to time. Periods are light and last maybe three days which is nice but they seem to come on every three weeks instead four. I can definitely feel the side effects taking these pills so if you don't want side effects maybe try something else.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was on microgestin for probably 2 years I want to say and I had ZERO problems. I would only break out here and there when it was the last week of the pack and my period was coming but that’s about it. One day I went to pick up my refill of my pills and they gave me a new brand of birth control. Junel Fe. I hate it. The number one reason I hate it is because it has made my anxiety, PTSD and depression sky rocket through the roof. I haven’t had anxiety this bad since I was in high school. I’m 22 now. It makes me panic for absolutely no reason and out of no where. I’ve also gained weight. I’ve gained a good 7 LBS from only taking it for 3 months since my clothes feel a little snug. I have no appetite at all but some how gaining weight? If you  have a history of anxiety or depression I wouldn’t take this pill. If you don’t have a history, this pill is perfectly fine for you as it does the job as I have not gotten pregnant and my periods are pretty under control.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This birth control is the absolute worst! I was put on it a week ago because under my new health insurance, my old birth control was over $280. In the week I have been on this I have had an insane amount of discharge to where it grossed me out. I literally had to change my underwear twice a day and would wake up leaking discharge in the morning. The discharge even started to smell. Then started the random spotting to which there is no solution because putting a tampon in became painful. My appetite has been out of control. One day I would eat a snack and be too nauseaous to eat again, the next day I would devour an entire pizza. I enjoy working out but on this birth control I have had no motivation to work out and felt sluggish the times I did make it to the gym. I feel bloated and off and my sex drive has been at a solid 0 mph since I started this pill. This has to be the worst birth control pill in existence. Seven days in and I’m throwing away the rest of my three month supply.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):So I shared how much I loved Taytulla after a month of being on it, and I’m now here to update you on month 6 of my experience! First off, this BCP was the first I had ever been on, so I was definitely nervous at the start. It never gave me weird hormones, depression or anxiety like other people have said. I did not gain weight, my acne has cleared up & I'm overall loving how I feel (plus I’m not pregnant!) definitely give Taytulla a try...I was very hesitant but I really love it

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I’m 18, and I started to take this at 17. I had very bad cramps, bloating, acne, cravings, diarrhea, bodyaches, headaches. My periods would be 3-5 days long w heavy flow every month. This September will mark a year of me taking this. In the first 2 months I had no period at all. November- 5 days. December -4 days. End of the month spotted for 1 week then got my period the next week. So I bled for 2 weeks. February-Nothing. March-spotting 2 days. End of April-May- 2 weeks. June nothing. July- 5 days. And now currently I am 9 days late. With extremely heavy bloating, and nausea. Before starting this birth control I was already an anxious/stressed person, over the course of taking this I have become so much more anxious/stressed to the point where I start shaking, crying, and get extremely cold.  If you’re an anxious /stressed person I don’t suggest you take this, it will increase those feelings and if you’re sextually active you won’t always get your period causing you to worry.

Junel Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I never in my life had a negative experience from a birth control pill until I switched to Junel Fe. I was extremely irritable to both my husband and my two year old. I lost crazy amounts of hair. My hunger sky rocketed and I would raid the fridge as soon as I got home from work. I was angry all the time on this pill. The only plus to this pill is that I did not have acne break outs, my skin was clear. But the amount of anxiety and irritability that comes with this pill is not worth it. It took me awhile to figure out what was causing all these horrible side effects because I never experienced side effects like this. It was so bad that I fear to try another pill.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was skeptical because of all of the negative side effects but I have not experienced any . This is the best birth control I’ve tried thus far. It stopped the abnormal spotting and heavy/painful periods. It doesn’t make me overly emotional or moody.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have heard a lot of bad reviews so I thought I should share my own review. This birth control has NOT made me depressed or gain weight or make me want to eat more. The only thing I would say is that I spot a lot more but that’s normal in any birth control within the first few months. Also, I get a little more acne than I had before but nothing too serious, and it will probably go away when my body gets used to the new hormones.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This pill was very effective for me but there were positives and negatives with taking it. The pros were that I hadn’t gained any weight, no nausea, no headaches, and my acne cleared up right away. The cons were that I had a full period for the second week of pills plus 3 days when I should’ve had it. I would cramp a lot as well. It was also causing me to have insomnia most nights. After I continued bleeding for those weeks I stopped taking it but other than that i had no major side effects.

Taytulla (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I had been taking Taytulla for almost 2 years. Since previous birth control had given me lots of stomach problems and Taytulla seemed to lessen them although they were still there. I take Taytulla consistently so I do not get a period, this was recommended by my doctor and is completely safe. However within the past 6 months my sex drive has not only been low but I have experienced extreme pain with sex, come to find out the pill was not fully stopping my periods correctly and actually caused me to grow a few cysts that have had complications. Ever since discovering this and really looking into the past few months I have realized  the pill has done nothing but make my life miserable. I have lost hair, had 13 day long break through bleeding, and my depression and anxiety has been the worst it has ever been. Each pill has different effects for everyone but this was my experience and after the recent recall of this product I do not feel it has worked properly.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I have been on this pill for about 4 months now. I have seen many negative reviews on it and was concerned, but I have been having a good experience with it. I have gained 10 lbs since on it and a slight increase in discharge/odor. Other than that I have had no problems, so I would say the side effects depend on the person.

Lo Loestrin Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):My gyno switched me to lo lo three months ago. I was on the generic of Aviane and had long irregular periods. She switched me to lo lo to help with that. I immediately stopped having my period and I hate it. It feels unnatural to not have it at all and it always makes me paranoid that I’m pregnant. I have felt VERY moody on Lo Lo. I’m 22 and have had acne since I was probably around 12. Not cystic- just mild sized hormonal bumps on my chin but it’s constant. Aviane had almost entirely cleared up my skin when I went on LoLo and ever since I’ve switched I’ve had HORRIBLE acne. Painful deep ones which I’ve never had much of before. I am switching back to Aviane brand only this time to see if that helps regulate me.

Blisovi Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):This is my first time taking any form of birth control. I’ve been on this pill for about 5 days, and I’m feeling fine. The first day, I did experience some slight nausea, but it went away after around ten minutes. I don’t get anymore of it (for now at least)! I haven’t noticed any side effects so far except for my period already starting to be a lot lighter. No acne, mood swings, weight gain, or anything so far. I’ll keep you guys updated next month :)

Blisovi Fe 1.5/30 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I started taking Microgestin in 2014, and just this year in March I went to pick up another pack and was told they no longer had it, but they gave me a new bc Blisovi and assured me it was exactly the same. Well, it’s not. My anxiety has been at an all time high, as well as my depression. I have gained 15 pounds just from taking this pill from March-August. This pill has made my life awful, I am always so nauseas and irritated. Would not recommend whatsoever.

Junel Fe 1/20 (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):Okay so I am on my first pack of Junel fe 1/20.  I recently switched from Cryselle 28 (horrible pill do not recommend gave me cramps and acne) so I went on Junel fe to help with acne and cramps. So I am on my second week and it did help with my acne I don’t have very many zits anymore so they have decreased so I am happy with that. I am now experiencing spotting, it’s been 3 days of spotting and it’s still going on ! It might be breakthrough bleeding but I’ve never experienced it before so I’m so confused. I’m waiting for it to end. Besides that it didn’t give me horrible problems. I don’t have depression and this pill didn’t make me sad like my last pill did.

Blisovi 24 Fe (ethinyl estradiol / norethindrone):I was just prescribed this birth control yesterday and took the pill last night. I woke up this morning at 3 am throwing up and continued to for hours on end. I have changed my prescription already and won't be using this one anymore.
